Address: 1168 Hamilton Street Unit 104 Vancouver, BC V6B 2S2 Canada
Review: busy place  strongly suggest a reservation great happy hour menu good service fish was nicely prepared and paella had lots of seafood in a very small portion

Address: 1168 Hamilton Street Unit 104 Vancouver, BC V6B 2S2 Canada
Review: i recommend squid is the best part i ordered garlic bread to eat with mussel dish was nice only the risotto not impress can put more flavourtexture is not reached overall is great

Address: 1168 Hamilton Street Unit 104 Vancouver, BC V6B 2S2 Canada
Review:
i really enjoyed my lunch at this cozy little place in beautiful yaletown vancouver today
they have a great selection on their menu and their lunch prices are reasonable what really stood out for me was their warm attentive and professional service from the beginning to the end the host made us feel very welcome and our server took very good care of us the whole time due to the winter wonderland feel and all the snow i felt i need to start things off with a nice cup of coffee i loved the coffee it was jj bean and piping hot and served in a sparkling cupexactly the way i like it

we had the pulled pork sandwich and the chicken cutlets
i loved the pulled pork juicy and well seasoned with a nice crisp fresh ceasar salad and a slice of gherkin with the meal which was a nice touch i love gherkins

i also tried the chicken cutlet which was beautifully cooked tender with the batter seasoned just on point and the mash was a perfect pairing
i mean who doesnt like great mash

next time im going for the muscles

Address: 1168 Hamilton Street Unit 104 Vancouver, BC V6B 2S2 Canada
Review:
ambiance is great with a great mixture of wood and metal light and dark hard and soft to drink i had their homemade ginger beer which was tangy and a hint sweet for dinner i ordered the short rib with a side of the corn both were outstanding the short rib was served with the bone marrow which was an interesting touch i didnt care for the marrow alone but when i added a little piece to the meat it was a brilliant combination the corn was superb too  sweet but spicy due to the jalape√±os definitely fresh corn too because i had to pull a string from my teeth   would definitely recommend this place

check it out vancouver

Address: 1168 Hamilton Street Unit 104 Vancouver, BC V6B 2S2 Canada
Review: we went to the flying pig for dinner last night and were so impressed by the incredible food and service that we went again for dinner tonight whilst travelling through canada for the past weeks this was most definitely the best meals we have had the menu is outstanding and so is the quality of the food and drinks bailey was our server both nights and is an absolute delight she was warm and genuine and has an excellent knowledge of the menu definitely a place we would highly recommend to everyone

Address: 871 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: during my 5day stay in vancouver i couldnt resist visiting the lovely japanese restaurant not once but twice its authentic flavors serene ambiance and impeccable service left an indelible mark a fusion of traditional and contemporary elements made it a standout experience in vancouvers vibrant culinary scene

Address: 871 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: the restaurant caught our attention when we walked by the restaurant around 1150am  people were lining up for the restaurant to open at noon we were lucky to get the bar seating its not a huge restaurant and some tables were reserved for customers who made advanced reservations we ordered hot green tea stonegrilled beef tongue beef tenderloin steak bowl sizzling stone pork kakuni bowl and all of them were delicious great meat quality and well prepared dishes its a restaurant running by japanese with great foods and services i highly recommend this place with advanced reservation

Address: 871 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: it was my first time visiting the japanese restaurant kingyo the food was absolutely good and the service was no problem only one thing they limited table time to just one hour my friends and i just had a quick drink quick eating everything kinda super rushes like eating fast food

Address: 871 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: was excited to come due to good reviews however was very disappointed it is definitely overrated the food is so so pictures look good but not the taste we spent about 200 3 adults and 1 kid dinner menu is diff then lunch a lot of food are not available during dinner i wouldnt want to come back enough said

Address: 871 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: we ordered four items as shown in the photos the salad is the best the sashimi is the second the ramen was not bad just that the beef was a bit chewy the pressed salmon sushi wasnt very good too much rice and the rice was not fresh the place was packed fun environment

Address: 200 Granville Street Suite 70 Vancouver, BC V6C 1S4 Canada
Review:
wow wow wow bite after bite was a sublime experience in what japanese fine dining can be  miku is a five star experience that deserves your visit

the modern restaurant is beautiful clean and perfectly maintained  we recommend sitting on the patio where you can either people watch or gaze over the harbour  inside tables offer window views or a view of the open kitchen  its all beautiful and adds to the experience

service is professional friendly and gracious  we followed our servers recommendations and that was the right choice  a team of people keeps the meal moving along and provides explanations of what you are eating

however the food is the star here and that is how it should be  the flavors are carefully paired here and you will want to give those flavors a chance to delight your palette  this is not sushi to be dunked in soya sauce  i think you will also be delighted by how their cocktails complement the food choices

put miku on your special meal out list and make an evening of it  this is one of vancouvers dining gems and certainly the best japanese cuisine i have eaten  i think you will agree

Address: 200 Granville Street Suite 70 Vancouver, BC V6C 1S4 Canada
Review:
it is the most elegant sushi i had the fish melts in your mouth what an amazing culinary experience
the service was friendly and the sake recommandation was spot on not cheap but since the meal was so refined it called for a lush and polished taste

Address: 200 Granville Street Suite 70 Vancouver, BC V6C 1S4 Canada
Review: i came here with my parents had an amazing experience steak and sushi were so good desert was delicious recommend the green tea opera desert    servers were so nice as well 5 star worthy

Address: 200 Granville Street Suite 70 Vancouver, BC V6C 1S4 Canada
Review: super awesome restaurant with really great staff we ordered the tasting menu and it was amazing but maybe one course too long it was a lot of very delicious food but after the 4th course it just became a lot and we didnt end up eating some of the dishes because we were so full the atmosphere in the restaurant is amazing and the fish artwork on the wall is beautiful super great cocktails and wine list

Address: 200 Granville Street Suite 70 Vancouver, BC V6C 1S4 Canada
Review: upon entering the restaurant for a evening dinner date it was quite spacious and i saw a sign that the restaurant was one of the nominees for a michelin star the lighting in the room isnt very flattering if you take pictures of your group but at least the food had decent lighting the server we had was friendly and knowledgeable about recommendations we ended up getting the platter sashimi salad and brussel sprout appetizer to share between 2 people when the food arrived the portion size was really small but it was to be expected of a upscale restaurant  the taste was fresh but i felt like other japanese restaurants ive tried were above in quality and taste so it was really nothing special that jumped out at me perhaps only the sashimi presentation was unique with the cool ice mist i guess i shouldve ordered more because i was left feeling hungry still but my date had a budget and i didnt want to scare him away with my huge appetite next time id like to try the lunch menu instead

Address: 1128 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1B2 Canada
Review:
the restaurant is known for its authentic korean cuisine which is prepared with the freshest ingredients and cooked to perfection the dishes are bursting with flavor and have a unique blend of spices that will tantalize your taste buds from traditional korean bbq to savory stews and soups there is something for everyone on the menu

in addition to the delicious food the service at kosoo is excellent the staff is friendly attentive and knowledgeable about the menu providing an exceptional dining experience for guests however as the restaurant is quite popular it is recommended to make a reservation in advance to avoid any disappointment

overall kosoo korean restaurant is an excellent choice for those who love korean cuisine and are looking for a highquality dining experience the food is exceptional the service is topnotch and the atmosphere is lively and enjoyable its a musttry for anyone visiting vancouver canada

Address: 1128 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1B2 Canada
Review:
we had the beef brisket skillet and it was absolutely amazing made many lettuce wraps and enjoyed it with rice
it was all delicious and theres little room for improvement because it was pretty much perfect
would go again and would highly recommend this place

Address: 1128 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1B2 Canada
Review:
had a great experience here the beef brisket skillet was amazing fried chicken was crispy and crunchy yet sauced and flavourful the miso soup was refreshing and the beef gimbap was great value
rose tteokbokki was good subtle flavour with a lot of cheese
improvements id suggest would be how the fried chicken shell was a little thick sides couldve been presented in bigger dishes for less refills and the gimbap didnt taste the most fresh though it was still good

Address: 1128 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1B2 Canada
Review: excellent experience we had here at this restaurant  tasty food and good portion size  service was quite decent as well  we especially appreciated the taste of korean style sausage  also the broth of army stew was rich  parking is available behind the building for 3 an hour  we will return soon to try their other dishes  overall this is a pretty nice korean restaurant to try if you are in the area

Address: 1128 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1B2 Canada
Review:
first off i have to say that the fried chicken at kosoo is absolutely delicious the batter is perfectly crispy and crunchy while the meat inside remains tender and juicy they offer a variety of flavors including original soy garlic spicy and honey butter so theres something for everyone i particularly enjoyed the soy garlic flavor which had just the right amount of sweetness and savory garlic flavor

in addition to the fried chicken kosoo also offers a variety of other korean dishes that are equally delicious the bibimbap is a standout with a flavorful mix of rice vegetables and protein that is sure to satisfy the side dishes such as the kimchi and pickled radish are also great

the service at kosoo is friendly and attentive and the atmosphere is casual and cozy the restaurant is relatively small so it can get quite busy during peak hours but the wait is usually not too long

overall i highly recommend kosoo for anyone looking for delicious korean fried chicken and other korean dishes in vancouver the food is topnotch the service is excellent and the atmosphere is welcoming

Address: 1719 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C8 Canada
Review:
quality 4
quantity 4
price 4
taste 4
service 4

i loved this place we may have ordered a bit too much food but we really wanted to get a good spread of the menu i had come in once years ago and can confirm it was just as good as i remember it

id recommend coming in with friends if possible as the dining can accommodate it easily and its best to get a variety of meals id say 15 orders per person is probably the ratio to go with anything more and you might be bussin out of your pants

id recommend to check it out

Address: 1719 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C8 Canada
Review: average taste but they give small portions the soup dumplings are the smallest i have seen excellent friendly service

Address: 1719 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C8 Canada
Review: more than a dumpling restaurant everything i ordered taste great definitely will come back

Address: 1719 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C8 Canada
Review:
we had rolls dumplings xiao long baos fried rice and some rice rolls which was fantastic

though i dont recommend shiumai  in particular the food was amazing

be mindful there is an intermission at 230 where youre not allowed to br inside the restaurant

i would still come again since i respect the house rule and like the food

Address: 1719 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C8 Canada
Review: theres a reason why its packed and theres a line up outside my first time and i went because i read out their soup dumplings being the best in the city to my surprise it wasnt actual soup with dumplings in it haha but actual dumplings filled with soup they were so good and why they are listed as 1 in canada i also had the wonton in hot and sour sauce and my stomach was very happyand warm just go to this place everyone around you is just taken back by how fast the service is but more so how amazing the food is

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review:
the pork chicken shrimp katsu is very juicy and tender on the inside the outside is crunchy and not oily the sauce is great but sprinkling salt and sesame seems to bring out meat taste more do not recommend the white fish as it was slightly soggy at the bottom and the fish was quite tough in the middle other white fish i had before is very fluffy and light with a gentle sweetness to it this one was briny only

presentation of the food is great seating is wonderfully spacious service is quite attentive and friendly

all in all it was a very pleasant experience slightly on the expensive side

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: decided to come here for a late lunch but even then the place is still packed very popular and i could see why we got the zenbu set and it was a lot of food for 2 people it was so good though esp the fatty pork and scallop also have to mention the salad seems very simple but the dressing is amazing service was just fine but the atmosphere was really nice will come back for sure

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: i am absolutely smitten with the culinary delights offered at this remarkable japanese restaurant however what truly sets it apart is the exceptional team of individuals who work here the waitstaff exhibited unmatched friendliness going above and beyond by attentively checking on my friend and me throughout the dining experience their genuine care and attentiveness truly left a lasting impression kudos to this establishment for fostering such a warm and caring environment

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: very pleasant and friendly  food was fantastic the chicken breast was prepared very well hot and tasted fresh    the soft drink was a bit of novelty but tasted good strawberry   the waiter we had was always smiling and very pleasant  the place was quite as most patrons despite the place being full most of our visit spoke in low voices

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: nice little quaint place staff were super friendly and service was fast free refills on the salad  rice and soup though we didnt need it our water was always refilled and they did such a tremendous job while we dined there katsu was so juicy and tender i love how they have the gravy baits too id highly recommend

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: the food here is amazing however the broadway location is not equipped for large parties we had 9 people and was told we would be able to sit together but on separate tables unfortunately the tables were really far apart and those on the ends of the table could not talk to each other until after dinner aside from that our dinner itself was good i ordered the cheese katsu with a side of curry to share with my husband miso soup and salad is refillable and we ordered it twice add the curry you wont regret it

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: i really enjoyed my meal here everything part of the dish was very delicious and so intricate with detail simple but tasty friendly servers price point was on the higher side for the full meals but the taste and portion is well worth the total at the end you can get unlimited sides too i believe

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: saku is certainly worth trying we ordered the chicken breast katsu with curry and the regular chicken breast katsu  both were great and the service is top notch the curry was unique and they provide a generous amount which you can share with your party the side salad and miso soup were perfect additions to the deep fried main dishes and theyre also unlimited which was nice the staff are super friendly and the prices seemed fair given the portions

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review:
ive been to saku broadway and saku robson and both restaurants are a 1010 for me the cheese katsu is immaculate and it comes with all these little extras like soup salad flavoured salt mustard the extras are u limited too so if you want more soup or salad just ask for it  the salad dressing they have is delicious too 

the servers at the broadway location were incredibly helpful they would come by our table every 510 minutes to ask if we wanted more food or to refill our water 

the price is quite expensive but thats the price of living in vancouver these days you do get a good amount of food for the price youre paying

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: first time trying nabe katau at saku i prefer the regular rosuhire katsu more than this soupy dish anyway its good for my throat when i needed something warm and not oily

Address: 1698 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C7 Canada
Review: went here on for a saturday lunch and it wasnt super busy the ambiance was quiet and cozy as for food we got a few dishes to share the tuna tataki was a bit of a letdown as it didnt taste fresh but pleasantly surprised by the beef tendon curry

Address: 1698 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C7 Canada
Review: always an amazing time here been coming here for over a decade super to see them survive this long and still going strong great good staff service food and drinks what more do you want always fun and energetic ambience always busy too like i said been coming here for a long time and i plan to keep coming back highly recommend

Address: 1698 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C7 Canada
Review: came here for some tapas before we went to the beach service was quick  friendly and the food was fast  delicious we ordered a few things here we havent tried before and a couple of our usuals the grilled pork cheek was my favourite presentation could be a little better  the seats outside were a bit dirty grease from what i assume to be previous customers were not wiped off but its an izakaya so not a ton of marks taken off there

Address: 1698 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C7 Canada
Review: an authentic slice of the rising sun in british columbia guu with garlic is located in downtown vancouver bc at the north end of trendy robson street walk inside and immediately feel like youre in a tokyo neighborhood restaurant hungry for sushi look elsewhere this place serves authentic izakaya style small plate cooked delights like takoyaki yakiudon karaage chicken tuna tataki etc high quality ingredients friendly patient professional  helpful service highly recommended support your local small businesses  restaurants

Address: 1698 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C7 Canada
Review: small establishment it was quite busy so my friend and i sat at the corner of the bar next to the wall it was a bit of a squeeze thankfully they have hangers on the wall behind to hang coats could be a hassle going in and out depending where you are sitting because everyone will have to get up anyway every item ordered was delicious started off with the assorted oden w soup it was quite cold outside so i found it quite comforting and the soup was light i had never had boiled daikon before it was quite delicious i wasnt too crazy about the hard boiled egg though it was over cooked because the yolk was green and very dry i thought the kimchi cucumber was going to be red and spicy but not at all perhaps im ignorant to the fact that not all kimchi means spicy it was ok mildly sweet and sour the kakuni stewed pork belly was absolutely amazing the meat was so tender and came with another boiledstewed daikon which i ate to myself  the poached egg was good the soy sauce gave it a nice flavor as for the assorted 5kinds sashimi plate i really enjoyed the yellowtail the scallops were good also actually tasted the sweetness and im no sushi connoisseur the carbonara udon was interesting i have never had carbonara before but i did enjoy it with udon noodles it just tasted like a creamy sauce over udon noodles i didnt get a chance to try it before the egg was mixed in i enjoyed it nonetheless the final dish pan fried pork intestines i really enjoyed this dish and so did my friend she ate 34 of the plate to herself it would have been nice if we had rice this dish i highly recommend i found out that each guu has their own specialty which i thought was interesting i would love to come back to this one for the other menu items before going to the other locations i highly recommend this place probably not good for large parties though

Address: 1944 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review: food here was pretty delicious for the most part i really liked the beet tartare and the gnocchi with pork belly my boyfriend ordered the medium rare duck and it had an interesting flavor drinks were pretty good too we ordered a stpatricks day sour with charcoal which was really tasty also our server was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu really great service here this restaurant is a bit on the expensive side though

Address: 1944 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review:
try the housemade mocktails best ive had  nogroni was complex aromatic and refreshing the pineappleginspritz was flavorful not sweet with a peppery finish
the butchers cut was already beautifully seasoned with herbs that really enhanced the flavor but then the pepper jam ginger reduction was absolutely to die for  rich sticky flavor explosions with every mouthful the bok choy greens and miso potatoes were the perfect accompaniment both desserts were wonderful  rhubarb with strawberry curd in blueberrybalsamic ice cream melded amazing flavors together under a toasted meringue top while the bittersweet chocolate orange with graham cake was a satisfying and rich blend without being heavy or too sweet

Address: 1944 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review:
this is an acclaimed restaurant located in the kitsilano area has been awarded the prestigious michelin bib gourmand renowned for its farmtotable concept fable kitchen is committed to utilizing locally sourced sustainable and seasonal ingredients the restaurants cozy and rustic space exudes a warm and inviting atmosphere perfect for casual hangout to a romantic date night

the menu at fable kitchen is a culinary delight featuring a diverse range of dishes that celebrate the natural flavors and freshness of the ingredients recently they have launched new items with creative twists and unique flavors that are sure to tantalize the taste buds

beyond the food fable kitchen also boasts an extensive wine list featuring both local and international wines as well as craft cocktails and locally brewed beers

Address: 1944 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review: has the ambience of a diner and a popular restaurant thats pretty unique loved watching the live kitchen do their thing while eating my breakfast they were kind enough to cater substitutes for my dairy allergy streak bacon was delish highly recommend it with your eggs as someone who never ate yolks raw or runny and always loved it mixed in scrambledcooked inover hard i have no remorse for all you patrons who enjoy bennies they did however look extremely appetizing

Address: 1944 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review: brunch time on a saturday is really busy in kitsilano so it was good that we made a reservation in advance food was good i loved my dish which was one of the daily features dont remember the name but it had hash potatoes with mushroom chorizo sausage swiss cheese 2 poached eggs and bread prices go with the market service left behind my expectations the server was not taking notes of the orders and like we were imagining she forgot some items not a bad experience but for sure not a remarkable one

Restaurant_name: Fanny Bay Oyster Bar & Shellfish Market
Address: 762 Cambie St Vancouver, BC V6B 2P2 Canada
Review: a few years back i had a truly enjoyable lunch at fanny bay oyster bar  shellfish market the oysters were the highlight remarkably fresh and reasonably priced the staff were helpful and friendly making the entire dining experience even better overall it was a great meal that left a lasting impression id recommend fanny bay to anyone looking for quality oysters on a budget

Restaurant_name: Fanny Bay Oyster Bar & Shellfish Market
Address: 762 Cambie St Vancouver, BC V6B 2P2 Canada
Review: after checking online for the best seafood we found the reviews of this place good but when we reached there  had one of the best seafood we will definitely go there again service is great shana was a gem of a person with whom we talked long  her friend guided us through what to choose  have white wine was great worth every penny as a tourist we want food which will touch our heart  carry sweet memories back this was one of it

Restaurant_name: Fanny Bay Oyster Bar & Shellfish Market
Address: 762 Cambie St Vancouver, BC V6B 2P2 Canada
Review:
absolutely impeccable service i was welcomed immediately and straightforward to my seat at the bar then came the oyster education awesome i had three minutes until happy hour was up the server generously said that i shouldnt worry they would have my order in within the happiest of hours

delicious fresh ocean fragrant oysters

get the fish tacos best anywhere

be here for happy hour its the best in the city just make sure youre here before three minutes to six i simply had to order a second round

Restaurant_name: Fanny Bay Oyster Bar & Shellfish Market
Address: 762 Cambie St Vancouver, BC V6B 2P2 Canada
Review: this place 5 stars all around amazing food period but even better is the staff andrew and adanary are among the top people ive ever encountered at a restaurant anywhere on earth the seafood is fresh and they literally sell live prawns oysters are a must here and happy hour is a steal sit at the bar and meet the local crew seldom do i find a place where i am greeted and treated as family pro tip to the owner youve hired amazingly

Restaurant_name: Fanny Bay Oyster Bar & Shellfish Market
Address: 762 Cambie St Vancouver, BC V6B 2P2 Canada
Review: a hidden gem have driven by this location quite often and had no idea what was behind this unassuming exterior nice modern interior excellent friendly staff we came here for the dineout experience and had a delicious meal each of the appetizer main and desert selections was very tasty the seafood was fresh the oysters had a nice fresh taste even the lettuce was fresh and crisp which is more difficult during january also a big surprise was the size of each portion usually during the dineout events the serving portions are more like for a tasting menu the portions they served were large probably their normal serving size so a very good meal at an excellent value

Address: 4172 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P7 Canada
Review: had a wonderful meal last night at this restaurant their menu was very extensive we ordered a few familiar items and they were amazing everything was perfectly seasoned service was good and we didnt feel rushed on a saturday night

Address: 4172 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P7 Canada
Review: ordered 2 starters one curry garlic naan and a side rice and everything exceeded my expectations although the atmosphere inside was really nice we opted to sit on the street patio and loved it the servers were very attentive and all the food was so fresh and flavourful 1110 recommend will definitely be back

Address: 4172 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P7 Canada
Review: we decided to order from sula on main  the food was delicious  garlic and potato naan picked up the sauces well   the lamb and chicken were tender and the spicy level good  food arrived hot  highly recommend

Address: 4172 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P7 Canada
Review:
first time dining at sula on main street with my family we had family visiting from california with us they wanted to have indian food on their last night in vancouver so we took them here
im so glad sula was able to accommodate a last minute reservation for 7 people

the food is amazing we had tandoori wings vegetable pakoras and paneer fingers as appetizers we shared 2 pitchers of rose sangria

we had lamb korma chicken biryani chicken tikka masala butter chicken saag paneer and coconut rice for our main dishes

for dessert we ordered gulab jamun and the ras malai cake

everything was presented beautifully the food tasted  fantastic everything was perfectly seasoned and spiced  the curries were rich and creamy

oh and that garlic cheese naan is divine we actually ordered more of that to go

our relatives were so impressed they said the food they had at sula was better than the indian food  they had in california

we sat out on their covered patio which was very nice and comfortable the interior of the restaurant is lovely too

the service was very good and attentive
ill definitely be back

i highly recommend this restaurant

Address: 4172 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P7 Canada
Review:
food was pretty good however the service was disappointing
took 20 minutes for a waitsperson to approach our table another 30 minutes for the food no one checked up on us for the next 30 minutes eventhough we wanted to order more stuff
we were initially offered a plate with a bug on it which grossed me out and isnt acceptable as we were one of the only 2 tables of customers in the store  would have been ok if it was busy but it wasnt
took over 10 minutes for catch the attention of someone to get new plates they replaced the plates  offered no apology

overall the foods good but it isnt worth the waiting and the lack of service

weve previously ordered through online platforms but the food arrived bland and messy  however in inperson dining the food tasted good would probably recommend one of their other locations over this one

Address: 244 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z7 Canada
Review: visited about 3 weeks ago on vacation with family service was great we didnt make a reservation but probably should have the hostess was very helpful seated us when the table was ready helped take our orders and helped us decide what to order when we were torn between a few items the food came out quickly and everything was delicious the pork chops were flavorful fried chicken wings were really good and the rest of the food did not disappoint

Address: 244 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z7 Canada
Review:
always amazing food at phnom penh the chicken wings are to die for its a must when you come here to eat i usually get a large order of wings for each person thats how good these are

the butter beef is another must order here its so good on its own

beef luc lac is another must try dish here you can order it with white rice this time i tried it with fried rice and its seriously delicious fried rice with fried egg on top you have to have to try it

i think everyone knows by now that this place is a must try whether youre a foodie or not ive been coming here for years and they never disappoint

food is always amazing service is always great and this time we didnt even have to line up to get a table which is a huge bonus

Address: 244 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z7 Canada
Review:
we got in at 11am when its open the restaurant is filled quickly within the first 15 minutes food quality is a lot better than takeout  the deep fried chicken wings with lemon butter sauce can retain the crispness the lemongrass pork tastes great and the combination c offers a variety of choices overall very good food and will visit again
warning  i feel very thirsty the afternoon after dining there they might have used msg in their food

Address: 244 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z7 Canada
Review: a friend took us here to this restaurant when we visited vancouver and it was quite the treat the food was excellent all around and my whole family really enjoyed the durian milkshake the chicken wings were my favourite they also had a few stir fried options for the vegetarians as well lotus stems snow pea tips etc

Address: 244 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z7 Canada
Review:
all the good was perfect no complaints here went with mostly all the house favourites and tried some of the other items definitely recommend try the
beef butter marinatesweet soy sauce with onions ginger a lot of cilantroparsley
phnom pheh pho was also good
deep fried chicken wings a nice sweet and crispy but also came with a good size portion of lemon pepper sauce to dip your wings in

Address: 1095 Hamilton St Vancouver, BC V6B 5T4 Canada
Review: celebrated a birthday dinner with my boyfriend and it was an impeccable experience antoine was a fantastic server he was very knowledgeable and attentive at the right times he answered all our questions and helped us choose oysters too best service i have ever experienced food was very delicious too

Address: 1095 Hamilton St Vancouver, BC V6B 5T4 Canada
Review:
went for dinner last night and was absolutely blown away by the service while the food was amazing the service was incomparable my friends and i had the pleasure of dining with tara and her colleagues and this was by far my best dining experience in the city and im a local

tara was knowledgeable attentive and just a pleasure to be around from the moment we arrived we were warmly greeted and never once did we have to try and seek her attention as she was always checking in any time someone left the table her and her team were quick ensure settings and napkins remained tidy and presentable upon our arrival back tara explained the menu in detail and was quick to recommend food and beverage pairings that we were all pleased with the food was beautifully presented tasted great and everyone was satisfied

while i dont have photos of everything we ordered the raw oysters were fresh and sweet prawns were plump and juicy and sashimi was fresh and paired with an in house soy sauce i ordered the beef tenderloin and asked for it to be cooked between medium rare and rare and it was cooked to perfection it was tender seared crisp on the outside and juicy on the inside i also ordered the truffle fries as a side and will say you have to try them

tara is a gem and i want to thank her and the staff for creating such a welcoming atmosphere that was paired with amazing food i dont know how it took me so long to come here but can definitely say i will be back

make your reservation now and thank me later

Address: 1095 Hamilton St Vancouver, BC V6B 5T4 Canada
Review: the best thing about this restaurant is the ambiance and the service lights dimmed to focus on the people you are eating with as for food my mixed ceviche was tender but needed a little bit more of lime you could tell the quality of the sea food was excellent but needed more acid to make it more interesting my chicken with potatoes was a bit undercooked and under seasoned it also needed to build more flavour overall it was a good enough experience

Address: 1095 Hamilton St Vancouver, BC V6B 5T4 Canada
Review: a delicious dinner with excellent service from liam a great place to celebrate my wifes birthday the seafood plateau was a tasty appetizer sized just right for 2 people just love the special fork they have to aid diners with the assorted oysters mussels clams and other tasty treats the halibut was firm and juicy and although the steak was medium rather than the mediumrare we requested it was still juicy and very tasty we didnt leave much room for desert so settled for tasty strawberry  raspberry lemon tarts highly recommended for a memorable night out

Address: 1095 Hamilton St Vancouver, BC V6B 5T4 Canada
Review: everything was phenomenal but the sablefish was impeccable  the best fish weve ever tasted it was cooked beautifully in the pastthe scallops and those are magnificent as well im addition to the food the service is professional and kind  were always well taken care of i rarely give out five stars but this place never fails to impress us

Address: 3388 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3M7 Canada
Review: a very unique and modern take on vietnamese cuisine the interior decor and outdoor patio are both really nicely decorated definitely feels different from the run of the mill pho joint theres an expansive menu of different vietnamese dishes the items i tried were the shaken beef dish and the beef short rib rice both of which were super tasty and had amazing presentation portions are decent and pricing is slightly higher but thats to be expected given the quality and refined ambiance their mixed drinks were also tasty service was friendly and attentive would definitely come back to try their other dishes

Address: 3388 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3M7 Canada
Review: first time coming heredidnt book a table in advance to my demise staff are very friendly great service all around waiter was very helpful with his recommendations starter was delicious and very well presented the prawn cakes i risked it going for the spicy beef soup which was tasty and lots of meatbroth and my partner got the deconstructed vermicelli noodles which were very tasty and again big portion  will go back again as vibe in there was cool and food is worth trying

Address: 3388 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3M7 Canada
Review: love the vietnamese vibe here the servers are energetic and friendly the mango salad and fresh saigon roll are so refreshing  perfect choices during summer the wok fried noodles and number 37 are highly recommended as well the skin of the lemon chicken is crispy but not oily all the sauce perfectly matches with the main dishes however the portion of each dish is not large those with big appetite may have to order more

Address: 3388 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3M7 Canada
Review: i love their covered patio setup it was nice to get some sun while eating even though it was cold outside food was good i enjoyed everything we ordered our server was new so the service was a little slow we had to wave her down multiple times but understandable

Address: 3388 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3M7 Canada
Review:
anh and chi was an excellent experience we did have to wait for about 20 minutes but it wasnt a big deal as we just purused down the street and admired all the other exciting looking restaurants for next time
we ordered crispy spring rolls amazing crispy prawn cakes delicious and chicken wings fabulous the wings especially were nicely cooked crispy exterior and moist and tender inside the sauce was excellent they all exceeded expectations and were full of flavor without being too greasy and heavy we ordered the curry with a side of rice which was excellent and the pho hoang a recipe from the original establishment that has been around for almost 40 years  and you can see why the flavor was just wonderful we also had the beef and watercress salad  the only thing i have to say could be improved is the salad was maybe a bit dry you definitely need to eat the vegetables with portions of meat in each bite otherwise its just not soft or wet enough more dressing or a soft vegetable something was missing the service was good although we did get better service from a waitress who wasnt actually assigned to our table our own waitress seemed a bit bored but she was still polite attentive and answered all of our questions
i would absolutely recommend this restaurant and if visiting vancouver would come again loved loved it

Address: 1038 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 0B9 Canada
Review:
amazing food and service our waiter brendan was great and guided us in our diningdrinking adventure

as there were so many amazing options on the menu we decided to go with a la carte in order to try more of the menu since we are from out of town

everything tasted amazing and they even split some of the dishes for us in order to make it easier to eat i could recommend everything that we ate drinks also did not disappoint very tasty and unique

i think this was my favourite restaurant of this trip and we went to quick a few nice restaurant including a michelin star restaurant highly recommend it if you are able to try it

street parking is reasonable plan for 3 hours though

Address: 1038 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 0B9 Canada
Review:
5 starts for everything undoubtedly

the food testing menu with level 2 wine pairing was phenomenal
every wine and meal was an experience
it is certainly a pricy experience but we would do again for sure you wont regret
cheers

Address: 1038 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 0B9 Canada
Review: absolutely an upscale restaurant good food good atmosphere good service however rating it in comparison with other restaurants i have been to would put it in the middle of the pack i actually just added one more star for atmosphere due to the fact that you can clearly see the kitchen it is quite entertaining to watch the head chef and his minions crafting the dishes

Address: 1038 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 0B9 Canada
Review:
an exquisite dining experience came in for brunch with no reservation luckily after a 10minute wait someone canceled
service was brilliant food and drinks tasted delicious and the vegan dessert was amazing
the brunch was under 90 with tips included fantastic spot for a date highly recommend reservations
i will be back 100 thank you

Address: 1038 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 0B9 Canada
Review:
a staple of upscale dining in vancouver the cocktails are some of the best in the city that is awarding winning

top notch service

the food can be a bit of a hit and miss as it changes quite a bit with the season the 3 dishes we had were tasty but just not memorable that leaves you wanting more the octopus was a bit on the chewy side and the scallop was buried under all the sauce that took away from the delicate textures and flavour of the sea the salad was my favourite of the night as it had a great textures from the bee pollen and acid from the dressing

Address: 1300 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C5 Canada
Review:
my friend and i shared the salmon benedict and the french toast it was incredible and the prices are super reasonable too
big shout out to our server and the staff here we got asked if we wanted more coffee every 15 mins and felt like the staff really knew what they were doing 10010 will come back here when im back in vancouver

Address: 1300 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C5 Canada
Review: spent a few days at the listel hotel and forage was recommended to me by several folks the restaurant has a nice modern feel the staff were welcoming and helpful in their recommendations if you are into locally sourced and sustainable foods forage might be up your alley i should also mention their sourdough pan bread is an absolute treat and definitely a must if you visit its great as an appetizer or dessert

Address: 1300 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C5 Canada
Review:
had a great easter brunch with the family  was able to get a reservation for 6 without issue we did book a week in advance due to the holiday they did request we be done in 75 minutes for the next party

great drinks and food i had the whiskey latte and the pork belly benedict highly recommend family also had the pancakes which they loved as well

Address: 1300 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C5 Canada
Review: we got the mushrooms entree bison steak and cast iron bread the mushrooms were ok the cast iron bread was very very very oily so i only ate one piece the major  was the bison which was cooked perfectly and absolutely delicious

Address: 1300 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C5 Canada
Review:
overall i think the food is nice and above average but i expected more given the prices charged and the fame of this restaurant

for starters the seared tuna and oysters were freshly served but i think there were too much tuna paste on the tuna which overtook the freshness of the seafood the miso itself was too rich and my tongue got carried away

for main i ordered the grilled octopus and pork chop again the use of miso paste in both dishes were too significant and i found the flavour too repetitive the pork chop in particular was drowned in different sauces i wasnt too sure what the chef was trying to present

knowing the chefincharged is a chinese i was hoping to see some chinese cooking method  elements in the dishes unfortunately there werent any

Address: 213 Carral Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J2 Canada
Review: some of the most delicious brunch food ive had while eating out i was especially impressed that they make inhouse glutenfree toast that can be subbed with most of their dishes minus the french toast and one other item their french press coffee is also delicious and generously portioned i would definitely come here again to try their egg bennies or something else

Address: 213 Carral Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J2 Canada
Review:
my group came here for lunch on a friday around 1pm and were able to be seated right away

right away i was captivated by the unique decor they had standing mixers filled with plants as centerpieces that was super neat

the staff was really friendly and also gave us some great recommendations for things to do in vancouver

my only complaint was the menu felt a bit limited they serve brunch for most of the afternoon and then switch to dinner at 5 i believe i wish there were some more dishes on the menu that didnt include eggs

i did order the fruit salad and scones it was honestly the best fruit salad ive ever had i would order it again

this is definitely a great choice for breakfastbrunch

Address: 213 Carral Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J2 Canada
Review: one of the best brunches ive had we got lucky and didnt have to wait more than 10min for a spot at the counter all the staff were friendly and attentive most importantly the food was so good we got the croque monsieur and french toast loved the attention to detail with the menu and how they made elevated versions of classic dishes very reasonably priced for the quality location and service that you receive and a great place to bring a date

Address: 213 Carral Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J2 Canada
Review:
uniquely designed brunch recipes are amazing in taste both sweet  savoury options are available menu is not so vast but serves the purpose of a brunch restaurant both alcoholic  non alcoholic drinks are available but in coffee only french press option is available
atmosphere of this place is unmatchable most desiring location under the sun and in the citys most happening area there is indoor seating as well staff is great too
we ordered french toast which was definitely a big portion served with some fruits n maple syrup but so delicious our other dish was savoury topped with perfectly poached eggs served with a naan bread  olives  some hummus

Address: 213 Carral Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J2 Canada
Review:
outstanding brunch and drinks the food portion was more than generous i ordered the eggs benny and it was unreal its a shame were heading back home i would love to have had it again the wait staff was super nice and helpful in guiding us though the menu and more importantly the drinks get the caesar
lastly the music selection according to my wife was top notch if your into pop music and are born in 90 give or take a few years youll have a blast listening

Address: 630 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2G5 Canada
Review: one of the best chinese food experiences of all time despite being a hole in the wall place with very little ventilation and no air conditioning id go back there to eat any dish from this place in a heartbeat handcrafted noodles were outrageously awesome and spicy pork dumplings were equally addictive a place like this is precisely why you travel and explore city streets

Address: 630 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2G5 Canada
Review: i love this place the food and my beautiful place its a cute little restaurant with great food they have a great selection of food my favorite is the chicken soup with handmade noodles i liked it so much that i went there more than twice in 3 weeks i think that says enough in my opinion it is the little secret restaurant in vancouver the portions are huge so go there with an empty stomach

Address: 630 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2G5 Canada
Review: tried out this noodle house as it was close to our hotel and looked like a lot of people inside its a small restaurant with only fans and no air conditioning so it was quite stuffy inside ordered some hot chilli wontons xiao long bao steamed buns and two types of noodles big portions which are enough to share between two food came out quickly the chilli dishes are quite spicy

Address: 630 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2G5 Canada
Review: wonderful family run place in downtown vancouver  ill definitely be going back again and again  the noodle soups are incredible had the pork bone noodle soup which is amazing  also had dumplings curried tofu noodles fried spicy eggplant and spicy won ton   its all good and i wish they were open later  highly recommend this resto  prices are very reasonable quantities are good just a great place to go

Address: 630 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2G5 Canada
Review: highly recommend this little restaurant the flavors and the service was on point by far the most surprisingly delicious dish was the beef roll a must try the chili oil wontons definitely have a kick so be prepared if you dont usually order spicy food fantastic job by the servers super attentive and friendly cheers

Address: 869 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2R7 Canada
Review:
another day another italian restaurant browsing through numerous restaurant candidates i came upon lupo a heritage house restaurant offside to my usual robson area right by the vancouver public library one of the things that struck me about the place was the fact that their menu is shockingly small

each course from their antipasti to their primi to their secondi boast not more than six options per heading so im guessing that they curated the best of the best i was intrigued because in my mind that meant they had really perfected these dishes and wanted to showcase their culinary prowress with the thoughtful handling of select dishes so i was expecting a stellar meal

i dont think ive ever had the pleasure of dining in a heritage house so there was already an air of charm surrounding the evening as we walked up the steps i was immediately struck by the eclectic decor an odd mix of wine bottles photographic prints abstract paintings unusual lighting and segmented ombre metallics im not sure it necessarily all worked together but it was definitely eyecatching

the food was simply fantastic we started with the popular focaccia bread a puffed vegetarian wonder which if you didnt know any better would think was a miniature pizza my girlfriend had the octopus mosaic which was a work of art and i had the wagyu beef carpaccio which had a lot of reggiano shavings both were delicious

mains consisted of the taglierini and fettucine where the portions were more than generous my only complaint about my fettuccine was that there were way too many peas otherwise both pastas were al dente and very flavorful

im happy to say that all the reviews about lupo were correct as it was one of the best italian restaurants ive been to in a while and i would definitely go back service was attentive and professional so you really couldnt ask for more

there are plenty of italian eateries downtown but you can say arrivederci to them all lupo stands out as one of the places you need to visit if you want authentic and tasty italian food make a reservation you wont be disappointed

Address: 869 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2R7 Canada
Review:
i had a great evening at lupo thanks to our server cristina and the great food

the food was well presented  well seasoned and delicious  the wine menu was very good with a wide range of selection of local and international wines

the pasta was super greasy with lots of oil left on my plate after i finished my pasta

the restaurant is very romantic  but there is no privacy as tables are very close to each other

Address: 869 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2R7 Canada
Review:
great intimate dinner spot

good selection of wine they had a special burrowing owl  lupo wine which was really good

which was good had the special burrata which was nice and refreshing the special black olive truffle was yummy but the gnocchi bolognese was delicious they have good portion sizes for the price i would come again and forgot to mention that they have great service

tiramisu was good

Address: 869 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2R7 Canada
Review: pasta here was pretty good i ordered the fettuccine and i was surprised with how big the portion was we also ordered the taglierini which was also quite substantial and tasty the desserts were great the almond cake wasnt too sweet and had a lightness to it the creme brulee was smooth and the bitterness of the hardened sugar on top complimented well with the sweetness of the custard service was decent and the fact that the restaurant is in a heritage house definitely makes for an interesting experience a little bit on the pricey side but a good place to go for a special occasion

Address: 869 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2R7 Canada
Review: the pasta was tasty however clearly inauthentic portions were huge and flavourful however the presentation was lacking feels like i was just given a heaping pile of food the chicken was not tender it was clearly overcooked i did not enjoy the focaccia the beet salad with goat cheese was alright but i would never think about it again the atmosphere of the restaurant was a bit stuffy and serious i wouldnt return

Address: 2054 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4A9 Canada
Review:
love dinning here with my friends
the food is always delicious and artistic love how they support local farmers and have unique high quality ingredients

when i was poor college student i usually got the okonomiyaki or one of the stone bowls one caterpillar roll and 1 dessert and that was enough to satisfy me and my friend i usually got something that was high in carbs that way it fills me up that way it doesnt go over my budget

now i get anything from their special menu its always different depending on the seasons i am never disappointed what i am about to taste

the service is good and friendly

the atmosphere there is calming chill classy the music in that restaurant is very relaxing in my opinion

also the tables are always clean and same with the dishes and cutlery

tip this place is quite popular so the wait time to get a table might take long 1hr  so i suggest you make a reservation come at 5pm or eat a small snack before you go but that depends on your eating schedule

Address: 2054 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4A9 Canada
Review:
this place only opens in the evening we came around 540pm and was told the waiting time would be around 1hr the wait was worth it tho

we ordered 2 kinds of oshi which were incredibly delicious but a bit smaller than i expected nonetheless the flavour in each bite were amazing

the veggie okonomiyaki was surprisingly good even if its filled with just onions cabbages and mushrooms looks can be deceiving so dont judge this okonomiyaki till you try it

Address: 2054 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4A9 Canada
Review: fantastic little japanese restaurant in vancouver reminded me a lot of our days in kyoto the sashimi was fresh and delicious my daughter loved her unagi bowl given that shes very picky the mushroom agedashi tofu was the best that i have ever had highly recommended we will definitely come back

Address: 2054 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4A9 Canada
Review: very very good food but service was so poor we got an appetizer and 4 rolls everything came at different times i saw delivery and people coming after us getting their food while our food was not fully ready yet

Address: 2054 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4A9 Canada
Review: loved the food here you go here to eat thats it didnt try drinks but looked authentic had the eel unagi rolls amazing the smoked sushi was just ok would not get again fresh and tasty a bit pricy so only go if you appreciate good sushi

Address: 840 Howe Street Suite 190 Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S9 Canada
Review: came here when it was udon season and the tempura was delicious they gave us a plate to put our tempura in so it wouldnt get soggy when you pour the saucesoup on top of your ricenoodles the flavours were good and i loved the tempura soft boiled egg i wish the tempura was a bit crispier but overall i was happy with my meal

Address: 840 Howe Street Suite 190 Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S9 Canada
Review: excellent experience the tempura udon is really good with a cool presentation loved the salmon salad topping and steamed egg as well the melon milk is way too sweet though

Address: 840 Howe Street Suite 190 Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S9 Canada
Review:
so crunchy tempura come with spicy sauce ohhhh ive loved japanese foods in canada already not only thative had better days because of this strawberry cheese cake awesome cheesecakes not too thick or sparse flavours arent spot on cloyingly sweet i cant get enough of their cheese cake the staff is really nice and well trained

the miso soup is wonderful too

Address: 840 Howe Street Suite 190 Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S9 Canada
Review: a vancouver must have if you like tempura of course if thats not your thing we cant be friends the egg is mindblowingly delicious they have udon too now specialty drinks are really special  great for a date hang out families friends friends who want to date but havent have that conversation yet you know the ones

Address: 840 Howe Street Suite 190 Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S9 Canada
Review:
quick efficient service in a modern yet cozy setting
really enjoyed the bowl was filling and not too greasy unlike some other places chawanmushi was perfect for a cloudy day

Address: 2340 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1P1 Canada
Review:
this is definitely one of the highest quality sushi restaurants in vancouver the price of each meal may not appeal to everyone however if i ever wanted to share a solid sushi meal with someone new in town or maybe even a business meal i would definitely bring them here

i came here with my wife and kids and the service was excellent the toro is some of the best ive ever had

this may not be a place that id come back to often simply due to affordability however if i ever want to celebrate and enjoy high quality sushi i will come back for sure

Address: 2340 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1P1 Canada
Review:
its a pretty fantastic japanese restaurant that focuses on high quality ingredients we had a large party so we had to put in the order ahead of time the atmosphere was really nice and the staff were busy but still friendly

i had the deluxe seafood bowl which was not cheap but the ingredients and the quality of the overall food made it feel like it was worth the hefty price tag

other food was generally delicious but if you want the best bang for your buck i would suggest the katsu

the cocktails were also quite tasty i had the yuzu flavoured drink with the yuzu infused ice cream which was perfect on the hot summer evening

i highly recommend this place for any occasion but especially birthdays because it seemed like almost every other table was celebrating their birthday i know this because the staff would come up and sing you a song with a nice dessert overall i had a great experience and would come again to try other menu items

Address: 2340 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1P1 Canada
Review: this restaurant has consistently been amazing excellent service highquality dishes fresh ingredients all wrapped up in a beautiful restaurant setting i never hesitate to recommend this gem of a japanese restaurant bonus they are so familyfriendly and serve the best childrens meal

Address: 2340 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1P1 Canada
Review:
definitely one of the best japanese restaurants in vancouver
food and service were great
the menu is big
the rating is also based on the fact that parking is not very convenient and we did not see access for handicapped individuals maybe we missed it
we will try it again and this time we will try reserving in advance the lunchdinnerbento boxes

Address: 2340 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1P1 Canada
Review: highly recommend this restaurant  food was fresh and delicious looked great too at a reasonable price the decor made me feel like i was transported out of north america and staff were friendly and attentive brought my friends here and they thoroughly enjoyed their experience too

Address: 305 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1C4 Canada
Review:
intimate space with tremendous food
the luigis meatballs were delicious with a strong tomato sauce and a generous serving only comment here would be it leaned acidic from the strong tomato sauce
the mushroom and truffle pasta special highlighted the fresh local mushrooms and homemade pasta
the lamb ragu had incredible depth demonstrating the effort involved in flawlessly executing this dish

Address: 305 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1C4 Canada
Review: our spot to try for our staycaytion we arrived a few minutes after 12pm we were quite lucky to get seated immediately megan our server was friendly amazing and knowledgeable full of smiles and ready to answer any of our questions we went with the specials the burrata salad with pistachios and asparagus delicious right amount of seasoning and flavoring i ordered the lamb ragout my wife ordered the cacio pepe youd think they werent enough to eat wow they were so generous the portions were perfect  the lamb was so flavorful to the very last bite i couldnt get over how good these meals were my wife asked that her cacio pepe not be too peppery and they were able to accommodate her request she loved the dish it was creamy cheesy with the right amount of pepper we both noted that their pasta mustve been made in house the perfect chew of the al dente noodles provided a beautiful experience we topped it off with the panna cotta which had the stewed plums and crumbly biscotti perfect way to end a wonderful dining experience they are recommended by the michelin guide they are a bit on the pricey side but they are well worth it this is one of those date night or day places quaint and intimate we absolutely loved our visit here thank you ask for luigi and to our server megan thank you so very much

Address: 305 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1C4 Canada
Review: it was my first time here and everything didnt disappoint from the food service to the ambience of the restaurant it was very good we went on a weekend and we didnt realize they were only serving  the brunch menu nonetheless the food were still great i would recommend taking an uber or drive going here because its a bit sketchy if youll walk outside

Address: 305 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1C4 Canada
Review: located just a few blocks off the end of gastown this quaint italian restaurant offers delicious homemade pasta for a very reasonable price reservation is available with a 30 hold refunded at sign in my friend and i went for brunch sunday at 1030am and its not very busy theres a parking lot out back and street parking all around our server is very communicative and attentive to our needs their cappuccino was delicious according to my friend and we thoroughly enjoyed the flavor of our meals the total came out to be around 60 for the two of us we also noticed a healthy portion of the menu is vegetarian friendly and the pasta can be substituted for a gluten friendly version all in all a very pleasant visit to this gem of a restaurant

Address: 305 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1C4 Canada
Review: great place simple menu with incredible original italian taste the brunch experience is more fun than dinner in my opinion the olive oil cake   i could eat this on a daily basis to die for price is fair due current economy circumstances

Address: 780 Richards Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3A4 Canada
Review: not your normal breakfast place  but thats why its great  a little eclectic  but nothing over the top from the coffees to the main courses to the waffles at the end  we all tried something different and they were all hits definitely a go to spot every time were in town

Address: 780 Richards Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3A4 Canada
Review: finally got a chance to try this place after making reservations 10person booking where it gets donated  its nice to just walk in and not have to wait  after taking a first bite of the waffle i know what all the fuss is about and why its always so busy  the food was all very delicious our server was patient and very attentive and food was so pretty and delicious  the ambience is cute cozy and airy and i will 100 come back again

Address: 780 Richards Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3A4 Canada
Review: wonderful breakfast spot in downtown vancouver came here two days in a row while being in the city the service was wonderful and quick the atmosphere is a plus and gives it a lively yet homey feel the menu items are all carefully crafted to ensure that all flavours compliment one another items are fairly priced but if youre looking to get a good meal for under 20 i recommend going with the avocado toast adding an egg and either adding the sausage or breakfast potatoes to your plate if you want to spend a little more i recommend coming for their happy hour 6 mimosas and fricass√©e dish as a cherry on top you can request their house made waffles either to go or to enjoy while sipping your mimosa highly recommend for anyone visiting downtown vancouver

Address: 780 Richards Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3A4 Canada
Review:
waffles slightly crispy with the caramelized sugar and pairs well with the pistachio rose white chocolate and berry compote not too sweet

the paella is spicy yummy and filling enough for two people

best lavender latte ive had its actually has a strong lavender flavor

service was very efficient we came on a tuesday morning around 9 and got seated right away at the bar

Address: 780 Richards Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3A4 Canada
Review: my favourite place for brunch in vancouver the menu is unique and food is delicious i love the waffles and got 2 bags of them for later service and atmosphere are great and we waited around 40 minutes for our table there are plenty of things to do around and they text you when your table is ready

Address: 6345 Fraser Street Vancouver, BC V5W 3A3 Canada
Review:
we had the hot pot which was great we also tried the seafood pancake and steak which were a bit on the fatty side but still had decent flavor

tried some korean sake too which was somewhat sweet and packed a kick

definitely worth a visit staff we also friendly

Address: 6345 Fraser Street Vancouver, BC V5W 3A3 Canada
Review: lots of tables were available at 1130 for lunch but within the hour many were occupied food came out relatively quickly had the beef bulgogi lunch combo i appreciated a nonspicy option with the chefs special sauce we received the usual shareable tasty banchan of which we could have seconds the bulgogi was flavourful and satisfied our korean food cravings our team was topped up regularly by their staff good option for a meal with an average price point there is pay parking along fraser street or in the lot behind as well as some 2hour parking in the residential areas

Address: 6345 Fraser Street Vancouver, BC V5W 3A3 Canada
Review:
i went to this restaurant sometime in 2019 and had the hot pot it was great really enjoyed it but for some reason completely forgot about the restaurant until 4 years later when i came back

with the previous food experience so good i almost ordered everything off the menu i sampled a variety of dishes with my partner the deep fried dumplings the seafood pancake beef bulgogi and bibimbap all were delicious as i expected the side dishes and the sauces were great accompaniment to the dishes

having said that i thought the bulgogi had too much beef in it which im not sure it is a bad thing but i was hoping to have more of those delicious glass noodles

would definitely come back this time sooner

Address: 6345 Fraser Street Vancouver, BC V5W 3A3 Canada
Review:
food is good overall seafood pancake is one of the better ones sufficiently thick which i like i have tried although i felt there werent enough octopus pieces hello inflation for me house of tofu still makes the best seafood pancake ive ever had

kimchi tofu soup was decent and the portion was fair the service was a bit subpar as i usually dont like it when i have to ask for tea refill especially when it isnt even that busy

overall its a decent and i would say above average korean restaurant in vancouver

Address: 6345 Fraser Street Vancouver, BC V5W 3A3 Canada
Review: it is a cozy korean restaurant with great food and friendly service i ordered the mediumspicy gam ja tang and it was flavorful the bulgogi was tasty as well the staff was knowledgeable and attentive and the atmosphere was welcoming

Address: 551 Seymour Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3H6 Canada
Review:
ive had the same mazesoba at their restaurants in tokyo and this place definitely achieves the same standard
the flavours of the sauce and toppings mixed together give strong flavours that make you want more and having the free rice mixed at the end helps you get every last bit in the bowl
definitely eat here if you want to try something that packs a lot of savoury flavour into the noodles

Address: 551 Seymour Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3H6 Canada
Review:
i visited kokoro recently and had a delightful experience the standout dishes for me were the tomato ramen and the spicy ramen both were incredibly delicious and the flavors were wellbalanced the ingredients used in the ramen seemed to be fresh and well cooked which made the experience way better

for those with a big appetite i highly recommend going for the large size its perfect for hungry individuals who want a good portion of ramen the staff at the restaurant were polite although there wasnt anything exceptional about their service  the general items price feelt to be a bit high but overall affordable

the restaurant itself had a fast food setup ensuring quick service the spacious and cool ambiance made it an ideal spot for a pleasant evening dinner

i would definitely suggest giving this place a try especially if youre a ramen lover looking for a satisfying meal in a comfortable setting

Address: 551 Seymour Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3H6 Canada
Review: many mixed feelings about this place the gyoza is probably the best i have ever had at any place super tender and full of flavor the karaage bao bun was spicy and flavorful and a perfect little bite however the ramen was not great it didnt have much flavor at all everyone else in my party got mazesoba and loved it though i would definitely go back but would try something other than ramen next time

Address: 551 Seymour Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3H6 Canada
Review:
definitely the best place in town for mazesoba its packed with flavour and umami
good portion with decent price service is also good and fast one of the place that i always go to whenever im in vancouver

Address: 551 Seymour Street Vancouver, BC V6B 3H6 Canada
Review: soooooo good omg i have to come back to try the other dishes i had the cheesy one and it was bomb and i especially loved how they give you a scoop of rice to eat the rest of the sauce  i will definitely be back

Address: 1137 Marinaside Crescent Vancouver, BC V6Z 2Y3 Canada
Review: went around 11am on a thursday for brunch the restaurant was packed with people the staff was friendly and cheery however the wait for the food was over 30 minutes which can be a little bummer the food was beyond delicious it was juicy and flavourful we tried the chicken and gold digga poutine with runny poached eggs it was hot and tasty it came in a bowl which is more than fulfilling most of the menu items revolve around eggs as its a brunch place we also got flight mimosas which was delicious including flavours such as mango grapefruit and orange the restaurant was lively with people it has both indoor and outdoor seating

Address: 1137 Marinaside Crescent Vancouver, BC V6Z 2Y3 Canada
Review: came for brunch on a sunday and made sure to get on the wait list ahead of time for a table of 4 we had to wait 2 hours which we expected our server was so helpful and had great recommendations my favourite thing to get is the croque madame  its rich and has a nice earthiness from the truffles its also huge and very filling definitely a musttry if you like truffles

Address: 1137 Marinaside Crescent Vancouver, BC V6Z 2Y3 Canada
Review: great breakfast spot with a great view of the marina  kids inhaled their food which is always a good sign of a great restaurant for us a family  lobster crepe was very good avocado toast was excellent omelette was filling and the belgian waffle was perfection  will definitely be coming back to this spot  staff was very attentive and quick to get our order put through

Address: 1137 Marinaside Crescent Vancouver, BC V6Z 2Y3 Canada
Review: amazing location right by the water and delicious food there are a lot of options and waitresses are very friendly we had dietary restrictions and asked for recommendations they were very knowledgeable about the dishes only thing i wish was better is that the portions are on the smallerlighter side and i wish they had more shade on the patio

Address: 1137 Marinaside Crescent Vancouver, BC V6Z 2Y3 Canada
Review:
we ordered croque madame and duck confit i wanted my egg to be overcooked because im pregnant and it came exactly the way i wanted it
the employees are very energetic and smiling the service is fast the food is delicious and the ambiance is very nice everything was awesome thank you

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review:
the pork chicken shrimp katsu is very juicy and tender on the inside the outside is crunchy and not oily the sauce is great but sprinkling salt and sesame seems to bring out meat taste more do not recommend the white fish as it was slightly soggy at the bottom and the fish was quite tough in the middle other white fish i had before is very fluffy and light with a gentle sweetness to it this one was briny only

presentation of the food is great seating is wonderfully spacious service is quite attentive and friendly

all in all it was a very pleasant experience slightly on the expensive side

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: decided to come here for a late lunch but even then the place is still packed very popular and i could see why we got the zenbu set and it was a lot of food for 2 people it was so good though esp the fatty pork and scallop also have to mention the salad seems very simple but the dressing is amazing service was just fine but the atmosphere was really nice will come back for sure

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: i am absolutely smitten with the culinary delights offered at this remarkable japanese restaurant however what truly sets it apart is the exceptional team of individuals who work here the waitstaff exhibited unmatched friendliness going above and beyond by attentively checking on my friend and me throughout the dining experience their genuine care and attentiveness truly left a lasting impression kudos to this establishment for fostering such a warm and caring environment

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: very pleasant and friendly  food was fantastic the chicken breast was prepared very well hot and tasted fresh    the soft drink was a bit of novelty but tasted good strawberry   the waiter we had was always smiling and very pleasant  the place was quite as most patrons despite the place being full most of our visit spoke in low voices

Address: 1588 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2G5 Canada
Review: nice little quaint place staff were super friendly and service was fast free refills on the salad  rice and soup though we didnt need it our water was always refilled and they did such a tremendous job while we dined there katsu was so juicy and tender i love how they have the gravy baits too id highly recommend

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: the food here is amazing however the broadway location is not equipped for large parties we had 9 people and was told we would be able to sit together but on separate tables unfortunately the tables were really far apart and those on the ends of the table could not talk to each other until after dinner aside from that our dinner itself was good i ordered the cheese katsu with a side of curry to share with my husband miso soup and salad is refillable and we ordered it twice add the curry you wont regret it

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: i really enjoyed my meal here everything part of the dish was very delicious and so intricate with detail simple but tasty friendly servers price point was on the higher side for the full meals but the taste and portion is well worth the total at the end you can get unlimited sides too i believe

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: saku is certainly worth trying we ordered the chicken breast katsu with curry and the regular chicken breast katsu  both were great and the service is top notch the curry was unique and they provide a generous amount which you can share with your party the side salad and miso soup were perfect additions to the deep fried main dishes and theyre also unlimited which was nice the staff are super friendly and the prices seemed fair given the portions

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review:
ive been to saku broadway and saku robson and both restaurants are a 1010 for me the cheese katsu is immaculate and it comes with all these little extras like soup salad flavoured salt mustard the extras are u limited too so if you want more soup or salad just ask for it  the salad dressing they have is delicious too 

the servers at the broadway location were incredibly helpful they would come by our table every 510 minutes to ask if we wanted more food or to refill our water
