the price is quite expensive but thats the price of living in vancouver these days you do get a good amount of food for the price youre paying

Address: 548 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1E9 Canada
Review: first time trying nabe katau at saku i prefer the regular rosuhire katsu more than this soupy dish anyway its good for my throat when i needed something warm and not oily

Address: 556 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: jam has plenty of options for vegetarians our favorite was the veggie bowl the serving sizes here are also very generous and can easily feed two people the pancakes are a little tough but other than that everything was great great service and atmosphere too

Address: 556 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: we visited this place for a weekend brunch as expected there was a line and we had to wait for around 30 minutes we got a table outside it was a bit smaller for a group of five but we were able to manage we ordered the french toast and i also tried one of their bowls with hashbrowns and pulled chicken i loved the food  it was so flavorful and had the perfect quantity it was a perfect beginning to my day and worth the wait we also had mimosas with litchi which was quite a surprise and it tasted quite good

Address: 556 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: took my visiting cousins into vancouver as they had told me about this breakfast place they had heard about the jam on beatty street so we packed up early to beat the line up and got in right away sunday morning made the orders and the aroma from each meal was mouth watering as our server placed each order i had the apple cinnamon waffles and they were crazy amazing and hard to finish the whole dish but i managed i do recommend this breakfast spot to everyone too 2 thumbs up and thank you jam

Address: 556 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: this breakfast was stellar though we were initially worried that we would be standing in line waiting for a long time we ended up getting in pretty quickly and sat at the bar our server was super personable and the restaurant manages to seat quite a few parties despite the smaller space the fried chicken benedict was wonderful moist crispy chicken savory little kernels of corn it was delicious but the real star of this meal was a cinnamon roll pancake absolutely incredible little crunchy bits of buttery pancake with a perfect amount of cinnamon and frosting it truly was one of the best pancakes ive ever had i would absolutely go again for that pancake alone

Address: 556 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: possibly the best brunch ive had in my life the food was absolutely incredible and the atmosphere was 1010 we visited both locations which were lovely but preferred the kits location our server was an angel and super friendly the menu has so many interesting options and elevated classics

Address: 1829 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 3E4 Canada
Review: we received an invitation to a birthday dinner celebration at this restaurant and we were pleasantly amazed by the exceptional quality of the food despite its location the restaurant tends to be bustling particularly during dinner hours without a doubt we will return here in the future when the chance arises

Address: 1829 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 3E4 Canada
Review:
visited here for date night and it was so delicious

we were seated in the patio and the atmosphere was lovely i appreciated the cushions and throws available as well

we ordered the fresh burrata with proscuitto a daily special proscuitto antipasto rigatoni pork ragu and the brick chicken

you have to get the proscuitto  fresh burrata  they really do it well the bread is not too toasted and the burrata is fantastic

we loved the rigatoni the pasta had the perfect aldente bite and the sauce was packed with flavour

the brick chicken was incredible ive never tasted a sauce like the one it was served it before  i wished i had bread to soak up all that was leftover i think it might be my favourite dish of the meal

tavola has got classic italian food right everything was a hit and a really laidback and romantic atmosphere well worth a visit

Address: 1829 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 3E4 Canada
Review: great service and wonderful location close to stanley park the restaurant atmosphere is cozy and in the summer they have a nice street patio the burrata anchovies on top of eggs and rigatoni pork ragu pasta were delicious

Address: 1829 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 3E4 Canada
Review:
fantastic dinner in tavola tonight with family and friends
we shared 2 crostinis walnutgorgonzola chicken liver pate and one each of the brusettas gorgeous
mixed mains we shared the ragu and meatballs gorgeous again

very tasty food and great service by kenton good portion sizes

the restaurant is very well laid too too not at all over crowded we had one end of the long table and were very comfortable

highly recommend

Address: 1829 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 3E4 Canada
Review: we loved this italian restaurant with a beautiful ambiance it was our first time visiting it and we thoroughly enjoyed the romantic vibe it offered the food was flavourful especially their potato gnocchi with egg plants olives basil and tomatoes and cod fish of the day from their daily specials chickpea crostinis were delicious as well our server was friendly and recommended the perfect wines to pair with our food i definitely recommend it

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review: the vibe of the place is simply amazing we were seated inside which was so convenient as you can enjoy the atmosphere and stay warm in the cool nights the server was so helpful with his suggestions the food is so tasty full of flavor properly served and you will be waiting for the next bite to indulge on the combination of flavors the dessert is simply prefect not too sweet yet memorable we went late night so there were out of paella on a busy sunday night yet it looked so good and i would definitely recommend giving it a try

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review: very attentive staff very good food and a wonderful atmosphere had the daily paella and the patatas bravas both were exceptional slightly expensive but definitely worthwhile if youre uncertain

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review:
the seafood in the daily paella was so fresh and delicious i thought i would pack some to go as its a portion for 2 but i couldnt stop eating it tinto de verano was exactly the same as i had it in spain i definitely will be coming back to try more dishes
its a romantic date spot especially in the summer
the service was fantastic thank you ladies
see you soon

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review:
food is fantastic and service is great
i love chicharrones so much paella is on point as well paella is good for two people

Address: 1118 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2M8 Canada
Review:
great little place enjoyed the food and the sangria  the paella was quite good and not overly salty like some other places
busy place better make a  reservation before u go

Address: 568 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: visited chambar with our company and it was a great experience had a great table by the window and service was outstanding lots of attention to detail all the appetizers were very tasty and well presented great chill atmosphere as well only negative really was the bay closing early on a sunday but we bounced next door to the pub to enjoy our last rounds great spot and the signature lamb dish was amazing enjoy

Address: 568 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: an unforgettable dining experience chambar restaurant impressed me with its delectable cuisine and charming ambiance the menu offers a delightful mix of traditional and innovative dishes and their attention to using locallysourced ingredients is commendable the staffs passion for food and topnotch service made the evening even more enjoyable if youre a food enthusiast looking for a standout gem chambar is the place to be

Address: 568 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review:
absolutely amazing food they were also very good with my food allergies not only was i accommodated i had flavorful and amazing food went for brunch which is hard to get my egg dairy and gluten allergy accommodated but it was amazing

they have an amazing gluten free bread without egg and dairy

their bacon and apple side was the most incredible bacon ive had in forever must get

was told their dinner menu is extremely gluten free dairy free and egg free friendly

Address: 568 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review:
my aunt and uncle were visiting and i think i couldnt have booked a better place i of course was drawn by the reviews and the positive feedback of other patrons experiences but these were not fluff marketing ploys

the food was absolutely amazing the dishes were unique in both presentation and taste if you want something different and novel then this is the place it may sound corny but the medley of ingredients that were activating my taste buds was incredible im really curious what the other dishes taste like and thats why its worth revisiting

the vibe was upbeat and you are made to get into that personable mindset as the staff members seem to be  from the reception to the initial greeting at the table and the overall service i would have preferred the tables and seats to be a bit farther apart for more semiprivacy but packing in that many patrons also made business sense

it was my uncles treat and i think the servers already got the cue from that considering he was the more senior at our table and staff members were engaging him more but the servers also were not short of properly addressing us when it was our turn to say something acknowledgement of presence was never short and i loved it about their service theyre absolutely attentive and also steadfast if the water levels on glasses were low someone was on it and they had that openhands stance about their demeanor in engaging us someone would swing by every now and then to check in on us and the staff members were not snoots this is probably the best experience ive had in a while

the restaurant is worth a try experiencing

Address: 568 Beatty Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2L3 Canada
Review: i cannot say enough about the service we found out our server was only in her role for two weeks she was professional presentable and knew the menu inside out you can tell the staff there is cohesively working as one unit and that they really loved being part of the team when our server was not able to come to our table i believe the general manager popped by  he already knew that we had dietary restrictions this place is a staple and absolutely one of my favourite places in vancouver

Address: 777 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 3V5 Canada
Review:
i was told by my informant that this is john cenas favourite restaurant in vancouver howeveri cant see him 

if you want the best fresh oysters in town this is the establishment for you just make sure you go during happy hour so you can save  as it can be pretty pricey

my friend and i ate here during happy hour and ordered mostly happy hour items my friend did however order a steak which he thought was ok but quite expensive

i really enjoyed the fresh oysters and i think ill be coming here just for the oysters the other items in the happy hour menu were pretty good as well but value could be a bit better

service here is amazing our server was great i forgot her name but she was friendly and provided good service

overall i would recommend this place to oyster lovers especially during happy hour

Address: 777 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 3V5 Canada
Review: very nice interior and vibes if you want to take some photo sit inside if you just want to chill try rooftop i also like what the servers wear food is excellent service is good seafood platter is top notch really enjoyed the dining experience here

Address: 777 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 3V5 Canada
Review: had a lovely birthday brunch here with my husband we didnt realize saturdays was brunch only but still food was still great they were very accommodating to my dietary needs heidi our sever was outstanding so kind and accommodating she even brought us an extra dessert for my birthday with a cute custom chocolate very impressed by the service

Address: 777 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 3V5 Canada
Review: had gone for a quiet dinner as it was highly recommended by tom ford store owner one feels good when as a tourist good eating joints are recommended by the locals michael our server was so sweet kind  helpful to suggest the best of the dish  wine we ended up talking long as we were the last of the customers to leave sea food platter was awesome  we had a great time tiramisu top notch thanks michael

Address: 777 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 3V5 Canada
Review: by far the best happy hour menu in downtown i would recommend going here if you are in the area the seafood tower for the price is enough for 2 people the beef carpaccio was so good service was quick and our server was nice i highly suggest you book ahead if you want to try their happy hour without waiting in line

Address: 11320 Steveston Hwy Unit 110 Richmond, BC V7A 5J5 Canada
Review: i ordered the udon soup and beef rice set menu everything tasted amazing i enjoyed the flavorful soup and tender beef the only issue was how slow the food service was it took around 20 mins for the food to come otherwise this place is definitely worth trying

Address: 11320 Steveston Hwy Unit 110 Richmond, BC V7A 5J5 Canada
Review:
i do like the atomosphere and service but

the food doesnt feel fresh my friend ordered the unagi a week ago and said that it was very fishy to the point she pushed it away after the first bite

i ordered the beef bowl and the taste was great only problem was that the beef was rubbery hard hard to chew like rubber hard to swallow with my friends comment about this place and my current experience

i dont think the food is very fresh

i think this is for a persons personal experience perhaps the beef was meant to be like rubber because of its cooked methods

and i havent been to this place for all its food so its hard to comment but my first impression of it was not so good i would say that one can give this place a chance but that person might meet the same experience that my friend and i had

the sauce and appearance of the dish was very good though

food 355
price 
cleanliness 55

comeback rate 10

Address: 11320 Steveston Hwy Unit 110 Richmond, BC V7A 5J5 Canada
Review: small restaurant with about 6 tables they were able to accommodate us as a table of 6 they have 6 different sets of meals you order at the counter first and they bring the food out to your table the food was decent its nice they come with a variety of side dishes the meal was 16 i also ordered the mango or passion fruit soda and it was pretty good

Address: 11320 Steveston Hwy Unit 110 Richmond, BC V7A 5J5 Canada
Review: home away from home  delicious japanese style healthy meals in a clean hospitable environment  love this place  would strongly recommend  do not forget about the delicious chicken   must try

Address: 11320 Steveston Hwy Unit 110 Richmond, BC V7A 5J5 Canada
Review: accidentally came across this japanese bento joint when we were in the area we tried the beef curry and the foie gras chicken teriyaki bento chicken was perfectly cooked juicy with charred bits the sides were good too seating is limited highly recommend

Address: 1017 West Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C4 Canada
Review: a delicious experience we sat on the upper floor with a view of the kitchen we loved how energetic it was up here the maple fried chicken and meatballs were a standout the pizza and dessert were also tasty we were met with great service throughout the evening

Address: 1017 West Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C4 Canada
Review: we just landed and wanted a couple of drinks and a snack before a late dinner  i read good things and we decided to stop in  it was great  the hostess was nice and bartender was friendly and fantastic  the meatballs and pizza bread hit the spot  were definitely interested in trying it for dinner the next time we come back to vancouver

Address: 1017 West Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C4 Canada
Review:
ive been to nightingales probably 34 times now and each time its been pretty good
we came for happy hour this time we had the fried chicken fries pepperoni pizza and the margherita pizza
the pizza was thin and chewy lots of toppings just the right amount of savouriness
the fries were probably my favourite could be a bit crispier the spice on the outside gives it a bit of sourness which makes it somewhat addicting
i get the fried chicken every time i come they sweetness balances off everything nicely and the pickles are just the cherry on top
every time i come the service is always very nice and friendly and this time was no exception if you want to go somewhere to hang out with friends with okay food and drinks and a laid back atmosphere with decent service this would be my choice downtown

Address: 1017 West Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C4 Canada
Review: service was excellent food was delicious the place is really cute we were there for a late lunch and it was not too busy our waitress forgot to put our last dish in so we never got it luckily we had ordered plenty of food it wasnt needed

Address: 1017 West Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C4 Canada
Review: found this place for lunch and enjoyed the beet salad fantastic simple and flavorful with the fried chicken  was so good i came back for dinner and had the margarita pizza 5 and the asparagus   food quality was all top notch and the service was also exceptional  the bar was gorgeous

Address: 1938 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review:
an excellent spot for enjoying thai cuisine offering a delightful and reasonably priced dining experience the quality of the food is exceptional particularly the dumplings vegetarian green curry and coconut soup which we found to be incredibly delicious similar to many establishments in vancouver this place caters to a diverse range of dietary preferences ensuring that even vegans have at least one suitable choice additionally their happy hour drinks are highly enjoyable

one aspect that stood out to us was the variety of options available on the menu whether you were a meat lover a vegetarian or a vegan there were numerous choices to suit every palate it was refreshing to see a restaurant that prioritized inclusivity and catered to different dietary needs without compromising on taste or quality

during our visit we decided to explore the happy hour offerings and we were not disappointed the selection of drinks was impressive with a range of creative and wellcrafted cocktails along with other beverage options it was a fantastic opportunity to try something new and indulge in refreshing concoctions that complemented the flavors of the food perfectly

Address: 1938 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review: wow  what can i say food was absolutely phenomenal the snacks at the beginning were small but were packed with punches of flavour we had a reservation and did the tasting menu about 80 a person and we definitely left with full bellies my aunt was visiting from out of town and she was absolutely blown away street parking on 4th was expensive so try and find parking in the residential areas

Address: 1938 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review: everything was perfect i dont remember the name of the food but the food was gorgeous and tasty the atmosphere was stunning moreover the staff are all nice and friendly my friend and i really had a good time and enjoyed the food and service here thank you thank you

Address: 1938 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review:
we had a wonderful dining experience
the flavors were incredible and the staff were very attentive
we had the pricefixed menu with the wine pairing and it was amazing extremely delightful and knowledgeable chef exquisite artistic and delicious dishes with fresh ingredients prepared from scratch distinctive and wellbalanced flavor and teste
love thai cup cake at first bit usually i always let my camera eat first but this meal i enjoyed it so much completely forgot to shoot photos
wine pairing both options bc  french flight are prefect pair with food and dessert i ordered them twice as perfect match 
highly recommended

Address: 1938 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M5 Canada
Review:
note that maenam only does tasting menu if you reserve this was not clear on their website or during reservations even if you read it now it doesnt say a la carte is only available for walk ins

besides that the food overall was good but nothing wowd us which i was expecting for a micheline guide recommended restaurant

88pp for 4 courses  menu said for an overall 11 dishes  fyi the appies were 4 hours derve sized bites which accounted for 4 dishes

appies  45 loved all of them but nothing over the top special

bison salad 05 it was soo salty it tasted bitter

halibut coconut sour soup  25
didnt quite give us the kick expected
it jusy tasted like a coconut broth

they offered us the shrimp salad after which we enjoyed the shrimp was definitely undercooked you can still see the raw center but i trust that its sashimi grade and ate nothing special  taste more like a viet dish 35

sablefish curry  55 fish was cooked perfectly more very flavourful and perfect with rice

pork belly pad cha  35 good but nothing special

desert hazelnut cake and coconut jelly 25
hazlenut cake got soggy from the sauce but i loved the brulee on top
coconut jelly was super dense i think they might have used too much agar agar but it wasnt too sweet and had a lot of  what felt like fresh coconut meat

overall a good dining experience but missed the mark for us on many things we probably wont be back
for comparison we really enjoy sawasdee for thai food taste is on point and authentic but obv theyre atmosphere and plating is not compatible

a little dissapointed since we had high hopes

Address: 1046 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W9 Canada
Review:
one of the best meals ive had in a while we got the 50 family style dinner everything was cooked extremely well and was fresh the use of fresh herbs makes a difference here
steak was cooked to perfection and the three layer dessert was a perfect blend would definitely come back

Address: 1046 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W9 Canada
Review: the reservation is needed such a great spot to have vietnamese food in victoria dr excellent service  alice was very friendly and helpful about the service and the menu detail and we end up with 8 dishes for 2 people we seem like very dish quite interesting the steak is very tender and soft and serve with watercress salad  so so good the pho noodle is yummy very concentrated in flavor and clear broth octopus with lime sauce is refreshing and go very well with seafood the prawn fritters is eatable till trail  the bone marrow does not have much substance maybe we arent lucky this time its mostly bone spring rolls were fantastic when you bite into it you can feel a mouthful of ingredients exploding in your mouth highly recommend this place   we will come back again and the pandan desserts is amazing good combination with ice cream

Address: 1046 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W9 Canada
Review:
c·∫£m ∆°n
my first time trying this local bustling joint i had hesitated as it seemed a bit more western and mainstream however i was massively incorrect
the grub here is phonomenal super yummy dope plentiful portions of authentic vietnamese grub at its finest with reasonable prices for the area i hauled a portion of mixed vegetables and fried tofu perfect i loved it and wolfed it down the joint is super cool love the asethetics and a fantastic vibe theres also a bunch of really nice outdoor benches to park your bit in the sun whilst having a chow down
im stoked to return this was a rad experience of many and an awesome feast
support local businesses

Address: 1046 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W9 Canada
Review: booking a reservation involved setting alerts for an opening and it finally happened  on coming in at the time assigned to us seating was quick our server was excellent and helped us put together a meal off the menu where everything was sounding good  we ordered the garlic fried noodles bone marrow stir fried vegetables and steak the bone marrow was tasty and fun to eat the noodles were flavourful with a good bite to them but a tad dry the vegetables were nice and not your usual mix finally the steak was good but we had pretty high expectations coming in  we ordered the sticky rice cake ice cream and it was marvellous

Address: 1046 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W9 Canada
Review:
visiting from chicago my lord make this a stop if you want fun interesting food started off with this octopus dont sleep on this green sauce its a little spicy and a whole lot of delicious the bone marrow was decadent and balanced out with the lime i also had an interesting cod dish that was served over a fire i didnt love the sauce it was served with but alex was quick to offer another suggestion for a garlicky fish sauce thing that was amazing

both alex and the other female bartender were great normally you just get one of the two bar tenders to give you attention they were a great tag team helping everyone at the bar

probably about 15 minutes away from my hotel well worth the uber to get outside of the touristy spots outside of the stanley park area

Address: 774 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C9 Canada
Review: while the restaurant is cute in a very good location and the food looked pretty i found its taste is below my expectation the waitress advised us that the share plate would be good to share among 4 people but it was pretty small so we called it a light lunch if you love dim sum i dont think this place will satisfy you

Address: 774 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C9 Canada
Review: pretty cool restaurant for dumpling first time having different flavoured soup dumplings gave me an unique experience went with friends all loved it have a great experience of chinese cuisine signature 7 is definitely recommended we also liked their mains orange chicken and  sweet  sour pork their flavours are great

Address: 774 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C9 Canada
Review: tried the different colored bao and it did not disappoint  not all flavors are to my taste but it was worth trying  the food was great and the service was even better  parking might be hard to find during weekends so great time to visit would be weekdays

Address: 774 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C9 Canada
Review:
excellent food we were seated in a place where we could see them making our food
good prices and excellent service our waitress was kind and answered all our questions
i highly recommend jingle bao their 7 different flavors baos were excellent the fried tofu and shrimp dumplings as well

Address: 774 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C9 Canada
Review: we tried their sampler and although some of the dishes were not our favorites we enjoyed the experience nonetheless three of us shared the sampler lots of food we all really enjoyed the jingle baos multi colouredassorted flavors however i personally would have been happy with just the classic but we were game for trying new things the chicken was good and the edamame and a few other things but i dont remember what theybwere called one of the tables had some napkins on the floor that one of the waitresses missed picking up but everything else was clean and we were seated quickly and served promptly

Address: 163 Keefer Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1X3 Canada
Review:
i enjoyed our dining experience at bao bei but found the cuisine a bit confused we asked the server for recommendations and she suggested half the menu so of course we obliged

we got marinated eggplant as an appetizer prawn dumplings pea shoots prawn fried rice and halibut the star of the meal was definitely the pea shoots and the strangest was likely the fried rice which tasted like a fusion of korean and indian which was a bit unexpected considering the traditional chinese menu

the vibe was cool dimly lit and sat small and large tables we had quick service and left full the entire meal may have been a bit expensive but were glad we tried it once

Address: 163 Keefer Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1X3 Canada
Review: recently came back to visit and now i remembered why i dont come here often the food takes a very very long time to arrive it was an average tuesday yes it was busy but ive never been to busy restaurant where it takes 2 hours to get fried rice and some  wagyu meat the staff was nice keeping us updated but dam we waited a long time on a more positive note i love their cocktails i recommend the nai nai punch and in a hot day the tokyo long island slushi

Address: 163 Keefer Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1X3 Canada
Review: the name seems like a chinese restaurant but the food tastes doesnt like local chinese food western people may like it cuz its for their taste to cook but if you are asian dont go there you wont be satisfied with their food overall they did really good job on their vibe and food and every chinese elements

Address: 163 Keefer Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1X3 Canada
Review: family owned and delightfully chic bistro with spectacular food we went for the chefs choice menu and were not disappointed stars were crispy fried silken tofu cold eggplant with ginger bao peashoots wonderful selection of mocktails and cocktails with delightful service just a really solid place built on family traditions and a love for fresh local ingredients prepared perfectly

Address: 163 Keefer Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1X3 Canada
Review: absolutely fantastic  well balanced dishes and great atmosphere there 55 per person option is more than worth it and nearly every dish is 55 fast service kind staff and overall enjoyable night perfect for a group of 23 for relatively quick bite

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: this restaurant offers stunning views of the water and city skyline the food is absolutely delicious with a menu that offers plenty of options to choose from but what really sets this restaurant apart is the atmosphere  its the perfect spot to catch up with friends over a meal and drinks the staff are friendly and welcoming overall i highly recommend checking out this restaurant for a memorable dining experience in vancouver

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
i recently dined at cactus club restaurant and wanted to share my thoughts although there was a delay in receiving our food the staff was incredibly friendly and made us feel welcome throughout our visit the restaurant itself had a great ambiance and provided a pleasant environment for our meal
one area of improvement would be the selection of nonalcoholic drinks which was somewhat limited it would be nice to see a wider variety of options in that regard on the other hand i must commend the kitchen on the fantastic calamari it was cooked to perfection and had a delicious flavor that left me wanting more
however i found the ravioli with shrimp to be a bit too sweet for my taste while it may appeal to those who enjoy sweeter flavors i personally would have preferred a more balanced taste
overall my experience at cactus club restaurant was positive with the standout being the delightful calamari despite the minor setbacks i would still recommend visiting for a friendly atmosphere and memorable dining experience

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
a very large restaurant with gorgeous views over the harbour the staff was very kind and the food was great though my chicken sandwich was better than the tofu bowl which lacked sauce and was a bit dry really good fries the cocktail menu was large and the cocktails themselves were very tasty too

while the views were lovely the restaurant was very loud and it could be difficult to hear the person sitting across from you

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: its not a fancy 5 star restaurant but for what it is it was awesome i had salmon for dinner and it was delicious i sat in the dining room with a water view most people wore sunglasses because the sun was bright and bold at 8pm at night my waiter was awesome i wish i remembered his name its a crowed place so make reservations early they have outside eating and since its right on the water side its a great place to take a stroll afterwards

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: great food great environmentvibe and reasonable prices food was a bit slow to come out and service was somewhat lacking but overall i really enjoyed my evening there a reservation ahead of time will make it much easier to get seated

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review: i came here last week for happy hour the happy hour prices are reasonable the food was good and came out pretty quick staff were friendly half of the outside patio was closed on a hot day so we had to sit inside but overall decent experience

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
came here with my partner during happy hour we were really happy with the happy hour menu the prices were reasonable for what we ordered and the service was great we ordered the
blackened creole chicken it was delicious we loved the mashed potatoes that came with it we also got the tuna poke bowl it was fresh and all the ingredients worked super well together excited to come again

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
the food was absolutely amazing especially the delicious avocado salad i tried baja fish tacos for they very first time and it was a little spicy but incredibly delicious
everything was perfect

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review: one of the only places not short staffed what a pleasure the food was amazing and they couldnt do enough for us

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
first off nicci our server was awesome the drinks appys and dinner was amazing
thank for a nice evening to help celebrate our 29th anniversary when making our reservations it asked if it was a special occasion l and it was put in that it was our anniversary so we were bit disappointed that there was no mention of it

Address: 157 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1B8 Canada
Review:
arrived early to a large group dinner and were thoughtfully greeted loved the bourbon cocktail to start and the poutine add bacon was unbelievably delicious chickpea flour fried chicken wings has the best flavour and dinner tacos just as yummy

everyone was delighting in the food amidst the vintage atmosphere

Address: 157 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1B8 Canada
Review:
this is my first time here and we had a great time  we sit by the bar and we l
enjoyed it our servicer blaize was very knowledgeable and friendly  she knows everything about the beer and the food  we were amazed by how much she knew about everything on the menu  she is super nice and outgoing  we ordered  craft beer  a couple flights  the wings we ordered were delicious and loved our beer  we will definitely invite our friends and come back again

Address: 157 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1B8 Canada
Review: we had such a lovely time at alibi room last night  great service didnt feel rushed good happy hour menu  beer selection i had the fried chicken sandwich which was tasty  the other had pork belly which he raves about whatever you eat try the onion mayo  appreciate being able to walk into a place on a friday night in vancouver  have a lovely little leisurely dinner will be back

Address: 157 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1B8 Canada
Review: ive been meaning to try to this place and damn was i not disappointed we came for their happy hour and it delivered snack size poutine was delicious there tacos were probably some of the best ive ever had which is saying a lot pretzel buns and cheese sauce was not too bad we each got a flight of their beers and each one had a unique flavour highly recommend checking this place out the vibe is amazing and the people are super friendly well be back forsure

Address: 157 Alexander Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1B8 Canada
Review: this is an awesome location within a charming and historic building the seating options are diverse and the atmosphere is fantastic their menu of food and drinks offers a wide range of impressive choices i decided to try something new and ordered the pork belly burger which was absolutely delicious additionally the fries were cooked to perfection and had an excellent flavor the service was prompt and friendly overall a superb place in gastown that ill definitely return to in the future

Address: 1175 Davie St Vancouver, BC V6E 1N2 Canada
Review: a great spot on davie st for sushi service was quick and attentive i really enjoyed their nigiri sushi and their special rolls my friend got their yakiudon and said it tasted good as well the presentation was nice and the restaurant wasnt too busy at 1pm on a saturday

Address: 1175 Davie St Vancouver, BC V6E 1N2 Canada
Review:
one of our favourite sushi spots in vancouver so delicious  i hate when sushi has too much sauce but the sauce to rice to fish ratio here is just perfect

our group ordered take out and they took our phone number however we waited for a text or call back for pick up and they never contacted us we also stood by the door but never saw our food bags come to the front they also never came out to tell us our food was ready quite annoying giving how long we had to wait until we asked them

Address: 1175 Davie St Vancouver, BC V6E 1N2 Canada
Review: great dining experience there was a bit of line up but wasnt bad considering it was saturday noon in downtown their sushis are very good the volcano roll is a must try also love the vegetable tempura service is friendly and speedy the parking is a bit hard to find

Address: 1175 Davie St Vancouver, BC V6E 1N2 Canada
Review: enjoyed this sushi restaurant a lot  excellent food and the service was also really good a bit slow because of how busy it was but not intrusive or bothersome by any means portions were generous and great for sharing and the prices were really good expect to wait for about an hour or more to get a table as this is a small restaurant that is very popular our table spent about 25 per person for 1 appetizer and 7 rolls to share

Address: 1175 Davie St Vancouver, BC V6E 1N2 Canada
Review: the sushi here is delicious rolls are a good size and have interesting flavours the sashimi is so fresh and melts in your mouth amazingly inexpensive for the quality additionally to the sushi get the cheese loin katsu and thank me later service is always good but definitely prepare to wait they dont take reservations we went on a saturday afternoon just past lunch time and waited 30mins  worth it for the experience the restaurant itself is pretty small so prepare to wait longer for parties bigger than 4

Address: 1809 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 5B8 Canada
Review: one of the top restaurants in vancouver great food service and atmosphere the reservation is hard to get and its a bit pricey but you get what you paid for we did wine pairing on our visit and discovered a few great wines the only downside the wine portions were quite small for the price and also additional caviar was not worth the price overall highly recommended to get there at least once

Address: 1809 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 5B8 Canada
Review:
this is a wonderful restaurant located on west 1st close to the beach and a wine store next door very awesome space the food and service definitely match up to it

its one of the michelin star restaurants in vancouver and its definitely earned its reputation the food was absolutely delicious and carefully crafted every bite was perfect and everything just seemed to work well

the cocktails were also delicious and matched well with the dishes

the dessert was fresh and gave a palette cleansing experience  definitely another highlight from an already amazing dinner

if youre worried about being hungry after the tasting menu you wont be it definitely will fill you i dont think you even need to opt for the add ons but i found it filling

dont worry about parking either as there is plenty of paid parking in the area we got lucky and found one right outside the restaurant but cars come and go quite often enough

i would highly recommend coming here but book well in advance as they fill up quickly

Address: 1809 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 5B8 Canada
Review:
the first time i have visited annalena and i can say it truly deserves the michelin start that it got last november

the servers are extremely knowledgable about their menu and their memory is impeccable every dish was served in unison and the balance of flavours is perfect with every dish

there was not a single dish we did not like but the torn bread was definitely the highlight of the night all of us left satisfied and full rare for a restaurant like this

5stars for a 5star restaurant

Address: 1809 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 5B8 Canada
Review:
we were at annalena during chapter 63 super attentive service the food was creative and had wellbalanced flavours there were interesting decorative bits reminisce of the 90s

we could only get bar seats and the corner we sat was kinda dark we couldnt see the dishes clearly or take good pics of it thankfully our taste buds could still savour them recommended

Address: 1809 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 5B8 Canada
Review: a very nice experience trying out the dining menu 62 we definitely get to try somethings that we otherwise wouldnt order the bread in the clam sauce was a highlight i also liked very much how the scallop and beef was cooked and seasoned some other dish fell flat for me but was still pleasant surprises

Address: 130 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T3 Canada
Review: we had to check out the chinatown scene as someone visiting from chinatown in the south we needed authentic chinese food before we boarded a 7 day cruise this place did not disappoint and dare i say it was our best meal in vancouver and on our vacation we got the mixed bbq plate and everything was cooked perfectly the pork in canada is betterim not sure why but its not as salty as in the states so the chinese bbq pork has a more subtle sweet flavor here i loved that they gave the ginger scallion sauce with the soy sauce chicken excellent salted egg that matches beautifully with well cooked rice the tea was perfect wonderful floral notes matches perfectly with the bbq we ate everything and wished for the remainder of the trip that we had ordered some food to go too if you can go early to avoid a wait and its a great value

Address: 130 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T3 Canada
Review: greeted by a roast rack packed to the brim with finely cooked chinese bbq within a clean old chinatown themed experience this is the most authentic bbq within vancouvers chinatown they do not go overboard on the seasoning and salt allowing the natural flavors of the meat to shine it is still imperative to pair the bbq with a neutral side dish such as rice or noodles to complete this experience

Address: 130 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T3 Canada
Review: an absolutely delicious plate of food the three treasures gave us the perfect sampling of what chinatown bbq has to offer the flavors were hearty and wellbalanced the service is a cut above the rest here they educate you about the menu items and are very friendly and accommodating

Address: 130 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T3 Canada
Review: our server was so nice and really attentive to our needs and mostly the food was really great highly recommend the crispy pork and the serving was fast too the ambience was nice and clean it feels like your in modern hongkong style restaurant and their washroom was very clean

Address: 130 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T3 Canada
Review: my dinein experience is long overdue i came back after a long absence but pleased the same outstanding quality of their roasted pork sui yok is still there the restaurant is comfortably lit lighting is soothing not overly bright clean retro styled decor the servers are courteous and friendly server ian is outstanding im coming back for more

Address: 3068 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: nice selection of food shown in a beautiful menu they taste as good as they look too the seafood cabbage cake okonomiyaki was one of our favorites and the salmon tempura was a good unique appetizer everything was flavorful but light a very nice balance the decor and ambience was modern casual good for both families and hipsters alike in fact we saw several families with young kids devouring plates of sushi rolls happily

Address: 3068 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: everything was so fresh the chef roll tasted so good and unique i would highly recommend if you like sashimi to try this roll with many fish inside its a bit pricey but the quality is very good here the zombie brain fried avacado with spicy tuna and crab salad was also good

Address: 3068 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: servers can explain any dish we do not know service is fast but not rushed we were able to sit comfortably and eat without interruption around 9 pm great atmosphere low light setting we got the hamachi carpaccio salmon carpaccio cheese katsu miso eggplant and beef sushi that i dont recall the spelling of all were amazing i wish i could eat miso eggplant like this at home would love to be back next time we are in vancouver

Address: 3068 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: its hard to give them 4stars as the food is amazing but the service was lacking hopefully they can improve on serving customers better

Address: 3068 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: went here for a friends birthday and it wasnt very busy but we went on a week night so thats probably why some food tasted really good and some were ok service was not bad and the atmosphere was fun

Address: 909 Burrard Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2N2 Canada
Review:
the food is incredible we have not had food this good since europe
everything is deliciouseven flavors that you think dont go together this chef makes them work in a delicious way
incredible food and service if you are in vancouver try this restaurant

Address: 909 Burrard Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2N2 Canada
Review:
absolutely phenomenal food and service every time i recently celebrated a birthday here and brought my own cake the hostess advised that there would be a plating fee of 450 per person fair enough it is a hassle for the restaurant to deal with this they plated the cake and used piping to decorate the plates with chocolate and caramel swirls they also garnished the plate with mint and whipped cream wow so impressed

the food of course was fantastic

Address: 909 Burrard Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2N2 Canada
Review: i visited this restaurant to celebrate my birthday and it was an excellent choice every dish had a special and unique taste and our server brian provided me with friendly food explanations and topnotch service throughout the meal his service escorting me out after the meal was a really nice touch and the best service ive ever received he was professional and i was genuinely happy i hope to receive this kind of service again on my next visit

Address: 909 Burrard Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2N2 Canada
Review: we attended recently for the alsatian night after many years i like the place calm and subdued atmosphere simple decoration it is comfy staff very good and helpful food was excellent and done well expensive wine list the cheapest one around 90 i thought they need to have more affordable wine around 60 to 75

Address: 909 Burrard Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2N2 Canada
Review: fantastic place with topnotch service since the moment we entered until we left everything was great we visited at the first time of the evening and it looked like they had an issue in the kitchen which was quickly and gently solved by the staff offering some appetizers to the whole restaurant we tried the mushroom soup the braised lamb a featured turbot fish with pasta orange creme br√ªl√©e and profiteroles they were all exceptional except for the fish that we felt it missed something but still not enough to not give a 5 star to this place

Address: 1428 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1N2 Canada
Review:
incredible food lovely drinks and great service all in a really beautiful space

we were delighted to get a reservation here for valentines day even on a night where you would expect it to be super busy the service was still dialled in all of the staff were super friendly and efficient food came quickly and the whole dining area was nice and spacious we never felt like we were too close to other guests or that it was ever too loud

linh caf√© has done a really great job in every way this is what hospitality is all about

Address: 1428 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1N2 Canada
Review:
food was great but service was poor

first of all the restaurant does not accept reservations for a party smaller than 6 or 8 cant remember exactly but we have 5 ppl therefore we purposely arrived earlier for dinner which was around 520pm we were immediately told by the host that we need to finish our dinner by 715pm in order to let the next reserved party sit down that sort of rubbed us in the wrong way to begin with but we accepted the challenge

then more issues with our waitress she was very polite but i think this is more of a training issue for her she was filling our glasses with a red sangria but it was dripping all over the table then it dripped on my friends light color dress she was apologetic and helped my friend to clean it then once again she reminded us we will need to finish dinner by 715pm during the whole dinner she was constantly interrupting our conversation by collecting empty dishes or even unfinished dishes at one point she collected all of our utensils and plates but there was still food left to eat we were already quite annoyed by that it feels like the kitchen was out of dishes and plates that they needed to collect them as soon as the customers are somewhat done with the food

finally we were paying the bill and our waitress brought over the credit card machine but basically walked right up to our friends back and leaned over against him thats the reason why we believe all of this is more of a training issue she needs to learn to give space and privacy to their customers and how to pour properly this is a higher end vietnamese restaurant and the service certainly did not feel that way

Address: 1428 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1N2 Canada
Review:
never disappointed in this restaurant

they dont take reservations you have to go early to write down your names and line up the line can be long from 30 minutes up to an hour or so

make sure you go there early so you can get the mussels before it sold out it was the best mussels i ever had before too bad we couldnt order this time the snails is really rich and tasty i could eat a whole bread with the snails sauce the lobster benny is pretty good but the portion a bit small compared to the price clam is good but we were too busy with the snails

Address: 1428 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1N2 Canada
Review:
based on a recommendation from a youtuber review my friend and i decided to try linh cafe a frenchvietnamese fusion restaurant in town the sleek and modern building immediately caught our attention as we walked in the interior is chic and comfortable  perfect for a girls gettogether or a selfie session

after perusing the extensive menu we decided to try a variety of dishes we started with the yellowfin tuna tartare which had a strong sesame oil flavor that overpowered the dish however the homemade potato chips served alongside it were exceptionally crispy with a bold potato flavor we wished we could have ordered the chips alone as a snack

next we had the nem  ch·∫£ gi√≤  spring roll which my friend loved while i found it to be a bit salty for my liking the filling was delicious and wellseasoned

the chicken liver was served with a creamy dijon mustard sauce that complemented the dish well however we felt it could have been even better if the liver had been marinated prior to cooking

the fried frog legs were a standout dish for us seasoned with garlic butter chili flakes and fresh herbs the frog legs were incredibly tender and perfectly complemented by the garlic butter i highly recommend trying it

the duck breast wasnt as impressive as we had hoped while it was served with glazed apples and grapes we found the fruits to be the highlight of the dish the duck breast itself seemed overcooked and lacked the desired tenderness

lastly we tried the ph·ªü b√≤ with braised beef brisket rice noodles and bone marrow we were blown away by the rich and flavorful beef bone soup base and the perfectly cooked rice noodles the bone marrow however wasnt to our liking

to end our meal on a high note we indulged in the restaurants delicious bread it was so good that we each finished an entire loaf

overall linh cafe offers a unique and delicious dining experience with a beautiful atmosphere some dishes may need minor adjustments but the quality of the food and the attentive service make it worth checking out

Address: 1428 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1N2 Canada
Review:
always wanted to check out this place and finally did today

there was a line up to get in  it was busy but the space inside is huge

menu didnt have any vegetarian options therefore i asked my server  she recommended noodles with vegetables which is not on the menu

it was delicious very flavourful  and huuuge  and quite pricey 
but no protein

Address: 3825 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P2 Canada
Review: really enjoyed the cod fish and chips loved that their fries are fresh handcut fries the fish was very fresh  looking forward to trying other fish types and items we ate on the bench outside with our dog and it was the perfect casual dinner

Address: 3825 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P2 Canada
Review: after a long and rewarding stroll from downtown to the bloedel conservatory i enjoyed one of the best  if not the best fish and chips of my life i was recommended to try the halibut and oh boy heavenly not oily at all crispy and light seasoned to perfection a generous serving of fish on a bed of fantastic fries coleslaw and tartar dip super friendly staff cool and laidback interior with some seating by the window really really recommended as they focus on local seasonal and sustainable seafood really awesome

Address: 3825 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P2 Canada
Review:
its usually halibut salmon or cod managed to veer off my typical menu choices and explore the arctic char for my fish and chips order

from the onset the service representative demonstrated a commendable level of hospitality and eagerness to cater to this unique request since it was not on the menu that was very nice of them

now onto the main event  the arctic char fish and chips to say it was superb would be an understatement the perfectly fried arctic char exceeded all my expectations it was succulent and full of flavour pairing harmoniously with the crispy chips this dish struck a perfect balance between the delicate fish and the satisfyingly crunchy chips its like a perfect balance between trout and salmon in taste

this was without a doubt the best arctic char fish and chips i have ever had in canada their tartar sauce is also to die for they now sell it in mason jars great choice

rating 55 stars

Address: 3825 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P2 Canada
Review: a very cool local spot with gluten free fish and chips so amazing fries and halibut chips were outstanding and cooked in a separate safe frier worth the trek also got the dairy free clam chowder

Address: 3825 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P2 Canada
Review: we are repeat customers  this is the best fish and chips shop in the city and i am very sure it is not close loved it all today  and a big fan of the new scallop bites  fun

Address: 1626 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6J 1X6 Canada
Review: just discovered this amazing restaurant beautiful decorated inside its a huge location inside and the food is super delicious loved the crispy chicken and the pasta dish the spicy  squid octopus  with the seaweed chips cant wait to come celebrate  my birthday  here

Address: 1626 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6J 1X6 Canada
Review: dined here this week and didnt have reservation ahead so we had to wait 20minutes before we were seated the place was very busy on a monday evening and noticed they had a few birthday shout outs happening back to back they bring out a cake or dessert of some type with a light up apparatus accompanied by drums and singing and the music volume is turned up and all the staff yells happy birthday as soon as we were seated the server greeted us brought out waters and menus right away awesome i was hungry already smelling all the delicious dishes all around me since they were busy the server asked if it was okay to bring the food as they come everything was so delicious the oxtail ramen broth was exactly as i imagined heads up this does not come with a lot of meat so must be ordered on top of your main dish the blue fin toro belly melted like butter it was so good the salmon carpaccio was very light and flavourful and not as fishy as i thought my husband loved taco wasabi it is definitely for someone who loves seafood and spicy food we also ordered chestnut dessert and it was surprisingly delicious cant complain over all it was a delightful experience will definitely be visiting again and highly recommended

Address: 1626 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6J 1X6 Canada
Review: we celebrated our friends birthday here which was really fun our server was attentive and friendly the food was made so that you can share out amongst the group or to yourself i loved their chicken karaage and ebi mayo i liked that they had a great selection of drinks would come back again

Address: 1626 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6J 1X6 Canada
Review: weve been going to suika for many years and its a consistently excellent japanese izakara restaurant terrific sashimi  seafood theres always creative new dishes  specials and the service is great highly recommended

Address: 1626 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6J 1X6 Canada
Review:
the food and service were phenomenal loved the genuine hospitality of the servers

i got the chirashi set which was amazing in every bite they also accommodated my shrimp allergy by making sure to use different utensils to prepare the dish

one of the bestmost authentic izakaya you can find in vancouver

the servers went above and beyond to even open the door for us as we exited super japanese hospitality

Address: 2430-8260 Westminster Highway Richmond, BC V6X 1A7 Canada
Review: if youre craving for rice rolls this is the spot to go great texture and flavours that combine well together to give you a satisfying and full stomach after eating although it is located in the richmond public market food court dont let it fool you you as wait times can peak beyond an hour there was a 20min wait ordering at 11am on a saturday morning but quickly jumped to a 45min to 1 hour wait by the time we finished beef rice roll was comparatively better than the shrimp rice roll which had lacklustre shrimp

Address: 2430-8260 Westminster Highway Richmond, BC V6X 1A7 Canada
Review:
as far as rice rolls ago i quite enjoyed this place the congee was great too although there was an aftertaste to the pork so it properly wasnt super fresh
but overall i would come back here for the rice rolls although there is a long wait it was a 50min wait for our order but the line never died down so that was understandable and i had a chance to do some shopping as i waited it was not a huge issue

Address: 2430-8260 Westminster Highway Richmond, BC V6X 1A7 Canada
Review:
great place for congee and rice roll well worth the 30 min wait

ordered the hei style sampan congee and preserved vegetable  pork rice roll combo got 250 off with the combo both were equally tasty

the osmanthus and fermented rice fresh soy milk was also very good

will definitely be coming back

Address: 2430-8260 Westminster Highway Richmond, BC V6X 1A7 Canada
Review:
nostalgic silky rice noodles pls like
this place makes the rice noodles by scraping it off the instead of rolling itx emphasizing texture and silkiness we got the pork beef and schrimp and the pork and beef rice rolls the soysauce is also to die for good prices for a nice cheap lunch located in a historic and cozy foodcourt unfortunately by the time we went the congee was sold out so didnt get to try that

Address: 2430-8260 Westminster Highway Richmond, BC V6X 1A7 Canada
Review: there is an emphasis of trying this spot because of the texture silkiness and thinness of the rice rolls it was very well done and in the style where its not wrapping the toppings it does get relatively busy here even on a weekday but took about 15 mins from ordering to get the food the congee and rice roll combo is a decent deal at around 14 dependent on type of rice roll you choose as some are more premium congee is thick and has a lot of content this spot does not accept card and its cash only or via wechatalipay worth going here to grab a meal best to eat fresh there was about 9 shrimps in the rice roll a reasonable amount

Address: 415 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G7 Canada
Review:
wow location is a bit sketchy to say the leastnotwithstanding the minute you enter youre welcomed by passionate and knowledgeable staff if you are a foodie this is a must try location best option is the i want it all option 85person its a 12 course tapas share option of delicious pallet popping delights where you get to try the entire chefs creations only catch is you need a minimum of 4 people to try this so get your double date on and try this place youll thank me later  cheers

ps there is also a very creative signature cocktails menu if you so desire

Address: 415 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G7 Canada
Review: absolutely delicious food and great service each dish was beautifully decorated accompanied by delicious sauce chicken of the sea is a must eat lamb tartare was not smelly at all flavoured with lemon and capers trout was fluffy and seasoned well quite pricey for the portion but recommend this place to everyone for quality food

Address: 415 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G7 Canada
Review:
amazing service and great food inside a very unassuming exterior the mackenzie room somehow manage to land a very interesting vibe that feels very welcoming and casual all the while delivering a great fine dining experience

would definitely come back

Address: 415 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G7 Canada
Review:
i came in for dine out this past sunday and was impressed we sat at the bar and our server gave us great service

the food was delicious in my opinion the stand out dishes were the chicken of the sea and the pork dish i also ordered a non alcoholic ginger beer for 5 which i thought was a great price for the taste  overall i thought for the food and service the price we paid was fair

i would definitely come back with 4 people to try the full tasting menu

areas for improvement would be check the chairsstools to make sure theyre level as mine was wobbly not a huge thing but its a small fix that i think would improve the experience

also i would recommend ubering as the area is unfortunately very sketchy if you are going to walk id recommend parking in the neighborhood with houses more south and then walking

Address: 415 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G7 Canada
Review:
fabulous food tastes better than the published good ambience and wait staff were professional courteous and welcoming

dessert could be a little bit better the flan was a bit too sweet and dense great overall experience and would rate the restaurant as a solid 910 or 45 out of 5

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: absolutely legendary fries were still crisp under the copious amount of gravy lots of squeaky cheese curds great smoked meat sandwich too service was a little whatever when we went though maybe funner at night

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review:
i recently visited la belle patate and tried their bbq poutine it was absolutely delicious the combination of crispy fries savory gravy and flavorful bbq sauce was just perfect i loved every bite of it

apart from the food the interior decor of the restaurant was also very unique and eyecatching it gave off a cozy and welcoming vibe making me feel right at home i especially loved the wall art and the cozy seating arrangements

overall i would highly recommend la belle patate to anyone who loves great food and a cozy ambiance its definitely a mustvisit spot in town im already planning to come back and try some of their other menu items and i cant wait to see what other surprises they have in store

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: first evening out in vancouver and i headed straight here so glad i did the laidback atmosphere as if you were at home a small place packed with a friendly and relaxed attitude but most of all poutine i got a mediumsized traditional poutine and it was just so incredibly good not greasy not too salty just perfect paired with a light beer couldnt ask for more

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: i love this place so much i have come here both times ive been on vacation to vancouver and i am always so happy with what i order i order the traditional and it is always enough food it comes out quick and the atmosphere is so great

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: great food in a convenient location i was looking forward to the poutine from this spot and it did not disappoint i got the breakfast poutine which was delicious others in my group were very pleased as well the gravy is the star of the meal so i recommend getting a poutine with gravy

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: a must for visitors like us from colorado and locals alike if you want delicious authentic poutine look no further plus the service was immaculate and the owner is so so friendly  definitely try the spruce beer nonalcoholic think ginger beer or root beer and you wont be disappointed the poutine is the best and the steamie is a perfect little hot dog with all the toppings dont miss this awesome place

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: thee best hamburgers and poutine d√©licieuse in the city dont even mess with rest fresh local ingredients friendly passionate staffgood positive vibes

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: i highly encourage supporting this local business the poutine options are great i personally enjoy the loaded steamie along with fries  gravy make sure you get their inhouse made spruce beer a french canadian pop so yummy the owner has always been so welcoming to us

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review:
id been meaning to try this place for longer than i can remember and upon finally stopping in i wish id done so much sooner

having seen la bella patate recommended countless times it lived up to the hype completely the staff were quite friendly creating a relaxed atmosphere and the food was great i ordered a small classic poutine and a spruce beer if youre on the fence try the beer and look forward to returning in order to try a hotdog next

overall this is a very fairly priced and tasty gem in esquimalt solid 1010

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: the poutine was delicious one side note they do have a pay phone in case you need to call someone in 80s

Address: 3096 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: dinner on a saturday night was surprised that the restaurant was quite empty is it that maybe cozy comfort food is not as popular during the hot summer  we had mixed reviews of the food two of us were not excited about our meals beef bourguignon and the smoked salmon salad whereas the other two loved their dishes chicken parmesan sandwich  afterschool special  our server was great though  thank you

Address: 3096 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: hit it  this is such a vancouver staple they have many locations and have been so consistent for years i like the one on main street because it has a patio and a good vibe it definitely can get busy and they do take reservations so call ahead if you dont want to wait they should probably advertise this more but they are nut free kitchen

Address: 3096 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review:
for a fathers day it wasnt packed until we left we totally forgot it was fathers day oops
we showed up at noon and there was a nice cozy both for us all to sit  including a walker
we ordered the gooey grilled cheese the jambalaya and the jerk chicken wings
all visually pleasing and all very delicious in taste
my first time here we will be back

Address: 3096 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: the restaurant provides home style food that really delivers the macaroni and cheese is really worth it along with the deserts and dont forget them because they leave me satisfied each time i visit

Address: 3096 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G5 Canada
Review: comfort food place with lots of good options last time the had muled wine and it was perfect everything we tried was good so i think you can go wrong staff is friendly and atmosphere is cozy also outside area has heaters for cold weather

Address: 1109 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review:
the ambiance of this place is perfect along with the impeccable garnish and taste of the food

every aspect is thoughtfully designed to ensure an amazing night for your special occasion from the staffs behavior to the presentation and flavors of the dishes everything is topnotch

you wont feel rushed to leave the place allowing you to truly enjoy your dining experience

the dessert was absolutely amazing and delicious while the steak was prepared exactly as we requested

i highly recommend trying this restaurant for a memorable and delightful experience

Address: 1109 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review:
fantastic experience very knowledgeable staff incredible quality and a good variety of cuts and origins for their meats while still having a fully fleshed out menu outside of the steaks

alicia served our table and was so attentive and caring she asked if there was any occasion and after learning it was our anniversary brought us complimentary bubbly and dessert to celebrate brought a beautiful selection of curated wines to the table to find the best one for us

we ended up staying for longer than we usually would as each dish was rich but perfectly balanced and we savoured every bite

will be back to explore the menu

Address: 1109 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review: the best steakhouse in town high quality of meat i can tell the excellent service and the server is knowledgeable and very friendly busy restaurant all night but the food arrived very quickly overall amazing and will definitely go again reservations recommended

Address: 1109 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review: elisa boasts a modern atmosphere that exudes contemporary charm one of its standout features is the extensive range of wine selections available to satisfy even the most discerning palate when it comes to the menu the tomahawk steak steals the spotlight with its succulent flavors and impressive presentation leaving a lasting impression on diners however while the overall culinary experience at elisa is commendable it must be noted that the preparation and execution of other dishes tend to follow more conventional approaches lacking the same level of innovation and excitement nevertheless the inviting ambiance and the exceptional tomahawk steak make it a worthwhile dining destination

Address: 1109 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review: really first class establishment amazing steaks  a really good and extensive wine list and wonderful service to back it all up ryan truly was an amazing host thank you sir a gentleman you are and full of great knowledge to back up his recommendations highly recommend a proper extensive bar too anything you could think of

Address: 269 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G3 Canada
Review: this is the last restaurant i had the privilege of eating at before leaving vancouver to my taste and liking it was easily the best the atmosphere is wonderful a small warm classy dining area filled with jubilant conversations and savory smells sparkling water is served complimentary which is a nice touch the service is intimate and friendly now let me get to the food everything they served was absolutely magnificent it started by taking me for a ride and each progression of the meal just continued to up the ante it left me wanting more and only disappointed that it all had to come to an end

Address: 269 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G3 Canada
Review:
its definitely not our favorite french restaurant we are a bit shocked it was a michelin star restaurant

what we do like is the service decent service

note when you book online you are forced to pay 20 tip

parking paid side street parking

 the only dish we really recommend was their honey sorbet dessert off menu great taste with different texture toppings that went perfectly together

unfortunately everything else was too sweet or wasnt the best we ever had or lacked flavor

Address: 269 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G3 Canada
Review: everything was soooo good honestly i am not a big fan of french food in general but i was pleasantly surprised at how good the food and service was here im normally very picky with the way my dishes are cooked but my first visit was very impressive that i went back and celebrated my birthday here i will definitely be back again as their menu locates very frequently

Address: 269 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G3 Canada
Review:
one of the most memorable dining experiences we have had in a long time the seven course meal was carefully crafted with meticulous attention to every item on our plate service was non pretentious but professional the restaurant is warm and inviting with hints of nostalgia adorned on its walls
if you are lucky enough to get a reservation consider yourself one of the winners of a golden ticket

Address: 269 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1G3 Canada
Review: st lawrence has been on my bucket list for a few years now and i was happy to see them win a michelin star my husband booked this place for my birthday and it ended up being pretty mediocre food and then when you factor in the price we paid 31250 including a mandatory 20 gratuity that you pay when you reserve for two people it was really not great and i would not recommend coming here the highlights for me were the cod and side stripe shrimp appetizer the pork rinds and then foie gras amuse bouche everything else was just okay or not good the halibut main was dry and on the bland side the desserts panna cotta and the raspberry pistachio mille feuille were either way too sweet or too bland between st lawrence and published on main i prefer the food at published the service was pretty good they were attentive at removing plates and refilling waters it was also really nice to sit in front of the chefs at the chefs counter watching them cook the food i personally wouldnt go back here though oh and the portion sizes are not great either my husband left hungry and had to go home and eat other things

Address: 2546 E Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V5K 1Z3 Canada
Review: passed by many times and decided to try with indian friends laksa very spicy butter chicken had lots of chicken roti canai must have been good as never got a piece would have tried deep fried banana but no time

Address: 2546 E Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V5K 1Z3 Canada
Review: havent been here since they changed ownership nothing changed in terms of decor the laksa was delicious it had a nice creamy coconut curry broth very flavourful the hainan chicken and satay chicken were pretty solid as well really wish they could fix their kitchen ventilation though my hair and clothes smelled like the kitchen after the meal

Address: 2546 E Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V5K 1Z3 Canada
Review: had the laksa hainan chicken and roti laksa was not too thick and nicely balanced more on the spicier side but very flavourful hainan chicken was nicely marinated and nice flavour sauce enhances the flavour of the chicken and rice roti was a really good appetizer fluffy and crispy and the sauce added a nice little curry flavour not too strong

Address: 2546 E Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V5K 1Z3 Canada
Review: great food thicker soup base on the laksa is a preference but it wasnt runny   the pad thai was the bomb as was the roti    atmosphere was the old frenchies 60era drive through decor   so abysmal    but lets be honest you came for the food

Address: 2546 E Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V5K 1Z3 Canada
Review:
terima kasih best laksa i ever had period
dope home cooking style malaysian food in a takeout style openplan kitchen setting this place is super busy and always bustling with locals and is a tribute to how authentic the food is a great menu with plenty of vegetarian and vegan options or alternatives without sacrificing any of the yum
we both opted for the traditional singapore laksa Êñ∞Âä†Âù°ÁâπËâ≤Âèª which was super yummy plentifully packed with a large portion and variety of proteins the broth itself is a perfect balance of coconut and aromatic spices i actually got mine with the spiciest or hottest modification which was really good and nicely took some of the creamy edge off however it really wasnt that spicy at all to be honest i tried my partners which was the default mild and without the extra chilli paste would have been way too creamy for me
the fish cakes bebola ikan were phenomenal and worked as a great compliment to the meal extremely fresh home made and no fuss grub with solid ingredients and flavors
there isnt a lot of malaysian food around greater vancouver this place is a gem worth heading too everything was cooked with awesome precision presented well and cooked with exciting ingredients and flavors
support local businesses

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: must try worth the wait must try great simple ramen the line ups can take over an hour at time but its worth it customer service is great food is amazing and the atmosphere is welcoming and clean even with such a long line up the staff are always so friendly and clean up after every guest so carefully to ensure the best experience for the next guest love this place

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
