Review: you want ramen in vancouver there are many options this is nononsense delicious ramen yes ramen like art is subjective but i cant imagine a scenario where a bowl of this could be sent back danbo is more consistent than the rain in this fair city for its ability to deliver an all around great bowl of ramen if you dont want to quibble about semantics and just have a delicious bowl accept no substitute i eat at a variety of ramen joints this one just hits every time no question

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: had to wait a while in queue to eat there but it was well worth the wait handsdown the best vegan ramen ive ever had the customization options are great the broth is delicious and the service is fast  friendly would easily recommend this place as well as the seattle location

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: truly worth the wait incredible note the ramen doesnt come with toppings so you have to add on everything including egg

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: absolutely wonderful ramen this was my first time having ramen and it all tasted delicious the environment and atmosphere were great and even with a line outside for seating it did not take long to get in highly recommended

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review:
this is one of my favourite place for vegan ramen as i prefer to have vegetarianvegan ramen its very difficult to find a place that offers multiple options and danbo is one of them try them out and i am sure it wont be disappointment for you i was impressed with its flavourful broth and service dining space is quite small but wellmanaged make sure to book a seat via yelp before reaching there
a mustvisit for delicious plantbased options and attentive service

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: absolutely some of the best ramen ive had in all of van and easily top 5 ive had outside of japan itself the rekka is a great spicy option albeit they could still turn up the heat more from extra spicy the wait can be quite long so dont expect to just arrive  sit down but the broth is full  very tasty the noodles are delicious  i like that they let you pick firmness the pork chashu is well cut  takes on flavour well cant recommend this place enough

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: this is one of my favorites spots in vancouver the ramen is always on point and i have great memories coming here however when we visited on july 11th our team of 5 had to wait for 2 hours to get inside what made it worse was that smaller teams who had hardly waited got to go before us i would have preferred if they had at least asked us first if it would be alright for us to sit separately a team of four that came after us got to go in before us just because they had one less person im not sure who is managing the queue but the waitlist seemed useless i would suggest implementing a time limit for bigger groups as two big groups before us took their sweet time while they saw a huge line what was more infuriating was that when we finally came in they put together two smaller tables for us and added a stool on the side i couldnt help but wonder if they could have done that sooner instead of letting in couples whod come after us finish their meal and then put the two tables together for us im not sure if i want to come here again as long the customers in line are not treated seriously

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: ramen danbo gets my vote for some of the best ramen in vancouver because there is limited seating inside there is often a long waitlist to get seated depending on your group size came during the week and for a larger group there was about a hour long wait to get seated once seated the food came out very quickly and the both the ramen and broth was delicious love how you can order extra noodles too in case you have extra broth leftover prices are very reasonable as well will definitely have to come by here again

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: theres always a wait so i was intrigued and decided to finally put my name down  try it small space inside but it wasnt stuffy at all service is okay they were really slammed with online orders all the way up to closing time the ramen was good but i think you could have the same experience somewhere else with less wait

Address: 433 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1B2 Canada
Review: after attending a concert at roger arena we decided to stop by this place for a late dinner we were pleased to find that it opened quite late and was conveniently located just a block away from our hotel marriott to our surprise the food here turned out to be exceptionally good the service provided went above and beyond our expectations and the prices seemed reasonable if youre looking for a great atmosphere delicious food and friendly service this place is the spot to be i highly recommend trying their chicken dish if youre a fan of spicy flavors it truly had a wow factor

Address: 433 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1B2 Canada
Review: went here late on a random wednesday night and it was so good im adding it to my vancouver must eat list the dandan noodles and korean fried chicken are a must try the noodles were so flavourful and filling we got the chicken 2 ways sweet spicy and hanoi glazed the chef came out and explained which pickled veggies to eat with each flavour and wow it was so flavourful and tender the pickled veggies complimented it beautifully would highly recommend these two flavours overall good vibes great atmosphere cool decor some options to play games by a lounge area in the front too

Address: 433 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1B2 Canada
Review:
what an amazing experience we had
the server and the owner were a blast to be surrounded by the food was outstanding  the menu is curated and christian really puts his heart and soul into the food he serves
recommended this place to all my friends and we will definitely be going again soon
spicy szechuan korean fried chicken is a must try great quantity of food

Address: 433 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1B2 Canada
Review:
we had lunch at holy chow and it was great the restaurant is very cozy
the waiter was very nice and attentive he even informed us that it would take a little longer for our food to come that day because there was not enough staff in the kitchen
we ordered dandan noodles vegetarian and with chicken we enjoyed both very much
we would recommend coming here

Address: 433 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1B2 Canada
Review:
short layover 4h at yvr enough time to skytrain to waterfront to chow down some holy chow

the order was ready in 10 mins on a tuesday night at 1030 amazing service booomb food the spicy sechuan kfc blew our faces off but we asked for it
pork spring rolls were probably the best we ever had and slaw was great too

thank you to the staff that greeted us great people

we will be back

Address: 718 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1B6 Canada
Review: love the place for fresh cut fries i found the food was a bit salty and seems like portion got little smaller but still good flavour they use cheese curd that is very fresh i would get regular fries next time not the poutine

Address: 718 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1B6 Canada
Review:
first time getting poutine in canada

poutine with smoked meat  double fried fries which means super crispy fries my favorite part is them making sure that there are toppings throughout the bowl most fry places put everything on the top and then you just have plain soggy fries near the bottom

Address: 718 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1B6 Canada
Review:
first time trying poutine and this place set my standards pretty high we got the poutine with bacon if i remember correctly absolutely delicious i would definitely come back

fast friendly service and pretty affordable for a lot of value i actually prefer this little hole in the wall a bit more over another more popular option we tried in the area this place also layered the poutine so you dont have to mix it which wouldve been hard since our cup was piled high the small poutine was plenty for 2 people as an appetizer or snack

one minor downside the tables here arent the best for eating at theyre low and maybe only 12ft3060cm in diameter so i found it more comfortable to take things togo i otherwise appreciated the fun decorations on their wall

Address: 718 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1B6 Canada
Review: fritz probably has the best poutine in vancouver the fries are crispy and there are plenty of cheese curds and gravy the shop is very small though and seating is limited but you can just walk a bit and eat it on the benches along false creek for a better view

Address: 718 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1B6 Canada
Review: my goto spot now while im from washington ill find ways of convincing myself to travel over the border to get some poutine from fritz european fry house ive only had the regular but i am excited to spice things up on my next visit with a few new additions anytime we have friends or family visit this is where we take them and they always love it

Address: 1505 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1E8 Canada
Review: spectacular fish and chips and other delicacies fish tacos and burgers at this modest shack near granville island the cod is fresh and super tasty perfectly cooked the chips french fries are excellent the tuna taco is worth a trip with cad 10 per person you eat like a king best food in a long time the service is super friendly the accommodation is a bit rustic but hey you can take the goodies out and eat it in your own castle

Address: 1505 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1E8 Canada
Review: the captain of our zodiac boat trip recommended go fish for lunch and told us that it was one of the best places to get fish and chips he was right its basically a shack that you walk up to and put in your order nothing fancy simple and really good we found a table by the side of the restaurant so we could  look over the bay

Address: 1505 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1E8 Canada
Review:
the perfect way to end your day visiting granville island this fish and chips shack is worth the walk over from the main market area the staff here is super friendly and the food is cooked to order

we got the cod fish and chips basket and it tasted so fresh and high quality the portions here are huge so honestly one plate is big enough to share between two people the dish also comes with an amazing sesame tasting slaw on the side

dont skip this place

Address: 1505 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1E8 Canada
Review:
i recently dined at go fish restaurant on granville island and i must say the fish and chips was amazing cooked to perfection and bursting with flavor the coleslaw they serve as a side dish was also exceptional with a unique taste that really complemented the fish

however i was disappointed with the lack of friendliness from the staff while the food was great the service left something to be desired also the seating area was outside only which may not be ideal for some customers

overall if youre looking for delicious fish and unique coleslaw go fish restaurant is definitely worth a visit

Address: 1505 W 1st Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1E8 Canada
Review:
this is the legit place for fish and chips fresh linecaught fish and amazing flavour at a fair price in a great location
my partner got their grilled salmon sandwich and it was epic just the right seasoning and sauce my fried halibut was a good portion and perfectly battered the fries were incredible but i into the ageold problem of my girlfriend stealing half of them
last but not least the staff were all amazing the cashier and cooks were the nicest people their quality of work proves they care and i loved their taste in music

Address: 1616 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1A6 Canada
Review: rare 5 star review cheese board with fruit was excellent expensive but great atmosphere upbeat bar area and relaxing vintage seating good lighting at night staff professional yet casual really good at checking in without being overbearing bit out of the way of most vancouver sites but worth it higher level creative bar menu

Address: 1616 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1A6 Canada
Review: i came here alone on a monday around 5pm to grab a quick drink i was seated at the bar and the bartender im sorry i forgot his name gave a nice welcome he asked me what kind of cocktails i liked and i told him mezcals and sprit forward drinks he then asked if i was okay trying a cocktail he created the drink ended up being incredibly delicious and the rest is history overall i had a fantastic experience and look forward to being back again

Address: 1616 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1A6 Canada
Review: i am very impressed with this place its such a hidden gem with amazing cocktails i highly recommend stopping by best part the bartender has so many offmenu cocktails they can make for you i highly recommend the offmenu espresso martini its one of my favorite  cocktails and this place just nailed it supper impressed looking forward to coming back

Address: 1616 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1A6 Canada
Review: a hidden gem if there ever was one everything clicks here the aesthetic the food the cocktail program are all top marks the burrata salad and house made gnocchi are a must i love burgers the burger here is perfectly fine but not a top recommendation in the city the cocktail program has many classics and tiki drinks i tried my first vieux carr√© here and i now make it home

Address: 1616 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1A6 Canada
Review: the food was excellent the portions were big enough for the price and high quality of the food i had chicken from the oven with seasonal vegetables which were delicious the server was friendly and courteos definitely coming back

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: price point definitely higher than average burrito lacks core flavours critical to mexican and latin american cuisine meat chunks are a bit dryhard with the lack of salsa and sour cream pico de gallo is barely there no option for hot sauce the overall flavour is flatplain with an overwhelming amount of rice and lack of the rest

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: la taqueria is one of my favorite mexican restaurants in vancouver the tacos and burritos are very tasty but a bit expensive the workers are nice and the location is perfect

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review:
had baja fish asada beef carnitas pork burritos delicious very filling friendly service helpful even for us novices
great food and prices are reasonable
exactly as it says on the tin roof
around 15 ea

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: stepping off the train into the city centre leaves you within throwing distance of some of the best tacos and burritos in the city we grabbed a few tacos and a burrito before heading down to the water and had a nearly spiritual experience devouring them highly recommend the baja taco it will create a new level of expectation for any taco you have in the future also their tortillas are a

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: this is truly a hole in the wall taco stand we tried their special of the day fish chicken and beef tacos our favourite were the fish and the special of the day they were absolutely amazing we ordered all of them at the same time but i would recommend getting tacos as you eat as they taste best fresh its a must try if you are in vancouver

Address: 3307 Dunbar St Vancouver, BC V6S 2B9 Canada
Review:
it had been a few years since my wife and i ate at la notte so we decided to come back for a meal and as always we were not disappointed i always like the spaghetti pescatore but decided on the regular spaghetti bolognese and the taste was amazing my wife had another pasta dish which was also very tasty we invited some friends and they went for the pizza margherita
to wash it down my wife had red wine and i had an iced tea the servers were very nice and prompt with the service even though the restaurant was really busy
we had a good time and definitely will come back to try many other dishes on the menu i highly recommend la notte for a good meal the portions are big enough and you can have leftovers for home
try la notte you wont be disappointed

Address: 3307 Dunbar St Vancouver, BC V6S 2B9 Canada
Review: we took our niece here for a dinner to celebrate her graduation from university it is a very classic local restaurant i found it very loud and although the piano player was a nice touch it just made it louder i had the eggplant parmesean which was delicious service was basic but friendly

Address: 3307 Dunbar St Vancouver, BC V6S 2B9 Canada
Review:
amazing service the guys who served was amazing 
i had a long day at work i wanted a nice italian pizza i went half meat  half 4 cheese the cheese was cheap  the flavours were like any cheap costco cheese  or bulky cheese greasy and without flavour
the pizza sauce same  not bueno  it was a 20 pizza and 10 glass of wine but i was expecting a delicious pizza flavoured tomatoes sauce the place had live piano and i thought this might be very traditional
great for a romantic night  you might wanna try the pastas instead

bill32 and just me  i dont think i will be back

recommend using better cheese quality better sauce  more salt definitely i will
change the wine glass  not the ikea kinda  ones cheap look
the love piano is greaaaaat
keep that
keep the great service
i will google some italian pizza recipes and will improve my pizza

Address: 3307 Dunbar St Vancouver, BC V6S 2B9 Canada
Review:
overall the food was good definitely worth it considering the price the service was goodthey gave us so much cheese for the pasta you really cant complain

the vibe of the place is cozy feels like a family ownrun business servers are super chill and friendly warning they will joke around with youso if you got 0 humour good luck

they also have specials that arent on the menu so its a surprise each time you go

what are the cons in my opinion its not a place where i see myself coming often mainly because im someone who wants to try something new and exciting something that is unique other reason is because i live 1h drive away

do i recommend yes it really helps fills the pasta cravings

tip the food is better eaten fresh at the restaurant and not as takeout

Address: 3307 Dunbar St Vancouver, BC V6S 2B9 Canada
Review: stopped in early on a friday  lovely piano player going and i tried the veal ossobucco  omg it was delicious  definitely try it out  next time i will get the linguine clams that sounds amazing too  very attentive and friendly staff  def be back

Address: 1716 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5N 2S4 Canada
Review:
this small restaurant offers authentic and tasty singaporean dishes at an affordable price

it is still a relatively young newly opened place as i believe they opened only 23 years ago

the restaurant is served sort of like a canteen  order pay first and then they will bring the food up to your table

a hidden gem in my opinion come give them a try you will not regret it

Address: 1716 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5N 2S4 Canada
Review: love love love familyrun super authentic singaporean food the flavours are just perfect nothing is too spicy the curry puffs are flaky and i like the addition of the boiled egg the laksa has everything you would wanttofu puffs shrimp fish cakes etc food is more affordable than most places in vancouver and came out fast

Address: 1716 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5N 2S4 Canada
Review:
best chicken satay and chicken curry

meh the other things i ordered

i like the name of the restauranteven though most westerners cant pronounce it ifkyk

Address: 1716 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5N 2S4 Canada
Review:
heads up  you need to order pay  tip before they will seat you
no issues paying up front but they ask you for tip when you pay this is before you even sit down eat or have a chance to experience their overall service

in terms of food the taste is good we ordered the laksa nasi lamak and satay

service was fine as well someone came periodically to refill our water

overall i would probably return again if a friend wanted to visit

Address: 1716 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5N 2S4 Canada
Review: this singaporean restaurant is surprisingly authentic the owners susan and pj personally served us and was extremely friendly and service oriented we had otak malay fish cake and chwee kueh steam rice cake with preserved radish topping for appetizers for main dish we had mee siam  spicysweet sour vermicelli and nasi lemak coconut rice for dessert we had pulot hitam black glutinous rice with coconut cream it was all delicious and we wanted to try every menu item but couldnt we succumbed to order curry puff kaya coconutpandan jam and more nasi lemak to go a must try if you are curious about singaporean cuisine

Address: 3014 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6H 1H6 Canada
Review: breakfast table is definitely my most frequented brunch place the service is always great the staff is super friendly and attentive i always get the vanilla iced latte and its my favourite coffee in the city the food is super delicious and flavourful and i would recommend the garlic miso salmon eggs benedict cant wait for my next brunch here

Address: 3014 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6H 1H6 Canada
Review:
this is hands down one of the best customer service experience ive had in vancouver the waitress always noticed if my friends had half a coffee cup left also genuine smile and conversation

the food portions look small but dont be fooled they are super filling and youll be rolling out the door i had the breakfast ratatouille and thai honey milk tea super delicious i had that at 1130 its now 8pm and still full thank you

Address: 3014 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6H 1H6 Canada
Review: first time visiting this establishment service was good and so was the food long wait times for a table and their online wait system is totally broken would return if there wasnt much of wait time

Address: 3014 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6H 1H6 Canada
Review: food was fantastic absolutely no negatives as was the service team was pleasant and courteous the cute patio added just the right amount of atmosphere the only reason i gave it a 4 star instead of 5 if i were to really give constructive feedback is that if youre going to have digital menus then you must offer wifi to customers im a visitor to the city and didnt have wifi to see the menu so had to check the menu from my guests phone other than that it was a lovely experience

Address: 3014 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6H 1H6 Canada
Review:
amazing service and delicious food loved the eggs benedict and the inventive drinks
the service was excellent

Address: 4127 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review:
i always love coming here the food is delicious prices are great and the serving sizes are huge i ordered the laksa which was very filling and is probably about two meals worth of food

the restaurant is small and is always busy so you might be hard pressed to find somewhere to sit

Address: 4127 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review:
love this place the staff are nice i like how they dont provide table service cause i just wanna watch youtube and eat in peace sometimes

id do the dry noodles over the laksa tbh the fried kuey teow and mee goreng was sooooo good

the fried fritters are good too but their portions are big so id eat those first then eat the mains cause theyre easier to pack home that being said i did take one of the fritters home to bake cause it was lowkey kinda sogged up from the vinegar sauce which is so delicious

Address: 4127 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review: a must visit when you have a craving for delicious malaysian food no need for further convincing go try it

Address: 4127 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review:
sorry this is a pass for me

mee sota was just a chicken soup  noodles nothing special

laksa was lacking flavor the broth is thin like a ramen broth instead of the thick rich coconut curry broth that laksa should have

i feel like i could have made both dishes at home better

the restaurant is very small good for quick meals or ordering takeout they only accept cashdebit card or you can pay extra and order pickup through uber eatsdoordash 14 cad price is more than id expect considering the atmosphere and quality of food

Address: 4127 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review: if youre looking to try singaporean and malaysian cuisine for the first time this restaurant is a good place to start the restaurant is small and the decor is a bit outdated but the food is authentic and delicious i ordered the laksa which was flavorful but a bit too spicy for my taste while i was eating i didnt realize that there was a small heater right next to me which made me sweat through my meal i also ordered some hainan chicken to go and it was very tasty the prices here are the cheapest youll find in vancouver and the portion sizes are fair overall i would recommend this restaurant for takeout but not for dining in

Address: 1833 Anderson Street Suite 202 Vancouver, BC V6H 4E5 Canada
Review: if there was a way i would have given them 10 stars the food is absolutely perfect the lamb shoulder was my favourite one of the best ones i had in vancouver the staff are so kind and friendly its like you have been invited to their home not their restaurant one of the best places to have a birthday party definitely coming back

Address: 1833 Anderson Street Suite 202 Vancouver, BC V6H 4E5 Canada
Review:
i love the atmosphere with draped clothes and the private booths or two traditional floor seating dining rooms dinner for two was enough for three with leftovers
i was sad to skip dessert as menu looked amazing but i had too much food

Address: 1833 Anderson Street Suite 202 Vancouver, BC V6H 4E5 Canada
Review:
delicious food with friendly staff they were really accommodating and explained the menu items for us it was my first time trying lamb shoulder and it was fabulous the rice was full of different spices such as cinnamon turmeric and cumin with a little sweetness from the carrots and raisins about the other dish i need to say i usually dont find vegetarian dishes at restaurants super tasty and it wasnt an exception i didnt like it much it was good but not for me 
next time ill get the lamb shank

Address: 1833 Anderson Street Suite 202 Vancouver, BC V6H 4E5 Canada
Review:
we sat at the cushion room for the experience and it was fun not so much if your legs arent flexible

the platter for two was sooo filling definitely can feed at least 3 people

the portions were really generous the appetizer of dips salad and bread was already quite filling

the lamb in the platter was so tender and definitely was the highlight for me

i really appreciate how much variety was included in the platter definitely recommend

Address: 1833 Anderson Street Suite 202 Vancouver, BC V6H 4E5 Canada
Review:
this place far exceeded my expectations

i went in expecting good food and the first thing you notice is the place has a slick vibe  when our meals came just wow  it was all soooooo good  we repeatedly complimented our meals to the staff and the staff were very pleasant to chat with as they served our meals and checked in on us

this place is worth the short walk from granville island if you are hungry and want a great meal

Address: 780 Bidwell Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2J6 Canada
Review: oh my what a gem i was super lucky to show up on a quiet weekday evening i was seated immediately and greeted by a really friendly guy we picked a drink and made the order that was brought to the table almost immediately i am not a chicken person but this is a whole different level the broth is so flavorful yet so delicate and light the pork was perfection as well as the egg the noodles had the perfect consistency and texture all in all a great dish paired with a great storebranded pale ale on draft really really recommended

Address: 780 Bidwell Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2J6 Canada
Review: the vegetarian ramen was incredible its the exact type of comfort food youd want to eat on a rainy day i usually cannot finish a full bowl of ramen by myself but maybe it was the thin noodles or the light broth i happily finished my entire bowl without feeling stuffed although there was a lineup even during midday on a monday the service was fast  servers were friendly

Address: 780 Bidwell Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2J6 Canada
Review: my ramen knowledge is still developing but i can attest that the broth was silky smooth with rich flavor the chilli pepper paste was fresh and aromatic and the noodles did not absorb much of the flavor as another reviewer indicates the pork was also fresh even though very thinly cut bur surely very tasty the egg was the best i ever had in taste texture and color more like an ember color in the yolk i would visit again

Address: 780 Bidwell Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2J6 Canada
Review:
this place is tied for my favorite ramen in all of vancouver their ingredients are always simple and fresh with consistently good results and no msg even more impressive service is always efficient since theyre used to long lineups their ramen egg is a musttryso delicious and a cut above the usual ramen egg

i recommend the chashutamago ramenclassic tamago ramen and definitely add an egg to your order if there isnt one

Address: 780 Bidwell Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2J6 Canada
Review: maruhachi ramen offers a unique twist on traditional japanese ramen with their chickenbased soup while most ramen places use porkbased broth maruhachis broth is made with chicken resulting in a rich and flavorful white creamy broth that will leave you amazed they also offer the option to add extra noodles for just 2 making it a great value along with their delicious ramen their selection of beer is also worth trying dont miss out on this incredible chickenbased ramen experience

Address: 1043 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B Canada
Review: this restaurant is awesome we ended up going during happy hour for a quick pre dinner snack and drink we were not expecting much but we were blown away by the food and customer service we ordered the dip platter and it was so so good it came with a lot of pita for dipping the spanakopita was delicious and freshly made definitely will be returning to try out their dessert

Address: 1043 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B Canada
Review:
first time customer alert  
my boyfriend took me here for valentine day and i loved it
i love greek food so im going to be picky

pro
 atmosphere is very nice and the music and vibe definitely set the tone
 during valentine they had red roses in front which was very nice 
 the music was bumpin and definitely was a chill vibe 
  the light bulbs is a nice touch to the restaurant 
 the structure of the restaurant was built well i was able to hear my partner perfectly fine even with the music louder than usual
 the table placement was what i enjoyed it was separated well that it didnt seem to be close to anybody 

foodservice
 had the lamb platter and side of calamari
 the lamb platter looked small but after awhile it does fill you up
 for 2 people and a side is sufficient to make you quite stuffed
 the lamb fell off the bone and was well seasoned around
 waitress was super friendly and nice she personality made it easier to pick dishes and small champagne wine to celebrate the occasion 

improvements
 the overall dishes from calamari to lamb plattter had too much lemon and same with the tzakiki a bit less would of been better

Address: 1043 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B Canada
Review: ordered through uber eats ordered a salad from this restaurant paid 20 cad and received a very small salad you can hold it in your palm not worth the money paid the box is 23 full shame as we dined at this restaurant and our salad was a lot bigger

Address: 1043 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B Canada
Review:
i had such high expectations for this place i love greek food and go out for greek often but this place left me very disappointed and unimpressed

my friend and i had a lunch reservation upon entering the restaurant we waited over 5 minutes before someone even acknowledged our presence mind you they werent even busy

we sat down and ordered the calamari to start then the country lamb for me and the pork and chicken thigh souvlaki for my friend

the calamari was really plain i wouldnt recommend my friend said her souvlaki was wellseasoned and enjoyable my lamb was cooked well but they didnt have any mint sauce or mint jelly to go with my lamb which i was surprised and heavily disappointed by

overall the food was mediocre

the food was a 35 but the experience was a 25
would maybe be willing to give this place another try for dinner or at its gastown location

Address: 1043 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B Canada
Review:
a sunny unfortunately windy soonafter typical vancouver day out on the patio had a great time catching up with a friend while enjoying awesome greek food and awesome service

if you want to skip the menu and know what to order like a pro saganaki lamb chops calamari
you are welcome

Address: 207 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1K6 Canada
Review: got the mixed grill and cold platters and both were excellent best lebanese cuisine ive had in vancouver so far the hummus was great and the grilled meats were excellent it would have been a bit better if they had more than just cauliflower as the only vegetable in the mixed grill platter although it was a meat focused dish

Address: 207 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1K6 Canada
Review:
i was able to book easily online parking was a bit of a pain
the atmosphere was very cozy
service was not bad
we went at 4pm so we were bummed to know we can only order from their lunch and drink menu dinner is at 5pm

we ordered
baba ghanouj  eggplant dip with pita bread
 not bad tasted very fresh wished it was seasoned more

mezze grilled samplermin 2 person pay per person  sample of their meats shrimp sauces and dips
 recommend great grill flavor all the sauces were super flavorful the protein was great the grilled vegetables were my favorite this isnt enough food for two people definitely order more

total 18tip  90
parking  12 15hrs

Address: 207 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1K6 Canada
Review: i ordered the lunch pate with chicken shish tawok and it was delicious i loved the garlic sauce just wished the pita was made fresh or at least not so dry

Address: 207 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1K6 Canada
Review: everything we ate was amazing highly recommend the dip platter with the hummus baba ganoush etc it comes with plenty of soft pita bread the cauliflower dish was so yummy too and the cocktails were nice and balanced

Address: 207 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1K6 Canada
Review: we got the grille mezze sampler and added some flatbread on it was sooooo delicious we scraped up every last bit off of the plate it was the perfect amount of each item i cant even say what my favourite item was in the sampler because everything was equally tasty if you havent been here before i think the sampler was the way to go for sure

Address: 1014 Main Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2W1 Canada
Review:
delicious food and drinks we had the octopus and short ribs took a star off because our octopus was way smaller of a portion than in other photos portion didnt match the price
highly recommend both of those
paella was also delicious
great and quick service

Address: 1014 Main Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2W1 Canada
Review:
the food and their vibe were very good we enjoyed our time there however unfortunately my friend ordered a nonalcoholic drink since she cant drink alcohol but the drink was alcoholic after the first sip she thought it had some alcohol so we even checked with the waitress and they said it was unseen nonalcoholic but after a few minutes her face started getting very red and she started feeling very dizzy after telling the waitress about the symptoms she admitted that one ingredient in the nonalcoholic drink contains a little bit alcohol i really dont think any alcohol should be in the nonalcoholic drink
when a customer orders a nonalcoholic drink i truly hope they doublecheck that the drink is nonalcoholic drink since some people simply cannot take it at all

but again other than this particular incident everything was great

Address: 1014 Main Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2W1 Canada
Review:
this meal and the mixed paella i tried was sooo delicious
absolutely this is the one of my favorite restaurant in vancouver areathe severs have good knowledge of menu and nice atmosphere for chilling dining out
definitely come back to the restaurant for having romantic eating out

Address: 1014 Main Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2W1 Canada
Review:
it is quite a decent spanish restaurant
i have personally never been to spain so i cant comment about the authenticity but their foods are so delicious overall food menus are a little bit expensive considering the amount of food but i liked them
paellas are a little salty but if you have them with other foods like fried eggplants or beef tongue they go really well together you would not regret it
it was my second visit and my first time to experience downstairs it was somewhat more private but it seemed like i was in a tavern or something even though the bar was upstairs
all in all it is always fun to dine here as we could laugh at each other watching lips colored with squid ink paella

Address: 1014 Main Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2W1 Canada
Review: we ordered mixed paella garlic prawns fried mushrooms beef tongue and sangria that day all the dishes were delicious i especially liked the beef tongue it was tender and seasoned really well seafoods in the paella were large in size and number servers were pretty nice and the restaurant had great atmosphere overall it was a wonderful experience having lunch here

Address: 1049 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1L4 Canada
Review: first time trying this place we loved the food there the service was quick food was decently priced and quite authentic i had enchiladas for the first time here it was delicious the tortilla was crispy and the cheese held the tortillas together quite well however i must say that its a heavy meal i personally couldnt eat this regularly but for times when i crave mexican flavours i am totally down to come back again

Address: 1049 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1L4 Canada
Review: my first time here and i cant wait to come back im from california and miss authentic mexican food from back home this place is the real deal and brought me back to my old neighbourhood restaurants in the mission we had the chips and salsa the tacos with cheese and a chimichanga all were so so yummy and very filling price is right staff was lovely flavours on point definitely give it a try

Address: 1049 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1L4 Canada
Review: it was overall a great place for some delicious mexican food the place was clean and had a very kind staff i had the pollo tacos and nachos and it was delicious the place was nearby to me and i would definitely suggest to try this place for a nice afternoon lunch

Address: 1049 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1L4 Canada
Review:
a hidden gem in downtown vancouver
very authentic mexican food
the environment is relaxed and the servers are friendly
food comes very fast and in great temperature
i tried the beef tongue tacos for the first time it is hot tender and delicious
good place for family or date

Address: 1049 Granville Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1L4 Canada
Review: first time being here and the food was so good if youre visiting from another city like i am i would definitely recommend that your try stopping by here to eat  lots of vegetarian options as well

Address: 1161 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C6 Canada
Review: the quality of chinese food here is top notch which is high compliments in vancouver where there is a lot of competition but mott32 is definitely a level above the rest the wine and drinks program is extensive and well tailored as well  i try to at least do 2 meals here on every trip

Address: 1161 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C6 Canada
Review: lovely ambience and a good overall experience the smoked black cod and the frog legs were the standout dishes overall and definitely would recommend ordering them if you go the peking duck was okay overall i expected something a bit more special for the price point and experience but it was still good would consider going back in the future to try a different variety of dishes as the standouts above were wonderful

Address: 1161 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C6 Canada
Review: it was our last restaurant that we visited in vancouver you get asian food on a high level fine dining in a nice atmosphere the food is great and also the cocktails are great the service was very friendly

Address: 1161 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C6 Canada
Review: mott 32 was quite atmospheric with their old shanghai style interior design playing up their posh and boujee feel didnt have a chance to try their duck as you will need to reserve a duck the day before dining their dishes were of course definitely on the pricey side but nonetheless tasty and flavourful would recommend their short rib and their signature lobster fried rice the style is more fusion in my opinion not quite the traditional chinese taste

Address: 1161 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6E 0C6 Canada
Review:
a group of 6 of us had dinner here recently and we received very good service from the wait staff to the sous chef who carved up our peking duck dish

this restaurant is right beside the paradox hotel entrance formerly the trump hotel for this who do not know the west georgia address of the place

i will say this is one of the most expensive dim sum dishes restaurants in vancouver we were going to try some dishes but lets put it this way i know maine lobster is expensive but 32 for a so gle piece of maine lobster siu mai

we also had the smoked black cod crispy rice with dried prawns in soup beef and flat noodles stir fried broccoli with tofu and a free range chicken dish i would say the dinner was good with the signature smoked black cod being the best dish even ahead of the peking duck

was plenty of room at the table to sit and they had an okay selection of cocktails and wines

nice to try for a holiday dinner

Address: 820 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1J8 Canada
Review: the portions are generous and the flavors are simply divine the interior is tastefully decorated creating an inviting ambiance musttries include the garlicky beans flaky roti and succulent beef satay dont miss the beautifully presented fried rice served in a pineapple bowl the service is outstanding adding to the overall dining experience prepare to be transported to the flavors of malaysia in this delightful culinary haven

Address: 820 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1J8 Canada
Review: i enjoyed every dish we ordered particularly the pineapple fried rice and eggplant food is beautifully presented with a raise of callers and delicious sauces service is reasonably good and i didnt care too much for the atmosphere because it was so dark inside overall its a great restaurant to visit if youre up for malaysian food

Address: 820 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1J8 Canada
Review:
i must say the restaurant really impressed me since im completely new to this cuisine i found a lot of similar flavors with latinamerican cuisine

we had this 9dishes menu and it was really nice the fried calamari were nice but missed more frying the sweet rice pudding was my favorite part the service was also friendly and attentive

Address: 820 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1J8 Canada
Review: this is a must try for people who love good asian food the fresh young coconut is amazing almost as good as the ones you can get in asia the hainanese chicken and the bbq skewers are to die for try it and you taste buds will definitely thank you

Address: 820 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1J8 Canada
Review:
great place for any occasion with friendsfamily or even for a meal on your own we had the 12 course dinner tonight minimum 2 people and it was 59 per person there was an option for 9 course meal for 49 but we decided to go for the bigger portion because we skipped lunch

it included papaya mango salad with peanuts roti cani with a dip three satay chicken skewers three deep fried whole oysters with a dip a bowl of steamed mussels three scallops cooked to perfect shrimpmangotomatobell pepper stir fry three lobster tails deep fried fish green beans with shrimp beef rendang and lastly their delicious deep fried banana with vanilla ice cream

seafood was fresh and the portion between three people was perfect the rendang was slightly dry but still edible they still have the plexiglass in between each party which is great to see that they are still being cautious

great service and attentive servers thank you for this experience

Address: 755 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1V3 Canada
Review:
five stars for you burger crush well done

burger crush has a simple menu with veg options and both non and alcoholic beverages prices were higher than the golden arches or competitors but reasonable given the quality and service

i went with the single patty cheeseburger and fries delicious burgers delicious fries perfectly messy perfectly cooked burger and fries excellent

presentation was above what youd expect from a burger place washrooms were clean accessible and gender neutral dining area was frequently cleaned by staff as soon as people were finished and leaving

i have no complaints and no areas to offer improvements however i did visit at 200pm on a friday your experience may differ depending on timing

enjoy

Address: 755 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1V3 Canada
Review: june 2023 this is us truly a finger licking good mess in and around your mouth tried the vegan cheese burger and the beef cheeseburger i was surprised at just how amazing they both were the vegan one is easily the best vegan burger in town the cheesy fries were also really good wont be long till i come back again

Address: 755 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1V3 Canada
Review: i like to try new places for burgers smash burgers are my new fave keep hearing of this place so decided to check it out overall a pretty decent burger i did like the fries maybe i should have got a milk shake although the burger was decent it didnt reach a standard such as a in and out or shake shack just saying but i i did love the fries crispy and thinly sliced good with your burger

Address: 755 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1V3 Canada
Review: super pricey for something that is just covered in a cheap cheese sauce the first few bites of the burger and poutine are great and then the cheese sauce just gets to be too much for the price i paid its not worth it i would suggest going to juicy joes over burger crush

Address: 755 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1V3 Canada
Review: i crushed that juicy delicious burger  i loved the vegan orange milkshake my husband got a regular milkshake and i tried them both vegan was definitely better as it was a bit less thick and easier to drink my lactoseintolerant butt appreciates it i got my burger lettuce wrapped too and i enjoyed every bite great service and prompt arrived at about 530pm on a wednesday will definitely come back

Address: 120-4751 Garden City Road Richmond, BC V6X 3M7 Canada
Review:
if youre looking for the best sweet and sour dish i would highly recommend this restaurant their sweet and sour fish was cooked to perfection fish tastes fresh juicy and delicious the sauce was the perfect balance of sweet tangy and savoury vegetables were not over cooked

we ordered the combo for two and it was worth it the deep fried squid was delicious crispy on the outside but tender on the inside  this combo came with a  few side dishes pork intestine cucumber and pigs ears

we will have to come back next time to try other dishes like shaved ice braised beef and more

amazing customer service too very friendly and attentive staff

Address: 120-4751 Garden City Road Richmond, BC V6X 3M7 Canada
Review:
i think your experience here depends on what you order as some of their food is hit or miss i absolutely love their nuggets which are essentially taiwanese popcorn chicken and honestly some of the best ive had its super crunchy and sliced thing would definitely recommend the braised pork ear and the sweet and sour fried fish are also super delicious not too much breading perfect texture and amount of sauce
i do not recommend their soup it had that pork intestine flavour to it that i really did not love their thai chicken is great in terms of how its cooked but i did not like the flavour
place is clean and service was good menu was a tad confusing but overall i would come back again

Address: 120-4751 Garden City Road Richmond, BC V6X 3M7 Canada
Review:
comfortable seating and very friendly service
free parking outside but dont forget to register your license plate with restaurant after 6pm
very limited selections on the menu ran out of pearls 3 in the afternoon very disappointed my spicy noodle was not spicy at all the flavour was very good though overall we were happy with our lunch

Address: 120-4751 Garden City Road Richmond, BC V6X 3M7 Canada
Review:
the restaurant has various selections to choose from small hot pot to deep fried dishes we ordered deep fried popcorn chicken scallion beef taiwanese braised dish rice and milk tea the serving speed was incredibly fast and we got all our meals in just a few minutes we have noticed that they greet all the customers amiability when they step into the store it was a great experience with all the foods and services

overall
food quality     
environment     
service

Address: 120-4751 Garden City Road Richmond, BC V6X 3M7 Canada
Review: good ambience and very fast service food was good portions were average for individual dishes but the braised pork rice was wellsized the sweet and sour chicken was my favourite the fried chicken did not have enough flavour affordable and good for groups 22 a person after tips

Address: 615 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5T 3K5 Canada
Review: this popular italian theme restaurant located in east vancouver on kingsway parking is basically on the street lucky after 6pm you can park without issues food quality is good tasty and unpretentious not your normal  parlor but more earth tone dishes i like this type of cooking i recommend to try the garlic pull bread the thick noodles with tomato sauce chicken liver pate with sourdoughthe pork chop which is juicy and delicious highly recommended the server is knowledgeable and friendly reservation is required because they only open for dinner the table for six is kind of tight otherwise everything is great will return recommended

Address: 615 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5T 3K5 Canada
Review: a wonderful dining experience with delicious food great service and a buzzing atmosphere we did the family style menu which was picked by the chefs based on a few questions it was perfect and so much food plenty of value we celebrated a birthday and we had a complimentary glass of champagne ready for us when we arrived plus a cute birthday dessert highly recommend

Address: 615 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5T 3K5 Canada
Review:
i reserved a single seat at the bar reservation for 500 pm  i was quite fortunate to be given a seat on the patio because the restaurant wasnt that busy it was a serene and beautiful setting  along with passing out the standard menus the waitress read out the days specials

i selected the lemony tortellini from the normal menu along with the featured arugula salad  i also had a glass of water for starters  together the food was delicious and the serving sizes were perfect  additionally the waitress was cordial attentive and made sure my service experience was excellent

i had a wonderful exceptional eating experience which much improved my evening after a difficult birthday night the day before  id love to revisit savio volpe to try their alla famiglia andor their green spaghetti sometime

Address: 615 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5T 3K5 Canada
Review: got the option to have items chosen for our family and it was more than worth it and much better than picking individual items recieved way more food than we expected and everything was great service was excellent the pork and polenta were definitely the highlights we also all loved our server and randomly shared dog photos with him

Address: 615 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5T 3K5 Canada
Review:
my family and i are from out of town and booked our table a few months in advance we had heard it was amazing and it 100 lived up to the hype

we did the tasting menu for our table of 4 the food just kept coming we were shocked to have so much food continuously come to the table it was my first time trying a few of them items served and they exceeded expectations

for 79 you definitely get your bang for buck and a wonderful experience the wait staff was also fantastic as soon as you took a sip of water someone was there to refill it cleared and wiped tables between courses too

we will be back

Address: 1525 Yew Street Vancouver, BC V6K 3E4 Canada
Review:
the pizza was incredible the flavors were amazing and the dough was soft and crunchy where it needed to be we got the mushroom pizza and cacio pepe pasta to share

the pasta was a bit disappointing in my opinion too salty and not flavorful other than a lot of pepper corn they added

overall i recommend this place for pizzas and a few drinks

Address: 1525 Yew Street Vancouver, BC V6K 3E4 Canada
Review: i have never written a google review for a restaurant in my life but oh my gosh did i love this place food 1010 ambience cool classy jazzy staff awesome fun lovely quirky or maybe its a vancouver thing because everyone here is kinda fun and i feel spoiled coming from the east coast either way love this place

Address: 1525 Yew Street Vancouver, BC V6K 3E4 Canada
Review:
great atmosphere i felt like i was on holiday
the person serving was good fun up for a laugh the food was amazing i had pasta conarelli cacao pepe which had a tower of cheese my husband had a vegetarian pizza there was so much pasta i had to take some home tomorrows lunch and they gave us a complimentary coffee cake desert which was so kind i will definitely be returning and the wine was also excellent

Address: 1525 Yew Street Vancouver, BC V6K 3E4 Canada
Review: the food was delicious and came in a timely manner i highly recommend the special crostini our server leah kristy was very welcoming knowledgeable and friendly had a great evening

Address: 1525 Yew Street Vancouver, BC V6K 3E4 Canada
Review: been there a couple days ago the service was amazing came into the store with warm welcome and the service is great food is awesome and tasty will go there very soon

Address: 1137 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review:
having worked there many times i can confidently say that it is a great place to hold such an important event as a wedding the venue boasts of unique architectural details and character that adds to the ambiance of the occasion

one of the standout features of this venue is the friendly and helpful staff they are always on hand to offer assistance and ensure that everything runs smoothly the location is also fantastic with close proximity to a waterfront and green spaces that provide excellent opportunities for a photo session

and of course the food is simply amazing from the panseared scallops to the fresh fruit sorbet everything on the menu is a delight to the taste buds these dishes are among my personal favorites and are sure to impress even the most discerning palates

overall i highly recommend this venue for anyone looking to host a wedding the combination of stunning architecture excellent service picturesque location and delectable cuisine makes it a standout choice that is sure to leave a lasting impression on all who attend

Address: 1137 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review: this restaurant is perfect for a romantic date we were lucky to sit in the courtyard on the second floor just like having a date in a beautiful garden as for the food we ordered shrimp and fried cauliflower salad for appetizers and they were both stunning the flavors were rich and delightful the steak and chicken for the main course maintained the high standards of a great restaurant

Address: 1137 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review:
went here few days ago for my birthday staff were super friendly and nice the food was perfect we had steak and it was one the best steaks ive had

one thing that i didnt like was the fact that i was expecting a dessert with happy birthday on it but that didnt happen lol also the atmosphere is not what we see in the pictures way smaller but i would still go back

Address: 1137 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review:
wanted to really like this place what with the nice reviews and photos of the restaurant  below are things that left a bad taste in the mouth
1  made reservations online weeks ago and when we get there we get a high top table when there was a booth spot  hostess made the change after i made a request
2  server was pushing the special and adding lobster tails at every interaction  she was pretty aggressive with her recommendations as if she gets commission for every lobster tail that gets ordered when we wanted to share entrees and app thats when the level of service really decreased  she barely came by after taking our order and i think we waited over half an hr before the food came  the restaurant was not busy so not sure what took so long for the food and there was no reassurance from her food was coming
3  the food was okthe 22oz steak we shared was bland and the server said the chef recommends having it medium but there were parts of it that were rare  the lobster tails were bland and doesnt look appetizing

honestly i shouldnt have given her the 18 gratuity thats the 1st button on the keypad but i was there with girlfriends for a bachelorette party  it took so long to get our food we didnt even get a chance to order dessert bc we had reservations for drinks somewhere else

the ambience is nice but no i would not come back here again  overrated

Address: 1137 Hamilton Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P6 Canada
Review:
brix and mortar is a restaurant that offers a memorable culinary adventure leaving a lasting impression on its guests my dining experience at this establishment was a combination of impressive highlights and a few areas that could be improved upon

the ambiance at brix and mortar is undeniably charming the interior design exudes elegance and sophistication creating a welcoming atmosphere

the service provided by the staff savannah was attentive and courteous ensuring that our needs were met throughout the evening the servers were knowledgeable about the menu and offered insightful suggestions

however there was a moment when i informed the waiter of a small hair on the ramen egg of the ahi tuna salad i think you can see it on the picture since i have already split the salad with my family members i wasnt expecting anything other than a follow up the waiter said let me check with the kitchen took away the egg and never came back with an apology or any follow up

the menu at brix and mortar offers a diverse range of dishes showcasing the creativity and skill of the culinary team we ordered the ahi tuna salad burrata di puglia wild sockeye salmon lamb neck and steak the flavors were generally wellbalanced and the presentation was visually appealing all the dishes were exceptional aside from the steak which was satisfactory but not outstanding the cocktails we ordered stregarita sakura blossom and basil exposition were delicious as well

overall brix and mortar is a restaurant that offers a memorable dining experience with its refined ambiance attentive service and creative menu although there were a few minor areas for improvement the overall experience was enjoyable and left a positive impression

atmosphere and environment 55 lovely
service 45 minor incident that had occured
food 455 all the dishes were great and exceeded expectations aside from the steak
drinks 455

Address: 663 E 15th Avenue Vancouver, BC V5T 2R6 Canada
Review:
food was good very fairly priced for a vancouver restaurant nice classic french bistro menu and vibes

hostess was nice we made a mistake with our reservation but luckily was able to fix it and have us seated our server dave was very friendly and helpful through the service

squid was very super tender and tasty

duck confit was pretty good the goat cheese salad under was great and was a very generous portion

hanger steak and frites was nice i prefer the mustard butter over the red wine jus very generous portion of fries too

would come back to try more

Address: 663 E 15th Avenue Vancouver, BC V5T 2R6 Canada
Review: excellent service our waitress was attentive and friendly however the dishes tasted pretty standard actually the beef tartare was a bit disappointing it was mixed in with so much spice and sauce that you could hardly taste the beef at all made you wonder the quality of the beef itself the dining room was too hotstuffy i was pretty much sweating by the end of the meal i would suggest not to come in the summer especially before 8pm

Address: 663 E 15th Avenue Vancouver, BC V5T 2R6 Canada
Review: the beef tartare was good i dont recommend the charcuterie board unless you can appreciate a bitter taste there is no fig jam its prices were pretty good for a french restaurant  you get what you pay for the steak was tender but i personally think it shouldve been served with mashed potatoes to complement the steak there are better restaurants

Address: 663 E 15th Avenue Vancouver, BC V5T 2R6 Canada
Review: delicious good service and wonderful food fairly reasonably priced as well for these economic times the grilled squid was fabulous and super tender

Address: 663 E 15th Avenue Vancouver, BC V5T 2R6 Canada
Review:
we came here as a walkin at 8pm on saturday the reservations were full until 945 so we decided to risk it thankfully we were seated right away it looks like the bar is reserved for walkin guests

the ambiance of the place was lovely with dim lighting i really enjoyed the music jazz

everything was delicious the only complaint was that the entr√©e took an hour to get to our table after our appetizers

for starters we got the onion soup and the beef tartare the portions were quite large almost equivalent to our entr√©es we really enjoyed both of them

it was my first time having a coq au vin so i was excited although i didnt enjoy it very much i dont think it was a problem with the restaurant maybe just not a fan of the dish itself

the steak was cooked perfectly according to our preference and it was delicious

allinall a lovely and romantic place for date night i would definitely come back

Address: 904 W King Edward Avenue Vancouver, BC V5Z 2E2 Canada
Review: i passed by here every day and wasnt aware of the restaurant until i first had dinner here it was surprisingly tasty i will come more and try more food here

Address: 904 W King Edward Avenue Vancouver, BC V5Z 2E2 Canada
Review: its nice to have this hong kong cafe in this area its slightly pricey than a typical one but thats the west side for you my curry fish rice was a pleasant lunch

Address: 904 W King Edward Avenue Vancouver, BC V5Z 2E2 Canada
Review: amazing find on the west side tucked away in a strip mall hong style cafe food that was delicious and served quickly as to substitute carbs for vegetables and was very happy with the portion and taste the hong kong style coffee was perfect and the lunch deal was filling certainly be back and try more food as these types of restaurants are getting rare

Address: 904 W King Edward Avenue Vancouver, BC V5Z 2E2 Canada
Review: slight higher than average priced hong kong style cafe food was good though the rice noodles were a bit bland service was fast parking is plentiful seems to have a good neighbourhood following the set dinners are a decent deal

Address: 904 W King Edward Avenue Vancouver, BC V5Z 2E2 Canada
Review: the lunch combo you get soup main dish and a drink food taste good but nothing spectacular the lunch combo is a bit expensive as well over 20 staff members are very quick and efficient

Address: 1510 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 2Y7 Canada
Review: i booked sopra sotto for a family dinner because it was on the same block as my favourite ice cream place and it was a great choice only the cocktails were really pricey all other items were an expected price for the area and cuisine atmosphere was nice with the patio and natural lightning and decorations service was alright a little slow and absent sometimes we tried everything from drinks appetizer board pizzas pastas cartoccio on special the pizza and board were the highlights in my opinion i would recommend those in your next visit

Address: 1510 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 2Y7 Canada
Review:
came here for lunch on a saturday and had such a wonderful experience the host let us choose our table and brought us water right away we ordered the meatballs that came with focaccia bread that was so perfect we had to order more we got caesar salad and the diavola pizza everything was tasty
also the environment is just so much more comfortable than all of the other italian restaurants ive been to in the city everything felt bright and clean and modern

Address: 1510 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 2Y7 Canada
Review:
a great location for a modern italian restaurant with a wood fire oven

the space is clean and open and aromatic on sundays they have live piano music with a pianist named bruno

the low star ratings is due to the fact that i am a little disappointed in their food

we ordered a focaccia but it was more like pizza crust in that it was thin very hard and chewy instead of thick and soft usually focaccia is a dimpled soft bread with italian seasonings similar to pizza bread we also ordered the pizza and it had what seemed like the same bread base as the focaccia 

the tagliatelle ragu is a little bland

the eggplant and homemade sausage margarita pizza wasnt that good the eggplant didnt lend any interesting depth or flavor i wish the sausage was more spiced

i tried the chili oil and its not spicy just oil to me

the best dish was the truffled mushroom pasta

Address: 1510 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 2Y7 Canada
Review:
loved it great ambiance quality food  servers were attentive without rushing us good costquality match 
definitely give it a try and enjoy

note this is something i recently noticed in vancouvers restaurants where you feel like youre in a dining match and rushed to leave ive added this aspect to my recent reviews

Address: 1510 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 2Y7 Canada
Review:
everything was excellent gabriel service was great he was super nice  he took the time to give us recommendations and to accomodate for my mothers allergies the pizza and pasta we ordered were amazing and they came very fast
we sat next to the kitchen bar and it was a very good experience we got to see how jose and rodrigo prepared our dishes to perfection we got to talk with rodrigo and jose and they are super nice people
definitely recommend

Address: 263 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T8 Canada
Review: absolutely a wonderful tasting experience the combinations of flavours were exactly right the fish tasted very fresh and the sauce on top puts the whole dish together the highlight is definitely the truffle omelette the most perfect omelette ive ever had in my life the truffle was aromatic paired with creamy eggs i just felt that my table was a bit squishy and the table felt very full

Address: 263 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T8 Canada
Review:
good food with amazing service everything was done perfectly and there was nothing that we didnt like went with the omikaze and the recommended sweet spot for pricing of approximately 170  200pp we werent too hungry so the waiter went more for higher quality food rather than quantity the waitress asked a series of questions in order to tailor the menu to us a little which was nice

youll want to make a reservation if you want a better chance at getting a seat walkins are possible but fill up quick paid street parking is available and relatively cheap couple of dollars for the 23h duration we were there

definitely a nice experience and worth trying at least once if you get the chance but it is quite pricey for the total price you could eat at a few nice restaurants instead but lifes short and you cant take your money with you so as long as the wife is happy youll be happy

Address: 263 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T8 Canada
Review:
loved kissa tanto since they opened really happy to see them receive a michelin star though that does mean prices have gone up a bunch corkage is now 75 and the truffle omelette was nearly 80 all that said food is still excellent flavors were well balanced and fun would definitely keep coming back

atmospherewise the restaurant itself is a bit loud and the solo chairs can be a bit uncomfortable

Address: 263 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T8 Canada
Review:
havent been back since they had the miso bread  to my dismay this dish is cancelled which to be honest was the only dish i remembered from my last meal here

service was exceptional and every dish was a delight except i would skip the rib eye   nothing wrong but for the price  taste my preference would be either elisa or victor and prepared traditionally

Address: 263 E Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1T8 Canada
Review:
while i recognize that my threestar rating may seem low for such an extraordinary restaurant the most important factor for me is value for money as a michelinstarred restaurant i expected an extraordinary experience but what i received was a decent restaurant albeit a bit too noisy with good service and okay food nothing was particularly extraordinary except for the price we ordered the entire menu and while the octopus dish and spaghetti were incredible masterpieces the rest was just passable

to sum it up the food is good but it neither deserves its price nor its michelin star

Address: 350 Carrall Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J3 Canada
Review: first time i tried a tasting menu and it did not disappoint we tried the regular tasting menu for a birthday celebration i forgot the name of the food but it was divine definitely will try the chefs station tasting menu for another experience we did the food and wine tasting we will definitely go back and we have been recommending this place to out friends

Address: 350 Carrall Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J3 Canada
Review:
all the food was sooo good
everything we tried was awesome and service was great too
this was just a really good culinary experience

only thing to note is that the area immediately outside isnt super inviting 

we would definitely come again

Address: 350 Carrall Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J3 Canada
Review: we had the pleasure of dining here based on a friends recommendation and we are thrilled we took their advice the service surpassed our expectations our server jordan was not only incredibly knowledgeable but also engaging and delightful to converse with if you are in the area worth checking it out although would be mindful of walking down hastings street which felt very uncomfortable to walk down given the crowd

Address: 350 Carrall Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J3 Canada
Review: the cheese filled tempura morels unpictured scallop tartare amuse bouche and the asparagus green pea scape salad were amazing went for the chefs table experience which was worth it we left with our tummies filled just the right amount

Address: 350 Carrall Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2J3 Canada
Review:
its a michelin recommended restaurant and its easy to see why its a great fusion of asian and western cuisine and all the dishes were carefully curated

we had the tasting menu and a virgin cocktail and its not for a full meal  its only to highlight the dishes and the restaurant

if you order separate dishes i highly recommend the scallop and bison dish it can be a bit pricy but i think its worth the price and the wait based on my experience

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review: i enjoyed the food here with my family  portions are good i just wish they could have more non spicy food for kids they do charge a 15 service fee if your group has more than 6 people which is like a tip so it is reasonable

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
at sura korean restaurant one can anticipate a truly unique dining experience that perfectly melds traditional korean flavors with a modern sophisticated ambiance from the moment you walk in the welcoming atmosphere resplendent with warm lights and comfortable seating sets the tone for an excellent culinary journey

the menu at sura is a vibrant palette of korean gastronomy showcasing the rich hearty flavors that the cuisine is known for the bulgogi tender and succulently marinated is an absolute musttry as is the bibimbap served in a hot stone bowl which creates an irresistible crispy rice layer at the bottom the seafood pancake brimming with fresh ingredients is an ideal start to the meal

vegetarians and vegans arent left out either suras japchae a dish of stirfried sweet potato noodles and vegetables is an example of their commitment to catering to diverse dietary needs without compromising flavor

one aspect that particularly stands out is the quality of their ingredients the freshness of the vegetables the quality of the meats and the aromatic spices all come together in a symphony of flavors that leaves one yearning for more

service at sura matches the high standard set by their food the staff is attentive helpful with suggestions and ensures a smooth dining experience

in addition the restaurants adherence to safety and hygiene protocols in these challenging times further enhances the overall experience making you feel safe and comfortable

overall sura korean restaurant in vancouver is a destination not just for those with a palate for korean food but anyone who appreciates good food well served highly recommended

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
we got there around 1 pm on a sun and had a 12 hr wait well worth it we walked down the street while we were waiting and this was one of 2 spot that had a wait i guess we now know why 

we found a parking lot for 3  hr across the back door in the street behind the restaurant they have 4 free spots behind the back door but they were full

we get the lunch set menu and got to try different things all of which were good kids got a dumpling soup and kimchi fried rice portions were just right to fill us up

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
you cant go wrong with ordering any food at this restaurant the food is flavorful and the service is great i actually felt like our server cared about our experience at sura
the only thing to consider is they dont take reservations and there is usually a wait list at this place
overall a must try for korean food in vancouver

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
what a great place on robson st for authentic korean eats

we actually tried coming here before but the lineup was too long of a wait fortunately we came again during foul weather earlier this month december 2021  yay we got a table without delay had to call the restaurant to let them someone know we were outside as patrons are required to stay outside until a staff member came out to assist i appreciate the covid protocol they do check for vax ids

their great ratings do not lie  the food is comforting and delicious portions are good considering the cost the decor is light and minimal their staff are all excellent in friendliness attentiveness and speed

the potato pancakes had perfect crisp to it and were very flavourful on their own  no sauce really needed the vegetarian japchae was so satisfying that we didnt even miss the meat

i loved the grilled mackerel the most not overly cooked with a softly cooked interior while maintaining a crispy skin it even came with a small doenjang jjigae  super flavourful soup broth with bits of beef

all the appies kimchi beans potato salad were a perfect sample taste i wonder if i could have asked for more

the staff were hospitable  and quick to serve and clear away

decor is modern minimalistic yet relaxed

im so looking forward to coming back again

find me on instagram aidaloves

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: i love korean food and this place doesnt disappoint they have a wide menu of classic korean dishes there bbq is amazing and a lot of fun only down side is that the food is quite expensive no matter the dish  i would highly recommend going with a bunch or people who love to share food and laughs

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: the service is very good and the people is so nice the food is good the place has a good atmosphere

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review:
went to sura for lunch and tried a variety of dishes all the selections were great and tasty

the staff was friendly and always kept our pitcher of water filled like how they gave us individual condiments rather than the traditional communal style condiments

was disappointed that their seasonal buckwheat cold noodle was well  out of season

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: delicious food reasonably priced and very well packaged they also included free kimchi on the side as well

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: both dishes were a real flop i had taken a bibimbap because i had heard that it was a very good dish but i honestly didnt like it i honestly think its not the dish itself but the way the restaurant makes it the tastelessness was really bad as was the chow mein the service was mediocre and the atmosphere of the restaurant is really depressing

Address: 88 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1R3 Canada
Review: great indonesian food in a food court on the second floor the owner suggested me to get the beef and chicken rice which comes with vegetables eggplants or mushrooms the owner is very friendly the food court is clean and spacious great to drop by after going to china town museums

Address: 88 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1R3 Canada
Review: that was absolutely amazing this has got to be one of my best food experiences in vancouver what just happened that was insane i ordered the beef rendang and egg balado with vegetables served alongside turmeric coconut rice i cant remember the last time i felt this sad taking my last bite of food i have been converted to the church of bali thai i will be coming here as often as i can

Address: 88 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1R3 Canada
Review: delicious and authentic i grew up in indonesia and its a rare treat to find rendang sapi and a good sambal sauce wonderful service and food

Address: 88 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1R3 Canada
Review:
