delicious indonesian food with very friendly service i had the two meat combo with beef rendang and spicy balinese chicken served with turmeric coconut rice eggplant and veggies the owner recommended some of her homemade chili sambal she called
911 spice to add some heat and it was delicious such a great spot in the international marketplace food court

Address: 88 W Pender Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1R3 Canada
Review: im indonesian and im so glad that bali thai exists i have visited multiple times their food never disappoint me when i miss indonesian food bali thai is the place i go great service lovely food and the best 911 super spicy sambal chili sauce

Address: 867 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review:
went during dinner time around the weekend at 6pm and was able to get seated i got to try their toppoki rose toppiki and their spicy pork bulgogi

despite the name suggests the spicy pork bulgogi just has the right amount of kick that enhances the taste given the price the meat to rice portion is actually more compared to other korean places that serves little rice pots like this

the regular toppoki is standard nothing too special about it and is spicy as usual the rose toppoki on the other hand has the same ingredients as the regular toppoki just added with sausages and mushrooms but the sauce used is different its milder and not spicy as far as i recall so if you crave for toppoki but prefer creamier and milder option then rose toppoki is recommended

Address: 867 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: the food was absolutely delicious and amazing and the staff were really kind and helpful offering suggestions will definitely go back soon

Address: 867 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: its the best korean restaurant ive had recently gamjatang is the best on a cold day but my favorite food is short ribs everything is delicious please order everything and eat it

Address: 867 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: damso has been our goto place for hearty korean dinner that never fails for many many years our all time favourites are beef soy bean paste soup and grilled pork belly but honestly all of their food is pretty darn solid their deep fried chickens are super crispy and i really liked their tacos with korean twist cant wait to go back again

Address: 867 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L9 Canada
Review: one of the best korean restaurants in townthe atmosphere is cozy and relaxing the staff were very nice and friendly we ordered their signature 48hr slow cook short ribs pork belly korean bbqspicy tofu soup and chestnut makgulii love the juicy ribs and the pork belly was paired with fresh lettuces that took away the oily feeling of the pork it was our first time trying makguli in an unique chestnut flavour nutty and delicious which balanced well with the food

Address: 4121 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review: i got the locus skillet with duck confit and was shocked with how fantastic it was each bite was so full of rich flavours and you could taste the quality of the ingredients service was excellent too and the coffee was great highly recommend this awesome spot

Address: 4121 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review: friendly staff and a nice little cafe to get in out of the rain  i wouldnt call the decor gothic necessarily but it does have an eclectic feel   the food was a hit with the family

Address: 4121 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review: this is a wonderful place for brunch i had the summer ratatouille breakfast hash it was delicious i will definitely be back service was attentive

Address: 4121 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review:
wasnt really planning to dine here but we saw the restaurant and it looked interesting so we gave it a try

what a fantastic decision food and drinks are tasty my favorite dishes had to be the twoways squid and seafood risotto as for the drink the server recommended the railbird which was a home run

the services was lovely the vibes in the restaurant were interesting but very pleasant we had a great night and definitely would go back

Address: 4121 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P6 Canada
Review: interesting choice of ingredients and unconventional dishes good for a quiet dinner night the cocktails are the star of the place imo tercio makes the best old fashioned ive had in vancouver super friendly guy and makes up for the gloominess of the place 100 recommend

Address: 39 Smithe Street Vancouver, BC V6B 0R3 Canada
Review:
had a nice friday brunch at honey salt my first visit to the restaurant they were kind enough to let me order their sweet potato pancakes usually available for weekend brunch this was arranged before my visit they were delicious and quite filling although the almond butter was quite dense and sticky to the teeth the honey salt market is a great sharing dish with a good amount of dips to go around for the veg and chips today we were given guacamole a spinach dip and a sweet potato dip my guest had their buttermilk fried chicken sandwich the fried chicken inside was so tender and moist and the batter had a solid crunch

we were celebrating a birthday and they brought out a small brownie cake with ice cream and a candle such a nice way to end a filling meal staff were kind and wished my guest a happy birthday as they introduced themselves and at the front desk our server was janine and she was fantastic on a friday for brunch it wasnt very busy but i imagine it will get busier at night or on the weekends chic and comfortable aesthetic inside

Address: 39 Smithe Street Vancouver, BC V6B 0R3 Canada
Review: my husband i came here for lunch we had such a great time here the service was fast the atmosphere here is a ten out of ten for sure its so beautiful inside the restaurant  the food here was so delicious and tasty  i would definitely recommend this restaurant  for everyone  five out of five for sure  definitely try their avocado toast and fish and chips so good

Address: 39 Smithe Street Vancouver, BC V6B 0R3 Canada
Review: vibes were on point the decor was great however my dish was quite small for the price and i felt that under the egg there was one piece of meat and a very small amount  of spinach and mushroom the spinach and mushrooms tasted fantastic while the rest of the dish not covered in egg or the rest tasted dry and boring none of us were very impressed by the food but the decor was great

Address: 39 Smithe Street Vancouver, BC V6B 0R3 Canada
Review: the service was good and food did have good taste but im giving only 3 stars because we got the seafood boil and the shrimp werent peeled and the crab legs were very hard to open not pre cracked at all it got quite messy i added the lobster tail so the dish was 80 i think if paying that much for a dish it shouldnt be so hard to eat i also had 6 oysters for 24 and 2 of them had pieces of shell in them would expect better quality and ease to eat for such a high price

Address: 39 Smithe Street Vancouver, BC V6B 0R3 Canada
Review: the place is so beautiful highly recommended for breakfast we tried eggs benedict and pancakes a little bit overprice in my opinion but the food was really good quality and size

Address: 2958 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1R4 Canada
Review:
pre dinner snack before our late night hot pot thats why we didnt order that many dishes

dim sum is my favourite cuisine i was curious how this modern restaurant would stack up against the traditional ones

the green tea sesame balls were super tasty but the other dishes were just average among other dim sum restaurants in greater vancouver we tried the golden corn dumplings even lux in langley made a better version than them

maybe i have high standards regarding dim sum i do think that they are making an effort to let more people try dim sum

unfortunately for us traditional dim sum lovers we wont be back

Address: 2958 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1R4 Canada
Review: the scallop taro puffs inside curry sauce were good match the chive  shrimp dumplings were delicious the vegetable siu mai were not my expectations the bbq pork had some sand inside

Address: 2958 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1R4 Canada
Review:
i grew up in hk and shanghai so i hold most dim sum to a pretty high regard some dishes have a fusion take to them but for the most part the taste of each dish is pretty authentic id rate it an 8510 for authenticity with the best places in richmond ranking 9 on my scale the accompanying sauces were a mix of old classics and new interesting takes wasabi mustard but i didnt really use them much in my opinion the taste aligns more with the younger demographic its definitely more flavorful and stronger i find other dim sum places to be on the bland side sometimes to cater to the elderly and constantly find myself drowning my food in sauces i really liked the shrimp corn dumplings and the fried wontons not my usual go to at dim sum and i was pleasantly surprised i wouldve taken better photos but the food was too good

yes theres better dim sum to be had in van for cheaper but those places have bad service most top tier dim sum restaurants also turn into fancy chinese dining at night so little bird is a solid alternative option this place is a little more elegant and date friendly great spot to go to after a day hanging around in the area

lots of the reviews point to the price which is understandable our table was 50 a head 42 food 8 alcohol so really not that bad in comparison to a dim sum bill in richmond we had a lot of leftovers too

Address: 2958 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1R4 Canada
Review: love the idea of dim sum for dinr with drinks and little bird delivered except for tight space as tables were about an inch apart i like haywire pinot noir which they serve with light dim sum fair which we enjoyed their fried items were crispy and tasty and steamed dumplings and sticky rice were fresh the portions were smaller than conventional dim sum places as the orders came in a pair or 3s which means if 4 top someones gonna miss out on the dumpling they do advise upon arriving of their strict time limit for dining in but we found it sufficient as the food came out promptly and small bites take little time to inhale lol hope to return with a larger group so that we try everything else on the menu alongside some craft beers

Address: 2958 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6K 1R4 Canada
Review:
the dim sum is good and very filling 3 items per person is a good rule of thumb as we went 4 and it was too much
the scallop taro puff was a particular standout
the steamed bbq pork bun was a little disappointing in the bun to pork ratio

Address: 900 Canada Place Way Vancouver, BC V6C 3L5 Canada
Review:
foodservicelocation are great
definitely worth it coming and experience it
we went for all inclusive weekend brunch and had great time
they have vegetarian and vegan substitutes

Address: 900 Canada Place Way Vancouver, BC V6C 3L5 Canada
Review: this hotel  restaurant was across from our hotel emilee was a great host she was honest   told us what was good to eat  here at arc  gave us other nearby restaurants to visit we wanted a light snack the chicken wings  fried cauliflower were yummy we also had a drink

Address: 900 Canada Place Way Vancouver, BC V6C 3L5 Canada
Review: was there the other day and had a good time the service was a a bit slow to start but overall it was good i was graciously seated by the manager i believe i had the four course set menu from local fresh ingredients and it did not disappoint albeit the seeds in the strawberry orange salad  though the flavour was goodthe risotto was amazing and had rich flavour the duck was very tender and the beanbacon was a good addition  i only hoped for a bit more such as mashed potatoes or a little something loved the lavender atop the honey gelato and strawberryrhubarb compote i think i described that rightlol was impressed with one male expediterbusser who was gentle kind and professional cant remember his name but i think it was something like moraomar i could be way off base loved the rooftop honey with my tea

Address: 900 Canada Place Way Vancouver, BC V6C 3L5 Canada
Review:
blahhh brunch

when you go to brunch at arc you have two choices going for the order brunch menu and the a la cart menu the all you can eat menu looked heavy so we went for the a la cart

in short nothing stood out as me as special for the price we paid the coffee though organic tasted burnt the pancakes fluffy didnt have a crunch or caramelization for that heightened experience the crab egg benny was pleasant but plain the 9 bacon was mostly fat

Address: 900 Canada Place Way Vancouver, BC V6C 3L5 Canada
Review: ive been following arc dining on instagram for 2 years now and finally got the chance to go yesterday with my mom and sister  we all loved it  fantastic view service and food  i actually couldnt think of anything that would make it any better  ok maybe if the price was lower but it is worth every penny  ill definitely go back and recommend it to anyone who wants to listen

Address: 5750 Oak Street Vancouver, BC V6M 2V9 Canada
Review: the food was amazing we tried the falafel hummus  shakshuka and salmon shawarma  the best middle eastern food in vancouver  service was very friendly

Address: 5750 Oak Street Vancouver, BC V6M 2V9 Canada
Review: best hummus ever in a falafel plate which happens to be vegan so creamy shakshuka pizza a clever twist on a freshly baked airy crust that is perfectly executed yolks still runny service impeccable

Address: 5750 Oak Street Vancouver, BC V6M 2V9 Canada
Review:
i was looking for a place to eat falafel and my friend recommended me this hidden gem in the corner of oak and 41st ave i order the falafel plate a coffee and some pastries falafel plate was amazing gluten friendly so my gf was able to eat from it pastries and coffee were also very tasty
i will totally recommend this place

Address: 5750 Oak Street Vancouver, BC V6M 2V9 Canada
Review: the best falafel and hummus ive tried in vancouver the shakshuka plate was super tasty as well  service was super friendly

Address: 5750 Oak Street Vancouver, BC V6M 2V9 Canada
Review: the food looks overcooked we waited for our order for about 25 minutes even after every customer who came after us including two jewish customers who arrived five minutes later and two others who arrived ten minutes later had their food before us i wondered if it was because we are asian

Address: 261 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2Z1 Canada
Review: amazing really everything we tried and we sampled just about everything on the menu was amazing the service is also incredible our waitress kristina was very knowledgeable and gave us so much information and ideas on what to try i highly highly recommend this restaurant if you are in vancouver the reviews are not lying this place is all that

Address: 261 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2Z1 Canada
Review: i enjoyed a birthday celebration here before going to a concert at the rickshaw  the service was top notch  when the server presented the food she explained what the dish was and how it was made the had great recommendations and the timing was perfect  the food was very fresh tasting and cooked to perfection i would not hesitate to recommend this place of course the area is a bit dodgy but inside you feel safe privileged and well looked after

Address: 261 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2Z1 Canada
Review: we loved every dish we got the environment is lively loud and could be fun for those that enjoy active bars we enjoyed our servers they were attentive and cleaned our small table often the areaneighborhood is dilapidated run down and scattered with public drug use

Address: 261 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2Z1 Canada
Review:
everything was delicious and sooooo filling
the tacos were so unique
the cornbread was very interesting its a must try i think more micro greens were needed to help balance the richness of it
got 6 tacos each order has 2 tacos skirt steak polenta the best one imo beef was cooked perfectly blueberry was so interesting and the polenta was really good in it lamb this was like solid meat i didnt enjoy it but my partner did and the chicken this was sooooo good i heard this is a seasonal item but it should be kept around taste was so good very heavy id love to have more celery sticks even if it was on the side

was so full after this but would love to taste the churros next time

Address: 261 Powell Street Vancouver, BC V6A 2Z1 Canada
Review: weve been going here for years and unlike many small restaurants their standards have remained consistently high the food is excellent the drinks are unique and the atmosphere  inside an old brick building  is warm and cozy its located in the downtown eastside which may make some people nervous at night but weve never had any problems

Address: 2280 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B6 Canada
Review:
i come here regularly for the cauliflower meal  its the best choice of dips and you can go all veggies or half rice itll fill you up

you have to try it and youll understand what i mean  ive had other cauliflower at other restaurants around town but this one is the best in my opinion

Address: 2280 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B6 Canada
Review: lovely atmosphere great service amazing food my friend and i went in for dinner and shared the cauliflower the board and the beets 1010 on everything will definitely be back as there were a couple things we wanted to try but they were sold out for the night highly recommend

Address: 2280 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B6 Canada
Review: just had the most beautiful meal with my bf at jamjar the atmosphere was cozy the staff were lovely and the food was fabulous i always find it hard to find good veggie food thats actually filling and that was 1110 the prices are very reasonable would 100 recommend and we will be back again

Address: 2280 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B6 Canada
Review: i came in for an early supper i ordered the tabblieh and a cider bandity food was really fresh and flavourful absolutely loved it the cider was awesome too it went great with the meal

Address: 2280 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B6 Canada
Review: fantastic food and service at the commercial drive location great flavours shareable dishes warm and casual atmosphere all of this at a very reasonable price good place to meet up with friends

Address: 1127 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P2 Canada
Review: this was a highlight of my visit to vancouver the bruschetta caprese was a fantastic and refreshing start to our meal i had the lobster and crab stuffed ravioli which sounded amazing but far exceeded my expectations my dining partner enjoyed the risotto with braised meet which he said was absolutely stellar everything was delightfully flavorful and the atmosphere was exceptionally pleasant the service impeccable as well

Address: 1127 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P2 Canada
Review: it was saturday night and a busy night it was a small restaurant good service fr irene food were all really good and  cocktail drinks and wine were also good we were five people in a table only problem here was if you were seated inside the restaurant and near the kitchen it was uncomfortable and hot too also on a saturday night you only have 2 hours seating even if you are still enjoying your drinks you have to pay and leave which was understandable for a small restaurant like this but thank you irene for a good service with a smile chef for our good food and bartender for our good cocktail drinks might come back but not on a weekend for sure

Address: 1127 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P2 Canada
Review:
unfair mandatory tip policy imposing on a group of five 

i am deeply disappointed with my recent visit not only did they enforce a mandatory 20 tip but they also insisted on applying it to my group of five even though the policy clearly states it is for groups of six or more

first the server nor anything on the reservation page informed us about the mandatory 20 tip and i was shocked when she insisted that we had to pay the 20 tip despite having only five people in our group according to their own policy this tip should not have been applied to us

what made matters worse was the servers complete lack of concern or understanding she made it clear that she had no intention of rectifying the situation or offering any sort of compromise her dismissive and rude attitude only added to the frustration we felt as paying customers

she stated that since we made a reservation of 6 people this mandatory tip policy applied to us because she spent her time reserving the table for us however i mentioned that they were going to seat us a 6people table regardless and she can inform us beforehand

springing it on us at the end of the meal especially when it doesnt even apply to our group size is both unfair and deceptive

i believe that a restaurants success lies not only in the quality of its food but also in the way it treats its customers unfortunately this restaurant failed to deliver on both fronts the mandatory tip policy and the servers poor attitude have left me with a negative impression that i cannot ignore

in conclusion i would caution others considering dining here to be wary of their unfair mandatory tip policy if you value transparency and fair treatment as a customer i recommend seeking alternatives where your dining experience is valued and respected

Address: 1127 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P2 Canada
Review:
we did the date night and think it was an amazing deal we priced it out before going and it was 100 bucks off seems like most people did the date night even if it was clearly just friends

the food was unbelievable carpaccio was absolutely phenomenal my spouse ordered the lobster and crab ravioli and he loved it i ordered the red gnocchi and was very impressed both were served hot and we were asked if we wanted fresh pepper and parm by the time desserts came we were beyond full

i wasnt overly fond of the tiramasu but spouse loved his mousse

we plan to return for date night the next time we return to van

Address: 1127 Mainland Street Vancouver, BC V6B 5P2 Canada
Review:
we had the date night special which consisted of 2 starters 2 mains 2 desserts and a bottle of wine

the portions were surprisingly big everything we ordered was outstanding will definitely be back soon to try the other dishes

Address: 1622 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3Y4 Canada
Review: such a great mexican restaurant stumbled upon this and decided to give it a go and instantly added it to our favorites great drinks friendly staff  delicious food we went to mexico last year and were pretty disappointed in the resort food  but this is what we were hoping for from what i can tell its authentic  and definitely really flavorful

Address: 1622 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3Y4 Canada
Review:
love this place we stopped by on our way to roger arena great location great food i cant wait to go back again

the happy hour menu is amazing  there were 5 of us we shared 4 appetizers and it was plenty of food

Address: 1622 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3Y4 Canada
Review:
popular spot very busy and somewhat small recommend reserving great tasting food service was good a little hard to hear or communicate at some times with how loud and busy it is we ordered the special drinkwatermelon jalape√±o slush type drink and the server misunderstood or didnt hear us order 2 we had to ask a second time

overall it was great service friendly and knowledgeable

Address: 1622 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3Y4 Canada
Review: great spot great service delicious food the horchata is so refreshing there is a great feeling in the space i was there in the day time but it looks like it can get bumping at night

Address: 1622 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3Y4 Canada
Review: wow wow wow amazing elevated mexican food i can say their food tastes amazing and their mezcal drinks are awesome i got the brunch complete breakfast which brings a little bit of everything and i got some tacos at happy hour which starts at 2 on top of everything customer service was 1010 definitely would recommend this restaurant

Address: 952 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W7 Canada
Review: french food and wine  need i say more we were excited to try this place as we were missing authentic french food we came here for a birthday dinner this bistro brought me back to france its a nice intimate cozy place we sat outside as it was such a warm day the food was good we ordered price fixe mealwhich consists of a starter entree and dessert you can also order starter and entree only the portions were a good sizewe almost wished we ordered the starter and entr√©e only the service was slow but we did not mind as we enjoyed ambiance and saw she was playing dual roles of server and hostess overall we would definitely come back

Address: 952 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W7 Canada
Review:
me and my frd came to absinthe bistro for my birthday we had their set menu which offers good selection of meat and vegetarian dishes i picked the foie gras as appetizer it was rich and flavourful and thats what u would expect from foie gras from most places beef tartare was well seasoned it was smooth and fragrant the lamb rack was good in portion a little too raw for my liking but i know authentic french lamb rack suppose to be medium rare i likely asked the server if they can cook them for me for a little more she gladly took it in and  it came back perfectly cooked to my liking with beautiful grill marks when the server became aware of my birthday she offered to take a polaroid pic for us super cute and personable service

ambiance was simple and open i like how tables were well spaced out so its not crowded

Address: 952 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W7 Canada
Review:
my gal pals and i had an amazing meal they have a set menu fixe prix menu 2 or 3 course i chose the crab cakes starter duck confit main and chocolate cake  michelan quality presentation generous portions and amazing ingredients i would highly recommend this restaurant for foodies had a taste of scallops foods grois halibut creme brulee from my friends all very delicious
friendly service cute decor with absinthe vintage posters  chandelier patio seating

ill be back for a special dinner thanks absinthe

Address: 952 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W7 Canada
Review:
i didnt know what to expect when i chose to come here but i knew that if they had a rotating limited menu the chef would have to know what they are doing and did they ever

for 65 per person this place is so fairly priced we ordered one of each thing on the menu that night and everything was perfect this is one of my favorite restaurants in vancouver now and for anyone that loves french food you gotta come here i cant wait to come back

Address: 952 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L 3W7 Canada
Review:
my fianc√© and i dined here in celebration of our 1 year anniversary and my birthday we met in france while studying and dining here allowed us to relive the french dining experience in such a sweet way
the staff were professional but friendly the food was incredibly tasteful and you can tell they made sure to present it as such we especially enjoyed one of the side dishes which was grapefruit with cracked peppershockingly delicious
at the end of the night our server took a polaroid picture of us to keep we used it to document the experience in our date journal

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: must try worth the wait must try great simple ramen the line ups can take over an hour at time but its worth it customer service is great food is amazing and the atmosphere is welcoming and clean even with such a long line up the staff are always so friendly and clean up after every guest so carefully to ensure the best experience for the next guest love this place

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: you want ramen in vancouver there are many options this is nononsense delicious ramen yes ramen like art is subjective but i cant imagine a scenario where a bowl of this could be sent back danbo is more consistent than the rain in this fair city for its ability to deliver an all around great bowl of ramen if you dont want to quibble about semantics and just have a delicious bowl accept no substitute i eat at a variety of ramen joints this one just hits every time no question

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: had to wait a while in queue to eat there but it was well worth the wait handsdown the best vegan ramen ive ever had the customization options are great the broth is delicious and the service is fast  friendly would easily recommend this place as well as the seattle location

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: truly worth the wait incredible note the ramen doesnt come with toppings so you have to add on everything including egg

Address: 1333 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 2B1 Canada
Review: absolutely wonderful ramen this was my first time having ramen and it all tasted delicious the environment and atmosphere were great and even with a line outside for seating it did not take long to get in highly recommended

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review:
this is one of my favourite place for vegan ramen as i prefer to have vegetarianvegan ramen its very difficult to find a place that offers multiple options and danbo is one of them try them out and i am sure it wont be disappointment for you i was impressed with its flavourful broth and service dining space is quite small but wellmanaged make sure to book a seat via yelp before reaching there
a mustvisit for delicious plantbased options and attentive service

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: absolutely some of the best ramen ive had in all of van and easily top 5 ive had outside of japan itself the rekka is a great spicy option albeit they could still turn up the heat more from extra spicy the wait can be quite long so dont expect to just arrive  sit down but the broth is full  very tasty the noodles are delicious  i like that they let you pick firmness the pork chashu is well cut  takes on flavour well cant recommend this place enough

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: this is one of my favorites spots in vancouver the ramen is always on point and i have great memories coming here however when we visited on july 11th our team of 5 had to wait for 2 hours to get inside what made it worse was that smaller teams who had hardly waited got to go before us i would have preferred if they had at least asked us first if it would be alright for us to sit separately a team of four that came after us got to go in before us just because they had one less person im not sure who is managing the queue but the waitlist seemed useless i would suggest implementing a time limit for bigger groups as two big groups before us took their sweet time while they saw a huge line what was more infuriating was that when we finally came in they put together two smaller tables for us and added a stool on the side i couldnt help but wonder if they could have done that sooner instead of letting in couples whod come after us finish their meal and then put the two tables together for us im not sure if i want to come here again as long the customers in line are not treated seriously

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: ramen danbo gets my vote for some of the best ramen in vancouver because there is limited seating inside there is often a long waitlist to get seated depending on your group size came during the week and for a larger group there was about a hour long wait to get seated once seated the food came out very quickly and the both the ramen and broth was delicious love how you can order extra noodles too in case you have extra broth leftover prices are very reasonable as well will definitely have to come by here again

Address: 1833 W 4th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1M4 Canada
Review: theres always a wait so i was intrigued and decided to finally put my name down  try it small space inside but it wasnt stuffy at all service is okay they were really slammed with online orders all the way up to closing time the ramen was good but i think you could have the same experience somewhere else with less wait

Address: 838 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1W2 Canada
Review: i ordered various meals beer sake and also desserts everything was tasty also atmosphere was great too  just one thing the service was just fine compare to their reputation in robson area overall  all was satisfying

Address: 838 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1W2 Canada
Review: tasty udon  and yummy takoyaki  the whole restaurant feels like japan  but unfortunately the sashimi  isnt the freshest  however its still worth the price  and the best part is we didnt have to wait at all

Address: 838 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1W2 Canada
Review:
1 wonderful place to spend an evening
2 varieties of japanese cuisine
3 we had octopus fish items beer etc
4 hot and happening place
5 recommended for japanese cuisine dont expect sushi they dont have any

Address: 838 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1W2 Canada
Review: it has been a long while since my last visit guu original at thurlow simple menu with delectable choices the flesh of the grilled saba fish was a bit on the harder side good value for the set at 1380 very pleasant dinning experience

Address: 838 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1W2 Canada
Review: probably the best restaurant experience ive had in a while every dish we ordered was absolutely delicious but i particularly reccomend the kimchi udon deep fried fish cakes smoked salmon with onions and unagi over rice the atmosphere in the restaurant was on point and the service was very accommodating

Address: 216 Abbott Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2K8 Canada
Review: great food and atmosphere every dish is well executed the duck confit had a crispy skin and moist fall off the bone meat we also shared the escargot and calamari the escargot definitely stood out better

Address: 216 Abbott Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2K8 Canada
Review: since we couldnt go back to france this year we decided to try a little bit of france here this restaurant did not disappoint although not exact duplicates due to availability of frenchproduced ingredients we miss normandy butter it was still very good escargot was very good foie gras was good lobster bisque was excellent steak frites with peppercorn sauce was cooked perfectly service was excellent and the room was charming weve been to restaurants where dishes were instagramworthy but lacking in taste this restaurant focused on taste we will be back

Address: 216 Abbott Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2K8 Canada
Review: romantic and chic spot with amazing food  try the duck confit  local and fantastic music for happy hour  the wine selection is also fantastic  i also had the french onion soup which was great  the fresh rolls were flawless

Address: 216 Abbott Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2K8 Canada
Review: absolute hidden gem so cozy and warm inside and makes me feel like im a cute little bistro in paris happy hour dishes are amazing great value and delicious also ordered the prime rib burger and duck confit  a wee bit on the saltier side but still really good great wine selections too

Address: 216 Abbott Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2K8 Canada
Review:
if you happen to be in gastown vancouver this little bistro is worth visiting during its happy hour sessions which i think start at 1430 hrs the place exhibits a cozy feel service is soso food is acceptable but during happy hour  oh so affordable and worth it

for whatever we ordered which was 3 mains plus 1 x 6 oz white wine we paid less than cad5000 before tax

Address: 1329 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C6 Canada
Review: the food was mediocre  the baby octopus  was very rubbery  it retained it shape even after i chew it for 1 min  but the most annoying thing is the little flies flying around my table

Address: 1329 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C6 Canada
Review: i always order malatang here late at night the advantages of this place are delicious malatang and the most delicious tangsuyuksweetsour pork in vancouver i recommend malatang but sweet and sour pork is super good trust me but this store has a big drawback it takes a really long time to make food and often forget the ingredients and food i think there is not enough manpower because this restaurant is open even at dawn i think the overall quality will improve a lot if the shortage of people is covered

Address: 1329 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C6 Canada
Review: the tantan tonkotsu is literally the best thing ever on this menu i really wished they had it available during the daytime im not really a late night eater but also there was this lemon ginger pork too they had i really miss that was it removed from the menu

Address: 1329 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C6 Canada
Review: a place i found because i missed korean jjajangmyeon the conclusion was successful delicious food and friendly service the only regret i found was that the restaurant was a bit narrow

Address: 1329 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1C6 Canada
Review: malatang was nice it would be 4 stars if level 1  mild wasnt so spicy

Address: 656W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1G1 Canada
Review: stopped by for a late lunch and was not disappointed place was pretty empty so was sat right away menu had lots of tasty options but opted for the spicy beef fried rice food was pretty fast and very tasty i also ordered a mango frost off of the drink menu which turned out to not be a drink but a dessert it was super tasty and i want another one already now i want to try everything on the menu highly recommend

Address: 656W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1G1 Canada
Review:
my friend and i originally came here to try their new shaved ice menu and it didnt disappoint  we also may have gotten too excited in trying out their food that we ordered much more than we could eat but thats okay we got to take them home to eat the next day

price wise its reasonable if you think of how many servings these could feed so remember to bring friends to share the greatness of this place

if youd like to try an assortment of appetizers i do recommend their appetizer trio it has fish cake squid and their signature chicken nuggets it is a bit on the saltier side so beware of that for rice you cant go wrong with their spicy beef fried rice its packed with lots of meat and their meat is really soft and tasty their tiger prawn however is alright nothing too special about it in my opinion

for the two drinks we got theyre a bit disappointing the lychee tea mostly tasted like regular tea and it was quite diluted their nitro guava black tea was okay

Address: 656W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1G1 Canada
Review: food was ok drink was good not bad but no surprising flavors service was great  servers are friendly and helpful when recommending dishes clearing out dishes environment is good pretty clean and spacious would be a good place for a regular day comfort food lunch or dinner though price is kinda high for this type of food

Address: 656W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1G1 Canada
Review: as a taiwanese ive always enjoyed exploring taiwanese food the food is pretty authentic you can even find the street foodoyster pancakes  here that really surprised me but i find the food a bit pricey and the service wasnt really good but its still worth to try

Address: 656W Broadway Vancouver, BC V5Z 1G1 Canada
Review:
night out menu is great for january and february

the taiwanese food is very peppery pepper not spicy it was delicious and a good change to what i usually eat they also keep the food relevant so it doesnt get boring if you visit often i would recommend the restaurant is very popular for good reason we got a reservation but even then its still busy place is great for special occasions with friends or taking dates

the server said the chef and owner are still working on getting desserts on the menu that would be appreciated cross my fingers dessert is the only thing missing from this flawless menu

Address: 128-11782 River Road Richmond, BC V6X 1Z7 Canada
Review: the food was nice we enjoyed the meal the staff were super nice they prepared the food and send it upstairs by an elevator the biggest problem was that the dining area was filled with smoke which came from grilling in the kitchen i would try the food again but definitely for a take out the chicken was tasty and tender lahmajoun had a sour taste to it which was not bad but it was strong

Address: 128-11782 River Road Richmond, BC V6X 1Z7 Canada
Review:
the food and service here are absolutely fantastic the man who runs the place is always so kind and friendly and has a huge smile whenever i see him the food they made is fantastic the bread is super thin and crispy but also stretchy too the chicken was super moist and very flavourful as well

i have to say my favorite part though was the dessert the napolean cake is made with light crispy pastry layers surrounding layers of cloud like sweet cream its so good

lastly the food elevator is very novel and kind of fun

Address: 128-11782 River Road Richmond, BC V6X 1Z7 Canada
Review: oh man do yourselves a favour and come here the service was outstanding  super friendly warm and personable and all of our questions about the menu were patiently answered the food was great and very reasonably priced a super unassuming location with seating on the second floor a musttry and we will be returning whenever we are in the area

Address: 128-11782 River Road Richmond, BC V6X 1Z7 Canada
Review: delicious unpretentious armeniangeorgian restaurant tucked away in richmond happened upon it with some time to kill before flying and was pleasantly surprised loved the cheese pide i will be back

Address: 128-11782 River Road Richmond, BC V6X 1Z7 Canada
Review:
we ate here two years ago while traveling around bc and still say this was one of the most delicious meals weve ever had what a hidden gem 

youll never regret eating here

andrew  jo

posting now in 2023 but this review was from our visit in 2021 totally forgot to write a review back then

Address: 2149 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B3 Canada
Review:
it was our first with ethiopian cuisine and this restaurant ambience was the best giving a traditional touch in the way dishes were displayed

peanut soup tasted amazing platter portion had a little bit of everything for both veg and non veg they even offered choices of curries for the non veg platter where we could choose some of the dishes we liked as we do not consume beef

injera was highly sour in taste and not sure if that is how it usually tastes and that was the only traditional bread available the sour taste was not that appealing to few of us

the portion size is very small compared to price over all an okay experience

Address: 2149 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B3 Canada
Review: great taste and very authentic honey wine is not overly sweet and home made we had kitfo and shared a one persons chief special great times definitely my go to place for ethiopian food

Address: 2149 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B3 Canada
Review:
my friends and i recently had the opportunity to dine at harambe ethiopian restaurant and i must say it was a disappointing experience we had high hopes for this place but unfortunately we encountered a few issues that left me with a bad taste in my mouth quite literally

first and foremost the injera a traditional ethiopian flatbread was not up to par it had a rather unpleasant sour taste which took away from the overall enjoyment of the meal one of the spinach side dishes too was sour and i stayed away from a second helping of that dish

to make matters worse one of my friends found a fly in their drink attached is the picture of it this was not only unappetizing but also a major hygiene concern its unacceptable for a restaurant to serve beverages with insects in them and it definitely affected our dining experience worst part the waitress initially argued that it wasnt a fly until she saw it herself

but the most disturbing incident occurred when our waitress dipped her finger tip into our drink to scoop something out this was a complete breach of basic food handling practices and left us feeling extremely uncomfortable its essential for the staff to maintain proper hygiene standards and this incident was a glaring violation

given these experiences i regret to say that i would not consider returning to harambe ethiopian restaurant the issues we encountered were too significant to overlook and they greatly impacted our overall impression of the place i value cleanliness quality and attentive service when dining out and unfortunately this restaurant failed to meet these expectations

i hope the management of harambe ethiopian restaurant takes these concerns seriously and works towards improving their food quality and hygiene practices until then i would advise potential diners to exercise caution when considering this establishment for a meal

Address: 2149 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B3 Canada
Review: i love this restaurant especially the fish platter it melts on you tongue i also like their tea very much and that they displqy art on the walls i got inspired by it

Address: 2149 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5N 4B3 Canada
Review: my first time having ethiopian food the restaurant had good ambiance and bonus points for good lighting at the table service was friendly but not attentive  took multiple asks to get water and it was slow food was good i just dont think its my palette dumaskli soup was my favourite  a sweet soup with a little kick to it chefs choice combination platter for two people was a great way to sample different dishes i liked this the ye assa tibs fish reminded me of chinese fish dishes the injera is like a less mild sourdough made into a steamed tortilla with bread consistency  not my favourite but i believe its personal taste as my friends liked it our meal came to 93 after tips for 3 people

Address: 1032 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X6 Canada
Review:
our first time in vancouver bc and after a heavy days shopping we visited this restaurant having passed it earlier in the day for a quick drink we initially sat outside at street level only to be directed to the roof terrace accessed by a lift  this was a fortunate move for us that was well received

briefly a stunning roof terrace with the kitchen open to the seating area not much of a view but the cool vibe smooth fixtures and furniture and chilled sound track more than made up for this our drink quickly turned into a meal and several drinks the food was excellent and not as pricey as the surroundings would lead you to believe the waiting staff were as alert and attentive than any that i have encountered a lush experience i fully recommend a visit

Address: 1032 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X6 Canada
Review: i like the atmosphere here always good vibes around we tried dine out 2023 the appetizer i chose scallops and bacon i liked it the main steak i ordered as medium rare inside was perfect but bit overcooked outside for meit was hard the sauce was good as well the side i wish i had a more variety of salad thou the dessert cr√®me br√ªl√©e was bit sweet to me overall it was good but not the best this year

Address: 1032 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X6 Canada
Review: my girlfriend and i love this place we come here for happy hour and it has always been amazing the staff are friendly  make sure you make a reservation before coming in just to guaranty a spot

Address: 1032 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X6 Canada
Review: this is a cool place for sure but we went for happy hour and had better food in other places in vancouver for sure the mac and cheese bites were good but the wagyu brisket was over cooked overall it wasnt bad but def over priced for all the hype

Address: 1032 Alberni Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X6 Canada
Review:
dont go there it is full of mice last friday night july 21st my wife and i went to this restaurant for the first time and it turned out to be a disaster we were in the middle of our dinner when we spotted three mice running around on the floor yikes we couldnt believe our eyes
after we finished eating and paid the bill we told the manager whose name starts with p about the mice but guess what he acted like it was no big deal he said its totally normal to see mice in downtown restaurants and that were just not used to it because were from outside the downtown area like seriously

we expressed our concerns about the hygiene and how it could put peoples health at risk not to mention all the utensils food and table settings would be exposed to potential contamination but he just brushed us off and said its none of our business to ask about what theyre doing to address the issue can you believe the nerve

honestly we felt so grossed out and upset by the whole thing with his indifferent attitude we decided to get out of there as fast as we could its so disappointing to experience this in a supposedly fancy restaurant we wont be going back thats for sure this whole ordeal left us seriously questioning their quality and safety standards
reading other reviews it seems it has been more than a month and they took no actions for resolving it

Address: 775 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L6 Canada
Review:
i enjoyed the omakase here my favorites were the scallop the spot prawn any of the bluefin the sea urchin and the king salmon otoro

scallop from hotate
seabream
spot prawn shaoxing wine on top
golden eye snapper
tachiuo cutlass fish
nodoguroblack throat seaparch
katsuobonito
bluefin tuna chutoro
bluefin tuna slightly higher than chutoro but one step lower than otoro
king salmon otoro
sea urchin with fish roe from hokkaido
bluefin tuna negitoro

a bit pricey but would recommend its a small restaurant reservations is a must

Address: 775 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L6 Canada
Review: from the japanese minimalist interior to the thoughtfully orchestrated nigiri omakase menu tetsu sushi bar is an experience having you booking again and again

Address: 775 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L6 Canada
Review: an exceptional dinner experience thank you for the good service fresh ingredients and innovative creations will return in future

Address: 775 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L6 Canada
Review: awesome omakase dinner you can feel the real taste of fine japanese with good selection of sake the price is hiked with covid inflation 200p ends up 300p after adding specials  sake bottle not sure how to say on value these days as everything get hiked i enjoyed very much the special day dinner this small place only can take 4 groups about 10ppl total could talk pleasantly and quietly surrounded by modern classic guitar sound

Address: 775 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G 2L6 Canada
Review: one of my must visit restaurants during my visits to vancouver this place is hands down the best sushi place i discovered the place by accident wandering the east end looking for a sushi restaurant found this gem and have never looked back you can get some of the best imported seafood from japan along with fresh local wares but my favorite is probably the foie gras donbori they pair just enough rice and sauce to make it delicious down to the last grain of rice without diluting the aroma of the foie gras

Address: 2815 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G1 Canada
Review:
great mexican spot i wish it was more advertised

spotless restaurant and has friendly staff has a variety of options and vegetarian items

i tried the cheese quesadilla fish taco and nachos they were delicious i really enjoyed the taco bread  its freshly made and melts in the mouth

Address: 2815 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G1 Canada
Review: came here for a quick bite and realized that it was 15 mins before closing and despite that i was greated very warmly i had a vegan taco and it was flavored beautifully just needed a little fat in it like avocado the shrimp and pineapple tacos are from the gods

Address: 2815 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G1 Canada
Review: really enjoyed the house made corn tortillas super soft and light i really enjoyed my tacos

Address: 2815 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G1 Canada
Review:
this is a nice little spot chill good for a family or a couple the staff is very friendly and helpful i gave it a 4 because the lamb taco was not available today the other items we got however arrived quick were fresh and well made
definitely give them a try

Address: 2815 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5T 3G1 Canada
Review: highly recommended spot for burritos and tacos the portions here are incredibly generous i recommend trying their chicken mole and the lamb burritos the chicken mole is my absolute favourite and typical go to their burritos are packed full and the meats are super flavourful you cant go wrong with their tacos either 3 should be more than enough for one person based on the portion sizethis has definitely become one of my new favourite burrito and tacos places in vancouver

Address: 4250 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: long standing thai restaurant in the community their curry is creamy and flavourful and their tom yum soup is a must order its hard to find tom yum that is so bold with flavour and acidity pad see ew has been good too but might be on the slight saltier side service always has been great their hours is tough though as they only open for 4 hours daily now

Address: 4250 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: honestly this is the best thai food ive ever had my gf and i came in and every dish we ordered was phenomenal i personally dont know how anyone could give this place less than 5 stars great picks are oyster beef chicken saute green curry and pad pew

Address: 4250 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: hit it  one of my favorite thai places in the world the food here is very consistent and always delicious i love how its been family run since i started going here almost 10 years ago its hard to recommend anything on the menu because its all so good the only thing i would warn you is that it can get quite busy so make sure you make reservations

Address: 4250 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: all of the dishes are delicious and i highly recommend trying their braised pork and cauliflower for drinks the thaistyle milk tea is a musttry the prices are also very reasonable averaging around 1520 dollars per person and you can have a very filling meal plus you can also take some leftovers home with you

Address: 4250 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: i walked into this store by accident and found that this is the best thai restaurant i have ever been to they were very busy but the service was fast i ordered four dishes all of them were really good i strongly recommend the pineapple fried rice and the chi chi cocktail was amazing as well

Address: 1392 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5V 3E4 Canada
Review:
great vegetarian food  amazing flavour and texture in all the dishes that is pretty close to their nonvegetarian counterparts  definitely get the spring rolls coconut rice cakes and banh xeo for starters

service was attentive and quick while the atmosphere in the restaurant was fitting and chic

Address: 1392 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5V 3E4 Canada
Review:
first time
excellent service delicious foods and good price
moonsoo roll you need to try it fresh and delicious the pineapple sauce i wish i could have a bottle of it
the uncle hings wings very delicious
my friend had vegan prawn curry and i had lemongrass tofu very very tasty definitely recommend this place and i will go back

Address: 1392 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5V 3E4 Canada
Review:
reviewing as a meat eater i would eat this type of food regularly

curries were very fragrant spiced to perfection but like a few others noted slightly on the sweet side they also skimped on the fake meat id like to see a bit more fake shrimp

i didnt care for the crepe salad dish its dominated by greens and beans sprouts

appetizers like spring rolls and coconut rice things were good

seating is spacious i like that they dont cram diners into the row of booth seating

Address: 1392 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5V 3E4 Canada
Review: the food is truly impressive and i am not a vegetarian not even close we tried a variety of offerings and none of them disappointed if i dined alone i will start with the diakon cakes and have desert island noodles as the main i wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant

Address: 1392 Kingsway Vancouver, BC V5V 3E4 Canada
Review: its a vietnamese restaurant specializing in vegetarian food the meaning of the restaurant name do chay we had the vegetarian pho banh khot mini pancakes and banh tieu fried bread which was stuff with cooked young jackfruit the pho was pretty good and the mini pancakes were very rich in coconut cream a bit too much for my taste the banh tieu was ok kinda bland to me although my aunt really liked it i applaud the creativity

Address: 12 Water Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1A5 Canada
Review: their butter chikken was pretty good but i didnt really like the salad come with it mine friend got burger with fries and she enjoyed it the portion is perfect not too big so i can finish everything i would come back to try other dishes

Address: 12 Water Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1A5 Canada
Review: loved it im not vegan or vegetarian lover and didnt even knew its vegan place before visiting we ordered sweet spicy cauliflower thai noodly and burger everything tasted great if you are not found of sweet noodle skip the thai noodles it was good but had sweet taste also their ginger elixir is must have in cold weather besides that service and ambience is top notch give it a try and you will like it as much as i did

Address: 12 Water Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1A5 Canada
Review:
nice vibe in the restaurant trendy music and modern urban decoration is exactly where you want to come for a drink with friend or date night

i ordered fresh soup with sundries tomato  daily soup is different cheesy pesto spinach dip and thai noodle with tofu and veges i would definitely come again warm welcome and great service

Address: 12 Water Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1A5 Canada
Review:
we went to gastown location we are a vegetarian family and look for options when we visit places my daughter found this and i am so glad she did we had brunch  steak tostadas waffles sunshine benny and gnocchi all the items were delicious and drinks were very refreshing too not often you find so much variety and good quality vegetarianvegan food our server astrid think was very friendly too
highly recommended

Address: 12 Water Street Vancouver, BC V6B 1A5 Canada
Review:
the location is super appealing outdoor seating in like a covered courtyard kinda im not vegan but it makes it easy to find things for my partner and this place by far blew other locations we ate at in the area out of the water

dont knock vegan food until you try it

Address: 1517 Anderson St Vancouver, BC V6H Canada
Review:
our server was fantastic  gabrielle
the reception lady was rather indifferent

nice atmosphere  do sit outside on a sunday day feel the vibes they get happy hour  limited choices on selected drink and food

order some oysters  quite small in size but sweet

Address: 1517 Anderson St Vancouver, BC V6H Canada
Review: its my first time dinning in here  our server brenna was quick and attentive  food tasted great  drinks tasted great  my son and i enjoyed our time together  the only dissatisfaction i have was the portion size  it was on the smaller size for the price i paid

Address: 1517 Anderson St Vancouver, BC V6H Canada
Review:
a swish yet casual restaurant next to a marina it was a good choice for chilling out with friends on the patio while catching the early evening sun there are blinds to shade you if its in your eyes

the fish and chips were excellent with top notch presentation and taste a friend had a dozen oysters and was pleased with them

it was quite busy and that gave the restaurant a buzzy atmosphere helped along by the happy hour drinks

service was quick efficient and formulaic

overall  a very nice way to spend a couple of hours in the evening

Address: 1517 Anderson St Vancouver, BC V6H Canada
Review: the service was very good our server was great   attention to detail the food was delicious  oysters were okay halibut was very moist my seafood linguine was fair  overall it was a nice dining experience

Address: 1517 Anderson St Vancouver, BC V6H Canada
Review:
went there after a few years has a nice patio with good service everything tasted fine scallops were a bit over priced 42 for a dish with 5 scallops
happy hour beer and wine is a great deal

Address: 820 Burrard St Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X9 Canada
Review:
we stopped by joey burrard for a quick bite to eat on a sunday we were seated on the patio right away
we ordered an ahi tuna club salmon substitute and a lettuce wrap with chicken the salmon club was pretty good
so was the lettuce wrap however there was no peanuts in the mix for the lettuce wrap not even one
service was amazing i wish i had asked our servers name he was attentive helpful and professional

Address: 820 Burrard St Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X9 Canada
Review: one of favorite places to come for celebration dinners and weve been to most of their locations in the lower mainland  our menu favorites include the sliders for the starters menu chicken katsu salad and the lava cake  a really nice touch was that when starters or desserts were ordered to share between 2 they plated the portions separately best for small groups of 46  although we made our recent reservation well in advance  confirmed details over the phone several times our party of 9 was seated at a booth which seats 45 comfortably with a table pushed up to it for 3 more only when paying the bill was i informed by our server theres another space by the wine bar groups can request

Address: 820 Burrard St Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X9 Canada
Review: nice presentation and tasty food beside relaxing place for a afternoon chitchat love my drink the tofu wrap was incredible although was difficult to manage hahahah our server was nice and made ever minute more enjoyable  if i m not mistaken her name was brook

Address: 820 Burrard St Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X9 Canada
Review:
this was our first time here and it was amazing  we started off with a crunchy potato roll that the waiter recommended and it was delicious and unique

i got the steak  sushi dish  the steak was so tendy and flavorful and the sushi was delicious  my husband got the steak frites and loved the steak and entire dish

the waiter was also very friendly the atmosphere was cozy and the prices were fair  we had no complaints and would definitely recommend this place

Address: 820 Burrard St Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X9 Canada
Review: im not a fan of chain restaurants however joey is the exception  id never been to this restaurant  i was not disappointed fabulous food i had the mediterranean bowl exceptional service and a cozy booth  my other 3 friends loved their meals too  the joey 75 champagne cocktail was so good i took a picture of the ingredients to replicate it at home thanks joey

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review: i ordered a flat white and it was the best coffee ive had so far the food is tasty and the raspberry tart is nice staff are so friendly the cafe is small but it still could cater for around 14 people its a very nice place to have a lunch and coffee in a cozy afternoon

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review:
today i visited them for the 4th time since they had opened the place and was quite disappointed with the menu and taste they used to have smoked salmon with scrambled egg croque madame french toast  but none of those existed on the menu this time
we got the fig and prosciutto and the eggs benedict with bacon both had basic taste the fig and parma ham definitely needed a sauce to tie them together the poached egg was broken
also you would see these comments in the store and on the menu a lot politely decline to warm pastries politely decline to  make any changes to the menu item politely decline to let you seat anywhere if you only order drinks and pastries they wont even replace fried egg on the menu with scrambled eggs
i get that the chef probably takes a lot of pride in designing and changing the menu often but if they continue doing so and removing their popular item they will be closing in a few years
outside area only has one umbrella and the photos ive attached show how empty the place is at around 1pm on a saturday
i remember that you used to wait for sometime to get a table in the past but the degradation in food quality has caused the place to be quite empty

their pastries are still good we had the fig danish and it was delicious

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review: the brunch here is exceptional without a doubt the hollandaise sauce is the finest ive ever tasted the ambiance is simply delightful reminiscent of the beautiful southern region of france furthermore the staff are incredibly kind and hospitable if youre in vancouver you simply must come here this is a charming location to enjoy sunday brunch the quality of the ingredients is excellent and the washroom is beautifully designed despite the focus on french cuisine there are also vegan choices available

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review:
mon pitou is perfection the ambience is so carefully thought out and fun the coffee is spectacular and full of flavor and the food is outstanding you really cant ask for more vancouver is lucky to have a french cafe of this quality

i got the ham and cheese danish and a cortado and couldnt have been more pleased cant wait to come back to try more things the music and atmosphere is so relaxing

Address: 1387 W 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6H 1B8 Canada
Review: the food is always fantastic and the staff are so great my husband and i often stop by for their breakfast sandwiches but their actual brunch is really good pricey but all brunch places are getting to be pricier these days so it isnt really surprising or unexpected  my only complaint is that it feels a bit cramped when it gets busy but it cant be helped given the constraints of the location

Address: 801 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6C 1P7 Canada
Review: we ordered the 3course lunch menu extremely small portion which reflects on price elegant presentation delicate taste attentive service overall a good place for business networking lunch or friends get together will likely visit again

Address: 801 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6C 1P7 Canada
Review: food was amazing service was great as well although my table wasnt ready and had to wait at the lounge for about 10 15 minutes not a big deal what bothered me was the atmosphere and ambiance of the restaurant it was loud noisy huge table of 10 sitting by tables of 2s last time i was here was more than 8 years ago but i remembered it as more intimateromantice atmosphere but nonetheless food was delicious

Address: 801 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6C 1P7 Canada
Review:
i always have a great time here food tasted delicious as usual drinks are very yummy service always top notch

the taste of hawksworth is a rotating 3 course menu delish as usual

Address: 801 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6C 1P7 Canada
Review: hawksworth restaurant used to be one of our goto dining establishments it boasts a luxurious decor and is conveniently located on the ground floor of my beloved rosewood hotel the prime location and impeccable service contribute to a memorable dining experience however it is regrettable that the menu options have become somewhat conventional and lack innovation in recent times

Address: 801 W Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6C 1P7 Canada
Review: an enjoyable experience with tasty food our server quinn provided phenomenal service during our visit the fried cauliflower appetizer was a delight to eat and their flat iron steak was well presented with plenty of flavour well come back in the future

Address: 401-999 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
i was here celebrating mothers day on the weekend  we made the right decision to come one week before otherwise we wouldnt have been seated by the window

the view of coal harbour and the snow topped mountains were incomparable and serene  the ambiance and decor was also excellent

our server was attentive and welcoming

we ordered the 65 pp high tea service which came with a small selection of tea  certain choices required additional cost we also ordered a la cart caviar  the variety and portions of food was perfect  we even had left overs

i wouldve given 5 stars if the tea selection was larger

overall id recommend visiting this restaurant and would definitely come back for other special occasions

Address: 401-999 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
five sails is one of the best fine dining places in vancouver dining here will be an unforgettable event you enjoy  the exceptional waterfront views and the beauty of sunset the menu is exquisite with unique options of duck several kinds of fish and steak every dish is unique and pairing with drinks and wine is perfect

the staff is brilliantly charming and lovely we had our server who is a student at ubc doing her masters you cannot find this kind of experienced and professional staff anywhere else we were offered an experience of devils coffeeonly two people know how to make it and one of them is here at five sails check out the video of how he makes coffee that you have never heard of or tried before will cherish this coffee taste forever

10 out of 10 for this fine dining place  for experience staff and unique menu

Address: 401-999 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: we went to five sails to celebrate our 3rd year anniversary our table was ready as soon as we arrived and the hostess accommodated my reservation requests and gave us a great table with the most amazing view of the harbour shawn was our waiter who was very friendly and attentive all evening shawn went above and beyond to make sure we both had a memorable anniversary they surprised us at the end with a happy anniversary dessert i would highly recommend five sails

Address: 401-999 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: had a birthday celebration and opted for the dine out vancouver 2023 menu and it was fantastic the view was spectacular the ambience at lunch was sophisticated and relaxing the entire service team was top notch the food was amazing flavour texture presentation was done to perfection it was such a happy experience and five sails topped it off with a complimentary birthday honey cake that was so delicious and cute thank you for the great time we will be back

Address: 401-999 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
we went to five sails for dinner first time at five sails my girlfriend has a number of food allergies and the restaurant was very very very accommodating food was great atmosphere was very pleasant
best of all was our server raymond he was incredibly attentive and a gentleman he was literally the best server ive ever had to deal with in vancouver
we both really enjoyed the restaurant we will definitely go back again

Address: G3-888 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2H1 Canada
Review: ive heard amazing things about this place and im happy i was able to expect it myself the service was excellent i have a food intolerance and the servers handled it so well making sure to tell us which plates i needed to avoid the food was really tasty i liked how clean the restaurant is considering each table has its own grill built in that grill definitely gets hot so make sure youre dressed in something short sleeve or youll be sweating up a storm  ill dine here again for sure thank you

Address: G3-888 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2H1 Canada
Review:
the restaurants ambience is inviting and offers an unparalleled dining experience with a contemporary japanese aesthetic its a truly nice place to dine

the quality of the meats whether flavorful beef marinated chicken or seasoned seafood are exceptional the diy cooking approach adds a unique interactive touch making the experience fun

their vegetarian options and variety of side dishes are really great garlic spinach steamed broccoli mushrooms spicy cabbage salad and more

the staff were attentive and so helpful but i had an expert with me who made the experience more tasty 
they helped us with the grill on the spot changed the surface from time to time theyre amazing

Address: G3-888 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2H1 Canada
Review: first time there  will be returning  very friendly  efficient staff who welcome all the guests as they walk to their table clean tables  grills they change the grill part way through the meal we had the value course and it was enough for the 2 of us meats are fresh and bright vegetables are fresh and crisp  rice is a good consistency and each person gets their own bowl salad was fresh and crisp i would like the large leafs cut smaller but it stays crisper with the big leafs tasty dressing  they gave us complimentary ice cream with delicious chocolate sauce for being 1st time guests overall anexcellent experience

Address: G3-888 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2H1 Canada
Review:
the food was great the marinated meats were full of flavour without the need for the sauces but were a bit too salty for us i liked the enoki mushroom and garlic mushroom more than the assorted vegetables which were plain except the corn

the service was decent the server constantly walked by she liked to adjust the heat setting on our grill but after most of the first batch of pork belly went burnt in the first two minutes the grill guide said 35 minutes we would readjust the heat after she left i understand that the suggestion of longer cooking times is to prevent food borne illnesses

the kitchen and the rest of the restaurant were playing different music we could hear both from where we sat it was noisy and eventually got annoying even if i liked both music tracks for example the kitchen was playing bruno marss locked out of heaven while the other side was playing whitney houstons i will always love you

all in all i liked the food and our servers attitude and attentiveness but not so much the ambiance and the indoor dining environment they do have an outdoor eating area

Address: G3-888 Nelson Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2H1 Canada
Review: the food and service are fantastic here the portions are big and the quality of the meat is amazing  its such great value especially if you go during happy hour i recommend the kalbi beef and toro beef as well as the garlic noodles and cold tofu with kimchi

Address: 108 Cambie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2M8 Canada
Review:
while visiting vancouver in 2018 we stopped at the corner of water street  cambie and the gastown steam clock after taking some of the usual tourist photos  waiting for the steam to blow the whistle we found our way to the black frog eatery settling in at 1 pm we were warmly welcomed and quickly seated from our table we had an excellent view of the steam clock i watched tourists posing with the clock as we awaited our order

we werent very hungry and decided to share a club sandwich  im happy to say that it was made with real meatnone of that sliced processed poultry  the fries were good too and i washed it all down with a local awardwinning kokanee lager

the ambiance of the black frog is definitely that of a pubstyle eatery and the decor accentuates that feel  thats a good thing and to me very comforting lots of wood brick and pubstyle elements all around this is absolutely the type of place id have lunch at if id worked in the area  their menu has a good selection to satisfy everyones tastes prices are on par with other restaurants offering similar fare  the type of place that i call no nonsense and basic good eating service was prompt efficient and the staff knew their menu well when we find our way back to vancouver i will certainly plan on coming back

Address: 108 Cambie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2M8 Canada
Review:
delicious food with reasonable price and excellent customer service i would recommend trying their buffalo cauliflower i dont drink so didnt check out their beverage menu
you can have steam clock view from patio

Address: 108 Cambie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2M8 Canada
Review: amazing spot great owner great people the food is wonderful and beers are flowin just right make sure to stop in and get the poutine and creepy uncle dunkle i love this place right by the steam clock too

Address: 108 Cambie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2M8 Canada
Review: a cute spot right near the steamclock reasonably priced but mediocre food staff was nice and friendly and the atmosphere was cool and welcoming enjoyed what we ordered but nothing to write home about a good spot for a quick meal

Address: 108 Cambie Street Vancouver, BC V6B 2M8 Canada
Review: wow found the black frog tucked away behind the steam clock in gas town after a stop at a few other establishments with 10 hours to kill waiting for a flight  amazing staff and customer service and a great atmosphere with all the right options on the drink and food menu    thanks to the owner and the great staff nemo sally and taylor for making me feel welcome from the start  i only wish i found it earlier it would have saved me on my quest for a super cool place to hang and waste away an afternoon in vancouver   i will be back

Address: 580 West Pender Downtown Vancouver, BC V6B 1W7 Canada
Review: place is very accommodating good happy hour menudaily fr 36pm hey buckaroo is a refreshing drinks fried chicken poutine is another good appie and red wine is okv 650 for 6oz good deal for drinks and appetizer service is very nice place is clean and very trendy and very relaxing music  and lighting is very chillaxing will be my to go to for chillin

Address: 580 West Pender Downtown Vancouver, BC V6B 1W7 Canada
Review: stopped by this place for dinner with a few friends and thoroughly enjoyed our time here the food was really delicious and the staff were quite wonderful

Address: 580 West Pender Downtown Vancouver, BC V6B 1W7 Canada
Review: the customer service was super slow our server seemed like she was in a bad mood the food took too long to arrive even though it wasnt busy at all i had to go to the front desk to ask for the bill after waiting for half an hour because our server kept ignoring us wont be coming back food was good but the dessert tasted so bad

Address: 580 West Pender Downtown Vancouver, BC V6B 1W7 Canada
Review:
the beer list is long and accessible by a qr code on the menu  its extensive and a bit daunting but the waiter was very helpful when i told him what i dont like

ahi tuna salad is great  good tuna that has been just cooked to perfection

Address: 580 West Pender Downtown Vancouver, BC V6B 1W7 Canada
Review: i had tacos they were spicy very delicious though  my brother had potato skins and caesar salad he enjoyed both my sister in law had the beef dip and said it was delicious

Address: 938 Helmcken Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S5 Canada
Review:
i was very excited to try this place as many of you know they have a strong social media marketing team showing off their delicious noodles and soups
