i had the tom yum seafood noodles pictured below and the price came out to 2777 including a 15 tip the flavor was certainly above average and the waitstaff was very friendly and accommodating i would say value is a bit of a weakness here as the meal was rather light and i noticed the soup in the bowls were not filled all the way might seem like a small thing but it felt like the soup proportion was off throughout the meal

tip if you dont know your noodles ask the waitstaff they have you customize your noodles for almost all the soup options but some noodles are more suitable than others for certain types of broth

overall solid 4 stars not the best but certainly good

Address: 938 Helmcken Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S5 Canada
Review: wow what a lovely discovery this place is i enjoyed my khai soi chicken so much i could have licked the bowl so tasty we got there in the nick of time because as we were leaving there was a small line up waiting to get in to the cozy restaurant

Address: 938 Helmcken Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S5 Canada
Review:
awesome place for a bowl of noodles wish we had a fat mao in toronto i ordered the braised beef bowl which was delicious our table also got the tuna ceviche and the roti curry appetizer which were both very good

all four of us were very happy with our meals the wonton egg noodles are really good here i will say this restaurant is definitely more on the pricey side as just a bowl of noodles is 23 but it was very good

it is also a little bit of a smaller restaurant not really the most accommodating for larger groups would recommend it for pairs though

Address: 938 Helmcken Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S5 Canada
Review: stopped by this place for dinner with friends we ordered tom yum goong  khao soi chicken currythai ice tea and roti with curry the food was ok but for the price of small portions  they are kinda over priced  the thai ice tea is plain  not recommended

Address: 938 Helmcken Street Vancouver, BC V6Z 2S5 Canada
Review:
this is absolutely an authentic place for thai noodles at first my thai boyfriend was shocked to know they serve thai food here because it seemed to be more of a chinese restaurant from the outside look interior decor was on point perfect with the giant mirror but the light was pretty weak to have a good picture here the space is kind of small not that many tables so if you come at lunch or dinner time you might have to wait in a line last time when we came we waited for around 15 minutes but the food was worth it
we ordered khao soi and braised beef noodles khao soi was well seasoned creamy and savory sweet enough braised beef noodles tasted okay but not that impressive as i expected
service was great most of the servers were thai they had great english i like their welcoming and helpful attitude
my boyfriend is really picky towards thai food but he totally approved this place
however the price is a bit high i feel like it is a bit overpriced
worth a comeback

Address: 217 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z6 Canada
Review:
i visited fat mao today and was pleased with my experience

we started off with the roti and the mapo tofu and both dishes were bangers then i slurped down the hot and sour pork bowl with shanghai noodles and it was perfect
i am very happy with my experience and totally look forward to visiting again
star of the show might have been the 5 roti sooooo good

Address: 217 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z6 Canada
Review:
come hungry but dont wear white amazing food with even better portion sizes

staff are extremely friendly and even gave me a tide stain stick when i couldnt keep the food off my shirt

if youre a tourist in china town its a definite must stop

Address: 217 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z6 Canada
Review: fat mao noodles nestled in the heart of chinatown vancouver is an unmissable culinary gem the star of my recent visit was undoubtedly their signature chicken noodles accompanied with thick luscious shanghai wide noodles the broth was a symphony of flavors masterfully balanced and seasoned leaving a rich and savory imprint on the palate its taste was enveloping and satisfying a testament to fat maos nuanced understanding of noodle artistry equally impressive was the thousand year egg appetiser a dish that was fascinatingly complex and yet astoundingly straightforward its texture the harmony of flavors everything was an elegant dance that added depth to the overall culinary narrative the exceptional service was the icing on the cake making the dining experience as delightful as the food itself fat mao noodles unquestionably excels in delivering an authentic and satisfying noodle experience that is worth every moment spent there this is a destination that proves time and again the transformative power of food when crafted with precision and passion highly recommended

Address: 217 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z6 Canada
Review: small holeinthewall shop with fast and friendly service i made the mistake of snacking before coming here thinking id be fine and it wouldnt be that much food anyways wrong come here hungry the food is packed with flavor and is served fresh seating is pretty limited so be careful if you have a big party or if you see that its super busy i feel bad because i couldnt finish my food nor take it to go since my lodging doesnt have a place for me to store it i need to come here once more before i fly back home for sure

Address: 217 E Georgia Street Vancouver, BC V6A 1Z6 Canada
Review:
55 service  our server very friendly never let us run out of water and took the time to tell us all about their dishes and the history of the restaurant

55 food  we ordered the spicy boat noodles quite spicy but not to the point where it takes away from the flavour like i said its all about the broth its phenomenal

355 vibe  not really coming here for the vibe though youre coming here to get a masterfully well balanced bowl of noodles

Address: 903 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L Canada
Review: i tried the soup and it had a great balance of sourness and spiciness the pork in the was tender and juicy and the soup portion size was a little small for my liking the sauce had a bit of a kick which some people may find too spicy but i thought it added a nice flavor to the dish the fried rice was also good but i found the sauce to be a little too salty overall i recommend pairing the meal with some water or tea to balance out the flavors

Address: 903 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L Canada
Review: kin kao offers a modern and inviting atmosphere where you can indulge in a remarkable culinary experience their menu features standout dishes such as the flavorful pad see ew refreshing papaya salad succulent pork neck and an array of delicious stirfried options each dish is prepared with care and expertise showcasing a harmonious blend of flavors and highquality ingredients from the moment you step into kin kao you are transported to a world of delectable thai cuisine leaving you craving more of their exceptional offerings

Address: 903 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L Canada
Review: there are two restaurants kin kao song on commercial drive is the test kitchen and seating is firstcomefirstserve song on broadway is the one that requires reservations i had initially made a mistake by making the reservation at song which i thought was kin kao after checking the menu one day prior to the actual meal i realized that song did not have some of the menu items i had intended to try fortunately i was able to cancel my reservation in time we were the first to arrive at kin kao on commercial drive  just to make sure we can get a table since i have garlic allergies there were only specific items we can order we were able to request no garlic for the green papaya salad the chicken satay does not have garlic in the ingredients we really wanted fish instead of beef so we selected grilled fish even though it was marinated with garlic for carbs we ordered sticky rice the green papaya was very aggressive i had a hard time finishing this dish as the dressing was so strong i did not enjoy the fight the chicken satay was very tender we both liked the texture of the grilled fish and did not detect the garlic emboldened by that i ordered a small portion of chicken wings as i was really craving it plus i am not a chicken breast person that was a mistake although the flavour of the chicken wings was interesting i liked the crispiness and the fact that it was not flourdipped the garlic left a disgustingly strong taste in my mouth that i had to live with all night although i cold have used some chocolate ice cream to remove the flavour i did not trust my body to be able to endure the garlic so we rushed home without stopping for chocolate ice cream we really enjoyed the sticky rice though overall this place has a more interesting menu than most of the thai place weve been to the execution was more creative and fusion next time though i will be sure to selecting items that we not marinated in garlic

Address: 903 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L Canada
Review:
enjoyed a fantastic meal at kin kao  one of the most authentic and best thai restaurants in vancouver the quality of the food is beyond our expectations  it always spicy umami and delightful flavours

portion wise the restaurant was vaso ery generous  tnbend to wife  service impeccable we ordered a spread of green papaya salad pork jowl skewers chicken satay thai crispy pork belly drunken noodles thai red curry thai fermented sausage and iconic mango sticky rice we were so stuff after the meal

Address: 903 Commercial Drive Vancouver, BC V5L Canada
Review:
cozy spot really enjoyed the papaya salad and the satay as well as the pad see ew

would love to come back and try the cocktails next time

Address: 88 W Pender Street Unit 1005 Vancouver, BC V6B 6N8 Canada
Review:
great food great service
amazing options for vegans
we took vegan lasagna and vegan burrito it was very tasty

Address: 88 W Pender Street Unit 1005 Vancouver, BC V6B 6N8 Canada
Review: ive been waiting to try this place for months and it didnt disappoint so many gluten free keto options i couldnt pick just one super chill staff cant wait to explore the savory dishes must try this place

Address: 88 W Pender Street Unit 1005 Vancouver, BC V6B 6N8 Canada
Review: we have been coming here for years always refreshing with quality ingredients the owners are genuinely nice people and their staff too thankful for this healthy eating gem

Address: 88 W Pender Street Unit 1005 Vancouver, BC V6B 6N8 Canada
Review:
we ordered 4 dishes
1 ordered the beet salad which had a picture that showed mostly beets with some cheese and lettuce however the item i received was a lot of lettuce with a small amount of beets the taste was fairly bland i would rate the salad a 67 out of 10

2 my 8 year old order the personal pizza the cheese and sauce was delicious but the crust was very different and not good

3 my husband ordered the butter chicken it was a large amount of food but the taste was average he rated it an 8 out of 10

4 my 15 year ordered the hamburger and loved it she gave it a 9 out of 10

it wasnt too busy on a sunday afternoon and we found a place to sit inside with no problem however its not the nicest place in terms of decor and vibe

Address: 88 W Pender Street Unit 1005 Vancouver, BC V6B 6N8 Canada
Review:
this place left a very good impression on me at first i thought it was just a keto restaurant but there are also nonketo options and plenty of choices for vegan and gf diets i dont follow any of these diets but the person taking my order made sure that i was aware of everything in my order in case i needed to know he was super friendly i went back and forth on whether i wanted hummus in my platter and apologized for being indecisive and he just laughed it off with me
i had a tandoori jackfruit feast platter the feast platters are very customizable you can choose your protein sauces type of rice basmati or cauliflower the veggies you want in your salad and if you want to add any hummus andor tzatziki dip i was super happy with the platter i built the tandoori sauce was as flavourful as i hoped for and pretty spicy but that mightve just been the jalape√±os i added and the cooling tzatziki went really well with it it was also very filling
for dessert i tried the keto new york cheesecake mixed experience with this the cheesecake had a very light texture similar to some nobake cheesecakes but with the fullbodied tangy flavour of a baked cheesecake and i really liked how unique it was but i think it was frozen in the middle and the biscuit crust was a little dry in a freezerburnt way there was a dollop of what looked like whipped cream on top but tasted like and had the thickness of butter which i had to discard because it was too rich for me and didnt have any flavour to contribute
i asked about decaf coffeeespresso when i ordered and they dont carry it but tea was suggested as an alternative so i ordered a green tea the bag wasnt labelled but it tasted like a sencha which is one of my favourites
order and pay at the counter and the food is brought to your table space is a little tight in the cafe but its kind of cozy and i found the atmosphere to be welcoming

Address: 1118 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N1 Canada
Review: super respectful and friendly staff food is pretty good not the best mexican food i had tho 3 stars is mainly for the price 6 tacos and a soup ended up being 50 bucks thats not great value for a inandout place

Address: 1118 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N1 Canada
Review:
visiting from winnipeg  first time
at this taqueria to be honestit was okay i wish they put cilantro and onions to enhance flavours and provided hot sauce salsa verde etc tacos were bland and small 4 small tacos for 15 was kinda steep in winnipeg we can get 3 tacos for 57 and even 3 quesadillas for 8 at bmc taqueria

Address: 1118 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N1 Canada
Review: the shop itself is basic but i got tacos al pastor and they were amazing the tortillas were smaller but they were doubled up and didnt rip which is very important for me there were too many fillings for these smaller tortillas but picking at the fallen fillings afterwards was a second meal in itself

Address: 1118 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N1 Canada
Review: great vibe and amazing food that came so quick the perfect lil place on davie street

Address: 1118 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N1 Canada
Review: staff was great service was fast food was delicious the kids enjoyed the cheese quesadilla it was huge we all devoured our tacos the lengua beef tongue was my favourite it was so flavourful my husbands favourite was the chicken pastor the onions cilantro and sauce make for the perfect bite the meal for the 5 of us came to just over 70  we all left very full  we love the location as well you get to sit inside and people watch or sit at their outside street patio now that it is summer they should add some umbrellas to their outdoor seating to make it more comfortable under the sun  it is definitely our favourite new restaurant in our neighbourhood

Address: 1551 West 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1S1 Canada
Review: absolutely delicious food everything we tried was amazing mussels and frites asparagusvegetable soup salmon omelette and the baguette is fresh service was attentive and professional highly recommend

Address: 1551 West 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1S1 Canada
Review: the real deal authentic fresh french food i had a great experience it felt like traveling to france without the airfare expense attentive and friendly service the escargots were the best ones i ever had even the french fries are made in house the wine by the glass is spot on what i need bon appetit

Address: 1551 West 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1S1 Canada
Review: we came here on a sunny warm saturday afternoon for brunch this is our favourite french restaurant in town the service and food was excellent as it always was we had spinach and crab benny croissant benny with lobster meat and mussels with fries

Address: 1551 West 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1S1 Canada
Review: i finally found my type of french restaurant  there is more creativity and quality in the food than in some fine french restaurants i liked the french atmosphere as well the servers were friendly and helpful

Address: 1551 West 7th Avenue Vancouver, BC V6J 1S1 Canada
Review: ordered a set dinner consisting of a salad seafood trio with salmon halibut and scallops and cheese cake dessert plus a regular order of mussels and escargots the regular size of mussels was more than the two of us could finish and tasted fresh whereas the escargot was disappointing as it tasted same as the ones from a can received excellent service from our japanese waitress

Address: 3416 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6R 2B3 Canada
Review: i usually go to the lougheed location and this is the first time i came to kitsilano the restaurant is small so the wait is long to get seated to order and to get food service is not the best as they seemed under staffed because we were out of water but there was no refill several times food was delicious when it arrived just hopefully not after almost 30min of ordering next time

Address: 3416 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6R 2B3 Canada
Review: we ordered some from delivery before this time was our first time to have oshi at their restaurant this time the sushi rice was not as good as what we expected even the flavor was really good except that everything was perfect and all servers there were friendly and helpful

Address: 3416 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6R 2B3 Canada
Review: small but comfortable setting clean great staff ask for james food is awesomeauthentic japanese cuisine try the snapper tempura comes with delicious greens fresh sushi and best aburis in town you will not be disappointed and also get your value for money

Address: 3416 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6R 2B3 Canada
Review: we got 4 rolls and sashimi the scallop and salmon rolls were great solid aburi rolls if youre looking for a solid veggie option the eggplant roll was great food is definitely a little expensive as it was over 100 including tip for two people to dine

Address: 3416 W Broadway Vancouver, BC V6R 2B3 Canada
Review: this was really good the sushi was not what i was expecting but it was scrumptious before this id never had oshi style sushi and i was pleasantly surprised it was very different than what ive had before at local sushi restaurants but it was great i especially loved the crispy roll we got the green leafamily for 3 combo and it was super tasty the miso soup was perfect as well  not too salty overall great place

Address: 4328 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: came here from ontario for the first time and let me tell you this place was amazing from the service to the food to the atmosphere it was amazing special thanks to one of the chefs ian for recommending some pretty incredible eats will definitely be back

Address: 4328 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review:
we ordered beef and arctic char as entr√©e and caramelized onion tart and halloumi french toast as starters absolutely fantastic food
we finished everything on the plates and were way too full to have deserts

Address: 4328 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review:
came here tonight  highly recommend you make reservations so that you have a table when you arrive we ordered the duck and lamp mains  i can confidently say we were impressed with the quality of food

one thing that was a bit odd was that the staff came over and said they need the table in the next 15 hours not a big deal but the food came out slow  by the time it arrived we only had 45 min to eat  i didnt really enjoy the feeling of being rushed to eat and leave  other than that the food and drinks was good

Address: 4328 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: do not miss out on the halloumi french toast crab fried rice and cannelloni fast efficient super friendly service

Address: 4328 Main Street Vancouver, BC V5V 3P9 Canada
Review: i would begin by saying that the experience is mindblowing the soup of the day and not to mention the french toast which was my favourite immediately raised our expectations for the rest of the meals the seared scallop was delicious and light i like how the rice that came with it has a lot of veggies and a spark of spiciness and juiciness when bit into the pork belly was cooked so well that it was crispy and the fat just melted in my mouth like a dream it will take too long to describe every dish but every dish didnt disappoint and this is the type of food that you could feel the chefs ingenuity and creativity we were really pleased it is a rather small restaurant but definitely a hidden gem

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review: i visited this restaurant several times already and i really like the food and drinks they serve and the service provided in this place the interior is very modern and nice so if you are interested to taste a ukrainian food prepared with some modern flavour then this is one of the best places to go in vancouver  you can also purchase some very nice bread and home made cookies there as well

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review:
this is the perfect place to go to have a nice dinner with friends the restaurant is busy but not too full reservations available the staff are quite friendly the food is very pleasant and the atmosphere is comfortable

we had the chicken kyiv and cabbage rolls the rolls were juicy and stoodout most

the real showstopper was the bakery so fresh and delicious we really enjoyed the double chocolate chip cookie the pistachio chocolate chip cookie and the babka dark chocolate slice absolutely delightful we will get the full babka loaf for a family special occasion

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review: delicious food and very attentive employees my family and i had a wonderful experience trying the diffrent ukrainian foods they had to offer i would totally recommend the beet salad and the mushroom  chicken crepes overall it was a great experience

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review:
a fantastic restaurant genuine european food good selection of beers and wine fantastic cocktails  they have a bakery onsite and delicious cakes

great area with irish pubs and bars nearby and a very stylish interior

highly recommended  i visited twice

Address: 1 W Cordova Street Vancouver, BC V6C 3N8 Canada
Review:
the food was extremely delicious we usually make gulash at home but always wanted to try borsch and it was fantastic

rita our waitress was very nice and attentive service was excellent and fast

the desserts are to die for

you must try it you wont be dissapointed

Address: 1130 West pender st Vancouver, BC V6E 4A4 Canada
Review:
small place for indian food 3 mins walk from marriott pinnacle downtown nice little buffer and a la carte is available
we tried out aloo samosa and chai enjoyed it ample seating area

Address: 1130 West pender st Vancouver, BC V6E 4A4 Canada
Review:
i recently dined at indian delicacy restaurant conveniently located near pinnacle harbourfront vancouver i was in the mood for some flavorful and authentic indian cuisine and this restaurant did not disappoint

the menu at indian delicacy restaurant offers a wide range of dishes including vegetarian and nonvegetarian options

overall i would recommend indian delicacy restaurant to anyone looking for tasty and authentic indian cuisine in vancouver the food is excellent the service is friendly and the location near the pinnacle harbourfront vancouver makes it a convenient spot for visitors to the city thank you to the staff for a great dining experience

Address: 1130 West pender st Vancouver, BC V6E 4A4 Canada
Review:
i spent the day in downtown vancouver and was happy to find this restaurant hidden away from the main street down a narrow path at the side is a hi rise people please if you like indian  please  please go here  its deliciousid travel 17 hrs all the way from saskatchewan again to taste more of the items on their menu we were there for lunch and needed to be in and out so had the buffet standard dishes as in most restaurants but they come out on top for quality and taste and one one more thing that no other restaurant in down town vancouver can touch and that was the price 20 lunch buffet  can you imagine that  think about it people average parking lot in downtown van is 1625 for the time you need to run around and do your business value for your cash is definitely there go enjoy you wont be disappointed except you picky people you cant be helped lol
leonardo s saskatoon sk

Address: 1130 West pender st Vancouver, BC V6E 4A4 Canada
Review: it is our second day here of eating out their food is appetizing and staff is welcoming they were working really hard making sure their customers needs are met love how pushpa made us feel at home

Address: 1130 West pender st Vancouver, BC V6E 4A4 Canada
Review:
amazing value in the middle of downtown its all you can eat for 20 and they include some garlic naan i go to taste a variety of indian dishes
the value was there but quality was a little lacking food was a little greasy garlic naan wasnt great butter chicken was dry and flavour was average the fried potatoes were good tandoori chicken was cooked well but also was lacking in flavour
everything was mild in spice which is to be expected because everyone is taking from the same buffet tray

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: this restaurant offers stunning views of the water and city skyline the food is absolutely delicious with a menu that offers plenty of options to choose from but what really sets this restaurant apart is the atmosphere  its the perfect spot to catch up with friends over a meal and drinks the staff are friendly and welcoming overall i highly recommend checking out this restaurant for a memorable dining experience in vancouver

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
i recently dined at cactus club restaurant and wanted to share my thoughts although there was a delay in receiving our food the staff was incredibly friendly and made us feel welcome throughout our visit the restaurant itself had a great ambiance and provided a pleasant environment for our meal
one area of improvement would be the selection of nonalcoholic drinks which was somewhat limited it would be nice to see a wider variety of options in that regard on the other hand i must commend the kitchen on the fantastic calamari it was cooked to perfection and had a delicious flavor that left me wanting more
however i found the ravioli with shrimp to be a bit too sweet for my taste while it may appeal to those who enjoy sweeter flavors i personally would have preferred a more balanced taste
overall my experience at cactus club restaurant was positive with the standout being the delightful calamari despite the minor setbacks i would still recommend visiting for a friendly atmosphere and memorable dining experience

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
a very large restaurant with gorgeous views over the harbour the staff was very kind and the food was great though my chicken sandwich was better than the tofu bowl which lacked sauce and was a bit dry really good fries the cocktail menu was large and the cocktails themselves were very tasty too

while the views were lovely the restaurant was very loud and it could be difficult to hear the person sitting across from you

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: its not a fancy 5 star restaurant but for what it is it was awesome i had salmon for dinner and it was delicious i sat in the dining room with a water view most people wore sunglasses because the sun was bright and bold at 8pm at night my waiter was awesome i wish i remembered his name its a crowed place so make reservations early they have outside eating and since its right on the water side its a great place to take a stroll afterwards

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: great food great environmentvibe and reasonable prices food was a bit slow to come out and service was somewhat lacking but overall i really enjoyed my evening there a reservation ahead of time will make it much easier to get seated

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review: i came here last week for happy hour the happy hour prices are reasonable the food was good and came out pretty quick staff were friendly half of the outside patio was closed on a hot day so we had to sit inside but overall decent experience

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
came here with my partner during happy hour we were really happy with the happy hour menu the prices were reasonable for what we ordered and the service was great we ordered the
blackened creole chicken it was delicious we loved the mashed potatoes that came with it we also got the tuna poke bowl it was fresh and all the ingredients worked super well together excited to come again

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
the food was absolutely amazing especially the delicious avocado salad i tried baja fish tacos for they very first time and it was a little spicy but incredibly delicious
everything was perfect

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review: one of the only places not short staffed what a pleasure the food was amazing and they couldnt do enough for us

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
first off nicci our server was awesome the drinks appys and dinner was amazing
thank for a nice evening to help celebrate our 29th anniversary when making our reservations it asked if it was a special occasion l and it was put in that it was our anniversary so we were bit disappointed that there was no mention of it

Address: 975 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G Canada
Review: just walked by this cafe by chance i dont generally love pies that much but this was a very fun experience we tried two different pies one with leek and chicken and the other was kangaroo i liked them both the pastry was just done perfectly and the stew inside was delicious i am curious to go try more flavors

Address: 975 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G Canada
Review: my first time trying these cute delicious mini pies so many different and tasty flavours available best option for brunch or small bites chicken mushroom and butter chicken were fabulous inside is clean and nice staff are super friendly and welcoming

Address: 975 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G Canada
Review: we tride 4 different types of pies it was our second time i recommend the hopper kangaroo meat chunky steak  mushroom steak bacon  cheese butter chicken was very spicy for us

Address: 975 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G Canada
Review:
hidden gem

we tried their rise  shine and butter chicken pie along with flat white it was delicious tried australian pies for the first time and loved them
definitely a must try

Address: 975 Denman Street Vancouver, BC V6G Canada
Review: love this place this is the only place i know of in vancouver that does australian food which is very cool they have many choices for meat pies but also a few great options for vegetarians  the vegetarian mentil lentil pie and vegan vegetable medley pie had this one at the other location but the experience at both seems consistent are both delicious and hearty although the pies are premade and heated when you order they taste fresh and flakey out of the oven the pies are definitely the highlight but the desserts arent bad the miningtons are a great light dessert with a lovely balance between the thin chocolate coating and fluffy sponge cake the other dessert ive tried the vanilla slice is one of those desserts thats just indulgently sweet but that was what my heart desired when i ordered so i was happy with it i havent tried the espresso drinks because they dont have decaf but im happy with their teas  the chai latte and london fog are very good even if theyre a little on the sweet side for my taste the prices are fair certainly cheaper than the same meal would likely be at a fullservice restaurant but pretty much just as good

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: price point definitely higher than average burrito lacks core flavours critical to mexican and latin american cuisine meat chunks are a bit dryhard with the lack of salsa and sour cream pico de gallo is barely there no option for hot sauce the overall flavour is flatplain with an overwhelming amount of rice and lack of the rest

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: la taqueria is one of my favorite mexican restaurants in vancouver the tacos and burritos are very tasty but a bit expensive the workers are nice and the location is perfect

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review:
had baja fish asada beef carnitas pork burritos delicious very filling friendly service helpful even for us novices
great food and prices are reasonable
exactly as it says on the tin roof
around 15 ea

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: stepping off the train into the city centre leaves you within throwing distance of some of the best tacos and burritos in the city we grabbed a few tacos and a burrito before heading down to the water and had a nearly spiritual experience devouring them highly recommend the baja taco it will create a new level of expectation for any taco you have in the future also their tortillas are a

Address: 322 W Hastings Street Vancouver, BC V8B 1K6 Canada
Review: this is truly a hole in the wall taco stand we tried their special of the day fish chicken and beef tacos our favourite were the fish and the special of the day they were absolutely amazing we ordered all of them at the same time but i would recommend getting tacos as you eat as they taste best fresh its a must try if you are in vancouver

Address: 506 Fort Street Suite 102 Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: excellent bar with sophisticated cocktails perfect fancy date night bar as a tourist i went out of my way to find a nontourist cocktail bar and they delivered they have an eclectic and extensive assortment of spirits knowing it was dedicated to historic bar masters i had high hopes but it truly exceeded my expectations anytime im back in victoria ill be visiting again

Address: 506 Fort Street Suite 102 Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review:
good not great the menu didnt match what was posted on their website so we showed up and were immediately disappointed

we got the tuna tar tar which was fine and split the burger which was also fine buns should be toasted on a 30 burger

gf got the marshmallow drink she described it as having a strange flavor combination

it was an average dining experience with above average cost

Address: 506 Fort Street Suite 102 Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: nice cocktails and friendly service would have loved to try their tartare but they ran out the mushroom pate was delicious earthy and rich the vongole was not what i expected but was a delicious balance of tomatoes and clam flavour the seafood soup with the fish was wonderful the fish was not just poached but panseared so it still had a nice crust mussels and clams were fresh and juicy

Address: 506 Fort Street Suite 102 Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: excellent service and good quality meals they specialize in a few dishes so chocies are limited the reason for only 4 stars is that we went for dinner and they ran out of spaghetti and steak which was what i wanted and the expensive cocktails are tiny i almost started chuckling when i received my mononoke pretty much a fancy shot for 20 somethings on their menu are justified with the prices like the wagyu beef burger but definitely not the cocktails nor the tuna tartare very small amount of tuna with filler took almost 50 mins to get out burgers but service was top notch and atmosphere was decent not as romantic as other reviews mebtioned especially when its busy

Address: 506 Fort Street Suite 102 Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review:
came here to celebrate me taking my nursing exam this place is the bomb we shared the little jumbo burger which was soooooo good it comes with parmesan fries we also had the short rib which was some of the best ive had the meat was very soft and fatty and i loved the unique flavors it was paired with there were blueberries deep fried polenta and i think some mayo it was so good

the ambience inside is super nice and intimate we sat at the bar and had the pleasure of chatting with the bartender clayton who was so so nice i had a lemonade but my boyfriend had a very smokey mai tai cocktail which was really good will definitely come back

Address: 1006 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T4 Canada
Review:
delicious unforgettable flavors the hour or so we waited for our food was well worth the wait and this places hype is well earned small hiccup when the staff got our order wrong but its understandable

easily one of the best fish and chips ive ever had you need to get the chowder as well

Address: 1006 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T4 Canada
Review:
the food was excellent we had tacones chowder and the misnamed cod dog
soup was delicious not a traditional clam chowder and all the better for that tacones were well balanced with fish fillings cooked just right the battered cod in a fresh roll with tartar pickles and slaw was tasty chipsfries were really good crispy outside and fluffy centres
the meal was definitely fair value for money
long line up for counter service style ordering though we waited nearly 30 minutes to order hence the 4 star rating but once we ordered the food came up pretty quickly with none of this sitting around under heat lamps
worth the wait delicious meal and very filling we couldnt finish it all

Address: 1006 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T4 Canada
Review: open air takeout style fish  chip shop that offers more than just deep fried items  grilled salmon is moist and flavourful and the seared tuna is generous in portion size fresh local ingredients paired with friendly staff whats not to love meal times are usually busy but the food is worth the 30 min line up for order then about 10 min for freshly made food

Address: 1006 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T4 Canada
Review: neat little food truck by the harbour there is always a line up all day long  the fish  chip is delicious crispy but not oily the chipotle coconut chowder is very tasty we were lucky to get a table with a view of the harbour

Address: 1006 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T4 Canada
Review: by far the best fish n chips ive ever had the wait line was 30 minutes but well worth the wait i think my only feedback is to move into another building and hire more staff to help with the high popularity of the food highly recommend to anyone visiting victoria

Address: 739 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review:
i rarely provide 5 star reviews due to something always being off whether that be the food service or the environment but this was impeccable very rarely did you find such fluidity and cooperation between serving staff and the kitchen

the food was very delicious and surprisingly quick having fast service is usually a red flag for me wondering if the food was fresh or made with quality but without a doubt it was made well

our waitress was very polite and nice to talk with she always responded to our thank you with a youre welcome she had the perfect balance of attention and checkups to not annoy people with constant checks but didnt leave you wondering if you were going to be served it was the perfect balance

the restaurant is small which does make the noise travel quite far on the louder side but being at the bar was a saving grace as volume seemed to be lower there

all in all it was a very nice experience and the next time we are in victoria we will definitely be returning for another meal

Address: 739 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review: well executed japanese tapas all ingredients and cuts were very fresh with excellent presentation our group sampled a mix of classic and modern rolls with atypical flavors as well as several small plates the maguro tartare with taro chips was quite lovely as well as the karaage which was incredibly juicy and tender drinks were well balanced and the servers all phenomenal

Address: 739 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review:
this place is bustling expect a wait for dinner time it will take some time to get a seat order and get the bill as i experienced so come with a patient attitude otherwise the waitersresses  have their hands very full

otherwise the food is great my favorite dish was the tomato curry karage the curry was mildly sweet and they were generous with the karate i also recommend the tofino  an assortment of scallop shrimp and white fish tempura  it was absolutely delicious crispy on the outside and so flavorful and tender in the inside

Address: 739 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review: delicious food and great service we enjoyed some great sushi rolls as well as their unagi bowl the service was also quick and friendly despite it being a busy evening for dinner the food was high quality and i was glad to see they had a few japanese beer options as well

Address: 739 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review: went here after a recommendation from a friend i was happy with what i ordered but my folks were less so octopus was good and the avengers roll was fantastic the chicken karaage was a miss overall just okay

Address: 555 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M2 Canada
Review: what a great find hidden away in a back alley in victoria the food was great and the atmosphere is warm and inviting tables are spaced enough that your not having to listen to overbearing conversations at the next table service was a bit slow and we felt neglected at times i understand that its tough to find good service in the hospitality sector these days hopefully this will not be a forever thing i would still recommend giving this place a try and i would not hesitate to return

Address: 555 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M2 Canada
Review: had a wonderful anniversary dinner at il terrazzo considering how big the seating is the place was packed yet we didnt feel rushed or crammed in the atmosphere was very inviting our bread and oil were so yummy and soft and the crushed olives were a nice add everything was perfect though i will say i was pleasantly surprised by the choice of mango in my linguine marco would definitely come back

Address: 555 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M2 Canada
Review: really enjoyed the food and the service the portions were generous  definitely a must go if you are in victoria

Address: 555 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M2 Canada
Review: easily the best and most authentic italian cuisine on the island fantastic menu fabulous service and a truly incredible wine selection i recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting victoria we have been many times and always have a great experience alongside friendly and attentive service

Address: 555 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M2 Canada
Review: its a great restaurant its romantic and cozy also very yummy portions are huge make reservations with time ill definitely recommend this restaurant however i did miss from their menu a more italian style pasta

Address: 716 Burdett Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 3G2 Canada
Review:
we had dinner to celebrate our anniversary during our weekend in victoria from toronto    hubby made an amazing choice in this restaurant

we were welcomed at the entrance with very pleasant professional personnel  i was immediately impressed with the ambiance  it feels like a restaurant in greece very spacious with lovely artwork and bluewhite look everywhere

dimitri assisted us with our order  we loved all the appetizers dinner wine and the best part was the spectacular service and attention to details

weve eaten at many greek restaurants over the years which meet our expectations however this one went above and beyond

we highly recommend it and will be back thank you for a wonderful night to everyone at ithaka

Address: 716 Burdett Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 3G2 Canada
Review:
excellent service the food was very delicious and it was definitely a niche on the market for a great greek restaurant absolutely fantastic ambiance loved the color decor that matched greece vibes  
prices were quite high but the whole experience is definitely worth a visit

Address: 716 Burdett Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 3G2 Canada
Review:
beautiful location friendly staff
drinks were amazing i had ithaka sour and  new drink of the month kackieo  refreshing and perfect for summer
meals calamari and the lamb souvlaki platter

our waitresses       awesome service thea and genile made us feel welcome

Address: 716 Burdett Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 3G2 Canada
Review: we loved our meal and the ambiance is spectacular also it is family friendly its a must while youre here for authentic greek meal

Address: 716 Burdett Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 3G2 Canada
Review: we had our staff christmas party here this year and everyone loved it  the food was fantastic and genuine cooked perfectly  the staff were very attentive and friendly but did not bother us too much while we enjoyed our meals  the cocktails were delicious and the bartender made a lot of great suggestions for each patron  the building and interior atmosphere looks great  we will all come back here again for sure

Address: 1210 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A4 Canada
Review: i heard great things and decided finally to treat myself  i was not disappointed  the house g  t was beautiful and divine paired with the bay scallop  cod fish ceviche was amazing perfectly balanced soft and delicious i will definitely be coming back

Address: 1210 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A4 Canada
Review: excellent food the soup was super good pepper and coconut i took the trio platter to try a little of everything i did expect more for the price 15 however it was very tasty i would recommend to just go with a full dish instead of the trio you get more for your money finishing touch a nice espresso i will be back

Address: 1210 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A4 Canada
Review: this place is awesome fabulous tapas you cant seem to go wrong with anything on the menu everything is perfectly curated beef carpaccio is love at every bite same with gambas al ajillo even the baguette and the focaccia bread as sides to the meals were fresh and delicious portions are fair for the price wine list is pretty good the few wines we had were great even the sherry list is pretty good if youre into that service is awesome and finally the atmosphere is really nice cool lighting inside and a beautiful open bar

Address: 1210 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A4 Canada
Review: excellent food creative menu great service what a fun and happy place  we will definitely be back

Address: 1210 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A4 Canada
Review: the service was wonderful everyone was so sweet and the food was amazing our waitress helped us with wine pairings and the gluten free bread was perfect

Address: 805 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review:
indianfrench bistro with soul food ie food that is so nourishing and full of flavour it comforts your soul i couldnt pick a favourite but would definitely suggest the mussels and fishermans chowder

also if youre like my husband and are hardcore about tasting the potato flavour in fries better to think of the fishhook poutine as a curry with fries in it  the curry is thick and luxurious and flavourful but it was too saucy for his expectations  would still recommend though it was delicious

Address: 805 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: this is quite honestly some of the best seafood ive heard on the west coast thus far there are combination of spices flavors and impeccable service will keep me coming back for more you need to try the hot pot is absolutely amazing the amount of seafood you receive as well as the endless baguette is to die for i highly recommend coming here

Address: 805 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review:
the very positive reviews we read about the restaurant while planning our victoria trip had our expectations high we had it on our todo list on our victoria visit we were glad to make it there for lunch just before our return trip from victoria fishhook went beyond our expectations we had ordered the biriyani and the pondicherry the flavours were unique and perfectly blended never before had we loved salmon so much
looking forward to our next visit

Address: 805 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: great food loved the poutini and catch of day pondicherri fish was good as well i wish i had a chance to eat inside and enjoy fresh n hot flavors instead of take to ferry

Address: 805 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: the food and the service were excellent we had the mussels biryani katch of the day and the fish chowder they were all exceptional i recommend reserving a seat ahead we went during peak hours so parking in fort street was difficult

Address: 919 Fort Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8V 3K3 Canada
Review: amazing breakfast spot in downtown victoria when we go early in the morning already had line up so can see how popular it is its featured in so many articles about the breakfast you have to try in victoria actually at beginning we are little skeptical but it turns out its very good the portion is huge and they are generous on putting ingredients the plates are full  we are super full after eating that we skip the lunch we highly recommend this to if you want to try traditional breakfast in this beautiful city

Address: 919 Fort Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8V 3K3 Canada
Review: they are usually pretty busy and there was a wait for us to get in but definitely worth it the food was very yummy and very large portions for the price i would definitely recommend one plate wouldve honestly been enough for both my friend and i the decor and ambience is also very nice service is quite attentive although a tad slow because of how busy they were i would definitely come again

Address: 919 Fort Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8V 3K3 Canada
Review: one of those rare times the lineup wasnt very long so we took advantage  its a busy spot but the service was efficient and the food came out quickly  i had the angel eyes eggs benny  the eggs were perfectly cooked  the homefries were crispy  didnt find it had oodles of flavour but of course that has more to do with my choice of order  my friend had the moroccan chicken club which he really liked  will go back but likely not when its lined up

Address: 919 Fort Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8V 3K3 Canada
Review: really good dishes i tried the foxs grill and it was really delicious we waited 1hour 30min to get in it was surely worth it very good serving you get full real fast great breakfast

Address: 919 Fort Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8V 3K3 Canada
Review: there was a line up outside the door but luckily it moved fairly quickly service was quick and the portions were huge the food was delicious we were very happy with our meals i would definitely come back for breakfast again

Address: 769 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review:
best food experience on our trip to victoria
we ordered kung pao tofu and special fried rice both the dishes were delicious for kung pao tofu one would imagine that tofu was the star of the dish which it was but for me it was the crispy fried broccoli which took the dish to another level chefs kiss 
food quantity and the service was pretty good i cant wait to go back and try other things on their menu

this place is a must visit if you are in victoria

Address: 769 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: definitely recommend  just what we needed on a rainy afternoon  they totally delivered on the street food promise with the bonus of getting out of the rain  red curry reminded me a lot of actual curry in thailand  lots of different veggies and a rich not overpowering curry flavors  really good food

Address: 769 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review:
dishes are well served really nice quantities we ordered 3 dishes and we had to take 1 in a box 2 adults and 2 kids this place is delicious they cook your plate on the spot pretty fast too the people there are very friendly and will consider go back on our next visit
i personally recommend the caramel chicken when visiting this place good luck

Address: 769 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review:
the crispy ginger pork was an explosion of flavor in my mouth i would definitely recommend it the spice level was just right for me

my wife got the famous caramel chicken which she enjoyed both dishes are delicious the potstickers though were just average fried pork dumplings their meat serving  was plentiful that we had to ask for a to go box for some leftovers

prices were reasonable considering it already includes taxes service was fast

Address: 769 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: we decided to try foo asian street food for dinner and it was phenomenal we got the saag paneer which is served with fry bread and streamed rice the tofu kung pao bowl is a medley of vegetables that comes with steamed rice both dishes were flavourful delicious and welldone they have a great menu as well love their concept excellent and friendly service from the host as well thank you highly recommend we shall return

Address: 546 Fisgard St Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review:
one of the best noodles ive had in my life

not only it was a great experience of serving ourselves the noodle mix the taste is incredible the waitress is also very nice very fast service

their pork ribs is also a must try and their pork belly is also good

definitely coming back when visiting victoria  its chinatown

Address: 546 Fisgard St Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: nice restaurant located in victoria chinatown near the fan tan alley their feature is cross bright noodle soup from yunnan to be honest not the worst but not the best either feels like the soup base add a lot msg because very savoury the portion is not big each ingredient like only one or two bites noodle doesnt feel fresh its precooked if just for simple dinner thats okay but dont expect too much fancy

Address: 546 Fisgard St Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: food was great   wonton needs a bit more favour  soup was very hot for cross bridge noodle but after adding the ingredients it becomes warm  overall it is very good

Address: 546 Fisgard St Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: a rare find of ËøáÊ°•Á±≥Á∫ø crossingthebridge noodles served in the traditional way guess its part of the fun to put small plates of a variety of meat and veggies into the boiling chicken broth in a sensible order and let the final cooking be done right in front of you the rich broth with fresh ingredients and smooth rice noodles couldnt be more satisfying and heart warming the tofu and kelp salad side dishes were tasty as well

Address: 546 Fisgard St Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: amazing food great service great restaurant i was not expecting much but it was absolutely delicious the fried dumplings are absolutely exquisite and the wifi and service was even better it was a fastsimple delicious dineindinner in chinatown and i loved it there was only one waitress working and while it took a while for the menus to arrive the food came very quick and anyone who doesnt go here is missing out great design great everything

Address: 611 Courtney Street Victoria, BC V8W 1B7 Canada
Review:
10 acres delivers the food is delicious looks great and all from their own farm
make sure to make a reservation so you get a great table
we had the chicken and mussels  i feel it was a mistake should have stuck with one theme either seafood or no seafood
the chicken was very very good
id have it again

Address: 611 Courtney Street Victoria, BC V8W 1B7 Canada
Review:
lovely atmosphere nice staff and quality food
incredible dishes and well designed menu had been there for breakfast and lunch loved it both

Address: 611 Courtney Street Victoria, BC V8W 1B7 Canada
Review: a farm to table restaurant we walked in on a saturday night and were seating right away the restaurant is very big there was a section with a bar with a younger ground another sections with larger groups and family and then another area that seemed to be more intimate everything that we ordered was delicious gnocchi lasagna and pumpkin cheesecake highly recommend the pumpkin cheesecake without the apple compote and lemonthose flavours didnt go well together for my palate i would say its the best ive had service was great i would definitely go back

Address: 611 Courtney Street Victoria, BC V8W 1B7 Canada
Review: stopped in without resos for lunch we were seated on the indoor patio which has a great vibe came in for an app and aperol spritz excellent atmosphere food was good fresh and unique they had a mix up with their bar order so they were out of prosecco which is finesht happens def coming back

Address: 611 Courtney Street Victoria, BC V8W 1B7 Canada
Review: we just ordered some drinks beautiful interior design i loved how they incorporated plants into their outside patio most of their drinks include alcohol so it is not so much friendly for those who are avoiding alocholic drinks

Address: 1001 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T6 Canada
Review: delicious took my boyfriend here for the first time and he absolutely loved it we both got drinks which were good we shared a calamari which was a little bit small for 20 my boyfriend has the steak and he likes it done rare and he was so happy with how it turned out i had the fish and chips and the fish was so crispy and very good i will add the fries are not good they are very soggy will come back but i would love to see the fries change

Address: 1001 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T6 Canada
Review:
an incredible restaurant and definitely priceworthy

we had a nice place outside in the shade and with a fresh breeze and our waiter was extraordinarily friendly and courteous

the dishes the burger as well as the fish tasted delicious were nicely plated and a good size the selfmade drinks were very tasty as well

the experience overall was great in any case the atmosphere was very harmonious the dishes tasted superb and were worth their price

Address: 1001 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T6 Canada
Review:
food
burger is juicy and tasty

it came with burnt refriedtasting fries

i am sensitive to reused oil the calamari wasnt only greasy but also smelled like it was cooked in reused oil

the service is good though  i was attended frequently and welcomed well

Address: 1001 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T6 Canada
Review: we went to nautical nellies not once but two weekends in a row for brunch all the dishes were amazing packed with large chunks of seafood and were really good portions especially for sharing my favourites are the lobster and crab salad large enough for 23 the lobster and crab french toast lobster roll and last but not least the brioche french toast the french toast is so good it should be illegal especially at only 10 as a victoria local i am always trying different restaurants in town and i have to say this place is one of the best dont miss this place the next time you are in victoria

Address: 1001 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1T6 Canada
Review: first time in victoria for some time parked our car and started walking googled seafood and found nautical nellies it was very cold out that day and we were looking for some warm coffee and some seafood the service was impeccable and the food was amazing we had the lobster dip the lobster mac and cheese and the seafood chowder all of it was delicious well go back next time were in victoria for sure

Address: 512 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 2Z6 Canada
Review: heard about this place from a friend of mine and decided to bring my parents here i was not impressed with the quality of the food we ordered a half original fried chicken a half sweet and sour assorted fries regular fries yam fries and onion rings and the spicy chicken soup the chicken that we ordered was warm and super dry the meat was not tender at all you can tell its been sitting in the back for a bit the fries were alright it was also dry and oily not much salt to it the spicy chicken soup was good but a bit too spicy for our taste the service was good our servers were super nice and accommodating

Address: 512 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 2Z6 Canada
Review: i have been to chimac a few times now and to be completely honest its ok their fire gopchang beef intestines is really good i would definitely recommend that if youre willing to try something new although sometimes when i order it its grainy which happens sometimes the nice thing about chimac is that they have a lot of different flavours to choose from for their chicken the only reason why i think its ok is because the chicken isnt as crispy as it once was however i do like their boneless padak because of the pile of green onions that comes with it i wouldnt recommend getting the fish cake soup as its quite bland the seafood udon is ok but i wouldnt order it again i just feel like there are better places for chicken but if you are downtown and are craving korean fried chicken heres an option

Address: 512 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 2Z6 Canada
Review:
a bit pricey but youll make sure to go back a few times a month to get your chicken fix

 we ordered
fried fish balls
they taste good perfect match with ketchup and mustard
 spicy chilli chicken  boneless 5
not that spicy just a very little kick
spice  
 sweet and sour chicken  boneless 5
it also has pineapples  i also love their presentation 
 honey mustard chicken  boneless 5
this is the one i like the most although honey mustard is quite a popular flavor it goes well with the chicken 
 poutine 4
not the tastiest but its okay big portion too 

 the portion  of the big one looks like its for your 1 week meal  its our first time and we didnt expect the serving to be this massive price to portion ratio is superb 

 the wait time is average around 1020mins i think

 service is quite good they ask what ever you need more and communicates

tip your servers

Address: 512 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 2Z6 Canada
Review:
pa dak was not good for us  firstly they did not have boneless chicken available so they offered bonein chicken as an alternative the chicken lacked the desired crispiness and the batter was a bit bland additionally the sauce had an unpleasant taste reminiscent of nail polish so we decided to return it after sampling just one piece despite this we were still charged for the entire dish

on a positive note the dumplings and assorted fries were delicious providing the only redeeming aspect of the meal

Address: 512 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 2Z6 Canada
Review:
quite underwhelming if you are looking for korean fried chicken the chicken is not very crispy and there was entirely too much green onion in the dish although the meat was very tender we also got the pork stew and that was pretty delicious in terms of the pork being stewed properly and fell apart i did not feel like the broth was very authentic tasting though and there was a lot of pepper
the resturant is quite busy and there is a waitlist for spots if it is a weekend the service is not bad although they did run out of rice when i wanted to order some to go overall not bad but i wouldnt come here for the chicken

Address: 225 Quebec Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W2 Canada
Review: one of the best breakfasts ive had based on quality of the food and ambiance very reasonably priced well worth the food alone add to that dining a 10 minute walk along the harbour from the center of the tourist district efficient service and very comfortable seating in a historic house we arrived a few minutes before opening at 9am with about five groups in line in front of us and were seated 10 minutes later we finished breakfast and were out the door before 10am we were not rushed at all  we just had places to go

Address: 225 Quebec Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W2 Canada
Review: amazing flavorful  healthy food great vibe and stunning cozy upstairs lounge the staff was so chill and kind this has got to be my new favorite breakfast place in victoria

Address: 225 Quebec Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W2 Canada
Review: this is better than any brunch place ive had in seattle new york level in terms of quality and ingredient selection small menu which i prefer everything is on point can you guys open a location in seattle please

Address: 225 Quebec Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W2 Canada
Review: small menu but all the items are tasty for someone like myself who cant make up my mind with a lot of choices the small menu was great i had the frittata and the eggs were cooked to perfection the bread and butter on my plate was the best toast ive had

Address: 225 Quebec Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W2 Canada
Review: great new addition to the casual fine dinning scene in james bay delicious elevated casual dishes thoughtfully prepared with fresh local ingredients

Address: 626 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R6 Canada
Review: best ramen i have had in 2018 we found this restaurant and have come back ever since my daughter loved the ramen tofu back then and this started her journey exploring different types of food for muslims dont let the pig on the door turn you off the vegan vegetarian dishes are incredible our whole family loves the vegan vegetarian tan tan men the tofu is crunchy and delicious i wholeheartedly recommend bao i look forward to it all year and it is a big reason why we all love coming to victoria so much

Address: 626 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R6 Canada
Review: im gluten free and vegetarian i cant remember the last time i was able to have ramen it was more of a pho with rice noodles however it was so delicious spicy and lots of different textures very generous portion sizes and a very fair price food came very quickly i had the tan tan ramen and iced vietnamese coffee absolutely loved it went with my brother and we both agreed it was fabulous

Address: 626 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R6 Canada
Review: one of the few restaurants open late night on a weekday decided to try a couple of their baos during our stay in victoria ordered buttermilk fried chicken chinese bbq mala 5 mushroom and the taiwanese classic from left to right it was 4 for 16 they were cute tiny baos good for an appetizer and the flavors were on point i wished they were full sized though the mala 5 mushroom had a good spicy kick to it

Address: 626 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R6 Canada
Review: look no further this is the best place to eat in china town hands down for starters hubs and i are in our 40s parents of teenagers restaurant owners and brought our large vacationing family to bao from other blogger recommendations we couldnt be happier that we tried it out everything we tried was amazing the 13 year olds loved theirs as well small quaint clean fast friendly and absolutely delicious we cant wait to visit bao next time we go to victoria

Address: 626 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R6 Canada
Review: have been in victoria a few times but hadnt gotten the chance to stop at bao until the other day what a disappointment the bao buns we tried were taiwanese classic buttermilk fried chicken and mala 5 mushroom the classic was the best flavour and it was just okay the rest were bad the tan tan men was just bad could barely eat it and the kara miso ramen was subpar something about it was off the vietnamese ice coffee on the otherhand was yummy you seat yourself and pay at the counter when you arrive so there isnt much service overall not nearly close to the 45 rating it has on google more like a 30

Address: 1001 Douglas Street Unit G2A Victoria, BC V8W 2C5 Canada
Review: my partner and i came in to a fun filled kitchenseating area for

Address: 1001 Douglas Street Unit G2A Victoria, BC V8W 2C5 Canada
Review:
i just went to victoria for the first time and looked at a lot of restaurant choices before choosing hanks  my friends and i were thrilled we did  we shared the todays best things which consisted of a watermelon salad so could you could take a bath in it the duck bolognese with homemade pasta tender duck and an incredible sauce beets with dandilion greens omg the flavors the spice perfection and a steak that was perfection with a salad that i could eat literally every single day  dessert was a cornbread cake with blueberries piatachios and some kind of cream cheesy whipped creamy pillow that sealed the deal

a 1000 reccommend and we are so sad its a six hour trip to get back there

tiny place excellent service cool chill atmosphere

thank you for the incredible meal

Address: 1001 Douglas Street Unit G2A Victoria, BC V8W 2C5 Canada
Review:
antifine dining  fine dining by a rag tag gang of young badasses cooking like wizards of old a stripped down almost unrefined atmosphere stands confidently in the awareness that its dark cathedral walls host a different kind of church
these guys are an absolute thrill to watch in their element as they dance around their tiny open kitchen slinging seriously excellent food and drink into the mouths of worship
well don chaps

your passion is carving a unique path keep refining your process and you will ascend into the ranks of infamy

to any fortunate enough to find themselves at this bastion of excellence let these young guns show you flavour no white tablecloth symphony here  hanks is a rock concert  and they dont miss  a beat

bravo

Address: 1001 Douglas Street Unit G2A Victoria, BC V8W 2C5 Canada
Review:
i remember clearly as a small
child that the best things came in small packages if you are one of the lucky ones to get inside this victoria gem called  hanks a restaurant  then youve just won the lottery of an experience like no other

we ordered and shared the walnut and arugula pesto  the cheeseburger with potato fries  each bite was like the first time you experienced disneyland for the first time  clark  the culinary artist  and part owner  personally checked to see how our meals were his attention to detail and passion for his craft is why we will return to experience many of the other incredible menu items 

we hadnt even finished our first meal experience and we were already talking  about what wed order next time

a true victoria gem definitely worth experiencing

Address: 1001 Douglas Street Unit G2A Victoria, BC V8W 2C5 Canada
Review:
there arent really any new words that i can add other then you need to visit this place note that its small 34 tables and about 8 bar seats so resos are recommended the food is made from scratch in front of you so expect a bit of a wait i cant believe that my plate was only 25 this was a gourmet execution of a simple concept and it was big enough to serve 2

apparently the victoria foodie scene is really good and hanks is one of the places that you need to go to

Address: 542 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S5 Canada
Review:
get ready for the hyperbole that isnt the blackstone benny was by far the best eggs benedict i have ever had the bacon alone is worth 5 stars
the service was top notch and its fun to just look around in this restaurant go and you will see what i mean

Address: 542 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S5 Canada
Review:
great food huge sizes we tried different things pork belly eggs benedict veggie bowl and french toast and they were all awesome
eggs benedict are great and big for one person but i would say bowls are for two theyre huge
french toast is a mots i would say we tried the apple one and it was unbelievable
the waiting times are a bit long but i would say they are worth it it would be better if you could write your name down and come back but still is good
buttermilk biscuits are very good and special too
definitely a great place for breakfastbrunch

Address: 542 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S5 Canada
Review:
great service and great food i tried johns place blue fox cafe and jam cafe in the span of 3 days service and menus were great at all 3 with a similar type of cuisine you cant go wrong with any of the 3 places
we tried the herald omlette and the later tater bowl at jam and both were great i liked the seating at jam cafe as well as the chicken apple sausage id recommend any of the 3 places for breakfastbrunch but go early or youre waiting in line for a while

Address: 542 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S5 Canada
Review: great breakfast place i got waffles and sausage patties so good  everything our table got was delicious as were the drinks very popular there were about 10 ppl in line ahead of us but we only waited about 15 minutes  we sat outside they had blankets for the customers to put on their laps i thought that was so thoughtful would definitely go back if in the area

Address: 542 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S5 Canada
Review: i love their pancakes their bowls are great too jam is a breakfast fave amongst my friends and i only downside is the restaurant is small tables are close together and you almost always have to line up for a long tome to get a table if you have the time i do really recommend it because its worth it

Address: 1325 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 0B5 Canada
Review:
i stopped at superbaba for lunch and it didnt disappoint they make fresh pita breads daily and thats key you can see them baking the bread in a hot oven the pita bread is soft and slightly chewy i got the falafel wrap and it was delicious the chickpea fritters were crispy i enjoyed the fresh and crunchy vegetables in the wrap the flavours are exquisite i love their aesthetics with modern flair

additionally i also decided to try the turmeric cookie along with the turmeric i appreciated the rose water the rose water adds a distinct and unique floral which in my opinion is very unique the cookie had a good texture with a slightly crisp outer shell and a soft and chewy middle highly recommend next time i shall order ahead

Address: 1325 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 0B5 Canada
Review: chicken wrap with two extra falafel balls on the side definitely filling a niche that needs filled and im so glad its around whenever i need it thanks

Address: 1325 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 0B5 Canada
Review:
i had a chicken wrap last week and it was not awful taste it was full of cabbage and hardly find chicken inside though it was chicken wrap instead chicken i got too much fries
hope will take care next time

Address: 1325 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 0B5 Canada
Review: ordered the spicy falafel bowl for lunch it took a bit of time but was worth the wait fantastic flavour and a good slow burn when finished add this to the goto list for lunch next time ill order ahead

Address: 1325 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 0B5 Canada
Review: there is a reason this restaurant is always busy so delicious i only wish they would ask if you need a fork when getting food to go because i assume its in there  then end up eating my saladchicken bowl with my fingers  the park  tasty tuom pita chips and ice cream sandwich  also love the lemonade i will never tire of the sauerkraut pickles  blackened chicken yum

Address: 807 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: this mediterranean styled tapa bistro seems to be a hidden gem at a time when many substandard restaurants are requiring paid reservations and add restrictions to your time to enjoy being out not here rich flavoured food and a great selections of drinks we had the grilled cauliflower grilled humboldt squid special spot prawn dumplings dry aged chorizo its in the name  just order some and churros he had a couple hh wines for 6 and cocktails this is a restaurant you should put on repeat

Address: 807 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: great food i had a grilled humboldt squid and  roasted potatoes for starter the grilled humboldt squid was terrific neither chewey nor too fishy at all the starter with potatoes was also great staff was kind want to try other dishes on my next visit

Address: 807 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review:
the food was exceptional olives fancy potatoes meatballs paella scallops and an assortment of deserts everything was remarkable and sooo tasty  the prices were completely reasonable and the service was right on time
1010  will definitely come again

Address: 807 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: what a find  super delicious little restaurant with great service excellent wine selection with a couple of very good spanish white wines paloma cocktail was excellent we had salt cod croquettes the meatball grilled bread and anchovies everything was so good so nice to have things not slathered in cream and cheese the meatballs were like a soft cloud  so delicious nothing oversalted and no heavy sauces amazing

Address: 807 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H6 Canada
Review: th√© paella was sooo good the seafood was seasoned perfectly and fresh i loved the sauce on the rice and it brought me back to spain the owner man at the bar was also super friendly we sat in front in the patio and had a lovely dinner i would definitely come again to try their other tapas

Address: 680 Montreal Street Victoria, BC V8V 1Z8 Canada
Review:
the quality of food and service  is pretty good for sure
but the portion is smaller than smaller also im not a fan of the coffee written as espresso but served as normal black coffee a lot of spaces for improvement

Address: 680 Montreal Street Victoria, BC V8V 1Z8 Canada
Review: great western omelette and aura benedict we enjoyed our stay in the hotel as well as our breakfast at aura waterfront restaurant we were also with 3 toddlers and they were kept busy with the provided drawing supplies which was nice

Address: 680 Montreal Street Victoria, BC V8V 1Z8 Canada
Review: spent a lovely night with good friendsfellow chefs thanks to the aura for supplying a amazing dining experience the food was some best ive ever had in my life especially the tuna and the pork belly muah  the plates are were all small and shared between two people yet by the end i was stuffed despite a big appetite to conclude for the price of only 65 per person and eating such delectable food till a full belly id definitely recommend either this menu or single plates off it

Address: 680 Montreal Street Victoria, BC V8V 1Z8 Canada
Review: the aura benny taste really good didnt expect the kimchi blend so well with hollandaise with the view of inner harbor peaceful dinning environment and attentive service really nice place for breakfast

Address: 680 Montreal Street Victoria, BC V8V 1Z8 Canada
Review: highly recommend seating on the patio where you can enjoy delicious food and a beautiful view simultaneously

Address: 620 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review:
one of the best places to enjoy a casual meal at commons we enjoyed tacos wine beer and cocktails during the happy hour the menu may be limited but pretty ok for the price and happy hours chicken tacos are delicious flat breads are perfectly made and a good enough portion for a quick snack the house wines red and white are average but not too bad for the price

the place has nice modern funky decor so wont feel the place as a boring restaurant fun place overall for happy hour
