Address: 620 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: i cant give it a five star review because they messed up my daughters sushi and put onions all over it when we had very specifically ordered it plain then they didnt ask if we wanted another oneshe sort of just asked if we could pick the onions off and walked away also i ordered my steak rare and it came very medium if not well done food was pretty good though especially the field greens which seemed extremely fresh my bloody mary was also very very tasty

Address: 620 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: the location of this restaurant is great i went with my 12 year old daughter we ordered the clam chowder calamari and tuna salad the clam chowder and calamari were good the tuna was dry and the potatoes undercooked and strangely at the end of our meal the server asked us if we wanted separate bills which made us think how common is it that a 40 year old and their 12 year old friend dine there and pay separately

Address: 620 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: good ceviche a bit pricey the prawn tacos were amazing the meat tacos were really good but we preferred the prawn ones the drinks are always  the server gave us more chips for the ceviche which is great

Address: 620 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: great place for dinner with some of the best views in downtown victoria the lasagna in particular was amazing servers checked in at a great pace so we felt quite spoiled throughout the night

Address: 1 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 0B2 Canada
Review:
these were the best muscles ive ever had in my life they were sweet and flavorful and not a tiny grain of sand in the entire thing absolutely worth 19 the halibut tacos were also fantastic the halibut fish and chips was the disappointment of the group but still okay
i would absolutely go back for the muscles and might even come back before our trip is over highly recommend
i would give 55 but i just dont give 5s for hardly anything

Address: 1 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 0B2 Canada
Review:
a female kitchen staff yelled guests because we were looking for the place for throwing garbage
we dont know because we are tourists do local come here and not know where are the trash cans
the cashier was very nice and recommended food a male chef is also nice i would like to give the two staff 5 starts
just fast food taste but restaurants change so they are expensive the food in the area seem for tourists
i give 5 stars for the atmosphere

Address: 1 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 0B2 Canada
Review: our harbour taxi guide recommended this spot as the fried items have a lighter batter than other places on fishermans wharf they have happy hour specials on oysters chowder with 3 types of salmon was great

Address: 1 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 0B2 Canada
Review: delicious oyster tacos halibut taco was a bit dry but still good three way salmon chowder was delicious  be prepared to get messy was in victoria for three nights and went twice  it was worth the return visit

Address: 1 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 0B2 Canada
Review:
super tasty bc halibut taco  salmon chowder the view is great the server is helpful it was all her recommendation and its all good too bad we couldnt try the shrimp yet because it wasnt ready and we had to leave

definitely coming back again its real fresh and good seafood

Address: 1692 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: tasty healthy food they dont use msg but the food is flavourful and all the ingredients ate well cooked and fresh we had the cozy place chow mien the veggies are sweet and the portion is fulfilling for one person

Address: 1692 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: this is one of my favorite restaurants in victoria  it feels really cozy inside like the name of the restaurant all the food i had here was amazing the price of the foods here is reasonable i hope everyone in victoria knows this cozy place

Address: 1692 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: surprisingly well managed husband and wife team created a comfy cozy place to dine alone or with your love ones   i ordered the simple but difficult to master scramble eggs with tomato sauce   the eggs were cooked separately so the flavors and texture of each ingredients were properly celebrated  my second dish is the slow braised pork spare ribs that was cooked to perfect then it was tossed in with a tangee soy based black pepper sauce  both dishes were served with generous portion and i had left over to take it to my hotel  out of the 5 days on the island this little place captured my heart with its simple but highly satisfying dishes   i will come back to try other dishes and to continue my conversation with the owner couple

Address: 1692 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: the restaurant has a cozy atmosphere as described and the food is absolute delicious fresh and full of flavour with great vegan options

Address: 1692 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: we loved this place some of the most authentic chinese food ive had outside of china the couple running the place were very kind and everything was fresh and made to order

Address: 633 Courtney Street Suite 22 Victoria, BC V8W 1B9 Canada
Review: we love this place currently only order for pick up such a hidden gem fish is so fresh they use fresh ingredient and locally source organic veggies we order once a week

Address: 633 Courtney Street Suite 22 Victoria, BC V8W 1B9 Canada
Review:
this is an authentic shokudo food you should not compare to a pricey omakase but you can expect comfort and satisfactory meal the grilled sockeye collar and the mackerel were wonderful we are happy to try this place during our visit

the only complain that i have was the rice which could be better

Address: 633 Courtney Street Suite 22 Victoria, BC V8W 1B9 Canada
Review:
this was hands down our favorite and best find in victoria we ordered a tuna and salmon lunch and picked it up the next day to eat at philips brewery

since they are not doing dine in currently you have to order the lunch the night before online at 7pm and then pick it up the next afternoon we actually got a little lost looking for it but loved the experience searching for it

the food itself was fantastic  loved the shredded egg thought that was pretty unique touch and the sashimi was fresh thick and just all around amazing would recommend this place to anyone

Address: 633 Courtney Street Suite 22 Victoria, BC V8W 1B9 Canada
Review:
if you miss the precovid uchida and have avoided supporting them or leave a low star rating because there is no dinein option you are missing out on this gem i was a long time customer who had his early dates with my now wife here always loved going there for their dinein experience  i am guilty of not going in the last couple years because of not wanting to takeout the amazing food in portable packaging  i ran into the chef socially in the last couple months and kept saying ill see you soon but today i really pushed myself in using their online ordering system and picking up takeout for a car date with my wife the number of times i kept saying wow as i sat in my car holding the paper box its astounding how much care and love the chef puts into this food for it to taste this good even in a portable form i am embarrassed now to feel that i was waiting for them to resume dinein to go support this amazing eatery

please experience uchida and let this chef express this talents  as of this review in nov 2022 you do you have to order online and pickup at their door  trust me its not the same takeout food you are used to i ate every grain of rice not to waste a single element of the meal made personally for me

Address: 633 Courtney Street Suite 22 Victoria, BC V8W 1B9 Canada
Review: exceptionally delicious and fresh order the night before for a stellar take out lunch perfect if youve got a busy day of meetings or if youre just visiting and are looking for a healthy picnic to enjoy while touring around our fine city

Address: 721 Government St Victoria, BC V8W 1W5 Canada
Review: a must do while visiting victoria high tea in an historic hotel rich in decor and traditions the food is gorgeous and the service is top notch go there hungry you will be really full once you get through all three tiers of the high tea

Address: 721 Government St Victoria, BC V8W 1W5 Canada
Review:
stayed at the empress for 2 nights and looked forward to breakfast at the q every morning the food was fresh prepared well and tasted well like food should taste it wasnt greasy overly seasoned or overly salted

service was professional but friendly and the atmosphere was wonderful the restaurant was clean and the christmas decorations were very tastefully done

i ordered the tater bowl which was very good it wasnt oily and felt clean the fully loaded oatmeal was fruity and had a good mix of flavors from the berries banana and brown sugar cream for the oats my partner had the french toast which she really enjoyed the granola we were curious what a 14 dollar granola tasted like it was just granola with fruits it was good but not with the money there were better options to be had

overall i loved breakfast and look forward to returning again

Address: 721 Government St Victoria, BC V8W 1W5 Canada
Review: the food was excellent the restaurant beautiful and the staff wonderful the tenderloin was great the pavlova to die for loved it and want to go back as soon as possible

Address: 721 Government St Victoria, BC V8W 1W5 Canada
Review: fine dining at its best food was spot on our waiter knew every little detail about their menu fancy interior perfect place for your date night highly recommend

Address: 721 Government St Victoria, BC V8W 1W5 Canada
Review:
since we regularly visit the fairmont empress we can say with confidence that it never dissatisfies every detail is correct they have it all dialled

we adore coming here for some cocktails beverages and their cuisine its wonderful for lunch brunch afternoon tea cocktails and dinner q at the fairmont empress is a genuine pleasure its a nice location

the bartenders are nice friendly and really knowledgable at all occasions the hosts provided excellent service the drinks and cocktails are outstanding we have had the empress lemonade empress old fashioned martini royale plus their popcorn is tasty unique and produced inhouse

in addition it is incredible that the empress gin thats their speciality is made in victoria live music and fantastic vibes can be found at q at the fairmont empress if youre seeking for an upgraded and elevated experience i highly recommend this location as you will not be disappointed thank you we shall return

Address: 602 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review:
beavertails is undoubtedly one of canadas most iconic and delicious pastries originating in ottawa and spreading across the country however i can understand why some people may only try it once due to its indulgent nature the pastry is made of fried dough and topped with a variety of toppings including cinnamon sugar chocolate hazelnut and maple butter among others while its undoubtedly a treat for those with a sweet tooth the sugar content may be too much for some

that being said for those willing to indulge beavertails is a musttry pastry its perfect for a special occasion or as a sweet treat on a lazy afternoon

Address: 602 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review: i was told president obama visited beavertail in ottawa so we wanted to try their food while visiting victoria  it was neat and fun  good tasty desert  dont expect seatings though as there is only couple of outdoor tables and a few chairs

Address: 602 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review: beaver tail and the poutine was delicious place was packed and we had to wait but it was worth it

Address: 602 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review:
this place is like a hole in the wall and absolutely delicious
id have to say the wait for me wasnt that long the staff were very friendly id have a garbage can on site to put your waste in after eating at the outdoor tables they serve mostly ice cream and dessert style pastry but they do have a poutine one and some wrapped hot dogs
i definitely like this place if you havent been there before you should at least try it once

Address: 602 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review:
price experience score pes 8510

service ok
food good
ambiance takeout

Address: 515 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K7 Canada
Review:
fiamo is a cozy yet chic italian restaurant  inside the restaurant is romantic dark and moody perfect for a date night evening cocktails or having an intimate night to yourself  they have a closed patio as well as an openaired one though unfortunately it wasnt open when i visited

leah was our server who was methodical in how she went about the steps of service  amy also stands out to me in her role as a support staffhost  overall the staff were quality laid back but also seemed to care for their work

i came for a sunday night dinner so regrettably the pasta dishes werent available reducing the choices in entree  however their rotating specials of the day were a nice addition ensuring greater variety  this also implies they utilize seasonal ingredients and come up with new dishes in addition to the set menu probably more fun for the kitchen staff too

i ordered their special of the day eggplant parmesan 26 which was delectable  i loved the addition of roasted vegetables including potatoes broccolini sweet peppers and carrots to brighten up the otherwise heavy dish

i would recommend this place for those in victoria and craving a good italian meal with a charming atmosphere

Address: 515 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K7 Canada
Review:
this place offers an exceptional experience that encapsulates the essence of italy within victoria fiamo consistently delivers satisfying and flavorful dishes making it a reliable choice for those seeking highquality cuisine during my recent visit i had the pleasure of savoring their delectable chicken parmesan which flawlessly embodies the essence of italian gastronomy in every bite the chicken was impeccably cooked ensuring it remained moist while the sauce boasted a delightful and irresistible flavor my dining companion opted for the classic italianamerican dish of spaghetti and meatballs which pays homage to the culinary traditions of southern italy according to their assessment fiamo did justice to that particular regions cuisine

however the absolute standout of the evening was our server while her name escapes me her distinctive long blond hair will undoubtedly serve as a recognizable characteristic when you visit this esteemed establishment she consistently exuded exceptional warmth and friendliness going above and beyond to engage us in meaningful conversation and cater to our every need with remarkable attentiveness her unwavering positive attitude and radiant smile which stretched from ear to ear left an indelible impression on us if you have a craving for authentic italian cuisine fiamo is unequivocally the place to be

Address: 515 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K7 Canada
Review: we ate dinner outside on a beautiful day the evening can be chilly but we sat right under the heater it was perfect my husband had their beet salad and loved it we shared some brussel sprouts and they were soooooo goodvery crispy on the outside and very flavorful we shared a pepperoni pizza and the meaty one cant remember the name both were delicious but the meaty one had a nice spice to it a great dinner to end the day

Address: 515 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K7 Canada
Review: fabulous dining experience having never been in victoria we combed through lots of reviews and dinner suggestions fiamo exceeded our best hopes everything from the very nice menu quiet atmosphere excellent wine list and outstanding specials made deciding on a choice a challenge fortunately we had a top notch server in leah to guide us every step of the way her wine choice was spot on like all of her recommendations we are only in town 2 nights we may just have to go back you will not be disappointed in this wonderful establishment

Address: 515 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K7 Canada
Review: service was great but the charcuterie board was sad it felt like they had transferred sliced meat from a costco platter to a 28 cheese board with all of the incredible local meets and cheese around this platter missed the mark brussels sprouts were great though and ive been back since this original review  pumpkin ravioli is a hit

Address: 530 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N6 Canada
Review: ive come here often and have ordered via skip to my home ive always had amazing food experiences here i have tried all the pizzas on the menu and quite a few of the monthly features they have all been amazing the staff have all been really amazing as well great service and great manager also they have a patio behind the restaurant where we were to have our dog with us oh ya the ice cream is seriously awesome too

Address: 530 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N6 Canada
Review: this is the best vegan pizza ive ever had  they know what theyre doing and you can taste it it was my first time here i loved that they have huge booths in the main area and seats back in their garden patio i decided to go for the classic margherita pizza the pizza was delicious and tasty to be honest you dont really miss the dairycheese on the pizza the pizzas crust was amazing and not soggy at all the service was good additionally  i got the vanilla bean ice cream pint to go and it was phenomenal all in all i highly recommend virtuous pie and i shall return to try other pizzas and items off their menu

Address: 530 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N6 Canada
Review: tasty italian salad candied walnuts were the best and detroit style pizza service was quick and we had our choice of seating vegans and nonvegans will enjoy the delicious pizzas mocktails were fantastic

Address: 530 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N6 Canada
Review: ive gone here numerous times for pizza 5 btw but tonight we stopped in for their vegan ice cream luckily nic was serving us and talked us in to trying the ballpark popcorn i actually said no first and they suggested i try a sample best decision ever so good thanks for the exceptional service and unique ice cream  the raspberry cheesecake was also good but if you have both eat it before the popcorn one

Address: 530 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N6 Canada
Review: some of the best vegan food ive had and definitely the best vegan mac and cheese we had the mac and cheese skillet the stranger wings pizza which was quite spicy and the pesto cbr the service was great and we highly recommend

Address: 199 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 1A2 Canada
Review:
the bistro is in a great area next to the famous dallas road close to ogden point the service is ok not bad not great the waiters just didnt seem to care much but were still polite i had a mac and cheese and it was so bland that i was shocked  i couldnt taste the cheese at all  so i can tell its not real cheese but rather some kind of powdery cheese  or fake cheese like velveeta and there was no salt at all  for 13 and for the tiny quantity i expected at least a regular mac and cheese and how on earth can you be a chef and mess up mac and cheese 

only a cheesecake for desert not even ice cream or a second option 

overall it is a place with so much potential but just not there at all they probably dont care since its a tourist trap

Address: 199 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 1A2 Canada
Review: excellent food friendly staff wonderful atmosphere and vibe and of course a fabulous view i wish they had more menu items and seating its a little pricey but that doesnt stop me from going back fish and chips are good and seafood chowder is also delicious the cocktails are really good too highly recommend

Address: 199 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 1A2 Canada
Review: this a great place to have dinner coffee or desserts after a walk on victoria s dallas rd waterfront good menu selections at reasonable prices great nachos tonight we had a glass of grafigna malbec with chocolate tartmmmm personnel is very friendly the view of the pier and the cruise boat terminal is very nice

Address: 199 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 1A2 Canada
Review: the first place i ate when i visited victoria for the first time two years ago excellent scenery fantastic ocean view patio delightful menu options and drinks now that i live here its become one of my favourite spots

Address: 199 Dallas Road Victoria, BC V8V 1A2 Canada
Review: lovely place feels like a dream drinking lavender cocktail in front of the blue ocean and snow mountain far away its so unreal

Address: 1025 Cook St Victoria, BC V8V 3Z7 Canada
Review:
ive been in this restaurant twice once sat outside and once inside
pros food is delicious and healthy
service is nice and friendly
decor and furniture is modern and relaxing colours
outside patio with heater
some beautiful and cute merchandise

con there is something wrong with audio insulation of the restaurant that makes it very noisy so if you need a cosy and quiet place that you can chat easily with friends its better to sit outside

Address: 1025 Cook St Victoria, BC V8V 3Z7 Canada
Review: our friends have been urging us to try this place but we had a ferry to catch and didnt want to be stuck downtown however after google guided us to a lessthanappealing cafe in christchurch we decided that we might as well try bear and joey i was dressed in sensible ferrytravelingandhiking garb and we didnt have a reservation the ma√Ætre d wasnt thrilled but seated us anyway one of the original reason i hesitated in coming was the menu but once we were there the menu made a lot more sense and we actually had a hard time choosing my weakness was breakfast sandwich but at the last minute i ordered the pork belly sandwich my partner ordered the fresh toast of course we think this place should get a michelin star for sure from ingredients to execution the food was amazing i usually only eat salad because it is healthy but actually hating it but the bear and joey kohlrabi and picked cabbage salad was amazing not boring at all i couldnt stop eating it and finished the salad before attacking the fennel and orange pork belly sandwich the bread was extra crusty which was quite enjoyable the pork belly had enough fat to melt in my mouth consuming this was a wondering experience there was a lot of mmm sounds and smiles coming from across the table while my partner enjoyed the french toast there was a lot more variety of fruit on the french toast that were not mentioned on the menu if this place was in vancouver i imagine it might take us a while to get a reservation well done

Address: 1025 Cook St Victoria, BC V8V 3Z7 Canada
Review:
the location is great patio is open and has heaters service was great food was absolutely amazing  thanks to the server for the french toast recommendation if you think you have had better french toast you would be wrong all their dishes are transformed the flat whites are also better than the bucks
thank you for a wonderful experience

Address: 1025 Cook St Victoria, BC V8V 3Z7 Canada
Review: we came for brunch on mothers day and we had such a great experience food was amazing recommend the french toast staff and owner very friendly love the atmosphere and location

Address: 1025 Cook St Victoria, BC V8V 3Z7 Canada
Review: i have eaten here multiple times with different groups of people dine in and take out and ive never had a bad experience ive tried the bread pudding and it was really different since it was savory but it was hands down the best item ive had there ive also tried the french toast photo below the breakfast sandwich and the salmon benny which were all delicious their coffee is great and they have decaf options the only reason i would not give this five stars is because it can be a little pricy

Address: 146 Kingston Street Victoria, BC V8V 1V4 Canada
Review: boy were we happy i am from alberta and rarely get the best fresh seafood i called last minute asking for a reservation and they managed to fit us right in ordered the crab cakes and halibut and the lady got chicken everything was delicious and we couldnt have asked for a perfect final date night on the island im definitely coming back next holiday thank you

Address: 146 Kingston Street Victoria, BC V8V 1V4 Canada
Review: we were staying near by while on vacation in victoria and really wanted to have a seafood dinner after reviewing a bunch of different places we decided on blue crab the menu looked quite good and the restaurant offered really nice views of the local harbor we started with an order of the chowder  fresh oysters and a local hazy ipa on tap the chowder was quite nice and had a good broth with rich flavors  my partner enjoyed the oysters but wasnt a huge fan of the in house hot sauce as for mains i ordered the local dungeness crab and my partner ordered the steamer pot the crab was fairly good the legs were a decent size  the head piece is just for show as they remove all material from the head i enjoyed the crab but still wonder if i should have ordered the alaskan crab legs as for the steamer pot we found it to be sadly a bit on the average side the sauce was alright and the assortment of seafood didnt seem as fresh as other places we tried while in the area the restaurant isnt too bad and the views are quite nice  if your staying in the area for a few days give this place a try for dinner

Address: 146 Kingston Street Victoria, BC V8V 1V4 Canada
Review: the atmosphere was nice staff were great a tad on the expensive side if you were to compare other restaurants with the same quality of food and service

Address: 146 Kingston Street Victoria, BC V8V 1V4 Canada
Review: nice restaurant with a really nice view food was nice servers were nice too remember to bring your paid parking ticket and theyll take it off your bill as part of the service to guests

Address: 146 Kingston Street Victoria, BC V8V 1V4 Canada
Review:
an amazing dining experience tonight  after 11 years of visiting this outstanding restaurant   the dining and service  experience is still great  the dungeness crab was perfectly prepared and the chefs selection of seasonal offerings was superb  kudos to our server dava for het attentive and thoughtful service and advice  and herknowledge of the ice wines and ports inthe rsstaraunts  cellar

an excellent dining experience supplemented  with knowledge courtesy and attention to detail  thank you blue crab for a memorable dining experience

Address: 500 Oswego Street Victoria, BC V8V 5C1 Canada
Review: wonderful meal  again the selections are always tasty and well presented  never disappointed and we were happy to bring two couples with us this time the firsttimers were as impressed with their selections as well  there is an accessible washroom single room which i believe is part of the hotel  unfortunately there are a few things that need to be improved to make it friendlier  the hook mounted on the door is too high for someone in a wheelchair as is the towel dispenser which requires hand motion to activate it  these things could be easily fixed by adding a lower coat hook and lowering the towel dispenser  the room is a good size and the there is an assist bar mounted beside the toilet

Address: 500 Oswego Street Victoria, BC V8V 5C1 Canada
Review: love going to the bar 500 for jazz nights its a cozy atmosphere and not too crowded the menu is small and the food is delicious our only requestrecommendation is to add a few monthly dining features to change things up a bit we would come more often then all in all a great venue

Address: 500 Oswego Street Victoria, BC V8V 5C1 Canada
Review: really enjoyed the pasta great texture on the noodles creative sauces and accompaniments tasty dessert wish the bread was grilledwarm you can taste the quality of the ingredients and everything was wellmade

Address: 500 Oswego Street Victoria, BC V8V 5C1 Canada
Review: excellent service and good food portions were on the smaller side for the prices but the food was creative and prepared well we brought our dog and sat in the outdoor patio area

Address: 500 Oswego Street Victoria, BC V8V 5C1 Canada
Review: we visited in the evening for the dine around town menu  the mushroom chowder was amazing and creamy  we had the sablefish entree which consisted of outstanding different flavours  i hope they consider adding the sablefish dinner to their permanent menu

Address: 893 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H7 Canada
Review: very nice little place friendly staff fast service great food we ordered the nonspicy ocean on the land for kids and thai spicy green curry chicken for adults both came out exactly how we liked fresh sea food authentic thai curry recommended

Address: 893 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H7 Canada
Review:
this is really good thai food for a fair price in the center of victoria bc
if you like thai food
this is the place to be
great service excellent food good price and delicious flavours
sookie always welcomes you with a smile

there is a lot of choice
and they also have their own spicy pepper sauce for 1250
try it and buy it
you can find it also in stores in victoria
the best

Address: 893 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H7 Canada
Review: we ordered 5 dishes they looked great but all were too salty for us but i love the atmosphere here

Address: 893 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H7 Canada
Review:
being in a relationship with a thai partner presents a delightful challenge when it comes to finding thai restaurants that evoke a sense of nostalgia and familiarity interestingly this particular establishment effortlessly meets all of his stringent criteria as he savored each bite he couldnt help but wonder about the chefs background to his astonishment the chef hailed from china but had dedicated time to master his craft in the northern regions of thailand precisely where my partner originates such unexpected alignment only heightened his appreciation for the culinary offerings

with utmost confidence i wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to those seeking an authentic thai dining experience the food itself is a testament to its genuineness while the ambiance exudes a quintessential thai atmosphere with whimsical touches that add a touch of enchantment furthermore the staffs warmth and affability further enhance the overall dining experience rest assured selecting this establishment will undoubtedly result in a memorable and gratifying culinary journey

Address: 893 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H7 Canada
Review:
wow amazing quality of food and a really exotic palette of flavors thai food this good is hard to come by truly artesanal in craftsmanship both visually and in taste also plentiful serving sizes

the servers were nothing but friendly and had wonderful suggestions the only complaint i had was that with menu offerings at these prices it seems a bit gimmicky to charge extra for things like plain rice while i understand charging for it i think it should come with the larger curry dishes especially considering the already steep pricing

nonetheless a really memorable restaurant experience and this place is often packed to the tee  expect a long wait and come hungry

Address: 239 Menzies Street Victoria, BC V8V 2G6 Canada
Review: a local hidden gem and one of my goto sushi places delicious food with fair pricing and the staff are always considerate and friendly i dont frequent the james bay area much these days but i will go out of my way to come here whenever i can

Address: 239 Menzies Street Victoria, BC V8V 2G6 Canada
Review:
great spot for quick food
very nice personnel and tasty food
miso soup is the same size as in combo

Address: 239 Menzies Street Victoria, BC V8V 2G6 Canada
Review: went their for a lunch date with my 5 year old and the lunch bento boxes were great quality and value sashimi and rolls were fresh and tasty so were other items and the prices very reasonable the only downside here is the place is quite small and doesnt have much seating but the service and food makes up for it

Address: 239 Menzies Street Victoria, BC V8V 2G6 Canada
Review: this was our granddaughters first experience with sushi and the entire time was momentous excellent and courteous staff and delicious food

Address: 239 Menzies Street Victoria, BC V8V 2G6 Canada
Review: i finally got around to trying sushi from matsuri and it was amazing everything was freshly made and you can taste the difference the staff were wonderful and the prices were fair they have quite a variety of gluten free items which can be hard to find for sushi they were also very knowledgeable and let me know what was and wasnt safe for celiacs definitely will be going back

Address: 760 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review: i have been here so many times now and also ordered takeout many times as well absolutely love tacofinos tacos my favorite is by far the yam taco and burrito i love how crunchy the yam taco is all that cabbage and a very simple tasty dressing everything that ive eaten here has been amazing this place is almost always busy so come early or order ahead staff is always very friendly and helpful and i also love the side pickup window which is separate from the front till order area so you dont have to wait in line with everyone who is ordering their meals the one downside is where the tillorder area is it is a huge bottleneck and can be very crowded at times

Address: 760 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review:
incredible tacos
found myself pulled here by my sister while visiting her this weekend popped in line there often is a short line i hear and had our order taken then delivered shortly thereafter a number tag and bottle of water with a cute blue cap is handed to me before we head to our table the server recommended the crispy chicken taco my sister swore to me that the steak taco was the best id ever have the former was great but the latter was indeed true get a steak taco
bonus points for local phillips brewery on tap modern aesthetic and low key vibe brought it all together
highly recommend checking this place out

Address: 760 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review:
so damn good 

nice vibes in a convenient spot downtown for some killer mexican food the offerings might not be authentic but theyre reaaaaally good  get over it loved everything i had here and even the margarita delivered hot sauces have my mouthwatering at the memory of them

definitely a spot ill be coming back to

Address: 760 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review:
eating at tacofino on canada day was a awesome experience
it was my first visit  the employees created a terrific vibe it was so keen to watch the employee prepare the burrito   it was a very satisfying meal burrito was a bit messy to eat hence why napkins are in abundance

i definitely will return to this restaurant

Address: 760 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8W 1N9 Canada
Review:
1st time here my favourite place in yyj 
the sirloin taco is amaaaaaaaazing so tasty  great service and staff good music too will be back to try some more reasonable price quality ingredients

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: this restaurant offers stunning views of the water and city skyline the food is absolutely delicious with a menu that offers plenty of options to choose from but what really sets this restaurant apart is the atmosphere  its the perfect spot to catch up with friends over a meal and drinks the staff are friendly and welcoming overall i highly recommend checking out this restaurant for a memorable dining experience in vancouver

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
i recently dined at cactus club restaurant and wanted to share my thoughts although there was a delay in receiving our food the staff was incredibly friendly and made us feel welcome throughout our visit the restaurant itself had a great ambiance and provided a pleasant environment for our meal
one area of improvement would be the selection of nonalcoholic drinks which was somewhat limited it would be nice to see a wider variety of options in that regard on the other hand i must commend the kitchen on the fantastic calamari it was cooked to perfection and had a delicious flavor that left me wanting more
however i found the ravioli with shrimp to be a bit too sweet for my taste while it may appeal to those who enjoy sweeter flavors i personally would have preferred a more balanced taste
overall my experience at cactus club restaurant was positive with the standout being the delightful calamari despite the minor setbacks i would still recommend visiting for a friendly atmosphere and memorable dining experience

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review:
a very large restaurant with gorgeous views over the harbour the staff was very kind and the food was great though my chicken sandwich was better than the tofu bowl which lacked sauce and was a bit dry really good fries the cocktail menu was large and the cocktails themselves were very tasty too

while the views were lovely the restaurant was very loud and it could be difficult to hear the person sitting across from you

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: its not a fancy 5 star restaurant but for what it is it was awesome i had salmon for dinner and it was delicious i sat in the dining room with a water view most people wore sunglasses because the sun was bright and bold at 8pm at night my waiter was awesome i wish i remembered his name its a crowed place so make reservations early they have outside eating and since its right on the water side its a great place to take a stroll afterwards

Address: 1085 Canada Place Vancouver, BC V6C 3E1 Canada
Review: great food great environmentvibe and reasonable prices food was a bit slow to come out and service was somewhat lacking but overall i really enjoyed my evening there a reservation ahead of time will make it much easier to get seated

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review: i came here last week for happy hour the happy hour prices are reasonable the food was good and came out pretty quick staff were friendly half of the outside patio was closed on a hot day so we had to sit inside but overall decent experience

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
came here with my partner during happy hour we were really happy with the happy hour menu the prices were reasonable for what we ordered and the service was great we ordered the
blackened creole chicken it was delicious we loved the mashed potatoes that came with it we also got the tuna poke bowl it was fresh and all the ingredients worked super well together excited to come again

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
the food was absolutely amazing especially the delicious avocado salad i tried baja fish tacos for they very first time and it was a little spicy but incredibly delicious
everything was perfect

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review: one of the only places not short staffed what a pleasure the food was amazing and they couldnt do enough for us

Address: 1125 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 3L7 Canada
Review:
first off nicci our server was awesome the drinks appys and dinner was amazing
thank for a nice evening to help celebrate our 29th anniversary when making our reservations it asked if it was a special occasion l and it was put in that it was our anniversary so we were bit disappointed that there was no mention of it

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review: the meals we ordered were awesome but man it took forever for our food to arrive i was starving and totally forgot to snap a pic  but hey it was absolutely delicious no complaints there the restaurant had such a cool vibe and my kids had a blast posing with all the animal decorations for pictures

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review: what a great spot for some breakfast welcoming staff cozy atmosphere great coffee and cappuccino staff go above and beyond to accommodate customizations and time accommodations all their shredded hash breakfasts are absolutely delicious and packed with nutrition i personally ask for well done hash so its nice and sharp when they flip it over

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review:
came in for breakfast with a group of 11 and kids we requested separate tables as we were going to pay separately but they offered 1 big table together as they were quite empty first issue kids were not prioritized even though we mentioned that they were hungry and adult can wait server only took drinks order then prioritized smaller table to get their meal order as it will take short time to do so compared to our table regardless they were seated after us last thing was they added gratuity to our bill without prior information which left us no choice but to pay thats was the main reason we wanted separate table and being charge for service that we considered not there
other than those issues that left us disappointed food taste was incredible freshly prepared ingredients with jam sauceeverything taste amazing worth to visit for food only

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review: you definitely gotta try this out we knew this diner has a special history which i can tell why locals keep coming back mesmerizing decor and menu is extensive it was hard to decide where to sit and what to order we tried their delicious breakfast menu generous portion and we were so full that we needed to walk it out the staff was humble and all their recommendations were spot on must try

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review:
this just may have been the best breakfast ive ever ordered at a restaurant we ordered the berry waffles and the poutine benny and my oh my were they delicious the contrast between the sweet and savory meals was delightful my wife and i shared our meals the waffles were honestly the best waffles i have ever eaten each bite nearly brought a tear to my eye from being so tasty the only complaint is that i live about 1000 miles away from the ruby  this restaurant alone tempts me to uproot my family and move to victoria just to eat breakfast here every week

a side note we were with our 17 month old baby and the staff was sooo kind and accommodating with him

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: what a great find such great service fun atmosphere and omg the food i think i have found a new breakfast favourite when in victoria a must try is the lavender latte so many delicious dishes to choose from we didnt see 1 unhappy customer while here and we loved every moment

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: the service was fantastic and food was incredible great place for the whole family even the wee ones theres is something for everybody without a doubt going back for seconds real soon hope everyone enjoys some food with family n friends enjoy

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: tacos chicken and waffles duck hash and the meal or the day  very good but a long wait you must be patient if you want to come here can take 3040 min wait but it has a nice sitting area good food though was worth the wait

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review:
what an awesome little gem hidden in plain sight lol didnt have to wait too long for a table service was top notch friendly and prompt im a waffle  pancake  girl and the ruby did not disappoint me caramelized bananas  roasted pecans and bourbon syrup on top of a stack of mouth watering waffles  hubby had an omelet with bacon  mushrooms  and cheese 
thank you ruby

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: went here for brunch the food was amazing  the portions were huge the potatoes are the perfect crispy fluffy ratio the duck just fell off the bone  the sauce that same with it paired perfectly well would definitely go back  recommended only downside is that its small so not lots of seating but still worth a visit the staff were also helpful  friendly

Address: 556a Pandora Ave Pandora St. Victoria, BC V8W 1N7 Canada
Review: a quaint place with a few tables for unique thai cuisines like pork belly and lemongrass chicken dumplings little buns stuffed with crispy chicken is a musttry the delicious spicy sauce adds just the right heat

Address: 556a Pandora Ave Pandora St. Victoria, BC V8W 1N7 Canada
Review:
very polite staff quick service ordered one order of pork belly dumplings  one special dumplings which was lemongrass chicken the hot sauce they use is so overpowering i cant really taste the different between the actual flavor of the fillings in the two types of dumplings didnt know they were going to be served deep fried has a very westernized spin on the dish this is my fault for not doing research prior to walking in the establishment

its fine for a quick in and out appetizer not filling for a meal at all

Address: 556a Pandora Ave Pandora St. Victoria, BC V8W 1N7 Canada
Review: decided to stop in here to grab a quick bite while exploring around victoria im glad we did they had a great special that was dumplings and a beer and it was a warm day we got the order of pork belly dumplings and the beer i havent really had dumplings like this before but my wife had so i was pretty excited this place didnt disappoint the chili oil that was on these and gave them a pleasant kick they were nice and full and cooked so nicely they held their shape and they didnt get soggy the filling was delicious and juicy it was a great little shop with friendly people and a great special i wish we could have bought some of the dumplings to take back with us but we didnt have a cooler

Address: 556a Pandora Ave Pandora St. Victoria, BC V8W 1N7 Canada
Review:
ordered the chicken bao  chicken dumplings and they were delicious the sauce served with both were just as good

only issue is the wait time for take out however the wait was worth it

Address: 556a Pandora Ave Pandora St. Victoria, BC V8W 1N7 Canada
Review:
it was our first time at dumpling drop and will certainly not be the last the dumplings and the chilli sauce were amazing we came here for lunch we ordered the vegan dumplings and the yuzu brussels sprouts honestly we werent expecting the dumplings to be fried but we really enjoyed them

the dumplings were crunchy and packed with great flavours this place is excellent for a quick stop and bite in my opinion its more of a takeout spot as there are limited seating inside but nonetheless i appreciated the charm of this place its cute and comfortable they also had some cute dumpling drop merch that you can buy the hostess at the cashier was friendly and brought our foods quite fast once we ordered additionally they have a large selection of frozen dumplings to buy and take home

all in all id come back again i would totally recommend eating here and go for some appetizing dumplings

Address: 2656 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8T 4E4 Canada
Review: overall great experience started with a condensed milk shaft that i absolutely loved and every dish that followed was great i ordered the pork and the texture was perfect very soft and dissolved in your mouth the broccoli and the cheesecake were also super tasty i ordered three dishes to share one cheesecake and one cookie and it was more than enough for two people so i recommend sharing service was great we sat at the bar and they were very attentive and helpful when explaining portion size etc i would definitely recommend this place

Address: 2656 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8T 4E4 Canada
Review: this has got to be the best fried chicken sandwich ive ever had it was juicy and crispy and the sauces were all finger licking good the menu changes often too so i cant wait to come back when it does

Address: 2656 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8T 4E4 Canada
Review: completely delicious with layered flavors wife said the cheese cake was true best she ever had treat your self

Address: 2656 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8T 4E4 Canada
Review: following the high rating on google i made my way to this inconspicuous little gem in the quadra village of victoria its easy to pass it on the street so keep looking if you miss it first time the food is some of the best ive ever tasted i got there in time for happy hour and tasted two amazing appetizers for 8 total one was made from only chickpea flour and deep fried to perfection served with a delicious spicy sauce the second delicious piece was grilled pork belly the flavour was fabulous i ordered the kalettes veggie main course and again the flavours didnt disappoint rich and unusual while being amazing my server strongly recommended the chocolate dessert which i cannot say enough about it was sweet salty creamy and decadent without being overpowering overall the meal was 5 star the vibe of the place is calm and smooth while being friendly and relaxed i will definitely be back

Address: 2656 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8T 4E4 Canada
Review: delicious food with an intimate atmosphere the kamut chicken slider and the wasabi fries were unexpected highlights there definitely were more blistered peppers in two orders than four people could tackle so id start with one order next time the pork belly bite had amazing flavours but was more of a jerky than other pork belly dishes ive had before the parisian gnocchi main was delicious but extremely heavy  we thought it might have been deep fried fun little place for a girls night out

Address: 944 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: absolutely incredible meal  from service to atmosphere to quality of the fare we had the lamb fish of the day steak and cured meats which are made in house and cheeses everything was fresh well balanced and very flavourful one of our new favourite staples in victoria

Address: 944 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review:
no surprise that the food and service was amazing a medium sized menu with a nice variety of choices most have the option to get half portions so you try a few different dishes easily enough i assumed the full portion would be smaller due to being a fancy joint but it was very filling

i had the pork cutlet which was mouth watering i tried the beat salad and carbonara pasta as well  both amazing

the only thing to complain about and you can probably tell from the photos is the lighting if its so dark your wait staff carry flashlights to read the menu its probably too dark

would be happy to return

Address: 944 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: my husband and i enjoyed several beautiful meals at cafe brio when we lived in victoria 15 years ago while visiting the island this past weekend we decided to go back this place remains just as exceptional as we remember the food and wine is outstanding the atmosphere is perfectly moody and interesting but its the service that really sets it apart it truly feels like every staff member is committed to making your experience great our favourite restaurant in victoria we will be back again and again

Address: 944 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: reservations recommended went with the brio family style shared dinner  67 per person chefs choice 6 dishes overall since its random ill speak to what we were served clam chowder cup meh soup on the lighter side new england style romaine lettuce salad ok garnished with crumbs garlic sharp cheese charcuterie board with pate good bresaola good rabbit terrine delicious sausage good mains gnocchi good duck with beets yum fish with pancetta and fingerling potatoes yum party of 4  bottle of wine  380 not including tips overall id stick with ordering charcuterie  individual mains though the variety was nice serviceour waitress was good though didnt bring the requested balsamic vinegar and olive oil

Address: 944 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: this place was great the atmosphere perfect the bartender was friendly and made my friend a custom drink the boards are deliciousthe duck with the brie and quince jelly was a 1010 combo my only regret was not getting the bartenders name to put in the review because he was both authentic and kind

Address: 769 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1G9 Canada
Review: we had steamed rock fish and eggplant with ground pork both are very authentic and tasty service was very good and got good recommendations we highly recommend this place

Address: 769 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1G9 Canada
Review: what a wonderful surprise  fantastic tasty fresh food of good proportions cooked by a 30 year experienced beijing chef  service was fabulous with a very humble kind gracious friendly and gentle server  didnt have to wait at all for food to be prepared hot and fresh even though they were busy with a constant stream of online delivery orders and dinein patrons humble environment which only makes the experience more of an amazing meal

Address: 769 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1G9 Canada
Review: amazing food and service the special fish is so unique and tasty i really recommend it

Address: 769 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1G9 Canada
Review:
good service but the food was done incorrectly some dish done with wrong sauce or cut vegetable in a wrong way that completely not washed or meat under cooked

according to the  menu some dishes are prolevel and not regular home chief can handle but the food we got today is not up to average chinese parent level

the food quality is hard to justify these high score reviews maybe something went wrong with their chief or management

Address: 769 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1G9 Canada
Review: awesome chinese restaurant with authentic food from north east china love the dumplings and steamed fish

Address: 911 Yates Street Suite 180 Victoria, BC V8V 4X3 Canada
Review:
cant tell enough how good this place is the burger is half price after 9 pm with drink purchased such a good deal kids friendly restaurant with kids menu
we always take kids for the kids meal and treat ourselves to beer and burger even with their regular price is still worth it i love the tuna burger off the hook its so yummy my husband loves their big dipper burger with wagyu beef
the after 9 deal you have to be there and put your name in the waitlistwait to get inwait for burgersend up you gotta be there for at least more than an hour its good when you go hang out im with friend not suggest yo ho with kids for late night deal

Address: 911 Yates Street Suite 180 Victoria, BC V8V 4X3 Canada
Review: i had a very disappointing first experience with the food i wanted to come back for happy hour and enjoy the outdoor terrace with my dog service dog the waitress didnt want my dog to go on the patio its the only patio in town where your dog service dog or not is not welcome i wont set foot here again as much for the welcome the service as the food i do not recommend this establishment at all

Address: 911 Yates Street Suite 180 Victoria, BC V8V 4X3 Canada
Review:
amazing burger  59 being bison and chorizo with lots of goodies on it  onion rings were great  chicken and waffle chefs special ordered by my spouse was very very good
i love this place

Address: 911 Yates Street Suite 180 Victoria, BC V8V 4X3 Canada
Review:
visiting from the lower mainland got the spender burger with half side salad pralines and blue cheese and bin 4 fries

absolutely awesome so many flavours and couldnt be more impressed the fact that you can get a gourmet side salad with this burger is impressive the burger itself was great fresh vegetables and tasty meat
moist and delicious we also tried the red onion rings very good also  impressive amount of options my wife had the ahi tuna burger which she loved i would highly recommend you try this restaurant

Address: 911 Yates Street Suite 180 Victoria, BC V8V 4X3 Canada
Review:
ordered the black and blue burger wpotato crisps and jalapeno dip this dip is awesome
 you may need an extra napkin burgers kinda a messy
 use knife and fork to finish of the last morsel burger falls apart towards the end

staff was friendly professional and responsive still were not obtrusive i appreciated that

covid protocols in place and not arduous respectfully requested my contact details

my fourth visit to this location my best burger choice to date

Address: 1414 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G1 Canada
Review: we had such a nice night  we came for a comedy night and while we had to buy tickets they were very reasonably priced  the food was pretty good drinks were good too  i ordered a cocktail i didnt like and they happily exchanged it for another  the atmosphere and service were awesome  great job the mint team with ok dope

Address: 1414 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G1 Canada
Review:
i recently dined at the mint in downtown victoria and i must say i was thoroughly impressed the guest skills of the staff were exceptional and made me feel welcome and appreciated from the moment i walked in 

as for the food i highly recommend the tofu dish  it was simply delicious  the dish was perfectly cooked and had a nice blend of flavors that left me wanting more the chef truly knows how to work their magic in the kitchen 

the ambiance of the restaurant is also worth mentioning  it was cozy warm and inviting making it the perfect spot for a night out with friends or a romantic dinner 

overall i highly recommend the mint to anyone looking for an exceptional dining experience in downtown victoria with friendly and attentive guest skills and mouthwatering dishes like the tofu its a mustvisit destination for foodies and those seeking a memorable night out

Address: 1414 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G1 Canada
Review: really nice ambience and lovely vibe especially love the convenience of the location and characterful entrance nonetheless nothing stood out to me when it came to food or drinks quite overpriced for what it turned out to be in my opinion but kuddos to the lovely staff who work here who were nothing but kind to us

Address: 1414 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G1 Canada
Review: food was very presentable but hard to order with unusual to me names the drinks were amazing

Address: 1414 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G1 Canada
Review:
imagine this its a friday night at 11pm  and as much as victoria is a cute town there really isnt that many places to get any food late night that isnt fast food or pizza

enter the mint a full curry menu through late night incredible ordered the lamb curry plate and it was delicious

Address: 614 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2H4 Canada
Review:
ive been to this place a few times already and enjoyed every one of my visit it is extremely busy so i highly recommend you make reservations ahead of time you likely wont be able to get in without reservation because you have to go thru security like the airport and they wont even open the locked door if you dont have reservation

the menu items are plentiful with a wide range of choices to satisfy all different dietary needs the price is also cheap compare to other restaurants the staff there were all very nice and accommodating the building itself has over a hundred years of history inside the restaurant they have some rather interesting old photos hanging on the wall make sure you ask the staff there about some of the more unique photos

Address: 614 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2H4 Canada
Review: service was pretty slow but the wait is worth it the food is excellent and the prices are more than reasonable definitely get reservations ahead of time they do not accept discover or american express cards for payment this information was not available to me ahead of time be advised that you need to go through security screening and surrender your identification card while you eat

Address: 614 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2H4 Canada
Review:
best kept secret in victoria reservation recommended

the food was excellent and the service was amazing great food and low prices what more could you ask for

we went there for lunch one day and breakfast another day both meals were perfect and under 20

be sure you plan extra time to walk around the building and see all the beautiful stained glass windows

Address: 614 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2H4 Canada
Review: i had breakfast there a couple of days ago while visiting visiting victoria both the food and service so professional were very good prices were extremely reasonable  excellent value  i wish there were more places like that its nice to sit at a table with proper tablecloth and special tableware designed specially for them it was a lovely experience

Address: 614 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2H4 Canada
Review:
wonderful food reasonable prices and a great location i had scotch eggs and mushroom and onion soup the scotch eggs were mildly spicy crispy on the outside gooey yolks on the inside the way i like them the mushroom onion soup was creamy and gently spiced service was friendly and fast reservations recommended white tablecloths and napkins

will definitely return next time im in town

Address: 536 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K8 Canada
Review: really enjoyed the tapas experience it is wonderful having so many different types of food all the dishes were really delicious and  very different the service was very good and the atmosphere  was interesting the one thing that  they need to do is  get more  comfortable chairs  i will be back to try try some more dishes

Address: 536 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K8 Canada
Review: this place is a gem its intimate and cozy with a beautiful dark ceiling brick walls and old victoria charm the staff are lovely the food is really good i enjoyed a cocktail and a glass of red wine i was able to ask for differences between wines to make a great choice the food specials were tasty they work around allergies im happy here

Address: 536 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K8 Canada
Review: without question the most incredible dining experiences i have had we did the tapas for two and wow 9 courses of tapas so bring your appetite the variety is just amazing and you just cant miss the warm bacon wrapped dates in fact we ate those before we remembered to take a photo they have a happy hour a great selection of drinks and its a nice atmosphere i will never visit victoria again without coming here for a meal the tapas for 2 is a great value as well in my opinion highly recommend coming here

Address: 536 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K8 Canada
Review: super covid friendly and insanely delicious we ordered basically the whole menu plus cocktails and wine and paid less than 150 for an epic feast for 2 people extremely yummy  highly recommended

Address: 536 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1K8 Canada
Review: food was very good highly recommend service was very quick lovely atmosphere and decor

Address: 768 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z1 Canada
Review: what a great quirky little spot for drinks the name makes sense its a dark cool spot downstairs and is totally like a cenote it was recommended by a bartender in the city for good cocktails and a relaxed vibe and they were right we had such a great time and the bartenders made great drinks for us some classics and a few custom cocktails inexpensive as well which is always a bonus we didnt eat so we cant comment on the food but the menu looked super fun

Address: 768 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z1 Canada
Review:
the house salad was underdresseddry with little flavour the baked brie bread jam olives and roasted garlic was all delicious but wasnt exactly made to be eaten together

appreciated the gluten free bread option but likely wouldnt go back

Address: 768 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z1 Canada
Review: this is a fabulous hole in the wall for small plates to share and unique drink specials my favorite lately is their double gin and tonic especially happy hour good nonalcoholic options available too

Address: 768 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z1 Canada
Review: cozy little bar tucked away under the stairs in the heart of downtown tasty cocktails and great atmosphere jess was our server and she went above and beyond to make sure were having a great time great place for a date or to catch up with a friend

Address: 768 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z1 Canada
Review:
friendly staff delicious food large portions and reasonable prices all the things youll find at cenote

the interior is cozy and makes for a great place to get together with friends for an after work drink and dinner

their hotdogs are a delicious option for lunch as well lots of tables large space and well laid out

food was served quickly drinks were topped up reasonably

definitely recommend and will return

Address: Market Square 140-156 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: truly a hidden gem in victoria as an indonesian this place is quite authentic but the menu is pretty limited everything was prepared skillfully and incredibly tasty a bit of warning for those who has a low heat tolerance everything is a tad spicy i will definitely be back next time im in victoria

Address: Market Square 140-156 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
has to be my favourite
food in victoria so far it tasted amazing but its very spicy we had the green curry and the spicy hard boiled egg dish and wow we will be coming back soon good prices 1320dishand great location the ownercook is very kind too i would recommend to anyone

Address: Market Square 140-156 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: good indonesian dishes green cury w prawn is a lodeh dish yummy my son had a chicken satay he loves it gado2 wrap is good as well picture attached look for previous review for parking guide if you come here just for ayo eat like myself the place is facing inside of the entire building 2nd floor eat anywhere on the open courtyard bottom floor ty chef bana for good dishes ps you can add any extra meat extra egg just tell the chef cheers mate

Address: Market Square 140-156 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: the best meal ive had while visiting victoria i took the spring roll and satay chicken they were absolutely amazing very flavorful the included rice was out of this world 100 recommend this hidden gem

Address: Market Square 140-156 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
i really like this place
delicious meal reasonable price the owner is super nice good atmosphere
they can get busy quite quickly around lunchtime i recommend planning ahead

Address: 680 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C9 Canada
Review:
i really enjoyed this place very authentic with a nice family run vibe food was healthy and delicious plus the little buns served with the dish were exceptional

well worth a visit

Address: 680 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C9 Canada
Review:
love it love it love it i have been a regular customer here for the last 5 years and came with different friends  we were never disappointed

i love pork momos   so delicious

their meat is supplied by local island farms all curries are cooked with cream of cashew are gluten free an dairy free

nice calming atmosphere dalai lama quotes on the walls are a very nice touch

next to a lot of parking spots  never had an issue

the staff is always friendly and attentive

Address: 680 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C9 Canada
Review:
pathetic experience no water asked no cutlery given  you would have to stand up and go to their plates section to get cutlery
asked for momo they present you a plate of oil and that to broken and raw pieces
in reply you get an feedback thats how it is

Address: 680 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C9 Canada
Review:
tried calling to the restaurant to make an advance order before stopping by at noon got answering machine stating closed dates for dec 2021  which is weird for a first time customer in late oct 2022 didnt leave a message figuring it probably wont make too much of a difference not going to bother with delivery services as nowadays it costs way more to use them when my temp job is one block away

came in server is quite prompt taking my order as soon as she took orders from customers before me which is fair food came in reasonable time considering it looks like one server  one cook in the establishment i could have done takeout but like the unique ambiance of the place  wanted to try a dine in lunch experience

lunch lamb curry was amazing packed a delicious punch in flavor medium spice heat i ordered is quite up there  was close to my level limit wondered how spicy hot is

im laughing mentally because my exboyfriend with absolute zero heat tolerance would not thrive unless the restaurant offers a zero heat option on a serious note if anyone has a severe lack of spicy heat tolerance please triple check with the server upon ordering

server was free enough to walk around with a water pitcher but never stopped by to check upon me for first taste or anything else  did tell her when i walked to the till to get my bill to pay about compliments to the chef  my gratitude for the tasty  filling meal that was obviously made with humble tlc

the meal is a real winner good value  the spice did well to clear my nasal congestion  nagging postcommon cold cough definitely will become my go to lunch spot whenever i neglect to pack a filling meal to work  will recommend for dinners too

Address: 680 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C9 Canada
Review:
prepare to be dazzled by the unforgettable experience at the tibetan kitchen cafe from the moment you step foot inside youll be transported to the enchanting streets of lhasa the alluring aromas and authentic flavors will awaken your senses and evoke cherished memories of tibetan cuisine

the culinary journey begins with a symphony of flavors that dance harmoniously on your palate each dish is a masterpiece carefully crafted to capture the essence of traditional tibetan fare i havent encountered such delectable tibetan food that closely resembles what youd savor within the country itself its a true culinary revelation

but hold on it gets even better the exceptional service provided by the wait staff adds an extra touch of brilliance to the entire experience during our visit for a delightful lunch my dining companion who was new to tibetan cuisine was guided through the menu with such grace and expertise the attentive server patiently explained each dish ensuring he made an educated selection that perfectly suited his preferences

the lamb curry was a revelation  an explosion of flavors that left us craving for more in fact my dining companion enjoyed it so much that he couldnt resist requesting a second bowl of rice to savor every last drop of the exquisite sauce

as for my choice the tiger prawn shaptak it was a divine revelation each succulent prawn was generously coated in a tantalizing blend of spices that delighted my taste buds with every single bite the dish was an impeccable balance of bold and harmonious flavors

while we didnt try the various flavored momos ourselves we couldnt help but notice the blissful expressions on the faces of fellow diners as they savored these delicate treats their joyous reactions were a testament to the sheer magnificence of tibetan kitchen cafes culinary offerings

if you crave a thrilling dining adventure with a spicy foreign flare tibetan kitchen cafe is an absolute mustvisit destination the authenticity warmth and richness of the experience will leave you with lasting memories and a desire to return for more so dont hesitate  embark on this gastronomic voyage and be enchanted by the magic of tibetan cuisine

Address: 1234 S Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review:
a place that doesnt serve french fries

and i enjoyed my visit

highlights
reasonable prices
nice patio view
dog friendly patio
pretty tasty food
roomy accessible washrooms

consider
could get busy because of the nice location if pursuing patio seating
fewer washrooms

friends and i went on a sunday at noon it opens at noon and we had no problem grabbing a table for four the menu is a good size definitely give it a look two of my friends got the nachos with added protein they usually like their nachos overdone and my friends were pleased with their food i had a bite of nachos with the added chicken i highly recommend that for sharing or solo the chicken was quite reasonably sprinkled over the nachos with some love not just lightly it was tasty not too salty for me

now please excuse my photos the blue umbrella really adds a colour filter and everything looks so blue i had potato salad as a side to my chicken wings it was a normal potato salad absolutely enjoyed the louie blue flavour of the wings though which had a very slight heat my friend that is sensitive to spicy flavors could tolerate it well it was very flavourful my only complaint all comes down to preference is that the generous and lovely sauce removed the crispness of the chicken wings but the sauce made it up for the lack of crisp server was wonderful able to check in on us as the customers started arriving more and more

i would come again to sample the pizza it looked appetizing

Address: 1234 S Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: had the prawns with coconut curry and it was the best our waitress was amazing so helpful and knowledgeable she understood celiac disease and cheerfully told us they have a designated fryer parking was right next to it and so easy to pay

Address: 1234 S Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: delicious food awesome staff and views when we went for dinner here they were short staffed and yet the staff were friendly and kept things moving a very enjoyable dinner

Address: 1234 S Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: the nachos were simply delicious and hearty very friendly service but took a little extra time to order and get food dog friendly  it overlooks the harbour delicious cocktails the orange margarita was great

Address: 1234 S Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: artisanstyle pizza and lots of choice of pizzas great views of the water  we even saw a seal whilst we were eating we had the mushroom pizza which was delicious and the servers were very friendly and accommodating four stars only because the food was a little slow and the ambience inside was slightly dingy

Address: 609 Yates St Victoria, BC V8W 1L1 Canada
Review: very much enjoyed a recent visit and service odd that they ran out of white wine early that night  somewhat disappointed by inconsistent sear on pierogies and extremely tough exterior to otherwise tasty meatballs maybe intentional sauerkraut bland ive actually made better at home apparently we missed news of the sour cream shortage we were allotted a few thimbles full  confusing menu many ways to order the same thing but at different prices  pierogi flavors very successful caesar cocktail very good

Address: 609 Yates St Victoria, BC V8W 1L1 Canada
Review: great poutine we got the basic bee  loved it had the pierogi sampler and loved trying the different flavors fun classic bar ambience

Address: 609 Yates St Victoria, BC V8W 1L1 Canada
Review:
ordered the pierogi sampler dude wheres my diner pierogi poutine borscht and the hulk smash pierogis every single bite of all the dishes was fantastic

the pierogi sampler was delicious a little bit of everything for the indecisive or curious like myself the hulk smash pierogis were so tasty i had to order more a little spice with every bite

dude wheres my diner was everything french toast buffalo chicken pierogis could be the bacon confit was a beautiful touch the cream cheese complimented everything nicely and the jalape√±obacon chutney tied it all together i cannot say enough good things about this dish

the borscht was to die for it was rich and smooth the cabbage and beets played beautifully together and every bite was a treat

finally the poutine was also very good

i highly recommend a stop here for whatever tickles your fancy my only complaint was sold out hats i was very much looking forward to being a tourist and promoting my favorite pierogi bar oh well this works too

Address: 609 Yates St Victoria, BC V8W 1L1 Canada
Review: first time at this restaurant  the perogies were delicious as well as the sulty meatballs  the beet  kale salad was ok as the beets were a tad on the hard side definitely enjoyed the drinks  will be coming back to try other items  good value for the money

Address: 609 Yates St Victoria, BC V8W 1L1 Canada
Review: quick good service the food was good we got the tin tater poutine large in size to share 2 of us  it was the perfect size

Address: 620 Trounce Alley Victoria, BC V8W 1K3 Canada
Review: we had dinner there and we had no regret about it food was delicious specially the pasta was a pleasure the service was so nice definitely a must go at victoria island

Address: 620 Trounce Alley Victoria, BC V8W 1K3 Canada
Review:
starting off with the appetizer of papas bravas was okay the tomato sauce was slightly a bit too much and the potatoes werent as fried to standard so it wasnt quite crispy the fritos was really really good highly recommend especially the fried jicama was a unique touch the moroccan chicken was good nothing special though slightly bland chicken this chicken dish had couscous base was well done and seasoned the gambas con coco  came
with focaccia it was a 710 good the sauce was delicious

Address: 620 Trounce Alley Victoria, BC V8W 1K3 Canada
Review: had a divine time here my partner and i shared the tapa platter for two and it was the perfect amount of food we left feeling refreshed and satiatedthe service was equally as good as were the drinks definitely would recommend this spot for a delicious spanish meal

Address: 620 Trounce Alley Victoria, BC V8W 1K3 Canada
Review: on recommendation from front desk at our hotel decided to go to the tapa bar saturday late afternoon    sat at the bar  had drinks and an appetizer  bartender was a very attentive lady friendly and professional   had such a fun time decided to have dinner there on sunday had margarita pziza and chicken cubanette  both very tasty  drinks as well  fun spot to enjoy a drink and some food

Address: 620 Trounce Alley Victoria, BC V8W 1K3 Canada
Review:
trounce alley is a neat little evening destination  tapa bar was buzzing this saturday evening  there were even diners sitting in the patio  music was loud but not too much that you cant have a conversation the lighting was pleasantly dim to set the ambiance fire will from time to time light up the corner in the open kitchen and there was a candle in each table
our host and server were very friendly and made you feel at ease all around good vibes with the staff
we ordered the pap√°s with both sauces the mixed olives with focaccia the fried fish bites and the roasted eggplant in marinara
also had a nice spanish beer to wash it down  everything was on point and delicious  the four tapas were enough for the 2 of us to share this evening
would go there again to try the other dishes and the desserts

Address: Market Square 1435 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
