i had a rare monday off and we happened to be downtown so we popped in here for brunch id heard good things and my expectations were exceeded from the friendly attentive service fresh coffee and timely refills helpful menu recommendations everything sounded so good we finally narrowed down our choices my wife had the fuego benny and i went with the fried chicken and cornbread french toast with side of blueberry coulis
the flavours and textures and presentation are spot on
it was all just so good and we left happy and very full
special thanks to our server michelle for excellent service
cant wait to come back

Address: Market Square 1435 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
i decided to try the harvest breakfast and it did not disappoint it was a tasty dish with a hint of spice that gave it an extra kick i also loved the homemade salsa sauce  it was so good that i ended up buying a bottle to take home with me

the service was also very friendly and fast the atmosphere of the restaurant was cozy and welcoming and it was right next to the sea which

for dessert i decided to try the churros pancakes which were simply delicious however i must say that they were a bit too sweet for my taste

additionally there were plenty of parking spots available right in front of the restaurant which made it very convenient overall i would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a tasty breakfast with a great view and friendly service

Address: Market Square 1435 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: very few mexican restaurants have the right touch and atmosphere this is an incredible gem right on victoria harbour food is amazing and the decor is fantastic with priceless huge posters of the mexican revolution and old town feel  i always come when i visit victoria try the divorciados eggs and corn bread they are superb

Address: Market Square 1435 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: great place the food was excellent they have a really cool courtyard in the back the food was very filling and tasty the breakfast burrito was amazing the staff seemed a bit annoyed and short with us otherwise it would have been a 5 star rating

Address: Market Square 1435 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: amazing food i got the chiliqueles which pulled pork sooo good had to try the cornbread which was fantastic great overall dining experience im coming back for the chimichanga

Address: 1200 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Y3 Canada
Review:
ordered the cod fish  chips crab bisque and shepherds pie only one was worth writing home about the fish  chips was a large portion but the batter was very greasy and the fries were soggy the fish itself was decent but the subpar batter was disappointing to say the least the shepherds pie was a little overpriced all things considered while it was okay it wasnt very memorable it felt thrown together and rushed however the crab bisque and included bread were absolutely incredible the bisque itself was rich and creamy little pieces of crab floating around it had a nice kick to it and overall was very good

the service was very good considering how busy they were and the atmosphere was also very inviting and comfortable however all together i wouldnt necessarily recommend coming here it was okay for a one time experience but wouldnt return

Address: 1200 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Y3 Canada
Review:
i had the shepherds pie here for about 22 cad it tasted pretty good i just wish the portion size was a little larger

mens bathroom could be cleaned better water and toilet paper was strewn all over the floor i dont know if this is a normal pub thing or not considering i cant drink in most countries yet other than that i quite liked the interior of the restaurant

service was great a waiter came to check on us during the meal and we didnt have to wait long to get the bill  all in all i might come back when i visit victoria again

Address: 1200 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Y3 Canada
Review: loved everything about this place the food was delicious the service was outstanding and its in a cool historic building i had the poutine and times salad both were great our server was incredibly friendly and helpful would definitely recommend this pub

Address: 1200 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Y3 Canada
Review:
irish man visiting victoria had guinness and a breakfast

our server megan was so so nice and genuine made us feel right at home

i must say the breakfast was pretty close to what we make back home and the hash browns are the best ive had possibly ever only flaw not enough black pudding

Address: 1200 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Y3 Canada
Review: midafternoon stop and just the ticket fun spot to hang for a while and recharge the batteries by that i mean enjoying a guinness though we did not eat during this visit very inviting looking food serving trays passed us by often held aloft as they were hefted up from the cellar kitchen lost count of all the smartly uniformed staff working here  bartender female was very sharp and attentive but left us alone doing our thing huge selection of spirits and drafts  will be back

Address: 1010 Yates Street Suite 1 Victoria, BC V8V 3M6 Canada
Review:
conveniently located this establishment offers delicious food and a friendly staff

while there was a minor issue with finding a hair in my sisters drink they promptly replaced it demonstrating thoughtfulness however they didnt remove it from the bill as a gesture

overall the ambiance and service were good

if youre visiting victoria its worth a try but be cautious about the hair incident

Address: 1010 Yates Street Suite 1 Victoria, BC V8V 3M6 Canada
Review: being a chain restaurant i really didnt have high expectations i was very pleasantly surprised by the whole experience nice clean atmosphere great wait staff and surprisingly delicious food i had the spicy chicken sandwich with truffle fries and would definitely come back again for more is it the most unique restaurant ive ever been to no but the consistency of food and service would certainly bring me back again

Address: 1010 Yates Street Suite 1 Victoria, BC V8V 3M6 Canada
Review: ive only been here once so far i was a fairly warm day so it was nice to find a beautiful patio to have some drinks and eats i would strongly suggest sitting in the oudoor patio area it is totally secluded from the street cant really see or hear the street noise the food was also very good and the customer service was very good and attentive would definitely go back just to hang out on the patiowhat a gem

Address: 1010 Yates Street Suite 1 Victoria, BC V8V 3M6 Canada
Review: after a very successful first experience in this restaurant for dinner i reiterated my experience with a delicious cocktail passion fruit mai tai which moreover was really cheaper and better than elsewhere i really recommend this place the interior is pretty and comfortable the outdoor patio accepts dogs but it is also really pleasant since it is half sunny half shaded and also has a sofa and trendy music

Address: 1010 Yates Street Suite 1 Victoria, BC V8V 3M6 Canada
Review:
ordered off a deliver app and the ribs i got were a bit dry i called moxies and asked if anything could be done they gave me a few options and remade my meal its delicious and the ribs are perfect

they went above and beyond with their customer service and even added a brownie bite i was not expecting

thank you moxies for the great customer service and really good food i will be back

Address: 435 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T4 Canada
Review:
firstly this place is located in a nice quiet neighbourhood  bathrooms are clean and space is very bright   theres also a patio thats great for a summer day

food  had potential and looked very pleasing at first but was over cooked and lacked taste  potatoes and fries felt it was warmed up

and finally service  well our server when they finally came was fine  i have to admit i felt i was inconveniencing them by asking for a menu after sitting down for 10 min was

probably a great place to go for drinks

Address: 435 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T4 Canada
Review: came here based on google reviews and we were not disappointed probably the best tasting ceasar salad ive had in years falafel burger was super tasty as well

Address: 435 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T4 Canada
Review: we ate here 2 days in a row it was convenient located in the heart of james bay atmosphere was wonderful menu items were plentiful and food was over the top live music twice a week people great little place to visit and will now be our go to place for eats

Address: 435 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T4 Canada
Review:
my recent visit to this restaurant left me with some disappointment the noise level inside the establishment was so high that having a conversation became quite challenging it created an uncomfortable and chaotic dining experience

furthermore the food did not meet my expectations specifically the chicken in the chicken burger lacked flavor and tasted predominantly like bread the absence of a distinct chicken taste was disappointing to enhance the flavor we had to request hot sauce to dip the chicken in

while this restaurant has room for improvement its important to consider that individual experiences can vary

Address: 435 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T4 Canada
Review: i absolutely love heron rock best chicken and waffles eggs benny in town tucked away in james bay with a warm friendly atmosphere and the loveliest staff definitely worth a visit i would highly suggest brunch they serve all week until 3pm chefs choice triple benny is a great way to explore the menu or for people who cant decide and like a surprise the chef will make you three different bennys of their choosing and its been super yummy every time if youre feeling like a cesar or mimosa heron rock has a fantastic list of all kinds of cesars to try as well as their manmosa

Address: 1725 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8T 3P4 Canada
Review:
great staff and one of the few bbq restaurants in victoria that can actually prepare some decent meats like pork and brisket we visited on a friday early noon which isnt as busy as the evenings and weekends the staff were very welcoming and informative on whats in their dishes and the ingredients the restaurant manager was also very open and actively interacting with customers when we were served and eating the overall environment of the place is clean with neat little decorations and an organized selfserve section for cutlery and drinks the prices are a bit on the higher end but for the place and service its worth it

i highly recommend any bbq lovers to visit jones bbq

Address: 1725 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8T 3P4 Canada
Review: i was recommended jones barbque for their amazing meats they did not steer me wrong i ordered the pulled pork poutine and it was great i would go back in a heartbeat for their other items

Address: 1725 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8T 3P4 Canada
Review: amazing restaurant with delicious smoked meats and stunning jalape√±o margarita one of the best smoked bbq ribs i got highly recommended friendly prices

Address: 1725 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8T 3P4 Canada
Review: first timer i always judge a bbq joint by the brisketa challenging cut to cook and hold they did a perfect job tender and moist the sausage was a pleasant surprise as well ill be returning for sure

Address: 1725 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8T 3P4 Canada
Review: tonight was our first night trying this place after eyeing it for awhile we ordered the pork butt sandwich and the big crunch poutine and had no complaints the meat was tender the food was well seasoned and the poutine was the perfect consistency we all agreed that the only downside to the meal was the cornbread which was a little dry and small considering its 4 we will definitely be going back

Address: 1019 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review:
i had ordered takeout so i cant judge the service from inside the restaurants
on the other hand it is the first time that i receive a boxing so well presented
the springtide roll is crazy hearty for the price and perfect balance between flavors and melting and crispy consistency in the mouth
the mac when to him is a killer  its perfectly rich exquisite flavors with lots of vegetables and nuts perfectly seasoned too
i recommend this restaurant

Address: 1019 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review: excellent customer service took us in 15 minutes before our 630 appointment the waitress was very friendly and kind the food were amazingly plated the smoothies were a treat however i didnt appreciate the spring burger and the sandwich we ordered the bread and the veggie patty and tempeh were too dry for our liking the buns were too crumbly dry and dense my excitement for coming back  here went down im pretty sure their other menu selections are tasty

Address: 1019 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review: seriously delicious we were there early and the place was quiet so the service was excellent the food was outstanding especially the gluten free bread on the sandwich and the mezze in particular i thought the tacos lacked a little punch and would have liked a touch more flair or flavour in them but that in no way detracts from a well deserved five star vegan lunch the roast potatoes were so perfect too yum excited to take my family when they visit

Address: 1019 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review:
i wish i could give more starts this is easily one of the best
meals i have ever eaten and it was plant based and vegan i wish they had a cookbook we ordered two appetizers  nori fresh roll and tacos and has the seasonal gnocchi and the spinach roti and split the chai cheesecake  each item was great the roti and the tacos were so soft and chewy that i wondered how they could be gluten free please make a cookbook

Address: 1019 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review:
stopped by for some lunchtime soup and was not disappointed

this gem of a restaurant in downtown offers extraordinary vegetarian meals im not a vegetarian but id gladly eat here any day the soup of the day on our visit was potato leek soup and it was hearty filling and so delicious definitely a spot worth coming back to

a worthy mention  lovely staff that prioritize a comfortable dining experience above all thanks for the great meal

Address: 1002 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E1 Canada
Review:
i wanted to rave about my experience at the palms restaurant in the rialto i was very impressed with the amount of options and quality of vegan dishes

they have multiple vegan options and even dessert we ordered vegan dumplings a delicious wrap beet ravioli and raspberry cheesecake with vegan ricotta so good

they have such cool cocktails with cool names ours were delicious

there were still two vegan mains we didnt get to try yet such a lovely experience

Address: 1002 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E1 Canada
Review:
one of the best places hands down i had visited in victoria during my vacation
the service was impeccable the food was beyond what my taste buds could handle and the decor was astonishing
i felt welcomed and the service was fast sweet and they were able to handle our dietary concerns no seafood

the drinks are very well made and the flavours were absolutely scrumptious

i highly recommend this place for your next birthday dinner or fancy date night

Address: 1002 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E1 Canada
Review: celebrated our 12 year anniversary there our waitress was very helpful the food was great and the atmosphere was welcoming i got the stuffed poblano peppers  it was very flavorful and filling with a bit of a spicy kick also got a goddess cocktail i also recommend the oysters and the deconstructed apple pie

Address: 1002 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E1 Canada
Review:
i love this place the spaghetti squash is in another level
we were short of time and wanted to eat something before taking the bus to the ferries they brought all our food on a timely manner as well as the drinks
service was wonderful
the next time i come to victoria will definitely eat at this place

Address: 1002 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E1 Canada
Review: had a lovely happy hour they have some great food and cocktail options the food and drinks were great as well as the service was 55

Address: 1012 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K4 Canada
Review: i live so close and yet hadnt been here until now  kind of easy to miss spot on fort st but if you are craving chinese food this is a good spot  food was incredibly quick to come out and was served hot  spicy beef satay was my favorite also tried the cashew chicken which was a bit mushroom heavy for my taste  i didnt think the dishes listed as spicy were very spicy at all  i will return great value

Address: 1012 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K4 Canada
Review:
this restaurant serves delicious chinese food at low prices also the food is served very quickly my favorite dishes at this restaurant are the house special fried rice and house special chow mein you should try them when you visit this restaurant
by the way it is recommended to make a reservation for dinner on fridays and saturdays as it gets very crowded

Address: 1012 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K4 Canada
Review: it was my first time here and i was not impressed with the food the service was fine they were nice but the food was lacking my friend and i ordered the pork chow mein and the tofu eggplant vegetable dish the noodles for the pork chow mein was not what we were expecting it was crunchy and stale i was expecting normal chow mein noodles but that was not the case the dish was overly sauced too there wasnt any other flavour other than the sauce itself the pork was cut very small and thin it was the same thing for the tofu eggplant dish it was drenched in sauce there was nothing special about it the sauce was super salty too the vegetables in both dishes were fine but it wasnt good for what it was worth

Address: 1012 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K4 Canada
Review:
i dont give a five star very often but this place blew me away first off for anyone else thats gluten free or celiac the absolute peace of mind that you can order something made in a gf kitchen and not be stressed out about problems is phenomenal

secondly their gf menu is a second standalone which was nicely flushed out with a mixture of dishes ive read other reviewers talking about the cost and yes it is a bit over average but i guess the dishes i ordered were just on the mark all three were very large servings and good ingredients plus you know when you are used to glutenfree lifestyle you unfortunately get used to very high prices so this seemed reasonable for me

go to be honest it was my first sit down since the pandemic so i was pretty excited but the whole experience was great didnt wait long for a table had excellent and attentive service very open to answer questions and make suggestions no awkward having to explain being glutenfree or asking about ingredients in substitutions it was just easy i had a nice seat facing the street in the window for some people watching

the food did not take long and filled my entire table i guess because its been a long time since ive eaten out  but i was shocked at how much food there was on my plate my three dishes lasted me 3 12 meals and if you havent read my reviews before i eat big

ok lets talk about the food
i did shoot a great video of it but unfortunately you cant upload it so check out my pictures

i had a combination of standard chinese dishes and one fun dish being the tofu eggplant hot pot which came so hot it was bubbling for a good five minutes
so you get entertainment and a meal  nice balance of hot sweet and sour a little bit too much thin sauce for my liking and i wouldve liked some shiitake mushroom in there  but thats a personal choice

the other dishes were your standard chinese fare the first was mixed greens with prawn which had the standard chinese take away flavor one which i hadnt had since before glueing glutenfree so that was pretty fantastic msg enhanced highly likely however i didnt have the response to it so maybe not

and the last was the recommendation by my server for the garlic ginger beef with snow peas im still shocked at how much beef was on that plate  seriously look at the pictures very well seasoned the beef was surprisingly tender considering its not a highquality cut which means they braised it properly veggies were perfect colour and crunchy texture   couldve done with a bit less oil but otherwise nice

obviously had a lot leftover to take away and they were great with the whole experience no awkwardness no fuss  they brought really decent quality eco take away containers    then gave me the time and space to put my food the way that i wanted

i had a happy belly a very happy state of mind good and ample leftovers and a great memory which will bring me back the next time i visit town

Address: 1012 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K4 Canada
Review:
a bit pricey but just few of the places that offer quite good chinese foods

 we ordered
 house special fried rice 4
a little oily but cant get enough of 
 salt and pepper prawn 4
quite good
 sweet and sour chicken 3
chickens a little chewie

 the portion  of the big one is just for 2pax

 the wait time is quite fast to be honest

 service i think its fine but nothing out of the ordinary

Address: 809 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B9 Canada
Review: browns is always a nice place to go for lunch my mom enjoys their veggie burgers and i enjoy their selection of drinks the service at browns is always good and staff is always friendly i decided to try their new brunch options and was a little disappointed however they are new and they might need time to perfect brunch

Address: 809 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B9 Canada
Review:
super yummy food i loved the butchers block burger crispy and tasty not too messy i upgraded to yam fries we also got the southwest bowl which was good the desserts were ok but not the best

the one thing is it wasnt busy or anything but i felt the service was very slow took a long time for them to come around to us but the food is great  the patio portion is heated and enclosed which is cool

Address: 809 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B9 Canada
Review: went looking for a place to have brunch had immediate seating which was a bonus on a sunday morning in victoria food was good and plentiful but the potatoes were undercooked server was very nice and attentive

Address: 809 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B9 Canada
Review: my friend and i ordered through the website and when we came in to pick it up a very friendly server got it for us right away while she was fetching our order another very friendly server greeted us and offered to seat us very fast amazing food best chicken fettuccine alfredo ive ever had and the atmosphere we saw was very nice they even wrote a little enjoy note on the bag

Address: 809 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B9 Canada
Review: met a friend for happy hour it would have been nice to have another choice of seating so busy and plenty of hubbub noise close to the service area and kitchen social white wine gluten free dry ribs and chips and guacamole yummy the server was great the bathrooms were clean

Restaurant_name: Fire & Water Fish and Chop House
Address: 728 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z5 Canada
Review:
ive been very fortunate to be able to try a wide variety of menu options and everything seems to be excellent quality

the crab cakes eggs benny is a must try
very flavorful crab cakes topped with sliced avocado and a perfectly poached egg tasty potatoes on the side and a creamy and zesty hollandaise sauce to pour over top

buffalo chicken wings were thickly breaded and really delicious

the seafood chowder was filled with yummy bites

the french toast was amazing it had so much flavour on its own but then it was paired with fruits and a cinnamon whip on the side you hardly have a need for any syrup

the reuben was juicy and not overly salty as others can be

the calamari was a bit odd and the least flavorful thing i tried

the steak was my absolute favourite dish perfectly cooked with a delicious flavoured butter and nice crust on the outside and rich sauteed mushrooms

the fish and chips were exactly what youd expect and they do have good fries

the cappuccino chocolate terrine dessert was nice and rich without being overly sweet despite it missing the raspberry sauce as advertised the chocolate was smooth and the almond bark on top was crunchy im not actually sure where the cappuccino flavour is meant to be but im an espresso addict so i tend to not be able to taste coffee flavours unless they are overly pronounced

Restaurant_name: Fire & Water Fish and Chop House
Address: 728 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z5 Canada
Review: dropped in for a nightcap and between my husband and i we had 6 delicious drinks  i asked for a espresso martini which was not on the menu and they delivered it with a smile sandeep was very knowledgeable about the drinks that was served and made us feel at home the bartender really is outstanding at his profession as well as quick  and the restaurant itself is very clean cozy and esthetically pleasing to the eye

Restaurant_name: Fire & Water Fish and Chop House
Address: 728 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z5 Canada
Review: this was an incredible experience and i thoroughly enjoyed myself and so did my company you must try this fun for all ages i wish them all the success  what an amazing concept

Restaurant_name: Fire & Water Fish and Chop House
Address: 728 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z5 Canada
Review:
m club lounge was closed at victoria marriott inner harbour during our 2 nights stay we were provided breakfast at fire  water restaurant located within the hotel

the staff recommended crab cake eggs benedict we both went with her recommendation wow she was on point rich tasty and melt in your mouth hubby loved it so much he ordered it again the next morning the next morning i ordered all canadian breakfast as i love scrambled eggs and chose rye bread bacon and substituted potatoes with fruit

i have to say the staff is amazing  attentive genuine and downtoearth

great breakfast to fuel us for the day full with walking we ended up needing to walk off the wonderful meal along the harbour not a bad start to a day eh

Restaurant_name: Fire & Water Fish and Chop House
Address: 728 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 3Z5 Canada
Review: came in for lunch and a glass of wine or two the food was surprisingly good much better than youd expect of a hotel bar very reasonably priced as well the wine list was pretty basic but the pricing was good the room is kind of what youd expect at a marriot nothing to write home about but nice enough the service was pretty bad though inattentive server and they werent really able to answer any wine drink or food questions too bad because the food was excellent

Address: 517 Pandora Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: my first impression was the bar is well put together and atmosphere was awesome for downtown victoria i enjoy the somewhat open kitchen concept you have to come up to the bar to order your food the food is a hitmiss the potatoes was a 310 very dilly the beef tongue reuben was a 7710 first time trying beef tongue so it was good the craft beer i ordered was okay after you order your food they dont really check up on you and ask if you need anything else

Address: 517 Pandora Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: such a tasty meal in a great atmosphere we ate outside in the marketplace square and shared the baba ghanouj and a pork belly sandwich each was big enough to serve two people so its a good deal we also had a flight of beers and i loved the dinosaur stone fruit sour so delicious well definitely be back

Address: 517 Pandora Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: great selection of beers interesting menu and some wonderful selections the grilled cheese with kimchi is a favourite the nitro porter was one of the most enjoyable beers ive had on tap  came back again for my birthday same positives and staff was awesome in accommodating a cake brought for me excellent atmosphere

Address: 517 Pandora Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
the flensburger dunkle dark lager was very good the cider was too hoppy for me i prefer a slightly sweeter cider it tasted like grapefruit juice
you serve yourself at the bar then take it outside

Address: 517 Pandora Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: so disappointed i ordered a cheese board and it was a bread board with two miserable small slices of really simple dry and untasted cheese and a small fresh cheese cup you cannot call this a cheese board when theres almost no cheese i told the manager and she didnt do anything by the way the young server girl from peru was excellent but i am still so disappointed

Address: 658 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S7 Canada
Review:
an anchor to the contemporary french fine dinning experience in victoria visually inspirational for every dish we ordered a mixture of different textures and tastes for each ingredient as those explode in mouth recommend their medium rare steak and seasonal berries as dessert

our return visit for we love the atmosphere and the waitress is approachable and friendly waiter and waitress know their dishes well my only side suggestion is to approach the diners with questions while theyre not having a moment eg laughing our conversation came to a hilarious end as we try to hold on our laughter the waitress came dropping us with a question our moment of climatic enjoyment got cut off short since we had to quickly recover to respond here their timing is key

Address: 658 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S7 Canada
Review: we went there for the 1st time tonight and were blown awayservice was incredible and sadly forgot the receipt to remember her name food was absolutely incredible most outstanding dish for us was the pork belly appetizer everything else was so beautifully presented and all the flavors were on point making it a full on sensory experience highly recommend

Address: 658 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S7 Canada
Review:
weve been to saveur a few times now  thought id post a review

prices are definitely on the higher side and portions are smaller as well but the quality of food is excellent

started off with the soba noodles and rosti  the soba noodles are to die for although the portion was 14 of the size compared to when we ordered them which was a bit disappointing

my fiancee got the tuna and i had the burger  everything was fantastic as usual

we finished off by sharing lemon pudding which was amazing

service was outstanding and was the two prior times we dined here  victoria doesnt have a plethora of fine dining experiences  if youre looking for a fancier spot for a special night out id highly recommend saveur

bon appetit

Address: 658 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S7 Canada
Review: great food and wonderful service the flavours were delicate and well balanced yet super flavourful and unique the presentation was beautiful the service was great we took our time and didnt feel rushed

Address: 658 Herald Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S7 Canada
Review:
worth the splurge  yes its expensive and yes it was amazing good things are worth spending money on and if youve never had a fine dining meal this should be on your local list to try service was attentive and on point the meals were paired wonderfully with reds and whites appropriately we started off with a super fun creative chai inspired whiskey sour if james has it available order it when they say their tenderloin is like butter its true and yes you should pair wine with your dessert
its a small venue with small tables but the service keeps on top of your table helping to avoid clutter thanks chef james and ryan for the great time

Address: 1005 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V7 Canada
Review:
our go to sushi restaurant for special occasions and casual lunch with friends freshness and taste of the sushi are just amazing very friendly and attentive staff rei is exceptionally welcoming and helpful our new absolute favorite is baked salmon roll just melts in your mouth
highly recommend gozen sushi bar izakaya

Address: 1005 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V7 Canada
Review:
if youre looking for a sushi place in victoria i highly recommend this place we went in 3040min before closing because we had arrived in town later than expected but their service was wonderful some places will show their frustration when you walk in late i get it but the servers here were professional very friendly  helpful i was trying to order everything all at once since they were taking last call but they have a wide selection so i was having a hard time choosing so the server helped recommend some items our waitress checked on us multiple times to make sure we were good

food also tasted very fresh  delicious sashimi pieces were nice  thick  one of my favorite was the tako wasabi will definitely wake you up ill definitely return when i visit the town again

Address: 1005 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V7 Canada
Review: ive had the pleasure of dining at gozen a few times now the service is always excellent and fast the sushi is always excellent and so is the atmosphere would highly recommend this place this is definitely the best sushi place ive eaten at in victoria thank you

Address: 1005 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V7 Canada
Review: great selection for both the go to classics and some new takes for people weary of fresh seafood overall food quality was in line with top in canada except the top ends for triple the price point overall great food and value

Address: 1005 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V7 Canada
Review: prices seem a bit steep but the portion sizes for the rolls are quite good noodles and rice bowls are a bit disappointing i would stick to the sushi rolls also would recommend skipping the takoyaki

Address: 1609 Store St Victoria, BC V8W 3K3 Canada
Review: the service was great i ordered vegetarian ramen which was alright maybe not my taste but the portion was huge the cocktail was really good my recommendation would be if you cant eat much and you go during happy hours order a single person portion from the happy hours menu its more than enough to fill you up

Address: 1609 Store St Victoria, BC V8W 3K3 Canada
Review: i was wanting to try a ramen joint while i was on the island and im happy to say this place didnt disappoint the atmosphere is very cool my girlfriend and i both loved the aesthetic layout of the restaurant the service was great and so was the food and drinks we went during happy hour so we got to try a couple things at a very affordable price ill definitely be back when i next visit victoria

Address: 1609 Store St Victoria, BC V8W 3K3 Canada
Review:
atmosphere and menu were super cute the staff were really friendly but service was kinda slow took a while before some came and took our order and had to wait a bit before food came out

but the food was definitely worth the wait we ordered the shio tonkotsu tori and shoyu gyokai soup was very flavourful and the sousvide chasu was amazing my favourite part was the egg it was perfectly cooked yolk was nice and soft boiled

Address: 1609 Store St Victoria, BC V8W 3K3 Canada
Review: walked by and decided to try it nice atmosphere food was okay drink price was inaccurate charged higher than the menu when we asked them about it they claimed the menu price was for the happy hour but we looked at the full menu and that drink is not listed anywhere else in the whole menu so its listed in only one place but in the end they will charge you more than that menu price

Address: 1609 Store St Victoria, BC V8W 3K3 Canada
Review:
had heard a lot of great things about ghost ramen and had to try it out while on vacation in victoria
absolutely did not disappoint
the atmosphere was welcoming calm and perfect temperature
the ramen was mindblowing the broth was delicious and hot noodles were absolutely perfect im still dreaming of them and the egg was cooked perfectly
desserts were also delicious along with the lime ginger cherry soda

if ever in victoria again i am definitely going back

Address: 759 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: went there to watch the second half of world cup final it was very crowded but they still had a few tables to accommodate us nice and relaxed atmosphere we ordered chorizo  egg taco and eggstoast our server elaine was really nice and helpful she helped to change the food a bit they did not have any deserts in their morning menu since we craved some sweet stuff she managed to serve us chocolate truffle cake which was nice pleasant experience

Address: 759 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: we stopped in before a movie at the odeon i ordered the heat seeker burger but when it arrived it had no crispy jalape√±os as advertised on the menu i waited over 10 mins for the waitress to come back to the table and i let her know the burger was missing items she brought it back to the kitchen and came back to our table with literally one single crispy jalape√±o on it see photo we had ordered calamari as well when the waitress originally took my burger back to the kitchen and when it showed up less than 10 mins later it had a bunch of the crispy jalape√±os lol at least it was a good laugh but seriously how petty does the chef have to be here

Address: 759 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: service was friendly and had a nice casual atmosphere important to note that the happy hour menu listed on their website is not the happy hour menu you are given inperson it seems they also now have taco tuesdays so all of the tacos were 350ea good value at that price but i imagine i would have been underwhelmed had i paid full menu price

Address: 759 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review:
place permanently closed

source i was personally there on their last day of operations



i have now visited this place so many times that i can leave a solid review about it in my heart this place is the true definition of a 4 experience

beer selection solid nothing fancy you gonna find something you like for sure are you going to find that special beer youve been looking for most likely not

food solid whenever we are in a big group with multiple dietary restrictions we come here as we can always find something for everyone yet none of the menu items alone stand out as the best in town for their category

service solid this of course changes depending on the server how busy the place is andor if theres an event going on but overall i had 95 positive experiences yet none of them truly memorable

a big thing they get is different nights for events like sports events trivia night and others things of the sort

Address: 759 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: came here last thursday and everyone was so friendly there were 2 people at the host desk that were very nice i sat at the bar and the bartender was really nice i think there was a shift change happening at some point and the next bartender i got was super friendly and helpful as well i got his awesome recommendation on a really tasty sour beer and i asked his recommendation on a good patio to check out i would definitely come back here

Address: 230 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3X3 Canada
Review:
am the luckiest person in this world because i live two blocks from this amazing restaurant am very picky when its about pizza and i tried all the pizzas here and all of them are amazing and every time am there i dont know what to eat this time
i really high recommend this place and try all the options available

Address: 230 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3X3 Canada
Review: except for the coworker showing up and sitting one table away the last time every time i come here i have the best pizza of my life the pizza is better than any of the pizza you can find in italy or anywhere in the mediterranean or for that matter anywhere outside the prima strada locations ultimately youll save money because having pizza anywhere else will just feel banal and secondbest youll save it for occasions to go to one of the prima strada locations also they carry anchovies like any serious pizza place would

Address: 230 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3X3 Canada
Review: i came here for a quick bite with my mom and oldest son after his band recital the servers were busy but they were sweet the food was hot and quick we also ordered a pizza but we ate it prior to me getting a picture of it highly recommend great for a family night for pizza a date night or a girls night

Address: 230 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3X3 Canada
Review: we really enjoyed this place and the pizza was one of the best we ever had freshly made and perfect service

Address: 230 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3X3 Canada
Review: closest thing to real italian pizza in town thin crust fire oven simple but delicious ingredients if you know you know ive also been informed that they are a socially conscious group doing the work so thats nice ive equally heard that some of the treatment of their employees could be better i hope that gets better join their email list and find out when the good deals are its not often but its worth it

Address: 1109 McKenzie Avenue Victoria, BC V8V 2W1 Canada
Review:
it was the first time i tasted ethiopian food and i was really disappointed  its bland and lacks flavor i felt like i was eating canned spinach potatoes ground in water in short only canned or vacuumpacked ingredients that have been reheated and have the same taste as at the school canteen
nothing interesting for my taste buds unfortunately
if this is ethiopian food then i wont eat it again in my life

Address: 1109 McKenzie Avenue Victoria, BC V8V 2W1 Canada
Review: absolutely love this place  the food is so tasty and reasonably priced for the portions i love the vegetarian combo plate or the beef combo plate hours can vary ive gone and they have been closed randomly so make sure you call ahead or have a back up plan definitely must try this hidden gem

Address: 1109 McKenzie Avenue Victoria, BC V8V 2W1 Canada
Review: first time trying ethiopian food i got the vegetable combo and it was awesome the price on their menu was very affordable the lady preparing the food was very courteous this place was really good and it was a great meal

Address: 1109 McKenzie Avenue Victoria, BC V8V 2W1 Canada
Review: soooo happy to have stumbled upon this little spot in cook street village located in a small strip of several restaurants seating and ambience is very casual had the combination plate and the food was super quick price was right flavours were amazing very glad to find an ethiopian place in vic

Address: 1109 McKenzie Avenue Victoria, BC V8V 2W1 Canada
Review: the restaurant is located in the cook street village food court at the far end the women making the food was really friendly and wonderful to chat with delicious vegetarian platter i totally recommend it

Address: 1307 Gladstone Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1R9 Canada
Review: terrific food amazing service really nice ambiance great menu options the bartender is very knowledgeable too and offers lots of nice vermouth and absinthe cocktails highly recommend for a sophisticated night out

Address: 1307 Gladstone Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1R9 Canada
Review: we really enjoyed our dinner here and also top it with great glasses of wine we picked chef choice dish it turned out fantastic server super friendly parking was okay a bit walking but best after dinner too much good food we needed to walk it off back to our car we would definitely visit again in the future

Address: 1307 Gladstone Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1R9 Canada
Review: coming back to this restaurant after a great first impression last trip the food is so delicious here and the smell of the charred bread is divine our server anna is so great love all her suggestions for food in both victoria and vancouver she is also just super friendly to chat with lovely vibe as the evening progressed and had more people come in

Address: 1307 Gladstone Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1R9 Canada
Review:
this is the most disappointing meal we have ever had on this island we came to this restaurant with high expectations the vibe of the restaurant is pretty good  it the food is incomprehensible we ordered feast set meal for 5 people because the server said this is chefs choice if we are very hungry we can try it

first we got three pieces of burned bread and two kinds of cheese and canned clams the second dish was a plate of vegetable salad the third dish was a plate with two pieces of halibut which tasted fine when the fourth course two chocolate cake was served we were shocked paying 325 and getting this after such an experience we talked with server he said about the price of the ingredients because of inflation of course we know that everything is going up in price but paying 325 for such 4 courses meal is unreasonable i believe if we order all the food on the menu it will not exceed this price

in the end our discussion did not have any results the server dropped a machine with amount and said if you dont wanna pay the tips thats is fine horrible night

Address: 1307 Gladstone Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1R9 Canada
Review: very good experience but since it was my first time there and we only got tapas to share i dont want to give full 5 stars yet until ive tried their actual meals overall very cool place

Address: 1020 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3Z5 Canada
Review: great local eatery lunch menu prices are really reasonable generous portions and include soup and a spring roll my partner did a fried egg addon for an additional cost and it was great on the rice dish thai iced tea was decent a little bit on the sweet side but not bad their pad thai sauce is a little on the sour side for me and their mild seems a bit spicy i would personally get no spice in my future visits hence the 4 stars

Address: 1020 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3Z5 Canada
Review: i loved the tom kha coconut thai soup with prawns the best ever all ingredients fresh and the soup wad seasoned perfectly the host was super friendly

Address: 1020 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3Z5 Canada
Review: its a small but great place to eat thai food jared is also very helpful and friendly careful when ordering thai original spiciness i thought western food can never be spicy but they are truly as spicy as chili padi

Address: 1020 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3Z5 Canada
Review: what a beautiful place set in a little cute area of town in victoria after purposefully getting lost in locating a little place for dinner i was pleasantly greeted by a very professional and polite and welcoming young man i was happy to hear him welcome me and when i asked for take out he politely handed me i menu and took my order after i sat he professionally offered me some water and even poured it for me which shows the etiquette of serving tables as being very impressive i was delighted and felt at home immediately as i waited for my food upon returning home and opening my food i was eager to taste the flavors for i had asked for as spicy as possible as i enjoyed my food i realize that this was a wonderful meal that had rich flavors spiced and the right amount of temperature in spice as well as temperature of food i would recommend this place and would only caution that though it is a small establishment it is huge in flavor and good quality food my compliments to the chef

Address: 1020 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V 3Z5 Canada
Review: this small thai restaurant on cook street tells a big story in their cooking lunch is a treat with delicious flavorful soup and a spring role with every choice and there are lots of excellent choices i had the gaeng massaman gai which was filling and fresh and very delicious i highly recommend this restaurant  for lunch or dinner

Restaurant_name: Sakura Sushi, Grocery and Japanese Restaurant
Address: 1213 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8W 2K6 Canada
Review:
great little place that offers fresh made sushi rice bowls and bento boxes

ive had their ramen it was flavourful with excellent noodles their new new curry bowl items are really tasty and generously portioned the karaage don is also an excellent lunch option

theyre definitely under new management  lots of new faces and a much improved customer service experience they also have a new expanded menu with more variations of each type of dish sakura has solidified its place in my lunchtime rounds

Restaurant_name: Sakura Sushi, Grocery and Japanese Restaurant
Address: 1213 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8W 2K6 Canada
Review:
i love their sushi and other hot meals however the last time i went there we ordered food for dine in at their outdoor table i requested one of the ladies if they could reheat the cold meals that were on display since we were supposed to eat it there and she said its not possible seriously why isnt it allowed so we ended up eating the very cold takoyaki and other dish on display i never came back after this very disappointed

additional comment with all due respect but we also ordered hot meals and ate it on the outdoor table of your restaurant so are you saying that even if we order hot meals we cannot have the additional grab and go food reheated in your microwave how is that helping your customer half the order is hot and half the order isnt allowed to be reheated because its to go if we knew about this in the first place we wouldnt have ordered any to go with the hot meals

i was a fan of your restaurant since we ate here multiple times it wasnt the first time but to tell your customer to go eat somewhere else because reheating is a big deal shows the value you place on your once loyal customers  again we wont mind if theres a sign saying this

ps

it might help to place a sign on the cold section that the food here cannot be reheated even if customer orders hot meals in that way it avoids confusion

Restaurant_name: Sakura Sushi, Grocery and Japanese Restaurant
Address: 1213 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8W 2K6 Canada
Review: they have fresh affordable sushi to go and its delicious service is so nice and makes you feel welcomed 1010 will be returning soon

Restaurant_name: Sakura Sushi, Grocery and Japanese Restaurant
Address: 1213 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8W 2K6 Canada
Review: i never been here before but i ordered a sushi tray delivered to me today it was great that i was able to build my own tray and only pick what i want the waiting time was reasonable and food were packed nicely sushi are good a bit too much vinegar in the rice i think i would come to the store one day for groceries

Restaurant_name: Sakura Sushi, Grocery and Japanese Restaurant
Address: 1213 Quadra Street Victoria, BC V8W 2K6 Canada
Review: very good place to have sushi service is very attentive and they are happy to accommodate your wishes its a simple place but very clean and the quality of sushi and complexity are rather high prices are moderate the place contains the restaurant and a small store

Address: 721 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R8 Canada
Review: we ordered take out at a very busy time 6pm on saturday but our order was ready on time and it came in nice containers that dont leak you know how sometimes you get home and gravy or whatever has leaked out nope  not with this order food was yummy would order from here again

Address: 721 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R8 Canada
Review: we enjoyed our dim sum they were tasty and soo good well definitely coming back when we visit victoria again

Address: 721 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R8 Canada
Review:
the best dim sum in victoria

i love their sui mai  its 1 in canada
and peanut pork dumpling rice rolls har gow oh the daikon cakes as well 
honestly everything was above and beyond the expectation
please keep this good business ongoing

Address: 721 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R8 Canada
Review: busy day here as its the chinese new year glad we made reservations we had all vegetarian dishes minus one they put shredded scallops on so we just didnt eat it but we didnt complain about it was too busy to bother this place looks dated so the outside does not reflect the inside

Address: 721 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R8 Canada
Review:
ordered from golden city using their online system and enjoyed the convenience i ordered vegtable chowmein with only beansprouts and two egg rolls golden city correctly made my order which i was worried about because i just wrote the only beansprouts into the comments this showed me they pay attention to detail the chowmein was a good large portion had great flavor and was a resonable price the egg rolls were lackluster without much flavor and the wrapping was a bit thick for my liking

overall good meal and i would order again just provide not the egg rolls next time

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review: i enjoyed the food here with my family  portions are good i just wish they could have more non spicy food for kids they do charge a 15 service fee if your group has more than 6 people which is like a tip so it is reasonable

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
at sura korean restaurant one can anticipate a truly unique dining experience that perfectly melds traditional korean flavors with a modern sophisticated ambiance from the moment you walk in the welcoming atmosphere resplendent with warm lights and comfortable seating sets the tone for an excellent culinary journey

the menu at sura is a vibrant palette of korean gastronomy showcasing the rich hearty flavors that the cuisine is known for the bulgogi tender and succulently marinated is an absolute musttry as is the bibimbap served in a hot stone bowl which creates an irresistible crispy rice layer at the bottom the seafood pancake brimming with fresh ingredients is an ideal start to the meal

vegetarians and vegans arent left out either suras japchae a dish of stirfried sweet potato noodles and vegetables is an example of their commitment to catering to diverse dietary needs without compromising flavor

one aspect that particularly stands out is the quality of their ingredients the freshness of the vegetables the quality of the meats and the aromatic spices all come together in a symphony of flavors that leaves one yearning for more

service at sura matches the high standard set by their food the staff is attentive helpful with suggestions and ensures a smooth dining experience

in addition the restaurants adherence to safety and hygiene protocols in these challenging times further enhances the overall experience making you feel safe and comfortable

overall sura korean restaurant in vancouver is a destination not just for those with a palate for korean food but anyone who appreciates good food well served highly recommended

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
we got there around 1 pm on a sun and had a 12 hr wait well worth it we walked down the street while we were waiting and this was one of 2 spot that had a wait i guess we now know why 

we found a parking lot for 3  hr across the back door in the street behind the restaurant they have 4 free spots behind the back door but they were full

we get the lunch set menu and got to try different things all of which were good kids got a dumpling soup and kimchi fried rice portions were just right to fill us up

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
you cant go wrong with ordering any food at this restaurant the food is flavorful and the service is great i actually felt like our server cared about our experience at sura
the only thing to consider is they dont take reservations and there is usually a wait list at this place
overall a must try for korean food in vancouver

Address: 1518 Robson Street Vancouver, BC V6G 1C3 Canada
Review:
what a great place on robson st for authentic korean eats

we actually tried coming here before but the lineup was too long of a wait fortunately we came again during foul weather earlier this month december 2021  yay we got a table without delay had to call the restaurant to let them someone know we were outside as patrons are required to stay outside until a staff member came out to assist i appreciate the covid protocol they do check for vax ids

their great ratings do not lie  the food is comforting and delicious portions are good considering the cost the decor is light and minimal their staff are all excellent in friendliness attentiveness and speed

the potato pancakes had perfect crisp to it and were very flavourful on their own  no sauce really needed the vegetarian japchae was so satisfying that we didnt even miss the meat

i loved the grilled mackerel the most not overly cooked with a softly cooked interior while maintaining a crispy skin it even came with a small doenjang jjigae  super flavourful soup broth with bits of beef

all the appies kimchi beans potato salad were a perfect sample taste i wonder if i could have asked for more

the staff were hospitable  and quick to serve and clear away

decor is modern minimalistic yet relaxed

im so looking forward to coming back again

find me on instagram aidaloves

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: i love korean food and this place doesnt disappoint they have a wide menu of classic korean dishes there bbq is amazing and a lot of fun only down side is that the food is quite expensive no matter the dish  i would highly recommend going with a bunch or people who love to share food and laughs

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: the service is very good and the people is so nice the food is good the place has a good atmosphere

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review:
went to sura for lunch and tried a variety of dishes all the selections were great and tasty

the staff was friendly and always kept our pitcher of water filled like how they gave us individual condiments rather than the traditional communal style condiments

was disappointed that their seasonal buckwheat cold noodle was well  out of season

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: delicious food reasonably priced and very well packaged they also included free kimchi on the side as well

Address: 1696 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: both dishes were a real flop i had taken a bibimbap because i had heard that it was a very good dish but i honestly didnt like it i honestly think its not the dish itself but the way the restaurant makes it the tastelessness was really bad as was the chow mein the service was mediocre and the atmosphere of the restaurant is really depressing

Address: 940 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: fantastic restaurant great food exemplary service we will definitely be back again a lot of great things on the menu some of the atmosphere slightly dated but that adds to the charm

Address: 940 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review:
its a good japanese food place in victoria love the vibe and atmosphere service was great but a bit slow which was understandable since they were super busy
the main dishes and sushi rolls are okay special rolls are really good there were no sits available so we sat at the sushi bar but it was okay since the bar table was bigger than normal
overall a 45 experience and recommended

Address: 940 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: first time i went to this restaurant and i couldnt suggest a better place to get sushi the menu has a wide variety of food choices and amazing drink selection our server was a very kind and professional man who made the experience even better and was lovely to talk too and as someone who has worked in a sushi restaurant this was such a great experience and the atmosphere was a very comfortable space to be in and has lots of beautiful artwork to admire while eating my boyfriend and i got the takoyaki miso soup negitoro maki dynamite roll bc roll and the karage roll and it was all so good we will most definitely be coming back

Address: 940 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: really excellent sushi i was impressed by the beautiful plating the fish is well selected and fresh so tender and delicious what was most delightful was how well built their rolls are perfectly balanced flavors and no danger of it falling apart

Address: 940 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K2 Canada
Review: havent been here since 2017 i ordered hot house sake cold chicken udon ebi tempura roll and spicy agedashi tofu although its not spicy at all for me tho overall the food and service was good recommended will definitely go back

Address: 500 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E5 Canada
Review: decided to celebrate my anniversary with my boyfriend at the keg and the experience was amazing everyone was so nice and the food was spot on the bread that they gave us was so good it pairs really well with the french onion soup my boyfriend and i both got the keg classics and the portions were really filling we did over ordered because we were quite hungry but we left with two takeout boxes with some of our food despite being really full they offered us complementary dessert because we were celebrating our anniversary our server was super kind and packed it up for us to eat later for someone who has never been to the keg before id definitely recommend the twice baked potatoes and escargots the steaks are really good too especially the prime rib i would definitely come back again for a special occasion because everyone was really nice

Address: 500 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E5 Canada
Review: excellent food and service   and harbour view seating  my wife and i loved our dinner  we highly recommend this steakhouse restaurant   the keg   we will be back many times

Address: 500 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E5 Canada
Review: fantastic food as always steaks are always done perfectly as we ordered service was too notch and atmosphere is very peaceful  romantic

Address: 500 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E5 Canada
Review: the keg is frankly the best steakhouse one can go to for reliably great steak  i have been to kegs at least dozen times over the last 10 years and i have never been disappointed  steak is cooked to perfection sides are yummy choice of potato and even a delicious wedge salad  service has always been tiptop and the price is right not too pricey just right for a special night out

Address: 500 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E5 Canada
Review: the service was great the young waiter treated us really well and made the night really enjoyable after a rare celebration for the family steak was cooked accurately and was nice a rare all around great experience

Address: 1019 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: my family and i decided to stop in for brunch and we were all surprised at how delicious the food and coffee was the staff were very friendly the atmosphere was nice and they had good music playing too

Address: 1019 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review:
ordered the congee

as a biased person being asian it was not the congee i expected especially visually this one was outstanding with colors and textures the bold ingredients were sitting atop a bed of thick brown rice the rice was not too viscous and also not as fluid as asian congee would be generally  it might be close to the viscosity of oats where it will still fall out of your spoon if you tip it over but not immediately

the temperature also is quite different  im guessing this was about 50c  122f

so eating the congee the ingredients were grouped together and arranged quite thoughtfully i thought of mixing everything together just like you generally would in an asian congee but my senses at this point whispered otherwise

so i went about my dish picking the ingredients often combining 23 at a time as i was scouring away from the bed of viscous rice underneath i found that eating it this way gives an easier time to distinguish and appreciate the flavors and textures as compared to having everything mixed together  this made the dish quite engaging as you try different combinations of the ingredients it was light yet felt
different from asian congee and unique in its way

Address: 1019 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: picnic is a fave for a reason they have unique and fun food that everyone can enjoy weve used picnic to cater multiple events and everyone is always so happy with whatever they bring sometimes they do such a fabulous job with presentation it looks too good to eat the cafe is also amazing portions are filling staff are friendly and the environment is laid back and relaxing

Address: 1019 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: came here for breakfast sandwiches and loved the cozy laid back vibes  the breakfast sandwiches we got were sooooo tasty   i got the owen and my partner got the weekender both amazing  the kind of delicious where you zone out while eating it because youre just lost in the flavours  yum

Address: 1019 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: my dad and i were visiting victoria on our way to shop rvs for my parents across the island dad ate the vegan hash which he said was so delicious large portion and very filling while i shopped a few stores nearby as i finished i returned for a chai tea latte with oat milk and it was also well done flavorful smooth and creamy would visit again next trip

Address: 1551 Cedar Hill Cross Road Suite 215 Victoria, BC V8P 2P2 Canada
Review:
i only went here twice when i lived in victoria i had the beef don the first time and ramen the second time both were good my friend has said that this was the best ramen hes ever had so make of that what you will lol

i wish i could have come here more often but whenever i tried to stop by they were always closed by coincidence unfortunately hopefully ill get to eat here again one day

Address: 1551 Cedar Hill Cross Road Suite 215 Victoria, BC V8P 2P2 Canada
Review: good ramen bad service could use more staff to help with the tables and to do cleaning we were sat at the entrance under the ac and close to the entrance and when asked to be moved to a booth we were told no rudely even when there were three booths empty

Address: 1551 Cedar Hill Cross Road Suite 215 Victoria, BC V8P 2P2 Canada
Review: to me its best ramen place in town the size of the portion is good taste of ramen broth and toppings are all delicious the server was super friendly

Address: 1551 Cedar Hill Cross Road Suite 215 Victoria, BC V8P 2P2 Canada
Review: i came usually every week for a salt ramen came again this week and was served soy instead of salt gyoza tooks 20 min and even came after the ramen when i pointed out that the ramen soup is wrong they just took it back throwaway thr soy soup and pour salt in do u really think i cant see the soy color floating on my salt ramen or do u think the soy taste can just vanish i understand that it can get busy during lunch hour but this is not what i can accept

Address: 1551 Cedar Hill Cross Road Suite 215 Victoria, BC V8P 2P2 Canada
Review: i have been eating here for years and this was the worst experience miso soup and  gyoza were made by an older woman the soup she gave me was only enough for half a bowl the bottom of the dumplings were all mushy and tasted bitter

Address: 812 Wharf St Victoria, BC V8W 1T3 Canada
Review:
my recent dining experience at milestone restaurant in victoria was nothing short of exceptional from the moment we stepped in we were captivated by the very beautiful view of the water which set the perfect ambiance for a delightful meal

the service at milestone was impeccable with attentive and friendly staff making us feel welcome and well taken care of throughout the evening our server was knowledgeable about the menu and offered excellent recommendations adding a personal touch to the overall dining experience

speaking of the menu the food at milestone was simply outstanding each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavors we tried a variety of dishes but the one that stood out the most was the beef taco it was a delectable combination of tender beef fresh ingredients and a perfectly balanced seasoning that left our taste buds delighted

in addition to the beef taco the menu offered an array of mouthwatering options to suit different palates and each dish was crafted with precision and creativity

the restaurants waterfront location not only provided a stunning view but also added a soothing atmosphere to the dining experience we enjoyed watching the sun setting over the water while savoring our scrumptious meal

overall i highly recommend milestone restaurant for a memorable dining experience in victoria the combination of the picturesque waterfront view excellent service and delightful food especially the beef taco made our visit truly memorable whether youre looking for a romantic dinner or a gathering with friends milestone is the perfect place to indulge in a memorable culinary journey

Address: 812 Wharf St Victoria, BC V8W 1T3 Canada
Review:
restaurant looked super busy but was able to be sat in less than 5 minutes fast service and food was delivered in a reasonable amount of time

fish tacos with fries sweet  fire cauliflower margarita peach bellini were all delicious

food was fresh and drinks were strong  plenty of outdoor seating family friendly close to the water highly recommend if your in the area

Address: 812 Wharf St Victoria, BC V8W 1T3 Canada
Review:
we were seated on the deck which is more seafood focused and menu is more limited

food continues to be very good and service is attentive   we cleaned our plates

but lets be honest the highlight is the people watching you do

Address: 812 Wharf St Victoria, BC V8W 1T3 Canada
Review: great location amazing atmosphere and delicious food could not have asked for more starting from summer drinksstarters to main course all the dishes was appealing and tasty really loved the baby back ribs excellent customer service would have loved to have dined outdoor it is a busy summer time next time definitely

Address: 812 Wharf St Victoria, BC V8W 1T3 Canada
Review:
the staff were attentive to our large group despite it being a busy night for them and the food was some of the best restaurant food ive had in awhile i had my baby with me and they were able to provide a high chair and bring water for his bottle when i needed it
this restaurant has some really fun cocktails and lots of choice on their menu for a special night out the view of the harbour was a lovely addition to a great meal this restaurant would be a good choice for a party or date

Address: 470 Belleville Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W9 Canada
Review: silly us we overestimated how warm it would be at night our food was amazing and the view cant be beat we were just so cold even when they moved a heater close to us the seafood platter more than feeds 2 adults i had the top sirloin steak and it was cooked to perfection at medium rare we were with friends and the other meals were steamed mussels and clams fish and chips and pepperoni pizza everyone left full and happy id say this was more spendy than many other restaurants in the area but totally worth it

Address: 470 Belleville Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W9 Canada
Review: i came here with ten people unfortunately we were all disappointed terrible service is an under statement the food took over 45 mins to arrive the food portions are small the calamari which says is for two people isnt enough to fill one person up we were waiting for water for at least 15 mins we were sitting outside and had no heaters next to us and they had none available i left the restaurant still hungry overall i am extremely disappointed

Address: 470 Belleville Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W9 Canada
Review: the fish and chips were good but the clam chowder was like soup and tasted bland they also got the kind of salad wrong when another person in the group ordered a vegan burger and asked about the fries being cooked in the same oil as the meat and then ordered a salad when the salad came it had cheese on it and other non vegan things we also ordered sparkling water that never came to the table

Address: 470 Belleville Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W9 Canada
Review: we had a great dining experience here with friends  it was a busy saturday night but we had a table that was off to the side overlooking the deck and it seemed quite there good food and good service  we had the tuna poke bowl the chicken boom boom bowl and the salmon bowl all were good

Address: 470 Belleville Street Victoria, BC V8V 1W9 Canada
Review: dinner time was busy be prepared to be waiting  beautiful waterfront view and food were delicious and healthy too we had harvest bowl v and mixed seafood

Address: 2950 Douglas Street Unit 222 Victoria, BC V8T 4N4 Canada
Review: amazing so excited to have authentic japanese ramen in town i had the tan tan men and the broth was so rich and incredible probably didnt need the extra noodles but i couldnt resist service was very friendly polite and efficient will be returning forever

Address: 2950 Douglas Street Unit 222 Victoria, BC V8T 4N4 Canada
Review: excellent food black arashi tan tan was fantastic the chicken karaage was also great its a very good restaurant the ramen was 17 and the appetizer was 750 and i felt it was worth it

Address: 2950 Douglas Street Unit 222 Victoria, BC V8T 4N4 Canada
Review: it was not dissapointed as a forst customer i think people really love their food great taste especially the noodlesramen so chewy love it the flavour in my opinion is authentic generous toppings as well ordered takoyaki as an appetizer and taste amazing a great visit for lunch

Address: 2950 Douglas Street Unit 222 Victoria, BC V8T 4N4 Canada
Review:
i have traveled across canada and have had ramen at many restaurants ramen arashi is the best ive had by far and i cant get enough of their spicy tonkatsu the broth is very flavorful and the chashu just melts in your mouth

the restaurant works like a well oiled machine all staff are well trained and good at what they do its a busy place and the staff handle it with grace thank you for great food and service

Address: 2950 Douglas Street Unit 222 Victoria, BC V8T 4N4 Canada
Review: hard to choose the best bowl but the spicy tonkotsu ramen is always a treat nice to go on a wednesday evening when theres less of a crowd no better ramen in victoria

Address: 2024 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1E4 Canada
Review: our goto neighbourhood fish and chips shop we love any of the fish meals popcorn shrimp oyster poboy and the cesar salad ordering online is simple and their gluten free batter is crispy and delicious

Address: 2024 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1E4 Canada
Review: oakbay seafood  is truly a gem when it comes to offering a topnotch takeout experience you can tell they are committed to offering only the freshest and highest quality products   tuesday taco is one of our favorite cant wait to place our next order and savour their oceanic delights once again

Address: 2024 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1E4 Canada
Review: the chef and the crew were helpful to explain the menu and gave me a pasta salad to sample as well  very hospitable to me and my wife pasta salad is a must try and the fish and chips are great too

Address: 2024 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1E4 Canada
Review: i had the shrimp sandwich and it was pretty good the bun was a little stale and dry but the shrimp salad inside was good i just expected a little more i guess staff was very pleasant and kind

Address: 2024 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1E4 Canada
Review: i highly recommend this seafood shop as it serves the best and freshest halibut fish and chips ever the staff are very friendly the decor is cheerful and the seafood selection both fresh and frozen is great the fried fish was very crisp flaky and favourable and the chips are fresh firm and hand cut i will be back for more thx folks

Address: 1010 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V8 Canada
Review: the salad role was the best i have ever had they have this crunchy thing in the middle that is a game changer we had the bun and it was all really really delicious except the chicken it was a bit soggy and tasteless i would definitely eat here again but i would get something else

Address: 1010 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V8 Canada
Review:
we had the spicy beef soup spicy beef pho and moms special dry noodle dish both were so flavourful very delicious the lemongrass flavour is what really kicks it up a notch

were from vancouver and we have great vietnamese restaurants this place is as good if not better than places back home thats a huge compliment congrats victoria you have a winner

Address: 1010 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V8 Canada
Review: love all we ordered  the curry the skewers and the fresh veggie rollthey are all good oh  you should try yheir green papaya salad as your startersooo good

Address: 1010 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V8 Canada
Review:
friendly server and okay food
restaurant interior is very outdated has no acoustic insulation  i could hear everything what the other 3 tables around me were saying it was very loud or maybe they were loud people

Address: 1010 Langley Street Victoria, BC V8W 1V8 Canada
Review: we loved the vietnamese grilled lemongrass chicken with the spring roll the spring roll was a very generous portion it was super big from being deepfried very cozy and comfortable atmosphere one note do not order the spicy meatball soup unless you eat very spicy it is actually spicy and my friend couldnt handle it haha but very delicious flavors nonetheless but they do mean it when they say spicy  highly recommend

Address: 1199 Government Street #100 - Bay Center Victoria Victoria, BC V8W 3M9 Canada
Review: sleek and sophisticated dining experience not quite royal as some of the restaurants competition around but still excellent choice for late night food nonetheless the sushi roll is not good however the truffle fries are to die for i had better salmon at vista 18 but earls is really really good too big portion and juicy cooked right however earls should work on their rice that they use for sushimains presentation and side combinations are well thought the sushi and fries could use a bit more of included sides but you can always ask for more if the default portion isnt enough non alc beers are on the expensive side

Address: 1199 Government Street #100 - Bay Center Victoria Victoria, BC V8W 3M9 Canada
Review: earls has one of the best happy hours here in victoria i really like their drink selections i would highly recommend their sangrias the watermelon slush is really good too although their happy hour menu has changed i really liked their calamari and kale and mushroom pizza the clam chowder is really good too i highly recommend getting the truffle fries and spinach dip as appetizers their chicken tacos are also pretty good too dessert wise i really like their toffee chocolate pudding overall my experience at earls has been 1010

Address: 1199 Government Street #100 - Bay Center Victoria Victoria, BC V8W 3M9 Canada
Review:
the cocktails are really very good there is a choice and the menu changes regularly
the food is good but not exceptional and it does not justify the price charged  25 for a salad and the same price for a basic bacon burger
the terrace is nice i was able to go there with my dog
