second experience more than satisfactory top cocktails hawaiian mai tai marylin monroe blue hawaian and seafood tower 120 excellent and perfect for 2 people
its one of the best places to enjoy a good cocktail in victoria many are either not dosed enough in alcohol or tasteless or too many ice cubes

Address: 1199 Government Street #100 - Bay Center Victoria Victoria, BC V8W 3M9 Canada
Review: everything was great as usual i just wished they wouldnt take away the shrimp spaghetti it was a personal favourite and alot of other customers too as i overheard

Address: 1199 Government Street #100 - Bay Center Victoria Victoria, BC V8W 3M9 Canada
Review:
not the best earls ive been to but still good food theres not a lot open late in victoria so this is a good option for a decent selection the rare steak was very good the truffle fries were really good the rest was just ok

the new truffle ravioli was disappointing and i got it with the prawns but they were pathetically small and underwhelming not worth the extra  the ravioli was good but felt a bit undercooked the sauce was a bit watery and didnt adhere to the pasta well

the cajun chicken was tasty and not dry the ribs were a little dry it came with potato salad which was kind of bland

the atmosphere in here is nice and decent service good location but if youre driving since its downtown you need to take a bit of time to park

Address: 1600 Government Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8W 1Z3 Canada
Review: 3 stars for food as i didnt quite like the dal tadka coconut rice and kale potato curry samosas were good as expected naan is soft and well cooked service is great spacious place too

Address: 1600 Government Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8W 1Z3 Canada
Review:
visited the place few days back with my friends i must say this is simply amazing right from the staff to the taste of food and drinks biryani chicken kofta all were mouth watering delicious
surely coming back

Address: 1600 Government Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8W 1Z3 Canada
Review: excellent and tasty food we tried biryani and chicken wingsarshad was a great host and a friendly personality we thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience here

Address: 1600 Government Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8W 1Z3 Canada
Review: i can not attest to how authentic the food is as i am not indian but it was pretty yummy to me the braised lamb curry was super tender and i dont eat super spicy they were very accomadating with making the curry mild for me and it tasted just right although ive had better naan bread elsewehre the ones here were not bad the resturant is very spacious and the service was decent i would not mind coming back here again

Address: 1600 Government Street Suite 101 Victoria, BC V8W 1Z3 Canada
Review: we had checked in this afternoon for lunch in varsha indian kitchen victoria island the food was amazing but felt if they had added more meat pieces that would be great but the taste was fantastic and the waitress over was nice and suggested the items to try she is a professional if anyone wants to have mild flavours i would recommend to go with spicy then the taste would be apt as mild that was my thought overall great food and had an amazing time and nice ambiance i would recommend this as to go place in victoria bc

Address: 1813 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8T 4K5 Canada
Review: had yet another amazing take out dinner from this cute little authentic thai restaurant everything was super fresh perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious the house made spring rolls are the best weve ever had super crispy without being greasy and the filling is so good we also ordered a container of their inhouse made peanut sauce for home use which is unlike any other peanut sauce weve triedits the perfect thickness made with actual peanuts unlike most out there that are just watered down sweetened store bought peanut butter its a must try if you love peanut sauce

Address: 1813 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8T 4K5 Canada
Review: really nice cozy spot for some excellent thai food spring rolls are best ive had in victoria i went with green curryprawnscoconut rice and medium spice they nailed it my gorgeous date went with pad thai and pawns and seems to enjoy it  correction she does enjoy it looks like ill get a second date outta the deal

Address: 1813 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8T 4K5 Canada
Review:
first visit and had great experience employees are so friendly and cooperative food was amazing with great price i had my best fried rice so far
will come back for sure

Address: 1813 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8T 4K5 Canada
Review: i love their yen ta four noodle its tasty like thai style the owner and staffs are super friendly and helpful  i would love to come back and try other menus

Address: 1813 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8T 4K5 Canada
Review: best thai food in victoria the restaurant run by a thai lovely family free coconut ice cream shows how sweet they are  their foods were amazing we all love thai fried rice their weekly special pink noodle soup was authentic and tasty every dish cook one by one so we could choose the spice level the dinner portion is generous the decorations are very lovely

Address: 784 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L4 Canada
Review: tried the drunk mushroom pizza and it was great  a bit of a different kind of pizza but im happy i made the choice there were lots of tempting choices on their pizza menu and i had a hard time narrowing it down prices were entirely reasonable staff was friendly and helpful id go back here

Address: 784 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L4 Canada
Review: great pizza  good luck catching them when they are open though literally at least 50 of the time i go there they are randomly closed i dont think they even have set hours

Address: 784 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L4 Canada
Review:
looking for fantastic flavorful well topped pizza in downtown victoria check out brickyard pizza perfect crispy thin crusttopped just right and packed with flavor dine in or take out the atmosphere is very chill and laid back they only make one size of pizza which is a 14 large the menu has something for everyone and the price is really decent especially for the quality of the pizza

we had the brick and a 4cheese

Address: 784 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L4 Canada
Review: only giving this place a 5 star rating because of logan best server ive had and such a hard worker shes so friendly and amazing made so many amazing suggestions for sightseeing absolute superstar if i owned the place she would deserve top dollar thank you logan

Address: 784 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L4 Canada
Review: usually just pop in for a slice but its also a good place to eatin with friends and have a drink stopped in with a friend for a sitdown and wasnt disappointed

Address: 120 - 735 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review:
not only is the food great here but the customer service is some of the best i have ever seen

the owners are so nice and courteous and provide detailed attention to each customer

i got the grilled chicken roll and it was so fresh and delicious you can tell they use good ingredients here and really know how to make proper japanese sushi

i definitely will be back to this great establishment

Address: 120 - 735 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: incredible food with the friendliest hospitality i was amazed that the owner knew so many of her customers by name my favorite is the unagi roll

Address: 120 - 735 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: great counter service and lots to choose from i ordered avocado rolls a philly roll and a teriyaki noodle box with veggies and tofu theyve been here for 9 years

Address: 120 - 735 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review:
truly the best sushi i have ever had in my life im from vancouver  was in town for business and decided to give this place a try based on its reviews

the grilled chicken roll and salmon avocado roll was so fresh and delicious the couple that own the restaurant are extremely kind hearted and accommodating i wish them nothing but success 

i will keep on coming back whenever i am in town

sunny

Address: 120 - 735 Yates Street Victoria, BC V8W 1L6 Canada
Review: the owners made a huge impression with their sweetness  then the food was incredible  we ordered the seafood udon nigiri rolls and the avocado poke salad  it was all thoughtfully presented and of the highest quality  they use free range eggs and only wild caught salmon  the environment was also most pleasant in an air conditioned area

Address: 1018 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H5 Canada
Review: this is an amazing place for ramen its definitely my favorite place in victoria ive mostly ordered from home but since i feel more comfortable now about eating in restaurants again i figured that i should stop by for a visit finally everything tasted fresher and hotter than compared to ordering for home the service was fantastic the staff was fantastic everything was very clean i was very impressed and will definitely be back thank you

Address: 1018 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H5 Canada
Review: a musttry minimalist ambience the creamy broth of the menbow ramen has a roasted garlic flavor the chicken karaage is the best in town

Address: 1018 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H5 Canada
Review: ive been wanting to try this ramen place for a while and i was pretty surprised with how many options they had i ordered the tantanmen and it was pretty good i liked how there was bean sprouts and the iconic swirly fishcake and of course bok choy the only thing i would say tho is i felt like the broth was a little too salty but overall its a pretty good ramen i also ordered the shrimp tempura which was really yummy too i would come back to try their black garlic ramen

Address: 1018 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H5 Canada
Review: we are visiting victoria from washington and decided to go to try the ramen here it was good i ordered shio ramen it was good not too salty but its ok  i like salty and hard ramen noodles  the taste is almost the same as ramen in japan will come back when we visit victoria again

Address: 1018 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H5 Canada
Review:
a wellthought out ramen restaurant restaurant is clean and tidy with attentive waitresses the menu shows a variety of ramen options such as pork chicken or clear vegan broth base there are ones without broth such as tantan stirred or rice available there are also side dishes to compliment to the order or not

miso pork broth ramen is delicious the bowl comes with large cuts of bbq pork bamboo shoots finely diced green onion corn nibs half of an marinated egg nori sheet japanese seasoning and a couple more it isnt salty overall theres a lot going on with each bite a diner wont be bored of it

on to the didnt meet expectation part i may be off but i guess the noodle is generic noodle kind one could purchase from market not sure if this has anything to do with the food but i felt super thirsty about two hours after dinning

in general this place is a nice option for downtown dining

Address: 100 Harbour Road Victoria, BC V9A 0G1 Canada
Review: overlooking the harbor this restaurant offers a stunning view that captivates too bad the rest wasnt the same while the service was fine but not great the food falls short of inspiration or taste  nonetheless the picturesque location may still appeal to those seeking a scenic dining experience with average culinary offerings

Address: 100 Harbour Road Victoria, BC V9A 0G1 Canada
Review: some of the most creative food we have had in a while the combination of flavours was great fantastic views of the harbour easy parking at the hotel which is free if dining there great night out

Address: 100 Harbour Road Victoria, BC V9A 0G1 Canada
Review:
ambiance was great stablefish and crab cakes were amazing the chefs seared and crisped up the skin on the fish perfectly
lindsey our server was sweet and attentive all staff in the restaurant have been amazing since our stay
definitely recommend

Address: 100 Harbour Road Victoria, BC V9A 0G1 Canada
Review:
update hanson is an excellent bartender hope hes there when you grab a drink at the bar 

here for happy hour in the bar great prices for both drinks and food bartenders are extremely friendly and helped us plan our weekend stay in town

Address: 100 Harbour Road Victoria, BC V9A 0G1 Canada
Review: lets start with the positive view is extraordinary you get to see the inner harbour from a very good angle staff are friendly and helpful now the terrifying part is the food which is a hit and miss chicken wings were amazing burger sandwich and fish and chips were horrifying its hard to screw up fish and chips on the island so many other places do it so well the batter was very thick and soft thick batter we have seen but soft thick uncooked batter is weird as for the the burger and sandwiches bacon was very hard patty all you taste is salt and the buns were quite burned fries some were not folly cooked manager was quick to address our experience people here are nice but i dont know if i would risk the chance for the food though

Address: 607 Oswego St Victoria, BC V8V 4W9 Canada
Review: 45 and 4623  its not often good cuisine meets stellar service and wonderful atmosphere  as a solo diner i didnt feel slighted and was seated at a window table  i had the spaghetti bolognese on day 1 and returned to have steak  prawns with the house salad on day 2  i was a happy grandma  thanks julie

Address: 607 Oswego St Victoria, BC V8V 4W9 Canada
Review: celebrated my husbands birthday in this quaint and home style atmosphere waitress was attentive food was very good been in business for 40 years would eat here again

Address: 607 Oswego St Victoria, BC V8V 4W9 Canada
Review: absolutely impeccable food the best oysters rockefeller ive ever had anywhere and ive tried it everywhere ordered takeout and my orders were ready not more than 15 mins after calling them in  insanely quick given the quality of the cuisine this will become a regular stop for me whenever i find myself in victoria again first class

Address: 607 Oswego St Victoria, BC V8V 4W9 Canada
Review: service was good but nonalcoholic cocktails contain alcohol 5 months ago i had gastric cancer surgery so absolutely alcohol is dangerous to me also my friends food has a kitchen iron brush my birthday dinner has become a risky meal

Address: 607 Oswego St Victoria, BC V8V 4W9 Canada
Review: what a fabulous meal and experience  the best server ever not sure if his name was jamesgood advice regarding choices engaging with folks at all tablesincluding us perfect sense of humour very accommodating and upbeat  happily it was a quiet beautiful place with wonderful jazz playing in the background the seafood was yummy

Address: 766 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H2 Canada
Review: great place for some great tacos   we have dined here several times now and as of late for the happy hour menu tacos are big and filling and priced well they are well presented and put together we had the fish cauliflower carnita and bean tacos delightful the guacamole and chips are yummy too the chips are nice and crunchy with the right amount of seasoning definitely recommend its our favorite place for tacos any day of the week

Address: 766 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H2 Canada
Review: aye yaye yaye lunch was everything we could ask for fast service and really yummy meals we had the fried chicken burrito fish baja tacos beef burrito and of course the very tasty and chilled miss hibiscus margarita definitely coming back to try more tacos and special drinks

Address: 766 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H2 Canada
Review: ive been a loyal patron of this victoria taqueria for years whenever i visit from california the service has consistently been outstanding deserving a 5star rating and the inviting atmosphere never fails to impress the food has always been a delightful experience offering truly authentic mexican cuisine that tantalizes my taste buds on every visit however today i was greatly disappointed the food was prepared poorly with overcooked dishes and an excessive use of cooking oil the tacos lacked any distinct flavor overwhelmed by the taste of oil and were noticeably overdone on a positive note the beverages were excellent the service remained fantastic and atmosphere of the restaurant has a great vibe considering the price i paid for lunch i expected a far superior experience reminiscent of my previous visits im pretty sure this was my last visit to this restaurant

Address: 766 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H2 Canada
Review: the tacos were super delicious  im super happy i tried this place  the tacos were a bit pricey but i will come back and i would love to see what they have for their happy hour  highly recommend

Address: 766 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1H2 Canada
Review: dont say you serve signature homemade guacamole when its clearly packaged it was whipped and had a weird texture like the stuff you get out of bags it was unappetizing ordered 4 tacos and they were all soggy and had hardly any filling i absolutely love mexican food and am shocked that this place is so popular had really high hopes not to mention service was sooooo slow took them 20 minutes just to take our order

Address: 703 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B4 Canada
Review: used to eat here back in the late 90s long before google existed but came here tonight to meet up with one of my acquaintance the foods alright but service was only satisfactory still a good place to chill and have a good hang food value seems decent

Address: 703 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B4 Canada
Review: i was very impressed that they could accommodate a table of 8 at 530 on a friday so quickly the restaurant is huge so i understood more as we were seated the design of the restaurant was good but fairly basic and comfortable it was very busy but i felt like they did a great job getting food and drinks to us the value of the food was pretty good and they have a great food and beverage selection the kids meals were generous and tasty i had the seafood fettuccine alfredo and i found it quite watery and bland my sister has the manicotti and she thought it was good a good family restaurant with mid to high prices

Address: 703 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B4 Canada
Review:
this place is one of the greatest
good value for money
ive been to all this franchise and gas town and this location are the best
evan bar manager is friendly and he knows how to practice greatest customer service and build a strong rapport with guests
recommend this place to everyone

Address: 703 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B4 Canada
Review: good price good services nice people everyone is so so so patient and kind to us when we taking photos indoor will recommend to friends

Address: 703 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2B4 Canada
Review: gosh i tell you their spaghetti is awesome i dont take a picture of my food but because i was so starving that evening so i forgot to take some pictures everything was absolutely delicious and amazing supper their warm bread with whipped garlic butter were top notch keep asking them to refill and they bring it up on the table always make reservation before otherwise you will be waiting for a long time to get your table and because they are busy just be patience and be kind to the waitress they serve you really well

Address: 206-2250 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: this is a very unique place oldest building in oak bay a yuge menu which can be daunting to get through but everything we had was quite tasty fair prices electric crowd warm service more than meets the eye

Address: 206-2250 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review:
the interior is warm but if you are coming here for good service or good food go elsewhere
we waited for over 10 minutes before a waitress came to our table she was rude not helpful and dismissive when we finally got our meal she forgot the cream for my tea and although i reminded her she didnt bring it i finally asked another woman if i could have some
i also asked 3 times for the jam i had told her i wanted when i gave her my original order although she said yes twice it never appeared one of the worst breakfasts ive had and the welsh rarebit that my partner had was not edible after all this when we asked for the check she didnt bring it we finally went to the bar to pay it needless to say with no tip which rarely happens with us we are 20 tippers
i would never eat here againnor should you

Address: 206-2250 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review:
love this place we have been twice in our first four days here on the island friday night for fish and chips and french onion soup then on monday for full tea and the original burger and fries the place is a nice old fashioned pub with a white exterior and large black beams inside is full of great old tables and chairs
our food was wonderful every time we went
i had been looking for a place with the english pub feeling and afternoon tea at a fair price they have several tea choices full tea was only 28

Address: 206-2250 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: that his our first visit since it had been the blethering place we came for afternoon tea which was quite enjoyable the wait staff were very efficient and also quite casual it wasnt bad at all just not the tearoom experience we were expecting it felt a bit like having afternoon tea in a snug pub or bar

Address: 206-2250 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: went there on a sunday just me they took forever to seat me i ordered a coffee and the shortrib eggs benny the first mug she gave had a lipstick mark on which was replaced when asked the eggs benny there was plenty of shortrib but lacking of flavor and salt i dont usually add extra salt after food is served but i had to the only tasty thing was their parmesan potatoes i would try a dinner to give them another chance

Address: 990 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H3 Canada
Review:
good service not too crowded excellent service the waitress and host were very attentive and friendly

i shared the omakase with one other person which was enough  its not really an omakase but it plated quite appealingly and i like the novelty

there were some questionable items however i wasnt a big fan of the shrimp dumplings ha gow and the bao bun as they seemed to me very put of place both were very underwhelming in taste and texture

the  yuzu sauce paired perfectly with the raw oysters however  takoyaki and squid skewer were unremarkable but tasty nonetheless

id probably not recommend the omakase as items are hit and miss

Address: 990 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H3 Canada
Review:
cool little bar we found while looking for a place to have a late meal 11pm and drink on a sunday night pretty comprehensive sake selection which you can see they take seriously with menus telling you about the level of polish on the rice

we had the chefs sashimi platter which was really nice staff were all great too

they have a nice range of japanese whisky too and they do flights

Address: 990 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H3 Canada
Review: having been fortunate to experience a large number of japanese restaurants this one ranks in the top 3 massive selection of sake one of the largest is canada every dish we tried was amazing finally the service was spot on highly recommend

Address: 990 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H3 Canada
Review:
came here on a thursday night and they had a lot of tables available with attentive and friendly service got the shokado bento box which features 9 small dishes of raw and cooked food curated by the chef this is great for sharing with 1 other friend

this traditional bento box contains gorgeous dishes the 9 dishes consisted of 2 types of sashimi sushi roll tuna tataki salad fresh oysters shrimp dumplings har gow fried mini octopus skewers shrimp bao and takoyaki my favourite is the tuna tataki salad  delicious tuna and dressing even though cute the har gow seemed out of place since i associate that with chinese cuisine and ive definitely had better at dim sum restaurants

Address: 990 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H3 Canada
Review: looking for the best sushi in victoria well look no further ene is the place to go for unique cocktails fresh sashimi and delicious food chef eric  his team are super passionate about creating the best guest experience and keep things fun and interesting with feature drinks and dishes dont sleep on the moriawase 126 jackie chan oshi oroku saki roll and bulgogi pasta my favourites their happy hour is also a great time to try lots of small dishes and taste a wide variety of drinks i come here almost every week to eat and post photosreviews at vicflavours

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review:
best pok√© ive had and ive had a lot

i got the island bowl and was seriously impressed the fish just tastes so fresh and has an irresistible marinade coating all the ingredients were bursting with flavor and worked together so well was a bit steep at 1520 per bowl but ended up being so good that id go again

definitely recommend trying this place

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: delicious poke with crunchy and umami toppings requested the tangerines on the side and the service kindly put the portion into small containers

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review:
when life gives you lemons squeeze them add salt garlic oils honey and create a marinade for cubed fishthis is what i imagine the owners think at island poke

very fresh and bright ingredients i had the ohana bowl for lunch a great size and prepared by friendly staff i will be back yum

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review: i cant say enough about how great this gem is i go almost every day because the food is so good and affordable with hearty portions and delicious recipes the staff are friendly they remember your name and always go the extra mile

Address: 1674 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2G6 Canada
Review:
the food was exceptionally fresh and excellent tasting i ordered a bowl 
all kinds of choices for your bowl you can pretty much have it made the way you want it the service was great we got to watch our food be made right in front of us stayed at the restaurant to eat and this little place was cozy
im not much for raw sushi type foods ill tell you one thing i was impressed and probably will go back

Address: 1313 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2E9 Canada
Review:
feels like coming home to your favourite aunt and uncles great bubble tea  always friendly and fun atmosphere funky art and environment the chairs walls and even the stairs have neat art
a staple in victoria that we are lucky to have  you must visit

thank you for your great service

Address: 1313 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2E9 Canada
Review:
decently authentic cantonese food ridiculously outstanding service

i didnt have high expectations of this restaurant given its location but what a nice surprise

google review did not disappoint the service was second to none we honestly felt like having dined at a friends house everyone was so friendly served us spring rolls on the house gave my parents bubble tea samplers took time to chat with us and made sure to make the food extra soft for my senior parents

the decor is quite charming there is a world map where customers pin where they are from on the map its almost full

Address: 1313 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2E9 Canada
Review: my family enjoyed our experience the service is outstanding the food was clean and delicious this is a must try try the bubble tea

Address: 1313 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2E9 Canada
Review: absolutely amazing the food was delicious we got some of the boba tea and the dinner for 4 and everything was delicious we got the sweet and sour pork szechwan beef and some noodles and it was all so good the owners were some of the most friendly people we met on our trip if you are looking for a place to eat near china town this is the place

Address: 1313 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2E9 Canada
Review: i came here with my husband and 4 kids aged 21 18 15 and 11  our meal here was a highlight of our 5 day stay here in victoria  we ordered the meal for four plus an extra entree and with 3 hungry teenagers we had leftovers  the food pleased the picky eaters and the food snobs alike in our big family  we all got bobba tea and decided the real fruit tea was the best  if the great food wasnt enough to make you happy the joyful service and human love exuding from the service would make it a joyful family dinner as well  if everyone were as kind and friendly as these wonderful people what a world it would be  if only i lived here in victoria i would be a regular here

Address: 950 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C6 Canada
Review:
not sure why i dont come to this restaurant more often i enjoyed the ambiance location food and menu items  its a reasonable place to take someone for a date however not too intimate pretty casual for a setting

date dinner with the hubby almost a month ago havent reviewed didnt know it was two for one appetizer saturdays of course we ordered the twoforone why not its there if it wasnt something we enjoyed we didnt have to order it or come back so there was nothing to lose

had no regrets on the selection ordered the wings with apple bbq flavour and the calamari be warned the calamari does have some spicy kick to it and i like spicy still delicious wings were crispy even with the sauce just a personal preference

for the entrees my husband ordered the halibut burger  but somehow ended up with the twopiece halibut fish and chips he went with it and didnt have any regrets the batter wasnt overly thick and the fish was thankfully not dry my own order was spicy prawn tacos and they were lovely nice light refreshing it comes with a side but thankfully i chose this because the appetizers were filling enough the fries were nothing remarkable but i did enjoy them

we arrived around 530pm to which dinner was just getting started the tables were about 90 full and our food still arrived at a reasonable time we were in and out in an hour without rushing our order and dinner  the atmosphere was overall good didnt feel rushed didnt feel like we were inconveniencing anyone when we asked for refills of our drinks i will of course come back again even for a somewhat priceconscious person im very satisfied with my visit

highlights for me
accessible washroom
twoforone appetizer saturdays excluding a few items
easy parking
good service and food

take note
no dog patio

Address: 950 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C6 Canada
Review: loved the food great place to bring our young kids we saw a couple otters on the ramp on our way in and out service was ok but thinking back maybe under staffed atmosphere was good next time we will probably request to sit on the flight deck with patio

Address: 950 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C6 Canada
Review: we sat in the patio and had a pilsener and an apple cider while we waited for our caesar salad and halibut fish and chips the food was great some of the best fish and chips id had id recommend a bit more dressing on the salad but the fried capers that it came with were a nice touch our server was attentive but not over bearing would go again

Address: 950 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C6 Canada
Review:
found this place while wandering aimlessly around victoria we loved the name and decided to give it a try it was a little busy but the hostess gave us the option to sit at the bar im so glad we did the otter has an excellent drink selection including local brews we split an order of poutine iykyk that was absolutely fantastic we loved watching the activity on the docks as we ate including one seagull that liked to look in the windows to see what people were eating

the staff were amazing and friendly from the jump they also worked incredibly well together anticipating what others needed which increased the level of customer care and service they elevated the experience tenfold

Address: 950 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C6 Canada
Review: a cute view of the harbour sitting at a hightop table the chowder was very good i had the salmon tacos with a salad on the side if youre doing this try a different side than salad i dont recommend the side salad on its own was fantastic but was basically the same ingredients in the salmon taco there was no variation in my lunch the salmon was a very small piece on a huge bed of salad couldnt really taste anything but salad my partner had the fish and chips the frieschips were great and the fish was battered lightly and was fresh  he had no tartar sauce given though isnt that a fish and chips staple i left hungry and unsatisfied with the salmon taco i have to go back to try again

Address: 1701 Douglas Street Unit 6 Victoria, BC V8W 0C1 Canada
Review: this was my first stop on my first visit to the public market  i had high hopes after reading the blurb on their website  i went for porchetta and for meatballs planning a takeout order for meal prep at home  it was on a monday around noon and the market was nearly empty  at roast i saw the porchetta on offer and decided to pass on that  i spoke to the server and ended up settling for a cup of balls a container with some arrabiata and four meatballs  the next day i made a meatball sub with part of my order and this is what i found  irregularly shaped meatballs very crumbly in a small amout of sauce which had a rather thick layer of solidified fat on topout of the fridge of courseand i used two meatballs for my toasted sandwich which was okay  i can cook so i did a good job on the prep  as i said it was an okay sandwich  three stars  my hopes were aimed higher but i am glad i made the effort to check roast out i plan to keep on looking for good meatballs in victoria

Address: 1701 Douglas Street Unit 6 Victoria, BC V8W 0C1 Canada
Review: delicious food and good service exactly what i want from a quick food restaurant the chicken meatball sandwich was delicious and if youve got a bigger appetite then try one of the bowls lots of fresh salad toppings if thats your thing ill definitely be back

Address: 1701 Douglas Street Unit 6 Victoria, BC V8W 0C1 Canada
Review:
went in for a meatball sub which they had no meat balls left ended up getting a pork sandwich which was cold chunks of pork on a untoasted rock hard bun the beef sandwich we got had a thick peice of broccoli on it that wasnt even done defrosting yet
the side potatoes where cold aswell went back to look for the person manning the front to complain and found no one there

Address: 1701 Douglas Street Unit 6 Victoria, BC V8W 0C1 Canada
Review: i tried the beef sandwich there with chimichurri and onion jam  it was soo tasty and satisfying i always say that bread can make or break a sandwich and they chose the perfect bread for it it was so soft and fresh im really happy i found this place

Address: 1701 Douglas Street Unit 6 Victoria, BC V8W 0C1 Canada
Review: went here based off recommendation from tasting victoria to get their pulled pork sandwich which looked really delicious in the photo unfortunately they were not serving this sandwich today so we tried the regular pork sandwich instead the staff were pleasant but the sandwiches were disappointing especially for 14 a sandwich the pork was cold the bread was cold and the sandwich came smooshed and looked unappealing it felt like something we could have slapped together at home for much cheaper based on the other reviews it seems like consistency is a challenge for this establishment and perhaps we came on the wrong day

Address: 4136 Wilkinson Road Victoria, BC V8Z 5A7 Canada
Review: dropped in for a quick bite my favorite was the dark matter beer by hoyne brewing  the loaded tots were delicious and plenty for two to share i love roasted carrots and theirs did not disappoint great flavor and perfectly spiced add smoked chicken to any dish to make it a perfect combination im glad we stopped

Address: 4136 Wilkinson Road Victoria, BC V8Z 5A7 Canada
Review: very nice place food taste really good and fresh good selection for drinks and my kid eats free  many things homemade coming everytime i visit victoria with my family

Address: 4136 Wilkinson Road Victoria, BC V8Z 5A7 Canada
Review:
the service was awesome the atmosphere was quiet the eggs benny were great but wasnt impressed with the tater tots even though i ate them all lol
my goose juice was delicious

Address: 4136 Wilkinson Road Victoria, BC V8Z 5A7 Canada
Review: i usually dont complain but this time i had to the quality of the food was like it was cooked yesterday and heated in the microwave the price points are simply way too high for the quality of the food the service was horrible there is clearly no standard here on how their servers should be treating customers if youre thinking about going here i would highly recommend reconsidering and saving your money there are much better places in the area

Address: 4136 Wilkinson Road Victoria, BC V8Z 5A7 Canada
Review:
this is a cozy restaurant that has a good menu and is reasonably priced it was very busy when we visited and the staff were friendly and prompt it took a while to get our food 25 mins but we knew that when we ordered

the food was good i had the fried chicken sandwich and it was tasty the side of poutine wasnt great but it was serviceable

i would go back again maybe for their trivia night as it looked those folks were having a great time

Address: 1017 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review: i visited day before yesterday i love such a welcoming staff and friendly customer service and on top of that food was so delicious i am vegetarian and it is difficult to find tasty option in victoria but la taquisa is one of the best place for veg people like me i would highly recommend to try tortila soup

Address: 1017 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review:
this is the place to go if you want delicious mexican food excellent every time we go i recommend the chicken mole burrito lots of spice levels and flavour profiles to choose from if you like a lot or a little

the staff is absolutely great  friendly helpful and patient

nice indoor eating space but options to sit outdoors in the front on the street or in the courtyard at the back we didnt know it was there the first time we came

Address: 1017 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review:
authentic mexican food like for real i had a giant burrito with beef al pastor the meat was so soft and tasty combined with marvelous beans and cheese that are nothing like you would ever experience at a texmex americanized place

now the salsa oh boy the green salsa savory salsa made just right to be flavourful while still mild i combined that with some sour cream perfect match for me i could eat a whole meal of just chips with this

a friend of mine ordered their small quesadillas and they looked just as good i cant wait to try some next time

Address: 1017 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review: thank you so much for catering our office luncheon today the setup was very nicely done and the food was wonderful  everyone asked me where i ordered the food from  for the first time out of all the monthly lunches i didnt have any leftovers unfortunately i couldnt take pictures of all the food but i managed to get a few look at that guacamole

Address: 1017 Blanshard Street Victoria, BC V8W 2H4 Canada
Review:
we tried this place for the first time today and were excited given reviews and the lovely service when we arrived they were out of limes which is fine as we thought the ones at home should work fine

we ordered two 5 taco deals with a mix of beef fish and shrimp to try them out we came home and opened the box and were shocked by what we found tacos with barely any toppings fish ripped to shreds little to no seasoning or toppings on the beef and some of the tacos were undercooked they were basically tacos with a bit of some sauce and pieces of shredded lettuce that too with unseasoned meat and ripped oily breaded fish we were very disappointed as i was personally looking forward to having tacos tonight bummer did like their salsas and valentino sauce was nice and spicy but the tacos themselves are underwhelming compared even to other places weve tried in the city again bummer as the staff was nice

Address: 1205 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review:
great location with harbour view from their beautiful patio
food is okay with reasonable price
service is very very slow we asked 3 times for water and at last my wife had to go herself to get it

Address: 1205 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: we went here on a gorgeous day in victoria the drinks were tasty i had the local lemonade and my husband had a mojito we stopped in for a snack and shared the stanley cup poutine and a pound of hot wings the wings were fried to perfection and the gravy on the fries was delicious the service was wonderful as well everyone was working hard to make sure everyone had what they needed

Address: 1205 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: went for brunch with a friend the service was good as well as the ambiance we ordered poutine and a sandwich and the food was yummy and abundant the waiters were friendly and i recommend  the place if you are close to the area

Address: 1205 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review:
we came here during the semifinals of the world cup and the atmosphere was incredible world cup aside this place was recommended to us by other restaurants and we decided we had to try it

the food beer and service was all top notch and all of the staff we spoke to was exceptional after the match we somehow ended up speaking to the owner jeremy and he seemed as if he really cared about his pub and the people and the staff

i couldnt rate the experience any better and next time were in victoria well definitely come back

thanks for the experience

Address: 1205 Wharf Street Victoria, BC V8W 3H9 Canada
Review: i went with a friend and my dog this weekend and every aspect was so wonderful it was busy but the service was still amazing a super dog friendly patio every server was so sweet about getting us water or anything we needed for the pup and the atmosphere of others around us was also amazing couldnt recommend it more and the food was great

Address: 809 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2W8 Canada
Review: so delicious best thai food in victoria i ordered vegetable spring roll crispy duck bamboo red curry they are super delicious especially the thai iced tea it is the best thai tea ive ever tried in victoria

Address: 809 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2W8 Canada
Review:
a great place to eat with good service and tasty food
my only complaint is that they leave the tails on the shrimp when they serve them but im sure you could ask for the tails off

Address: 809 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2W8 Canada
Review: we went on june 21 for the first time  its friendly and comfortable  the staff were kind and helpful  we had pad thai with chicken a red curry and coconut rice  it was all delicious and generous portions all gluten free the decor is old but i dont mind that at all  there were young families and seniors in the restaurant  it had a great neighborhood vibe

Address: 809 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2W8 Canada
Review: the lunch combo is so good it is a good deal  tofu green curry combo and thai iced tea for around 18 excellent value and super delicious food

Address: 809 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2W8 Canada
Review: finally tried this place it didnt quite live up to the reviews spring rolls were great the red curry  the cashew chicken werent bad the chicken pad thai was easily the worst ive ever had  no flavour and the saddest amount of chicken i would have returned it if i lived closer

Address: 123 Gorge Road E Victoria, BC V9A 1L1 Canada
Review: hecklers is such a great spot they have the best priced and best tasting wings on island you cant compete with all those flavour options there daily specials are so enticing and they make it super fun by offering free foosball retro games trivia and comedy nights are hilarious our friend group loves hecklers

Address: 123 Gorge Road E Victoria, BC V9A 1L1 Canada
Review: best place to get wings 8 a pound on wednesday with around 20 choices of flavours between sauces and dry rubs quite a popular spot with really nice staff and ambiance went with 3 other friends and got 2 types each had a great time

Address: 123 Gorge Road E Victoria, BC V9A 1L1 Canada
Review:
went for one of their saturday comedy shows didnt buy tickets like they recommended but were fortunately able to squeeze us in

we got to see 3 different sets from comics from around canada who were all great the host was also super funny and i enjoyed his presence

our server was quick and surprisingly didnt forget to check in on us to offer more drinks throughout the show

highly recommend checking it out for a unique experience or date night

Address: 123 Gorge Road E Victoria, BC V9A 1L1 Canada
Review: went here for their wing wednesday these wings were the best wings ive ever had id fly out to victoria just for them

Address: 123 Gorge Road E Victoria, BC V9A 1L1 Canada
Review:
this place impresses me good service good food very fair prices jake was our bartender last night and treated us very well
the only issue i have is that ive been living in the gorge for 3 years now and havent checked this place out sooner great job guys

Address: 1701 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Z4 Canada
Review: the cheese cake here is ridiculously good we were passing by and decided to grab a cup of chai so glad we stopped in  i ordered the mini egg cheese cake and my partner ordered the salted caramel no complaints at all  what an amazing bakery in a coffee shop definitely worth a stop for a treat

Address: 1701 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Z4 Canada
Review:
i recently visited qv bakery to order a cheesecake for my husbands birthday and i just have to say  the experience was absolutely fantastic from the moment i called to make the order the staff was friendly and welcoming and they helped me to choose the perfect cheesecake to suit my husbands tastes

the cake itself was absolutely scrumptious  it was so creamy and rich with a perfectly smooth texture and just the right amount of sweetness the crust was also delicious with a lovely crunch and a light buttery flavor that complemented the cheesecake perfectly

overall i was extremely impressed with the quality of the cheesecake and the level of care and attention that went into creating it the team at qv bakery clearly takes pride in their work and it really shows in the finished product

i would definitely recommend this bakery to anyone looking for delicious highquality baked goods  whether youre in the mood for a sweet treat like a cheesecake or something savory like a freshbaked loaf of bread you cant go wrong with qv bakery thanks for making my husbands birthday so special

Address: 1701 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Z4 Canada
Review: great selection of cheesecakes its one of the cafesbakeries that stays open later which is nice since so many cafes close early in victoria

Address: 1701 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Z4 Canada
Review: another one of our go to becfest hointsbaked goods yummiest been coming back here for years especially when around canadas oldest china town neighborhood  ghosts n snuff  highly recommend good food friendly vibes qv bakery

Address: 1701 Government Street Victoria, BC V8W 1Z4 Canada
Review: cute little place for some cheesecake and snacks cheesecake selection is vast and drink menu is decent plenty of seating either indoor or outdoor with good atmosphere

Address: 450 Swift Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S3 Canada
Review: craft has a lovely waterfront location with a great environment and tasty food the only downside or upside depending on the person to the beautiful outside seating is sometimes the sea planes fly closely overhead my table and i were personally not bothered by this and most of us thought it was cool i opted to try a raspberry moscow mule which i was pleasantly surprised by it was not too sweet and in my opinion better than the regular the waitress was very kind bubbly and knowledgeable they were very cautious with any dietary restrictions and had plenty of options to substitute i would strongly recommend the laguna beach chicken bowl it was a great blend of flavors and the perfect size i wouldve liked there to be more chicken but the pieces i did have were delicious i didnt get a chance to go inside and see what it looked like but from the outside looking in it looked fresh and modern with a very summer vibe to it where i could see my friends and i getting together and hanging out all in all a great family dinner that we all enjoyed and the food left me wanting more

Address: 450 Swift Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S3 Canada
Review: atmosphere and ambiance was amazing great selection of good food and libations danielle was the best server and helped guide us on our lunch experience 1010 recommend

Address: 450 Swift Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S3 Canada
Review: during my visit to this place i had an enjoyable experience overall the food was decent although i wished for a better menu selection however the beer selection was somewhat limited which left room for improvement although the beers i tried were of good quality the lack of variety on the flight was disappointing with a broader selection this place has the potential to become a goto destination for beer enthusiasts nonetheless the friendly staff and inviting atmosphere made the visit memorable if you have the chance dont miss the opportunity to enjoy their patio or balcony seating during the summer

Address: 450 Swift Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S3 Canada
Review:
even better than vancouver one 
great atmosphere lots of options of craft local beer but also they got inhouse brews which are amazing their specials are made with  love recommend 1010

Address: 450 Swift Street Victoria, BC V8W 1S3 Canada
Review: amazing view great heated patio beautiful place the food was amazing and our server was very funny and outgoing i asked the server his two favourite menu items and chose the arugula prosciutto pizza and it tasted like an authentic european pizza he also recommended drinks for all of us and we loved each one will definitely be coming back

Address: 50 Bastion Square Victoria, BC V8W 1J2 Canada
Review: the produce was really good but the eggs were over cooked and the had browns were burned the vegan bowl was too oily and the sauce bland the atmosphere was really nice

Address: 50 Bastion Square Victoria, BC V8W 1J2 Canada
Review: lots of light and fresh decor full range of vegitarian and vegan food selection the rueben was made with marinated tempeh and beets  deliciius 3 sisters enchiladas very good andrea came by to see how the food was

Address: 50 Bastion Square Victoria, BC V8W 1J2 Canada
Review: i got the 3 sisters enchiladas  they were good unfortunately our experience was tarnished by the incredibly slow service it look a half hour to get our drinks alone

Address: 50 Bastion Square Victoria, BC V8W 1J2 Canada
Review: lovely and lively lunch i was visiting victoria and decided to give rebar a try even though it was past 100 pm the place was busy and bright colourful table covers greeted me i had the full rebar salad that was both filling and delicious the lemon square for dessert was just the right balance of sweet and acidic staff were friendly and efficient enjoy

Address: 50 Bastion Square Victoria, BC V8W 1J2 Canada
Review: so glad we tried rebar while in victoria the waitress was happy to point out the many gluten free  vegan options the portion sizes are great you wont leave hungry lots of fresh flavours and veggies in the dishes it would also be worth it to go just for the fresh juice delicious  it really hit the spot

Address: 512 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: this is the closest to thai food you get in thailand  excellent service from abc and her colleagues combined with tasty food  we highly recommend

Address: 512 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: i went here a few years ago and it was not good a friend invited me here recently and i told him that i had a bad experience last time he told me that the owners are new and the restaurant is much better now  i am very picky about my thai food but i reluctantly agreed to go and am i ever glad i did this is very good thai food in a very nice atmosphere the service was good too im glad the new owners have changed things ill be back

Address: 512 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: the prawn fried rice and prawntofu noodles were super delicious the portions are big and there are about 6 big juicy prawns per meal i ordered on doordash and it arrived quickly was well packaged and hot i will definitely order again

Address: 512 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review: had a great veggie pad thai lunch special it was a very open and welcoming environment friendly staff food came out hot and quick big portions for a great price takeout later was delicious

Address: 512 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8W 1E6 Canada
Review:
the food was really good first time trying this place the vibe in here is so cute and it says its the first thai restaurant in victoria since 1990
the papaya salad was nice balanced flavour with sour sweet and a bit hint of spicy the green curry was soooo good creamy and not too rich or too sweet the noodles was really good too i like this better than pad thai would definitely go back there and try more of their food
the coconut soup is so creamy and so good never had such rich soup before its well balanced with lemon flavour in it

Address: 549 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R5 Canada
Review:
wellthis isnt chinese food an edible attempt but not chinese food food is meh decor is extremely questionable for an asian restaurant even an eclectic one staff was accommodating and nice food came out with reasonable speed with effort on  presentation portion sizes are large but its still very pricy especially for mediocre food

description says they specialize in bubble tea but there was no bubble tea on the lunch menu i looked we ordered the ginger beef combo one wonton soup and the daily special which is the same every day by the way i believe that was pork fried noodles and fried shrimp on bean sprouts

wonton soup broth tasted exactly like chicken broth with more salt frozen wontons so so disappointing there might have been beef in the ginger beef or maybe it was just skinny strips of fried batter dunked in sweet sauce with ginger chunks the fried shrimp had bland batter bean sprouts no flavor at all saving grace is sweet and sour pork as well as fried rice were were fine

the staff came over to ask us if everything was ok well yeah it was ok so thats  what we said i didnt think asking for home made broth simmered for hours or more meat would be very feasible for the staff

about the decor the ceiling is literally spray painted black with extra holes punched in the ceiling for lights to look like stars maybe but it looks bad in the daylight the art is ok on its own honestly it just makes the whole thing look like an attempt at an avantgarde nightclub seats on the wall have tiny thin cushions to sit on and its kind of dirty there was a napkin and crumbs on the floor left by a customer who ate there and left no one cleaned it up just started moving the tables for the next guests snapping the fan on this one

Address: 549 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R5 Canada
Review: the sweet and sour pork was good and the service was great the won ton soup was a little salty but tasted great

Address: 549 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R5 Canada
Review: great food with a nice atmosphere right in the heart of canadas oldest chinatown went for lunch and really enjoyed the spicy lunch combo it was flavorful but not overly spicy definitely recommend a stop if your walking around downtown victoria

Address: 549 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R5 Canada
Review: this place was pretty good the food was very good for chinese food though the pork for the sweet and sour chicken was a bit too fatty the service here was awful the server was rude and watched expectantly at the screen when we were giving the tip she was also were snippy about everything the atmosphere was alright and the bathrooms were nice i might come back here again for the food but definitely only because of that i would maybe recommend this place to others

Address: 549 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R5 Canada
Review: the food was quite good the won ton soup had a favorable brith and was full of good ingredients  there is quite a difference in sizes the medium is definitely a meal i had the daily special  it was a good size the breaded shrimp had a little too much breading the noodles were delicious  i just didnt like the black walls but at lunch it wasnt too dark i would go again

Address: 1028 Hillside Avenue Victoria, BC V8T 2A3 Canada
Review:
maybe im ordering the wrong items or my taste buds are wonky

highlights
great service
atmosphere
location
saw a number of group tables which looked happy
wheelchair accessible looked like it to me which is nice

extra things to consider
parking

my experiences wont really stop me from coming back we have family dinners for peoples birthdays and we manage to rotate as best as we could around restaurants in victoria so im sure someone will choose this place as a venue again

overall family members party of 9 mostly were pleased with their meal all of us was happy with the service we didnt feel forgotten or felt like we were inconveniencing them  atmosphere is always consistent and warm when you walk in the outdoor patio looks comfortable

my only complaint is the food never seems to be enough in fries ok sorry i guess potatoes are going up in price my husband ordered the strips and fries strips are always good with the honey mustard but the fries portion keeps seemingly getting smaller every year we come back my pizza was good but just good seemed more like a fancy flat bread it felt like it was alright but felt like something was missing the artichoke dip was flavourful no complaints there nicely cheesy had good consistency didnt feel like we were really saving on portions so much

since the place does get busy its good to maybe note that parking could get tricky we had to park a little further down at the residential street

again maybe im just nitpicking but ill probably be back i will just say the service is always good

Address: 1028 Hillside Avenue Victoria, BC V8T 2A3 Canada
Review: natasha was so nice and her service was excellent  one of the nicest servers ever  i has the rotisserie chicken  its always delicious

Address: 1028 Hillside Avenue Victoria, BC V8T 2A3 Canada
Review: great and friendly service had a nice juicy burger after all love the atmosphere and the vibe

Address: 1028 Hillside Avenue Victoria, BC V8T 2A3 Canada
Review: very much looking forward to coming here again the atmosphere and decor were stellar i had the 14 chicken and rib dinner and everything was delectable including the coleslaw which usually never finds its way off the plate the gravy was out of this world and everything on the menu was very reasonably priced

Address: 1028 Hillside Avenue Victoria, BC V8T 2A3 Canada
Review: the lady who served me was absolutely wonderful check back in often made sure i was comfortable and had my food served in a timely manner very well done will be back again

Address: 810 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8T 5B1 Canada
Review: terrible food and service we had toast that look like bread sticks and the yogurt parfait tested expired it was so sour they said it was greek yogurt but the taste was so sour we couldnt eat a single spoon of it they offered to replace the yogurt with a bagel and then they told us they would charge us for it

Address: 810 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8T 5B1 Canada
Review: expensive and not terrible i paid 42 for two breakfast sandwiches i had asked for an extra four dollar bacon for two or three small pieces the sandwich is very small and not really well filled i wont stop here

Address: 810 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8T 5B1 Canada
Review:
wow 5 star flavour at an incredibly affordable price  did i say wow lol  a medley of comforting delight sweet potato gnocchi but with a mysterious twist radish peas roasted apple and a beautiful homemade cream sauce arugula garnish on the side  tasteful and blended perfectly

on a rainy night a wonderful local option and at 7pm open for dinner

my favourite coffee shop but now a dinner place amazing

Address: 810 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8T 5B1 Canada
Review: this was the location attached to our hotel which gave a gift certificate for our stay   we would have gone anyway   weather was beautiful and we could eat outside creating a particularly nice ambience  happy hour meals were quite good as were drinks   service was attentive   we would return

Address: 810 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8T 5B1 Canada
Review: terrible customer experience i went here with a friend for a couple of lattes and sat down 5 minutes later an employee comes over and hands us to go cups and says we cant stay in the cafe i question the employee and he told me the front of house manager said you have to leave liberal use of the title for a 5 seat coffee shop anyways we leave and 100 will never be back there are 50 other options in victoria for good artisan coffee dont waste your time here

Address: 405 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2V7 Canada
Review: best classic juice fired chicken in town best meat quality they use island chicken super tasty and fresh i order it every month i tried three different new fire chicken restaurants they are no match chicken on the run still the best

Address: 405 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2V7 Canada
Review: ordered the hungry man 6 pc chicken with fries and coleslaw for pick up plenty of parking staff was friendly the fried chicken is juicy and the batter is tasty as is the chicken their home fry wedges are excellent its fried with whats like tempura batter the coleslaw was okay would definitely order here again note that this place has only about 6 seats so its more for either pickup or delivery

Address: 405 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2V7 Canada
Review:
food this is the best fried chicken in town just like mom used to buy plus they also do milkshakes skip the fast food joint and have some local fried chicken instead delicious

service the staff are friendly and provide excellent service

accessibility ground level concrete entrance onto tile floor no tables a small 32 inch high counter seating with freestanding bar stools counter to order and pay is 48 inch high no customer bathrooms

Address: 405 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2V7 Canada
Review: this place has crispiest and juiciest fried chicken i have ever had i got a chance to try their ginger beef as well it was delicious highly recommended staff were wonderful will definitely go back there

Address: 405 Craigflower Road Victoria, BC V9A 2V7 Canada
Review: i thought chicken on the run and crown palace are two separate restaurants but turned out theyre one that makes it easier to order many people likes fried chicken here but for me theyre too salty even though the skin was thin and crispy but i couldnt eat more than one piece their wedges were very good though the other dish i order was ginger beef chow mein were just okay service was on time and friendly

Address: 614 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review:
10 acres delivers the food is delicious looks great and all from their own farm
make sure to make a reservation so you get a great table
we had the chicken and mussels  i feel it was a mistake should have stuck with one theme either seafood or no seafood
the chicken was very very good
id have it again

Address: 614 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review:
lovely atmosphere nice staff and quality food
incredible dishes and well designed menu had been there for breakfast and lunch loved it both

Address: 614 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: a farm to table restaurant we walked in on a saturday night and were seating right away the restaurant is very big there was a section with a bar with a younger ground another sections with larger groups and family and then another area that seemed to be more intimate everything that we ordered was delicious gnocchi lasagna and pumpkin cheesecake highly recommend the pumpkin cheesecake without the apple compote and lemonthose flavours didnt go well together for my palate i would say its the best ive had service was great i would definitely go back

Address: 614 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: stopped in without resos for lunch we were seated on the indoor patio which has a great vibe came in for an app and aperol spritz excellent atmosphere food was good fresh and unique they had a mix up with their bar order so they were out of prosecco which is finesht happens def coming back

Address: 614 Humboldt Street Victoria, BC V8W 1A4 Canada
Review: we just ordered some drinks beautiful interior design i loved how they incorporated plants into their outside patio most of their drinks include alcohol so it is not so much friendly for those who are avoiding alocholic drinks

Address: 1294 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A5 Canada
Review: rise and grind on broad street is easily my favourite goto casual breakfast brunch and coffee destination in downtown victoria the food options are diverse and made to order plus the brewed fresh discovery coffee is always a hit highly recommended never disappointed

Address: 1294 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A5 Canada
Review: the sandwiches were so good we got the strawberry banana smoothie as well which was really good i got the chicken blat which tasted really good too i loved the avocado in there we were able to sit inside but theres also outdoor seating and the atmosphere is nice and clean restrooms available as well

Address: 1294 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A5 Canada
Review:
the girl taking my order was polite  friendly
the food was definately subpar the toasted sandwich i ordered was barely warm not crisp like toasted it should be for 11 i expected a lot more of each filling described on the menu if the owners spent 50 cents to make this i would be surprised when my order was ready i just got hollered at by a number i had to get up twice as my drink and sandwich were ready seperately my sandwich was wrapped in a foil bag  tossed on the counter with no word of thanks or even a smile the staff were more interested in talking to each other than creating a friendly atmosphere i had high hopes looking at your menu i was willing to let the very worn floors  poor seating options slide for a good sandwich its just a sandwich after all  even subway makes a better sandwich for less money have you seen a sandwich from the red barn step it up rise and grind take  look at what your competitors are doing
i will not be back poor recommendation from me

Address: 1294 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A5 Canada
Review: finally after 2 years living downtown i have found a coffee shop that is absolutely wonderful they have excellent breakfast amazinghealthy lunch options and more the staff are nice and welcoming and not snobby or pretentious like many of the other coffeebreakfast spots downtown victoria excellent location too look forward to coming to rise and grind almost every morning thank you for your great cafe and service

Address: 1294 Broad Street Victoria, BC V8W 2A5 Canada
Review:
wow amazing breakfast sandwich i had there their ingredients were super fresh and of high quality the recipe and choice of ingredients were a perfect blend of flavor which delivered an harmonious taste experience the portion was satisfying and the price decent
i recommend

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review: the meals we ordered were awesome but man it took forever for our food to arrive i was starving and totally forgot to snap a pic  but hey it was absolutely delicious no complaints there the restaurant had such a cool vibe and my kids had a blast posing with all the animal decorations for pictures

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review: what a great spot for some breakfast welcoming staff cozy atmosphere great coffee and cappuccino staff go above and beyond to accommodate customizations and time accommodations all their shredded hash breakfasts are absolutely delicious and packed with nutrition i personally ask for well done hash so its nice and sharp when they flip it over

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review:
came in for breakfast with a group of 11 and kids we requested separate tables as we were going to pay separately but they offered 1 big table together as they were quite empty first issue kids were not prioritized even though we mentioned that they were hungry and adult can wait server only took drinks order then prioritized smaller table to get their meal order as it will take short time to do so compared to our table regardless they were seated after us last thing was they added gratuity to our bill without prior information which left us no choice but to pay thats was the main reason we wanted separate table and being charge for service that we considered not there
other than those issues that left us disappointed food taste was incredible freshly prepared ingredients with jam sauceeverything taste amazing worth to visit for food only

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review: you definitely gotta try this out we knew this diner has a special history which i can tell why locals keep coming back mesmerizing decor and menu is extensive it was hard to decide where to sit and what to order we tried their delicious breakfast menu generous portion and we were so full that we needed to walk it out the staff was humble and all their recommendations were spot on must try

Address: 642 Johnson St Victoria, BC V8W 1M6 Canada
Review:
this just may have been the best breakfast ive ever ordered at a restaurant we ordered the berry waffles and the poutine benny and my oh my were they delicious the contrast between the sweet and savory meals was delightful my wife and i shared our meals the waffles were honestly the best waffles i have ever eaten each bite nearly brought a tear to my eye from being so tasty the only complaint is that i live about 1000 miles away from the ruby  this restaurant alone tempts me to uproot my family and move to victoria just to eat breakfast here every week

a side note we were with our 17 month old baby and the staff was sooo kind and accommodating with him

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: what a great find such great service fun atmosphere and omg the food i think i have found a new breakfast favourite when in victoria a must try is the lavender latte so many delicious dishes to choose from we didnt see 1 unhappy customer while here and we loved every moment

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: the service was fantastic and food was incredible great place for the whole family even the wee ones theres is something for everybody without a doubt going back for seconds real soon hope everyone enjoys some food with family n friends enjoy

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: tacos chicken and waffles duck hash and the meal or the day  very good but a long wait you must be patient if you want to come here can take 3040 min wait but it has a nice sitting area good food though was worth the wait

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review:
what an awesome little gem hidden in plain sight lol didnt have to wait too long for a table service was top notch friendly and prompt im a waffle  pancake  girl and the ruby did not disappoint me caramelized bananas  roasted pecans and bourbon syrup on top of a stack of mouth watering waffles  hubby had an omelet with bacon  mushrooms  and cheese 
thank you ruby

Address: 3110 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8Z 3K4 Canada
Review: went here for brunch the food was amazing  the portions were huge the potatoes are the perfect crispy fluffy ratio the duck just fell off the bone  the sauce that same with it paired perfectly well would definitely go back  recommended only downside is that its small so not lots of seating but still worth a visit the staff were also helpful  friendly

Address: 560 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: amazing char sui and rice got a large portion for about 20  the red bean bun and egg tart were also amazing its hard to find good chinese bbq and buns in victoria so this is really appreciated staff were very kind too cant wait to come back and try the crispy pork

Address: 560 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review:
amazing place to enjoy chinese food
bbq pork with wanton noodles soup is awesome kids love it too
food server kevin is very helpful in suggesting what dish is a must for our first time

Address: 560 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: some of the worst asian food i have ever eaten  duck was mostly bones and had little taste beef flank lo mein had tasteless fatty meat with some corn starch sauce that also had an off taste  worst was the noodles which were not lo mein but singapore thin noodles that i have never seen offered in this dish service was pretty rude  dont bother with this nasty place

Address: 560 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: awesome experience delicious sweet and sour pork tasty rice and good spicy soup well definitely return here

Address: 560 Fisgard Street Victoria, BC V8W 1R4 Canada
Review: great spot for authentic hong kongcantonese cuisine in victoria this place along with don mee dim sum are my two favorite restaurants in victoria they also have bakery and bbq meat offering too the food quality is top notch and the taste is just as good as the best from the mainland definitely the top 3 best chinese restaurants on the island

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review: this is the second time ive stayed here i love it the rooms are small and still use the old style hot water heating radiator so if its cold in there it will take a bit to heat up there is no ac so id expect it can get hot in the summer the hotel has a colourful history and is over 100 years old the hallways are adorned with emily carr paintings she died there also the hotel supposedly is one of the most haunted in canada although i havent experienced anything while there  the staff is very friendly and helpful if youre into older style hotels that arent just another boring place then this place is for you

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review:
this is one of my favorite spots for dinner when in town  ive tried almost everything on the menu and have yet to find something i didnt enjoy

in addition to the regular menu they have specials each evening which typically include a pasta and a main entree  these can sell out quickly on busy nights

the caesar salad is amazing and i always get one

there are several vegetarian options and the veggie burger is great

bar options are limited in the restaurant but you can enjoy beer or wine with your meal

service is always friendly and attentive and the atmosphere is cozy

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review: overall good  food was good proportions generous  tasted pretty good although my steak sandwich could use more seasoning and less cooking  service was excellent atmosphere was excellent both restaurant and pub prices very reasonable would like to try again

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review: nice old place in the heart of james bay 10 min walk from down town no line up big and roomy  ordered a full candaron breakfast first bite amazing tastes like home made bread  vary happy with the size of the breakfast the service is good if you like a place for breakfast without a line up  this is your place parking is easy too

Address: 270 Government Street Victoria, BC V8V 2L2 Canada
Review: cant say enough great things about this hotel immaculately clean roy at the desk was a gem dinner in the bar was great with friendly conversation and they accommodated us when we said we needed our breakfast to be quick great location to visit the stunning beacon hill park rooms are small but thats to be expected for an historic hotel like this highly recommend

Address: The Strathcona Hotel 919 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2C2 Canada
Review:
old world charm meats big screen tvs
nice selection of both import and local brewery beer i went with the wicket lager its brewed by vancouver island brewery
menu is not overwhelming and its easy to find something you want to try whether it be bangers and mash a burger or even mac and cheese
the food is seasoned well and decent portions
staff were all welcoming and friendly  we did find that one gentleman who brought the food to the table wore entirely too much cologne it was to the point i would sneeze every time he walked past us
perhaps businesses need to bring back the no scent atmosphere for their customers convenience
we will return
import beer is pricey

Address: The Strathcona Hotel 919 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2C2 Canada
Review: steak was well cooked with delicious herb butter on top brussel sprouts were way undercooked mashed potatoes were really salty mac and cheese is incredible though  you can add chicken broccoli etc for an extra charge our server was nice but only visited the tables on each side of us not ours in the last 20 minutes so it took a long time to get our check we never got a refill on water either but maybe they figured the bottle of wine was adequate for us  be aware that theres a game room with pool etc sports games on tv so it can get a little loud if youre seated near it main dining room is relatively quiet otherwise or it was when we went basically the food is good service is alright and they have a rooftop patio that looks great the food was good enough that id give it another chance when im in town it wasnt particularly busy but maybe our server had more tables in another room that kept her busier than we were aware of

Address: The Strathcona Hotel 919 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2C2 Canada
Review: hanna was great sat in the actual sticky wicket not the rooftop which has a cover and no view or the games room which seems to be more about watching sports this is a confusing place there are multiple bars and all of them have different taps and features but they kind of represent as one establishment except they arent many of the menu items like the seafood boil for instance are only 2 days a month and only on the rooftop im not sure if its intentional deception or just bad marketing staff was friendly service was good just a little confusing and frustrating nice margaritas and palmeos with tajin rims mexican chilli lime salt beer selection is to limited as far as im concerned no hazy or imperial ipa or sours

Address: The Strathcona Hotel 919 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2C2 Canada
