Review: wish there were more vegetarianvegan options but for a traditional pub it was great i had the baha bowl with tofu and it was great my friend had the bangers and mash and said it was ok

Address: The Strathcona Hotel 919 Douglas Street Victoria, BC V8W 2C2 Canada
Review: great food and service bar area was nicely maintained and things werent too busy on a thursday night enjoyed hearing my parents stories about this place from 25 years ago the sticky wicket has a special place in my familys history

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: absolutely legendary fries were still crisp under the copious amount of gravy lots of squeaky cheese curds great smoked meat sandwich too service was a little whatever when we went though maybe funner at night

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review:
i recently visited la belle patate and tried their bbq poutine it was absolutely delicious the combination of crispy fries savory gravy and flavorful bbq sauce was just perfect i loved every bite of it

apart from the food the interior decor of the restaurant was also very unique and eyecatching it gave off a cozy and welcoming vibe making me feel right at home i especially loved the wall art and the cozy seating arrangements

overall i would highly recommend la belle patate to anyone who loves great food and a cozy ambiance its definitely a mustvisit spot in town im already planning to come back and try some of their other menu items and i cant wait to see what other surprises they have in store

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: first evening out in vancouver and i headed straight here so glad i did the laidback atmosphere as if you were at home a small place packed with a friendly and relaxed attitude but most of all poutine i got a mediumsized traditional poutine and it was just so incredibly good not greasy not too salty just perfect paired with a light beer couldnt ask for more

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: i love this place so much i have come here both times ive been on vacation to vancouver and i am always so happy with what i order i order the traditional and it is always enough food it comes out quick and the atmosphere is so great

Address: 1215 Davie Street Vancouver, BC V6E 1N4 Canada
Review: great food in a convenient location i was looking forward to the poutine from this spot and it did not disappoint i got the breakfast poutine which was delicious others in my group were very pleased as well the gravy is the star of the meal so i recommend getting a poutine with gravy

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: a must for visitors like us from colorado and locals alike if you want delicious authentic poutine look no further plus the service was immaculate and the owner is so so friendly  definitely try the spruce beer nonalcoholic think ginger beer or root beer and you wont be disappointed the poutine is the best and the steamie is a perfect little hot dog with all the toppings dont miss this awesome place

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: thee best hamburgers and poutine d√©licieuse in the city dont even mess with rest fresh local ingredients friendly passionate staffgood positive vibes

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: i highly encourage supporting this local business the poutine options are great i personally enjoy the loaded steamie along with fries  gravy make sure you get their inhouse made spruce beer a french canadian pop so yummy the owner has always been so welcoming to us

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review:
id been meaning to try this place for longer than i can remember and upon finally stopping in i wish id done so much sooner

having seen la bella patate recommended countless times it lived up to the hype completely the staff were quite friendly creating a relaxed atmosphere and the food was great i ordered a small classic poutine and a spruce beer if youre on the fence try the beer and look forward to returning in order to try a hotdog next

overall this is a very fairly priced and tasty gem in esquimalt solid 1010

Address: 1215 Esquimalt Road Victoria, BC V9A 3P1 Canada
Review: the poutine was delicious one side note they do have a pay phone in case you need to call someone in 80s

Address: 455 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T3 Canada
Review:
ive had ok pizza from here and the staff are generally decent their thin crust is not good but regular crust is maybe a 6 we order from them sometimes because they are local and close

i ordered delivery from them a week ago and everything was delivered cold

the worst part is that i tried something new their cheese stuffed bread the description

fresh baked bread stuffed with garlic butter villages mozzarella edam blend  cheddar cheese topped with parmesan cheese

the reality

it was cold burnt and inedible and after taking the picture it went directly in the garbage unfortunately no email address for customer service

very disappointed and on this basis alone quite unlikely to order from them again

Address: 455 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T3 Canada
Review:
this is there meat lovers i just bought for 25 dollars  a tinny bit ground beef and some pepperoni yuck is all i can say and my buddy who lives a block away warned me
better off buying a frozen pizza

Address: 455 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T3 Canada
Review: some days its very good other days the amount of toppings and cheese even though i paid for extra cheese is lacking crust is amazing though delivery drivers are top notch and super helpful

Address: 455 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T3 Canada
Review: one of the best thick crust pizzas ive had in this city pep  bacon slice for 4 really hit the spot friendly customer service too

Address: 455 Simcoe Street Victoria, BC V8V 4T3 Canada
Review: we usually love superior but this past friday we ordered and it was not good the crust was thick and chewy the cheese was barely melted there was very little sauce the mini brownies came in a villages pizza paper bag if its been taken over by villages  it explains the downturn in quality time to find a new pizza place

Address: 740 Burdett Avenue 18th Floor Victoria, BC V8W 1B2 Canada
Review: we had a wonderful dining experience here with great food and service and a fantastic view of the city we had the fresh oysters and humboldt squid as appetizers then the sesame tuna and pork tenderloin for our main course cheesecake and three truffles for dessert

Address: 740 Burdett Avenue 18th Floor Victoria, BC V8W 1B2 Canada
Review: world class food some of the best dinner server michael left an impression nobody can ever live up to what a service such a caring gentlemen treating diners like royalty if not just for food id come back just to be served by michael again salmon and squid for dinner with a guava passion fruit juice was a very memorable combo id have it again breakfast is great too but service is just normal potato green apple soup with olive oil was the bomb for breakfast the artichoke spinnach benny on their biscuit was really good i packed one home too and it stays fresh and soft for long time wow wow wow great vegetarian and pescatarian options

Address: 740 Burdett Avenue 18th Floor Victoria, BC V8W 1B2 Canada
Review:
this place always amazes me  never had a bad meal here
they do have a happy hour till 6 if i remember correctly food is delicious and service is great highly recommend free parking if you go into the desk

Address: 740 Burdett Avenue 18th Floor Victoria, BC V8W 1B2 Canada
Review: a wonderful treat with a very satisfying dine around menu kevin was a very attentive friendly and professional waiter who clearly takes pride in his work the food was fresh delicious and well presented always a pleasure dining here and well definitely be back

Address: 740 Burdett Avenue 18th Floor Victoria, BC V8W 1B2 Canada
Review: i love this place its unique because its on the 18th floor and also i think its a real treat the drinks are incredible and so is the food staff are always so friendly and attentive

Address: 1075 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: randomly tried this spot on the weekend and the food was fantastic all five in our group thoroughly enjoyed our meals the pancakes were fluffy the fruit was fresh and service friendly it took a little while for our food to come out but it was worth the wait i would definitely recommend coming here for brunch and will be back the prices are also very reasonable

Address: 1075 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: fantastic food and service must eat here eggs benny were delicious pancakes light and fluffy and the skillet was incredibly tasty did i mention the potatoes they have got to be the best and most delicious potatoes ever crispy outside soft and tender inside perfectly seasoned amazing they are all homemade 10 stars server was super attentive and kind and great for pokemonners since theres a stop out front and we made a new friend from the restaurant

Address: 1075 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: my new favourite breakfast place its a small greasyspoon style diner run by a family the portions are large the staff are amazingly friendly and the coffee is refillable it was very busy the day we went and the stafffamily was obviously struggling to keep up but you could tell they were trying their best and everyone waited patiently all around this place is amazing and i will go back many times

Address: 1075 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review:
in victoria for a quick vacation and happened upon this little restaurant
so impressed courteous service and astounding food wild salmon  avocado benedict on the homemade bread was delicious

Address: 1075 Fort Street Victoria, BC V8V 3K5 Canada
Review: decided to try this place out because my friend and i didnt feel like waiting in line somewhere else im so glad we came here instead the food was perfect and the prices were amazing compared to some of the other brunch places in town i had the smoked salmon and avocado benny and it was delicious the potatoes were super crispy and their homemade bread was so good as well as their homemade hot sauce service was awesome as well and the atmosphere was very cozy and homey in the best way found my new favourite brunch spot

Address: 1507 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 6P9 Canada
Review: great wings and a decent price they have some really delicious and interesting sauce options highly recommend the creamy dill tossed with actual little pieces of pickle the fries are also amazing the house salad is also a great value for how much you get and is awesome to cut through the grease a bit with some veg

Address: 1507 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 6P9 Canada
Review:
unfortunately fartnpuke has gone way downhill since i used to frequent in 2015 and 2016 area recently coming back several times in the past two years always fairly underwhelming
last time i came here it seemed to be a
very high bill for a hotdog combo with 2 beers 40 or 50

i came today to get the garlic fries came to 1160 altogether and they were very underwhelming charging an extra 3 for no real sauce or flavour really is a new thing to add

Address: 1507 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 6P9 Canada
Review: im 100 not a review person but as a gluten free vegan i have to post here to praise the vibe that is this restaurant perfect dive bar feelings with gluten free vegan wings and almost 20 vegan flavoursauce options ask for the vegan tahini sauce for dipping your veggies and wings brilliant hidden gem in the city for the best option for a night out with multiple people and lots of options ive never been so full of and stoked on tofu

Address: 1507 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 6P9 Canada
Review: food was so so expensive literally 2 dollars per wing in a 12lb order not worth it burgers were 12 bucks and tiny for that price things tasted fine but not good enough to charge an arm and leg the server was kind the atmosphere seemed fine but the prices were 3 dollars more than only a couple years ago thats ridiculous even given the pandemic and i wont be going back

Address: 1507 Pandora Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 6P9 Canada
Review: i have never had a better smash burger or fries in victoria never staff is fantastic food and tunes were great along with a solid place need to go back and smash some of the best wings in victoria a few years running now but the burger already has my vote

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review:
1 chicken supreme
 so good soft n tender mushroom sauce and cabbage was right on the point 1010
2 lobster bisque
 amazingly good and i love the texture could be more salty and richer though
3 french fries
 hot and crispy just perfecto

in general very good service there was a bit of waiting for the food but thats fine dinners good

ratings 910

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: this is a cozy little restaurant very warm atmosphere the food is amazing we came for breakfast several times while on vacation in victoria

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: very nice patio and two different menus options  you can also order from the penny farthing menu i only dont give them a 5 star review because the menu doesnt specify what the gluten free options or any other dietary options are the service was good and they are pet friendly at the patio i had a gluten free brie pear prosciutto chicken burger it was good but later on i realized that i could have opted for lettuce wrap and my server didnt even mentioned anything anyway we enjoy our food and will definitely come back

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: first time dining here this weekend and was very pleasantly surprised it lived up to the hype best french onion soup ive ever had and escargot was fantastic will definitely be back

Address: 2232 Oak Bay Avenue Victoria, BC V8R 1G5 Canada
Review: worse restaurant food ever very lukewarm service  pictures say a thousand words the carrots were charred black and inedible the duck leg was black and theres a rat named remi that makes better ratatouille  believe it or not we had to pay for this  very very sad that we didnt go to our favourite brasserie lecole

Address: 604 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review: favourite sushi bar in victoria great location to walk to if youre downtown near great shops off government street service is always excellent the atmosphere is quiet and a great layout not a huge place so at peak times you may have to wait for a table ive purchased takeout as well and quality is still superior to other sushi takeout a favourite place of mine for lunch the food is top notch always peak freshness excellent presentation as well

Address: 604 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review: make a reservation because the fact that our reserved group of 6 the max theyll reserve for went on a tuesday evening and the place was just packed says it all really good food really good service if you love sushi do not miss this opportunity and if you have celiac disease just ask for glutenfree options and theyll have you covered i went there with my glutenfree meetup and it was excellent reasonable prices too considering the times we live in a great datenight idea in the heart of downtown

Address: 604 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review: i have eaten at many sushi restaurants and this one definitely places among the very best the fish was so fresh with a buttery texture the green tea refreshing and wellpresented the service was excellent and the prices were good if i lived here i would eat here at least once per week highly recommended

Address: 604 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review: we had an excellent experience with friendly staff great food and honest prices

Address: 604 Broughton Street Victoria, BC V8W 1C7 Canada
Review:
my work colleague rants and raves of this place all the time and had been bugging me to go all these months i finally did somewhat reluctantly i had a onetime unpleasant experience eating here with my dad when i was 16 my older daughter is currently this age just to give you a time stamp and had bad diarrhea afterwards nearly missing my first young drivers appointment back in the day 

food quality is okay the sashimi is fresh but not that huge deal that it melts in your mouth and you must go here now that i read in other reviews  as you can see the presentation for their large assorted sashimi is very lacking 15 pieces yes but of very limited type and for the price not a good value to the eye of a sashimi connoisseur my beef teriyaki was overcooked they asked how i liked it done i replied medium rare but dish was medium borderline well done

service was there but quite slow we were given the bill but took a very very long time for them to come back for the pos i mean why bring the bill if youre not ready to accept payment right then and there and made to wait 

no stomach upset this visit which is a plus but even ordering their two biggest entrees i left the place hungry still and underwhelmed i feel this place is overhyped would only go back here with accompaniment and would most likely order something completely else on the menu

Address: 313 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V Canada
Review:
ive been here three times for the chicken soup with rice i really enjoy it and its a great portion for the price

cute cafe and its a nice vibe for cozy

Address: 313 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V Canada
Review: this is the perfect stop for a quick bite while youre out running errands or doing homework i tried the chicken pozole and a slice of the banana bread the soup was absolutely amazing i got a cup of the soup and you have an option for a side of bread or rice i tried the bread and it was so fresh and went great with the soup the banana bread wasnt the best it was a little tough to bite into but i did order it in the afternoon the cafe itself has only a few tables for mostly groups or two but many seemed to be available when i went will definitely be stopping by again

Address: 313 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V Canada
Review:
we werent sure if this is where we wanted to stop for lunch but we were glad we did the staff was very helpful and enthusiastic about our menu choices and gave us a good timeframe for when wed get our food

the curried egg sandwich was fresh and light made with their housemade bread the salad was also really nice and very tasty glad we stopped in for a bite

Address: 313 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V Canada
Review: it took me way too long to try some of the sandwiches here but now i cannot be stopped the creamy almond veggie and sweet chili chicken sandwiches are so fresh and delicious its everything you can ask for in a sandwich the soup and salads look very yummy as well so cant wait to try them you will find me on the outside street patio with my dog on too many days of the week watch out around this time of year the beautiful tree out front will pelt you in the head with its little spiky green acorn thingys

Address: 313 Cook Street Victoria, BC V8V Canada
Review: i come here 2 times a week  all the food is good i have yet to find something i dont like  the two regular menu soups chicken and a curry one are fantastic have them with the rice for a very filling meal  staff is always friendly

Address: 1117 Blanshard St Victoria, BC V8W 2H7 Canada
Review: excellent meal at baan thai  service was great and food came out quickly  the tom yum soup was rich and delicious  the papaya salad was surprisingly spicy in a good way  the drunken rice and panang curry were both so flavorful  i prefer pad thai elsewhere but with so many great choices here its hard to go wrong the key lime pie was amazing

Address: 1117 Blanshard St Victoria, BC V8W 2H7 Canada
Review: nice restaurant great ambience and friendly staff the food was great as well we will visit again when next we are in town

Address: 1117 Blanshard St Victoria, BC V8W 2H7 Canada
Review: we had a delicious meal with another couple four of us enjoyed spring rolls tom yum soup yum papaya salad yum chicken satay calamari not very thai but someone wanted it was good for appetizers for our mains we ordered pad seeuw thai garden macua phad tofu we also ordered a chicken dish which i did not eat as i mostly eat plant basedvegan we ordered the food mild and it was very mild but with many herbs and spices  it was flavourful we all agreed it was delicious we thought the food prices were reasonable its a new favourite restaurant

Address: 1117 Blanshard St Victoria, BC V8W 2H7 Canada
Review: my drunken noodles were pretty good  husband didnt like his food at all the atmosphere was nice

Address: 1117 Blanshard St Victoria, BC V8W 2H7 Canada
Review: 1010 food i think i got pad see ew and it was soooo good the service was wonderful as well our server gosh im terrible with names was super sweet and really went above and beyond for us my friend and i had never been in canada and asked about the currency and she gave us a full tour of it all canada i do not mean to mock your currency it is beautiful but i really thought she was kidding when she told us about loonies and toonies delicious and educational lunch

Address: 2000 Cadboro Bay Road Unit 104 Oak Bay, BC V8R 5G5 Canada
Review: delicious food and speedy service the place has a fairly cozy atmosphere and fair portion sizes hands down the papaya salad was the best thing we had its been ages since weve had a good papaya salad with a proper spice to it martini was a touch bit on the strong side and dont bother with the coffee if youre looking for a caffeine slap overall will definitely be returning next time im in town

Address: 2000 Cadboro Bay Road Unit 104 Oak Bay, BC V8R 5G5 Canada
Review:
baan thai service is amazing the food is brilliant

in oak bay theres a place to dine
where cuisine is spectacular and so divine

baan thai youll come to know
as a flavoured journey thatll make you glow

from savory curries to spicy soups
each dish is crafted with exotic roots

with flavors that dance upon your tongue
and aromas that leave you forever sprung

baan thai youll come to know
as a flavoured journey thatll make you glow

Address: 2000 Cadboro Bay Road Unit 104 Oak Bay, BC V8R 5G5 Canada
Review: baan thai is a classic go to for thai in victoria the food is consistently good and the space is calm and bright tonight though it was the service from solomon that motivated a review he was the best cheerful attentive and friendly made our night

Address: 2000 Cadboro Bay Road Unit 104 Oak Bay, BC V8R 5G5 Canada
Review: best thai food in victoria the food is exceptional and the service is flawless our server ella was so friendly and offered us some great recommendations delicious food relaxed ambience and super friendly staff keep us coming back regularly i would highly recommend this restaurant

Address: 2000 Cadboro Bay Road Unit 104 Oak Bay, BC V8R 5G5 Canada
Review: not really traditional thai food way too sweet in every dish

Address: 637 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M7 Canada
Review: tasty food and wonderful service my son whos a picky eater said that if there are more than 5 stars then he would give that to this place we ordered coconut curry mango curry and butter chicken all three of them are yummy and the latter is the best

Address: 637 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M7 Canada
Review:
didnt take a lot of pictures but the food was very much on point absolutely amazing tandoori fish sizzler curries cocktails and that dal tarka was just too good 

also special mention for the hostessserver who was very accommodating with all our requests kind friendly and also suggested few good spots to check out in victoria

ps went back the next day to get some take out lovely indian food in victoria that i hope everyone checks out if theyre craving some

Address: 637 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M7 Canada
Review: this was the only place that was open and not busy on family day and im glad we chanced upon it this place was wonderful and the food was delicious i got the chicken tikka curry and my husband got the kharri curry it was perfect for a cold february day we will be back again

Address: 637 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M7 Canada
Review: we had a fantastic dinner the food was amazing  my husband said it was the best indian hes ever had kirn and her staff were friendly engaging attentive and helpful we just wish we lived closer but well be back whenever were in victoria

Address: 637 Johnson Street Victoria, BC V8W 1M7 Canada
Review: this has become destination dining for us when visiting victoria for a number of reasons the food is packed with flavor and consistently excellent whether you take it mild or spicy the drinks are inventive and delicious and the bartenderwho i believe either owns or coowns the restaurantimprovised an offthemenu version of a manhattan for my wife that was as tasty as it was potent finally the staff are attentive and welcoming warm and knowledgeable a hidden gem well worth a try if youre ever even remotely in the mood for indian cuisine

Address: 1425 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: i dropped by to order take out after their cut off time for take out orders ari was very accommodating helped me with  choosing the dishes and the spicy sauces food was amazing and it was only surpassed by the staffs service next time i will try to dine in

Address: 1425 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
very good the food was excellent the chips were hot and the salsa was tasty
the service was okay but they were trying so i wont fault them for that
i would come back again

Address: 1425 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: great authentic mexican cuisine and the staff are really friendly i got into a long conversation with the manager about how they make pulled pork he even shared the recipe so i could try to replicate it at home  and recommended a pretty fantastic cookbook a great place

Address: 1425 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review: great place to chill and hang out we got the churros mexican rice and classic margarita everything was good

Address: 1425 Store Street Victoria, BC V8W 3C6 Canada
Review:
great location interesting interior and clean washrooms
good selection of legitimate mexican food and drinks good local beer selection too
ill definitely be back soon

Address: 141 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1A8 Canada
Review:
the missus and i along with our travelling family members discovered water prince corner shop during our walk around charlottetown we took the only available seating on the outside for lunch what a find

the food and service were superb the lobster roll was perfection the fish and chips was also nicely done with a healthy portion of fish

we all highly recommend and agreed you gotta eat here

Address: 141 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1A8 Canada
Review:
best lobster roll on the island so far even saying that its going to be hard to find better great family restaurant vibe friendly and helpful staff very clean no wait time although we came after peak lunch time
the seafood chowder was very good my wife got the chicken burger and it was also very good
left it up to the waitress for a local beer and she definitely didnt steer me wrong 100 would come back

Address: 141 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1A8 Canada
Review:
excellent local restaurant  the best lobster roll i had during my stay  also ordered the fish cakes and onion rings  reasonably priced about 75 including tax

ordered seafood to take home with me  great service  they make it super easy to order and pack it well for travel  better product and cheaper than buying it at home

would definitely recommend as one of the restaurants to check out in charlottetown  love that they have long hours

Address: 141 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1A8 Canada
Review: great place the scallop burger and the lobster roll were so good the scallop was slightly fried to perfection and the lobster was tender slightly chewy and fresh i really like the buns of the lobster roll because it was toasted on the outside and very crispy compared to the other lobster rolls this was the best the oysters were very fresh and goes amazingly well with the sauce highly recommend and would come again

Address: 141 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1A8 Canada
Review:
highly recommended well worth the wait we came back the next day instead of trying out other restaurants
we ordered mussels clams oysters seafood chowder lobster roll and halibut fish and chips during the 2 visits food was beyond great both times it did not disappoint were not a fan of oysters we just wanted to try it again and the oysters were great too
we did eventually try another restaurants mussels but this place has the best musselsfood
extremely friendly staff
when we came back it was very busy we did have to wait long but it was well worth the wait
make a reservation or come in between meal hours for a better chance of getting a table when we come back to cahrlottetown this will be one of the places we will definitely come back to

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review:
i was very excited to eat here as i read that it was one of if not the best seafood restaurants in halifax it was underwhelming

i ordered the oysters rockefeller which was probably my own fault for ordering it was just cheese on a shell

the halibut special was good although the strawberry pur√©e they served it with clashed a little the potatoes were only okay

i enjoyed the mussels that my friend got some of the best ive had

all in all it is a good restaurant the service is alright and the food is pretty good i would say its not worth the price though i was tempted to give 4 stars but at these price points its a 3

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review:
quite enjoyed our food here pei oysters were absolutely amazing
i had lobster risotto and my partner had seafood pasta both were good not raving about either dish but we werent disappointed either
small place inside so recommend reservations

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review: excellent meal tonight we started with some oysters and the shrimp tempura oysters were so delicious and the shrimp tempura had just the right spice we both went with the special for the night which was a grilled halibut with a jerk spice sauce unreal meal highly recommend

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review: what a delicious meal we enjoyed the rockefeller oysters were superstars the new potatoes were so buttery  cooked to perfection a delicious meal we would certainly recommend to anyone in pei

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review: charlottetowns best restaurant  did not disappoint the seafood cakes and pasta were delicious  be sure to reserve a couple of days ahead its a small room

Address: 151 Kent Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1N5 Canada
Review:
they were kind enough to give me the onion rings i ordered not sure why i was given fries
however onion rings tasted very oily  yuck

the dumplings were really good

the chicken burger was good except it tasted very salty  did someone just dump salt onto it

lastly the refills which came much later  my cola tasted like moldy   not sure if it was ice cubes glass or the actual cola

the pictures online show well but food was substandard

i really apologize for leaving this review but i was struggling with my meal

good luck to your business  zero tip

Address: 151 Kent Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1N5 Canada
Review:
my family and i are so grateful we stumbled upon this place the service was impeccable atmosphere was lovely and the food was absolutely delicious
they change their menu each month which we think is super cool and as a family with a million allergies celiac seafood nuts dairy soy etc we were delighted by the precautions taken and assurance that we were in the right hands
i love my family but we tend to be very stuckup when it comes to trying new restaurants as we have high expectations this restaurant blew us out of the water
we cannot wait to come back and are even more excited to try a whole new menu
trying this is a must whether you just want a drink or are looking for a delectable meal the hopyard is the place to be

Address: 151 Kent Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1N5 Canada
Review: sooooo good its worth stopping in here if youre ever in charlottetown for sure with an ever evolving menu options for vegan vegetarian and gluten free and amble beer selection youll have to visit more than once to experience everything you would want to try here 1410 would recommend you go here now

Address: 151 Kent Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1N5 Canada
Review: we had great service and it was a nice environment my only complaint was that the food we ordered was coated in so many different rich sauces and it was very salty having a sensitive tummy sometimes all the saucesalt made the food hard to eat  if i had known i would have requested lessss sauce but i can see how people love this place

Address: 151 Kent Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1N5 Canada
Review: stumbled in here mostly by accident while looking for vegan food we were both delightfully surprised by the menu tons of great veggie options my partner loved the vegan tacos and the poke bowl was amazing lots of cool brews on tap my light ale tasted more like a hoppy ipa but i am not a beer expert overall highly recommend great spot

Address: 126 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G4 Canada
Review:
stop in for a drink in between meals while exploring charlottetown great beer flight options id recommend the podium flight my wife really liked the tropical popsicle
didnt try any food but the menu looks like its worth checking out next visit very clean friendly staff interesting architecture

Address: 126 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G4 Canada
Review:
a friend of mine from pei  well actually hes not my friend hes my husbands friend so my friend by association  recommended this place and were so glad he did

delicious fish cakes tuna tartare and fish tacos our waitress was great and the service was excellent

highly recommend

Address: 126 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G4 Canada
Review: oysters on the half with choice of beer would have hit the spot  place was hopping and had i known we were going to be moved like cattle i would have foregone the oysters my husband wound up eating them after the entre  delicious fish tacos and fish and chips service was friendly and personable next time i wont order the meals til we get the drinks and apps

Address: 126 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G4 Canada
Review: great place to have some fantastic beer and food the pretzel and chilli cheese starters and fish and chips were delicious great venue great service for a reasonable price would recommend

Address: 126 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G4 Canada
Review: this very traditional pub has great atmosphere our group had fish cakes seafood chowder and the ring bearer burger the burger was a huge disappointment as the beef patty came burned  we were puzzled that such badly cooked item could come from the same kitchen that has produced amazing food in past visits and the great fish cakes  chowder  not to repeat anytime soon despite the great beer

Address: 125 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K4 Canada
Review:
a great place to stop in for brunch with friends this historic building is very quirky and modernized inside with beautiful artwork displayed on the walls and nice dim lighting huge wellstocked bar upstairs with a large variety of spirits to cater to all your cocktail needs

the plating was a bit messy but dont let that offput you  the food was delicious and the dishes were quite large everything was very filling a bit on the pricier side overall but worth it for a treat

Address: 125 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K4 Canada
Review: food is amazing service is great as well music feels off with the atmosphere maybe instead of pop music jazz or blues would be better just a suggestion

Address: 125 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K4 Canada
Review: such great beer selection delicious seafood chowder and the warm brownie was to die for very fair prices and lovely servers

Address: 125 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K4 Canada
Review: went here with a group of 5 around 12pm and waited an hour and a half for our food the waitress was very polite and friendly and continued to check on us throughout our wait though the food was good the portions were relatively small for the price

Address: 125 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K4 Canada
Review: great place had the best calamari ive ever had here and the best halibut

Address: 70 Grafton St Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K7 Canada
Review:
great outdoor patio and great food had the chicken burger fries flat bread pizza and garden salad
flatbread pizza and the garden salad were plain and i did not like the homemade salad dressing however their homemade ranch is amazing i highly recommend getting a side of ranch for your fries
chicken burger was a 1010

Address: 70 Grafton St Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K7 Canada
Review: the buddha bowl with shrimp is delicious  sangria was very good also our servers were  very sweet one spilled one of our drinks so we werent charged for the drinks  we only each had a drink  we sat outside and there was entertainment  very nice atmosphere outside

Address: 70 Grafton St Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K7 Canada
Review:
a definite stop if youre in pei the staff are super friendly and the food is delicious

i ordered the ribs which were fantastic the potatoes were amazing

the restaurant itself was very clean and located in an old building with character

Address: 70 Grafton St Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K7 Canada
Review:
weve been twice during our vacation and were not disappointed with a single one of our choices  the food is delicious
budda bowl fried chicken sandwich wings perogies and poutine burger were all delicious
may just come back before we leave charlottetown

Address: 70 Grafton St Charlottetown, PE C1A 1K7 Canada
Review: came in as a walkin and wouldnt have had time to sit and eat due to it being a friday night in a rush to watch anne  gilbert in a little more than 15hrs we ordered take out but then the manager sorry forgot your name said a table opened up and if we chose could sit and experience the restaurant instead we chose to stay and found out it was the right move from the beginning the two greeters were amazing helpful and friendly also our server who recommended the no boats on sunday cranberry cidar maddy atmosphere was lively and the food was great only thing better was the service and kindness by the staff go to pilot house

Address: 39 Eden Street Unit 5 Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: the food was tasty and prepared as suggestedif you are craving for plain indian food this is the placethey had nice chicken momo and have nice service and decent sitting areawe tried chicken currymix veg and it tasted goodwe were tourist there and tried this restaurant based on the reviews and it worked well for us

Address: 39 Eden Street Unit 5 Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review:
this place is awesome and i love their food their chicken curry with rice reminded me of my maternal grandmother because the preparation and the spices had touches of bengal i also liked their dessert options and the beautiful nepali music

i strongly recommend this place

Address: 39 Eden Street Unit 5 Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: delicious indian food all curries had different flavours so very well understood that they dont share a common base like many other restaurants lassi tasted very natural and glad tried both plain and mango there are only limited seating options service was good will repeat given a chance

Address: 39 Eden Street Unit 5 Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: awesome place to eat out at the prices are amazing and the portions are very good for the price vegetarian options are plentiful and the naan is great

Address: 39 Eden Street Unit 5 Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: the food is always excellent here my favourite is chicken tikka masala with rice or naan i also love their mango lassi the servers were great and its a nice quiet and calm atmosphere i highly recommend it

Address: 138 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: the food was tasty and prepared as suggestedif you are craving for plain indian food this is the placethey had nice chicken momo and have nice service and decent sitting areawe tried chicken currymix veg and it tasted goodwe were tourist there and tried this restaurant based on the reviews and it worked well for us

Address: 138 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
this place is awesome and i love their food their chicken curry with rice reminded me of my maternal grandmother because the preparation and the spices had touches of bengal i also liked their dessert options and the beautiful nepali music

i strongly recommend this place

Address: 138 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: delicious indian food all curries had different flavours so very well understood that they dont share a common base like many other restaurants lassi tasted very natural and glad tried both plain and mango there are only limited seating options service was good will repeat given a chance

Address: 138 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: awesome place to eat out at the prices are amazing and the portions are very good for the price vegetarian options are plentiful and the naan is great

Address: 138 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: the food is always excellent here my favourite is chicken tikka masala with rice or naan i also love their mango lassi the servers were great and its a nice quiet and calm atmosphere i highly recommend it

Address: 86 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A7 Canada
Review: fantastic had the filet mignon with the gouda and a lobster tail mashed potatoes were wonderful also had the broiled oysters hubby had the ribeye the atmosphere is amazing everything down to the restrooms is amazing our bartender server sat at the bar was great dined at 4 pm on a tuesday it was not crowded

Address: 86 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A7 Canada
Review: we are on a road trip in the maritimes weve had meals in montreal quebec city halifax peggys cove lunenburg digby st john and saint andrews bythesea do dinner we had that sims corner steakhouse  oyster bar was by far the best hats off to the chefs and our server sarah

Address: 86 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A7 Canada
Review: great service by our waitress never missing a beat and very good hospitality the food was well served and prepared i recommend the seafood chowder  wonderful flavor and if you order biscuits it comes with a sweet butter that is so delicious the building is well designed in atmosphere love the old chandelier

Address: 86 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A7 Canada
Review: its a pretty dark restaurant the furniture are heavy looking with all velvet chairs or velvet couches very mixed colors from bright pink to dark green chairs not sure how my eyes felt but i was comfortably sitting though the service of our waitress was super slow but she was super nice example it took her 20 minutes to bring us two bottles of wine so you can imagine how long it took to take our orders and to receive our plates i ordered seared halibut with roasted vegetables and green salad with candied walnuts beet chips goat cheese and raspberry vinaigrette the salad was mind blowing my halibut was good till you reach in the middle where flavor hasnt penetrated inside so it was very bland inside otherwise good experience with my amazing group even tough i didnt pay the prices are very steep for a tiny portion of meal

Address: 86 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A7 Canada
Review: fresh oysters excellent service we ordered 2 dozen oysters and followed the waitress recommendation all the oysters are fresh and delicious we mentioned that the seafood chowder is a bit salty for us the waitress immediately waived the bill for the chowder i would like to say their service is a five star level they let customer feel reliable and comfortable i will recommend this place to my friends

Address: 2 Lower Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review: we came here for supper with friends one of us has a food allergy they sat us served drinks and asked about our friend who had brought her own food she acted as if everything was fine she came back to take our orders after about 10 minutes of getting our drinks and our friend halfway through eating her food the manager came to us and asked us to leave he said that they couldnt allow outside food into the restaurant so we left before actually getting our food as we were walking in a couple was leaving because they werent getting any service no go

Address: 2 Lower Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review: a wonderful patio taylor and carlos provided us with excellent service very reasonably priced great selection of beers and the pork tacos were some of the best we had only drawback was the county music the dj was playingugh enough crying about trucks and dogs and work

Address: 2 Lower Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review: great place off the water relaxed and great staff

Address: 2 Lower Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review: had a wonderful experience here live music on the harbor and wonderful food fast and friendly service my wife and i managed to finish the seafood boil that was supposed to feed 4 but we were hungry after a long day of travel

Address: 2 Lower Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review:
great place to bring your dog their patio is essentially a dog park with chairs very cozy and casual

service was underwhelming waited 5 minutes to be seated despite most of the patio area being empty

our order was taken promptly after we were seated and the food came in under 10 minutes

we got fish and chips it was a little greasy and not fresh but thats to be expected good food overall loved the fries

it was quite a while before we saw our waitress again everyone at the table next to us stood up and flagged the staff down because they were tired of waiting for their bill eventually we had to do the same

as the temperature began to drop we noticed the staff bringing blankets to other guests so that was nice for them

tldr
good food slow service got the impression that they were slightly understaffed and perhaps a bit inefficient but it is by far the most dog friendly place in charlottetown

Address: 132 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review: perfect dinner especially when we went to the hunter restaurant recommended by a friend just after the plane landed and they didnt let us in  came to this lively and delicious restaurant  the staff are very welcoming  the staff helped me choose a very weak beer suitable for ladies  i am very happy with my beer alas  serve with seafood pasta and seafood tacos  very satisfied listening to music and drinking wine  the first day of our pei trip ended perfectly

Address: 132 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
the server was nice and i feel bad she had to take our calamari back that said what is the restaurant thinking we love this island and have had great experiences across the board including culinary but this was a joke

the beer and wine was fine and the beet salad was good albeit a little pricey for its size but the calamari i cant even lol

check the two pics first is what the tried serving us with no dip lemon or anything we did not have a bite the second is what typical calamari for the price looks like

seriously if you cant make a dish up to par dont have it on the menu

shame that we picked this place and others were open this was kinda a night killer but whatever i hope they use this review to get better or remove this item from their menu

oh yeah once again we did not take one bite of that plate lol

Address: 132 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
all ive got to say is chefs kiss

the bowl of chowder was a huge portion and was rich and hearty
the seafood pasta had great ingredients  steak bites were perfectly cooked and the pretzel bites was like the cherry on top

service from the bar was prompt in food and drinks  and the drinks were flowing well

highly recommend for a stop in if youre visiting charlottetown

Address: 132 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
my wife and i just had our 2nd anniversary dinner here and we loved it i had scallops she had the haddock it was all amazing
one of the many friendly staff members took our picture with dinners presented
highly recommended

Address: 132 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
i absolutely loved the big andy burger it was superb and made my tummy very happy just the right amount of spice and savory from that jalapeno aioli my friend go the fish and chips which were also very nice flakey and cooked perfectly  the tartar sauce was good and flavorful

the beer selection was very good i was able to sample a few to see what i liked best and choose from those the gahan blueberry wheat beer was especially yummy the beer could have been colder though as i found it was a bit warmer when it was served but still appropriately cool this was more of a personal preference

service was great too fairly normal wait time for a busy place and the staff were very quick to help you out with a request id certainly recommend this place to friends

one last thing  the live music was a nice touch and they were great performances

Address: 2 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
great little spot the vibe of this place was super positive  with lots of lovely outdoor seating  and the people working there were super lovely 

lobster roll with fries for only 22 coming from toronto i was certainly expecting a higher price point and was pleasantly surprised the roll was a bit smaller than i would expect but again the price was at least 6 cheaper than what i have seen elsewhere and the food tasted great well seasoned lobster buttery crispy exterior on the bun and the fries were perfect

i would come back again for sure

Address: 2 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
if you want something different this is the place
the fish has some different batter in a good way
fries seen to be the real ones had cut and wild fish as well
pulled pork poutine was good too
good customer service 
we recommend it

Address: 2 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
ordered the lobster roll fish sandwich and a beer  i believe the lobster roll was 24 the fish sandwich was 14 and the beer was 8

overall the lobster roll was okay but didnt come with full chunks of lobster  there were a few chunks with shredded lobster  the bread used for the rolls was very good  the fish sandwich was also okay and the fries were tasty and very crispy

the staff were very nice and the shack is located in a great spot

Address: 2 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: i am missing seeing the owner who used to essentially live here but its good to see that she can take a break every once in a while and trust her staff to do an excellent job just like her everyone was professional friendly and helpful the food is great the homemade french fries with their homemade garlic dip is a must ive been here before and i will be back many many more times

Address: 2 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: ive been here multiple times as im from charlottetown the owner is an amazingly high energy beautifully kind person she has chosen her staff very wisely and on the odd time when shes not there they take over seamlessly the food is amazing the lobster roll is incredible my absolute favourite is the homemade french fries with the yummy yummy garlic dip keep up the incredible work guys look forward to seeing you each year i will be back over and over and over

Address: 146 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A Canada
Review: i went there for dinner when we traveled to pei the restaurant was really good and clean the experience was very pleasant and theres shows and music on that street we ordered the seafood chowder and burger they were delicious definitely worth the money and time and would go there again

Address: 146 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A Canada
Review: we stopped in here for a much needed late lunch it was quiet at the time my wife had an excellent lobster roll i had lobster poutine there was just enough lobster to keep me satisfied  my wife also had the chowder which was great as well they have a handful of beers on tap as well too a decent place to grab lunch after a long day for sure

Address: 146 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A Canada
Review:
what can i say loved the place
nice ambience fantastic food and great service
our server angela was super friendly fun and entertaining as well as kind enough to give us a crash course on dealing with our first whole lobster
we decided to go all in and opted for the church main  a whole lobster preceded by a chowder and a bowl of clams and followed by a dessert
the chowder was very smooth and creamy with teragon being the secret ingredient the clams were great with their souse
and the lobster  just delicious
turtle cheesecake in a jar was the cherry on top
not a cheap dinner but the experience was well worth every dollar

Address: 146 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A Canada
Review: after trying 3 different lobster rolls during my trip here this place offers average lobster rolls with very high prices compared to most places the flavor was lacking in the roll unfortunately  but the fries were very crispy and tasty service was great and attentive

Address: 146 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A Canada
Review: stopped twice for drinks friendly staff but got a little attitude when we declined the food menu prior to a show we were going to took them more than 10 minutes to bring our drinks on the other side we had 2 nice waiters asking us if we were ok a few times  not our waitress as we were going for dinner on a saturday night because it was highly recommended they were closed for inventory  why would you close on a saturday during tourist season

Address: 7 St Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N1 Canada
Review: the gluten free crust is chewy and thinnot the best combination toppings were generous but the chicken was a tad dry i did order delivery so i didnt have the freshest pizza but i was expecting more for the price

Address: 7 St Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N1 Canada
Review: good pizza little expensive but worth it i would recommend you to try different pizza each time you visit for different flavours

Address: 7 St Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N1 Canada
Review: we took our kids out tonight to try famous peppers for the first time and it was absolutely amazing we got 4 9inch pizzas to try and cant wait to go back and try some other ones out

Address: 7 St Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N1 Canada
Review: server was extremely friendly pizza was good if you like different styles of pizza the maple cream sauce was a bit confusing but its good its more so like a whipped cream beer was good and cold only small complaint is the wait time but it wasnt to bad compared to some places

Address: 7 St Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N1 Canada
Review: a nice variety of signature pizzas with a great selection of hot sauces was kidfriendly and easily accessible

Address: 45 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A4 Canada
Review: great spot i am not usually one for restaurant pizza but i couldnt pass it up i had the americana and it was probably one of the best pizzas i have ever had the staff was also great with accommodating my request for a singular arancini since no one would split an app with me

Address: 45 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A4 Canada
Review:
although all the food was excellent my wife and i both believed that there was opportunities to step up the game the all of appetizer couldve been made excellent by getting some smoke flavour to the olives as well as serving them warm with just a minimal amount of orange zest grated on top
my wife had an appetizer that was mozzarella cheese wrapped in prosciutto with a marinara sauce we both believe that the cheese ratio shouldve been higher as well as a pan sear on the prosciutto before putting into the marinara sauce with it elevated this dish we both have the pizza different times and it was excellent

Address: 45 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A4 Canada
Review:
i was thrilled to stumble upon this delicious italian oasis on a rainy and windy sunday night in charlottetown

for those of you new to the east coast myself included you will quickly learn that pretty much everything is closed on a sunday and monday and tuesday but not this place

the butternut squash soup was a great way to warm up from the cold and the pizza was light and satisfying we got the vegan pizza with real cheese as was suggested by our waiter he was dare i say a genius

finished off the meal with tiramisu in a jar cuz were cool like that

Address: 45 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A4 Canada
Review:
nested between the various shops and numerous restaurants crowding queen street in charlottetown the piatto may be easily missed by the inattentive passerby in a hurry from the outside the venue has a low profile compared to many of the flashier eateries lining the street

i went in blind without prior knowledge of the place despite living quite nearby and passing it frequently i entered the piatto and was almost immediately welcomed and seated  there was a friendly ambiance and familiar vibe from the moment i set foot inside the restaurant

my server marlow introduced himself and offered me the menu i looked at the various options but eventually decided to ask him for recommendations  he gladly obliged and suggested some favourites as well as something based on my preferences for something with many toppings marlow spoke passionately about each dish and eventually i settled for a simple delicious classic  the siciliana

the siciliana was served surprisingly quickly and looked beautiful at first i thought that i might not be able to finish a 10 pizza by myself but the pizza was light and refreshing with a balance of fresh veggies and evenly spread proteins every bite introduced my taste buds to fresh peppers tomatoes and basil all complemented by some light cheese if you go in expecting your typical heavy fat american pizza you might want to reconsider but if you are looking for a more authentic fresh handcrafted pizza look no further than the piatto

Address: 45 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A4 Canada
Review: great food  really great in fact great service wonderful that they have vegan options my partner could enjoy could have done without the live music  too loud and not very entertaining we were there to eat not listen to some guy sing the unicorn by the irish rovers overall recommended

Address: 186 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: i have been to this place multiple times over years when visiting charlottetown the dishes are delicious and the staff friendly we have even ordered takeouts for 10 people this year they say if we give them more advanced time they can prepare trays but we ordered an hour ahead so it was all separate dishes all good and all clear they have a small buddha hall upstairs check it out next time

Address: 186 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: the best vegetarianvegan restaurant in charlottetown hands down the pricing is fair service is great and the atmosphere is always so calm and welcoming several times in the past the staff have given out treats for special holidays as well which is always greatly appreciated dont miss out on trying this place if youre looking for some delicious veg food in town

Address: 186 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: nice menu selection and good vegan options however it seems like the spice we expect from this style of restaurant in other cities has been tamed down for maritimes palates

Address: 186 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: stopped here for some vegan food for dinner  service was good if a bit slow food was fine but nothing more perhaps we had three dishes that were misses but we werent super impressed with the flavours or quality overall a good enough experience it seems that many people love this place so take what we say with a grain of salt

Address: 186 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: my unique taiwanese cousin in pei  sweet tofu is delicious thai stirfry eggplant is morelike northeneast flavor the only concern is the quantity of tofu is less than eggplant

Address: 189 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4L1 Canada
Review: took a friend here for their sunday afternoon jam so she could experience some celtic music  we had a really good time with great seats  we shared the bacon wrapped scallops and the spinach dip  the scallops were large and cooked perfectly  my friend ordered the blueberry ale which she loved  very attentive waitress and we appreciated that she told us that the spinach dip would take a bit longer and we were asked if we wanted the scallops first or to have them held to come out with the dip  definitely worth a return trip

Address: 189 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4L1 Canada
Review: the food was very filling one entree can fill you to the brim we made the mistake of ordering appetizers the food was too salty for me but good waitress was very kind and checked on us often we ordered potato skins which was more nacho form with potato skins and a giant plate full then we ordered the steak n steak n colcannon and the irish stew the stew came with colcannon and irish brown bread i finished everything and am not proud to say that i proceeded to have the worst gas of my life i think my entire intestine was inflated by the end of the night my husband loved the food and for the first time in his life could not finish the second steak i think if i were to go back id have to order something smaller and not be so ambitious haha

Address: 189 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4L1 Canada
Review: i love the irish coffee the platter was perfect to share with friends there was livemusic which makes good vibes

Address: 189 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4L1 Canada
Review:
half price appetizers monday and tuesday with the purchase of beverage foods are fantastic especially considering the price lots of choices of beer both crafts and commercial brands
gunniess is 6 dollars on tuesday

Address: 189 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4L1 Canada
Review: we were very grateful they took us in at 940pm for dinner unfortunately i wasnt the biggest fan of their food i thought their shrimp pasta has far too much sauce and their chowder tasted meh their fried shrimp and service was great though

Address: 330 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M4 Canada
Review: really good korean food not fast but thats probably a good thing not going to say the atmosphere is anything to write home about but if you are looking for good authentic bibimbap or kimchi while on charlottetown this is your place

Address: 330 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M4 Canada
Review: ordered the fried chicken and i have one question do you not believe in seasoning it was so bland and boring and just  meh never had it but i think boiled chicken would still be seasoned better and thats some in a a whole league on their own and not a good one over priced and boring only pro was that the skin was a perfect crisp which at least it had texture not sure about the rest of their food but i hope they do better

Address: 330 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M4 Canada
Review: ideal location for a quick bite or takeout delicious famous korean dishes and asian styled flavoring their shop is a little bit small so it might get crowded

Address: 330 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M4 Canada
Review: our favourite spot in town everything weve tried is excellent the menu is small so you dont have to spend an hour looking for something their dumplings are a must

Address: 330 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M4 Canada
Review: pricey for a rice dish however i love dolsot bibimbap its what i order at every korean restaurant kinda an expert at this point always good food and good service

Address: 23 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review:
prior to moving to pei i tried the merchantman patio and had an underwhelming experience poor service and poor presentation of my meal fast forward to last week when our family came to visit and they made a reservation which worried me  but thankfully my concerns were completely unfounded  we sat in the restaurant the service was okay but the food was excellent especially the island seafood boil our server advised the portion was large and suggested it was a meal for two thank goodness we took heed of his suggestion it was huge and definitely a meal for 2 the scallops were cooked perfectly and lots of them  as were the mussels clams shrimp and snow crab and lobster  i now know where we can go for that special occasion and have a wonderful seafood feast that we love so much
i know a lot of people are are very critical of establishments and if they have one bad experience they wont return if we had subscribed to that philosophy it would have been our loss thanks merchantman for improving your game

Address: 23 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review:
appetizers were great the baked oysters especially would recommend

the sangria was a good price for the size

disappointed in the meals the beef was low quality and kinda tasted like wild meat the lobster role came on a hot dog bun tasted very processed do not recommend

sat down at 8pm reservation we were going to order desert but was advised the kitchen closed at 9pm oddly a table was seated after 9pm and still received food

Address: 23 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review:
we went here last week after strolling adorable downtown charlottetown they couldnt get us in to the main restaurant so we walked around to their patio area next door there was live music and sunshine so we had high hopes however after sitting we were ignored for quite a while others who came after us were served drinks before we were acknowledged at all once we were served the gin fizz i ordered wasnt at all as described in the menu so i mentioned it and he offered something else i got a glass of wine instead after the long delay plus some other mishaps with delivery of our appetizers raw oysters with underwhelming presentation and scallops with pork belly that werent gluten free due to the maple whiskey glaze for some reason we decided to end it there rather than risk further disappointment there also werent many gluten free options
we noticed later that theyd charged us for the higher priced gin fizz rather than the wine a mistake or a grab for more money either way poor form perhaps just bad luck that night but i wouldnt return or recommend

Address: 23 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review: merchantman  fresh seafood great restaurant for fresh seafood we had a wonderful dinner time the food was super delicious the lobster is a must try the service is so good the environment is wonderful and well maintained the staffs are friendly and make the order perfect as requested had a great seafood dinner

Address: 23 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A2 Canada
Review:
loved all the foods
it was one of the best restaurants ive ever been to im not a seafood person but their buttermilk fish sandwich and seafood chowder were marvelous i would highly recommend this place to others d

Address: 128 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H7 Canada
Review: travelled all over canada and i would say for both me and my wife that receiver has the best lattes weve ever had the food was also great

Address: 128 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H7 Canada
Review: perfect art of coffee done by barista even i ordered mocha i love the vibes on being top corner table the breakfast set is kind of healthy with own choice of eggs see you again in future days its perfect place for coffee

Address: 128 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H7 Canada
Review: pretty good lattes went here a few times because it turned out to be our favorite coffee spot in charlottetown would also recommend willow cafe if youre out west

Address: 128 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H7 Canada
Review:
food is pretty good smaller portions than expected prices are higher than expected

wait time for just a coffeelatte is way too long i work in an office nearby and the few times ive popped in to get a midafternoon coffee ive waited much too long it appears only one person is ever able to make espresso based drinks which leads to a bottleneck and the wait for drinks being much longer than needed or expected

dont come expecting to grab a quick coffee

Address: 128 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H7 Canada
Review:
what a great little coffee house found you after we landed in your lovely city airport hotel and then you first was a coffee what a great coffee second was coffee and brownie what a great brownie then was breakfastomg eggs cooked perfectly along with bacon that was crisp but chewy all at the same time dam good home fries and brioche toast but wait it gets better banana bread french toast topped with bananas and candied walnuts outstanding
we will be back next time were in town thank you

Address: 178 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8W1 Canada
Review: travelled all over canada and i would say for both me and my wife that receiver has the best lattes weve ever had the food was also great

Address: 178 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8W1 Canada
Review: perfect art of coffee done by barista even i ordered mocha i love the vibes on being top corner table the breakfast set is kind of healthy with own choice of eggs see you again in future days its perfect place for coffee

Address: 178 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8W1 Canada
Review: pretty good lattes went here a few times because it turned out to be our favorite coffee spot in charlottetown would also recommend willow cafe if youre out west

Address: 178 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8W1 Canada
Review:
food is pretty good smaller portions than expected prices are higher than expected

wait time for just a coffeelatte is way too long i work in an office nearby and the few times ive popped in to get a midafternoon coffee ive waited much too long it appears only one person is ever able to make espresso based drinks which leads to a bottleneck and the wait for drinks being much longer than needed or expected

dont come expecting to grab a quick coffee

Address: 178 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8W1 Canada
Review:
what a great little coffee house found you after we landed in your lovely city airport hotel and then you first was a coffee what a great coffee second was coffee and brownie what a great brownie then was breakfastomg eggs cooked perfectly along with bacon that was crisp but chewy all at the same time dam good home fries and brioche toast but wait it gets better banana bread french toast topped with bananas and candied walnuts outstanding
we will be back next time were in town thank you

Address: 7 St. Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N3 Canada
Review: the staff was kind but almost to extremes coming over to see how things are every couple of minutes i suppose they could just ignore you like the previous owners did but they could definitely slow down a little bit the buffet was alright but the rice was sort of chemically tasting and the ribs had a bit too much fat compared to what im use too all in all it was an ok experience

Address: 7 St. Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N3 Canada
Review:
i dont often complain or feel the need to review experiences however tonight was unacceptable from a consumer standpoint

i ordered from door dash was hoping for a good chinese meal as a treat after a long week what i got was nothing near what i expected
i ordered the shrimp and mushroom dish kung po chicken an order of chicken chow mein and an egg roll
90 of what i ordered will not be eaten

the kung po chicken was by far the worst ive ever had it was more of a spicy raw onion soup than it was anything even resembling kung po chicken

the mushroom shrimp was alright again very watery and soupey i was able to eat some of it but it very much lacked any flavor

the chicken chow mein was basically steamed bean sprouts with very little chicken to be seen and absolutely no flavor

if not for the egg roll which was delicious this rating would have been 1 star

cherry on top they use paper bags to deliver it was left at my door with a soaked bottom it all fell out when i lifted it up thank god i hadnt picked it all the way up or i wouldnt have got to eat anything not that it made much of a difference in the end

Address: 7 St. Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N3 Canada
Review: the food tastes really good and i would definitely get it again however the service was a little slow but thats kind of expected for mothers day also i found what looked to be a claw im not sure what from but im assuming maybe a chicken one thing that i love about this restaurant is that they do so much good in the community i rate silver streams a 35 and i will probably be back

Address: 7 St. Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N3 Canada
Review: first time here while vacationing it was awful the chicken balls were so dry i couldnt cut through them any food with meat was really fatty wontons were just chips no meat at all rice tasted burnt chicken wings were good though my husband had a few bites but couldnt eat the rest restaurant was not very clean doors covered in finger prints bathroom unclean we wont be returning

Address: 7 St. Peters Road Charlottetown, PE C1A 5N3 Canada
Review: i called to place a food order for pickup for my grandparents to enjoy this evening i asked the gentleman on the phone if he thought it was enough food for senior citizens or should i order more and he said he would upsize the rice portion complimentary it was a very kind gesture  the owner also regularly cooks for the upper room soup kitchen which speaks volumes about his character

Address: 188 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 2P7 Canada
Review: wow the food here is so authentic and delicious

Address: 188 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 2P7 Canada
Review: as usual everything was delicious   my friend and i enjoyed our meals

Address: 188 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 2P7 Canada
Review: i absolutely love this place my first choice when i crave chinese food its the closest thing i had back home in ontario for any of you cfas out there looking for your fix

Address: 188 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 2P7 Canada
Review:
this has been our goto chinese food restaurant for the last several years service is welcoming and friendly
the food portions are generous and offer a large variety of choices the cost is very reasonable and reflects the freshness and quality
thank you for always being so kind and thoughtful when answering our many questions as we try new items from your menu
a gem of a restaurant operated by a thoughtful and caring family see you next time

Address: 188 Great George Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 2P7 Canada
Review: great unique atmosphere and splendid service food is as expected and good but a 5 star rating could easily be possible by integrating some uniqueness into their menu something pei thats the only thing missing

Address: 141 Great George Street Charllottetown, PE C1B 4K7 Canada
Review: our first time  we ordered the lobster burger with butter and the fried chicken sandwich the lobster burger was great not excellent  the roll used was too soft  the chicken sandwich was just fried too thin so dry  it would have been better with fish or grilled chicken  see photos

Address: 141 Great George Street Charllottetown, PE C1B 4K7 Canada
Review: really nice local restaurant in downtown charlottetown mainly serving seafood but also burgers and such fish and chips portion is quite good and the fries are some of the best fries on the island also had veggie options burger which did not disappoint

Address: 141 Great George Street Charllottetown, PE C1B 4K7 Canada
Review:
very nice atmosphere with plenty of seating and service was fast and friendly
we were each going to get the 2 piece fish n chips but the owner assured us the pieces were largeand that was a good call the 1 piece was plenty it was cooked to perfection the haddock was moist and flakey and the batter crispy and golden  they have an inhouse tartar sauce that was also very nice  dont pass this place up if youre craving some fantastic sea food

Address: 141 Great George Street Charllottetown, PE C1B 4K7 Canada
Review: my husband and i stopped for lunch today at brits fish and chips i was so happy to learn that they had a dedicated glutenfree frier i have allergies to dairy gluten soy eggs and corn they prepare the glutenfree fish with rice flour some apple juice salt and pepper nice and safe for someone like me i added sweet potato fries and it was all delicious my husband had the standard onepiece haddock with fries and he really enjoyed his as well they have a great patio space that is dog friendly but the weather today was not great for that so we ate inside

Address: 141 Great George Street Charllottetown, PE C1B 4K7 Canada
Review: stopped by for lunch on a cool day in june and it was well worth it the staff was friendly and helpful the mussels top notch and the haddock lightly breaded and fried just right pair this with a local pint and you are all set for the rest of the day

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review:
the olde dublin pub is an absolute gem of a place from the moment you step inside youre transported to a cozy welcoming atmosphere thats steeped in history and tradition the decor is classic and timeless with wooden beams exposed brick and vintage irish memorabilia adorning the walls

but the real star of the show is the food and drink the pub offers a wide selection of irish and local beers on tap as well as an extensive menu of classic pub fare with a modern twist the fish and chips are some of the best ive ever had and the shepherds pie is hearty and flavorful but the real standout is the irish stew  its a musttry

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review:
it was highlyrated and praised so we made our choice comfortably  thinking we would have quality food thats affordable

alas the oysters served were extremely dirty and badly presented the oysters were laid on top of one another causing the oysters below to be contaminated with the shell remnants of the oysters above them mignonette was promised alongside the lemons and cocktail sauce but unfortunately none was served
