many of the oysters werent even properly removed from their base the adductor muscle the oysters had so much debris inside it was very obvious that they didnt even bother purging them soaking them for 10 mins in ice cold water so they can spit out the dirt from within
it was a filthy and grainy experience that truly took away from our love for oysters

but that is not all

the chowder oh my god we ordered the chowder right after the oysters and i was in complete shock at the state that it arrived in ill insert a video below the consistency was horrid it was far from creamy i am very very rarely offended and i felt personally insulted that the chef actually looked at these bowls and thought this was good enough to send out where are the standards it was bland the seafood inside were severely overcooked and it was the consistency of broth after voicing our dislike for the chowders they still charged us for them even though we didnt even have a second bite im absolutely mind blown 

we tipped the servers and didnt take away from anyones hard work but we didnt feel equally appreciated as customers

it was our first ever meal arriving in pei and what a disappointing experience it was we stormed out bellies hungry and our pockets significantly emptier searching for another place to have dinner for the night after our long road trip there

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review: 4 of us eating all different meals  shepard pie  steak sandwich burger and indian curry  all good eats  the beer is cold  the atmoshere and service awesome

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review: we arrived late and the kitchen was almost closed but they did everything to accommodate us and we were able to order food which was absolutely delicious staff was incredibly friendly owner took a moment to come chat with us lively ambiance highly recommended

Address: 131 Sydney Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1G5 Canada
Review: oysters were fine but mignonette wasnt provided contrary to the menu cocktail sauce is very basic five ounce bacon wrapped filet was passable but stringy nothing special here fish with the fish and chips was outright terrible overcooked and didnt have the consistency of quality fish try churchills on queen st instead much better service was okay but slow 90 for a subpar meals not recommended

Address: 393  University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: tasted great but very poorly prepared and appears to be thrown together never usually have a problem but the zesty garlic sauce was in between all my tacos and the soft shells were covered in the sauce making them impossible to pick up and hang on to without getting covered in sauce

Address: 393  University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: this was the worst food experience for me in charlottetown never going back again the burrito was so bad no flavor at all i had to force it down my throat because it is food regardless and i was hungry

Address: 393  University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review:
my favourite place to go and eat
people serving are always super nice
last person who waited on us was so amazing he even went out of his way to make us churros i felt very special

food is so delicious  100 percent would recommend

Address: 393  University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: good and fast

Address: 393  University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N4 Canada
Review: love the renovation staff here are the best

Address: 201 Buchanan Dr Charlottetown, PE C1E 2E4 Canada
Review: stopped by here for a quick eat and was pleasantly surprised the price was quite good for the portion they have lots of variety from tacos burritos quesadillas nachos bowls and churros it was tasty and the toppingsauce options were plenty would come back here again

Address: 201 Buchanan Dr Charlottetown, PE C1E 2E4 Canada
Review: great business i love trying different quick service restaurants that we dont have back home and this did not disappoint delicious and fresh ingredients very helpful staff and so many options to choose from will be back for sure

Address: 201 Buchanan Dr Charlottetown, PE C1E 2E4 Canada
Review: always amazing i can never finish my burritos because theyre always so stuffed love

Address: 201 Buchanan Dr Charlottetown, PE C1E 2E4 Canada
Review: always delicious but they never have the beef barbacoa which is the best meat there in my opinion

Address: 201 Buchanan Dr Charlottetown, PE C1E 2E4 Canada
Review:
lady messed up my order put super spicy sauce on my quesadilla instead of garlic and also didnt give me a receipt 

teach your employees to grab the right sauce you absolute monsters

pic is how i feel

bro at the front was super nice tho with the beard give him a raise

Address: 2 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8C1 Canada
Review: so we are new to the whole seafood so after some extensive research we settled on this gem located conveniently by the waterfront and docksthe view is breathtaking i settled for the lobster roll as i would of locked myself if i didnt at least try it was mouth watering i couldnt believe i waited so long to try one the service was impeccable as was the restrooms parking is possible on the street but better off using the parking lot thats right next door

Address: 2 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8C1 Canada
Review: was a bit hesitant to try this place based on some of the harsher reviews but very glad we tried it  the food was good and reasonably priced  had the lobster macaroni and cheese crab cakes and fries  the macaroni and cheese was absolutely delicious  the crab cakes were good but are very potato forward  the fries are cavendish fries and were very tasty and crispy  a bit over seasoned but still good

Address: 2 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8C1 Canada
Review: we were here for dinner during our trip we got excellent seating with great views the server was super helpful and hospitable the food was fresh and tasty really fresh mussels lobster and other seafood here

Address: 2 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8C1 Canada
Review: wow wow wow this restaurant superseded my expectations i had been searching all over the place for lobster rolls the staff were incredibly friendly the food was delicious presentation was beautiful and i ate very well ill 100 come back and i recommend this restaurant for any traveller or local seeking the ultimate seafood dining experience

Address: 2 Prince Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 8C1 Canada
Review: great dinner at the lobster on the wharf restaurant the service was quick to get seated and order we were seated outdoors as it was a nice sunny day  nice overlooking platform had the seafood chowder to start followed by the lobster mac n cheese  both prepared really well

Address: 189 Kent St. Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: holly molly i love this restaurant so much their happy hours with good deal of food were amazing im a sport fan and they have tvs everywhere big plus super nice to go there for my first day in pei def will go back again soon love their quesadilla and fish and chips their beer was so cheap too big big recommend to everyone

Address: 189 Kent St. Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: delivery was about 10 min late wont complain just a reminder for people who want to order delivery spaghetti sauce kinda tasted like canned sauce which is fine i guess meatball tasted quite good actually

Address: 189 Kent St. Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: the vibe was great the food was cold the service was ok and i  had to chase people down for things which isnt cool the wine was good though

Address: 189 Kent St. Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: fascinated place to entertain especially karaoke every thursday at 10 pm

Address: 189 Kent St. Charlottetown, PE C1A 1P1 Canada
Review: loved this place great atmosphere  great service best garlic fingers ever the meatza pizza was very yummy too

Address: 660 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review:
not a chance are all these amazing reviews legit  the service was very prompt and friendly but that is absolutely where the positive ends  the food was a 210 at the most generous  we have never had totally bland chinese food before but here it is  nothing tasted bad because it would actually have to taste like something to begin with  we have traveled a lot of countries and we can without a doubt award this place with a worlds most flavourless trophy
the caption on the bottom of the sign would be a travesty for charlottetown if its true
first and last timesave your money and go elsewhere

Address: 660 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review: i recently visited kings bbq chinese restaurant and i was thoroughly impressed they had multiple choices of delicious dishes to choose from and the atmosphere was very warm and inviting the service was very polite and the prices were very good the highlight of my meal was the sweet and sour pork i forgot the exact name and the eggplant  it was cooked to perfection i would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great chinese dining experience

Address: 660 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review: service is not that great but the owner is really nice and approachable we just waited long enough to finish the side dish before the rice came out from the kitchen maybe they could bring out rice and side dish at the same time so we can enjoy our meal

Address: 660 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review:
not authentic chinese food too oily and saucy for authentic noodle the ingredients used for wonton soup was also not authentic overall taste was ok
they also had many photo displays for more authentic chinese food but they cannot be ordered we havent make them in such a long time i was told by the server as they served the wrong food to me
i was looking forward to try this place but i am disappointed now

Address: 660 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E5 Canada
Review:
they advertise duck no such thing been long time they say been driving around for 20 minutes for nothing

i ordered sweet and sour chicken they left the chicken out ill lay in it out with a lot of broth and vegetables
i also got something i never ordered and i have no idea what those brown crispy things are

the barbecue pork was good

Address: 359 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M9 Canada
Review: today i had dinner at swiss chalet with my friends harman kaur was our server and she was very pleasant and helpful she quickly delivered our food

Address: 359 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M9 Canada
Review: my family and i enjoyed a wonderful meal together in your restaurant  it was really jackie our server that made the experience more exceptional  she was extremely attentive very kind shared a laugh with us and ensured that everything was just right with our meals  thank you for making our family meal a memorable one jackie

Address: 359 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M9 Canada
Review: just keeps going downhill use to frequent here often now only once a month and after this experience im done frys are always soggy and not fried at all basically just wet potatoes soaked in cold oil chicken is missing the wing skin is not on the breast and the chicken is dryer than a maple leaf in october please someone quality check whats coming out of your kitchen

Address: 359 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M9 Canada
Review: food was good our server kamal was phenomenal we had a large group of people and she handled all of us very kindly and efficiently all with a smile on her face she was very intentional in making sure  we all had what we needed

Address: 359 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 4M9 Canada
Review: the customer service of my past review has been spoken to and i was very pleased with the outcome and the way the lady administered herself  we had a terrible experience last evening and it was made right today  i am appreciative of the lady i spoke with on the phone  an apology and some options were all that i expected  so thank you for your genuine understanding and customer service correction

Address: 123 Grafton Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
overall is ok
beautiful interior and a good atmosphere
the dishes sold beautifully at unreasonable high prices
the portions are too small that they should be especially for the main course
srimpsscalops consist of 4 shrimps  3 scallops with a few baby potatoes with sauce for 45 so  it was not enough for my 13een year son he remained hungry

i would not return to the restaurant a second time

Address: 123 Grafton Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
i cannot begin to express how much my wife and i loved redwater the dining room was very comfortable and classy our server was a very nice polite young fella that was very versed in the menu

the mussels were phenomenal my wife throughly enjoyed her burger and yukon gold mash and i had the best mushroom risotto so full of flavor and the margherita and basil flatbread had an amazing crust tenderchew with a nice crunch the pesto made the flavor pop off the plate just fanatic

and because we were celebrating our anniversary they gave us a piece dark chocolate cheesecake with a chantilly cream that was out of this world i mean we could have eaten 2 of those bad boys such a thoughtful gesture on their part we will definitely be returning to this gem

weve been looking for a good place to eat in town and we finally found it and then some

Address: 123 Grafton Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
went to the redwater rustic grille for lunch today after an absolutely terrible experience at another restaurant nearby that we walked out of  this experience was completely different

first our waiter was absolutely fantasticknowledgeable attentive friendly  the food was absolutely fantastic  i had the soup of the day a roasted red pepper soup to die for  my main course was the maple chipotle bbq chicken stone baked flatbread  delicious  and to top it off coffee and sticky toffee pudding with rum sauce and chantilly cream  everything from the atmosphere the incredible waiter and the awesome food was such a wonderful experience  and the price was more than reasonable  highly recommended

Address: 123 Grafton Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review:
redwater rustic grille has a great menu with top quality food i am a longtime fan of their grilled caesar salad with chicken unlike any others i have eaten theirs has am amazing dressing flavored with jalape√±os

for the next few weeks it is part of the winterdine festival where top restaurants offer specials for lunch and dinners changing offerings each week

this week they are offering chicken and waffles with chicken gravy and an incredible chipotle dipping sauce that tastes like an incredible honey mustard sauce

the chicken was crispy boneless and had some heat it was accompanied by a perfectly dressed wild lettuce salad that cut the richness of the chicken and waffles

my husband not a fan of sauces gravities or dips practically liked his chipotle cup clean and finished mine 

i asked to meet the chef to tank him for a terrific lunch because of the promotion of winterdine it was a bargain with mint chocolate affogato with a brown butter shortbread cookie

if you can book a lunch while winterdine is in effect redwater rustic grille isnt a cheap lunch normally but worth it

at 20 its bargain a great time to become acquainted with one of the best restaurants in the maritimes

Address: 123 Grafton Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4K6 Canada
Review: love the atmosphere  hate the food neither myself or my guest enjoyed the meals the menu is limited and the prices are too high for whats offered the space itself is very cozy and nice

Address: 136 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
prior to moving to pei i tried the merchantman patio and had an underwhelming experience poor service and poor presentation of my meal fast forward to last week when our family came to visit and they made a reservation which worried me  but thankfully my concerns were completely unfounded  we sat in the restaurant the service was okay but the food was excellent especially the island seafood boil our server advised the portion was large and suggested it was a meal for two thank goodness we took heed of his suggestion it was huge and definitely a meal for 2 the scallops were cooked perfectly and lots of them  as were the mussels clams shrimp and snow crab and lobster  i now know where we can go for that special occasion and have a wonderful seafood feast that we love so much
i know a lot of people are are very critical of establishments and if they have one bad experience they wont return if we had subscribed to that philosophy it would have been our loss thanks merchantman for improving your game

Address: 136 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
appetizers were great the baked oysters especially would recommend

the sangria was a good price for the size

disappointed in the meals the beef was low quality and kinda tasted like wild meat the lobster role came on a hot dog bun tasted very processed do not recommend

sat down at 8pm reservation we were going to order desert but was advised the kitchen closed at 9pm oddly a table was seated after 9pm and still received food

Address: 136 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
we went here last week after strolling adorable downtown charlottetown they couldnt get us in to the main restaurant so we walked around to their patio area next door there was live music and sunshine so we had high hopes however after sitting we were ignored for quite a while others who came after us were served drinks before we were acknowledged at all once we were served the gin fizz i ordered wasnt at all as described in the menu so i mentioned it and he offered something else i got a glass of wine instead after the long delay plus some other mishaps with delivery of our appetizers raw oysters with underwhelming presentation and scallops with pork belly that werent gluten free due to the maple whiskey glaze for some reason we decided to end it there rather than risk further disappointment there also werent many gluten free options
we noticed later that theyd charged us for the higher priced gin fizz rather than the wine a mistake or a grab for more money either way poor form perhaps just bad luck that night but i wouldnt return or recommend

Address: 136 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review: merchantman  fresh seafood great restaurant for fresh seafood we had a wonderful dinner time the food was super delicious the lobster is a must try the service is so good the environment is wonderful and well maintained the staffs are friendly and make the order perfect as requested had a great seafood dinner

Address: 136 Richmond Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 1H9 Canada
Review:
loved all the foods
it was one of the best restaurants ive ever been to im not a seafood person but their buttermilk fish sandwich and seafood chowder were marvelous i would highly recommend this place to others d

Address: 131 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: real great italian restaurant that also serves your standard breakfast items came here pretty early 730am so had no issue sitting down and getting quick service the coffee here was amazing  large portions for both the lattes and cappuccino the breakfast portions were amazing  had both the casa mia eggs benny and the casa mia hash very tasty well seasoned and eggs prepared on point price range is also decent for the quality and size of food

Address: 131 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: breakfast lunch and dinner are all amazing here one of our favorite places in charlottetown we highly recommend making a dinner reservation on the busy summer weekends

Address: 131 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review:
my friend and i came over here from ontario to try some things and sightsee
i found this restaurant from a video on tiktok and im so glad we came the food amazing our server ernie was so attentive and warm we had the fish  chips muscles in white wine sauce siciliana pizza  bruschetta sooo good
they also make an amazing espresso martini if youre on the island its absolutely worth the stop 1010 recommend

Address: 131 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: the breakfast tacos were amazing so filling could share them the side potatoes are sweet and delicious

Address: 131 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: really disappointed with this spot the vegetarian options are really lacking i ordered a croissant sandwich without meat they put ham on it and it was sooo soggy was pretty gross to be honest coffee wasnt anything special prices were really high and the service left a lot to be desired the decor is cute

Address: 92 Queen St Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: i consider this place better than other sushi places in charlottetown i get really really hungry sometimes and i think the ramen is tasty  hits the spot the miso soup and glass noodles that come complimentary before the food are great i like getting the veggie ramen i wish there was more eel in the unagi but still tastes good

Address: 92 Queen St Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review:
if you are lucky enough to visit ta ke sushi either come on an empty stomach or be prepared to eat the leftovers the next meal you have the portions are large and very filling the menu had a variety of japanese and korean dishes able to satisfy whatever craving you may have the servers were extremely attentive and prompt unsurprisingly everyone around us seemed to also have nothing but rave reviews

ps i believe they have a lunch special between 113 most days too call to confirm prior

Address: 92 Queen St Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: the service was great and the food was yummy i had miso soup las vegas roll and spicy tuna it was all great

Address: 92 Queen St Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: best spot for japanese on pei their rolls are always really fresh and packed they have a bunch of creative and really tasty vegetarian rolls  great rice to innards ration the miso soup and noodles come with your meal and the service is incredible we love all the staff at ta ke we are regulars here and always look forward to our meal i highly recommend this spot

Address: 92 Queen St Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: food is always great and served quickly very small space so they can get busy pretty fast and it can feel a bit cramped

Address: 73 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4J7 Canada
Review:
im giving this place a 35 rating because i really really appreciate their effort to provide glutenfree options for their battered foods  unfortunately there was a mixup  just as the skip driver was arriving the restaurant called to say he had taken the wrong order and needed to return  by the time i got my food the fish batter was soggy on the underside  the batter also did not stick to the fish so i ended up eating the two separately  it also needed salt

as you can see in the picture it came with two very large pieces of haddock  also included an extra tartar sauce

next time im on the island i will dine in and hopefully be able to update my review

Address: 73 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4J7 Canada
Review:
oh my goodness get the fish and chips they will be the best fish and chips you ever have the fish was light noticeably fresh cooked to perfection huge portions too

special shoutout to our fabulous waiter phil talk about someone who can read their customer pop in for a visit youll know what i mean thanks for a 5 star meal with 5 star service

Address: 73 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4J7 Canada
Review: best fish and chips fresh crispy and delicious notable mention to phil thanks for recommending the cod for your service and hospitality if youre looking for quality food and great people  look no further

Address: 73 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4J7 Canada
Review: fabulous seafood in a cozy atmosphere jay and phil took great care of me when i needed to step in out of the drizzle the seafood chowder was outstanding and the mussels incredible a definite keeper thank you

Address: 73 Water Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4J7 Canada
Review:
the food was on point and so tasty the atmosphere was so welcoming and friendly it makes me sad that i dont live there so i could make it my regular place

if you are visiting for the canada games make sure you visit before leaving

Address: 123 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review:
went there based on the reviews regretfully it was a disappointment

not much flavor in the broth very weak and watery bland noodles hearing microwave oven when waiting for your food at a restaurant is never a good sign but here we are

not sure if i went there at a wrong time or the place is past its prime reviews more recent than mine will tell

Address: 123 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: i approve this place food was great large portions and very yummy ill be back

Address: 123 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review:
oh my god this was good

i am from vietnam and i can say that this was one of the closest to an authentic taste that i have here in pei had the vermicelli with grilled pork and it was one of the best i ever had

the owner was nice i came in order the food and came out hot crispy ate a bite and now coming back again for another bowl

if you want some good vietnamese food this is the place 

bonus point for the price being very affordable

Address: 123 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: honestly not much expectation on this viet restaurant at the beginning but it gave me a good surprise it is not the excellent one when compare to the good one in toronto but it definitely above average service also good when you consider try pho this could be a nice choice in pei

Address: 123 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B3 Canada
Review: after a few days visiting pei i was craving pho we stumbled by this restaurant and i couldnt be happier fried chicken was delicious and the pho hit the spot

Address: 73 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A8 Canada
Review: weve been coming for takeout for yearsquality has nosedived tho  last time fried rice was dry eggrolls were underdone chicken balls were a little hard and spareribs were great  feels like they are making too much food and it is sitting too long  too badused to love this place

Address: 73 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A8 Canada
Review: went there  last summer sadly first and last time visiting they state on the restaurant that they serve both chinese and canadian food we asked about the hamburger platter and the waitress told us it was meant for sharing so we ordered one for the two of us the price also indicated it was bigger than the individual hamburger once it arrived in actually consisted of the smallest hamburger ive ever been served and a lot of french fries the meat was so overcooked it was hard my husband ordered another burger and the quality of the meat was so bad it had hard chunks in it that were impossible to chew and it was also overcooked we were disappointed because the food also took so long to arrive we were already too hundry and had no other option but to eat it but that wasnt a pleasant experience at all so even though we were hungry we didnt finish our meal

Address: 73 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A8 Canada
Review:
the service was okay and the egg rolls are great but otherwise i was a bit disappointed as the food items werent as fresh as they could have been

one reviewer described it as canadian chinese food and i would agree

ill be back for more of the egg rolls though as they are fantastic

Address: 73 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A8 Canada
Review:
really good service comes here for typical canadian chinese food
got a combo plate chicken balls and rice were pretty good rice was acceptable and the egg rolls were awesome however the ribs tasted bland and i couldnt put my finger on why but seemed like they could have been reheated not sure but something was up with them

Address: 73 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4A8 Canada
Review: horrible service i have been eating here for atleast the past 10 years and i will never again i live in the country now amd spent easily 20 in gas yesterday not to mention time to drive there and home for simply chicken balls chicken 4 extra fried rice and 3 eggrolls and they only filled the chicken ball order naturally i called back and explained and after 20 minutes on the phone they agreed to redo the order and for pick up the next day today called in today to make sure the order was ready for pick up and they sent a single order and then expected me to drive back in to show my recipete once again to get it rite food was awful  chicken was way chewy and rice not great  chin balls over done and the one egg roll we actually for was not cooked properly

Address: 365 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N2 Canada
Review: food was great  the service is rated lower as it took over 15 minutes for order of burger and fries to be made  was not expecting that much delay for the meal  there was plenty of staff but they seemed more focused on the drive through and the ice cream orders

Address: 365 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N2 Canada
Review:
if its after 10pm and youre looking for somewhere to dinein dont go here they might kick you out earlier than expected

so anyways before i headed out i checked the stores hours on the website says 10ammidnight basically no separate hours section for dinein versus drive thru like say wendys or mcdonalds do on theirs i take a walk down hoping its accurate get there around 1045pm i glance at the door on my way in no hours sign need to hope the site is accurate

cashier takes my order asking me dinein or takeout no mention of the dining room closing soon a few minutes later my food comes out still no mention of the dining room closing soon  at 1105 one of the staff comes to my table and tells me the dining room closes at 11pm and i have 5 minutes i was alone so i doubt it was an excuse for something like being noisy maybe the cleaning staff just wanted to leave early and went rogue without managements knowledge

either way seems their stated hours are just a suggestion or something if youre looking to relax but its late pick somewhere else or you might get badgered out the door here

Address: 365 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N2 Canada
Review: went there for lunch for a chicken salad they give you 1 dressing for a side salad then when you get a large salad double the size they still only give you one dressing went to ask for a second and was told i had to pay an extra dollar for a second dressing because they dont give you enough dressing for a full salad and want you to pay for an extra dressing they were rude the service was horrible we had to wait 20 mins for kids ice cream my 3 year old was having a meltdown and im sure they made me wait because i was upset about having to buy a second dressing and having to put a dollar on my credit card ill be heading to wendys cause they dont charge extra for condiments they give you more then you need i was scared they were going to charge me for a refill of pop too

Address: 365 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N2 Canada
Review: i ordered the salad  my friends ordered burgers after me and got their food before i did  the salad was delivered without dressing  also they have a rule that you have to ask a worker to unlock the bathroom before you can use it  their ice cream is great but i will not be ordering the salad in future

Address: 365 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1A 4N2 Canada
Review: i just finished the 8 value meal deal and it was so good the service i received at the drivethru was spot on

Address: 403 Capital Drive Charlottetown, PE C1E 1Z3 Canada
Review: really tasty burgers and amazingly fresh cut fries came here twice and was very satisfied both times first time we tried the fries with sea salt and that was great the second time we tried zesty pepper and it was very flavorful but became way too salty the staff members were nice and the place was clean would come here again

Address: 403 Capital Drive Charlottetown, PE C1E 1Z3 Canada
Review: i have an allergy to gluten and dairy i told them about this i ordered my wifes food then mine my wife gets the zesty fries which we were told it contains gluten or dairy at our last visit and the works put all the fries in with my gluten free burger so i cant eat any of it they offered to make my food over but my wife had an appointment so i didnt have time for that it also cost 50 dollars for two burgers which i was unable to eat the employees told my that we always put all the fries with the allergy bag which is the first time they have ever done it each order should have its own bag so last time ill be going back use to eat there a lot

Address: 403 Capital Drive Charlottetown, PE C1E 1Z3 Canada
Review:
best burgers  fries on the island
we love to dine on the lime green picnic tables

Address: 403 Capital Drive Charlottetown, PE C1E 1Z3 Canada
Review:
its a pretty good burger and spot with lots of options for your meal
i had a burger fries and drink its pricy for a brown bagged meal but i do believe the quality is there

the fries are always in an overflow style which makes you feel like you received more than you paid for very similar to five guys in that way

i think for the price id like a more formidable bun but it is good flavour wise

Address: 403 Capital Drive Charlottetown, PE C1E 1Z3 Canada
Review: the food is really good quality for fast food it is a little pricey compared to other fast food places but you dont get sloppy burgers falling apart expect to wait but youll enjoy your food when you get it

Address: 96 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review:
definitely worth the visit tried china garden for the first time tonight despite living only two short blocks away from the restaurant for the past four years we were two for dinner this evening and selected one of the combination dinners  the 2 dinner for 2  along with an order of crispy wonton chips from the appetizer menu

the staff is awesome theyre so warm and friendly and make you feel welcomed from the minute you open the door it was takeout service only this evening which suited us just fine but china garden would definitely be a really great place to enjoy a dinein meal

the service is polite courteous and lightening fast after placing my order i went for a short twenty minute walk around the block and by the time i returned to china garden to pick up the order it was all packaged up and waiting for me

the food is super fresh and the portions are generous there was plenty for the two of us and enough leftovers for lunch tomorrow there was plenty of plumb sweet and sour and soy sauces included if you require napkins and utensils and things of the sort just ask the staff and theyll be more than happy to try their best to accommodate you the prices are very reasonable and you get great value for your money

i believe someone said in their own review that china garden is a great endofthenight spot and thats definitely true china garden reminds me of some of the best hot spots back home in toronto that were considered a mandatory stop at the end of the night

special shout out to gordie for his excellent customer service this evening

sincerely
jon

Address: 96 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: while the food was tasty for canadianmaritime chinese food i would recommend confirming exactly what you are ordering i ordered chow mein and chop suey and the only difference between the two was one had mushrooms when i called back to ask if there was a mistake he told me that they are made basically the same like i said food was good but i dont understand why they would have two options on their menu that are the same but under different names

Address: 96 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review:
we ordered combo 2 for 2 today it was amazing best eggrolls i have ever have everything was perfect with lots of flavor and hot

eileen  tommy

Address: 96 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: they left sign on their sign states they close at 9pm was there at 850pm to pick up food store person had called 5 minutes prior we confirmed wed be there in 5 minutes got there at time confirmed  the door was locked and open sign still on and no one answered the phones

Address: 96 Queen Street Charlottetown, PE C1A 4B1 Canada
Review: my new go to for my basic yummy chinese food only have take out but thats all i want always friendly

Address: 700 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E3 Canada
Review: went here this evening and had a one phenomenal experience the staff were very attentive and exceptionally friendly my food came very fast i was there at 6 pm would absolutely recommend

Address: 700 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E3 Canada
Review: the staff were all friendly and polite and did their jobs well the food was decent had the new macaroni and cheese it was good but not amazing the portion was smaller than i expected although certainly enough for a meal overall its good food but id probably order something else next time

Address: 700 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E3 Canada
Review: we went to celebrate the end of the school yr even though it was very busy we were seated and served fast britney r was amazing she was kind whitty and engaging with us great job

Address: 700 University Ave Charlottetown, PE C1E 1E3 Canada
Review: our server andy was great he had a good rapport with the table and even though we waited a little longer for food and such his service made up for it

Address: 25 Hopeton Road Stratford, PE C1B 1T6 Canada
Review: if u want chinese food and i mean good chinese food just forget about this place not worth your money or the drive there food was cold and terrible   so was the service thumbs down  place should be shut down

Address: 25 Hopeton Road Stratford, PE C1B 1T6 Canada
Review:
this was my second time eating here the first time i didnt have a great experience though after hearing so many positive reviews i wanted to give them another go

the food was tasty the portions were a good size and the staff were a delight and very friendly the only issue i had was that they must use a significantly more salt or msg then other chinese restaurants that ive eaten at all of us had mouths that felt like the sahara desert an hour after eating and we spent the evening drinking water

to clarify the last time i ate here half the food was partially raw there must have been a new cook in the kitchen at that time or some kind of significant error thankfully there were no issues like that this time and all the food was well cooked

Address: 25 Hopeton Road Stratford, PE C1B 1T6 Canada
Review:
very disappointing not really worth the 1 star
food was cold but even hot it still would not have been good  lacked  any flavor if you have had good chinese food before be aware because when you order a dish it is not remotely like what you have had before  chicken fried rice spot the chicken ginger beef extremely small portion and filled with veg and non tasting beef sweet and sour chicken still trying to figure that one out  i could continue but i think you get the point
9800 wasted             so disappointing

Address: 25 Hopeton Road Stratford, PE C1B 1T6 Canada
Review: prefab chinese frozen walmart type chicken balls and egg rolls not authentic at all frankly  and to top it all off we were shorted the pops that were supposed to go with the meal very disappointed but decided they could keep their pop it wasnt worth returning

Review: had a really good experience at the charlottetown location it had been a while despite the new app failing me the drivethru order went smooth got the food and smoothie very quickly everything was correct and tasty  good job

Address: 650 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 1E3 Canada
Review: the place is warmth but the area where the condiments are place is not goodthey should know how to clean the area

Address: 650 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 1E3 Canada
Review: the food was fine they got a small part of the order wrong i dont care about that but you get to the counter the cash attendant does her thing and ignores you for a few minutes while she does something appears to be drive thru orders i dont know wouldnt hurt to clean the urinal every now and then either makes me wonder how clean the kitchen is

Address: 650 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 1E3 Canada
Review: used to be my favourite but i believe they have new owners no more soul out into the food fries have really been getting colder every time i go i miss the way it used to be best burgers in town very very expensive

Address: 650 University Avenue Charlottetown, PE C1A 1E3 Canada
Review: in a word discusting health department should be notified about this place gross go in a look around the dining room see if you still want to eat there before you go through the drive through asked to speak to manager about the state of the dining room was told their was none do yourself a favor and do not eat here if they are willing to let the customers see that in the dining room and are ok with it imagine what is happening in the kitchen also staff dont seem to care when i asked them about it if this is the best you can offer shut it down to the ownergo into a new business venture you are not worthy of serving food to people

Address: 10643 - 123 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 1Z1 Canada
Review: very impressive all of the food was wonderful especially the duck breast the duck was stunningobviously top quality meat with really nice spicing and a good crust elk carpaccio and the woodfired bread were standouts my server rob was greatsuper friendly and had excellent recommendations

Address: 10643 - 123 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 1Z1 Canada
Review: the restaurant itself was lovely however we had issues with the food and service i think i got food poisoning from the bison i ordered the bison and was told that it is cooked at the perfect point between medium rare and medium when the bison steak came out it was definitely bluerare picture below i was so disappointed because i cannot stand raw or extremely rare meat and had only ordered this because i had been told it would be between medium rare and medium my partners steak also pictured is medium rare for reference mine should have been cooked even a bit more than his i tried a bite anyway to see if there was anyway that it could work but it was so raw and bloody i just couldnt stomach it i told our server about the meat being too undercooked and it was clear she didnt believe me and i had to stand my ground to be taken seriously the whole interaction felt condescending but she did take it back to the kitchen when she brought it out again it was maybe cooked to rare but at this point i felt too bad to say anything and i didnt want to be belittled by the server again i ate as much as i could leaving the rawest pieces behind but i wish i hadnt as i had an extremely upset stomach when i got home and woke up sick enough to call off of work this is the first time ive been sick in months and it feels clearly related to eating rawextremely undercooked bison from this restaurant its also concerning because we looked at reviews for this restaurant when we got home and there are many 1 star reviews describing receiving extremely undercooked bison i dont understand why such an expensive restaurant would provide undercooked and potentially dangerous meat

Address: 10643 - 123 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 1Z1 Canada
Review: truly a farmtotable experience the food and service were excellent each time weve been in particular the housemade butter and bread the ribeye and denver steaks the charcuterie board and the earl grey cr√®me br√ªl√©e with lavender shortbread reservations are a must highly recommend rge rd for elevated canadian fare

Address: 10643 - 123 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 1Z1 Canada
Review: finally i was able to enjoy the fantastic place the atmosphere perfectly sets the stage for a very enjoyable time for just a quick bite and drink or a beautiful meal much of their fare is locally sourced and the open access view of the kitchen helped enhance my appreciation for this place the food is exquisite and only surpassed by the service

Address: 10643 - 123 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 1Z1 Canada
Review:
we did the 5 course tasting menu and it was the most amazing experience great inventive food and the staff made it so special
great cocktails and mocktails

Address: 10132-100 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N8 Canada
Review: a wide array of unique handcrafted cocktails coupled with a food menu that fires on all cylinders one of the best experiences ive had in the downtown core its really refreshing to see a restaurant dare to be different and succeeding in creating something magical i highly recommend woodwork shout out to dylan  the cocktail master extraordinaire

Address: 10132-100 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N8 Canada
Review:
woodwork is a wonderful stop on 100 street in downtown edmonton it may be a bit of a lesser known haunt as it doesnt have direct access with parking out front typically i park around the corner on rice howard way however its a super dining experience offering up smaller plates for sharing and larger ones if you want to go it alone its more modern fusion and its delicious

the space is very inviting and cozy  beautiful stylings make this a very wonderful setting and the service is always great

5 x

Address: 10132-100 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N8 Canada
Review: enjoyed dinner and desserts with two others june 1723  our combined comments are that this was the best dinner weve ever had in a fine dining restaurant  quodos to chef rick and staff saturday evening when in edmonton again we will be back thanks for a wonderful evening of fine food and drinks see photos right photo the special that night wow

Address: 10132-100 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N8 Canada
Review: great cocktails and delicious food reservation definitely recommended on weekends the butternut agnolotti was 5 stars for me service was exceptional

Address: 10132-100 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0N8 Canada
Review: great service drinks and food such a cool vibe the steaks were cooked perfectly and had such good flavor

Address: 10544 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z7 Canada
Review:
came here after searching google for edmonton xiao long bao i usually go to shanghai 456 but im so glad i tried this place because in my experience its the best shanghainese restaurant in edmonton for flavor

theres only 1 person working so dont expect 5 star service she was doing her best given the circumstances but man oh man the food is outstanding

we ordered the braised beef noodle soup dan dan noodles pan fried bao and xiao long bao

the dan dan noodles were average not enough pork and sichuan peppercorn flavor

the pan fried bao and braised beef noodles though were amoung the best ive ever tried the noodles were of perfect texture chewy and complimented the rich complex beef broth perfectly

this is a small restaurant so expect to wait for a table but i can assure you its well worth the wait

i highly recommend this place

Address: 10544 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z7 Canada
Review: probably one of my favourite places to eat in edmonton the food is always amazing and the best soup dumplings ive ever had the spring onion noodles are so tasty as well the baos are also delicious i tried to take a photo but my boyfriend ate his whole order of dumplings immediately they were that good in the photo fried mushrooms soup dumplings spring onion noodles and dandan noodles

Address: 10544 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z7 Canada
Review:
good food and affordable only tried beef bisket noodles soup 55
dumpling soup 55
baobun classic 355 it was a bit dry

but overall its great will definitely come back and will try other food on their menu

update
went back two to three times after the first visit i found the best baobun sandwich is the one with fried  chicken and still the pork dumpling soup and beef brisket noodles are consistently good tried the beef baobun it was alright

Address: 10544 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z7 Canada
Review: stopped in today specifically for soup dumplings and cucumber salad the food was very good we also had the pan fried dumplings and shrimp bao everything was good and we will definitely be back

Address: 10544 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z7 Canada
Review:
the food is honestly amazing here
the service needs a bit of tweaking
the water jug wasnt very clean and they gave us tiny spoons because the soup spoons were all dirty which is something that shouldnt happen since chinese soup spoons are dirt cheap to avoid this
the food more than makes up for it
we still highly recommend it

Address: 103-10359 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B9 Canada
Review: this place was awesome ive wanted to try the food here for so long and i cant believe i waited food was amazing if youre into asian fusion youll love this place the baos were awesome and the indonesian fried rice which is nasi goreng was delicious and actually had a kick to it which was nice we had some drinks and they were great too the ube had a subtle but ube flavor and it was my favorite i will definitely be going back for more

Address: 103-10359 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B9 Canada
Review: this was the first restaurant we tried in edmonton alberta it was highly recommended by a travel blogger location was great very near the hockey arena it looks like a bar inside but they have patio seating with umbrellas for shade they have a big selection of different cocktails we had a great server food was hit and miss we ordered the deviled tea eggs and they were very salty not edible  the calamari was expensive but quite ordinary be careful with the seasonings on top because it made the dish salty as well we were getting quite disappointed with the food  until we tasted the  stirfried bok choy it was perfectly cooked with different kinds of mushrooms and garlic ginger soy sauce the stems of the bok choy remained crunchy  just the way i like it we also ordered the nori ramen bowl with shrimp it was also delicious it came with cucumber corn salsa red onions mushroom and scallions there was an option to add pork or shrimp or tofu for additional cost the restaurant was pretty pricey we spent almost c100 for two people  we didnt order any drinks

Address: 103-10359 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B9 Canada
Review:
i cringe at seeing asian inspired the food here is like food made from a cookbook that was written by a tourist who traveled to tourist oriented eateries and then the chef here at baijiu decided halfway through his cooking to not follow the recipe and cover up the lack of authentic flavor with too much salt and mayonnaise i would have had less expectations if the food wasnt labeled asian inspired  cuz its nowhere close to asian food

the chicken tasted like it was made from carnival food batter and the onion balls tasted like a mini donut recipe  not close at all to asian food overall i found the food overly salty covered in too much mayonnaise and lack nuances of asian cooking the food here is basically pub food

i would have rated this at 2 stars but our bartender was fantastic we were in the private room with our own bar so he didnt have all the ingredients to make the menu drinks which is odd btw he did however made me an old fashioned to suit my palate  notsosweet cinnamon syrup with mango and makers mark it was super fantasticly delicious the scotch he suggested was also on point we had it with ice on the side the bartender was super accommodating friendly and knowledgeable and if we had to the only reason we would come back to baijiu would be because of him

Address: 103-10359 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B9 Canada
Review: had the speakeasy room for a group celebration and the experience was amazing alex our bartender made delicious drinks for us all the dumpling nachos are very good

Address: 103-10359 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B9 Canada
Review: the vibe here is amazing food is bangin and the drinks are original and delicious walk in only unless you have a big party so if its busy prepare to wait a bit insta gold photos to be had and theres a speak easy

Address: 11405 95 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5G 1L3 Canada
Review: amazing locally owned restaurant that serves sausages that are made inhouse they have great selections of sausagessides that compliment each other perfectly plenty of drink options and there are patio seating outside during a nice summer day definitely a great place to visit

Address: 11405 95 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5G 1L3 Canada
Review: so glad we discovered this little gem  first time here and definitely wont be our last great selection of delicious inhouse made sausages and sides  friendly service and fabulous food  highly recommend

Address: 11405 95 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5G 1L3 Canada
Review:
ill admit immediately that we didnt have food but well definitely be back we showed up today and found the restaurant closed because of a private event the owner instead of simply sending us on our way bought us drinks and chatted with us the drinks a local prickly pear moscow mule and a blackberry lemon non alcoholic beer were delicious but it was the real care the owner took to make sure we were comfortable that made this such a beautiful experience wed had a less than stellar afternoon up to this point and i can confidently say that otto turned it around the owner was even going to recommend another place to eat but we went to the italian centre for sandwiches excellent people skills and a true care for the customer

a week later we went back to eat and it was stellar the schnitzel was perfectly cooked the fries were crisp and the brussels sprouts that my partner initially turned up his nose at were so good that i had to fight him for every bite great non alcoholic beer selection and excellent service you can see the people walking in being treated like friends and family will definitely come back and eat here again thank you ed and natalia for a lovely evening

Address: 11405 95 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5G 1L3 Canada
Review: friendly and helpful staff and a cozy atmosphere this neighborhood gem is one of my favorite places to go to for beer and a hearty meal i especially love the otto sausage pickles brussel sprouts and the fish and chips

Address: 11405 95 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5G 1L3 Canada
Review: neat spot really enjoyed the food and the drink selection the fries with curry ketchup were extra extra tasty

Address: 10228 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B8 Canada
Review:
had very high expectations from the place in terms of culinary experience but it turned out to be mediocreas a vegetarian we had very limited options
food was not balanced and was either completely bland or lacking salt which was not expected
and the food had repeated ingredients and taste was exactly similar between different dishes because of thatwe ordered parmigiano soup which was good but than we ordered their famous ravioli and it had exact same soup as the sauce on ravioli with very little modifications
food was tasting very fresh which was good sign but again not enough for their 5 star price point
cocktails different taste but were not balancedthe two drinks that we ordered one was over spicy and the other one overpowering peach soju
their bar has potential but dirnks were very average for 21 price tag
moving on to ambiance place has a nice decor but its very congested as they tried to fit in as many table as possible in a small spaceat this price point they should reduce the table capacity to half
there was no walking space left once everyone had seated
overall an over priced experience for a average place

Address: 10228 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B8 Canada
Review: the broccoli dish was fantastic we also tried the beets which were great and the bass which neither of us would order again we just didnt like the flavours dont expect to be full unless you spend a small fortune the portions were not very big as it is a tapas place the cocktails were great though and service was good

Address: 10228 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B8 Canada
Review: super service and a nice interior with some outdoor seating available but what sets this place at the top of the rankings is the food every dish was a hit and beautifully presented have you had parisian gnocchi well  not made with potatoes it was light fluffy and i wanted more the dessert a lemon posset so easy to make yet so delicate and light a great way to finish a dinner the addition of the mint was perfect as for the cocktails excellent

Address: 10228 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B8 Canada
Review: we had a very enjoyable dinner here  great ambiance smaller restaurant with good service  we brought our 14 month old daughter and she loved the meal too  the food was amazing  humble ingredients with good flavor and unique sauces  we absolutely loved the gnocchi and roasted cauliflower  yum  if you like sharing dishes with friends then this is the place to go

Address: 10228 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1B8 Canada
Review: we were recommended this place by a friend of mine we walked in ans they opened and it was empty and they said they were full but could accomodate us at the bar both my partner and i found it excellent the service was great ambiance was calm and the food was delicious the flavors were great we had the soup to start i believe it was a mushroom soup but cant remember it was a couple weeks ago the gnocchi and the chicken and we all loved it had no more room for dessert we expected smaller portion so we ordered a lot but the portion were also very generous for the amount we paid the soup was honestly to die for wish i had room for dessert will be back

Address: 8216 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review:
welcome to meat where carnivorous delights await in wondrous varieties prepare to embark on a mouthwatering journey as the meats tender and juicy are served familystyle on rustic trays encouraging mixing matching and sharing with their range of four different dipping sauces the combinations are limitless

indulge in the skilletfresh cornbread a delectable treat that complements the magnificently flavored and beautifully seasoned macaroni  cheese a dream come true for every child my grandchildren enticed by the promise of this dish willingly postponed their snacks

the brisket oh the briskettruly to die for and the cherryglazed ribs out of this world a symphony of flavors that will leave you spellbound

set amidst an informal picnic table setting its an atmosphere of fun and kidfriendly charm the service truly amazing ask for taylore whose spectacular service and smiles add extra delight to the dining experience

in sum meat is a carnivorous paradise where the meats are delectable and the flavors unparalleled an experience that promises to tantalize taste buds and leave diners with a truly memorable feast of meaty marvels

Address: 8216 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review:
the cornbread and mac and cheese were really good would probably come here just for the sides and peach tea to be honest

the cherry chili ribs were good glad they give you both lean and fatty pieces of brisket i thought i didnt like bbq but it turns out i just didnt like bad bbq

i like how the bathrooms have a step and pull door so you dont have to get your hands dirty leaving or trying to do some paper towel tech

Address: 8216 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review: our first time at meat was amazing hard to pick a beer from their beverage menu because it is so big and everything sounds so good the server offered us samples since we couldnt decide she was very friendly and walked us through the whole menu with every detail food was great and half portions of a little bit of everything we ordered were big very impressed cant wait to come back

Address: 8216 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review: hmm where to start the ribs was a little bit tough and the garlic fries where was garlic the pulled pork sandwich was pretty good along with  burnt pork belly ends what i must say the service was great and the food came out pretty quick the location is excellent with an outdoor patio

Address: 8216 104 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 4E6 Canada
Review: great place for southern style smokehouse meal recommended the beef brisket especially in the earlier service hours super juicy also recommend the garlic fries self service homemade  bbq sauce and mustard  on the side this place also have am extensive bourbon menu highly recommended for anyone to try slightly on the expensive side

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: brunch was fantastic we had the brunch special lobster roll with potatoes today and the crab eggs benedict the food came in delicious filling portions the staff was amazing welcoming friendly and helpful thanks to bailey for your wonderful service and suggestions and thanks to the back of house staff we definitely will be back to try the rest of the menu

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: i had supper with a friend at their new location and it was amazing 1010 great food vibes and service the food was amazing i got the seared rainbow trout the fish was perfectly cooked and had a crispy salty skin and i was pleasantly surprised at how good the pearled couscous was it had a really good lemon butter and the cherry tomatoes in it made it taste very fresh and light i think the pearled couscous carried the trout very well the beef rag√π was also very good my friend ordered it and she enjoyed it a lot the new location is much bigger but the decor and atmosphere still felt very intimate and cozy our server was also very kind and attentive 1010 would come back again

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: finally got to try pip and i gotta say the food and drinks were exceptional great cocktails for good price the even made me an off menu blood orange negroni seared manchego cheese is a must order a few for the table for sure i had the tagliatelle also was great really fresh pasta pip is a small intimate spot great for dates or catching up with friends 1010 would reccomend

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: our first time here in edmonton and this place was the most pleasant experience we could start our trip withd  amazing food everything tasted so awesome and fresh and what made this experience even more amazing was our sweet wonderful server stephanie she made this experience 10010 for us thank you so much i would definitely come back here on the next trip

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: went here for a lovely sunday brunch with some girlfriends our waitress food and the atmosphere were amazing i personally had the classic eggs benny with yummy dill hollandaise my friends had a cappuccino afterwards and said it was great the only downside i experienced is they dont take reservations for brunch so we had to wait about an hour for a group of 5 and they were a bit slow on food service cute venue with lots of awesome options

Address: 10550 82 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review:
was really looking forward to dining here but was left a little underwhelmed with a part of my order to be honest the service was good wait time was a bit lengthy

loved the salmon sandwich only had good salmon sandwiches like that in vancouver but this was better my one complaint would be it had too much sauce garlic fingers was decent as well however my fish tacos were so runny and soggy i could barely enjoy the meal i asked the server and was told its because the slaw was freshly made not sure if thats a good reason the fries were also cold  overly salty and overdone

im hoping the quality was a one off thing and im planning to return to another location and ill try some other menu items and hopefully it will be a better experience  overall not a bad experience but it really didnt meet all my expectations

Address: 10550 82 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review:
blowers  grafton on whyte avenue offers a culinary journey to the east coast but my recent visit was a mixed bag the initial impression was marred by a long wait for seating and a less than warm welcome from the staff which extended to when we were ordering our drinks

a significant issue was the restaurants lack of cheese a staple ingredient that resulted in a surprising number of unavailable menu items including their pizzas and nachos their dessert doughnuts as well as their cauliflower dish were also unavailable for order amoungst who knows what other dishes may have been subject to this fate this was a considerable inconvenience and quite frankly a bit absurd for a restaurant of this caliber

however the fishermans feast was a redeeming factor offering a delightful taste of the sea the mussels on the other hand were let down by a sauce that leaned towards the bitter and sour side

the staffs attitude improved over the course of the evening and the bartenders offer of a 20 gift certificate to compensate for the food issues was a commendable gesture however the explanation for the shortages  a bicycle race  seemed a poor excuse for a restaurant that should anticipate and prepare for such events

in conclusion while blowers  grafton has potential my experience was inconsistent with improved preparation and customer service it could truly shine as a beacon of east coast cuisine in edmonton

Address: 10550 82 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review: absolutely amazing experience wonderful time spent here not only was it our first time but it was the best experience great waitresses great music chill vibes and some of the best cocktails my husband and i have ever tried and we booked a reservation for the future for our anniversary in a month loved our experience definitely recommend

Address: 10550 82 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review:
blowers and grafton offers a wide range of halifax street food amazing for brunch lunch and dinner it has been one of my usual spots to catchup with friends

what we ordered
 garlic fingers perfect choice for appetizer and sharing it is pizza dough with garlic butter and a generous amount of mozzarella cheese dipped with their signature sauce once you have a bite you cannot stop
 hali cheesesteak sandwich speechless just look how stuffed it is
 sausage and bacon hash bowl available on brunch menu a filling dish with loads of flavors

one of the best sellers here is the mini lobster rolls definitely have it the next time i go

happy hour is from 3pm6pm and 9pmclose everyday dont forget to check out their daily specials

from the classic halifax donair to the addictive garlic fingers they have nailed every dish with authentic flavors and a modern twist

Address: 10550 82 Ave NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review:
had a great time and delicious food has a nice selection of beer to choose from east coast beer
the tnt brothers pepperoni was very spicy  the hot chicken nachos were also delicious

jordyn our server was fabulous and thanks to scott for playing some easy coast music for us
see you soon for one of the friday night parties

Address: 10807 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 4A7 Canada
Review: came for dinner with a friend service is always great never any complaints however the food was mediocre paying 32 for chicken parmigiana the breading to the chicken should not be soggy due to the large amount of sauce which also made it hard to taste the mozzarella for starters we ordered the cesar salad and the maple sausage crostini the meat on the crostini tasted heavily processed and the flavours of the maple and ricotta did not make sense to the palate the bread was also extremely hard to bite for dessert we got the tiramisu which was a 55 overall i found the quality of the food did not align with the price the menu also seems a bit outdated 355

Address: 10807 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 4A7 Canada
Review:
after a very long time went back for family dinner to this gem of a restaurant first the pleasing welcome we encountered from none other than the owner in spite of having full house our reserved seats were kept even though we were a bit late on our arrival the service was quick the hostess was very pleasant and on top of it chris coming and checking it out frequently shows the passion  dedication of this very successful man
kudos to him

our family thoroughly enjoyed each and every spread of the night left the restaurant with our heart  tummy full

Address: 10807 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 4A7 Canada
Review:
we enjoyed our experience the food was amazing try the caesar salad lunch time the pastas were only 10 which was amazing our server justine was super helpful and kind

highly recommend

Address: 10807 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 4A7 Canada
Review: cafe amore bistro is a familyrun jewel visiting family in the area we called ahead to see if we needed a reservation and the gentleman on the phone informed us at the time no reservation was necessary but asked us what we needed and got a table ready for us three adults a 3yr old and a baby the server allyn was amazing perfect balance of attentiveness without being pushy the food was the best italian ive had next time im in edmonton cafe amore bistro is on my list of must stops the portions are generous and the flavour mindblowing

Address: 10807 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 4A7 Canada
Review: this was my first visit to this bistro the servers were very attentive they apologized a few times because it took them a few minutes to take our order our water tumblers were filled multiple times i ordered chicken parmigiana i chose linguine for my pasta choice i have no complaint about the quantity the pasta was nice and hot but the chicken was quite cold  at about room temperature the chicken breast was overwhelmed with tomato sauce i could hardly taste the parmesan cheese because of the quality of the food im opting for three stars actually it should be 35 stars with the price of the food i hoped that they would offer some buns many other restaurants do this is something the establishment should consider

Address: 6509 112th Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5W 0P1 Canada
Review: steamiest warmest most perfectly crusted baguette and tasty tapas that ive ever had in a reasonablypriced cute city ambiance and ive lived in france edmonton is beating france out its niche here staff caring and heartwarmingly chatty a mustvisit for edmonton if you havent already

Address: 6509 112th Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5W 0P1 Canada
Review: food is great a bit pricey though and the sizes are small service is great the atmosphere is average space is too tight and was cold inside overall mixed feelings about this place

Address: 6509 112th Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5W 0P1 Canada
Review:
as soon as i crossed the threshold into bodega i felt like i was immediately transported to catalunya or santiago or maybe paris or new york the lighting the decor the music the ambiance and the warm greeting at the door embraced me with a promise of a wonderful evening the menu reads like a cornucopia of culinary sophistication each item more tempting than the next the wine list alone is enough reason to come here and the cocktails are creative and tantalizing this could very well be my new favourite goto place in edmonton

update summertime i just discovered bodega highlands has a wonderful little patio out back also i neglected to mention above that this place has an awesome patio out back

Address: 6509 112th Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5W 0P1 Canada
Review:
went for an early dinner after a walk in the river valley
no problem getting a table it is a very cozy atmosphere
the service and food was delicious as always
love the salted cod fritters and the piri piri prawns always good first time trying the mussels in the saffron cream sauce it was absolutely delicious and nice that they gave a nice amount of bread to help soak up the sauce also had the mushroom risotto was very good quite salty luckily im a fan of salt

Address: 6509 112th Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5W 0P1 Canada
Review: so glad i found this place amazing food such bliss everything is sharable and quick to eat the staff were so friendly got the calamari ate too fast to photo grilled octopus mushroom risotto pork belly and meat and cheese board im coming back soon

Address: 14413 115 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 3B8 Canada
Review:
a great spot in the diner tradition open 09001400 monfri  we two had breakfast on a tues at 1030  we were the only customers  the diner is in a commercial area and caters to the lunch trade  one of us had the standard sausage eggs 3 panfries toast and coffee  the other had the farmers 3 egg omlette includes bacon  panfries inside with toast and coffee  the food and service were great with large portions the coffee was good  more people came in as lunchtime approached   we did chat with the owner a bit   who previously cooked at a wellknown local german restaurant now sadly closed  it shows  since schnitzel and goulash are also on the menu

note cash or debit cards only no credit cards

we highly recommend this restaurant for breakfast or lunch  5 stars all round

Address: 14413 115 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 3B8 Canada
Review: always amazing food friendly and quick service  and great value the portions are big and cooked to order rotating hot specials are like eating home cooked meals the burgers are massive and the fries are cooked  seasoned really well love coming here whenever we get the chance we also really appreciate the space is like a time capsule and always feels so familiar and comfortable

Address: 14413 115 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 3B8 Canada
Review:
20230216
homemade cooking from lunchbox diner highly recommend if you like east european cooking homemade apple pie is to die for

Address: 14413 115 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 3B8 Canada
Review: friendly service good food classic dinner environment highly recommended

Address: 14413 115 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 3B8 Canada
Review:
hidden little gemthe price was very reasonable  the food portions were generous the hamburger patty was so juicy and full of flavor every bite taken juice would drip down
the daily special was very delicious every bite taken was filled with wonderful flavors worth going back to this place

Address: 12223 156 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5V 1E6 Canada
Review: it was pretty good i liked the fish tacos but did not like the tamales it was fine but there are so many mexican restaurants in edmonton that are outstanding so i probably wont go out of my way to return to this one

Address: 12223 156 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5V 1E6 Canada
Review:
i went to this place for lunch and i have to say i was really excited about it the place itself is really nice and clean and the staff is friendly we tried quite a few dishes but unfortunately some were really salty and others were just flavorless the jamaica water was good but the horchata tasted like milk and the dessert didnt taste good at all it felt like it was really old and it was way too expensive for such a small portion we also tried a torta which was okay the elote was good but it was also pretty expensive overall i would give this place 3 stars its a nice place to go for a drink but i wouldnt recommend it for lunch or supper
bulldog was the best

Address: 12223 156 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5V 1E6 Canada
Review:
we absolutely loved our meals at el mero mero
we attended their 1 year celebration and enjoyed the festivities
we ordered so many different dishes that i cant remember it all lol
but the one that sticks out is the mole chicken and the chips and salsa
delicious delicious delicious

Address: 12223 156 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5V 1E6 Canada
Review:
my wife and i recently decided to give el mero mero taqueria a try since it was conveniently located nearby we opted for the sampler which allowed us to choose five different flavors of meat among them the al pastor and fish tacos stood out as my personal favorites the elotes were pretty good but if youre used to taber corn itll be different from that sweet soft texture

we visited this taqueria for lunch and my initial excitement was wellfounded the restaurant itself has a pleasant ambiance and is kept clean the staff members were friendly although slightly busy during our visit it seemed like they were in the midst of preparing their lunch special or something similar

while enjoying our meal we also decided to try their churros unfortunately the inside of the churros seemed slightly undercooked as the batter was still chewy

el mero mero taqueria is a fantastic place to experience authentic tacos with a wide selection in edmonton the restaurants environment is cool and unique featuring art that adorns the ceilings and floors before finalizing my review i would like to try a few more menu items to get a better sense of their overall offerings nevertheless as a newcomer in town its definitely worth a visit

Address: 12223 156 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5V 1E6 Canada
Review: this is our new favourite mexican restaurant in yeg the atmosphere was welcoming relaxed and fun  really cool artwork on the walls  the service was fantastic our drinks were never empty and everything was quick the best part the food we started with gauc and chipsdefinitely the best of both ive had  i could have left just eating that and been happy  also started with the queso funido with chorizo which was also fantasticthe cheese pull was top notch we split the birria tacos and the pescado  both had beautiful presentations and out of this world flavours i do have to pick favouritesthe birria  i could have drank that broth super tender and so flavourful  you guys take the cake in the city for the best they had really tempting dessert options but we were already stuffed so that will be visit 2

Address: 9570 - 76th Avenue Edmonton, AB T6C 0K2 Canada
Review:
good tasting food and kind service
the beef tartare was tasty and the bread that came with it was amazing the cucumber salad was also one of my favourites

Address: 9570 - 76th Avenue Edmonton, AB T6C 0K2 Canada
Review: biera serves fresh twists on classic dishes i especially love the new brunch menu we tried the english breakfast and the ambrosia french toast and both were delicious the atmosphere is lively and friendly

Address: 9570 - 76th Avenue Edmonton, AB T6C 0K2 Canada
Review: great service friendly and knowledgeable staff nice selection of beers the zestyzee is a must if you enjoy gemanic or belgian based wheat beers the food was mostly good i would definitely recommend the beef tartare the house bread is sublime unfortunately our steak was overcooked

Address: 9570 - 76th Avenue Edmonton, AB T6C 0K2 Canada
Review: i understand that the food is locally sourced and a lot is made in house but the high cost did not translate to the best quality and my experience was okay at best we got the yellowfin tuna and beef tartare normally been tartares texture isnt my favourite but it was surprisingly good the fish however was not although i love raw fish the taste combination was not good especially for 23 we left hungry and not even satisfied by the food the service was okay

Address: 9570 - 76th Avenue Edmonton, AB T6C 0K2 Canada
Review:
