have been here a couple times now and its absolutely amazing the food is great the drinks are outstanding and the service is even better
their steak tartare is a must have and now that they are open for brunch itll be a a new weekend favorite for us
try the french toast if you have a sweet tooth you wont be disappointed

Address: 10132 104 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review:
the very freshest seafood in the city bar none  black pearl is in a little hole in the wall on the vibrant 104 street in edmonton  there are other restaurants in the city that can do up fancy dishes with sauces and with varying presentations but for just fresh seafood on a plate black pearl is head and shoulders above all other seafood establishments  the food is extremely fresh and you can taste the quality

the space is very hip  its very chic but also blends elements of an eatery you might find in the maritimes there are two floors to this space so dont let the small footprint from outside fool you

the service is incredible the servers are extremely helpful and kind

one note the food is very expensive but you pay for what you get and to be privy to such incredible seafood on the prairies is very special warranting the prices

make sure you make a reservation

5 x

Address: 10132 104 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review: service was terrific and so was the food  a gentleman who i assume was the manager came through with some amazing wine recommendations as well as some future recommendations we did the buck a shuck which was a lot of fun at a great value also tried the calamari and the lobster flatbread not my first time visiting and certainly not my last

Address: 10132 104 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review:
popped in for a quick it of oysters during a busy week in for a conference the menu seemed so interesting i wanted to see the place

dark woods and fascinating atmosphere black pearl indeed really great service and as an oyster fan i must say expertly shucked and a unique offering of sides too

cant wait to get deeper into that delicious menu upon next visit to town

Address: 10132 104 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review: amazing  food quality   atmosphereambiance perfection  highly recommend already looking forward to going back and tasting more dishes from the menu  so many to choose from  the atlantic salmon was en pointe as were the brussel sprouts

Address: 10132 104 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 1A7 Canada
Review:
the realistic sea decorated ambience with a subdued lightning resembling candle light creates a relaxed and transporting atmosphere the place has an adventurous and collectionist vibe proper of a pirate its simply fun just to be there one can appreciate the amount of detail and care to create such timely scene yet theyve also managed to make it look modern
the place has a second floor for big reservations or special events it gives them a lot of privacy

our waiter tony did an amazing job creating cocktails for us upon request non alcoholic and he made us have a wonderful dinner experience all throughout he noticed we were checking out the decorations and took the time to share with us the place is actually decorated with real ship items and ornaments he was so nice and patient with us

we had octopus oysters tea and cr√®me br√ªl√®e they were beyond incredible and beautifully served

i would totally recommend i hope tony and the chefs are appreciated amongst the staff as they were amazing

thankyou

Address: 10406 Mayfield Road Edmonton, AB T5P 4P4 Canada
Review:
stopped in before a ball hockey game as they have happy hour enjoyed a drink with a teammate before our game and some appetizers we ordered their sweet potato fries and feftedakia meatballs both were really good and i loved the fetedakia
hope to invite more teammates for happy hour before a few of our games next season

Address: 10406 Mayfield Road Edmonton, AB T5P 4P4 Canada
Review: a group of us met for lunch this week and i was impressed a bit of a throwback menu and appearance but thats not why you go out of 7 of us 6 had the smoked meat sandwich i was the only one that changed it up a bit and had the club roll the smoked meat guys all loved their choice but they also all wanted to see what was in my sandwich roast beef smoked meat turkey and salami best sandwich ive ever had the service was great the beer selection is a bit limited but it was a great price and a true pint in a nice big chilled beer glass definitely going back

Address: 10406 Mayfield Road Edmonton, AB T5P 4P4 Canada
Review: great experience high piled smoked meat on warm soft rye bread with nice hot mustard  fantastic jamie who is now one of the greatest servers ever did an absolutely phenomenal job service was fast made sure our food was hot  and when something wasnt just so for me  she made a point of rectifying the issue without me even having to ask bam if you like smoked meat and great service  go to the refinery grill and ask for jamie you wont be disappointed with either

Address: 10406 Mayfield Road Edmonton, AB T5P 4P4 Canada
Review:
three of us met for brunch at refinery grill and we were all most impressed the restaurant is quite nice  clean and the service was excellent the food was delicious and the coffee was topped up frequently
we will be back and i highly recommend to anyone looking for a great atmosphere  meal

Address: 10406 Mayfield Road Edmonton, AB T5P 4P4 Canada
Review: beautiful little restaurant our server was very friendly and helpful i ordered the western omelette with rye toast aside from one burnt piece of potato the dish was cooked perfectly and well plated the atmosphere is welcoming and enjoyable overall an excellent breakfast for the right price

Address: 9910 109th Street Edmonton, AB T5K 1H5 Canada
Review: this place has amazing service super nice servers and a really cool vibe lots of drinks on the menu and the wings were great 4 stars because the patio is quite noisy with the cars right next to it also warning lots of mosquitoes at night and its hard to converse inside because the music is super loud

Address: 9910 109th Street Edmonton, AB T5K 1H5 Canada
Review: this place has a very awesome atmosphere romantic relaxing and friendly  the food is absolutely delicious the only reason for losing a star is because what i wanted to order off the menu was discontinued the crab cakes  thats ok the tacos and truffle potato cannelloni were superb  definitely a unique taste and experience and well worth the money  the staff are super friendly and do go above and beyond  our waitress was super informative about the menu and was so great the happy hour prices are amazing tuesday to friday 300 to 600 so worth it  food and beverage

Address: 9910 109th Street Edmonton, AB T5K 1H5 Canada
Review: this is one of the best restaurants in edmonton i had the stroganof and it was amazing i will definitely be back again and whenever friends from out of town come to visit i will bring them here i cant wait to go back again

Address: 9910 109th Street Edmonton, AB T5K 1H5 Canada
Review: the common offered a great patio experience the interior of the restaurant seems super cool though i ordered the prairie fish and chips and it was outstanding fries were salted to perfection and crispy the fish had a tasty batter and was tender with a crispy outside food came out extremely fast and so to our server who great and friendly

Address: 9910 109th Street Edmonton, AB T5K 1H5 Canada
Review:
this was my second time eating here the first time the food was mind blowingly delicious but this second time we came the food was sub par i had a burger and my girlfriend had a chicken sandwich the burger wasnt anything special and the meat seems to be cooked weird and my girlfriends sandwich wasnt the best

however we did order the charcuterie board which was really good and came with what i think was a dill cream cheese id definitely order it again we also ordered old fashioned which was decent as well

service was good and the staff was incredibly friendly we will come back and try it again soon

Address: 8115-104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E4 Canada
Review: overall a good korean restaurant in the neighbourhood service is great the restaurant is small and neat a great place to eat on whyte the kimbap is sublime bulgogi is delicious also ask for tea and was served roasted corn tea something different but good

Address: 8115-104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E4 Canada
Review: probably the best place to eat on whyte the kimbap is sublime bulgogi is delicious you must get the ssam with it they have a mushroom japchae that is really tasty too and vegetarian also ask for tea i dont know what the tea is but it is the best tea and i havent found it anywhere else

Address: 8115-104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E4 Canada
Review:
excellent service
the staff are very friendly and approachable
a little bit pricey but hey the food tastes delicious i would say that what we paid for was worth it
we had bulgogi jangeol pork bulgogi and bibimbap
we will definitely come back again


and so we went back and tried different dishes today budae jiggae spicy o sam and kimchi bokumbap everythings delicious

Address: 8115-104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E4 Canada
Review: first time dining here food was excellent great staff loved the continuous movie playing  no sound so doesnt impact your meal well be back next time were in edmonton

Address: 8115-104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 4E4 Canada
Review: seafood pancake was very crispy though ÌååÍ∞Ä ÎÑàÎ¨¥ ÎßéÏïÑÏöî butter bulgogi deopbap was delicious because the beef and butter created a great combination servers were very nice and we had more Î∞òÏ∞¨ kimchi and daikon can be refilled worth a try

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review:
incredible food i had the nuevo burrito wasnt a hand held which took me by surprise but the flavour was incredible i can honestly say this was one of the best meals of my life the flavour combination was perfectly balanced the menu and selection is not only organic and has lots of vegan options but is also really good made it hard to choose what to eat
highly recommend
great price for the quality you get the proportions are perfect musics good here to staff was incredible too

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review:
this review is based off a visit on 05032023 and again on 05042023 also it was brought to my attention i posted this review for the wrong oeb location how lucky for edmontonians that you have three oebs to choose from

i live in toronto and unless youre willing to stand in line for hours on a weekend or manage to go on a weekday you cannot get into the oeb in liberty village so believe me when i tell you i was thrilled to discover an oeb in edmonton during a recent visit

my experience was so good on visit number one we visited again the very next day

first of all the restaurant styling and theme is impeccable truly a gorgeous space with a clearly defined brand identity

second the service is amazing on both occasions we were greeted and seated promptly and our servers on each visit were bubbly friendly knowledgable about the menu and attentive without being overbearing

im normally a sweets for breakfast kind of person but i couldnt resist the idea of a breakfast carbonara i was not disappointed with my choice the gnocchi was perfectly plush surrounded by hearty chunks of bacon and topped with a gorgeously orange fresh egg yolk every bite was perfection and i could have eaten three more servings

on visit two i reverted back to my old habits and ordered the french toast trifle another delicious choice featuring two slices of thick brioche topped with a tart lemon curd fresh strawberries and toasted meringues no need to add syrup

the only downside of my visit to oeb is that we didnt have time in our trips schedule to visit a third time

overall

pros
 gorgeous and quaint restaurant with amazing decor and design choices
 incredibly friendly and helpful staff
 wide variety of choices from savoury to sweet to please all taste buds
 fresh ingredients combined in creative ways

cons
 paid street or parkade parking only

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review: first time going  was not disappointed at all  we are from out of town and the reviews kept popping up every time we were searching for best places to eat in edmonton  we have been trying to come a number of times we ended up going to the city centre kelly ramsay in edmonton food was absolutely stellar and on the healthy side for a breakfast place  service was quick and top knotch  all the servers helped each other out  justin and sydney were excellent  all the staff were happy positive smiling and personable  they kept us topped up with everything  they use umbria coffee roasters which is of superb quality  and we are fairly picky with our food  we almost always wont post negative reviews but will only post the best of the best thank you oeb staff  we will be back our new go to breakfast place in the city

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review: ambiance and service were great my blue crab benny was really good but it was quite fishy tasting so beware if you dont like strong fishy flavors its a bit too much for me personally would definitely go back to try other items on the menu

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review:
avoid

visiting edmonton and spotted the reviews for this location so took a chance

party of two we were greeted well as a walk in and promptly seated the location was busy for a saturday morning as to be expected and was well lit with refreshing colours and seating staff was very kind and friendly

the food however was mediocre to gross my partner ordered the ham with eggs sourdough bread and potatoe wedges which came as ordered and was a typical ham and egg breakfast though at an elevated price so it goes

for myself i ordered the gold digga breakfast poutine which is made up of poached eggs herb potatoes saint cyrille curds berkshire roast pork black truffles and brown butter hollandaise to the staffs credit i asked for my eggs soft and they confirmed that they would be runny what i was not expecting once the meal arrived was firstly the smaller portion size and secondly that the mix of the egg yolks whites hollandaise sauce oils and cheese would leave the bottom half of the bowl a symphonic mess of a soggy herb potatoe soup this was contrasted with the overcooked berkshire roast pork which more closely resembled last nights overcooked leftover steak cubed and refried for the nextday patrons the seasoning was present but immediately overwhelmed by the soggy potatoe soup to be rendered pointless and the truffles were simply absent all together the dish is worthy of a spot on gordan ramsays kitchen nightmares and were it not for having spent time in the army eating whatever we were told to eat im sure i would have rejected this out of hand

regardless the location was clean and the staff were great maybe well return in the future but i simply cannot recommend these breakfast poutines which appear to be constructed without care or attention to detail

1 star for the breakfast poutine mess 1 star because the cooks knew how to cook the ham and eggs served to my partner along with the good staff and atmosphere

Address: 10349 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review: one of my favourite places in edmonton the food and cocktails are delicious and the service is top notch it does get busy so i recommend you reserve a table in advance and then prepare to have a blast

Address: 10349 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review:
food

wagyu beef carpaccio 1010 an explosion of flavors fresh juicy and super delicious this plate is their best appetizer the meat melts in your mouth fold it and put it on the fresh bread they serve to have a musttry bite its so good

ricotta gnudi 1010 the basil pesto genovese is made to perfection it is soft and buttery the ingredients are so fresh and the quality is simply top of the line the addition of roasted pine nuts and arugula is marvelous

agnolotti 1010 its so creamy and tasty the truffle makes it super tasty one of my favorite dishes the portion is a bit small but the taste is just amazing i love it

chocolate budino 1010 a dense soft thin top crust excuisit piece of brownie i usually dont like super chocolaty desserts but this changed my mind its so fulfilling that you want to just indulge in it its their number one dessert

service

the staff is super friendly and helpful the food came fast and fresh

atmosphere

the place is a bit cosy nevertheless its a perfect choice for a date casual meeting andor business meeting the ambiance is somehow calming i love it

Address: 10349 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review: tasty little restaurant the elegant atmosphere and amazing level of services support the great selection of food and alcohol i loved their chared lettuce and olive cakes other menu we tried were gnocchi and arancini and both of them were also pretty good we also tried one of their daily specials which was also amazing but i dont remember the name of it unfortunately highly recommend

Address: 10349 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review:
an edmonton must probably the best italian restaurant in edmonton food was outstanding and they have a good collection of alcoholic drinks
i ordered their full course meal
 their bread with duck fat and ricotta cheese was mindblowingly delicious in my opinion a little too rich for an appetizer
 salad fresh colorful and offered a variety of different textures very very light
 pastas fluffy gnocchi that was accompanied by a savory and earthy black truffle sauce was slightly disappointed with the texture of the meat balls and the overall flavor of their tomato sauce the pastas were all somewhat salty even for someone who likes their food salty
 fish grilled to perfection fresh juicy flaky and had a slight hint of smoke

Address: 10349 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Y7 Canada
Review: i recommend you order the chefs menu  a fantastic tour of the menu  its beautiful

Address: 10922 88 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0Z1 Canada
Review: i had the chicken and waffles which was okay generous portion of chicken the waffles were very sweet and crumbly there was little watermelon salsa on top which was a bit disappointing also the topping was not true maple butter which was confusing the cinnamon buns were very tasty

Address: 10922 88 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0Z1 Canada
Review: great brunch fare but lacking a tad in variety especially in healthier options a local favourite that often requires a lengthy wait before being seated does not take reservations the breakfast sandwich is excellent and the pulled pork with hash and poached eggs receives great reviews whenever we stop by with friends

Address: 10922 88 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0Z1 Canada
Review: my friends and i arrived early so there wasnt much of a wait our server was very friendly we all ordered different meals so we could try everything i ordered chicken and waffles and they were okay nothing special it was a nice cute place for breakfast the servings are pretty generous we were pretty full after and we had to take out some of it

Address: 10922 88 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0Z1 Canada
Review:
the sugarbowl used to be lined up out the door with long lineups for breakfast or brunch its a legendary iconic spot in edmonton that has stood the test of time however with so many new more innovative offerings in town this spot is starting to age a little

the rustic space is still quaint and has a great university vibe the servers are amazingly positive and upbeat

the food is good its no longer on par with the industry that is moving so much further forward in breakfast dining  the chicken  waffles and the benny are decent  howevergood newsthey still have the giant cinnamon roll on the menu that can serve a whole family

4 x

Address: 10922 88 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6G 0Z1 Canada
Review:
the food at sugarbowl is exceptional i like to sample different restaurants in town i am fond of their chili and corn bread
service is great and food quality is top notch

Address: 9707 110 St NW Edmonton, AB T5K 2L9 Canada
Review: we were treated very special for our anniversary dinner our server matt knew when and when not to come by our table they locally source most of their menu items beef tartare on sourdough and ahi tuna to start flavour explosions they accommodated us by putting the avocado on the side for allergy reasons we had the caviar plate next wow sustainably sourced and so delicious main courses were lamb and salmon with a side of pork belly the salmon with the dill sauce paired perfectly and the rice side was such a great combo of citrus tomato and leek the lamb with meatballs was so tender with an incredible tomato jam that i have never tasted before i need to buy that the pork belly was cooked so well crisp and tender at the same time for dessert the vanilla panna cotta was a nice light finish the chocolate cake was a bit harder than we expected while the mousse on top was a delicious crusted caramel and we took home two macaroons we had wines to go with every course and were not disappointed in choices recommended by matt chef scott came at the end to say hello and congratulate us on our anniversary we had a nice chat learning about the restaurant what a great fine dining experience highly recommended

Address: 9707 110 St NW Edmonton, AB T5K 2L9 Canada
Review: i had the best brunch of my life here when they first opened and had always wanted to go back the menu changes often perhaps seasonally and i was very happy to see they finally added their prices to the online menu they also stopped charging a 10 fee for reservations if thats prevented you from visiting as it has for me now is the time the dinner is incredible i savoured every bite the beef was cooked to perfection and just melted in my mouth the dessert was equally as incredible one shareable two mains two desserts and two non alcoholic bevies was 145 before tip highly recommend and of course its a stunning view of the legislature and river valley

Address: 9707 110 St NW Edmonton, AB T5K 2L9 Canada
Review: the best place for a fine dining i had a wonderful experience and got a extraordinary service love the oysters and beefs

Address: 9707 110 St NW Edmonton, AB T5K 2L9 Canada
Review:
the food here isnt anything special i didnt taste it and say wow tiniest portions ever for how much i paid and how small amount of food i got it should have been at least better than i can make at home

i never order dessert but i did at this place because i was still hungry after eating 2 strips of steak and 4 tablespoons of mashed potatoes the dessert was straight up bad mousse on top of a brownie hockey puck sprinkled with a heinous amount of hard caramel pieces

the mojito was good the service not bad dont waste your time or money if you are considering this place to eat out

Address: 9707 110 St NW Edmonton, AB T5K 2L9 Canada
Review:
my partner and i had absolutely great experience at butternut tree from the start to finish phenomenal dining experience from service to the food the tasting menu is seasonal and changes based upon the availability of local produceprotein

definitely will be coming back to enjoy another tasting menu also on a side note you can order regular tasting menu and vegetable tasting menu together not one over the other

i also appreciated the attention to detail on the presentation of the food they also use local ceramic dinnerware which looked amazing

Address: 10220 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 4A1 Canada
Review:
the seafood here is amazing everything we ordered was fantastic although they specialize in portuguese cuisine the spanish fare here was amazing they even have jamon iberico bellota and galician octopus

the service left nothing to be desired our server was very prompt and she was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and provided excellent recommendations a real pleasure to have her as our server

Address: 10220 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 4A1 Canada
Review:
the restaurant is beautiful the wait staff is attentive theres multiple dining options  tapas on a limited menu and sabor with a full menu to start the bread and cheeses are amazing the braised boar cheek 1010 couldnt have done it better

but when it came up to catch of the day it seemed rather uninspired no sauce my wifes salmon was undercooked i also wasnt a huge fan of the lobster risotto it just tastes of tomato sauce the lobster was also overcooked it was kind of gross to be honest it looked rather unappetizing on the plate as well the catch of the day was salmon and halibut together

it made me really wish i had whoever was in charge of red meats cooking my mains that night haha

Address: 10220 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 4A1 Canada
Review: wow what an evening to remember while having fun with family members we had the best meal of the year the waiter was very professionally dressed he maitained his positive attitude to all customers he was serving  if you need a place where you can have the best meal  visit sabor restraunt if you need to be   treated like a valuable customervisit sabor restraunt  do not hesitate

Address: 10220 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 4A1 Canada
Review: oh my havent been this satisfied with a meal in a long time especially loved the octopus and clams will definitely go back or try one of their sister bodegas

Address: 10220 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 4A1 Canada
Review: best restaurant i have ever eaten at we got the seafood platter so much incredible food we are beyond satisfied and our server cory went above and beyond its was the best dinning experience in my life

Address: 12832 137 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 4Y8 Canada
Review: i tried this place a while back and their food was delicious this time i tried chicken tajeen which was good but not great the veggies on it are delicious tho portions are really big loved the appetizers tea wasnt free as opposed to what other reviews are suggesting

Address: 12832 137 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 4Y8 Canada
Review:
we were recently in edmonton exploring that citys vibrant restaurant scene were huge fans of north african and eastern mediterranean cuisine so the bedouins was high on our list of places to visit and we are so glad we did

the food here is fabulous and priced very very fairly the vibe is casual and unpretentious and the staff are friendly even when they are run off their feet when its busy

we wanted to try lots of dishes so as usual we ordered far more food than we could eat at one sitting

we ordered two appetizers batata mbuttana spiced minced meat between two layers of fluffy mashed potato breaded then fried and buraik think vegetarian deep fried spring roll while the buraik was very good the batata mbuttana was outrageously delicious especially when dipped in the creamy garlic sauce that accompanied the dish

we were going to order the mashweeya dip essentially a roasted veggie tapenade and the bedouin lamb soup but our server informed us that small orders of each were included with our mains so we didnt have to order separately very cool

as for the mains we ordered chicken tajeen and lamb haneeth both were outstanding

the tajeen was a halfchicken and not a small bird either that had clearly been marinated in a medley of spices then baked to perfection it was served on a generous bed of perfectly cooked yellow rice delicious

the lamb haneeth is advertised as roasted lamb in a mix of herbs creating a dish you have never seen or tasted before  and theyre right we love lamb and order it whenever the opportunity presents itself so were picky this was some of the best lamb dishes weve ever had complex rich and layered flavours accent a generous portion of meltinyourmouth tender lamb seriously if you like lamb this is a mustorder dish

as for the accompanying small plates the lamb and pasta soup was a revelation and the lentil soup was almost as good and the small plate of mashweeya dip  hummus served with a scrumptious warm bread was a creamy taste delight heck even the simple green salads were served up with a very tasty herbed olive oil dressing  so good

oh and if you like a nice strong black tea infused with fresh mint leaves order up a pot  its so delicious

all this for 95 tax and generous gratuity included great value considering the quality and the fact that our boxed leftovers provided breakfast and a light lunch the next day

highly recommended

Address: 12832 137 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 4Y8 Canada
Review: came for dinner and left satisfied we ordered the combo dinner for our table of 5 adults the lamb and chicken dishes accompanying the combo were delicious more than enough food for us and to be honest most likely would have fed up to 6 in addition to the fantastic food was the great service of the staff the staff was prompt and checked to make sure everything was satisfactory they even found time to crack a joke and put a smile on everyones faces the atmosphere was relaxed and definitely a place i would recommend to have a nice homestyle meal i will definitely be back

Address: 12832 137 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 4Y8 Canada
Review: the staff were incredibly friendly and we were given so much food along with our meals the bread was freshly made and so delicious and the soup that was given was perfect i got the shawarma plate and it had a lot of food i even had enough for a whole lunch the next day but it was absolutely delicious turkish coffee is also worth a try

Address: 12832 137 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5L 4Y8 Canada
Review:
this restaurant has a great atmosphere and very nice staff they also have a private room for large parties

the food was good and came out quickly service is probably the best part aziz was our waiter and he made sure we were all taken care of he was very kind and nice

delicious bread and hummus the meals are very large portions most people in our party couldnt finish their meals

will definitely come back again

Address: 11978 104 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0T3 Canada
Review:
tokiwa ramen meets local expectations  is a must for ramen lovers or firsttime eaters

my friend suggested this location after i mentioned i was craving some ramen

wow this place was fantastic i have to apologize for the photos because the food looked so good i had to digin right away

fresh ingredients awesome customer service delicious broth this place lives up to the expectations

during rush hour just be prepared to wait in line

check out tokiwa ramen if youre in edmonton you will not regret it

Address: 11978 104 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0T3 Canada
Review: been trying to come to this place so many times either they ran out of soup or it was just a crazy line up finally made it and certainly worth it waited 20 minutes in line we had the tokyo tonkotsu and the black garlic ramen so delicious that broth was so flavourful also had the bou gyoza nice and crispy crunch to it and a different texture than the traditional gyoza wish there were more than 4 pieces cause i could have had that all to myself service was good they were busy so things moved quickly we got our drinks and food promptly there was still even a line up after 2pm overall great place highly recommended

Address: 11978 104 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0T3 Canada
Review: a great addition to edmonton honestly the best ramen ive ever eaten at a restaurant there are a variety of toppings and great broth flavours to choose from i have been many times and every time it has been delicious beautiful presentation and great noodles too i just cant say enough the staff are friendly it is a very small dinning space but that just adds to its appeal you walk in and get sat right away unless its busy then its usually still only 15mins wait the menus are qr codes on all of the tables and you get your food super quick after ordering so a great place for lunch if you dont have too much time definitely a favourite place of mine to go to eat would recommend to anyone who likes soups very spicy to nonspicy options all taste delicious

Address: 11978 104 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0T3 Canada
Review: here on a weekday around 1pm it was busy 1520min wait there were signs and the staff directed as well when it comes to wait times service was quick the only thing is we didnt get a chance to chat and stay longer given that it was continuously busy and the tables were so close to each other it is worth the wait when it comes to their food delicious ramen for sure

Address: 11978 104 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0T3 Canada
Review:
overall the noodles are good but soup seems lacking definitely had interesting topping choices no bamboo shoots but shoyu black fungus the bowls are full of taste but lacking aroma
black garlic tonkotsu  shoyu tare is heavy on shiitake mushroom taste and umami has a roasted flavor from the black garlic oil
yuzu shio chicken  super strong yuzu taste from the oil on top light clear broth but not as good as other yuzu shio chicken soup ramen that i have had
small chicken rice bowl  standard a bit on the sweetumami side from the sauce generous amount of green onion garnish
the table condiments include pickled chili sauceoil and rice vinegar

Address: 3739 99 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review:
terrific sushi very polite staff the food is great my waitress amy is super helpful at explaining the various dishes and thats a huge help shes very polite and always has a smile

i have eaten here over 10 times and each has been a terrific experience

Address: 3739 99 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review: best izakaya experience in edmonton it was my wifes birthday and they made us feel like family terry was phenomenal and the food was out of this world each of the dishes left us speechless highly recommended

Address: 3739 99 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review: havent gone back here in years because our first visit didnt leave a mark back in 2018 not sure if they changed the menu or the chefs but everything we ordered this time tasted great the portions were justifiable the prices were not too expensive considering the inflation these days loved the traditional decor and calm ambiance it was a busy rush hour and we didnt have a reservation we had to be at the bar but didnt mind it since there was only two of us we got to see the chefs make the food in live time will definitely visit again

Address: 3739 99 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review:
updated  we went there again tonight and all the food still tastes amazing my number one choice of japanese restaurantizakaya

we ordered a lot and all tastes great  staff were friendly and reminded us a lot about japan  will definitely going again

Address: 3739 99 Street Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review: great food and friendly staff  be sure to have their sake cesar drink  one of the best tasting cesars that ive ever had  carbonara udon is always my go to dish there

Address: 10310-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 4X1 Canada
Review:
joey never disappoints with their food  always of high quality and the menu is always fresh

downtown has a super vibe with the post work crowd raising the bar on the cool factor

our hostess was a little inauthentic  too put on  but the service was serviceable

Address: 10310-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 4X1 Canada
Review:
great food with reasonable pricing most likely going to have to pay for parking if you drive here as its in the ice district and parking is hard to come by but great vibes for a dinner out with friends
our waitress seemed very inexperienced though and didnt remember parts of our order is affogato not something joey offers i asked for one and explained what it was to our waitress but she served it already poured and was cold when i received it i also didnt get a spoon and our waitress left before i had time to notice and didnt come back for a long time i ended up eating the ice cream with the chopsticks served at the table my friend ordered one after me and the espresso came out 5 minutes after the ice cream was served again without a spoon even though i specifically asked for one this time
if you are unsure what a customer is asking for please ask a more experienced staff member or google it or just say we cant make it that was so ridiculous and unprofessional to me and it seemed like the waitress just didnt care
i do think joeys is a good place though and would go back im assuming most staff members are more present and professional

Address: 10310-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 4X1 Canada
Review: ive heard service here was great but that wasnt the case when me and a couple of friends decided to go here for my birthday we were served so poorly and not only it made us feel unwelcome and by the time our food came the pasta to their so called chicken parmigiana was hard the food was unappetizing the only good thing was this drink called she pretty but joeys was just another typical white restaurant with uninviting customer service

Address: 10310-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 4X1 Canada
Review: it wasnt very busy which was nice our waitress i think her name was dani was super friendly and made sure everything was perfect and the food was delicious she definitely deserves kudos as ive never had a server who was as nice and who cared so much compared to most definitely would go back if im ever in the city again

Address: 10310-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 4X1 Canada
Review: wonderful location with amazing hostesses gina was in charge of our table and she did an excellent job taking care of our needs i believe i had the bombay butter chicken and wow it was so good i ordered an extra rice bowl i had to pair it up with their kendall jackson avant chardonnay prolly one of the best meals ive had this year so far will definitely drop by again

Address: 10548A 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review: best new orleans food ive ever had this place is a perfect 10 from the outside its not crazy flashy it has a nice diner retro vibe but the food is probably the best food ive had in a long time ive had jambalaya before and i thought i didnt like it until i came here portions are huge and worth every penny and the flavours are honestly amazing come eat here if youre reading this

Address: 10548A 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review: what a great restaurant really charming decor and atmosphere an old school diner done properly right down to the twoperson booths and diner counter the food was great their poboys are known for a reason the service was fantastic and despite it being very busy we werent neglected at all i will absolutely be returning

Address: 10548A 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review:
i had been itching to try this place out for weeks and was finally given the opportunity

firstly i would recommend making a reservation if its the weekend as it can get very busy

we had ordered the crab cake poboy and breakfast poboy and they were both absolutely fantastic the crab cakes had a fantastic flavor and good coating the bread didnt get soggy at all and the andouille sausage was very flavorful in the breakfast poboy

the service was also great and all the servers were very kind overall this was a 1010 experience and i will absolutely be coming back the next opportunity i have

Address: 10548A 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review: everything weve had here has always been amazing hot wings and ribs are also 1010

Address: 10548A 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2A4 Canada
Review:
food was wonderful staff were friendly it was a nice night so sat outside on the patio
only complaint was that when we sat outside after checking in inside we waited for about 10 minutes to even be acknowledged and have drink orders taken once we flagged someone down the service was quite fast and very friendly

Address: 10135 100 Street NW The Westin Edmonton Edmonton, AB T5J 0N7 Canada
Review:
review only based on drink take out

walked downstairs to order a wine to go
wines only come in 5oz 8oz bottle no half bottles
friendly server staff even made sure i did not have any nut allergies and gave me warm nuts to go with my wine as i walked it up to my room myself

dining area seems beautiful and clean

Address: 10135 100 Street NW The Westin Edmonton Edmonton, AB T5J 0N7 Canada
Review:
generally provides consistent quality of food but missed the mark on my most recent visit however they were able to rectify the situation and i was satisfied with the resolution in terms of pricing theyre slightly more expensive than similar grade hotels the staff are pleasant and they dont bother you too much so you can enjoy your food in peace

its definitely worth visiting if youre staying at the westin especially since the winter temperatures here are unreasonably cold

Address: 10135 100 Street NW The Westin Edmonton Edmonton, AB T5J 0N7 Canada
Review: we had a reservation no one was there to seat us so my wife and i sat ourselves after waiting a bit we then waited 1520 minutes and no one served us so we walked out the waitress totally ignored us and others there too and it wasnt busy we were both well dressed as we were going to the theatre after

Address: 10135 100 Street NW The Westin Edmonton Edmonton, AB T5J 0N7 Canada
Review:
food is meh prices were very high this restaurant is also in the hotel lobby the ambience isnt good
food ordered duck tagliatelle  bad pasta and duck very over cooked sauce very bland  mushroom flatbread burger  fine i guess crab cake  good

Address: 10135 100 Street NW The Westin Edmonton Edmonton, AB T5J 0N7 Canada
Review: i visited share restaurant of the westin edmonton hotel for dinner one evening i ordered the salad with the goat cheese tomatoes salmon etc it was pretty good the server was okay coworkers of mine ate breakfast here and said that the food was good but quite pricey eg 2030person there is a bar to order drinks and a handful of tvs to watch sports

Address: 10013 101A Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 0C3 Canada
Review:
there was another restaurant near by that wouldnt let my women in because she had no id shes 42 but yeah this place lets us in thats why i give 5 stars

i been here a few times i really like the decor staff was very nice to me

Address: 10013 101A Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 0C3 Canada
Review: the places open till 2 offering wide variety of beer options the beers are local beers and they are amazing we went for raspberry beer which tasted splendid we ordered ribs  pasta  mac n cheese

Address: 10013 101A Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 0C3 Canada
Review:
craft beer market in edmonton is a fantastic spot for craft beer lovers the atmosphere is lively and energetic making it a great place to hang out with friends and enjoy a good drink the restaurant offers a wide selection of craft beers from local and international breweries as well as a delicious menu of food that is perfect for sharing

one of the things i love about craft beer market is the knowledgeable and friendly staff they are always happy to offer recommendations and help you find the perfect beer to suit your taste whether youre a seasoned beer connoisseur or just starting to explore the world of craft beer the staff at craft beer market will make sure you have a great experience

the food at craft beer market is also topnotch the menu offers a range of appetizers entrees and desserts that are all made with fresh and highquality ingredients i particularly enjoyed the pretzel bites which were served warm and accompanied by a delicious beer cheese dip

overall i highly recommend craft beer market in edmonton for anyone who loves craft beer and good food the atmosphere selection of beer and quality of food are all outstanding and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable whether youre looking for a casual night out with friends or a special occasion craft beer market is definitely worth a visit

Address: 10013 101A Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 0C3 Canada
Review: first time trying craft  food and service was great  excellent atmosphere on rooftop patio  great experience

Address: 10013 101A Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 0C3 Canada
Review: the vibe is more inspiring than the food that said the beer is plentiful and perfect lots of choice great place to watch a hockey game and explore some delicious local craft brews

Address: 10205 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 3X8 Canada
Review: great food and reasonable prices we saw everyone ordering karaage chicken but it wasnt all that great way larger pieces of chicken than i typically enjoy but the pressed sushi was great definitely worth a visit the only other knock i have is that when it gets really busy some of the tables are in some pretty high traffic areas not much that the restaurant can do about this but be wary if you were hoping for a quiet night out

Address: 10205 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 3X8 Canada
Review:
unique and different tasting japanese cuisine

i do not eat sushi but had a japanese version of fettuccine where upon noodles where used the cream sauce was out out of the world tasting

my dinner companions indicated  not a true tradition place to eat sushi  they had extremely tasty sushikind of options to eat that were very good regardless

servers were excellent

Address: 10205 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 3X8 Canada
Review:
the food was amazing definitely reccomend any of the pressed sushis we ordered more of them after the cabonara udon is interesting and very creamy had the lychee cocktail which was really nice

the server was very friendly and knowledgeable explaining any questions we had it was my friends birthday and they were gifted a little free dessert with a sparkler

the ambiance is nice and cozy the washrooms were also well kept will come again

Address: 10205 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 3X8 Canada
Review:
this has to be the absolute smallest beef tetaki i have ever received and i live in vancouver 

this is the land of beef and you serve a portion so small and charge 15 for it

for shame

the tomato kimchi  is decent but for the price very disappointed

2 items for 27  one item is smaller than the phone i am typing this on sad

chopsticks in picture are for size comparison

Address: 10205 82 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 3X8 Canada
Review:
it was my 10th marriage anniversary yesterday
prosfood was served so fast bluefin tuna really fresh
cons ramen is a little bit salty beef tataki very salty  i dont like it fried chicken is fine but dont compare with the professional fried chicken restaurant
we ordered yuzu cider and tokyo both tasted so so food is overpriced with less amount

Address: 10004  90th Street Edmonton, AB T5H 4P4 Canada
Review: located in cute historical building the ambience inside was great also the outdoor space seating was wonderful made for a wonderful experience outdoors to relax  have breakfast service friendly as well happy they had vegan option as well for breakfast hope they include more in the future great place to visit

Address: 10004  90th Street Edmonton, AB T5H 4P4 Canada
Review:
so delicious peaceful surroundings in the middle of the city they have tent and patio seating as well as inside the building

cappuccino was great and the earl grey tea in the london fog was definitely a star we had the breakfast sandwich with potatoes and pulled pork sandwich everything was delicious and home style the buns were soft and flaky paired really well with the fillings 55 stars experience

Address: 10004  90th Street Edmonton, AB T5H 4P4 Canada
Review: it was the best place in edmonton for the eggs benny unfortunately its not anymore last couple of orders the eggs were overcooked almost hardboiled so sad but coffee is still good and the staff are friendly its a nice and cozy dogfriendly place i really enjoy being here hope they can make that amazing yolkrunning eggs again

Address: 10004  90th Street Edmonton, AB T5H 4P4 Canada
Review: amazing coffee and drinks the vegan hash was soooooo yummy definitely recommend really pretty chill atmosphere it was pretty busy but still got a good spot

Address: 10004  90th Street Edmonton, AB T5H 4P4 Canada
Review: this is one of my favorite places to eat in edmonton and easily one of my top 5 favorite restaurants the food quality is fantastic portions are great and the staff are very friendly its located in a quiet neighborhood which adds to its charm but because of the location parking might be limited definitely check this place out if youre ever in town

Address: 2 Athabascan Avenue Unit 8 Sherwood Park, AB T8A 4E3 Canada
Review: a great spot for clean and tasty mexican cuisine decor was clean and comfortable service was quick and friendly food portions were good and fresh the flan was huge and tasty desserts are a highlight here

Address: 2 Athabascan Avenue Unit 8 Sherwood Park, AB T8A 4E3 Canada
Review: nice place with great feel we came in on canada day late afternoon so it was starting to get busy but not quite yet they gave us a lot of time before starting to serve the appetizer the nachos was so delicious though it did not have any cheese on top but was super flavourful i do prefer it without cheese despite being a cheese lover because sometimes restaurants put too much cheese on top and ignoring other ingredients also bring flavours to this dish we also had the suadero brisket and al pastor pork taco the brisket was a bit dry to my taste but the al pastor was both flavourful and refreshing because of the pineapple bits on top i also personally liked the rice better than the bean paste as it again can be a bit dry on its own maybe i dont know the proper way to eat it churros with whipped cream was also good overall a good experience and great food

Address: 2 Athabascan Avenue Unit 8 Sherwood Park, AB T8A 4E3 Canada
Review: first time here  it was highly recommended by friends  we are glad we did i had the pork tacos and my hubby had the brisket  both very delicious  we also started with the homemade chips with guacamole and fresh salsa everything was very fresh and well seasoned our  server was very good and helpful with picking menu items we tried the 3 milk cake it tasted good but you have to like soggy cake the custard dessert was tasty but it was quite firm  not bad just not like a brule we will be back to try new things

Address: 2 Athabascan Avenue Unit 8 Sherwood Park, AB T8A 4E3 Canada
Review: what a gem very fresh ingredients the melted cheese in a skillet appetizer was super tasty fish tacos were fresh and delicious very friendly and inviting service 5 stars for overall experience

Address: 2 Athabascan Avenue Unit 8 Sherwood Park, AB T8A 4E3 Canada
Review: really good experience firsttimer in this restaurant and absolutely thrilled to see tostadas on the menu full house that must mean the foods really good and people always come back i arrived on wednesday about 1230 it was only open for an hour and a half into place was packed recommended make reservations for dinner the horchata is delicious too

Address: 10236 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review: this place is fabulous the service was wonderful the food is awesome and the location is super accessible 1010 recommend the beef satay soup which was a perfect balance of rich and aromatic the appies we got were the salad rolls and papaya salad both had delightful nuances crunchy salty tempura bits in the salad rolls and beef jerky in the salad the staff were lovely and speedy this my be my new spot for vietnamese

Address: 10236 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review:
xo bistro downtown is an amazing fusion vietnamese experience all of their dishes are very creatively done and extremely tasty  youll recognize many of the favorites you traditionally get at vietnamese restaurants including the soups and ricevermicelli dishes except they add that extra flair and the dishes are fresh and inventive

the space is very gorgeous with a stunning bar and their trademark giant pink tree overhanging the space

the service is very good as well

4 x

Address: 10236 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review: the restaurants and bathrooms are very clean decor is incredibly cute and minimalist tastefully done fair warning the booths in the back arent well lit some outside paid street parking that is a bit scarce the playlist is fire as per the fianc√© and the affogato desert is enormous with quality espresso many vegan options and the chicken is amazing so juicy and well cooked loved the chicken satay and the pink daiquiri drink is highly recommended

Address: 10236 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review: great place good bang for buck staff were super friendly and helpful definitely glad to find this place especially for a late night bite to eat

Address: 10236 103 Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0Y8 Canada
Review:
exceptional food and location beautiful decor and grilled meats it was super hot when we went is the only reason why atmosphere wouldve been higher as it seemed their ac may not have been working
definitely worth checking out

Address: 5842 111 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6H 3G1 Canada
Review:
one of the best places around the glass monkey is a wonderful place to have dinner
the staff are amasing and all hard working and polite very kid friendly and i saw 4 tonight the place is hidden around a corner with a visible banner out the front and a rotating sign out the very front of the mall love the place and have been there almost 10 times so far love the food i usually order something from the feature menu or the burger the potato skins were delicious and so was the seafood chowder
will continue to visit this place as it is close and a wonderful little gem of a restraunt

Address: 5842 111 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6H 3G1 Canada
Review: ive known about this restaurant for ages would have never been its one of the best restaurants ive ever been too  great food amazing atmosphere  and the best part knowledge and non scripted service

Address: 5842 111 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6H 3G1 Canada
Review:
kaitlin was superb and gave me awesome service

one of the best patios rob and jennine are the most fantastic owners and always treat us like family

would always recommend and keep coming back

Address: 5842 111 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6H 3G1 Canada
Review:
its a cute restaurant in the neighborhood that the quality of food and nice services are guaranteed its got that unique local friendliness all staff were super friendly and nice including those who answered our phone who sat us and who served us we were very happy about the menu our server rick recommended and services he provided i am pregnant and wanted to have some nice virgin cocktail other than mojito and he offered sangria that is substituted with pomegranate juice and oh boy it was delicious
also all the food we ordered were delicious you must try their mushroom pizza the taste of the fresh ingredients with a touch of truffle oil was great the pate and halibut fish cake were also great
they have a nicely set up patio that we want to try next time we originally went there to sit in their patio but we decided to stay inside since the inside set up was also very romantic and came with more comfy chairs

Address: 5842 111 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6H 3G1 Canada
Review:
great wine selection and super friendly staff great food i ordered their lamb shank and it was so really good lamb was juicy and had amazing flavors highly recommend this place

went there again on wednesday and this time i had half price wings and ordered the fish entree totally enjoyed my food amazing experience staff is so friendly and polite makes you feel so welcomed at this place

Address: 10704 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H1 Canada
Review:
chill atmosphere great place to hang out on a warm day and have some great food and drinks

chicken was hot crispy on the outside and moist inside

the mac and cheese was amazing definitely understand why it won awards

we went on a wednesday which has 2 pieces of chicken

loved the experience will go again

Address: 10704 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H1 Canada
Review: amazing food amazing service this was my first time at northern chicken and it did not disappoint the chicken was the crispiest and tastiest ive ever had in my life the dorito mac and cheese was life changing and the smashed potatoes were unbelievably good we had the buttermilk pie for desert and i cant believe how delicious such a simple thing can be every moment of my visit was amazing i cant wait to go back dont miss out on eating at this gem of a place

Address: 10704 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H1 Canada
Review: came here for lunch the chicken was super tender and juicy and the smashed potatos were awesome if i had to point anything out itd be the coleslaw isnt anything special other than that i had a good meal here

Address: 10704 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H1 Canada
Review: great local spot huge delicious portions local beer on tap and super friendly service have ordered take out and table service here great service each time

Address: 10704 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H1 Canada
Review:
chef youve outdone yourself once again  i said in my tweet i was bringing nothing but my appetite and credit card  this wasnt exactly correct  i brought a buddy and introduced him to the best fried chicken north of guss  im happy to report that you have a new customer

the chicken was as juicy and tender as ever but the coating was insert chefs kiss emoji here  my appetite was more than satisfied and so was that of the other fried chicken lovers that i brought the extra 10 pieces home for

sorry about the photoshould have a made a proper one

Address: 10586 100 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2R6 Canada
Review: i visited this restaurant first time the food and service are good here staffs were nice you have to mix your own recipe sauce to eat with hotpot this place is one of the best hotpots ive ever been in the city just combo is enough for you

Address: 10586 100 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2R6 Canada
Review: the food and service are great here their late night menu is a great deal for a late night snack

Address: 10586 100 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2R6 Canada
Review: this restaurant has changed from being a very crammed and humid place to a much better ventilated dining spot over the years they have decent quality and and a nice selection of food they also provide quite a bit for their lunch special and sometimes they offer dessert for free however there was an incident where a friend found a fly in her veggie 25 years back were unsure if the fly didnt get wash out of the vegetable or if it flew into the soupbut they offered her a free lunch

Address: 10586 100 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2R6 Canada
Review: staff were nice and accommodating although they forgot to give us out some of our stuff this place is one of the best hotpots ive ever been in the city a little bit pricey but you get to eat all you can overall great experience

Address: 10586 100 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2R6 Canada
Review: first time at a hot pot portions were large overall it was alright decor was out dated but seeming clean will go back to try other options for the dinner 5 item special as the lobster balls and shrimp were so so

Address: 10408 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z3 Canada
Review:
visit july 2023 january 2023 december 2022

july 2023 got the curry chicken rice bowl it was okay i wasnt really blown away by the flavours and likely wouldnt get it again there was a bogo on bubble teas so i got a strawberry panna cotta with 30 sugar definitely not sweet enough and i dont like really sweet drinks and the salted egg yolk milk tea very unique flavours

i love dagu rice noodle they have a lot of great soup dishes and sides if you go there you know youll be full when you leave

when they had the offer for a vip card i knew i had to get it and it was a good call for sure

their prices are very good for what you get and on mondays they have 1 skewers which is pretty awesome

their soups are very flavourful and they dont skimp out on the ingredients theres also unlimited noodles so you can eat to your hearts content

overall love dagu and i usually think about coming back whenever im downtown

Address: 10408 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z3 Canada
Review:
came here for lunch first impression of the restaurant is very spacious clean and newly renovated

ordered tomato soup based noodles soup it was delicious the tomato soup based is very thick and rich there are a lot of spices and tomatoes in the soup has the right flavour

service was not attentive i had to wait a while before they seated even theres no one waiting in line and less than 5 tables with 3 servers

Address: 10408 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z3 Canada
Review:
amazing and delicious rice noodles fried chicken and bubble tea 55

not only does dagu rice noodle offer unique noodle dishes not found in many other stores in edmonton but the consistency and quality of the noodles and the flavour of the broth is unmatched its very fun to come with family and friends and spend time dipping the different ingredients in the hot stone bowl

other items on the menu i would definitely recommend are the salted egg bubble tea i know but trust me it will blow your mind and the fried chicken

the staff are also very friendly so i have become a repeat customer

Address: 10408 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z3 Canada
Review:
my go to bubble tea place they use all the real fruits drinks are not overly sweet

mango sunrise is my favourite drink i can have it everyday all of their drinks are between 68

check out uber eats as they offer discounts often

Address: 10408 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5J 1Z3 Canada
Review:
weve been here a few times and im glad the food is still very good but service seems to have come down quite a bit it took a long time to get the food and it was always very difficult to get the waitresses attention

aside from the service issue we started with the pigs feet which was delicious personally this is not a dish i enjoy due to the many bones but it was very authentic to the real stuff in china and the sichuan pepper flavour was spot on definitely a great choice if looking for the real deal

for the noodles i had the tomato crossing the bridge which was delicious its not spicy at all but the flavour of the booth is amazing all of the crossing the bridge noodles come with a side tray of vegetables and if you get the beef slices or other meats they come on the tray like in a hot pot i get the meatballs though instead which are really nice and they come directly in the soup the other soup we had was the fish one which again the soup was amazing

the noodles are technically all you can eat but the bowls are so large you dont really need a second bowl of noodles and they dont actually taste like anything for us its all about the broths their bubble teas are also very good but take quite a while to be made so overall its worth it just dont go if in a rush

Address: 10923-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: i went for my cousins birthday and i love sushi so the food was great the fish was super fresh and melted in your mouth my one problem was the slow service that night due to cov 19 they reduce the staff which make sense but to have one waiter on staff come on even so i still had a grand time and had the best beer ever

Address: 10923-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: this is by far the freshest sushi in the city  i have never had a bad experience  when we are able to eat in the restaurant the staff is always amazing  cant wait to eat in restaurant again  the atmosphere is always pleasant  highly recommended

Address: 10923-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: glad to see this place reopened with new owner and brand new menu their ramen is superb rich tasty broth and tender chashu dont really feel thirsty after drinking the soup so i guess as they said no msg added girl friends ordered some sushi and they are delicious and cute too love this place service was good too planning to try their donburi next time

Address: 10923-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: kiwado is an amazing japanese restaurant the service was excellent and prompt and the food came quite quickly i thoroughly enjoyed the takoyaki and would happily have it again as an appetizer the tonkotsu ramen was unreal the broth was super flavourful and unlike anything i have ever had before the pork was delicious and the entire dish was filling and delicious i am tempted to try something else on my next visit but the tonkotsu ramen was just so good they also gave us free mango pudding on the house which was also excellent i highly recommend coming here

Address: 10923-101 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review:
ive always wanted to try out this restaurant but every time i try theyre always closed but today i finally had the chance and boy it did not disappoint

 m  e  n  u 

 sampler salad
 gyoza
 tonkotsu ramen 
 ta lo men kiwado special ramen
 kiwado roll
 lobster roll 
 tuna toro sashimi tuna belly 

the tonkotsu ramen and lobster blew my mind although for the lobster roll you have to pay a lil extra but i didnt mind the jawdropping dish that had me salavating from first bite was the toro sashimi melts in your mouth foodgasm

the staff went beyond as well we came around 130 in the afternoon a little bit close to their closing time around 230 but i wasdesperate to try it out once we were done they complimented us with a free dessert we were very satisfied and relaxed we didnt even notice that we over stayed waaaay past 230 but they didnt rush us whatsoever it was our bad but they didnt even bat an eyelash i will be coming back here but hopefully i wont over stay as i feel bad for the staff that had to do overtime

thank you for the hospitality and fine cuisine see you next time

Address: 10181 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review:
went here for lunch on canada day with some italian friends it was perfect as its not crowded of course who can suggest the best food to try but  my italian friends themselves so we had the arancini siciliano as appetizer the italian rice balls was cooked in perfection crispy outside and so yummy inside with or without the dip then came the ravioli con aragosta i ordered man i was in love at first sight just the way the ravioli looks my eyes already told me its delicious the pasta is stuffed and cut neatly and looked very fresh and as i taste it wow my eyes didnt lie to me al dente as it should be the  pasta didnt overpower the umaminess of the lobster the sauce has the lobster juice that makes it heavenly mmmm
my friends had the duck confit gnocchi and bresaola  arugula pizza and they said it was great too i had a bite each mmmm yeah it was yummy too but im proud to review my ravioli maybe next time i come back and really have the gnocchi and pizza for myself we ordered the tiramisu for dessert it was really good but its not like the traditional tiramisu we know and my friends make
im going to visit italy in sept and would be looking for these dishes as well

Address: 10181 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review: came in for dinner with a small group the service was mediocre at best felt a bit neglected by the server we had a selection of cocktails which were tasty the food was tasty but in my opinion overpriced

Address: 10181 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review: everything was delicious  had some appetizers to share for a nice lunch  food was fresh and hot and were good serving sizes  a definite visit again  restaurant was properly respectful of the social distancing rules and the staff was appropriately geared  waitress was friendly and attentive  love the new sidewalk patio its a wonderful touch to the general downtown atmosphere

Address: 10181 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review: this was my first time and i quite enjoyed the food and the portion was a lottt i wasnt particularly impressed with the wait time considering the restaurant was relatively empty when i arrived although it filled out subsequently

Address: 10181 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5J 0Z9 Canada
Review: we had a fabulous dinner at bottega 104 in downtown edmonton  the restaurant has a very positive vibe  tables are nicely spaced with modern furniture  the staff is friendly and welcoming  service is appropriately attentive  the great atmosphere is matched by the quality of the food  each dish is well prepared and presented  the flavour is magnificent  overall a fantastic dinning experience  highly recommended

Address: 10939-101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: never had northern chinese food before before coming here it was a very satisfying experience and this became a frequently visited restaurant the dumplings here are probably the best in edmonton their fried dough was also quite good and the salty tofu was an interesting experience

Address: 10939-101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: this place has the best chinese long donuts in the city they are freshly made and when it comes out they are so fluffy without any trace of baking soda or  ammonia bicarbonate taste the pork and vegetable dumplings are very good too customer service is lacking other than that its a great place for long donuts dumplings and handmade noodles soup

Address: 10939-101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review:
i always come here for breakfast if you wanna try authentic chinese style breakfast this is the place to go
the only downside is their waitresses are so unprofessional they always make mistakes taking our orders one time they spilled half of the soup out when they were packing up noodles another time they mixed up our packtogo with someone elses we didnt check until we got home so of course we ended up throwing everything away
it is really frustrating after a couple times hopefully they can hire someone more reliable

Address: 10939-101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: food was 100 northern chinese food they offer breakfast food including chinese donuts sweet soy milk and tofu jelly they also have fresh made dumplings and baozi i would definitely go back

Address: 10939-101 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 2S7 Canada
Review: try the handmade green onion cake so flaky and tender

Address: 5324 75 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6S4 Canada
Review:
i met up with a couple of friends at loft thai for dinner recently none of us have been there before but we heard it was very good and that its quite small inside so we made reservations the restaurant has 6 tables inside and was very clean and tidy our waitress was very attentive and friendly and offered up some suggestions for dishes to try

we started off with some spring rolls which were quite delicious and perfectly cooked there were 5 spring rolls in total two of us ordered the pad thai and the other ordered the chicken cashew nut we all enjoyed our meals but also commented that it wasnt anything special i know ive had better pad thai elsewhere but this was still very delicious

id definitely return again to try some of their other dishes like either the thai green curry or the thai red curry with their coconut rice as well as the zap wings which also sounded interesting

Address: 5324 75 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6S4 Canada
Review:
great authentic thai ingredients and preparation presentation is nice flavours are rich

give it a try duck confit is a must

place could use a little better work on the tables and utensils being sanitized and residue free

Address: 5324 75 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6S4 Canada
Review: this time not so good the curry pesto has no curry and no pesto taste to it just some heat hummm

Address: 5324 75 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6S4 Canada
Review: one of best ambience restaurant in edmonton great for friends meeting good try with curry beef pad thai mussel soup small restaurant but good enough for clean tasty and have a great night with friends and family

Address: 5324 75 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6S4 Canada
Review:
really good food i ordered a rama salad with salmon it was really good the peanut ginger dressing was so good my friends ordered from there lunch menu and everyone liked there food i highly recommend their coconut rice
one more thing if you planning to go there for lunch dont be surprised by long wait ad the place is small and is super packed

Address: 10522 124 St Edmonton, AB T5N 1R9 Canada
Review: our first time at may on 124st i had the harissa tomatoes which was delicious it had a nice kick and the basted eggs were perfectly cooked i highly recommend if you like a spicy dish my wife had chorizo verde bowl which she  loved they create amazing flavours using fresh locally sourced ingredients i should also mention that the service was top notch  well definitely be back to try more of the menu items

Address: 10522 124 St Edmonton, AB T5N 1R9 Canada
Review: amazing chef bri makes her mark with stand out dishes full of flavor and creativity the rolls mushrooms romaine and pork chop were stand outs if youre looking to support local eat well and leave satisfied this is your go to edmonton

Address: 10522 124 St Edmonton, AB T5N 1R9 Canada
Review: visiting from out of town we were looking for a spot to rest our feet and fill our stomachs  may was the perfect place for this the service was warm and friendly the food added to the service as it was fresh and thoughtful each dish we tried felt and tasted intentional we left feeling renewed and eager to come back additionally the prices were really good for the quality of food that we received

Address: 10522 124 St Edmonton, AB T5N 1R9 Canada
Review:
delicious food and awesome service if you like pork you should definitely try the pork belly featuring now the risotto is also a great option specifically with the braised ribs i also loved their pickle caesar

generous portions and lots of flavour will definitely come back

Address: 10522 124 St Edmonton, AB T5N 1R9 Canada
Review:
opened only a few months ago at the end of 2021 this restaurant is still not that busy  id like to keep this as my own secret but at the same time i want it to also be successful and sustainable

this super cool ambient upscale dining spot is attached to the art gallery lots of concrete in the infrastructure and beautiful paintings adorn the walls

we have been here on both new years for brunch and this past weekend for dinner their food is contemporary fusion with some asian flair  its become one of our faves in yeg and we have a big list of establishments in town  the food is creative fresh and the room has such a good mood

make a visit you wont regret it

addendum have dropped the food rating to a four star the quality seems to have changed somewhat in recent months with the departure of their precious chef neverthelessstill worth a visit

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review:
incredible food i had the nuevo burrito wasnt a hand held which took me by surprise but the flavour was incredible i can honestly say this was one of the best meals of my life the flavour combination was perfectly balanced the menu and selection is not only organic and has lots of vegan options but is also really good made it hard to choose what to eat
highly recommend
great price for the quality you get the proportions are perfect musics good here to staff was incredible too

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review:
this review is based off a visit on 05032023 and again on 05042023 also it was brought to my attention i posted this review for the wrong oeb location how lucky for edmontonians that you have three oebs to choose from

i live in toronto and unless youre willing to stand in line for hours on a weekend or manage to go on a weekday you cannot get into the oeb in liberty village so believe me when i tell you i was thrilled to discover an oeb in edmonton during a recent visit

my experience was so good on visit number one we visited again the very next day

first of all the restaurant styling and theme is impeccable truly a gorgeous space with a clearly defined brand identity

second the service is amazing on both occasions we were greeted and seated promptly and our servers on each visit were bubbly friendly knowledgable about the menu and attentive without being overbearing

im normally a sweets for breakfast kind of person but i couldnt resist the idea of a breakfast carbonara i was not disappointed with my choice the gnocchi was perfectly plush surrounded by hearty chunks of bacon and topped with a gorgeously orange fresh egg yolk every bite was perfection and i could have eaten three more servings

on visit two i reverted back to my old habits and ordered the french toast trifle another delicious choice featuring two slices of thick brioche topped with a tart lemon curd fresh strawberries and toasted meringues no need to add syrup

the only downside of my visit to oeb is that we didnt have time in our trips schedule to visit a third time

overall

pros
 gorgeous and quaint restaurant with amazing decor and design choices
 incredibly friendly and helpful staff
 wide variety of choices from savoury to sweet to please all taste buds
 fresh ingredients combined in creative ways

cons
 paid street or parkade parking only

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review: first time going  was not disappointed at all  we are from out of town and the reviews kept popping up every time we were searching for best places to eat in edmonton  we have been trying to come a number of times we ended up going to the city centre kelly ramsay in edmonton food was absolutely stellar and on the healthy side for a breakfast place  service was quick and top knotch  all the servers helped each other out  justin and sydney were excellent  all the staff were happy positive smiling and personable  they kept us topped up with everything  they use umbria coffee roasters which is of superb quality  and we are fairly picky with our food  we almost always wont post negative reviews but will only post the best of the best thank you oeb staff  we will be back our new go to breakfast place in the city

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review: ambiance and service were great my blue crab benny was really good but it was quite fishy tasting so beware if you dont like strong fishy flavors its a bit too much for me personally would definitely go back to try other items on the menu

Address: 10174 100A Street Edmonton, AB T5J 0H3 Canada
Review:
avoid

visiting edmonton and spotted the reviews for this location so took a chance

party of two we were greeted well as a walk in and promptly seated the location was busy for a saturday morning as to be expected and was well lit with refreshing colours and seating staff was very kind and friendly

the food however was mediocre to gross my partner ordered the ham with eggs sourdough bread and potatoe wedges which came as ordered and was a typical ham and egg breakfast though at an elevated price so it goes
