i went in with breakfast brunch in mind they serve breakfast options all day amazing hard to find in edmonton once i got there and looked more at the menu i had a lot of trouble deciding against my idea of getting breakfast or not there were so many delicious options i ordered the bacon brioche sandwich it did not disappoint i highly recommend this sandwich but i do warn you it is messy i will be returning asap to try some nonbreakfast options and for sure will be returning for breakfastbrunch as well the owner was great to chat with very welcoming and personable neat and unique atmosphere with all the tables and walls covered in sharpie art 
no need to dress fancy xd

Address: 10933 - 120 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 3R3 Canada
Review: the service here was really good atmosphere was fun you can draw on the tables and walls i had the diner burger and poutine my husband had a breakfast burger and my daughter had the chicken burger for our taste we found the gravy too salty however if you like salty gravy this is the place for you i may come back and try something else however i made a poor choice of getting the diner burger since it also has gravy on it whoops id recommend sticking to one item with gravy for your first visit and again service was great everyone was super friendly

Address: 10933 - 120 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 3R3 Canada
Review:
gravy is the old local omnivore in the queen mary park area in a new modern hip building they serve up incredibly creative and innovative burgers and fries as local omnivore used to so delicious

the space is wild with graffiti all over the walls that have been written by the customers what a vibe

and the service is outstanding the guys are so friendly

all around 5 x

Address: 10933 - 120 Street Edmonton, AB T5H 3R3 Canada
Review:
it must have been an off night the burgers were both so salty  the regular hamburger had so much burger sauce that it was pouring out

the slushies tasted exactly the same  the orange had no hint of citrus both tasted like the blue raspberry

hopefully my next experience will be better

Address: 8712 150 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 5Y2 Canada
Review:
we have dinner today the plates are well served and delicious  i had tokansu cordon blue pizza the meat was tender and crispy outside
the ratio price quality is perfect
the server is very polite and attentive
the place is nicely decorated
its a good place to have dinner with friends

Address: 8712 150 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 5Y2 Canada
Review: this place was recommended by a friend finally got to try it out and we like the food the tonkatsu and chicken katsu are both crispy and delicious paired with a light salad is a good combo

Address: 8712 150 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 5Y2 Canada
Review:
nara is amazing i highly recommend everyone to come here ive had the chicken katsu and the beef bulgogi with noodles before i had the beef bulgogi with noodles today and i was very satisfied with the portion and the taste

there is something for everyone here and the price is well worth it

5 stars

Address: 8712 150 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 5Y2 Canada
Review: absolutely amazing super friendly staff and delicious food i highly recommend the curry tonkatsu and the bulgogi fries

Address: 8712 150 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 5Y2 Canada
Review: i placed an order for pick up few minutes later they contacted me to let me know that the potato korokke is sold out i said it was fine the lady replaced it ttkeboki and 2 bulgogi korokke instead i was blown away awesome service i ordered 2 cheese tonkatsu and omgggg its amazing

Address: 10969 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2P7 Canada
Review: cozy place to have dinner we had their giant grouper special  a veggie dish and the peach shrimp peach shrimp sauce wise is a bit dry but the shrimp was fresh the giant grouper combo was fresh and well made into a soup and our choices of stir fry  soy bean sauce steamed overall impressed with our meal would come again

Address: 10969 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2P7 Canada
Review: food is excellent  family owned and operated so all the comments about service relax enjoy the food and experience traditional chinese cooking if you want fast id recommend panda express

Address: 10969 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2P7 Canada
Review: they raise their own ducks for peking duck we ordered the peking duck set and it was the right amount for 5 adults and 2 kids

Address: 10969 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2P7 Canada
Review: great place for chinese food d

Address: 10969 98 St NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2P7 Canada
Review: the food was amazing i loved their won ton soup will be back for sure

Address: 12411 Stony Plain Road Edmonton, AB T5N 3N3 Canada
Review:
food atmosphere amazing service
jorge was absolutely wonderful and takes pride in his service  my food hit the spot in a way a home cooked meal does and the hot sauce was drool worthy it was worth the trip down 25 stars

Address: 12411 Stony Plain Road Edmonton, AB T5N 3N3 Canada
Review:
staff one server friendly family run business

service slow considering there were only 3 tables there at lunch time only one server but did not check in did not offer water or napkins etc

establishment nice central location parking in front or neighbouring streets

food the guacamole starter was delicious the tacos looked amazing  they just lacked some flavour i was expecting authentic mexican flavour but it was all very bland

Address: 12411 Stony Plain Road Edmonton, AB T5N 3N3 Canada
Review:
although the food was good it is quite pricey for the portion size im confused with the 15 thin slices of lime in addition to the single slice of radish 2 slices of cucumber for 7 tacos the guac and chips portion was also very small for 14 unfortunately i also think charging for every single thing like lime and sauces threw the experience off for me a bit due to the portions however i am cognizant the location may have played into the pricing

otherwise the atmosphere is pleasant and esthetically cute

Address: 12411 Stony Plain Road Edmonton, AB T5N 3N3 Canada
Review: beautiful atmosphere from the decor to the music this place is really sweet the al pastor taco was delicious highly recommend

Address: 12411 Stony Plain Road Edmonton, AB T5N 3N3 Canada
Review: frida urban taqueria is so good love the vibe in the restaurant started off with the guacamole and chips so flavourful and fresh then i had the gordita so flavourful wish i had more the carnitas tacos were to die for finally for dessert the churros were the best

Address: 16336 ‚Äì 111 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 4G3 Canada
Review:
i walked in with high expectations based on a rec from a client  service was friendly and prompt  definitely a nice chill vibe to the place 630pm on a tuesday afternoon

i ordered the smoked chicken with the lamplighter bbq sauce mashed potatoes coleslaw and cornbread  the entire meal was served to me in 7 minutes
thoroughly enjoyed the coleslaw and mashed the cornbread was a little too dense for my liking but very tasty  i found the smoked chicken to be very dry and i wasnt a huge fan of the bbq sauce  i also ordered their bluebeary ale which i would definitely have again

all in all next time im in town ill give it another try  based on other reviews im sure the other dishes on the menu are worth the try

Address: 16336 ‚Äì 111 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 4G3 Canada
Review:
visit april 2023
got the full platter and it fed 2 of us the food was pretty good though i found the chicken to be quite dry the sauces were also pretty tasty fries were well seasoned and very fresh the atmosphere was great and the staff was very friendly food was a little bit pricey for what i felt like we received but in the end we were relatively full

Address: 16336 ‚Äì 111 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 4G3 Canada
Review:
okay so a couple of my close friends and followers suggested i try this spot
as my rating goes this place has so much potential but it could be way better definitely wouldnt eat here again
the moistness of the meat and fall apart aspect of it 1010 the seasoning and flavour aspect 110 was not there was not giving

mac and cheese was a 010 was no flavour noodles werent even al dente they were hard

mashed potatoes 1010

the meat platter was 510
the five was the fall apart aspect and tenderness but the chicken was very dry
the sausage was amazing 

the barbecue sauces need to be blended a lot more if these are home made but as of those id give a solid 4

burnt ends 810 

brisket was 510

cornbread 1010

ribs 210 was not giving what it needed was very dry and lacked flavour

Address: 16336 ‚Äì 111 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 4G3 Canada
Review: amazing bbq place try the brisket it is everything i love about brisket meaty greasy rich and filling reasonable portions good beer menu and stunningly clean washrooms ill be back

Address: 16336 ‚Äì 111 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5M 4G3 Canada
Review: wow what a hidden delight found this place by mistake and so glad that we did my husband and i started with some burnt ends which i only got a picture of after we were halfway finished then we decided on the large smoked meat platter with sides of mac  cheese and dill pickle spears to share the platter came with a large serving of smoked pulled pork another large serving of smoked brisket a large piece of smoked chicken about 4 or 5 large smoked ribs a smoked sausage two pieces of cornbread and four bbq sauces along with our two sides that we ordered everything was delicious the coolest part was this was part of princess auto and the menu had a brief description of princess autos history on the top  so neat the atmosphere was a cozy industrial setting with lots of seating and the waitresses were friendly and attentive we will definitely be returning

Address: 10569 97th Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L7 Canada
Review:
my 2nd time here i came back because the food was excellent the 1st time however this experience was so bad i called at 430 for pickup and was told it would be ready at 530 upon arrival the only thing that was ready were 2 appetizers i ended up waiting until 630 i checked my order before the server packed it and 2 of the dishes were wrong then an argument ensued where i was told i had ordered red curry i ordered matsuman etc finally the server realized she was wrong and had to go back to the kitchen and reorder thus more waiting by the time i got the massaman curry everything else was ice cold and then when we started eating not only was everything cold all of it was disgusting overcooked mushy bland oily and 1 order was still wrong plus i paid extra for 2 coconut rice and got 2 steamed rice fried eggs mysteriously appeared on the 18 padkapow shrimp stir fry what a fiasco doubt i will be returning my observations while waiting were that the restaurant is lacking proper management the kitchen is understaffed the existing staff servers etc are not trained thus there is extremely poor efficiency
please see food photos 1  im not sure what this was supposed to be it was overcooked shrimp  chicken floating in oil 2 steamed rice 3 menu item 9 yum glass noodle salad with shrimp it had no onions or shrimp or dressing or peanut sauce dressing that is supposed to come with it 4 oily spring rolls 5 menu item 18 pad ka pow overcooked mushy and bland 6 matsuman curry this was good this cost me 100 plus i left a 20 tip very disappointing

Address: 10569 97th Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L7 Canada
Review: their soup was very good great service as well healthy portions as we had tons of left over

Address: 10569 97th Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L7 Canada
Review:
my first thai food experience was here at their previously smaller location in chinatown over ten years ago this location is much larger and beautifully decorated

it was great to see boualuong still in business after the pandemic where many others have not reopen they are a mom and pop shop who quietly work diligently over the years dishing out some amazing food tonight our group of friends had the privilege to enjoy another great spicy tom yum soup original pad thai without ketchup delicious green curry and a mango salad the food was amazing and the portions were generous

they were understaff with only one server but she and the owner were able to service our large group plus two other large tables with a smile grace and pride you would find in any south east asian home

when you walk around chinatown you know the struggle these restaurant owners are going through by me choosing to eat at this terrific restaurant despite what is going on in this neighborhood that should tell you how much i enjoy the experience of eating here

it is a gem for those who recognize this hole in the wall and it was busy as usual here at boualuong

Address: 10569 97th Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L7 Canada
Review: if i could give this place 10 stars i would the service the food out of this world laos and this food with so much flavor  i cant think of a more delicious restaurant

Address: 10569 97th Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L7 Canada
Review: i had a great experience eating here the green curry with the coconut rice was amazing and the gold bags were yummy yummy huge thank you to our server carmen she was extremely helpful and caring towards me and i will definitely be coming back

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review:
i came to this restaurant for lunch and it was an amazing experience we sat at the bar and were welcomed by our server working at the bar

service and atmosphere was amazing food was fairly good i highly recommend getting the chips and onion dip for the sides

we ordered the breakfast sandwich and their beef dip both without any cheese

food was good nothing too crazy next time i will definitely be trying their chicken sandwich because it looks amazing

overall a good place to try

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review:
pals is a really great spot their staff were super friendly and welcoming

the sandwiches were great the chicken sandwich and beef dip were both flavourful and made with quality ingredients the cheesy fries were also great and filling

the dill pickle soup was good but a bit too spicy its definitely worth a try if you like dill and spice

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: this was by far one of the best sandwiches weve had here in edmonton we tried both the cuban and the meatball sandwich the cuban was delicious with great toppings and the meat used was excellent the meatball sandwich was also one of the best ive had the meatballs were so good that i kinda wished they had spaghetti meatballs on the menu the only thing that could be better would be to use a smaller bread i found the bread too thick could have also used a bit of extra sauce the sandwiches were 19 with side fries the fries were also really good and a large portion too for me personally i dont like when the fries are unpeeled so i didnt eat all of them but they were still really good

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: first time customer  had to try their meatballs sub with house salad and saskatoon lemonade  presentation was spectacular waiting was very minimal and the experience was awesome  thank you robbie for providing a mouthwatering delicious product  a perfect lunch on a sunday  get their as i highly recommend it  again thanks robbie

Address: 10335 83 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T6E 2C6 Canada
Review: this is the place you go when youre seriously craving a good sandwich we ordered their cheese fries beef dip hoagie and smores pie we both tried their craft saskatoon lemonade they had a delicious soup of the day and their fries were solid the lighting was intimate as we came an hour before close our server was great and he was telling us how they make the bread soup and meats from scratch we were considering trying the reuben but they had run out of that and their foccacia earlier on that day we probably would ahve been more than fine just with soup and sandwich  but they did so well as leftovers looking forward to next time

Address: 8026 118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5B 0R8 Canada
Review:
good food and flavours a little bit pricey but still good to try their colombian and venezuelan dishes friendly staff and clean place
the bandeja paisa is big and worthy the beef soup is a little bit expensive for the size and i was expecting a stronger flavour the teque√±os were too salty i have tried them before there but this time was way too much salty the empanadas are delicious and their salsas are marvellous

Address: 8026 118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5B 0R8 Canada
Review: this was my first time trying venezuelan food and it was extremely delicious  we had the arepas which were stuffed full and topped with cheese  the service was excellent and by the time we had finished paying the table had been cleared and sanitized

Address: 8026 118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5B 0R8 Canada
Review:
i been here about 4 times i always get the tripe soup its really good staff are always nice to me

something about that soup i just love and staff are always nice

Address: 8026 118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5B 0R8 Canada
Review: this place is wonderful the food is delicious the sauces unbelievably tasty the service is friendly and nearly everything is gluten free thank goodness for serendipity  we found it quite by accident gracias a d√≠os

Address: 8026 118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5B 0R8 Canada
Review: excellent service very clean and the food was so tasty  the arepas and fried cassava are a must try and the platter can easily feed 45 people

Address: 21F Kingsway Garden Mall NW Edmonton, AB T5G 3A6 Canada
Review: awful i  had food from here years ago and was quite good i honestly cant believe how bad it was 2 days ago a piece of soggy skinned chicken that was undercooked so i couldnt eat it cabbage rolls were dried right out and had a taste i cant identify i ate 2 perogies off my almost 15 dollar plate so disappointing as i had a quick craving for ukrainian food never again ill make my own

Address: 21F Kingsway Garden Mall NW Edmonton, AB T5G 3A6 Canada
Review: i used to live in edmonton and my friends and i were talking about our favourite restaurants when i brought up shumka everyone agreed i lived on jasper ave and had to take 3 buses to get there but it was well worth it now i live in the us and it would be several more buses id have to take but ill tell ya what it would be worth it the food is delicious abundant and fresh someone is using their babas recipes and it shows

Address: 21F Kingsway Garden Mall NW Edmonton, AB T5G 3A6 Canada
Review: definitely could be better or easier ordering wise but the nice lady helped me through and the food was delicious especially after only having the typical fast food for the past week went back for seconds highly recommend

Address: 21F Kingsway Garden Mall NW Edmonton, AB T5G 3A6 Canada
Review:
came here this morning and got 4 items i really enjoyed and lady was very nice to me i been here many times and i always enjoyed it

i liked the sausage and cabbage roll

Address: 21F Kingsway Garden Mall NW Edmonton, AB T5G 3A6 Canada
Review: grew up on ukrainian food and this is a sad attempt at it confusing order options and maybe using cheemo perogies sausage also wasnt very good not at all happy with this whole experience and wouldnt order again

Address: 10416 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A2 Canada
Review: we went for drinks on a holiday weekend afternoon the place wasnt too packed we were sat right away the waitress was very polite and checked in frequently i had the chicken and waffles it was delicious opt for tater tots as your side instead of fries you wont be disappointed

Address: 10416 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A2 Canada
Review:
i had amazing baked salmon cake
it was way better than i expected but it could be little spicy for some people the sauce was very tasty too
my sister had chocolate cake and she said it was one of the best chocolate cake she ever had
i wanted patio seat but it was too hot today so if ill visit here again to sit at the patio

Address: 10416 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A2 Canada
Review:
great spot  the menu has great options and the service is great  if the oilers are playing it will be on live
i like kick in my food but for most it would be a 5  the caesar salad i had was above average and thats always a good thing

Address: 10416 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A2 Canada
Review:
food was ok best food super bowl  ceasar sald fantastic 
jack fruit sandwich   french fries too much salt
great server

Address: 10416 82 Avenue Edmonton, AB T6E 2A2 Canada
Review: my wife and i decided to try malt  mortar for our date night we were greeted immediately by our server jeffrey he was attentive helpful with advice and opinions and friendly i had the blackened chicken sandwich which absolutely delicious my wife had the chicken and waffles which she thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere was pleasant and the beer selection was top notch would highly recommend this establishment to anyone and will definitely be returning in the future 10 out of 10

Address: 10004 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1R3 Canada
Review: fantastic place to eat after a long day service was so kind and friendly and the food was fantastic with great portions highly recommend

Address: 10004 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1R3 Canada
Review:
there are no burgers here craft beers at a 16oz can be found  it is pricey here the new 22 plate is the old 15 dollar plate

reservation made although we were missed on the first drink order as another table sat down after us and had their drink order taken before ours which we sat 5mins before them me a bit like okay thats why i do reviews

food seems or actually is very tasty made to perfection  portion sizes well small the tenderloin buttery soft to cut with a butter knife  jamaican curry goat flavourful but small 34 pieces of goat noticed  duck wings seemed dry but is that normal for duck wings they did have flavour just had that dry bone and flavour to them

beer  well a great selection of crafts at a 16oz pour

women will love this place guys will walk away with i wish they had more food options take your dare here but keep your own guy thoughts to yourself and move on for guys

Address: 10004 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1R3 Canada
Review:
what a place they make almost everything on their menu inhouse with exception to some ice cream flavours which means everything you eat from the bread to the sauces to the green onion cakes are all made here
the food is mouthwatering just from reading the menu and every bite is so good that we wound up licking the plates emphasis on plates we came in for just a snack and wound up ordering more than we bargained for
there are also a diverse amount of local canadian brewed drinks great sour and porter menus and various flight options to choose from

theyre coming up on their 10 year anniversary and have truly mastered their crafts 100 recommend popping in any time for a delightful experience

Address: 10004 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1R3 Canada
Review:
potentially the greatest bar experience ive ever had wasnt sure what to expect from this literally underground tap but they had amazing tasting beer from places throughout canada impeccable appetizers delicious meals and decadent desserts our host was super nice and even helped with some tough decisions on picking the best options
1010 will visit again

Address: 10004 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 1R3 Canada
Review: went for some dinner and drinks after work before a show and had a good time the beer menu is extensive and had local options as well as other canadian craft brewers i had the ahi tuna bowl as a main which was tasty as well as a poutine and nachos to start the thursday special was nachos for 10 which was a good deal as they were quite big and very tasty our waiter was nice but told us some misleading info about happy hour but nothing major he said all beers were 6 when it is really only select beers for that price overall a good experience at a downtown pub

Address: 3440 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 5X5 Canada
Review: got there right when it opened at noon already a line to get in which is a good sign a large selection of items we ordered the sliced noodles with beef rolling noodles in sour and spicy soup with pork and the hand pulled noodles with beef and beef bone soup the noodles were excellent quality and taste but the beef bone broth was basic if not a bit bland the braised beef pieces were perfectly tender it was the lunch rush and orders were slow coming out of the kitchen and mistimed at tables service was adequate

Address: 3440 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 5X5 Canada
Review: i havent been to northern china but now i am sure i could eat there very happily  they gave a free can of pop as it was their anniversary  the noodles were delicious chewy noodles with savoury pork in chile sauce clearly a solid dish enjoyed by millions it was perfection the dumplings felt handmade the wrap was thick enough to feel like i was eating noodles with the pork the pork burger was a surprise hit full of flavour and the bun looked thick but surprisingly light clearly handmade  dont expect great service its not about show here its clearly about the food i wouldnt want it any other way great pricing

Address: 3440 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 5X5 Canada
Review: delicious fresh homemade noodles that are bursting with flavour and legitly authentic northern chinese noodles there is no fusion here this is as pure as it gets

Address: 3440 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 5X5 Canada
Review:
visit february 2023

been wanting to visit noodle feast for a very long time and finally had the chance i was hoping to get the hand pulled noodles but having arrived around an hour before closing they were sold out 

instead i got the cumin fried sliced noodles with beef the dish was quite good and flavourful i just feel like there was a little bit too much grease for myself personally my other friends did not have this issue

the restaurant and food had an authentic feel to it which was nice

ill have to go back to try more food there

Address: 3440 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 5X5 Canada
Review: visited edmonton over the weekebd and decided to have some noodle for lunch great authentic dinning experience showed up at opening hour and already a hugh lineup ahead of us waiting i remembered it was just like that 10 years ago when they first opened up hard to believe they are still popular like this nowadays

Address: 3735 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review: beautiful spot with delicious food not only does the place look nice but the food is super tasty and delicious staff were friendly and ready to server at a moments notice great customer service one of the best food ive tasted and will definitely come back

Address: 3735 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review: ordered take out first time ever since moving from toronto this has got to be my first time experiencing good korean food thank you for the delicious food will def order again soon

Address: 3735 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review:
my recent dining experience at hanjans south location was pleasant as soon as we entered we were welcomed and seated within a few minutes into the tastefully patiolike decorated ambiance with string lights and dimmed lighting

the menu was extensive with a variety of vegetarian options available that were just as tasty as the nonvegetarian ones look at the online menu for vegan options personally i would recommend their spicy rice cake which consisted of chewy rice cakes and fish tofu the crispy tofu with soyginger sauce is also a musttry option on their vegan online menu

i also ordered a london fog tea it was fragrant and soothing with the perfect blend of earl grey tea vanilla and steamed milk i couldnt go without trying their mango bingsu it comes with a copious amount of sweet and juicy mangoes stacked over a bed of shaved ice and topped with condensed milk its perfect for anyone with a sweet tooth the only downside of my experience was that at times i felt rushed by the service merely from the number of times the waisterwaitresses visited my table

Address: 3735 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review:
visit april 2023

visited hanjan for a party the staff was quick and accommodating the restaurant is also very nice and has great vibes with nice decor that is very comforting

shared a lot of food between 3 of us
 kimchi fried rice is pretty standard good flavour not a ton of meat but price wise its pretty decent
 bulgogi fries are amazing fries are very fresh the sauce has good depth and pairs well with the meat highly recommend this as a appetizer
 grilled pork belly was good as well when it comes to pork belly this is one of the better places ive had it the pieces are marinated and grilled well theres a good amount there as well for the price got the full size order
 they provide sides as well which include kimchi bean sprouts pickled radish and a mashed potato these pair well with some of the dishes
 bulgogi udon is pretty standard too like the kimchi fried rice nothing too special here but the noodles are cooked well and are flavourful with hints of beef
 army stew budae jjigae i love army stew and this one is pretty good as well they include instant noodles which is a nice touch good amount of meat in the mix too but wish there was more tofu
 cheese corn was alright for some reason i tasted a bit of mexican spicesflavours in there which threw me off a little
 tequila shots patron was surprisingly well priced in restsurantbar standards at 4 a shot was smooth going down too

overall everything above split between 3 people was about 48 before tip which is pretty good considering what we got

the prices here are a bit higher than other korean restaurants ive been to but is still quite good in general and i find myself coming back from time to time

Address: 3735 99 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6E 6J7 Canada
Review:
the ambiance is great the servers were friendly beef bulgogi was good and as per my son the rice is great until they served us our most awaited fried chicken only to find out it was partially cooked i think its a cardinal rule to all restaurants to make sure the chicken is well cooked to prevent spread of diseases such as salmonella i was surprised and disappointed that they forgot about this this is just a big no
this happened during mothers day dinner and it seems like they werent prepared enough to how busy it will get they should have anticipated it and not compromise the quality and safety of the food they serve

Address: 16518 100 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5P 4Y2 Canada
Review: we had dinner on a sunday and i would say coming in an hour before closing will be a tight call it got busy but 1020 minutes wait is manageable as long as youre not hungry by far i love their service very friendly staffs even love their menus first time trying their japanese cream soda and it was just ok ordered to satisfy our curiosity their soups as always are superb very filling and served in a big bowl ill keep coming back here price is reasonable too for the quantity and quality clean restaurant as well

Address: 16518 100 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5P 4Y2 Canada
Review:
not bad tonkotsu ramen

the noodles were good the meat was tasty but broth wasnt up to par

the broth wasnt bad per say it could have been much better but it was ruined due to the abundance of beansprouts
every sip is an aftertaste of beansprouts

theyre also pretty cheap on toppings the pork only had two thin slices and egg was only half of one for this price
the only generous topping was beansprouts which again i say ruined the broth

however the resturant eastern atmosphere is very nice along with anime songs blasting definitely how i would like to eat my ramen

Address: 16518 100 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5P 4Y2 Canada
Review: food was great but it definitely seemed like they were understaffed as it took a really long time to be seated and have our order taken i do recommend trying the ramen here people were getting pretty upset about the wait time so that had an impact on the atmosphere but i do think in normal circumstances when they are fully staffed that it would be a good atmosphere i really like the decorations and you get sesame to grind up and put in your ramen which is cool

Address: 16518 100 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5P 4Y2 Canada
Review: my husband and i loved our first visit here we went right at the opening on a saturday and the single front of house staff was amazing we were seated right away along with the other 1015 customers and received our food within 10 minutes we had the fried dumplings to start and both a bowl of ramen the dishes were delicious and we will definitely go back to try more of their soups

Address: 16518 100 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5P 4Y2 Canada
Review: the service is good atmosphere is 35 food is 25 although the service staff was friendly and fast i dont believe the food is up to par and the food is expensive for the portions you get

Address: 10712 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 2A7 Canada
Review: came here from reading all the great reviews online its good definitely a historic eatery in edmonton walls are lined with articles photos and lots of memorabilia definitely dig the old school vibe the service is topnotchstaff is friendly and welcoming food and the value are decent was expecting bigger portions but the prices are inexpensive definitely worth a visit for the americans the sign says they take discover card but mine was declined

Address: 10712 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 2A7 Canada
Review: absolutely amazing food and service here very cool atmosphere old school diner feel the servers are awesome my server both times was angie and shes so friendly and great customer service very authentic

Address: 10712 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 2A7 Canada
Review: an edmonton institution its a classic sort of diner that offers basic breakfast and lunch options for some of the lowest prices youll see these days although the prices have gone up along with everything else postpandemic i love the vibes here very unpretentious and welcoming place and they offer some kitschy but entertaining musical acts on the weekends i feel like more of a true edmontonian now that ive visited the commodore

Address: 10712 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 2A7 Canada
Review:
our favourite greasy spoon it took a while but dave the cookowner got my brekkie absolutely perfect and im picky lol

angie is our favourite server in the city and always makes us feel special everyone needs to eat at this time capsule

Address: 10712 Jasper Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5J 2A7 Canada
Review: love this place they had music playing when i went for lunch on a saturday afternoon and the musician was really good i had the mushroom swiss burger and it was delicious i will definitely be back here

Address: 10991A 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H9 Canada
Review: such delicious and authentic food and for great prices also the staff were phenomenal we went with a fairly high maintenance group of 8 and he took his time answering everyones questions and orders also we loved the latin food store in the back of the restaurant too we will definitely be coming back

Address: 10991A 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H9 Canada
Review: been here many times for their taco tuesday special 2 a taco authentic mexican tacos they are seasoned well and flavourful great selection of salsas to try from mildextra hot service is ok a bit slow we were forgotten about a few times  our server would forget to refill our waters after asking a couple times

Address: 10991A 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H9 Canada
Review:
visit april 2023

visited el mariachi and it was great i got the enchiladas which was pretty filling it tasted pretty good as well though the chicken was a bit dry

i did also have some of the birria tacos only available on weekends and those were superb extremely hot fresh and crispy the dipping sauce was also very flavourful so id highly recommend it

i also had the carne asada tortas which i bought home and ate the next day and wow was the carne asada meat amazing extremely tasty and works well with the creaminess of the avocado

when dining in they gave some free chips with sauce the service was a bit slow but they made everything fresh

the atmosphere is also great theres so much decorations and everything just felt really unique and authentic theres also a mini store inside where you xna purchase mexican goods

overall highly recommend especially the birria tacos and tortas

Address: 10991A 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H9 Canada
Review: honestly amazing authentic mexican cuisine ive never had real authentic mexican food before such as enchiladas and mole and i was so amazed by the deliciousness of the food totally blew me away the prices were really great too and the waiter told us about 2 tacos on tuesdays before 6pm

Address: 10991A 124 Street Edmonton, AB T5M 0H9 Canada
Review: i just had my first experience at this restaurant and let me tell you it was amazing the food was really close to authentic mexican food and our waitress was super friendly we ordered carne asada tortas and quesabirrias and everything was so delicious it did take about 35 minutes to get our food but the menu does mention that some dishes take longer to prepare overall we are definitely going back im excited to try more dishes and they even told us that on tuesdays all the tacos are only 2 cant wait to go back and try more

Address: 16907 127 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 0T1 Canada
Review: visited this quite authentic place for dinner with another couple and we were recommended to share a platter memphis feast which had plenty of choices and quantity of food for a solid leftover lunch for one person owner was great in creating laid back atmosphere and treating us with some amazing desert i will definitely go back very soon

Address: 16907 127 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 0T1 Canada
Review: lunch was excellent the service was outstanding and very pleasant the restaurant is clean and the food was just the best  i would recommend taking your family and enjoying the outside patio

Address: 16907 127 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 0T1 Canada
Review:
outstanding guys super friendly  awesome food  massive portions and great atmosphere ill be back
a must go to in edmonton

Address: 16907 127 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 0T1 Canada
Review: what a gem weve known this restaurant was here for years but never took the time to visit we stopped for lunch and turns out its fantastic the service is phenomenal we were greeted immediately and provided with friendly prompt and passionate service its clear the owners care about their product and customers very much the food was amazing the wings were on special and we had lunch features from the menu everything had that distinct smoky barbecue flavour you go for and the sides were incredible youve got to try the fries my child was treated so well by the staff we will be going again for the food and the service what a wonderful experience

Address: 16907 127 Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 0T1 Canada
Review: it was nice when we walked in felt very welcome having not been for awhile i was very surprised with the prices lunch was good and the fries were excellent you wait on yourself so you are up and down at times asking for what is not on the table salt  pepper ketchup the brisket and rib ends were tender bbq sauce the best

Address: 11806 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0C1 Canada
Review: i love their sushi their design for each roll and the taste were awesome we ordered dynamite cheesy dragon mango fry tnt and california roll and all of them were so delicious but i expect more friendly behaviour from the waitress

Address: 11806 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0C1 Canada
Review:
really nice place food was delicious and we had a great time there
we order cold sake and it was amazing too staff was really nice too well be back soon

Address: 11806 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0C1 Canada
Review:
i frequent this restaurant quite a bit and i am always amazed by the quality of food

today we went for my sisters birthday and had an amazing time as usual today was particularly amazing due to our waiter aidan who made us feel very welcomed and tended to he made sure that everything was to our liking and made pleasant conversation that made the dinner feel welcoming

the food was delicious and has great value for its price even when the place is busy we still got served quickly and had a great time i couldnt recommend it enough

Address: 11806 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0C1 Canada
Review: low key family dinner food was excellent and our server logan was attentive and helpful had a relaxed night out took off one star for the bakudan roll too much tempura bits and overshadowed the spicy tuna new style sashimi tuna tataki are highly recommended

Address: 11806 Jasper Avenue Edmonton, AB T5K 0C1 Canada
Review: excellent fusion japanese food in edmonton great drinks sushi appys and dessert came on a week night and it was packed so reservation is recommended i really liked the premium nigiri plate which consist of 3 pieces of blue fin tuna akami chutoro and otoro and 3 pieces of aburi nigiri other than that wagyu beef was also very good and melts in your mouth after cooking table side save room for dessert  slightly on the pricy side about 100 dollars per person spent including drinks and dessert

Address: 13727 127St NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review:
service atmosphere and food were all really good we were greeted and seated promptly the server explained the dishes we asked for the food came quickly and everything was fresh and hot everything we ate tasted great
the place has quite a bit of seating we went there a bit early for dinner so there werent many people
the washrooms were clean

Address: 13727 127St NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review: absolutely delicious would definitely recommend for such a welcoming place the food was all on point and over the top amazing customer service

Address: 13727 127St NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review: the most weird and terrible restaurant ever i ordered the pork bone soup taste was basically super weird if koreans try this  they will know like the picture i didnt even have soup at all i just picked the meat out and ate it and they didnt peel the potato off on the top of that employees were fighting in the kitchen the female server or kitchen staff kept screaming or crying i dont think this was appropriate behavior in the restaurant where customers are or i assume they made weird soup while they were fighting it was seriously horrible experience in my life i dont actually understand why this restaurant has more than 4 stars rating on google map please do not go here i want to remove this experience in my head to be honest

Address: 13727 127St NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review: we ordered soft tofu stew beef bulgogi rice cake and kids meal we need to try the other dishes because we were not satisfied with the taste maybe the other dishes are better

Address: 13727 127St NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review:
service was good but the food was just
ok for me everything was too heavy on the soy the seafood pancake had a good amount of seafood but was strangley very eggy in taste and texture     i also was not impressed with how little banchan was provided especially since you have to pay extra for it as it was not included with the meals the picture i attached was how it was brought out with 4 tiny pieces of radish in each dish i did enjoy the corn cheese very much though

Address: 4306-118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5W 1B2 Canada
Review: i wanted to update my review after visiting for a second time the food here is amazing no matter what you order everything is delicious my personal favorite is the swiss sandwich the salty pretzel bun really adds so much flavor this time i actually got to try the teacup cheesecake and although it was a bit smaller then expected it was sooo good it has a sugar cookie bottom with chocolate and cheesecake and also came with a fresh strawberry on top highly highly recommend this place for lunch dinner a snack anything

Address: 4306-118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5W 1B2 Canada
Review: this place is amazing i have a large family with young children and usually i walk into a cafe like this and i can hear the groans from the staff not here we were welcomed literally with open arms everything here is scratch made to the highest standards and the food is to die for the cakes are truly european and just like europe each item is sculpted with love and pride the flavors were incredible and worth every penny we spent the coffee was also perfect i had a latte and it was exactly what i was looking for my kids had the biscotti and although they were a little pricy they were huge lasted my kids 2 days so i cant grumble seriously though if youre in the area and want a coffee and a cake come here its worth it

Address: 4306-118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5W 1B2 Canada
Review:
i was so excited to visit swiss 2go cafe last sunday finally i had a chance to go there but it was disappointing
i was expecting it to be busy on sunday early afternoon there were only a few people the atmosphere wasnt welcoming the employee wasnt friendly he seemed impatient while i was browsing through the menu and bakery
i heard of this cafe because of their famous cheesecake cup so i ordered 1 to take home i was shocked about the price it was 20 for a little cheesecake oh well i still want to try and see why its so famous
thats the only one i bought who knows how much it costs to buy other products
i tried the blueberry lemon cheesecake it tasted good not super sweet like north america cheesecake but it is dense and heavy i only can have a few bites  then another few bites for the next day
i think the products are over price even tho they might be from oversea but still

Address: 4306-118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5W 1B2 Canada
Review: i have been coming here for the past 7 years since i was in high school lol best sandwiches in the city i love the female cook also has the same amazing energy every time i come in  i got the large clubhouse with a strawberry cheesecake so worth it and ill continue to eat here till i die or they close lol

Address: 4306-118 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5W 1B2 Canada
Review: the food here is always super impressive the baking on display is amazing delicious sandwiches are out of the park awesome these sandwiches seriously defy gravity and logic how can a sandwich piled so high with ingredients not become a mess on the plate everything holds together and i think the pretzel bun puts this meal on another level i wish they still offered my favorite sandwich  san rosa i think it was called  that had swiss dry cured beef hardboiled eggs green apples and toasted nuts this is my shoutout in hopes of seeing it return i love this place and go waaaaay out my local area to get swiss2go sandwiches special trips even cozy quiet shop to stop for a coffee and have one of the best sandwiches in the city

Address: 10602 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review:
i have to be honest the plan wasnt to eat here  the original plan was to eat at a different hot pot place but we didnt make reservations so couldnt get in  at least that is what our friends said they may have decided for us that this was the place to go  we eat together quite often i call them my taste buds

i am glad we tried this place and it is now on my list of excellent places to eat and chat

ambiance
im not a fan of the big fans above each table  but i understand why they are needed as it keeps the humidity down  that much boiling liquid is bound to create humidity but the air wasnt humid  we could speak at a decent volume

to the point
condiments
the sesame sauce was pretty good  it is a good indicator if the the food is going to good

soup base
no one at the table complained  i like spicy food and the spicy base was perfect  flavorful with the right amount of heat

meat
the lamb pork and beef melt in you mouth

follow up
i was worried i gave a glowing review and it was just a once off  it wasnt    it is my new go to place day or night

if you reading this and thinking where to eat dont take my word for it try it

Address: 10602 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review:
i been regularly going there this is the best hotpot place to go to hands down as other mentioned in the reviews dont let the exterior of the building deter you park and go inside the atmosphere is completely a different one

it is cozy inside and there are a lot of options their staff are friendly they bring you the menu and the options for your hotpot such as soup bases noodles meats seafood veggies and more

you cook your options right at the table it is so much fun doing that if you wanted more you can always ask for more

i tried other hot pot places but this place still beats than any other ones

give this place a try you wont be disappointed

Address: 10602 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review: it was fun and delicious first experience with chinese hot pot with my husband for his birthday we dont think we could eat a lot of food so we went for lunch instead of dinner price is reasonable per person and the potions are good size and well quality staffs are helpful and friendly we definitely go back again  photos are not all of what we get i forgot to take the photo because i got excited

Address: 10602 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review: we had lunch here after driving up from calgary and this place didnt disappoint great value at 18 for lunch which comes with 6 items that doesnt sound like a lot but seriously most folks would have a challenge of finishing their meal powerful vents made a difference and since everyone gets their own hotpot it is a fun family experience

Address: 10602 97 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2L6 Canada
Review: great place hot pot was top notch love the all you can eat i had the szechuan broth which is never a miss only thing is theyre so busy if you need help with something it might be a little while until this notice you need help

Address: 10011 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 0N8 Canada
Review: ordered here last night for take out and have been ordering or eating in for years my must favorites are always peaches and shrimps beef brisket in hot pot and soya sauce garlic chicken the takeout service was fast after calling ahead of time price wise is decent i suppose over the years prices have gone a bit up i certainly will crave time and time again the food from here

Address: 10011 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 0N8 Canada
Review:
right next to hope mission  womens shelter place the whole neighbourhood looks terrible garage everywhere homeless people sleeps on the street

we ordered shrimp wonton soup cantonese chow meinthousand spicy chicken they were very salty and service is just ok definitely not going back im done trying chinatown disappointed every time

Address: 10011 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 0N8 Canada
Review: do not order from herefor a 1900 combo it comes with ginger beef and only 2 yes 2nonedible chicken ballsliterally hard as a rock with garbage meat then the rice is not even fried rice at all but just plain jasmine rice with a teaspoon of egg in it threw it all straight into the trash

Address: 10011 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 0N8 Canada
Review: og place for chinese food from one asian to all the peeps well priced and well portioned and serve all my favourite traditional and more westernized chinese dishes they are open pretty late too so its always an option they are located by the hope mission and some freaky people do come by but the server aunties are really good at handling them and escorting them out if they come in in the most curt and fastest way so its really more of a people show than scary in my opinion the gan chow niu he stir fried flat rice noodles with beef are so goood as well as basically any chicken dish and the beef brisket hotpot curry or regular also you get this surprisingly delisciousss pork bone and vegetable soup to start for free do give it a try

Address: 10011 106 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5H 0N8 Canada
Review:
we had to have happy family when we stay in edmonton food was fresh hot and always tasty we tried a couple new items today both were very good the wok hay on the beef chow fun was in believable its just a smell and taste you get if you are cooking in a traditional wok using chinese cooking techniques

i have to say we were impressed to say the least so affordable never fails all happy family rocks

Address: 10582 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2W1 Canada
Review:
lingnan serves up what id call old school chinese food  its what i remember of american chinese food from pre2000  they do it well they also have the edmonton famous hot and dry chicken that went viral at their now closed sister outlet downtown called chicken for lunch

the service is amazing theyre always so kind and helpful

and the space is old but in that dim space you can find such a sense of chinese heritage adorning all the walls

4 x

Address: 10582 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2W1 Canada
Review: its always lovely going to the ling nan the service is always great and the family is amazing and the food is top notch with great serving sizes at a reasonable price and i always recommend the hot and dry spicy chicken

Address: 10582 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2W1 Canada
Review:
first time at lingnan just amazing food and service amy herself came to chat and welcome us when she heard i had celiac disease she made sure i knew to order instead of going for the buffet she was as warm and cheerful as i remember from 20 years ago at chicken for lunch the wait staff were all attentive friendly and quick the food was all amazing and our teens loved the buffet

we were so busy enjoying we forgot to take food photos so just have one of the lego lingnan near the door next time

Address: 10582 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2W1 Canada
Review: old school chinese food in the capital city   classic menu dishes with fun cocktail list enjoyed the lemon chicken shanghai noodles and house special fried rice all with friendly and attentive service  definitely recommend for a fun family meal

Address: 10582 104 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5H 2W1 Canada
Review:
a true hidden gem you have to go to witness the real beauty of this place at no point did i taste anything frozen and the buffet 5pm frisun is only 30 their drinks are also great and the enviroment is always friendly and eager to take those dirty dishes from the table haha

would 1000 recommend

Address: 7230 Argyll Road Edmonton, AB T6C 4A6 Canada
Review: wow wow wow food specially butter chicken and teriyaki chicken noodles

Address: 7230 Argyll Road Edmonton, AB T6C 4A6 Canada
Review: service great food cold went for mothers day 40 per adult reservation at 10 buffet not ready no eggs on buffet line only eggs benedict on a made to order basis english muffin made with a toaster on a made to order basis muffin overtoasted so hard as a rock ever hear of shafing dishes no omelette station not worth the money will never go back

Address: 7230 Argyll Road Edmonton, AB T6C 4A6 Canada
Review: i have been going here for 16 years  i took my wife and mother in law here to celebrate mothers day what a mistake  the buffet was horrible for a special event there was little effort put in to it  all of the items were greasy and lacked any sort of flavour  the bill for this was 140 we will not be returning thank you for making our day special

Address: 7230 Argyll Road Edmonton, AB T6C 4A6 Canada
Review: this is now the argyll pub good food and friendly service daily specials

Address: 7230 Argyll Road Edmonton, AB T6C 4A6 Canada
Review: the steak was delicious and chelsey is a delight to have as a server i always say the food is only as good as the service and both were excellent thank you chelsey for being such a nice happy server it was a wonderful experience

Address: 12620E - 132 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5L 3P9 Canada
Review:
decided to try this place because im a serious fried chicken fan

ordered a the three piece meal with fries and soy garlic dipping sauce

service gets five stars
hot fresh fries get five stars
coleslaw creamy with a touch of sweet gets 5 stars
fried chicken gets three stars

two of my three pieces of chicken were hot and juicy and had good crispiness drumstick and wing but the centre breast piece was a bit dry overall my main criticism is that the chicken didnt have much flavour i expected to taste the herbs and spices but it was a bit bland without the very tasty dipping sauce the chicken was underwhelming

how does the chicken stack up against other places ive tried in the edmonton area

1  mary browns chicken and taters are fabulous
2  swiss chalet when they have fried chicken available
3 coco deef fried chicken its good with quality sides but a bit bland without the dipping sauce
4jolibee salty but crispy and juicy its ok
5 churches chicken kind of plain tasting sides are meh
6 kfc ok if served fresh but thats rarely the case
7 popeyes not very good

i will give coco another try when im in the area

Address: 12620E - 132 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5L 3P9 Canada
Review: i love their chicken crispy in the outside and very moist in the inside chicken has always been my comfort food and they did satisfy my craving  best of all they serve rice  parking wont be a problem maybe it needs work on the interior design of the place to make it more appealing and inviting to eat a personal favourite is the snow cheese and honey buttered chicken staffs of the restaurant are very accommodating two thumbs up

Address: 12620E - 132 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5L 3P9 Canada
Review: i love the fried chicken here at my last visit the staff took my order quickly and i didnt have to wait long for it to be ready this is consistent with previous visits too the sauce flavours are delicious i especially like the garlic soy and the chicken is juicy and tender with a delicious crunchy coating its not close to me so i dont have it often but when im in the area i definitely stop by i was just there recently and nothing has changed

Address: 12620E - 132 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5L 3P9 Canada
Review: the chicken from here is delicious the down sides are  majority of chicken pieces are drums  wings 912 pieces  large fries is small its comparable to everyone elses medium at best and last they want you to order through their own app which is a pain to use you have to wait for a code to be text to you to finish your order there is also a user fee the service from the store is good waiting time is appropriate for fresh chicken ample parking

Address: 12620E - 132 Avenue Edmonton, AB T5L 3P9 Canada
Review: we absolutely love their unforgettable chicken it was so crispy and juicy and the flavour was great we quite had a feast since me and my friend were so hungry before coming here you would definitely satisfy your chicken cravings here the staff were super friendly and they were quick in getting our orders i like their chicken so much coco deep has then become one of my favorite chicken places

Address: 13823 127th Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review: food was ok but nothing special some lacked flavor some were better expensive for what it is

Address: 13823 127th Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review:
last minute decision to eat chinese and it was the only place open later than 9pm in the north end nice bonus that its a hk style cafe unfortunately there was little to no hk cafe style food on the menu so we refered to the online menu which had it all listed
our food was really tasty and portions a bit skimpy but the prices were ridiculously high 1795 each for fried rice and fried noodles and almost 13 for a noodle soup the food was good but not good enough to justify those prices this being the only legit chinese restaurant in the north i can see why the prices are what they are but this will only deter me from the northside for chinese i will stick to chinatown to get great chinese food at a fair price in the future

Address: 13823 127th Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review: we frequent chinese restaurants especially hk style ones and this was the worst experience weve had by far ordered the barbecue duck soup noodles and the duck was basically all bones asked about it and they cut off two tiny pieces off the rear end of the duck awful service and the worst noodles weve had in edmonton

Address: 13823 127th Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review:
one of the rare hkstyle cafes located in the city the seating and the atmosphere sort of makes you feel like you are in hong kong vancouver

there is a huge selection on the menu which may take several visits to try price is fair and food quality is alright cant compare to hk though

the only drawback to this place was the service they were a bit disorganized the servers seemed confused at times and we had to ask two different servers before our food finally came

bottom line dont expect the servers to be extra friendly or personal it might be a bit of a cultural shock to some but the edgy serving style is actually quite normal among most hong kong style restaurants around the world

Address: 13823 127th Street NW Edmonton, AB T6V 1A8 Canada
Review: misinformation on the website regarding delivery note to anyone considering delivery it is 50 minimum for delivery not the 35 for free delivery as advertised pricing makes it very awkward to order for 1 person no delivery available for distances above 5km and the staffs were very uninformed dine in is okay for some nostalgia food is not bad but price is high however i will never consider little bee for delivery in the future ever again

Address: 9112 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 0M7 Canada
Review:
we ordered a some non alcoholic beverages one called the wannabe which used ginger beer as the base there was some pomegranate syrup and seedlip groove 42 a mediterranean style distilled non alcoholic spirit quite sour and extremely herbal the second was pulp fiction this used grapefruit juice as a base with anise and cardamom syrup with a grapefruit moon garnish sweet delicate and delicious

had the fries to start the fresh ground pepper at table side was a lovely touch and i very much enjoyed the spicy house made a√Øoli

for the main course we ordered the mushroom toast house made spicy chicken soup and breakfast with tiffany avacado toast with poached eggs

the mushroom toast had an egg yolk on top of various pan fried mushrooms and seasonings with the micro greens as a garnish i felt like i was transported to the forest floor so beautifully earthy and wonderfully herbaceous an absolute win

the breakfast with tiffany was filling and refreshing a small mason jar of fresh fruit was a perfect palate cleanser

cool touch with the phone chargers tastefully hidden at the table

Address: 9112 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 0M7 Canada
Review: pizzas are made fresh in house and delicious the carbona was fantastic long list of good cocktails and plenty of beer on tap nice patio for sunny days highly recommend for dinner or drinks

Address: 9112 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 0M7 Canada
Review: easily one of my favorite places to eat at in edmonton ive been here several times and even chose to celebrate my birthday here each time the staff was super friendly the food delicious and the cast iron pie amazing i definitely recommend checking this place out

Address: 9112 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 0M7 Canada
Review: rebel never disappoints great atmosphere happy hours and delicious menu with lots of variety the best part however is definitely their hospitality we went there yesterday for a birthday with twin babies and a toddler  and the manager and staff were incredibly accommodating so awesome to have the option to still go to cool spots in the city that welcome families and allow us to dine out with kids in tow will definitely be back and will be getting another slice of the confetti cake  delicious

Address: 9112 142 Street NW Edmonton, AB T5R 0M7 Canada
Review:
this place was great outside is deceiving as you feel like its a strip mall but once youre inside its a whole new experience

the staff are very outgoing and friendly and make the dinking experience great

the food was great and reasonably priced with a great menu

i would recommend stopping here for your next meal asap

Address: 8015 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5B 0R7 Canada
Review: first time visit to this legendary establishment in the cromdale area and left as one happy customer who will certainly return again warm welcome at the door and exceptional service at this family owned business with an extraordinary ambience portions are large and can easily be shared the  bar is well stocked and staffed given the proximity to the coliseum and expo center and with kdays it was busy on sundays they close at 8pm a takeout service is also available plenty of oilers photosparaphernalia for hockey fans in yeg

Address: 8015 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5B 0R7 Canada
Review: i always order thier beef ribs one of the few places in the city to make them they are so delicious and worth every penny if you a lover of beef this is a must have excellent service too always super friendly staff in a homey atmosphere theyve been around a long time and you can easily see why

Address: 8015 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5B 0R7 Canada
Review: absolutely love the food here super fair prices and the staff here are incredible all very friendly and the service is great we both got steaks and they came out extremely fast and cooked perfectly also the atmosphere here is great i love the old timey feel when you come to coliseum steak and pizza will be back

Address: 8015 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5B 0R7 Canada
Review: stopped in for an early dinner last week  food came out fast and was fresh and hot  service was wonderful waitress was attentive professional and polite  ordered steaks and each one was cook to proper type

Address: 8015 118 Avenue NW Edmonton, AB T5B 0R7 Canada
Review: they have always been such a great place to go for a steak ive been coming here for many years and they never fail my blue rare steak is always cooked to perfection since ive been a teenager

Address: 540 Queen St Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review:
great place to have dinner in downtown fredericton perfect place for a date a little pricey but its worth it friendly staff and good music
the food is amazing and if you still have room for dessert try their chocolate cake

Address: 540 Queen St Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review:
mussels is chipotle coconut milk broth was amazing

she had rack of lamb i had steak with gorgonzola demi glace  both were great

nice wine selection   well be back

Address: 540 Queen St Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review: the staff was very friendly and very helpful with questions about the menu i love the cheesecake a definite must if you eat here

Address: 540 Queen St Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review:
cocktails were great especially the laphroaig based drink cant remember the name was busy on a saturday night and just a few dishes were out

started with the shrimp  grits it was outstanding slightly sweet in spots slightly acidic in others juicy shrimp crispy bits it was a well executed dish

the pork belly on the other hand was a bit of a miss now while the pork belly was perfectly tender and easy to eat the skin was basted with what tasted of cattlemans bbq sauce and it was accompanied by what can only be described as bottle caesar dressing the white sauce needs to go the little round cakes on the dish were very dry for all 3 of us who ordered it out of our group of 7 corn was fine  crispy puffy skin no bbq just flaky salt would have made this dish greateven just a little 5 spice seasoned salt on the meat

would definitely come back for the cocktail though

Address: 540 Queen St Fredericton, NB E3B 1B9 Canada
Review:
great atmosphere and food presentation was great 
id definitely go back
staff were friendly and portions were great
i wasnt a huge fan of the steam buns wasnt enough flavour for me but i have higher standards for asian food

the ceasar salad was delicious

thanks

Address: 462 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review: absolutely amazing my partner and both loved our plates we took the dinner for two deal and everything was delicious highly recommendthe drinks were super tasty and service was great

Address: 462 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review: food was good drinks and service were decent the overall issue though the whole time seemed pretty rushed like asking if youve decided on dinner choices before even been asked for a drink we will definitely try it again another night

Address: 462 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review: excellent food it was the best scallop ive ever had loved the shrimp super tender

Address: 462 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review: very nice and pleasant place the staff are great and caring about your experience at the palate and the food is delicious

Address: 462 Queen Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1B6 Canada
Review:
i have been here on friday night lately for a dinner with my supervisor and my friends at around 6 pm my suggestion is that you should make a reservation before hand as the place can get very busy on friday

for lunch i found it is quite busy from monday to friday as well you may need to book a table ahead of time to avoid disappointment

the food is good they always have specials of the day which is not on the menu ask for them most of the time they are surprisingly very good

the price is good for the food quality and services

the parking can be tricky during during the day for monday to friday as you have to pay for street parking if they are full you have to drive one more block and use the citys parking lot paid and walk back to the restaurant the street parking is free after 5 pm from monday to friday and all day on the weekends and holidays

Address: 100 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review: we ordered calamari a couple of pasta dishes and mini doughnuts to top it all off food was incredible i highly recommend this place i plan to come back and try other dishes

Address: 100 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review: what a great surprise  its was sooo delicious definitely  its a n amazing restaurant to try service was impeccable  food was really hot and sooo good its worth the 5 stars

Address: 100 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review:
the food was exquisite cooked to perfection spiced to light up your tongue
the service was kind we do need a reservation as it is quite busy but the food was worth it and good quality to price
i recommend the brie  artichoke dip entree and the salmon piccata main dish

Address: 100 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review: as an italian whose moved to fredericton i can say this restaurant is the real deal homemade tomato sauce perfectly cooked pasta and delicious appetizers this will be a staple for us

Address: 100 Regent Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1G1 Canada
Review:
the whole visit here was wonderful  the arrancini balls with pesto fried rice and house made marinara sauce were so good then i was brought over rosemary focaccia bread crispy at that with balsamic vinegar and olive oil with herbs a very nice free offering
finished off with the mushroom ravioli it was amazing
the server i had was wonderful
great gibeon a thursday night
definitely recommend this place

Address: 79 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review: wow amazing amazing amazing thats all i can say fabulous eats and amazing cocktails in a small but quaint setting the chefs change up the menu a bit but if you can get the pork belly roasted cauliflower or carpaccio  go for it the most original food ive had in a restaurant in a long time

Address: 79 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review:
update still awesome revised menu items keep this place fresh

absolutely brilliant experience all the dishes we tried were perfect with wonderful conversation with our bartender we will definitely return to try more plates

Address: 79 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review: best food experience ive had in fredericton a bit pricey but definitely worth the visit try to get a seat inside the outside is a bit rough maybe they could put some patio cushions down outside to spruce it up

Address: 79 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review: wow ive lived in the maritimes for about 8 years and first time in fredericton im a little surprised to find the best restaurant ive yet been to out east the staff were so lovely and truly went above and beyond the owner jenny was very generous with her time to chat with me and share a bit about the place and her inspirations for the cocktails and the food wow nothing else to say really stunningly delicious and very memorable even the small bites i had the taco special which was phenomenal and the regular menu beef tostadas which were divine all in all truly a great experience i will be recommending this place to everyone i meet

Address: 79 York Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3N4 Canada
Review:
had the best dinner with my family here didnt book a reservation but happy we got there early because people packed in as it got later

each dish was made from extremely fresh often local ingredients

highly recommend the house pickles beef tostadas and the brassica for appetizers the portions arent that big but the flavours are

for mains the steak was a dream and the pasta was cooked to perfection i really enjoyed the salmon too the potatoes that came with it had great flavour

the dessert was unique out of the three id say that the home made peanut butter ice cream was the best but the olive oil cake came a close second if you are too full for dessert youd have to get their coffee we loved it

staff were friendly and helpful and we had a great time a must try in this small town

Address: 723 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 5N8 Canada
Review:
stopped by on a maritime road trip tasty lobster roll with huge chunks of lobster the fries were crispy and not greasy

the location is very homey and filled with memorabilia staff was friendly and even hosted us right before closing time

Address: 723 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 5N8 Canada
Review: it was a smaller diner than i expected but you could it was a place that the locals hang out as most knew each other by name the decor was like stepping back in time  i enjoyed the cabin and would go back the guy at the table next to me ordered a pancake and one pancake was the same size as the dinner plate it was good value for the price i had the steak and eggs

Address: 723 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 5N8 Canada
Review: stopped in for the lobster roll had to take a couple pics was full of lobster so much that some fell out onto my plate as i was eating delicious and worth every penny one of the best ive ever had

Address: 723 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 5N8 Canada
Review: food was excellent good tasting and good size portions lobster pieces as big as my thumb the cabin is literally a cabin on the side of the road license plates on the wall and old time music boxes at each table a step back in history

Address: 723 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 5N8 Canada
Review: it was good but nothing out of the ordinary big stop irving much better i heard great reviews about the place but my experience was not so great  very friendly staff  very run down and dirty  the bathroom had what appeared to be old chip fryer finger tip deep grease in the grout lines of the flooring you could wipe it out with your finger like it was placed there on purpose  old cabin feel and run down 2 very different things  this place needs a deep clean

Address: 253 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2H8 Canada
Review: an absolute must to go eat at very friendly people amazing tasting and presentful food and good atmosphere

Address: 253 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2H8 Canada
Review: i wasnt hungry enough to warrant a full buffet so i opted for a combination plate the chinese food was okay not the best i have ever had but good i didnt really like the ribs so i wouldnt order them again nice selection of white wine but not a great red wine list service was fantastic and our server was really friendly and helpful

Address: 253 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2H8 Canada
Review: incredible snow crab in the buffet my girlfriend loved the curry noodles i loved the wings there is lots of variety for a chinese buffet and the dessert at the buffet was incredible chinese

Address: 253 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2H8 Canada
Review:
food was a lot 3 or even 4 can order the dinner for 2 special it is a lot of food kids portion are huge too food is good less sweet for the chicken balls might be nice staff was friendly our server was a very nice madame she was very helpful and easygoing provide info about the plates and suggested the plates for the kids she was amazing we visited about 45 after dinner we do not have anything else during that day and we even had leftovers food was a lot

must try their ribs really good

Address: 253 Woodstock Road Fredericton, NB E3B 2H8 Canada
Review: 1010 experience the food was amazing and huge huge portions the staff were all amazing as well fast and genuinely happy to serve all guests

Address: 546 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E6 Canada
Review:
im so glad we came here for lunch while we were in fredericton this is one of the best meals of our trip the mussels we started with were amazing

they have many gluten free options i wouldnt have guessed the pasta i had was gluten free it was that good i asked about the spiciness level of the carbonara sauce and the waitress had them tone it back for me it was perfect

we packed up half of our entrees to go so we would have room for dessert im so glad we did because the creme brulee was perfection

Address: 546 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E6 Canada
Review:
top dining in fredericton
excellent service and perfectly prepared dishes flavours are excellently matched and presented
lamb and duck are on the menu
good selection of wines and liqueurs pairing is offered
the restaurant is up a steep flight of stairs and the restaurant is lighting is dim
street parking
always and extra star for cr√®me brule

Address: 546 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E6 Canada
Review:
one of the best meals ive had the carbonara linguini is amazing

the bread came with butter molasses which ive never tried before what a delicious surprise that was

finished off with the tasty apple turnover

yummm

Address: 546 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E6 Canada
Review: excellent atmosphere and staff i had the brewbakers spicy pie which was a korean flatbread pizza the kimchi was spicy and perfect and the pork loin was a great addition to the overall dish

Address: 546 King Street Fredericton, NB E3B 1E6 Canada
Review: allround enjoyable experience friendly personable staff second floor patio amazing food and paired beverage suggestions

Address: 1034 Prospect Street Fredericton, NB E3B 3C1 Canada
Review: this is my second time at the hilltop and the staff there is incredible always friendly and accommodating i was served about an hour before closing by alicia alisha and she regularly checked in on my table and was very friendly the food was hot and very delicious we were told it was a 45 minute wait but we definitely got served quickly regardless much less than 45 minutes i thank all the staff for making this a great experience
