Review: the canteen is an absolute must on your to eat list well worth the quite enjoyable ferry ride the canteen combines atmosphere care affordable prices and fine dining 3 people suggested i take the short ferry ride from halifax to eat here  and i now understand why the brussel sprouts are simply heavenly combining an orchestra of flavors that only gets better with  each bite as a complete beginner with oysters i was blown away with how fresh the canteens oysters were not slimy in the slightest i enjoyed them with a squirt of lemon juice although the house mignonette was fantastic as well my server mark was immensely professional and deeply cared about providing a sensational experience he offered fantastic pairing suggestions created special cocktails and coffees based on my tastes offered sound advice on the menu and truly cared for the clientele i wish i could give the canteen 10 stars a stop you simply cannot miss in halifax whether you are visiting for a few days or a local i highly recommend making a reservation the place is well known all over the country for its fantastic dishes but i was easily able to secure a table the morning of the prices are quite reasonable but i enjoyed an appetizer entr√©e dessert 3 cocktails and a specialty coffee

Address: 22 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1G9 Canada
Review: food was fresh and delicious albeit a bit pricey definitely worth a trip on a splurge day recommend reserving a table in as much advance as you can as you usually cant get one for the day of  walkin in my experience they also dont open until 5pm for dinner so be mindful of the weather because you wont be getting in sooner

Address: 22 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1G9 Canada
Review:
two of us shared a crobster roll and the risotto with scallops and it was incredible  might give the slight edge to the crobster roll but my wife chooses the risotto  just a sign that everything on menu is worth ordering

server was very attentive but not overbearing parking was difficult for us we were about 5 blocks away

Address: 1533 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z4 Canada
Review: our server john was fabulous from greeting and seating straight through to wishing us goodbye as we left the food was incredible the buttermilk biscuits with molasses butter was a beautiful appetizer i had the kale caesar salad with chicken and i loved every bite both of these paired well with the pop shopinspired mixed drink i had the dessert  maple creme br√ªl√©e  i could have married that the atmosphere was fantastic and the music wasnt so loud that we couldnt have a simple conversation 100 recommend and will return

Address: 1533 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z4 Canada
Review:
first time time in halifax and enjoyed my time at this restaurant the burgers are great and fries are good
the drinks are on average little priced higher on the drinks but then again im from out of town

the overall atmosphere is good nothing to complain about the waiters and waitresses are nice would come back in the future

Address: 1533 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z4 Canada
Review: it was a blustery halifax day a few hours before a snow storm when we stumbled onto 2 doors down and decided to have an early supper the ambiance of the restaurant is great not overly bright very clean appropriate decor for a romantic night out or a lovely gathering with friends around food and wine the food was delicious my wife said it was one of the best gourmet burgers shes ever had they have a fair selection of local libations to choose from at reasonable prices for this type of establishment our wait staff was great kyle in particular was very friendly and helpful we will definitely be back

Address: 1533 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z4 Canada
Review: we had a large group of 20 come in for dinner which the restaurant kindly accommodated the service was prompt and the food came out in a timely manner despite the group size the tacos were on point the brisket was tender and melty the lobster mac was creamy and flavourful and the scallops hit the spot

Address: 1533 Barrington Street Halifax, NS B3J 1Z4 Canada
Review:
the old school burguer was one of the best burguers ive ever had perfectly seasoned and balanced absolutely delicious very likely i will be coming back here for more the cider on rotation the perry recommended by our server was delicious and paired very well with the burguers

service was incredibly kind and prompt while not feeling rushed really enjoyed every aspect of this dinner

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: so we dropped in for lunch and decided to sit inside as it was still a little cool outside  i grabbed a lager as we were deciding what to order  my wife decided on the thai bowl and i had the seafood chowder with molasses bread the chowder was good and so was the beer  my wife didnt finish her bowl because the flavor was just too overpowering she struggled past the third bite i was good just too much of it the servers seemed to be somewhat new but they were good and made it an excellent experience this is the second time we have frequented this location and will return for sure

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: visited 2 doors down while in dartmouth on the way to the airport to have dinner we had the old school smash burger and added bacon we also had parm fries as the side and they were delicious we also had the seafood chowder the seafood chowder was really good with no shortage of seafood which i appreciated id definitely encourage anyone to have their smash burgers because they were amazing the service was also excellent our waiter was very attentive and helpful

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review:
delicious did the dine around menu and it was superb a little pricey so didnt end up getting a cocktail will be back to try regular menu items as it was hard deciding between many entrees
was a little colddrafty sitting by the window so sitting farther in the back would have been more cozy

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: different kind of style of food what im used to getting other than that was not too bad everybody there was nice and friendly and made us comfortable kids love mac and cheese

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: dont be fooled by the unpretentious outside albeit with a nice patio the foods great and service was excellent i had the vegetarian noodle soup and my husband had the pork chop with glaze desserts were excellent  great angel cake berry dessert and ice cream sandwich got a big thumbs up from the ice cream addict two thumbs up from me for the great selection of iconic music which will have you  tapping along

Address: 171 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review:
best asian food ive had in a long time ordered the dinner for two b and every dish was amazing the flavors were wonderful it was much better than any other asian restaurant ive been to recently wonton soup alone is worth coming back for servings were huge too
the service was great staff were very friendly and quick to refill waters
doesnt look like much from the outside but once inside it has lots of traditional asian art and decor the fish tank was clean and not overstocked which is great to see the music was in chinese i think which is another nice atmospheric touch

Address: 171 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: honest hardworking chinese family operates this restaurant their older children help out with the cleaning of tables large portions very reasonably priced and quick service would definitely come again

Address: 171 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review:
i went to modern orchid because my friend recommended it and im so glad she did the cashew nut chicken was amazing and it came with a perfect little spring roll and perfectly cooked rice there was a bit of zip to the chicken and vegetables but not too much that i couldnt enjoy the flavours after my meal they brought me a nice little bowl of chocolate ice cream free of charge
55 recommend

Address: 171 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: overall a great freshtasting meal i ordered through skip the dishes and got the chicken lettuce wraps a veggie spring roll and a pork spring roll to try the lettuce wraps were absolutely delicious and made a perfect lunch but the filling was really liquidy so they were definitely messy to eat the spring rolls were great as well i would recommend the meat spring roll the veggie spring roll was a little lacking in crunch and flavour but still nice the sweet and sour sauce is yummy as well i will definitely eat here again

Address: 171 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: this is another great chinese restaurant in dartmouth staff is warm welcoming and friendly cuisine tastes nicely dishes are value money highly recommend the singapore fried noodle and beef rice noodle

Address: 62 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C2 Canada
Review: great place for a tasty burger and a pint the service was great and the draught variety was awesome the patio had shade options i hate the sun but my wife loves it so its great to get an option that makes us both happy we were there celebrating a birthday no one came to sing so that made us happy

Address: 62 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C2 Canada
Review:
went in here for a late afternoon lunch the place was packed and had a fun atmosphere although the seating is a bit tight the place was very clean and hygienic

ordered a fried chicken and a mushroom hoagie along with the jupiter cocktail and a mocktail the chicken sandwich was fine but we were left a bit disappointed with the mushroom hoagie the fries were good too the cocktail was excellent

hope they improve upon the vegetarianvegan menu but otherwise alright

Address: 62 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C2 Canada
Review:
truly one of the best hangout spotsbars in downtown dartmouth the staff are extremely friendly the decor panders to a mix of geek cultures in a maximalist and playful way something both my boyfriend and i really enjoyed and the atmosphere felt extremely relaxed and comfortable for two easily overstimulated bargoers though we were there extremely early in the day

unfortunately we never had a chance to try the food but the menu hits all the necessary classics and we hope to be back soon to try some

Address: 62 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C2 Canada
Review: great downtown dartmouth location we arrived on saturday lunch hour and it was super busy the service was great  food was good for the price we found it was a bit cramped in the small space and because of this we found it difficult to converse with others at our table overall i give it 4

Address: 62 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C2 Canada
Review:
battery park was a pretty cool spot to have a few beers and grab a bite

we sat down on the patio and even though it was a chilly evening we enjoyed the atmosphere

we tried several different beers and we definitely found a couple of favorites the food was quite tasty simple but well executed

overall service was also good a little laidback but still responsive so no complaints

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review: i was hungry after work and there were lots of people around because of the naig happening i ate inside but there was a table next to me that was very loud and noisy  there was also a table of kids i had to wear my earbuds and play music and eat but it still was noisy the korean pork tacos were excellent but a little messy the cocktails id had before and were refreshing loved the chocolate tofu pie and was pretty full after

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review:
the seitan donair was really good 55 stars and the roasties were really good too the vegetarian special was not good it tasted like left over food from yesterday the pasta over cooked cold and the roasted vegetables were just vegetables cut and thrown on the plate the fish cakes would be a 35 nothing crazy the garlic pizza was small but it is what it said it was
overall pretty decent restaurant but the portions didnt really justify the price the concept behind the restaurant is nice

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review:
disappointed again this is the second and last time ill eat here the food does not ring true to their mission statement of being locally sourced it was bland and uninteresting the ingredients were clearly not in house made and tasted like it came from a can i had the eggplant parmigiana which was basically a piece grocery store eggplant roasted with cheese on top

i dont feel good about this review and the food also made me feel sick

the staff was delightful and i found that made the experience better

thanks

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review:
attended here for a work lunch gathering a few weeks back this was my first and likely my last visit our server was very friendly and attentive the bright spot to my experience
i ordered the monkey club with roasties as the side the sandwich was underwhelming for taste and the bun it was served on was dry and crumbled in your hands the roasties which are their oven baked potato wedges were nothing to write home about
this wasnt the worst dining experience ive had but it was far from memorable in a positive way the product did not match up with the price and therefore i could not recommend it i imagine it does well based on its convenient location and its accommodation to different dietary needs

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review: very good service with good food  the reason for 4 stars is that its good food but not great food  we were a large group so we got a chance to try quite a few items  everything was decent but just lacking that little bit extra to out it over the top  for ex the scallops in the pasta were a bit over cooked  the pasta itself was a bit underseasoned  there were a good things as well the brushetta was awesome the caeser salad was pretty good and the pork loin tacos were good  i think its safe to say we enjoyed the appies more than the entr√©es

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
the food was fantastic and the service was even better i dont think ive ever had such good service in a restaurant importantly the server was very proactively helpful to one of our party at navigating the menu for a dietary restriction
i ordered the scallop pasta it was delicious as feedback though i think id suggest mentioning in the menu how many scallops are in the dish as a tourist from a noncoastal part of canada seafood pricing in restaurants is unfamiliar to me so despite how much i loved the dish and would recommend it i may have chosen something different had i known how many scallops would be involved not a complaint just feedback from a tourist who is still learning to ask before ordering when it comes to mouthwateringly delicious fresh seafood
oh and get the creme brule its worth it

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
the atmosphere was very good given the clean wellorganized promises and beautiful views of the halifax skyline i found the staff to be very friendly and the food quality was also good i found the place to be a little bit on the pricey side though

i recommend this place my experience here was positive

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
theres a lot to love about the wooden monkey as a fan of sustainable farming they are a glowing example of how we can have awesomely delicious food while working with local farms to achieve true farm to plate as a business model

the menu is based off seasonal and local offerings so it may change based on the time of the year but youll find veg and non veg offerings at pretty much anytime of the year

if youre looking for a great date spot or just love good food check out the wooden monkey

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
great atmosphere on the patio beautiful setting indoors was spacious and inviting
server was very energetic attentive and polite
food was very good ordered a pizza this place is excellent for allergies clear answers allergy guide online and great responses
highly recommend trying it out

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review: funny but also semi seriously they should have called it the hokey pokey bc you will get yourself all turned around trying to find the entrance go into the market and follow signs for elevator its on the 2nd floor i cannot think of a restaurant where ive eaten morebetter to die for food everything was absolutely delish our waiter sam was great we sat outside on a chilly day they provided blankets for guests that were cold 1010 find a way to make sure you eat here

Address: 1740 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B6 Canada
Review:
great first night halifax glad we decided on this place the atmosphere was excellent and just the right noise level for us

they were booked up and we didnt have reservations so we sat at the bar the staff at the bar were excellent very friendly and knew when to chat and when to be scarce get seats if you have the chance

we had the 5 fish experience and it was great everything cooked perfectly though i will admit the portion was a tad small for my expectation

Address: 1740 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B6 Canada
Review:
this place is fantastic was a recommendation from a friend we were only in halifax for two nights but after enjoying it so much the first night we returned we made a reservation and were seated promptly the whole place had a great vibe with friendly staff and excellent music our server sydney was excellent she made several recommendations and was spot on with each one the drinks we enjoyed were the south end gin and tequila mockingbird tequila and they were delicious

food five fishermen experience arctic char was trout because they were out but was excellent oysters rockefeller mushrooms apps seared scallops mussels and crab cakes we did think the serving size of 3 very small scallops was a little lacking but it tasted very good

i felt like my stomach got a hug after eating here so good would definitely go back next time we are in town

Address: 1740 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B6 Canada
Review: 5 stars are not enough for my experience here food was amazing shrimp toast was delicious staff were lovely and the restaurant is stunning my spouse booked our reservation for our 6 year anniversary they went above and beyond with a complimentary drink and even gave me a rose after our dinner unbeknownst to the staff he proposed that night on the waterfront and having the service and experience we did that night made everything more magical definitely a go for date night

Address: 1740 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B6 Canada
Review: an upscale experience for sure but i dont know that the food necessarily deserved the same pricing felt a little too expensive for what was served regardless the food was tasty and well made service was quick and friendly our waiter was so personable which made the restaurant experience feel less formal  because we certainly werent

Address: 1740 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B6 Canada
Review:
great beautiful modern lounge style dining experience

food was amazing we had a delicious lightly dressed ceasar salad with pumpernickel croutons

our mains were a big bowl of mussels cooked it what tasted like a lightly sweet and savory french onion soup that paired well with the sour dough toasted bread wedges for dipping

the other mains were the five fishermen experience had a very savory mushroom based mushroom risotto and the scallop grenoblise had very plump juicy tender scallops

our server was amazing laura she was very accommodating suggesting slight variations to the dishes to suit our taste was also very friendly attentive and had great attention to detail

definitely one of the best seafood places in halifax definitely worth the extra money

Address: 2057 Gottingen Halifax, NS B3K 3B2 Canada
Review: a sweet little spot to hangout for a few drinks ans food came here on a friday night at around 930 they had live music and the place was pretty busy we were just able to snag a spot for 2 despite the small size the place didnt feel overcrowded service was quick and they had a good selection of drinks and bar food the music was really good and the overall atmosphere felt very welcoming parking was a bit of a challenge but we were definitely glad we came

Address: 2057 Gottingen Halifax, NS B3K 3B2 Canada
Review:
a must dine in when you go to halifax awesome courteous quick service the elliot page vegan chocolate cake  layered chocolate cake with creamy chocolate mousse an absolute perfect end to the scrumptious mealeven if you share it though you wouldnt want to share it

everything we ordered was so flavourful it has many vegan options the pics are some of the vegan options available they also have glutenfree options

they even have weekly events like trivia open mic live music and comedy evenings though we didnt make it for those

Address: 2057 Gottingen Halifax, NS B3K 3B2 Canada
Review: service was awesome fun atmosphere live music when we went was really good although very cold in the winter with the door opening and closing but overall really nice

Address: 2057 Gottingen Halifax, NS B3K 3B2 Canada
Review: had a reservation for roughly 10 people staff were friendly and food was good the service however was very slow the two women working the tables just sat behind the bar chit chatting several people sat there for 40min without being asked if they want their drink replenished they also screwed up my food order customer service needs improvement

Address: 2057 Gottingen Halifax, NS B3K 3B2 Canada
Review: this place is cozy and the music is not too loud you can have a nice conversation theres a good selection of beer the service is friend and the haddock burger was just succulent best ive ever had

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: staff are very friendly and accomodating they take pride in putting the customer first the wrap i had was delicious chicken fajita with bacon chicken is roasted on site as well as the bacon the vegetables are crisp and fresh and you build it the way you like it best of the best delicious and i am fan highly recommend if you want a custom tasty and fresh sandwich the clubhouse is delicious toojust saying

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: amazing food amazing price amazing staff my husband and i will definitely be back

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: this is a great little sandwich shop i usually get the chicken salad sandwich but the staffowner will probably attempt to persuade you to try the clubhouse with fries which my girl ordered and its great too the fries are really good as are the prices so if youre looking for a tasty sandwich soup andor salad at an incredibly reasonable price id recommend giving the dill pickle a go

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: my husband and i just went there for the first time we were very impressed  food was great and great prices the biggest thing was the man at the cash you very rarely experience such amazing customer service i previously managed restaurants for many years and would have loved for someone so amazing to have worked for me great job

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review:
i was highly amazed when stepping in this place
i was hungry and googled food near me when i seen this place pop up so without second guessing i was on my way to try this place

immediately i was greeted and they took my order right away
the staff were so friendly and helpful
and the food was so good if youre looking for a good home cooked meal this is the place to go

i will definitely be returning when im back in dartmouth for work

i did a review on my tiktok if you want to see my reaction when trying the meal
hope_thescorpio

Address: 4 Panavista Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3M8 Canada
Review:
i went to vines pasta grill  had the wednesday night pasta buffet oh my goodness it was so good
how much pasta can one eat  there was about 8 different pastas a soup warm bread and mussels  i tried small portions of most of the pasta but it was allot of food 
everything tasted great and the service was great too

Address: 4 Panavista Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3M8 Canada
Review: the food is wonderful great spot up on the hill i think they had a sick call the last time i was there bc our server had way too many tables to give anyone good service not their fault for sure we made the best of the evening by making a joke about how we never got what we asked for or that all the tables around us sat dirty after people left for 2hrs i understand how hard it is to find service staff if this had been my first time i could see not wanting to return but this situation had never been the case before maybe have some grace for your server if you happen to have a similar experience maybe theyll be able to get their staffing issues sorted before the height of summer wishing them the best

Address: 4 Panavista Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3M8 Canada
Review: excellent food and service while entrance is not appealing  dont be fooled food and service is exceptional had the shrimp and scallop flamb√©  delicious followed by the after eight cheesecake  service is top notch

Address: 4 Panavista Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3M8 Canada
Review: amazing meal and the server was fantastic as well it was my first time going but it definitely wont be the last  the bread made in house was delicious 100 would recommend

Address: 4 Panavista Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 3M8 Canada
Review: we tried their pasta bar lots of variety moderate price salads and muscles were excellent lots of garlic the rolls were fresh and delicious  we wanted to eat 10 of them we didnt try the soups but they sounded good we tried all the pastas  just a tiny spoon of each our favorites were the new lobster ravioli and the cheese and spinach manicotti the lasagna was nice each pasta produced with care i would certainly go back again bring a friend service was very attentive by all staff

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review: i was hungry after work and there were lots of people around because of the naig happening i ate inside but there was a table next to me that was very loud and noisy  there was also a table of kids i had to wear my earbuds and play music and eat but it still was noisy the korean pork tacos were excellent but a little messy the cocktails id had before and were refreshing loved the chocolate tofu pie and was pretty full after

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review:
the seitan donair was really good 55 stars and the roasties were really good too the vegetarian special was not good it tasted like left over food from yesterday the pasta over cooked cold and the roasted vegetables were just vegetables cut and thrown on the plate the fish cakes would be a 35 nothing crazy the garlic pizza was small but it is what it said it was
overall pretty decent restaurant but the portions didnt really justify the price the concept behind the restaurant is nice

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review:
disappointed again this is the second and last time ill eat here the food does not ring true to their mission statement of being locally sourced it was bland and uninteresting the ingredients were clearly not in house made and tasted like it came from a can i had the eggplant parmigiana which was basically a piece grocery store eggplant roasted with cheese on top

i dont feel good about this review and the food also made me feel sick

the staff was delightful and i found that made the experience better

thanks

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review:
attended here for a work lunch gathering a few weeks back this was my first and likely my last visit our server was very friendly and attentive the bright spot to my experience
i ordered the monkey club with roasties as the side the sandwich was underwhelming for taste and the bun it was served on was dry and crumbled in your hands the roasties which are their oven baked potato wedges were nothing to write home about
this wasnt the worst dining experience ive had but it was far from memorable in a positive way the product did not match up with the price and therefore i could not recommend it i imagine it does well based on its convenient location and its accommodation to different dietary needs

Address: 1707 Grafton Street Halifax, NS B3J 2C6 Canada
Review: very good service with good food  the reason for 4 stars is that its good food but not great food  we were a large group so we got a chance to try quite a few items  everything was decent but just lacking that little bit extra to out it over the top  for ex the scallops in the pasta were a bit over cooked  the pasta itself was a bit underseasoned  there were a good things as well the brushetta was awesome the caeser salad was pretty good and the pork loin tacos were good  i think its safe to say we enjoyed the appies more than the entr√©es

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
the food was fantastic and the service was even better i dont think ive ever had such good service in a restaurant importantly the server was very proactively helpful to one of our party at navigating the menu for a dietary restriction
i ordered the scallop pasta it was delicious as feedback though i think id suggest mentioning in the menu how many scallops are in the dish as a tourist from a noncoastal part of canada seafood pricing in restaurants is unfamiliar to me so despite how much i loved the dish and would recommend it i may have chosen something different had i known how many scallops would be involved not a complaint just feedback from a tourist who is still learning to ask before ordering when it comes to mouthwateringly delicious fresh seafood
oh and get the creme brule its worth it

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
the atmosphere was very good given the clean wellorganized promises and beautiful views of the halifax skyline i found the staff to be very friendly and the food quality was also good i found the place to be a little bit on the pricey side though

i recommend this place my experience here was positive

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
theres a lot to love about the wooden monkey as a fan of sustainable farming they are a glowing example of how we can have awesomely delicious food while working with local farms to achieve true farm to plate as a business model

the menu is based off seasonal and local offerings so it may change based on the time of the year but youll find veg and non veg offerings at pretty much anytime of the year

if youre looking for a great date spot or just love good food check out the wooden monkey

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review:
great atmosphere on the patio beautiful setting indoors was spacious and inviting
server was very energetic attentive and polite
food was very good ordered a pizza this place is excellent for allergies clear answers allergy guide online and great responses
highly recommend trying it out

Address: 40 Alderney Drive Alderney Landing Dartmouth, NS B2Y 4W1 Canada
Review: funny but also semi seriously they should have called it the hokey pokey bc you will get yourself all turned around trying to find the entrance go into the market and follow signs for elevator its on the 2nd floor i cannot think of a restaurant where ive eaten morebetter to die for food everything was absolutely delish our waiter sam was great we sat outside on a chilly day they provided blankets for guests that were cold 1010 find a way to make sure you eat here

Address: Bedford Place Mall 1658 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 2X9 Canada
Review: havent been here in awhile so pleased to find its still as great as always i love the interior with the sockhop cafe style so cool that theres a jukebox and any song you request is a donation to the iwk service was fast and friendly its my favorite place for fish cakes  2 pieces slightly crispy outside and tasty inside love their chow a bit tangy first time having one of their shakes and it was awesome a whole dessert in itself overall a great dining experience

Address: Bedford Place Mall 1658 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 2X9 Canada
Review: great service server was friendly and professional my burger with onion rings was tasty and arrived hot the turkey dinner was delicious but arrived luke warm key menu item chili was unavailable

Address: Bedford Place Mall 1658 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 2X9 Canada
Review: stop  give this place a chance youll be pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food the milkshakes are fantastic and we only tried the classics chocolate and a strawberry milkshake if you feel hungry two must tries are the seafood chowder  and the burgers more specifically the bangger burger

Address: Bedford Place Mall 1658 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 2X9 Canada
Review:
im still getting used to candian pricesso it seemed a tad pricey but i am not positive about that  i didnt like the fish in the fish and chips but that was on me not the cook  i didnt notice it was halibut i was expecting perch or cod but that is not the restaurants fault  the breading on the fish was good it was just the halibut consistency i dont like  my son got a burger and a side of sausages which he enjoyed  my wife got turkey blt and onion rings  we also got a shake float and a waffle desert all of which were quite good  the shake comes in a glass but with the metal mixing cup like they used to do at some places i went as a kid

heather was out waitress very nice and attentive  atmosphere was nice  could have used a pinball table but minor quibble  if we get by again will definitely return

Address: Bedford Place Mall 1658 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 2X9 Canada
Review: ive been meaning to visit for years finally my brother and i stopped in for a late lunch i intended on getting a burger and they seem to have an interesting array of burgers on the menu but we opted for the hot turkey and the hot hamburger sandwiches they were hot and fresh made to order fries are hot crisp and fresh we also ordered coleslaw on the side which was a tasty addition  our server was nice and friendly looking forward to returning and trying something else

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J Canada
Review:
stopped in last evening and im so glad we did

right off the jump we were treated so well the staff are outstanding friendly engaging and knowledgeable

it wasnt long before we turned the decision making over to them and boy they made it wonderful

we started with fresh oysters shared their burger week offering and picked items from the dine around menu having a veritable smorgasbord of deliciousness

the dessert oh my what a treat hats off to the pastry chef

completely impressed with the cocktails they crafted for us there is a lot of beverage experience  knowledge coupled with passion in spades

we will be back

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J Canada
Review:
loved the vibe the place is beautifully set up we went for the brunch and it was delicious we ordered eggs benedict with salmon and the avocado croissant the mimosas have a special place in our hearts now
would definitely recommend

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J Canada
Review: we went there for our friends birthday we were five people in total it had a lot of sitting space but ive heard that its mostly reserved better to book it in advance i would definitely go there again if im in halifax their fries were very fresh and dips were awesome

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J Canada
Review: an absolutely incredible venue for a wedding the manager and all of the supporting staff at lot six went above and beyond to execute everything so flawlessly they worked with us to create personalized details that we had in mind and were very flexible and helpful leading up to the big day as well as on the day of the food drinks and whole atmosphere were amazing the atrium was a beautiful backdrop for both a ceremony and reception all of our guests had an incredible time i would recommend lot six for anyone looking for a place to have their wedding

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J Canada
Review: lot six is by far one of our favourite restaurants it has a beautiful ambiance especially in the atrium with its glass roof and edison lights its lively and the service it always great even when they are busy the cocktails are always delicious and the food keeps us coming back again and again if the atrium is too much for you they also have a study which is another dining area off the front bar its quieter and delivers a great alternative for those who may not want to sit in the atrium with the main bar and music

Address: 1345 Hammonds Plains Road Hammonds Plains, NS B4B 1P6 Canada
Review:
cold rainy day so i ordered hot chocolate which arrived just over room temperature we had the fish and chips cod which were ok nothing to scream about the small burger was overpowered by the locally smoked bacon which was tough and rubbery the food is as advertised edible
the waitress was polite friendly and attentive1010

Address: 1345 Hammonds Plains Road Hammonds Plains, NS B4B 1P6 Canada
Review:
visiting and touring halifax area from ontario stopped here for a bite to eat really good food came out hot and tasted home made not the typical chain restaurant lots of parking
also very accommodating i currently use a cane to walk so they seated us at ground level so i didnt have to go upstairs to the main eating area
ps the pressed juice is delicious

Address: 1345 Hammonds Plains Road Hammonds Plains, NS B4B 1P6 Canada
Review: i hadnt been to edible matters for a while since the renovation and when i visited recently it was really great the tomato soup and sandwich was delicious and affordable the whole menu seemed fairly priced also the bakery case was full of so many good looking treats we tried one of the cheesecake slices and it was super yummy big enough for two to share with plenty for each we made reservations before coming but it was not too busy at all anyway around dinner time on a thursday night i hope to come again to visit the cafe

Address: 1345 Hammonds Plains Road Hammonds Plains, NS B4B 1P6 Canada
Review:
beer battered cod was delicious side ceasar salads not so much a touch of romaine with what looked like spring mix watery dressing and no garlic flavoring one came without croutons
pulled pork tacos were quite dry

Address: 1345 Hammonds Plains Road Hammonds Plains, NS B4B 1P6 Canada
Review: first time diner after hearing from others that the food and service at edible matters were not to be missed i was very happy with both when i stopped with my wife as we were on our way to the halifax airport my entree chicken curry with grilled chicken strips over basmati rice was excellent a satisfying full meal for an affordable price highly recommended the adjoining market although small offers some excellent bread pastries sweets and various artisanal foods there is a coffee bar as well

Address: 2795 Windsor Street Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: absolutely stunning atmosphere and ambiance expertly curated wine list extremely well prepared dishes knowledgeable and approachable servers honestly best restaurant ive been to in halifax which is a fiercely competitive market 1010 no notes

Address: 2795 Windsor Street Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: brittney thank you for the best meal ive had in halifax in the two weeks ive been here bar kismet and bicycle theif are good but perhaps over hyped the steak tartar is the best ive had in ages  cant wait to make my way through more of the menu

Address: 2795 Windsor Street Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review:
topnotch food some of the best ive eaten in halifax i had a potato leek soup which was very good although i could have done without the pickled mustard seeds one of my baguette slices was toasted beyond edibility but that was quickly corrected my entree was a short rib which was very very rich it was served with hasselback potatoes covered in a delicious sauce and a broccoli cooked with olive oil lemon and salt they were the besttasting broccoli ive ever had and one of the highlights of the meal

my wife had halibut with french gnocchi which she loved too i had a few bites of the gnocchi and it was creamy and delicious

Address: 2795 Windsor Street Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: brooklyn warehouse is an awesome neighborhood spot with a great atmosphere the service was fantastic i like the menu i ordered the fried chicken sandwich today w the kale salad  it was very satisfying highly recommend this spot

Address: 2795 Windsor Street Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: delicious food relaxed atmosphere my partner had the mussels and sirloin and i had the scallops and halibut all were really enjoyable wil definitely be back for more

Address: 150 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E6 Canada
Review: visiting elas is the first thing we do after arriving at yhz this restaurant has an amazing staff and wonderful mediterranean food our local family has been visiting this location for years cannot say enough good things started with the mediterranean trio and risotto balls had the chicken souvlaki with greek salad and lemon grilled potatoes my goodness this is reason enough to visit again and again

Address: 150 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E6 Canada
Review:
location and atmosphere are fantastic  if you want a small piece of greece go here

spanokapita was the best ive ever had fresh and hot
the mousake was delicious but a bit cold they did not warm it enough service was amazing kind and promt

Address: 150 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E6 Canada
Review:
ela is probably in my top five favourite places to eat in halifaxdartmouth
i recommend many appetizers including the spanakopita which was one of the best i have had  or the kopanisti dip which also is one of the best ive had
if sharing the grilled platter is a great choice and includes seftalia pork souvlaki two pieces of rack of lamb two chicken breasts a salad lemon potato and a dip
the lamb is always done perfectly
the stuffed chicken breast is also a great choice always so good
the service at ela is always great every time i go
i recommend the ekmek or chocolate torte for dessert actually some of my favourite desserts around 
ela is a cozy well decorated restaurant with nice traditional background music  a romantic feel of greece i love to eat at ela

Address: 150 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E6 Canada
Review: yum yum yum went here yesterday for the first time despite always recommending it to people because a friend said it was the best i decided to finally go myself and wow the food was so fresh the falafels were the best i have ever had and the crispy cabbage and pickled onions paired with them were so good the atmosphere in the restaurant was very chill quiet and relaxing the waitress was lovely

Address: 150 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E6 Canada
Review:
very poor experience my sister and i visited this afternoon dartmouth crossing location my sister had had a valentines day dinner here and enjoyed it a few months ago todays experience was night and day we were seated promptly  good another server came over after wed spent time with the menus asked if we wanted something other than water we didnt the server immediately turned her back and walked away without asking if we were ready to order we were a little taken aback but figured shed be right back she returned several minutes later after making eye contact with us and immediately turning away to check on another tables desserts seemed rushed and dismissive even though there were very few people seated in the restaurant we waited over 30 minutes for our meals we were counting down to walking out when she came out of the kitchen
the food was very lacklustre for the price calamari was over cooked and rubbery lemon potatoes tasted like they had been cooked in vegetable stock and nothing else greek salad was fine but its hard to screw up a greek salad pork skewer was very bland and under seasoned aside from the greek salad this was the most tasteless and unappealing greek food either my sister and i have ever experienced i had to go up and ask for the bill as no one checked in on us after we received our meals staff were just standing around
poor service meh food quality for a pretty inflated price and an extended length of time waiting ensures neither my sister or i will ever eat at ela again and i will very much recommend against dining there

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review: their food is always delicious  if you are looking for a good tasty and fast thai food at lunch i would highly recommend  best to arrive at 1130 to avoid a friday waitalthough the wait is usually not long

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review: this is an authentic thai food im so glad to found this place this  thai noodles soup is the killer this is exactly why im here for the staffs and cooks are really awesome

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review: some of the best pad thai in hrm anytime im up in this side of the city i always make an effort to stop by cha baa thai the store is always clean and tidy the staff are always friendly quick and prompt the food is always incredible cant say enough good things love this spot

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review:
the best massaman curry and black pepper beef ive had always excellent and prompt with service polite and professional  takeaway is usually about 15 minutes so if youre ordering for lunch in burnside call ahead and they have it ready at the counter still piping hot
the food is excellent no matter what you get its hard to try something new on the menu because everything is so good that you want one of everything

definitely recommend

Address: 100 Ilsley Avenue Dartmouth, NS B3B 1L3 Canada
Review: we dined in for lunch and enjoyed delicious thai food cooked up fresh  friendly fast service and reasonable prices whats not to love  well definitely be back

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review: good thai food with pleasant ambience the drinks were bit below average but no complaints from the food pad thai was the standout followed by the red curry and cashew chicken the quantity is quite good and can be shared by two peoplewith rice or sides

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review: the restaurant was nice the staff was friendly the cashew chicken was delicious but unfortunately the spring rolls were not fresh they were sour fried noodles taste sweet and sour but it will be a little greasy not recommended to try thai coffee tastes a little more weepy and creamy

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review:
great spot for a delicious and authentic thai meal

the restaurants pad thai is a delightful mix of stirfried rice noodles vegetables peanuts and beef the pad thai is served in generous portions perfect for both lunch or dinner

wonton soup was surprisingly relexing strongly recommend as well

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review:
very nice experience i ordered the red curry chicken the curry was full of flavor and the portion was perfect

they even gave me extra chicken because i didnt want the egg roll that comes with it since im gluten free

will definitely be going back

Address: 1546 Queen St Halifax, NS B3J 2H8 Canada
Review: wow probably the best thai food ive ever hadhavent had much but this was exceptional the flavors of my green curry chicken lunch special and coconut soup were out of this world the thai iced coffee was strong and sweet and my friends thai iced tea was such a sweet and unique flavor if you are in downtown halifax or around the other location in dartmouth you gotta go here for some of the best thai food in halifax

Address: 3187 Highway 2 Halifax, NS B2T 1J5 Canada
Review: it is a great place in fall river to go for some food and drinks with lots of parking the club house is very unique and well worth a try theres a nice big back room with a view of the lake that a large group can use or maybe you just want a nice cozy table just for two both are doable

Address: 3187 Highway 2 Halifax, NS B2T 1J5 Canada
Review: we called in around 730pm on sunday 5 march for dinner the food was superb i thoroughly recommend the turtleback burger see pics the fries must have been freshly cooked because they were red hot always a good sign

Address: 3187 Highway 2 Halifax, NS B2T 1J5 Canada
Review: the food here is incrediblewe had the big pig burgerand pulled pork potato skins freaking amazing  this is a highly recommended place to eati had a gin ceasarso yummythe pitcher was a vodka ceasar equally as yummy honestly cant say enough about the food here extremely excellent  the chef tiny is above and beyond an incredible artist for food heather our server was a definite laugh and great person all aroundthis was first time hereand i will recommend turtleback tap  grill to everyone and will definitely returnthank you so much for an awesome experience

Address: 3187 Highway 2 Halifax, NS B2T 1J5 Canada
Review: would highly recommend trying this place the food is consistently amazing lots of parking and excellent service it has a great atmosphere and large windows on the water   great place for amazing food and a relaxing evening with family

Address: 3187 Highway 2 Halifax, NS B2T 1J5 Canada
Review: fantastic great family place delicious food

Address: 205 Pleasant Street Unit 101 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 3RS Canada
Review: their service on top of personal and amazing is so quick my head spun the order was given and back cooked  to perfection in a matter of minutes even crowded you can enjoy a good old east coast vibe with great deco and fun staff

Address: 205 Pleasant Street Unit 101 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 3RS Canada
Review: we shared the haddock tips and scallops combo and it was more than enough for us to share everything was cooked perfectly and the tartar sauce was excellent we cant wait to come back when clams are in season the service was very good as well

Address: 205 Pleasant Street Unit 101 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 3RS Canada
Review: went there at 1 pm on a busy waited a few moniutes for a table and then my order of scaƒ∫lops and fries arrived quickly and it was good a generous portion at a reasonable price good service decent coffee i will be back

Address: 205 Pleasant Street Unit 101 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 3RS Canada
Review: we love this place its the best diner in dartmouth or even in hrm we love the food attitude and atmosphere fish and chips and seafood platter are our familys favourite dishes highlyhighly recommended

Address: 205 Pleasant Street Unit 101 Dartmouth, NS B2Y 3RS Canada
Review: my husband and i took his brother and wife here last night for seafood  they are visiting from alberta and love seafood the reviews seemed good so we decided to try it  my sister in law wanted clams but they did not have any at that time she ordered the seafood platter and they gave her an extra piece of fish and i think extra scallops  i had a salad and the guys had fish and chips the fish and chips were terrible  small pieces with way too much batter and the fries were frozen not homemade  the only thing that actually tasted good were the scallops  so disappointed i had high expectations  i read the negative reviews after we ate there and they are similar to ours  owners please read the reviews make some changes and this would be a wonderful place to eat  we wont be back

Address: 1595 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B4A 1E8 Canada
Review:
met some friends here we had not seen in a long time for dinner  the staff were super friendly and very attentive

the food was very fresh and tasty we had the seafood stew halibut bruschetta and lobster ravioli  everyone was very satisfied and had no room for desert

loved the phrases on the beer glasses

Address: 1595 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B4A 1E8 Canada
Review:
while in halifax the hotel staff recommended this restaurant

we didnt have a reservation so we sat at the bar

the staff was very friendly and we had an amazing meal

Address: 1595 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B4A 1E8 Canada
Review:
food was delicious and just as i ordered
waitress flora was devine
four stars on atmosphere only because i sat outside and the view is great green hills and sunset but it looks out over the parking lot

Address: 1595 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B4A 1E8 Canada
Review: great service even better food reservation for 6pm got seated right away service was quick food piping hot and delicious we were so full we skipped dessert but well try some next time

Address: 1595 Bedford Highway Halifax, NS B4A 1E8 Canada
Review: food is flavorful outstanding presentation and just down right outstanding  brett marie went above and beyond and recommended the best meal i have had in a while

Address: 635 Portland Hills Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 0J7 Canada
Review: i love turkish  mediterranean food so i was very pleased to learn about this place recently its been here for 7 years or so i was told and i feel like its kind of hidden from sight on the opposite side of finbars probably why i didnt notice ittheir food is delicious and they have a lunch menu so its my new goto when i dont bring a lunch to work i highly recommend upgrading to the beet salad and if you see the lamb shank is on special id suggest getting it

Address: 635 Portland Hills Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 0J7 Canada
Review: first time visit and i would return and try more we ordered the beet salad delicious and some appetizers terrific server who was attentive we saw people from the kitchen coming out to see if we enjoyed our food

Address: 635 Portland Hills Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 0J7 Canada
Review: we had the menu for two  it came with hot and cold mezza and  a salad to start  then rice with either chicken or beef  dessert was also server with tea  removes all the selections and the chef decides off his menu  very nice atmosphere and stephanie was very helpful and attentive

Address: 635 Portland Hills Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 0J7 Canada
Review: the restaurant is sooooo amazing that were so glad we had our first date since we moved here the waitress stephanie is so beautiful and nice to us also the chef is so talented and wonderful to cook these magic dishes we tried the grill cheese for appetizer two lamb dishes even one is special today highly recommend the lamb dishes best lamb we had in halifax definitely will come back

Address: 635 Portland Hills Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 0J7 Canada
Review:
id like to start by saying all these years i have been planning to try usta but always went elsewhere not realizing what i was actually missing we had a table of 7 and noone left disappointed the variety of appetizers and the main dish options gave us plenty to choose from and only two people ordered the same thing i had the lamb kofte and it was so well seasoned and tender my appie of hummus and ground lamb with the warm pita type bread was amazing our server really made the meal he was very pleasant to deal with knowledgable about the dishes and he just added to the whole situation

i plan to go back soon with my 88 year young mother and will definitely be recommending to other family and friends dont delay like i did as i ended up regretting that i hadnt experienced it sooner well done usta

Address: 1477 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z4 Canada
Review:
came in with 4 young kids and was happily greeted by staff who engaged us and our kids  they provided some colouring and a kids menu and we all enjoyed a very delicious meal together  small warning that this is a semi fancy place and while we were not dressed up and had kids we also went a bit early to avoid the later celebrationromancespecial occasion crowd

parents this is a great place to bring your kids but be aware their meals come with only the entree so drinks and dessert are separate and definitely worth it

Address: 1477 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z4 Canada
Review: we went here for my birthday and it was a great experience the indoor seating was pretty full and a little loud so we sat on the patio which was perfect the food was good and francesca was a great host and made sure we had whatever we wanted we will definitely be visiting again

Address: 1477 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z4 Canada
Review:
we came to ristorante a mano for lunch early on a friday at first it wasnt busy but it got crowded quickly we were a large group and even though the service slowed down at times the staff was quite diligent

overall the food was very good for the most part the portions were filling or at least reasonable the drinks were also good

Address: 1477 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z4 Canada
Review:
so i found this restaurant on google maps i really wanted to avoid greasy food as im out of town and been having a little to much of that recently

my partner had the pizza which wasnt anything to write home about just okay

i had the tortellini al prosciutto it costed 24 on the menu i was expecting a big dish but i was served 1213 peices of tortellini thats the equivalent of 1842 a piece i was pretty disappointed with the dish being this was advertised as a main course meal when this could easily be eaten as an appetizer the pasta is hand made which i understand although its nowhere near a dish being a main meal

drinks are alright sangria and mia

the manager came to my table with a piece of cake on the house to go which was nice of her would of appreciated if they remade the dish to go being how little was served but i guess take what you can get right

Address: 1477 Lower Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3Z4 Canada
Review: appetizers were great food was absolutely delightful service was fantastic we sat outside the breeze was perfect on a hot day a strong 1010 for me well be back for sure

Address: 1725 Market St Halifax, NS B3J 3N9 Canada
Review:
wow were sleeping on this place saturday night the place was like 14 full its been a around for a long time and was known to be fancy back when i was in high school but over the years with all the new restaurants this place has kind of been forgotten

the scallops short ribs octopus and cocktails were fantastic the ceviche was told it was new on the menu needed more lime and salt but the fish was very fresh after adjusting it it was great as well the parsnip dessert was cute but just tasted like a spice cake maybe go for the chocolate dessert next timethere will definitely be a next time the asian bartenderserver also made dinner very enjoyable go with his recommendations

gosh those scallopswith a sweet creamy savoury sauce and perfectly cooked scallops ill be dreaming of you

Address: 1725 Market St Halifax, NS B3J 3N9 Canada
Review: what a great dinner i was very impressed with everything the food service and atmosphere the food was amazing and everything i was hoping for our server oscar was a delight and very knowledgeable he made us feel at ease and had great suggestions the bone marrow and snowcrab salad was lifechanging thanks for a great evening

Address: 1725 Market St Halifax, NS B3J 3N9 Canada
Review:
gio is considered a 4 diamond restaurant and i can absolutely see why right from the moment we set foot into the restaurant the welcome and attentiveness was impeccable the menu is seasonal so what you may see online in terms of menu may not match whats currently being offered this means that the ingredients used are fresh and local hence why the change in menu depending on availability

all that to say that they chana masala included in picture i ordered was absolutely divine the basmati rice was cooked to perfection and the chickpeas were beautifully flavourful but the stand out here was the homemade mango chutney  it was quite possibly the best chutney ive ever had

our server oscar was a pleasure to deal with from the very first moment being also the main bartender he was able to recommend some fantastic cocktails for us to try depending on what we were in the mood for and the cocktails on my theyre inventive modern and a pleasure for the sense id highly recommend trying one

all in all an excellent place to dine with what i consider absolutely bargain prices for a 4 diamond restaurant highly recommended

Address: 1725 Market St Halifax, NS B3J 3N9 Canada
Review: gios pretensions far outweigh its delivery management needs to get a real chef pronto it was perhaps the worst restaurant meal i have ever had at the highest cost i am 70 years old and have travelled around the world both mine and my husbands meals were appallingly bad as soon as mine arrived he asked where is the rest of your dinner when his arrived he promptly lifted his atlantic trout out of the curdled swill that surrounded it and ate it off his bread plate my two tiny unaccompanied agnolotti were the texture of cardboard i managed to eat half of one and tried picking out the tiny smear of mushroom duxelle but the other was headed for the garbage bin nothing else was on the plate for 31 and even the bread cost extra the next night we ate at the keg right across the road and got a much better meal for less money oh and the ambiance 1980s hotel breakfast bar there is none

Address: 1725 Market St Halifax, NS B3J 3N9 Canada
Review: 1010 the oysters came with their blood orange granita and it added a lot of flavor the agnolotti dish was exceptional

Address: 5190 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review: decided to try ramen for the first time i been putting it off for years as it just doesnt wow me whenever i look at pictures of it or read about it since i live next door i decided to support local the atmosphere was great the service was splendid and the food was prepared in a flash  i got a sapporo beer to wash it all down  the food was flavourful and extremely fresh after trying ramen i can say im not a fan of the style of meal it is it was nothing to do with this place as they seem extremely knowledgeable and serve up a great ramen but as i stated not my thing if you like ramen i suggest trying this place for myself this was a one time experience

Address: 5190 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review:
a hidden gem right downtown

pretty cozy space with not a lot of seating so keep that in mind if you have a larger group attending

their vegetarian ramen is delicious so flavorful and loaded with toppings they also offer a tasty korokke croquette if youre looking for a veggie appetizer the tables each have some additional toppings as well if you want to kick it up a notch

i was pleasantly surprised by the variety of options for japanese brews and liquors  their sake was smooth and tasty  nothing fancy but just nice to have the option available on a cold day

would recommend checking it out if you have an itch for ramen in the downtown core

Address: 5190 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review: i really liked the staff were attentive and quick service was provided had great meal loved the ramen and sweet edamame beans they have limited menu but still have gluten free options although i find its bit pricy i would still visit again

Address: 5190 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review: first time dining at buta ramen and first time ever having ramen i ordered the nagasaki champion and my partner had the tantanmen to start we had the chicken karaage all of it was amazing so good the atmosphere was cute and cozy all of the staff members who served us were friendly fast and knowledgeable the food came out lightening quick and it was busy will definitely be back again

Address: 5190 Morris St Halifax, NS B3J 1B3 Canada
Review: nagasaki ramen while filled with lots of stuff some plain fried pork belly some mussels a couple shrimp and lots of squid didnt have a very authentic ramen flavor the tantan noodle was better flavoured but there was only a bite of meat the fried squid legs were delicious

Address: 942 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E6 Canada
Review: really disappointed with the food after seeing lots of good reviews the lemon potatoes must have been soaking for days  the spinicapita was soaked in grease  i actually sat it on napkin before taking it home to soak up some of the grease  thd waitress was excellent and the drinks were good

Address: 942 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E6 Canada
Review:
such a great experience received a warm welcome from the moment we walked in and had excellent service the entire time
we ordered the eggs benedict fried calamari and fish  chips three pieces
the eggs and calamari were great but the star was the fish  chips they were huge remarkable fish to batter ratio and very nice texture

Address: 942 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E6 Canada
Review:
hard pass on the breakfast next time for me

walked into the restaurant to be immediately greeted with the door closer hanging off the frame was seated fairly promptly and ordered a bacon  feta omelet with a poutine hollandaise home fries with toast and wife ordered a mediterranean benny daughter ordered a waffle with bacon while the restaurant was practically empty the food took forever and the server never really came back to see if we wanted our beverages topped off the other server looked over in what appeared to be concern but didnt really assist the matter

we finally get our food and the wifes benny looked quite paltry compared to similar restaurants benny meals perhaps it was the small eggs and the micro hash browns but our portions in general were on the verge of being below average

my meal had to be sent back as the poutine did not appear on my plate 7 minutes later my food reappeared as everyone else finished their food i found it extremely odd that it took that long just to put cheese on the home fries the hollandaise itself was tasty the omelet was more of a mixed western with bacon and feta but it didnt quite taste like the feta im used to at his point i didnt really care too much over the entire experience as i was starving sorry forgot to take a photo as i was ravenous by that point

daughter received a decent waffle with a side plate of bacon again kind of odd not to be on the same plate but not the end of the world we were packing up waiting for the bill when the waitress recalled she had to bring jello for the daughter but decided it was a to go thing instead of giving it to her with her meal then forgot the spoon kind of unfortunate

so sadly the entire first time experience pulled my mood down and is reflected in my review perhaps i may try the seafood lunchdinner but right not im disappointed enough that i may not just bother we had tried to get into this place one other time and the waitress tried to shove us into a tight corner where neither my wife or i could even get between the table and the chair so we walked out

Address: 942 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E6 Canada
Review: best breakfast and coffee in town served to 4pm which is perfect for some of us like myself who doesnt eat breakfast until early afternoon they consistently serve up some of the best meals in town and the prices are very reasonable  my wife and i often share the seafood platter when we go out for dinner or lunch which is fantastic btw highly recommend

Address: 942 Cole Harbour Road Dartmouth, NS B2V 1E6 Canada
Review: we came across this place by chance for breakfast while my mom and grandma were visiting all wait staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful we all enjoyed our breakfast  we each had something different and all dishes were delicious really great feel comfortable spacious eggs benedict was so good we would drive back to have it again and we live nearly half hour away

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review:
discovered byblos just over a year ago and i keep coming back their food is the definition of comfort food warm delicious and flavourful the space is inviting and all staff are beyond friendly i especially adore sara who is an exceptional server and gives great recommendations

if you enjoy hot spicy like me give the chicken kadai a shot something i appreciate about byblos is how fresh the spices are it truly makes all the difference my favourite dish so far is the butter chicken  the best ive tried anywhere in the halifax area the veg samosas and butter chicken are great options if youre looking for something more mild

whether youre coming here for a full meal or a quick snack i find it quite affordable

attached are photos of the aloo tikki chaat butter chicken with rice and garlic naan  which is a classic of course we also had some gulab jamun for dessert but it was gone so quickly i forgot to take a picture

thank you byblos you always make my night i will never stop recommending this awesome local restaurant

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review: super delicious food thank you biblos team i tried manchurian and amritsari kulcha today it was a complete taste of india price is also reasonable loved it must try

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review: we had the samosas the dal makhani and the butter chicken with garlic naan and the food was incredible we have been a couple times pre covid when they only served lebanese food and the food was always amazing this was our first time trying their indian cuisine and it was phenomenal hands down the best meal weve had in a long time will definitely be back

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review: this was our first visit and we will definitely be back  we shared the dinner for two with butter chicken a lentil dish samosas  rice and garlic naan simply delicious the service was great  honestly a very pleasant surprise dont hesitate to try this restaurant a new favorite

Address: 644 Portland Street Dartmouth, NS B2W 6C4 Canada
Review:
we had a great time at byblos the menu was indian with lots of varietiesveg and non veg and the drink menu had a great variety of wines spirits and cocktails there was a bubble tea bar too so that was a good touch the staff is very accommodating warm friendly and welcoming we ordered veg manchuria chicken 65 naans and jeera rice  everything was made fresh and the taste of every dish was amazing the food came out in 15 minutes and we were very happy overall
i highly recommend this place to everyone

Address: 556 Sackville Drive Lower Sackville, NS B4C 2S2 Canada
Review:
my favorite place to go with my son
the salmon pizza is my most favorite the salmon is so fresh and just like butter delicious

Address: 556 Sackville Drive Lower Sackville, NS B4C 2S2 Canada
Review: the food is really good the servers are so kind the only thing is if you want add more food at your order you might to wait for a while but definitely i gonna back sushi lovers would love this place

Address: 556 Sackville Drive Lower Sackville, NS B4C 2S2 Canada
Review: we took the buffet set menu but it is very limited selection wudon soup is too salty to taste no free drinks provide sushi roll collections are not bad no any surprising touch point

Address: 556 Sackville Drive Lower Sackville, NS B4C 2S2 Canada
Review: 4th time weve been here the food is always delicious and fast it was the second time we got the all you can eat sushi we had the food in about 6 minutes which was crazy the place is never to busy which is nice so there isnt usually a wait but it is always busy enough for a good atmosphere they seem to do a huge take out service which i am sure we will be trying some night after work it is now our go to spot for sushi since we moved to a lower sackville it is worth the visit for anyone outside of the area as well sushi

Address: 556 Sackville Drive Lower Sackville, NS B4C 2S2 Canada
Review:
small restaurant all you can eat available all you can eat ordering done via paper the service was slow and the restaurant was not very busy on the inside but it did look like there was alot of pickupmobile orders being prepped
the food itself was oktoo much rice with the sushi and some of our sashimi was still slightly frozen
bathrooms were a mess water everywhere on the sink dirty doors wet floors

Address: 6021 Cunard Street Halifax, NS B3K 1E5 Canada
Review: just awesome have been coming here for years and always have the best time guy and andre dont do this for a living they are passionate about what they do and that reflects on the dishes they put out here very generous portions and explosion of flavors jessica and sara are always awesome cant wait to go back

Address: 6021 Cunard Street Halifax, NS B3K 1E5 Canada
Review:
its been a min since last dining studio east and thats my error  this place has a vibe  wednesday night and the place was packed with a vibrant crowd     staff and service was excellent

you can tell when the owners out their own personal touches in the food   everything was homemade and fresh  the menu has some creative elements but always some standard loves such as the pork ramen     the drinks were a surprise hit   cannot wait to find the next opportunity to go back

Address: 6021 Cunard Street Halifax, NS B3K 1E5 Canada
Review: really really great food my partner and i had the chicken karaage and i had the bulgogi short rib and he had the chicken sandwich with the parmesan fries our server was very friendly love that they have an ipad with a visual menu makes choosing the food easier and more fun drinks were good my friends had the chicken crisps the bao that was on special the burger and the small ramen bowl and raved about how food their food was was pleasantly surprised there were so many gluten free options will definitely be back

Address: 6021 Cunard Street Halifax, NS B3K 1E5 Canada
Review: super fun place staff so attentive food excellent one grind was the drinks were skimpy and small for the high price of 1600 but tasty

Address: 6021 Cunard Street Halifax, NS B3K 1E5 Canada
Review:
good asian fusion options  was very cool to see that they provide an ipad at your table to show you pictures of all the dishes  absolutely helps with decision making  first time ive ever seen that  id recommend the bao buns as an appetizer  the tofu bao had good flavour and was not dry  we also enjoyed the chicken crisp and the studio dumplings for apps  my partner had the chicken rice bowl  this was a miss for us  it was very saucy almost too the point of soupy and we found the different sauces they used did not really compliment each other
i had the kung pao cauliflower bowl which was great  i opted for the noodles  the only suggestion is i wish it had more vegetables because its quite carb heavy with the noodles and the cauliflower being fried
overall  i would visit again they seem to change the menu quite often which is great

Address: 5120 Salter Street Halifax, NS B3J 0A1 Canada
Review: loved it here super friendly and considerate waitress ordered a seafood petite tower that came with two different sets of oysters half a lobster tuna sashimi halibut and chopped scallops absolutely delicious we also ordered a separate two sets of oysters which tasted quite different was nice trying them all the seafood chowder was amazing as well highly recommend and would come here again

Address: 5120 Salter Street Halifax, NS B3J 0A1 Canada
Review: came here during happy hour 46pm for the 150 oysters  very fresh and satisfying ordered a couple other dishes to try and we discovered that the fish  chips here are to die for one big piece of fresh fish in thin panko crust  yummy we didnt have enough and ordered more im not a big fan of thick greasy batter so i really enjoyed their version the octopus salad on the other hand was a little fishy for me

Address: 5120 Salter Street Halifax, NS B3J 0A1 Canada
Review: my boyfriend and i had a holiday  we chose this restaurant for lunch  the service was excellent  the waiter is friendly and patient  however we do not speak english well but the staff listened attentively to our wishes regarding the menu  good impressions tasty romantic atmosphere  i ate pasta with seafood the shrimp had an incredible taste the scallop was tender 3 types of oysters  incredible i definitely recommend this restaurant  at least  taste oysters

Address: 5120 Salter Street Halifax, NS B3J 0A1 Canada
Review: my husband and i went to shucks last night what an amazing experience right from when we stepped into the restaurant the staff is very helpful polite and friendly it was happy hour so we had to indulge in the oysters every oyster was fresh and nicely shucked the best oysters we have ever had and i have had plenty next we had the the suggested meal for my husband baked cod and fish and chips for me once again we thoroughly enjoyed our food we will be back again and again as long as they put out such amazing food we were too full to even consider dessert one recommendation would be to use some sort of noise dampening material in the restaurant as it is very loud making conversation difficult other than the latter it was a totally awesome experience thank you shucks

Address: 5120 Salter Street Halifax, NS B3J 0A1 Canada
Review: very nice place service was amazing and the food was good too pricing is reasonable not cheap but on the lower end in comparison to nearby restaurants for the same foods the facility also has a lot of ecofriendly features one of my favourite being that the bathroom provides fresh towels for drying your hands with a basket under the sink for the used towels rather than wasteful paper towel

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review:
the nachos were absolutely amazing highly recommend the nachos the chicken wings were amazing my husband raved about the flavour of the hot wings they did run out of honey garlic though so i was not able to try the wings myself we ordered dessert along with a cocktail and beer i had the ocean pearl it was very delicious

my husband and i will definitely be back to have the nachos again

restaurant was nice inside with a good atmosphere the option of bar side or restaurant service was also really great friendly and quick

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: yummy the food was amazing and my son and i ate and loved our experience it was truly delicious and our service was exceptional  they got my son a high chair when he asked hes 3 they said sure and brought it right over and cleared the table for us right away etc   they were very nice and sweet girls working here and im very happy with their service and the amazing food  my son ordered fish and chips and his order was huge im very happy with the food we had thanks

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
Review: the service at millstone public house is absolutely top shelf unfortunately i did not enjoy the buttermilk sliders as much as i thought i would they were very dense a but dry and could have used some acidity to round out the flavour of the dish also my cocktail really needed to come with a straw to mix it better the gin royale was sitting on top of the lemonade

Address: 250 Baker Drive Dartmouth, NS B2W 6L4 Canada
