Address: 1919 Upper Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3J5 Canada
Review:
the service was the best part hannah and christian were fantastic and fun to be served by
the burger was tasty although i think i let the bun get a little soggy cause i was busy chatting fries are well seasoned and crispy and the dragon tail cocktail is worth trying great comfy seating with pillows and they close later than other spots in the city my friend got the fish and chips and said it was very tasty as well good place for quiet dinner and drinks with good company

Address: 1919 Upper Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3J5 Canada
Review: we popped in to grab some appetizers to share after walking around the halifax waterfront on an overcast day staff were awesome the food  nachos wings  ribs and charcuterie board  was delicious and the overall atmosphere was perfect we will be back for dinner soon

Address: 1919 Upper Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3J5 Canada
Review: atmosphere is the best love the booths bold colors light fixtures very instaworthy my service tonight was also really good

Address: 1919 Upper Water Street Halifax, NS B3J 3J5 Canada
Review: my wife and i ate here while staying at the marriott we both had the eggs benedict with home fries everything was very good and cooked perfectly the coffee was good as well the service was very good too update we stopped by for a quick bite and drink at happy hour we shared an ocean sampler and it was delicious nice to have other choices besides fried seafood we be definitely going back on our next visit but not going to share this time

Address: 6041 North Street Halifax, NS B3K 1P1 Canada
Review: great food with some value i had the special while my son had the spicy and my wife grabbed the tacos we shared a large fry this was my first visit we went because my son recommended it they have a great menu with something for everyone if you like chicken i hope you like chicken  the burger is a great size with a perfect dredge and flavor topped with the perfect garnish and flavors  the special had cheese which i always shy away from cheese on chicken but is was excellent  go eat and rave the meal was 20 per person which is where the value is  a phenomenal chkn burger side and drink for20 too easy to recommend

Address: 6041 North Street Halifax, NS B3K 1P1 Canada
Review:
ive wanted to try this place for months but never have randomly decided to try it today i got the weekly special which was a jalape√±o cheese chicken bacon sandwich and i got fries alongside it came to 19 before tax 23 after tip

thought for that price is better be good its better than good amazing the chicken sandwich was huge and the fries though looked burnt were not they were perfect in texture and flavor

staff was friendly and the service was quick its expensive but they lived up to the hype will definitely return again someday

Address: 6041 North Street Halifax, NS B3K 1P1 Canada
Review:
the location is ok there are lots of free parking  
decorations and layout  although in my opinion that the restaurant should be classified as fast food the decorations is modest and nice the space is small and can fit small groups
that makes this place unique 
waiting to be seated  my experience we have to wait for 20 minutes to get seated   i understood that the space is not meant for tables serving
time to get the order it was really fast beyond expectations
cleanliness  from my experience  the space is cleanliness is within expectations 
food the good was rich delicious     and tasty   yamy it is well cooked and prepared and the food presentation was good  
prices are affordable and reasonable
staff are friendly and respectful  
conclusion i am coming back for sure

Address: 6041 North Street Halifax, NS B3K 1P1 Canada
Review: this is such a lovely little place first of all the food was excellent freshly made flavourful sandwich  no frozen chicken patties here generous portions  next time ill order a side to split with someone rather than a sandwich and my own side fairly priced for the quality of food you get and i was really impressed with how creative the special sandwich i ordered was this is an order at the counter kind of establishment which i didnt realize but it was very efficient and the staff were helpful and patient while we ordered i imagine the place would be great with a patio in the summer the only reason i removed a star was for reasons of accessibility the restaurant is very cramped inside and that could be a challenge for those who use a mobility aid as well the washrooms have a very narrow door and no handlebars on the wallsreachable sink which does not accomodate for someone in a wheelchair overall we will definitely be back

Address: 6041 North Street Halifax, NS B3K 1P1 Canada
Review: an excellent food stop for a variety of chicken options and sides ive had the 12 chicken and chicken sandwiches and both were excellent id skip the salads but the other sides are very tasty can get a bit pricey if you want sides and drink as theres not meal deals they often have specials too

Address: 30 Farnham Gate Road Halifax, NS B3M 3W8 Canada
Review: the korean food was ok the sushi wasnt good we got there at 630 there was only one waitress and many tables were not cleared until we left

Address: 30 Farnham Gate Road Halifax, NS B3M 3W8 Canada
Review: this place is fantastic the food is absolutely amazing and our waitress was probably the best waitress weve ever had we arrived around 615 and had our first dish japchae within 20 minutes of going through the menu and ordering they also gave us complimentary miso soup and it was excellent we ordered the tiger roll to share as another appetizer and it was pretty great too my girl had the bibimbap and i had the bulgogi and we were both super happy about our meals but the best part of the whole dinner was the bingsu which is absolutely delicious and we will be going back often even if its just for dessert thanks arirang

Address: 30 Farnham Gate Road Halifax, NS B3M 3W8 Canada
Review: your saying the je yuk bo keum 1895 plus tax and you send a small half bowl when its just beef and a bit of veggies

Address: 30 Farnham Gate Road Halifax, NS B3M 3W8 Canada
Review: i ordered take out and was not disappointed in the quality of the food when it came id be interested in dining in one day seems to be pretty great value and delicious

Address: 30 Farnham Gate Road Halifax, NS B3M 3W8 Canada
Review: good koreans and japanese food with lots of options available on the menu we ordered a sushi set and a tofu soup both came pretty quickly although the restaurant was empty there was a bunch of people picking up food for deliveries or take out while we were there food was good but not amazing they also had the shaved ice as a dessert option which was affordable and delicious we ordered the mango shaved ice and it came with frozen mango chunks syrup a scoop of mango ice cream and blueberry cheesecake pieces we spent 50 for two and it was a very filling meal

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B5 Canada
Review: an absolute treasure we attended 2 shows there for the jazz fest and we cannot believe the quality of this place the reservation process was seamless the service outstanding  and the food delicious  however the icing on the cake is the incredible music venue it is from the sound quality to the layout of the room we had the best time enjoying live music and cannot wait to go back kudos to the whole team

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B5 Canada
Review:
went to see the stanfields play on may 12 2023 and it was my very first time there
i absolutely love the atmosphere  the staff was so happy and accommodating and our waiter was the sweetest
i cant say enough good things about this place   the sound is amazing and it has an extremely intimate feel  even though it is quite large   the food is sooooo great i mean what can i say the menu is small and eclectic but everything on it looks fabulous   i had a hard time choosing but finally decided on the crispy chicken sandwich   it was yum   i finished the night with the orange cr√®me br√ªl√©e and a cappuccino had a couple of great drinks in between  lucky for you i have included some photos for your viewing pleasure  i will be back for sure thank you so much to the carlton for such a great night and introduction to your wonderful establishment

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B5 Canada
Review: best place in town to see musicians play in an intimate setting  food is great love their special skinny spiced fries drinks too  the staff are amazing

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B5 Canada
Review: watchd the stanfields play tonight great band only had some appetizers for food from the carleton which was good except the charcuterie board wasnt to our liking staff was pretty low key and had a decent vibe

Address: 1685 Argyle Street Halifax, NS B3J 2B5 Canada
Review: the carleton never disappoints i have been here many times to see some amazing live music tickets are affordable food is delicious and the staff are fantastic i recently purchased 4 tickets to a show and 2 people couldnt make it its was a sold out show and i told the venue i had 2 tickets for anyone on their wait list they credited me that same evening thanks for supporting local also

Address: 135 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C9 Canada
Review:
super friendly people i ordered the donair with cheese i think its my favourite in halifaxdartmouth now it was super good and not crazy messy like most donairs my favorite before i tried this was tonys donair
but hungry hut prepare theirs with much more care and it shows that is why this is now my favorite donair thank you

Address: 135 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C9 Canada
Review: hungry hut has been a staple in the dartmouth community for as long as i can remember the food is amazing especially the donair pockets my fave but the service is really what makes this place special my partner and i both used to come here as kids and hana always lets us know how sweet it is that she sees us together now everyone is always positive smiling and happy to see you whether its been a day a week or a year you can always count on the family of hungry hut to accept you and welcome you home we love hungry hut from the mozzarella sticks roast beef subs donairs all the way to the pizza garlic fingers and deep fried pepperoni theres nothing on their menu that they dont make perfectly support local and you wont be disappointed become part of the hungry hut family

Address: 135 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C9 Canada
Review: this place has the best food and the best prices in town  the people who work there are really nice too and friendly  i had the best pizza pocket in town and my husband had a donair that he says was awesome

Address: 135 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C9 Canada
Review: best large donairs around a little hidden gem and they have great deals too i love their deep fried pepperoni too  awesome staff

Address: 135 Ochterloney Street Dartmouth, NS B2Y 1C9 Canada
Review: always awesome i go their so often they know me and my family by name and what we order  love them always friendly and have quality food best donaor in town

Address: 342 Windmill Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1J1 Canada
Review: so im not one to usually do this  but honestly one of the worst pizzas ive ever had happened a few weeks ago me and my coworkers called and ordered a pizza for pick up  which we didnt realize they closed at 130 and reopened at 4 or 430 we asked if we could pick up at 2 and she informed us but told us it was ok and we could come to the side door and get our pizzas they must have made it right there and then because it was not hot at all by the time we got it i have never opened a pizza box and laughed before but here we are  we did ask for pepperoni on top but they should have informed us it is not your traditional pepperoni  the cheese underneath tasted sour and some of it was not even melted we also got a hawaiian pizza as well which the meat and cheese also tasted rancid we were sick for days after eating this its really sad to see this place go so downhill as it used to be one of the best in the area back in the day i really hope they try and do a bit better

Address: 342 Windmill Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1J1 Canada
Review: hidden gem best donairs ive ever had not pictured a small is large enough to feed two people easily donair meat was spiced perfectly i had a chicken caesar as well that was equally as delicious highly recommend if youre looking for some good eats

Address: 342 Windmill Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1J1 Canada
Review: roberts pizza donair  subs makes delicious food the first thing that i noticed when i picked up my medium donair pizza i asked for no veggies was how heavy it was these pizzas have some serious weight to them beyond that they are layered with meat see the picture the pizza comes with ample sauce on the side since the donair pizza doesnt have tomato sauce dining in was comfortable though there is no wifi excellent experience overall

Address: 342 Windmill Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1J1 Canada
Review:
gettting donairs at roberts has been a tradition with friends for several decades since their old location back home for vacation a visit to roberts was on the agenda one of our friends is well acquainted with the owner malek having made regular stops for donairs when living in new brunswick and cambridge bay

we all enjoyed a tasty donair and a chat with malek the donairs were great but i will need to make two visits there next time to try the pizza  they look delicious

Address: 342 Windmill Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 1J1 Canada
Review:
i was a bite discouraged about my first ordering on uber but glade i got it 75 off with the uber coupon

i order a 16 donair pizza

what i liked was the pizza was huge and weighed a lot love the big pieces of donair chunks and they werent shy with the cheese and donair meat
i loved that the donair sauce came on the side  not being on the pizza it self made the pizza easy to cut without it being sloppy love the idea


what i didnt like was there a inch and a half of the donair meat not covered by cheese making it very dry
looking at the pizza wen first opened cheese topping could of been a bite more cooked and spread out more to the sides of the pizza as there was about a inch and a half of donair meat not covered making it very dry and could of added a bite more tomatos on top
for the crust pizza was over cooked on the bottom and had to cut with a streak knife it was very hard to go true crust but inside of pizza crust wasnt cooked and looked like raw dough

Address: 2398 Robie St Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review:
cute spot cute ambiance great fish tacos and margaritas i have no experience with margaritas but i liked it

first off fish tacos were so good fish was perfectly fried in a crispy batter with great toppings
pork taco was loaded but lacked a wow factor looked good and was filling and juicy though
chicken wings were dryovercooked and the flavour wasnt great reminded me of a cold chinese fried fish dishalso might be a me thing but i wouldnt get it again
nachos were yummy but basic so i felt like the price was a bit high chips were very fresh and crunchy
pork belly bao was yummy but lacked a fresh flavour like cilantro or pickled veg might be a personal preference but the pork belly was yummy and the bao was fantastic

we ordered the classic margarita and i thought it was great i usually hate tequila but im trying to open up and try it again and the agua de jamaica wasnt my jam but that might be a me thing

female asian server was great so nice and helpful but there was the grumpiest looking white female server that might be in the wrong profession i felt intimidated whenever she glanced at our table she brought out our nachos and practically rolled her eyes while adding another table to ours i told her to leave nachos on the bench table was full beside me no biggie just big frowns the whole time we were there

overall pretty good experience kinda pricy 135 for 2 people but will be back for more delicious fish tacos and margaritas

Address: 2398 Robie St Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: i loved the atmosphere and how delicious everything was its a small venue with limited seating allowing the staff and kitchen to focus on quality food and service i also loved how the menu was short you knew that whatever you ordered would be delicious the food did not disappoint the nachos and the tacos were so tasty and generous portions ill be back and next time to try their bao ice cream sandwich

Address: 2398 Robie St Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: i went to el chino for my sisters bachelorette party we wanted a mixology themed event and k and her team really delivered they organized a super fun informative  delicious evening they were incredibly friendly and helped us through all the steps of crafting our own cocktails they went above and beyond by decorating the space and crafting personalized cocktails we also tried some of their snacks which were very tasty and generous cant recommend them enough perfect space for a small event or just an evening out with loved ones

Address: 2398 Robie St Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: great food great service the restaurant itself is quite small they dont take reservations its worth the wait though the bao are amazing the cucumber salad is refreshing the nachos are a big serving great for sharing but pretty basic

Address: 2398 Robie St Halifax, NS B3K Canada
Review: really enjoyed my first experience here at el chino a friend recommended it because of the tacos and we were excited to try it we had the pork dumplings general tao chicken wings and the pork tacos everything was delicious the standout item was definitely the tacos they were jam packed and very authentic mexican tasting its definitely a little bit pricey for what you get which is the only reason i didnt give it a full 5 stars however they do call them self a snack bar so its not exactly a dinner destination so i may do it right next time and just pop in here when i crave a little snack rather than a full meal

Address: 6214 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A3 Canada
Review: first time dining in at truly tasty and it was amazing if we could rare it more than 5 stars we would we got the gnocchi appetizer a soba a ramen and a rice bowl and every single dish was generous flavourful and beautiful will be back to try the other items on the menu best ramen restaurant in halifax by far

Address: 6214 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A3 Canada
Review:
the best ramen you will have in halifax

food is extremely tasty portion is generous service is 55 they should get more recognitions

Address: 6214 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A3 Canada
Review: the name of the restaurant is accurate we really enjoyed our ramens with homemade noodles and amazing flavors the portion are generous the vegetarian options are great the staff is friendly nice place

Address: 6214 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A3 Canada
Review: had the shoyo chansu ramen and the fried chicken the portions are kinda big so come hungry great flavors and fast service even during the lunch rush

Address: 6214 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A3 Canada
Review:
my husband and i just ate there for the first time we ordered spicy tan tan ramen spicy kimchi ramen and the fried chicken to start

everything was delicious portions were huge i couldnt finish my ramen and have enough left over for an entire other meal

this was the best ramen weve ever had fresh flavorful ready quick excellent broth and the service was perfection 1010 would recommend

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: best sushi on the east coast amazing service atmosphere  fresh sushi that is always perfect dine in or take out gonna miss this place so much after living here for 7 years we will be back when we come  visit the maritimes

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: visited from toronto and first time trying restaurant they had a good variety of selections  i chose the dinner special with soup and salad which were both very good  the sushi plate had california roll spicy tuna assorted sushi and sashimi  the platter was good but sashimi was cut a bit too thick  i have eaten a lot of sushi and sushi nami was just okay

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: had our lunch they open 12nn every sunday we came early around 11 am they charge extra 15 service fee if you exceed 5 person we are 6 but its considerable because they got nice and good service nd food

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: canada day lunch awesome sushi delicious desserts and overall a wonderful experience

Address: 149 Hector Gate Dartmouth, NS B3B 0E5 Canada
Review: not  the greatest   but if you dont know good sushi then you may think its a good place   plus you shouldnt have to worry about  bones

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review: the food is always delicious and comes out fast i love getting a bunch of appetizers and having small dishes and its a great place for that

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review:
this is a pretty decent sushi restaurant middling food but not terrible they have a wide variety of options if you want to explore some new flavors

the interior design and atmosphere is probably the best part about this place  a wide sushi bar takes up the middle of the space and the entire restaurant is slightly sunken into the building which makes it feel a little quieter despite being right downtown

they have a pretty nice variety of beverages including an interesting ramune flavored drink which i would recommend if its still available

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review: went to get sushi downtown for a lunch date with a friend i ordered the maki lunch providing me with a delicious plate full of rolls the atmosphere in the restaurant is very nice with kind servers to bring you your food the miso soup was excellent and the spicy salmon rolls were very yummy however the house salad was not very good and some of the rolls had an uneven proportion of elements making each bite slightly unbalanced overall a good place to go for a reasonably priced sushi lunch deal

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review: great fresh sushi the quality of the food makes up for any other shortcomings i was there on a holiday weekend canada day and it was clear they were not prepared to be that busy the staff was struggling to keep up but once i finally got my food it was amazing would definitely recommend to anyone

Address: 1458 Queen Street Suite 102 Halifax, NS B3J 2H7 Canada
Review:
the sashimi is a must big chunks of meltinyourmouth salmon tuna  escolar this cantoneseowned place has been a halifax classic and i was happy to know theyre still open this newer location has great decor and is very spacious waitress was very polite

rolls were somewhat of a letdown on the day we went but tasted good they are a bit loose sparse and some classics like the dragon roll while not bad here didnt taste as good as some other restaurants

Address: 5144 Morris Street Halifax, NS B3J 1T6 Canada
Review: this place is as authentic as it gets in nova scotia i have never had a bad meal here and i am a repeat customer the pizza is the best in the province and so is the tiramisu i would definitely recommend this place for a formal dinner date or a casual lunch

Address: 5144 Morris Street Halifax, NS B3J 1T6 Canada
Review:
i love the wood fire oven pizza from this establishment  the beet salad is equally amazing  the burger week burger was also tasty  in 2022  i eat here regularly and have never had a bad experience  great place to pull up a seat at the bar solo for a drink and apertivo or to go on a date night with your partner atmospheric and the staff are over the top friendly  cannot suggest this place enough
edit1 burger week burger is insane best i had all week 2023 edit 2 now owned and operated by new management as of 2023_07_07 still the same vibes for now but with more creative freedom over the food i would think down the road the place will be redone inside for a new and refreshing feel  cant wait  sincerely longtime supporter

Address: 5144 Morris Street Halifax, NS B3J 1T6 Canada
Review: the food was delicious the service was excellent  we went to celebrate my friends anniversary and they gave us a courtesy liquor shot to all of us

Address: 5144 Morris Street Halifax, NS B3J 1T6 Canada
Review:
not enough sauce or cheese raw ingredients and middle barely any prosciutto on the siciliana  not impressed

not enough selection no quattro formaggi  perche

Address: 5144 Morris Street Halifax, NS B3J 1T6 Canada
Review: i never leave reviews but me and my mom came in a few minutes before closing and the service was great we got takeout and they gave us free focaccia bread and a lemon dessert on the house the meal came within 10 minutes of ordering worth the price the ambience was great and they had 3 display vespas 1010

Address: 1887 Upper Water St Halifax, NS B0J 1W5 Canada
Review: we had our wedding at lower deck and i really cant say enough about the entire team laura and larissa are beyond amazing they are so well organized and basically took away all my stress the staff were so lovely and every guest commented how great the food was thank you to the lower deck team for making our day absolutely perfect would highly recommend

Address: 1887 Upper Water St Halifax, NS B0J 1W5 Canada
Review: awesome venue for a smallmedium sized wedding weve photographed here multiple times and its always been an absolute treat the decor is really rustic super into the wooden slats and dope spot for dancing its also right in the historic properties on the waterfront which is perfect for portraits and super beautiful it is a dark venue but as long as you hire photographers who know how to shoot there you are golden 1010 recommend

Address: 1887 Upper Water St Halifax, NS B0J 1W5 Canada
Review:
i mean what can you say about this iconic location we went for supper and a beer but ended up staying until last call the band that playing that night was excellent and once the place got busy we just ended up staying despite the place being extremely full the staff was attentive

i would not recommend this place to anyone who gets claustrophobic as once the band starts playing it is very hard to move we were there on a wednesday evening and it was a busy as a friday night

otherwise we had a great night and of course i highly recommend the lower deck for a true maritime experience

Address: 1887 Upper Water St Halifax, NS B0J 1W5 Canada
Review: i didnt stay long had a corona on the patio waiter was a bit odd but better than rude the service was really fast but i had to pay for each drink when i got it kinda odd but ok

Address: 1887 Upper Water St Halifax, NS B0J 1W5 Canada
Review:
had the fish n chips and it was pretty good

went a second time and was told it was a 9 a person charge for live music we were just looking for a quick bite to eat so ended up leaving i do feel 9 cover charge is a bit much though

Address: 32 Albro Lake Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 3X8 Canada
Review: i was wrong when i expected some glossy noodles with heavy taste they are not we ordered three types of noodles and each has its distinct colour i didnt taste any msg and each has its tasteful personality neither did i have hiccups after meal like other greasy chinese takeout

Address: 32 Albro Lake Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 3X8 Canada
Review: never heard of this restaurant before  decided to give it a try im so glad i did the food is incredible  the rice and eggrolls are delicious 1010 from food to customer service  i will be back

Address: 32 Albro Lake Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 3X8 Canada
Review: had almost everything on this menu and i love it  every time i visit halifax i do my best to stop in for a plate

Address: 32 Albro Lake Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 3X8 Canada
Review: came here twice now big portions and tasty

Address: 32 Albro Lake Road Dartmouth, NS B3A 3X8 Canada
Review: this is the go to chinese food restaurant i have found after a long search since living in nova scotia when giving the rating i separate its rating category in comparison to going to a fine dining experience so far i have had the items from a dinner for 2 plus meat spring rolls  nothing short of being blown away every item was cooked as close to perfection you can get each item deserves a thorough review as they all genuinely surprised me but i shall not for both our sake flavour consistency portions and a truly harmonious balance of greaseoilmoisture in each item i have not had a bad experience i wont ever care even if i do this establishment has both earned my respect and culinary appreciation please dont order from them on a food app its worth the effort

Address: 80 Hogan Court Bedford, NS B4B 2H1 Canada
Review: visited them for brunch had to wait for 15 minutes but they do text you when the table is available the staff was friendly the place had a happy vibe perfect for a breakfast place the pancakes were delicious and the portion size is good as well would visit again to try other menu items

Address: 80 Hogan Court Bedford, NS B4B 2H1 Canada
Review:
spotless restaurant coffee great thermos on the table too  the staff were helpful and kind multiple flavors of maple syrup
55 menu only 999 in most cases the same size as 55 but cheeper
receipt attached regular menu prices quite reasonable very cool hash browns multi grain toast
nice clean bathrooms

Address: 80 Hogan Court Bedford, NS B4B 2H1 Canada
Review: very friendly staff wasnt busy at all omelets are very good and a large portion had to take home half was a bit disappointed  there was eggs benedict advertised but it wasnt available until tomorrow i would think something shouldnt be advertised if you cant get it overall a good place to have an enjoyable meal

Address: 80 Hogan Court Bedford, NS B4B 2H1 Canada
Review: i am seriously disappointed at the ihop here in bedford i have eaten at ihops in the united states and absolutely loved it the nova scotia version is a disappointment i just ordered the cinnastacks and only have cinnamon on the top not in between the stacks the cream cheese drizzle was lacking as well

Address: 80 Hogan Court Bedford, NS B4B 2H1 Canada
Review: delicious food but often a bit of a wait however i discovered that you can order take out so for mothers day we did just that called about 40 minutes ahead of time and staff was very helpful to get our order right take out bags had everything we needed to enjoy a perfect breakfast at home

Address: 540 Southgate Drive Bedford, NS B4A 0E1 Canada
Review: best pictou county pizza and garlic finger in town super generous on cheese and ingredients  very fast and friendly delivery person definitely will come back

Address: 540 Southgate Drive Bedford, NS B4A 0E1 Canada
Review:
i definitely recommend nayya to every pizza lover they probably have the biggest pizza collection in the entire ns i have never seen this much variety anywhere else amazing and very exciting quality of the food was superb taste was fantastic and very balanced
staff are super super friendly and i really liked their behaviour specially mr amin whose behaviour and customer care discipline should be a role model to many famous restaurants in halifax such a down to earth and nice person
i am so happy to have found this place its a game changer for me

Address: 540 Southgate Drive Bedford, NS B4A 0E1 Canada
Review:
one of the best place to have variety of pizzas subs and many more customer service is really good especially mr amin sanjam is a really good person who always has a smile on his face all crew members were really nice they did their best

3 cheese garlic fingers and margherita pizza highly recommended

55 pizza base made from fresh dough  one of the best i ever had
55 fresh toppings
55 overall food
55 customer service
55 ambiance
45 wait time  this is normal as compare to other restaurants
55 mr amin

Address: 540 Southgate Drive Bedford, NS B4A 0E1 Canada
Review: so yummy we live just around the corner and often get pizza from other places in the area but thought wed try this new place we were not disappointed  it arrived quickly and was hot fresh and really delicious loads of fresh toppings the taste is so amazing and perfect everyone raved about how tasty the sauce is  and how generous the toppings were this is now our goto pizza place best pizza in the area and best price in the area

Address: 540 Southgate Drive Bedford, NS B4A 0E1 Canada
Review:
put this on your bucket list well worth the hour travel

wow i was super impressed at this recommendation from my friend i ordered the gourmet donair with garlic fingers combo and it did not disappoint carved tastefully spiced donair meat right off the stick and the ingredients where to die for the garlic fingers were on point and soo good

the wife ordered the shawarma platter not realizing how huge it was and absolutely loved it i took a few bites of it as well and it was tasty

the child ordered the fish and chips but she thoroughly enjoyed them

price point is on the higher side but you are getting a lot of food pretty sure we could split the shawarma or the donair pizza between the three of us

my only complaint was the dine in experience could have been made better minus the timers constantly chiming in the background otherwise zero complaints for us

Address: 772 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 1A2 Canada
Review: very professional staff their mussels dish is very good after that their lobster sandwich is good but it is totally unacceptable that their calamari dish is calamari taken directly from a deepfrozen bag and the same goes for their french fries even with their vegetables which are all taken from frozen bags for a restaurant in halifax where youre not looking for fast food they serve calamari that i can enjoy at home just by taking it out of a bag and frying it forget frozen food increase price of your dishes and your gonna be the king of your area with happy customer and same profits

Address: 772 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 1A2 Canada
Review: this is a cozy restaurant along the bedford coast i go there very often since its close to my work place i am curious to know why mostly elders eat there its normally full at peak time the food is not too bad and reasonably priced i like the coffee which is refilled my friend cyntia absolutely love the coconut pie cake

Address: 772 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 1A2 Canada
Review: came just for the lobster roll and it did not disappoint overall a great diner spot for lunch the chowder was good too

Address: 772 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 1A2 Canada
Review: very cozy family friendly place chowder was fantastic server was very friendly and helpful loved this place will go back more

Address: 772 Bedford Hwy Bedford, NS B4A 1A2 Canada
Review:
excellent food and service coming from a landlocked city i forgot that seafood was supposed to taste like this  we had the seafood chowder and fishchips  the shellfish felt like butter in my mouth and the dish flaked easily but still moist  the chowder was not thick but rather like a cream soup  the fish and chips was light and not oily

service was very friendly and attentive had the feel of a seafood dinner with its relaxed local atmosphere

price point is decent for the quality of the food  the presentation is what you expect for a diner but the flavour is far above

Address: 6403 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A7 Canada
Review:
we were in the area and looking at dine in options i found this restaurant and was sold by reviews immediately i knew i had to try it not sure how you can spend there 1020 per person you eithereat like a bird or dont like rolls we ordered bento box udon couple rolls and icecream with bananas i wouldnt call it a lot of food per person our bill was a little over 60 per 2 people
the food was very fresh and delicious complementary rolls were also very good i wouldnt think of ordering them myself but the combinations of ingredients make them so yummy i will order them next time
i would definitely recommend the place

Address: 6403 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A7 Canada
Review: what does excellent customer service mean  this answer the wasabi house sure knows  the food was wonderful the waitress was incredibly friendly and attentive and the cooks were happy to receive customers  it sure makes all the difference

Address: 6403 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A7 Canada
Review: they stopped dinein since the pandemic started heard they resumed dinein recently and decided to go for lunch  the sushi tastes the same as before the food is fresh and the service is as good as ever  the two of us ordered three rolls and tempura shrimp the boss gave us a large plate of sushi for free in the end we paid less than 35 and took a large box home  i will be back again

Address: 6403 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A7 Canada
Review:
if you see other reviewers saying that they get free rolls theyre right i ordered 2 rolls and they gave me 2 extra rolls on the house

this makes wasabi house a truly reasonablypriced restaurantperhaps the best one in halifax

Address: 6403 Quinpool Road Halifax, NS B3L 1A7 Canada
Review: the service was fantastic and the sushi was delicious we have food allergies and they were very good about making sure we could eat the sushi the chef made us extra on the house it was a great experience

Address: 5501 Boulevard Gouin O Montreal, QC H4J 1C8 Canada
Review:
we came here specifically for poutine and was not disappointed

we ordered a traditional poutine and popcorn chicken poutine the gravy was good and not too salty the popcorn chicken was still crispy and the squeaky cheese was perfect

they have so many different options for poutine that i would need to come back

the restaurant is a small local vibe and is 247 just a heads up they only accept cash

Address: 5501 Boulevard Gouin O Montreal, QC H4J 1C8 Canada
Review: my favourite food place ever the best poutine in montreal also restaurant working until late recommend everyone to visit especially try their pancakes with chocolate and strawberries for dessert

Address: 5501 Boulevard Gouin O Montreal, QC H4J 1C8 Canada
Review: i personally dont understand the hype of this place i had the bbq poutine and the poulet extreme grilled cheese the grilled cheese was good but the poutine was horrible the gravy was good not too salty and there were a lot of cheese curds however the fries were not good i feel as though they were fried in old bad oil i dont understand how people can say this is the best poutine in montreal i was extremely disappointed the service was not great the waitress messed up the order maybe its because she was new but it didnt make my experience enjoyable

Address: 5501 Boulevard Gouin O Montreal, QC H4J 1C8 Canada
Review:
cash only placethey have a withdrawal machine but the machine doesnt always have cash in it

best comfort food ive had in mtl
the food is always on point whether you pick it up or on uber eats

they put the perfect portion of cheese curds and gravy on the poutine

fell in love with the smoked meat grilled cheese

the burgers are all so good always having trouble deciding which one to get

the staff has always been super nice

definitely the place to go to satisfy your comfort food cravings

they have a small seating area which is always packed this place is mostly packed during night time also

they do breakfast lunch dinner late snack
i also love there thin crepes with strawberry and bananas

im obsessed with this place

Address: 5501 Boulevard Gouin O Montreal, QC H4J 1C8 Canada
Review: great food in general a table could hold up to 56 people maximum would recommend for small group of friends for a night out could be a little busy at night because it is one of few places opened at that time

Address: 1844 Rue Sainte-Catherine O Montreal, QC H3H 1M1 Canada
Review:
despite my name  i am actually japanese and for the first time since moving here i felt like i was eating real japanese food we ordered the bone marrow  yakitori forty eight hour pork w curry and deep fried beans  all of which were excellent with that said as is usually the case with small plate restaurants the dish you least expect ends up being the highlight of the meal today the green beans were no exception to this rule the combination of rich truffle mayo and salty and crunchy beans was perfect

i was also surprised to find actual vegetable chunks in the curry personally i prefer when restaurant opt to make a more homestyle sauce instead of blending it smooth

overall a fantastic meal will definitely be bringing my japanese mother here

Address: 1844 Rue Sainte-Catherine O Montreal, QC H3H 1M1 Canada
Review: we had a group of six and it took us more than 15 hours to get a seat on a saturday night that being said the food was good but the drinks are desserts were the highlight for me yuzu beer and ginger beer was amazing the black tea soft serve ice cream was the best part get the homemade ice cream for sure food wise it was a little over hyped i read the reviews on google and a lot of people recommended the tuna salmon bowl so i ordered it it was good but wasnt fully worth the hype it felt like it had more salad in it that salmon instead i would recommend ordering the 48 hr pork or lamb the fried beans for appetizer was good and came in a large portion

Address: 1844 Rue Sainte-Catherine O Montreal, QC H3H 1M1 Canada
Review: a must go to restaurant they are the nicest people ever they are super understanding when it comes to allergies and the food is so flavorful and feels like youre in japan you feel like youre at home i came here from the united states and i would honestly fly back to canada just to come back and eat here again we came in 30 minutes before they closed and they were still were kind and sweet were sorry we came here late but thank you so much for the amazing service and food

Address: 1844 Rue Sainte-Catherine O Montreal, QC H3H 1M1 Canada
Review: there is a reason that theres always a lineup in front of this restaurant  its simply the best one in town so flavourful and mouthwatering we enjoy every single dishes i especially love the beef carpaccio the sashimis and the shrimp burgers the wait is about 45 minutes depending on what time you arrive they make their own soft ice cream which is extremely delicious

Address: 1844 Rue Sainte-Catherine O Montreal, QC H3H 1M1 Canada
Review: always a lineup at this place you will not find sushis but authentic izakaya style japanese foods the place is always crowded if you dont want to wait start to line up at 1645 when they open their doors at 1700

Address: 1201 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1K4 Canada
Review: my second time here and it was just as amazing as my first time we decided to order only appetizers tonight and all were amazing thanks to the awesome recommendations of our waiter if its your first time i highly recommend trying the tasting menubring your appetite fantastic ambience and amazing service enjoy

Address: 1201 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1K4 Canada
Review: damas is my newest favorite restaurant everything was to perfection the food is incredible from the texture of the hummus to the grilled veggies its the tastiest food it was so good and very good portions the waiter was able to guide us through the menu and we did not regret an of the choices the drink were also very good and the decor and ambiance were fun

Address: 1201 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1K4 Canada
Review:
i have never eaten syrian food before this was an incredible culinary introduction to fantastic food the food was delicious the service was attentive and the atmosphere was nice

my only issue is that this seems like a restaurant worth going to with a few people to split and share the food it is an expensive place and my wife and i ordered too much food for 2 people go with friends

Address: 1201 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1K4 Canada
Review:
not the first visit and will go back again and again for sure  its a beautiful dining experience  u feel like u went on small  vacation 
its pricy so its not to be repeated every other week   but the ambiance is very nice  the music in the background  the excellent service and exquisite menu  the place is always packed but you never feel rushed to eat and you dont feel waitresses are stress and running around  every thing is organized and chill 
one tiny note  i used to like the hotly served bread better in the past  again excellent experience

Address: 1201 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1K4 Canada
Review: we took the tasting menu with wine pairing exceptional wine honestly it was expensive and i was expecting that the wine pairing were awesome the food itself for the most part was amazing and really tasteful except for the desert  i must admit though i was still hungry after a 400 bill which is a bit disappointing no matter how good the food was

Address: 2059 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1N3 Canada
Review:
weve been the montreal branch found it better than laval service is only okay i mean from
the welcoming to the availability of our table sharp at the time of reservation food is always very good in both branches order from what they have on the special menu for the night often you will be satisfied and its always good to twist the menu and add new things no problem for the prices very reasonable for this very high quality of pizza

Address: 2059 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1N3 Canada
Review: i have eaten bottega pizza before but never at the laval location i got a chance to eat more than just the pizza which is always delicious but a good amount of many other dishes and it was all phenomenal the atmosphere of the restaurant was only bettered by the incredible and kind staff an incredibly authentic italian experience i cant wait to go back again highly recommend

Address: 2059 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1N3 Canada
Review: i went to this restaurant yesterday with my boyfriend and we were both shocked of how delicious the pizza was i never tasted a pizza like that before it was incredible all the flavours were there everything seemed fresh we also had desert the ice cream was chefs kiss also the staff was great everything is 1010 im very satisfied

Address: 2059 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1N3 Canada
Review:
i want to bottega for the first time for a work party and it was hands th√© th√© best italian restaurant ive been too
the staff was very friendly in answering my questions telling me about the lastest specials and really knew the menu well
i recommended literally a lot of things on the menu especially the lamp piece which is 1010 juicy
the portions are decently sized to really enjoy a appetizer main dish and desert for a good fair price for the quality you are recieving
1010

Address: 2059 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1N3 Canada
Review: most tasty place for me cuisine at the highest level

Address: 1223 Rue du Square-Phillips Montreal, QC H3B 3E9 Canada
Review: one of the best pizza i ve ever eaten enjoyed the atmosphere too located in one of the most touristic places of the city montreal enjoyed the draft beer and salad czars before our pizza guys you are perfect my wife and i enjoyed our friday evening there and was there the next day for saturday lunch cant wait for the weekend to go there again

Address: 1223 Rue du Square-Phillips Montreal, QC H3B 3E9 Canada
Review: i was amazed by how large the menu was and how many options were available just on pizza our waiter was wellseasoned and his recommendations were exactly what we needed this restaurant was founded in the early 1980s and i found the taste of the pizzas nostalgic here is a musttry spot if you are a pizza lover like me

Address: 1223 Rue du Square-Phillips Montreal, QC H3B 3E9 Canada
Review: freshly made pizza and really fantastic there is lot of choices you can select last but not the least the tiramisu was so good that i highly recommended

Address: 1223 Rue du Square-Phillips Montreal, QC H3B 3E9 Canada
Review: the pizza was so good i can not have lactose so when i saw that were two options for cheese i was thrilled i got the number 11 with lactose free cheese and my goodness i finished the whole thing my sister enjoyed her pizza as well we definitely recommend this place if you have some dietary restrictions

Address: 1223 Rue du Square-Phillips Montreal, QC H3B 3E9 Canada
Review:
i was surprised to suddenly find this place in the city center considering that i passed by many times but did not pay attention and this was my mistake im crazy about pizza so going to a restaurant with 77 types of pizzas  going to heaven the service is very fast my order was ready in 7 minutes
by the way there is a beautiful view of the park and skyscrapers from here

Address: 2491 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H3J 1N6 Canada
Review:
this was one for the record books a flight over to canada a booking made in advanced a clear my schedule kind of evening

from the moment you set foot in joe beef you know youre in for a what can only be described as romantically gluttonous time

we started with the seafood platter scallops the size of my fist with an added lobster tails for good measure moving onto the octopus bouillabaisse sweetbreads duck and hanger steak all with their own amazing sauces that seemed to almost glue the dish together with richness

the staff were welcoming and made us feel right at ease in our quest to tackle the menu throughout each dish we were almost confused where to start and end as each bite was just better than the last

a full but nonintimidating wine list let us make the best of our food settling on a lovely riesling

did we travel to canada just for joe beef no but would it have been worth it if it was the only place we visited yes

Address: 2491 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H3J 1N6 Canada
Review: we were a party of 3 and loved everything that joe beef offered we had high expectations and it exceeded it flo made our experience even better with all his recommendations they are known for their lobster pasta but honestly just ask whats good they are the professionals after all all the staff were lovely and so courteous thank you so much for the experience

Address: 2491 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H3J 1N6 Canada
Review:
i will be honest i can see why some people will say that it is the best restaurant in town
however it is just not for me

i have seen better french cuisine restaurant with a larger menu and product that are just as fresh and local even if its about the same price i would still prefer the one with larger menu

the waiting time is quite dreadful i understand that it is a smaller sized restaurant but waiting for an hour and 15 minutes isnt exactly ideal for the food quality received food was okay fries were extremely salty

have to give credits to the waiters for refilling our cup every 10 minutes so the service is really up on another level

the booking has to be made too much in advance in order to guarantee a spot this is due to the fact that the restaurant is very small and has a very large title under its belt

maybe the place is really the most astonishing place to visit or maybe my brokeneess has limited my vision towards fancy restaurant and made me unable to understand the reaction by most people but i would say that it is definitely a restaurant that you would go for once or twice in a lifetime not more unfortunately

Address: 2491 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H3J 1N6 Canada
Review: joe beef was one of the many reasons we first visited montreal the food here meets and some cases exceeds expectations the drinks are also very well made the perfect martini is a great way to start the meal along with some oysters and one of the specials as an appetizer the lobster pasta was insanely good along with the special of short rib that we got this time around the desserts are also so so good hits the mark all around great place and will definitely go again

Address: 2491 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H3J 1N6 Canada
Review: this was a fantastic experience the restaurant feels very low key but the food and drinks were phenomenal do whatever it takes to get online once the reservations are released and grab a table before theyre all snatched up

Address: 735 boul D√©carie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L3 Canada
Review:
quality price the food isnt bad but its not as good as before thats why im disappointed a few years back it was one of my go spot

the portions are generous but the dumplings are my biggest disappointment the skin of the dumplings were too thick and the meat had no flavor i could not distinguish which one was beef lamb or pork

Address: 735 boul D√©carie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L3 Canada
Review: decent sunday evening dining experience homemade noodles were great the smoked tofu  cucumber salad was ok the steamed dumplings were a bit too thick yet ok the skewed squid was meh decor and hygiene can be improved and byob is a huge pro will be back one day to try more stuff

Address: 735 boul D√©carie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L3 Canada
Review:
pretty quiet environment service was fast and took the shrimp dumpling and the chicken general tao the chicken general tao was actually pretty good  love the crisp of it and portion was alright

as for the dumpling was little disappointed for the price the texture was little harder to chew than the usual ones but overall its alright my experience  will probably come again to try their others stuff on the menu

Address: 735 boul D√©carie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L3 Canada
Review:
i ordered from this restaurant since i was with friends and we wanted to eat dumplings we ordered 4 types of dumplings
they gave us a good recommendation of which one should be fried and which one should be steamed it was pretty on point
also for the price payed it was pretty good quality and quantity i definitely would recommend this restaurant for dumplings it will be my go to place from now on

Address: 735 boul D√©carie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L3 Canada
Review: absolutely amazing dumplings great quantity and fair price peanut butter sauce is delicious as well

Address: 1255 Rue Crescent Montreal, QC H3G 2B1 Canada
Review: i could talk about this place for hours first of all great music i announced that i loved a song they were playing probably around 5 times second of all everything was so so accessible for my allergies which is rare for an asian restaurant gluten sensitivity their meats are marinated in gluten free sauces so i was able to enjoy my meal with my family without concerns of cross contamination finally the service was amazing the server was so incredibly kind and helpful with my allergies and knew the menu front to back she provided helpful advice on how much food we should order and reminded us on the allergens for every dish she brought out overall i would definitely recommend and i will be visiting soon in my area

Address: 1255 Rue Crescent Montreal, QC H3G 2B1 Canada
Review:
first time trying this place beyond my expectation

the ambiance is great music lots of happy customers enjoying their food

our two waitresses back to back very friendly and efficient always made sure we had everything explained to us every dish they would bring to our table

food wise the meat and seafood were quite fresh and tasty except for the kimchi not the usual korean kimchi it was overall too sweet and not spicy

price is definitely not cheap for those with budget but definitely worth going very nice experience definitely will go back

Address: 1255 Rue Crescent Montreal, QC H3G 2B1 Canada
Review: i have been to gyukaku a few times and i would easily recommend this over korean bbqs around theres a lot to choose from and its always too much meat for me even when i went for lunch and had two meats lunch course but the ambiance is amazing not a big fan of cooking my own food id rather get salmonella from the chefs cooking than my own but they change the grill frequently so thats one good thing the garlic fried rice is delicious and the basic meats are great overall i definitely recommend this place 4 stars because i am not a big fan of the whole grilling your own meat concept

Address: 1255 Rue Crescent Montreal, QC H3G 2B1 Canada
Review:
be sure to call beforehand as they are always fully booked

this is my best friend and is goto place
they have a lot of food choices very good variety and very good quality meat and marinades they also have good tasting desserts beware it is not an all you can eat if thats what you are looking for

weve been eating here a lot and each time i have forgotten to take photos before we completely demolish them heres a photo of the desserts though

Address: 1255 Rue Crescent Montreal, QC H3G 2B1 Canada
Review:
love it the quality food is impeccable alot of meat options for groups or individuals services a little slow but normal because they get full house easily so you better reserve your spot in advance and also it is not an all you can eat you have to pay by pieces so get your wallet ready if you are planning eating without minding cost because its abit pricey but worth it
ps if you cant finish your cooked food you can ask for a transport box to bring it home

Address: 2575 Boulevard Daniel-Johnson Laval, QC H7T 1S8 Canada
Review: hands down the best veg√© ramens available everything from the broth to the noodles was great their rice noodles have great texture and doesnt get soft and pasty like other places but that spicy miso broth was the star of the night in the future i hope they add spicy tofu and fried potatoes on the menu those would be delicious in ramen great food great atmosphere

Address: 2575 Boulevard Daniel-Johnson Laval, QC H7T 1S8 Canada
Review: food is great as always but service was really slow the beef donburi is pretty good the pork tonkotsu ramen is a classic

Address: 2575 Boulevard Daniel-Johnson Laval, QC H7T 1S8 Canada
Review:
the food is good and especially delicious during winter we liked the beef ramen but personally we liked the pork better

what was a bit annoying was the waiting time we first had to wait 20 minutes for a table which you had to install yelp and then another 40 minutes for two bowls of ramen and our order got mixed up

so good food but the service and waiting time was what brought the rating down

Address: 2575 Boulevard Daniel-Johnson Laval, QC H7T 1S8 Canada
Review: i went to kinton ramen with my boyfriend for dinner and it was packed the staff was friendly overall i ordered the pork shoyu and my boyfriend ordered the pork miso unfortunately the shoyu lacked flavor compared to the miso but the miso itself wasnt exceptional either while the portion sizes were good for the price we were disappointed with the taste of both ramens

Address: 2575 Boulevard Daniel-Johnson Laval, QC H7T 1S8 Canada
Review: good ramen at a good price servers were friendly would come here again i got the original pork ramen good but a little bland for my liking and the pork was tougher than i wouldve liked

Address: 7153 Chemin de la C√¥te-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3R 2M2 Canada
Review:
good little restaurant i had the dry phnom penh soup egg rolls fried chinese doughnuts and an avocado smoothie
even though the restaurant was full the wait was not too long about 10min service was quite quick the soup was tasty the egg rolls were amazing the fried doughnuts were crispy great little meal just dont forget to bring your cash because it is cash only

Address: 7153 Chemin de la C√¥te-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3R 2M2 Canada
Review:
food is great and staff is nice i had a phnom penh with soup on the side you can have the option of choosing rice noodle wheat noodle or both together

not the best localisation though and not much place to seat its toddler friendly baby seats
parking hard to find

overall it was worth my 30 mins drive and 5 mins time of searching for a parking

Address: 7153 Chemin de la C√¥te-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3R 2M2 Canada
Review: authentic food i liked it very much ive never tried cambodian food before but i found it super good highly recommend

Address: 7153 Chemin de la C√¥te-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3R 2M2 Canada
Review: this was my first time trying authentic cambodian food the soup was delicious the sliced meat was tender and the broth was flavourful truly a hidden gem satisfied customer from toronto

Address: 7153 Chemin de la C√¥te-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3R 2M2 Canada
Review: hu tieu mi nam vang soup phnom penh  is delicious  good service

Address: 1624 Rue Sainte-Catherine Ouest Montreal, QC H3H 2S7 Canada
Review: i personally had a mediocre experience we were sat at the worst table that was wobbly and next to a large group of loud people even though i had made a reservation prior other tables were available and i do realize i should have asked for a different table the drinks are really good but do not order the set menu its boring and repetitive not any of the dishes had a wow factor and for a table dh√¥te you would expect the dishes to be better curated i still think some of the other dishes might be delicious though on another hand the decor is very charming and the bathrooms are top tier visit the bathroom just for the experience you wont regret it note that the music is very loud and its hard to hear each other talk one thing that really bothered me though is the poor service the dishes were served not in order it took them very long to pick up empty plates and overall they looked like they did not want to be there l√©a was the only one that should be a server since she at least had the ability to smile and check on us a couple of times

Address: 1624 Rue Sainte-Catherine Ouest Montreal, QC H3H 2S7 Canada
Review: the atmosphere here is clean open and casual the service we were provided with was also top and one of the best everyone was so nice and the food was so good i honestly recommend their cocktails too  i had the mojito lychee and it was the most refreshing cocktails ever i wish i could try all their cocktails for food we ordered okonomiyaki to share karaage curry and sukiyaki curry udon the price here is so reasonable and the portions are very large if you havent been definitely try

Address: 1624 Rue Sainte-Catherine Ouest Montreal, QC H3H 2S7 Canada
Review:
ordered almost everything on the menu
must try cold noodles udon fried chickenkaragge sushi cheese curry rice

dont recommend the fried stuff beside chicken because they all tasted burnt and bitter

overall 1012 dishes were good
one of the best jp restaurants in the street

Address: 1624 Rue Sainte-Catherine Ouest Montreal, QC H3H 2S7 Canada
Review:
we came here on a wednesday night we didnt have any reservations but we didnt mind sitting at the bar area

its a cute little place that has an open chicken

when we walked in you can instantly see the interaction between the employees which i loved they were calling out of each other when a customer was coming in or leaving and also when it came to food

the service was good we ordered and the food came in pretty fast

we ordered miso soup seaweed and tofu salad veggie dumplings udon carbonara and the salmon tataki

this is a tapas restaurant so the portions arent huge

my favorite was the udon carbonara is was creamy but not to heavy and also the veggie dumplings

the seaweed and tofu salad was not that good there was barely any seaweed or even dressing in the salad it was mostly mixed greens
and the salmon tataki was a tease there was only 4 pieces that we shared

we didnt get any drinks so i cannot comment on that

overall it was good and not expensive if you like to share good this is a good place but not the best izakaya in montreal

they also have locations in toronto and new york

Address: 1624 Rue Sainte-Catherine Ouest Montreal, QC H3H 2S7 Canada
Review:
i only discovered this restaurant this year and came back 4 times so far because of its great food and ambiance the host even recognized me

i strongly recommend this place for birthdays because of its festive atmosphere and the warm hospitality of the staff they give one small matcha cheesecake for the birthday person so if you want to have something for the whole group you can also order the assorted dessert in extra

my favourite among appetizers is the sashimi salad and among tapas the tokyo calamari for the noodles the stirfried beef udon is very good and is not too salty and for the sizzling stone rice bowl the curry cheese smells extremely good and can be smelled meters away i wish however they didnt get rid of the pork tonkatsu curry on the menu

i cant wait to come back to try their lunch menu and their terrasse during summer

sorry i didnt take pics of all the food i ate was too busy eating

Address: 1440 Rue de l'Eglise Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 2H3 Canada
Review:
ive never tried taiwanese much so cant compare but over all tasty it cost around 50 for the beef soup  pork with rice  2x potatoes and fried chicken so quite cheap  we were the only one at that moment and there was no music in the background so we couldnt talk much i was too shy to talk in the quiet place  i felt watched and heard haha
so i still recommend

Address: 1440 Rue de l'Eglise Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 2H3 Canada
Review: highly recommend food was bursting with flavor the owner and cook was so friendly

Address: 1440 Rue de l'Eglise Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 2H3 Canada
Review:
maison mignon is very easy to miss this small familyowned humble business doesnt look like much from the outside or the inside but dont let appearances deceive you the food is ridiculously good the owner is incredibly friendly hospitable and honest this is one of the rare places that i actually feel deserves 20 tipping

the beef noodle soup is easily one of the best in the city easy this is a complete sleeper op restaurant it is legitimately one of those hidden gems

the prices are fairly low too

strong recommendation for the beef noodle soup and almond shrimp plate

Address: 1440 Rue de l'Eglise Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 2H3 Canada
Review: maison mignon taiwanese restaurant is a hidden gem in the city the menu is diverse offering a mix of traditional taiwanese dishes as well as some other japanese and unique fusion items the flavors are authentic with a particular emphasis on fresh ingredients the atmosphere is cozy and intimate perfect for a small gathering with friends service is prompt and friendly with the staff knowledgeable about the menu and eager to make recommendations overall maison mignon is an excellent option for anyone looking to experience taiwanese cuisine

Address: 1440 Rue de l'Eglise Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 2H3 Canada
Review: prices are very reasonable and food tastes home made staff is nice and friendly

Address: 170 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B7 Canada
Review: amazing customer service and the food was good and very aesthetically pleasing  micheal was so sweet and very knowledgeable about the food his energy also made our experience that much better felix was also super helpful and kind  amazing dinner experience

Address: 170 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B7 Canada
Review: my boyfriend and i wanted to try some authentic french cuisine while we were visiting montreal and looked up this restaurant on google we had to wait a few minutes before we got a table outside ben was very courteous and explained the menu to us in english i got their signature arugula salad with goat cheese while my boyfriend got duck condit the food was absolutely delicious we finished our dinner with soe delicious chai tea crumble we left the place satiated and full of gratitude

Address: 170 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B7 Canada
Review: quaint restaurant with welcoming and attentive service the daily set menu was perfect escargots presented in a unique salad that was especially tasty ricotta pasta and chocolate profiteroles were perfectly prepared kids loved their french onion soup and even ate the onions this time beef tartare and fois gras delicious lamb shank tender

Address: 170 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B7 Canada
Review: food is amazing nice normal portion sizes but maybe small for some people love that the wait staff dresses nicely  nicelydressed servers seems to be a dying art they are classy there  also love that they dont play loud music  will go back for sure

Address: 170 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B7 Canada
Review: really really great food presented really well the waiter was attentive and fun too i cant wait to go back and try other things on the menu the only minor issue was that it was a little bit cold inside the restaurant maybe it was because it had just opened for the evening either way it wouldnt stop me coming back again ill just wear a sweater next time

Address: 617 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L2 Canada
Review: first time trying russian food and i have to say i loved it very cozy restaurant  if you go saturday night you might be able to enjoy some russian music live very friendly and attentive staff i would definitely recommend the place and come back again if i have the opportunity

Address: 617 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L2 Canada
Review:
one of the best russian resturant in montreal we reserved a table for a saterday for our family post covid  backing to normal life party and the owner was kind enough to give us party menu although we were a small groupwe reached there at 7pm and non of us thought that we would stay there for 5 hours our table was filled with very delicious russian appitizers and salads egg plant roll was astonishing  jouline was extra ordinary  overall the tastes of all the meals were great and resturant serve them on time in a proper maner and sizedelsious food plus great music and dancing place made the expirence  unforgetable   they also packed all left overs for us upon our request and it means we had a chance to eat tasty meal the next day too10 from 10  i have a  plane to make a biger party there very soon stay tuned
update 30 july 2022  i went there with my international family usairanrussia once more and the experience was amazing i resereved for party menu for 8 people for saterday night my family were in love with great music tasty foods and positivity the singer could sang in many launguages and owner also sang that night we all danced  like there would be no tomorrow my whole family were obsessed make sure to reserve before going and do not lose your chance to have great russian party

Address: 617 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L2 Canada
Review: all about this place is 5 star perfect food quality chicken broschet was super amazing the vibe is perfect dj accomodates everyones ask for songs servers are kind  attentive owner is very kind  caring as well he ensures best service is provided we have been here multiple time and every sinhle one of them was amazing

Address: 617 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L2 Canada
Review: absolutely delicious we ordered out to eat in the backyard and everyone in my family loved it the eggplant filled with cheese is amazing my dad didnt want to share his beef stroganoff because he loved it too much everything was perfect we will go there again very happy to support local family business

Address: 617 Boulevard Decarie Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 3L2 Canada
Review: absolutely delicious traditional russian food we had cesar salad and pelmini with a main dish of cabbage rolls and kiev chicken napoleon cake and everything was fantastic terrace was quiet and service was quick i look forward to come back soon

Address: 4271 Rue Saint-Jacques Montreal, QC H4C 1J7 Canada
Review:
really comfortable cafe with great food and service

their pastries are good but their sandwiches turkey pesto etc are what really stand out they are a bit pricey at 1213 but they are delicious

its a really nice space with lots of light and live plants as well as a chill terrace in the back

Address: 4271 Rue Saint-Jacques Montreal, QC H4C 1J7 Canada
Review: we loved this place a proper oldschool corner cafe in an authentic neighborhood great for breakfast

Address: 4271 Rue Saint-Jacques Montreal, QC H4C 1J7 Canada
Review: wow truly a hidden gem in montreal i decided to stop by on my way to the airport back to vancouver i grabbed some lunch and i grabbed a few items to take back with me for the plane ride i love croissants so i decided to grab three to share with my family at home but when i got home and opened the bag i saw an extra croissant it felt so nice that the staff tried to make my visit to the caf√© a little extra special  i will be recommending this place to everybody the staff are truly kind the food is absolutely delicious pesto is unreal and the vibe is phenomenal thank you for giving me a wonderful experience i cannot wait to come back again someday

Address: 4271 Rue Saint-Jacques Montreal, QC H4C 1J7 Canada
Review: small caf√© and cozy especially for a winter day theres an outdoor terrace thats also nice during good weather service was quick but we only ordered drinks we got icedchai for 7 each its quite pricy for a glass of chai halffilled with glass my friend the chai was dull i thought it was good after i added an alternative sugar i think it was called twinner you also have many vegan milk options in addition to the regular but the windows and the vibe is so cute

Address: 4271 Rue Saint-Jacques Montreal, QC H4C 1J7 Canada
Review:
very cute place food was priced right and good the live jazz on sunday is a nice treat might be there other days too not sure
they have a cute outdoor seating area as well as indoor seating the staff was friendlier than most places i am happy to have this place in my neighborhood and will keep going go to brunch on the weekend they offer the best deals then

Address: 536 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A9 Canada
Review: food was delicious  just stopped for a quick bite had the best poutine of my life the service was 1010 made us feel like family had the pleasure of enjoying this on the patio i cant wait to try more from the menu next time i ordered

Address: 536 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A9 Canada
Review: our best meal in montreal i highly recommend everyone have dinner here all our food was incredible and the drinks were amazing the service was impeccable

Address: 536 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A9 Canada
Review:
disappointed with the food we got the oysters great appetizer foie gras poutine pretty good but slightly overpriced and finally the duck in the can
duck in the can is overly overhyped unflavoured and overpriced for 60 i was expecting something exceptional we got a nice show and hard duck breast the cabbage was not that good and the meat was hard and unsalted
maybe different strokes different folks but my 2nd time at au pied was a big disappointment

Address: 536 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A9 Canada
Review: completely worth the hype had the foie gras poutine and the duck in a can to share we were very full from this the dishes werent too heavy and just great flavours and cooked perfectly i have never experienced such incredible service we never had to fill our own cups with water and had our table wiped down multiple times and felt well attended to

Address: 536 Avenue Duluth E Montreal, QC H2L 1A9 Canada
Review: i highly recommend this restaurant  the food and the service were excellent  we had the duck temaki salt  maple sugar fries and the duck in a can  everything was high quality and the presentation was beautiful  the duck in a can is a large enough portion for you to share with someone for your meal  this place is popular so i recommend making a reservation before going on your vacation like we did

Address: 5968 Rue de Salaberry Montreal, QC H4J 1J8 Canada
Review: the best restaurant in montreal  a variety of food to choose from great atmosphere good drinks and  the services are impeccable

Address: 5968 Rue de Salaberry Montreal, QC H4J 1J8 Canada
Review: food was really delicious we took the cabri en sauce the service was excellent staff super friendly and kind its a bit more on the pricy side but still worth it would recommend

Address: 5968 Rue de Salaberry Montreal, QC H4J 1J8 Canada
Review: excellently prepared and fresh authentic haitian food highly recommend for those who like to try new things my mediterranean palate was completely satisfied here the lalo jews mallow with rice and the fried red snapper were my favorite dishes

Address: 5968 Rue de Salaberry Montreal, QC H4J 1J8 Canada
Review: 1010 ive been going to fourchette antillaise everytime i come down to montreal since 2018 the food is great the service is great the restaurant is always clean and well maintained nice spot for a date celebrate an event or more ive bought friends here who also enjoyed it and said they would come back because thats exactly the feeling this restaurant leaves you with the desire to return

Address: 5968 Rue de Salaberry Montreal, QC H4J 1J8 Canada
Review: my boyfriend and i  went to that restaurant last weekend and we surely enjoyed the food we couldnt even finished our plates they give you a very fair portion for the price and the service was very fast if you are looking for an haitiancreole restaurant well thats the  place to go great job to the team working at fourchette antillaise we will definitely be back

Address: 3825 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1B2 Canada
Review: my boyfriend and i come very often and its always a blast the staff and food are great my boyfriend said that no one can beat his nonnas cooking and yet this restaurant came close we are so grateful to the portions and quality of the food as well as the experience we get this was the third time i get the gnocchi and its so hard to not come back everyday and get it again you guys need to try the cheesecake they have its the best thank you so much for always satisfying

Address: 3825 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1B2 Canada
Review:
very reasonable prices for freshly made pasta chef panza definitely knows what hes doing is super friendly and brings the true authentic flavors of italy to your plate in this cozy setting no bells or whistles just good food

has never disappointed looking forward to going back

Address: 3825 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1B2 Canada
Review:
hands down the best pasta i have had in montreal and laval ever since i came back from italy 7 years ago from the first bite i had it brought back memories of what i was eating when i was in napoli and arezzo

dont be fooled by the outside signage the owner told me he knows and are planning on rebranding i am so lucky i found this place and will be coming more and more i swear this is the best italian food i have had in a long time

you will not regret coming here friendly delicious and homemade fresh food its a treasure

Address: 3825 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1B2 Canada
Review: the best pasta place i have ever been to in canada the pasta is really fresh and ingredients used are top quality will recommend all my friends and will surely come back again also very customer friendly and you are welcomed well

Address: 3825 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1B2 Canada
