Review: an absolute gem easily the best pasta i have ever had had the tagliatelle carbonara and it was out of this world good the quality of all the ingredients and the fresh pasta itself is unparalleled love that you can pick your sauce and pasta and have it be very customizable the chef is also very friendly and personable will definitely be coming here again to try their pizzas and more

Address: 5195 Rue Par√© Montreal, QC H4P 1P4 Canada
Review: in one word its mom made food  not many masalas and total home style  prices were nice but takes only cash  was not enough food as were told by them but survived  kofta and shahi paneer curry was same  dal tadka was good and also cheese chilly

Address: 5195 Rue Par√© Montreal, QC H4P 1P4 Canada
Review:
i love the food here i have tried most the  dishes on the menu and everything tastes nice been coming here for years now and will continue to
post covid the taste changedstill tastes good for few items may be the chef changed earlier it was more home like now its little spicy and more oily

requires some efforts on regular cleanliness of the washrooms

Address: 5195 Rue Par√© Montreal, QC H4P 1P4 Canada
Review:
i ordered on uber  gravy of paneer korma is as thin as dal  chapaties are thick and cold   totally unhappy with the quality  not only that food is delivered without cutlery and tissue paper  how can you eat  

my advice to owner try restaurant  tgg nearby you  you will see the difference of food quality   concentrate on quality rather than quantity

Address: 5195 Rue Par√© Montreal, QC H4P 1P4 Canada
Review: great affordable local spot lots of people coming and going which shows its a staple in the neighbourhood worth the detour especially if you like indian food andor vegetarian options

Address: 5195 Rue Par√© Montreal, QC H4P 1P4 Canada
Review: best place for vegetarians tastes like home made food reasonable prices good staff fast servings best in everything will recommend everyone to visit this restaurant prices are really really good

Address: 640 Rue Jarry E Montreal, QC H2P 1V7 Canada
Review:
food is affordable tasty and the portions are generously served the few times ive ordered 34x
its better calling before going to be sure theres enough fresh food man answering the phone is not friendly at all and has 0 customer service
he refused to take my order even though the usual lady is ok in preparing the plates a bit in advance since theres only street parking not really a place to dine in cuz the tables are quite small place could definitely use some improvements and be more clean

Address: 640 Rue Jarry E Montreal, QC H2P 1V7 Canada
Review:
i visited this haitian restaurant in montreal several years ago thanks to a recommendation from a dear friend back then my experience was fantastic the service was satisfactory the portions were generous and the food itself was incredibly tasty i often made it a point to stop by this place before heading back to my town

however over the past 5 to 6 years ive observed some noticeable changes in the level of customer service and the overall layout of the restaurant it seems that the owners have missed an opportunity to enhance their profits by not considering the logistical aspects of the establishment theres room for improvement in this regard

one of the major changes i noticed is the declining level of customer service the staff appears to lack the same level of care and dedication they once had during a recent visit i brought some friends to experience the authentic haitian cuisine unfortunately i encountered an unpleasant situation when i had to return to the front cashier to make a change to my order despite clearly specifying my desired rice type the staff in the kitchen were rude and insisted that it wasnt on the receipt instructing me to go back to the front to pay for it this encounter left a sour taste in my mouth

furthermore upon reaching home and indulging in my meal i noticed a decline in the quality of the food particularly the beef as a lover of the legume ive been consistently disappointed by the dish at this restaurant in recent times

i truly hope the owners take note of these customer concerns and consider making changes to enhance the overall experience it would be wonderful if they paid attention to reviews like these i believe there are customers like myself who long for a return to the delicious food and enjoyable dining experience that this restaurant once offered

Address: 640 Rue Jarry E Montreal, QC H2P 1V7 Canada
Review: i went in today after a recommandation as some other previous comments the customer service is seriously lacking i dont know haitian cuisine so i was asking the cashier what the dishes are and the whole time i felt like i was bothering her she told me beef tasso was griot but with beef and didnt even bother explaining the different sizes i dont even know if its true but what i ate today was nothing like the griot i had before a few slices of an extremely dry meat i couldnt even finish the dish and to top it all i paid 2750 for that plate  an accra aran kind of who she said was 5 for a single accra very disappointed

Address: 640 Rue Jarry E Montreal, QC H2P 1V7 Canada
Review: terrible customer service the ladies who prepare the food should take a course on how to treat their customers they are very disrespectful and have no manners you cant even ask them a simple question i will not be coming here again and i do not recommend this place there are so many better haitian restaurants than this place

Address: 640 Rue Jarry E Montreal, QC H2P 1V7 Canada
Review:
i ate a lot of griot when working in haiti this one is excellent portions are very generous and include all the trimmings rice djondjon coll√© blanc banan pese sauce pikliz  add an order of akra to this
they also have tassoit lambi  everything to make you feel in haiti

Address: 994 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2J3 Canada
Review: hands down the best poutinerie i feel like they are crafting art when i cant tell where the fries end and the meat begins they have really crafted something special this place is always busy but the staff are always calm and relaxed they definitely have good systems in place here ive been here 3 times now and its a must visit whenever i am in montreal

Address: 994 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2J3 Canada
Review: everybody told me that this is the best poutinerie but now i doubt it we had to wait 40 minutes for the food and when the food arrived the fries were cold like old ones the beef onions and sausage were burned maybe it was because of the amount of people but the quality of the food should not go down in such a renowned restaurant

Address: 994 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2J3 Canada
Review:
the hype is real
when we arrived here the line up was pretty long we also came on a saturday

the line didnt take to long and we eventually got a table on the terrase outside one thing to note is that they dont serve alcohol outside they had really good music out on the patio as well

we ordered the regular size poutine 1 classic and the other with smoked meat on top they were both divine

beware if you order the grande its massive
poutine so good we wanted to come back the next day to eat more

Address: 994 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2J3 Canada
Review: good and delicious food poutines are really good and so are the burgers we ordered a vegetarian option and it was too yummy my wife liked the veg burger the ambience is good they have an atm machine inside sometimes they have a long queue too so plan accordingly

Address: 994 Rue Rachel E Montreal, QC H2J 2J3 Canada
Review:
there was a long line but tables for 2 get in faster i tried the poutine with pickles and ground beef and loveddd it i didnt know what to expect the pickle to taste like but it all was great together

id say its a must try when in montreal

Address: 73 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B4 Canada
Review:
this restaurant is colorful and fun all the food we ordered was tasty and feels authentically venezuelan the portions are generous and even though the menu makes you want to order one of everything keep in mind that the food is very hearty and filling
everything on the menu is also gluten free

Address: 73 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B4 Canada
Review: great venezuelan fare with a great sense of allergies and helpful staff helping you identify the tastiest foods that respect dairy gluten and egg allergies their arepas are crunchy fluffy juicy amazing deliciousness wholeheartedly recommended for a delectable treat definitely a place worth repeated visits to explore their menu

Address: 73 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B4 Canada
Review: the entire restaurant is gluten free so theres no worries about cross contamination food comes out quickly and hot servers are friendly and welcoming

Address: 73 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B4 Canada
Review: what a beautiful restaurant and amazing food areperas quality of food was amazing for its price i loved that we were able to order our food from our phones and the server just comes and brings it to you their empanadas were different from what im used to crunchy in the outside and soft in the inside the areperas itself were tasty service was great and atmosphere was amazing loved my experience there

Address: 73 Rue Prince Arthur E Montreal, QC H2X 1B4 Canada
Review:
delicious food and fantastic service this was my first time eating arepas and arepera exceeded my expectations to eat we had the cheese empanadas la llanera de pollo arepa and domin√≥ con pl√°tano arepa and each item was exceptional  light crispy and flavourful not to mention the house made sauces yum

what made our visit truly perfect was the staff our server pascual was phenomenal he was friendly checked in often and made us laugh he also went above and beyond to ensure we were well taken care of such as clean up our baskets regularly provide fresh napkins and refill our waters consistently mali and norah were also lovely each stopping by to ensure we received our food quickly we were satisfied and also humoured us while we waited

well done arepera you have fantastic food and fantastic service an unbeatable combination when choosing where to eat we will certainly be coming back again soon

Address: 699 Boulevard Cur√©-Labelle Laval, QC H7L 5R7 Canada
Review:
food was delicious and service was great the summertime special cocktails were a bit strong in taste in my opinion but still good i loved the sangria
the ambiance was great the music playing was enjoyable and fit the american bbq theme

Address: 699 Boulevard Cur√©-Labelle Laval, QC H7L 5R7 Canada
Review: we came here because of the blooming onion and it was really worth it it was so good that id want to come back just to eat that our waiter mathieu was super friendly too and he took the time to recommend us which drinks to choose he made our resto experience super enjoyable  he definitely deserves a raise we ordered the rio grande dish to split between 4 people and even at the end there was still plenty of food to bring back home for each of us

Address: 699 Boulevard Cur√©-Labelle Laval, QC H7L 5R7 Canada
Review: the fried chicken was good service not bad either couldve used a bit more coleslaw with my dish fries tasted like they were from mcdonalds though hence the minus 1 star

Address: 699 Boulevard Cur√©-Labelle Laval, QC H7L 5R7 Canada
Review: as always excellent food and service loved every seconds of it

Address: 699 Boulevard Cur√©-Labelle Laval, QC H7L 5R7 Canada
Review:
boeuf cochon burger is tasty would order again
mother clucker sandwich hmm its good in general but the chicken is a bit dry
service is fantastic the waiter is bilingual and he was friendly with my child asking directly what she wanted to have

Address: 3721 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H4C 1P8 Canada
Review:
first time trying singaporean restaurant and was definitely impressed by its unique flavours the ambiance and service were fantastic and the staff were all dudes dressed in shorts and tshirts giving a relaxed and welcoming vibe

the chicken satay was absolutely amazing the other dishes and cocktails were good as well i highly recommend this place

Address: 3721 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H4C 1P8 Canada
Review:
amazing place great staff and ambiance music is a bit too loud but very good everything was delicious papaya salad and pork buns are a must

highly recommend to share the plates we shared 5 plates and the desert plate for 3 people and it cost us under 40 before tax and tip

place gets packed everyday reco to get there before 7308pm

Address: 3721 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H4C 1P8 Canada
Review:
the music was extremely loud when we visited impossible to make any conversation even with the person sitting next to you food was alright would have enjoyed it better if we couldve talked to each other
we made a reservation for 11 people and one person didnt show up they split the 11th persons charge evenly over our bills even though they only brought food for the 10 of us

unfortunately i would not go again

Address: 3721 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H4C 1P8 Canada
Review: a must for those who love asian food but crave something different from the traditional flavors found in chinatown i suggest coming as a group and ordering many dishes to share the umami is through the roof and can feel heavy if not paired with white rice my personal favorites are the pork belly steamed buns and the laksa

Address: 3721 Rue Notre-Dame Ouest Montreal, QC H4C 1P8 Canada
Review:
no resos for groups under 6 and i recommend getting there early we arrived at 630pm on a thursday and it was packed we waited roughly 1520 minutes for a spot for 2 they let you order drinks while waiting though which is a great start

must trys on the menu are the satay skewers with peanut sauce the fried pork and shrimp rice rolls not pictured but we both agreed it was the best thing we tasted papaya salad and the regular pork steam buns

the shrimp buns were part of their specials but its not as balanced and tasty as the pork buns if youre stuck between the two go pork

for the noodles i would go for the mussel and chorizo noodles instead of the shrimp and cuttlefish

but really everything on the menu is excellent we also have our amazing experience to thank to our server carl who went above and beyond in the service

100 recommend

Address: 510 Promenade de Centropolis Laval, QC H7T 3C2 Canada
Review: nice place with a good cocktail selection i think the music inside is too loud because my friends and i couldnt hear each other the food was tasty so i think i would come again

Address: 510 Promenade de Centropolis Laval, QC H7T 3C2 Canada
Review: the burgers were only warm when we got them the meat was dry and lacked flavorthe fried pickles were the best but the portion was tiny only 4 pieces the music is so loud we couldnt hear each other talking the only good thing is the rapid service and nice interior decor

Address: 510 Promenade de Centropolis Laval, QC H7T 3C2 Canada
Review: overall satisfying experience can be crowded and noisy amazing burgers highly recommended great selection of drinks

Address: 510 Promenade de Centropolis Laval, QC H7T 3C2 Canada
Review: lets be serious the burgers here are pretty mid but its a fun place to grab drinks with friends while getting serenaded by the friendly staff

Address: 510 Promenade de Centropolis Laval, QC H7T 3C2 Canada
Review: the decoration service and the vibes are excellent  the food is good however it can be enhanced  the flavors are missing

Address: 4105 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2W 1Y7 Canada
Review: ok this wasnt our first choice but i am glad we made it excellent food limited beer choices but quality menu out of sight we had the caesar salad pork cheeks octopus and beef all amazing and each with their own unique flavor look if youre american looking for mega servings this is not the place this is relaxed fine dining small plates big flavors cocktails excellent and wine selections almost overwhelming staff is down to earth and informative dont miss this place

Address: 4105 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2W 1Y7 Canada
Review:
very recommended their oyster it comes in 3 different types all of them are fresh and tasty come with natural sweetness other food is very wellseasoned
the mousse de foie surprises me because of its creamy fatty flavour with a bit of bitterness from the liver and sweetness from the pear and br√ªl√©e on top
their hot dog is pretty big obviously its 12 inches the mixed salad balances the flavour well
the whelks is a hitormiss tho
i will come back to taste more of their dishes and drinks if you dont come for their food you can try their drinks because they have a very long list for them

Address: 4105 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2W 1Y7 Canada
Review: i cant recommend this place enough professionals doing a great job providing delicious food amazing cocktails and attentive friendly service at a reasonable price  they love what they do and it shows i will eat here again in the near future

Address: 4105 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2W 1Y7 Canada
Review:
one of our go to favourite places for a drink dinner and oysters if you get michelle as you server youll be in great hands  very attentive attention to detail and great recommendations the hostess was also a pleasure to talk to over the phone duck tartar was very delicious well come back for the pork belly and next time well do 24 oysters instead of 12 fries are absolutely worth getting the vibe is great as it gets busy but not overwhelming and the decor is spot on we make an effort to visit all our favorite places everytime we come back to montreal as we are from toronto and this place is on our list thank you michelle for giving us such a great night

saka  jamie
visited fri aug 27 2021 8pm

Address: 4105 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2W 1Y7 Canada
Review: the food here was beautiful shrimp sandwiches mackerel salad dip etcgreat small plates phenomenal and not pretentious at all

Address: 983 Boulevard D√©carie Montreal, QC H4L 3M6 Canada
Review:
lovely owners and food had the dolsot bibimbap ingredients tasted fresh and the dish was delicious the veggie dumplings were also great

every now and then i also get a box of rice cake skewers togo and they always hit the spot

place can get crowded at times but the atmosphere is still nice to be in ill definitely come back to sit in with more friends thank you for the service

Address: 983 Boulevard D√©carie Montreal, QC H4L 3M6 Canada
Review:
five stars well deserved
ordered the hot stone beef binimbap  the flavours have a nice warm feeling to it tasteful and full filling also had the ramen with beef and it was outstanding the place looks and feels cozy too
definitely recommend for korean food 1010

Address: 983 Boulevard D√©carie Montreal, QC H4L 3M6 Canada
Review: i love this spot the one spot in montreal with some of the best kimbap i always go here for the spicy tuna kimbap its to die for  i believe its a family owned business and they have great food for great prices also very close to the metro for those of you who dont drive metro cote vertu i also always get their dak galbi stew spicy chicken stew with rice so good must try

Address: 983 Boulevard D√©carie Montreal, QC H4L 3M6 Canada
Review:
update april 24 2023

they finally hired a new good staff  it was a full house at 6 pm  saterday  prices went up again but so did service snd quality

wings    1010
bi bim bap   1010   i like to to have a little more crust at the bottom of the bowl but it is a personal choice
ramen noodles  910    good broth and flavor


very good fried chicken not many places offer wings most offer half or whole chicken   bi bim bap was very good    the noodles and kim chi were ok the is the only place in montr√©al toronto that has pork bone  soup bi bim bap and fried chicken  very good prices   the food is timed and comes out at the same time most of the time

Address: 983 Boulevard D√©carie Montreal, QC H4L 3M6 Canada
Review:
service came here when they first opened food is always good went back a couple of times recently the person that works in the front is a bit slow we had to ask for cultery dishes napkins when we were ready to leave which we waiting 20minutes to have the bill we asked and the person went back to clean some spoons or going into the back doing god knows what asked a second time and still proceeds on doing something else so we finally walked to the front and asked the owner to have the bill as for the service id give 35 the waiter would leave tables dirty and not clean up the table until there is a line up not very efficient

food love their spicy tuna kimbap chiken cutlet is very good but the chiken is always overfried as it was super hard to chew and burnt

we love coming to this place but for sure has some adjustments to make

Address: 1440 Rue Drummond Montreal, QC H3G 1V9 Canada
Review: wow what a mesmerizing place came to celebrate my friends birthday and everything was even better than expected food was so fresh and flavourful wine and service was astonishing all the staff were so friendly and welcoming we got quite a few of the ¬†snack¬† dishes and every single one was beautifully presented and tasted amazing atmosphere was everything music was nice decor vibe etc was worth every second will be back many more times thank you xx

Address: 1440 Rue Drummond Montreal, QC H3G 1V9 Canada
Review: another great experience of food and culture  such an amazing building with superb design and art loved the stained glass but be prepared to pay for this it cost me a small fortune i love hibiki but not willing to pay 54 bucks plus tax and tip this is crazy i did not like the octopus and frozen fries but everything else was a1 i ordered the beef wellington and loved it

Address: 1440 Rue Drummond Montreal, QC H3G 1V9 Canada
Review: what a lovely old home the architecture and decor are outstanding had drinks at the bar but would love to go for dinner hostess was super friendly  accommodating so much to look at and appreciate

Address: 1440 Rue Drummond Montreal, QC H3G 1V9 Canada
Review:
i recently visited bar george in montreal for a latenight outing initially i intended to have dinner but unfortunately the kitchen was closed by the time i arrived however this turned out to be a blessing in disguise as i got the opportunity to sample their drinks instead

despite the fact that there were empty seats i had to wait in line for about 20 minutes to get a seat at 1am which was a bit of a letdown however once i was seated i was quite impressed by the atmosphere the interior is beautifully designed giving off a highclass vibe that i thoroughly enjoyed

overall even though my visit didnt go as initially planned i had a good time at bar george the ambiance and the quality of the drinks made up for the initial hiccup i would recommend this place for anyone looking for a classy spot to unwind in montreal

Address: 1440 Rue Drummond Montreal, QC H3G 1V9 Canada
Review:
the place itself is a historical building with lovely carved wood the dim setting and combinations of wood makes it a perfect dining space i appreciate the staff allowing us to explore the second floor of the building

we came during lunchtime we ordered the hamburgers they are so good the buttery brioche bun topped with an amazing smokey caramelized onion and well seasoned beef patty perfectly encapsulated the combination of sweet and salty the density of the burger felt perfectly balanced all throughout although i believe the mayonnaise sauce served with the fries was too dense and did not compliment the lightness of the burger

unfortunately i could not take a picture of the burger as the lighting present with my phone was too bad

the staff were very kind and helpful

Address: 3455 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1A2 Canada
Review:
where should i begin

the food is absolutely delicious and it tastes so fresh we had various starters to start and everything was great from the salad to the hummus it was delicious

for the main plate weve ordered the kafta brochette the chicken brochette and the lamp chops delicious

the staff is friendly and helpful

i recommend it

Address: 3455 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1A2 Canada
Review: highly recommended delicious food fresh ingredients and fast service their hot pita bread hummus and garlic yogurt were an amazing combination as a starter a grilled plate could be a good option for the main course and out of this world

Address: 3455 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1A2 Canada
Review: my family and i went to beroya a handful of times and it was always excellent the food was always outstanding the quality is unparalleled to any other syrian restaurant in montreal plus the prices are extremely reasonable there are many options of authentic syrian meals to choose from including meat vegetarian and vegan options kevin our waiter was incredibly kind and made us feel very welcomed

Address: 3455 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1A2 Canada
Review:
i recently had the pleasure of dining at beroya a syrian cuisine restaurant located in laval and i must say that it was an amazing experience from the moment i walked in i was greeted with a lovely middle eastern and syrian look and feel that immediately transported me to a different world

but the real star of the show was the food i was lost what to order but the staff were incredibly helpful and provided excellent recommendations i ended up trying several dishes and each one was more delicious than the last the taste was mouthwatering and the spices were just right giving every bite the perfect kick

one thing that really impressed me was how quickly the food was served i didnt have to wait long at all which is always a plus in my book and once i was done with my main course i made sure to taste the delicious dessert options the ice cream and cotton candy were particularly noteworthy and i found myself craving more even after i had finished

overall i highly recommend beroya for anyone who loves middle eastern and syrian cuisine the food is simply amazing the staff are helpful and friendly and the atmosphere is perfect for a night out with friends or family dont miss out on this hidden gem in laval

Address: 3455 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7T 1A2 Canada
Review:
it was perfect since i love exquisite food that is less than 500 calories when seriously watching my weight  there individual dishes 3040 are dishes to die for plate is cute even smaller than regular plate where they fit little bit of protein with grill veges  half med onion half med
tomato a half pepper and garnished with 5g of parsley and onion pita sliced into few pieces leaves your stomach much room for dessert  so yummy and so little we finished our individual dish in less than 5 mins this was first time in the history defeating mcdonalds trio under 5 mins yes you can order rice potato and salad for extra extra charges of course you can order chef choice platter for 55person which supposedly fills the whole table in short there are better restaurants gentleman serving us was nice

Address: 6653 Rue St-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2M5 Canada
Review: disappointed the service was bad even though the place was empty we ordered the beet salad and found a hair in it we complained about it and they offered us another plate of salad we also ordered the lobster roll and it was okay we asked for a smoothie with our order but it never came although we have paid for it so before leaving the restaurant we claimed the smoothie and thats when the server started making it i think the smoothie was the only tasty thing we had at beaufort unfortunately it was a bad experience and we dont think we will ever come back here again

Address: 6653 Rue St-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2M5 Canada
Review: its my first time to come to montreal i booked a airbnb nearby the house owner recommended me this restaurant its really a good recommendation i like this pieuvre and the french fries is also good btw the service is pretty good i will come again to try the steak

Address: 6653 Rue St-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2M5 Canada
Review:
im super glad i finally made it to this restaurant 

the atmosphere is very relax the decor full of cute little details a place where you feel comfortable and welcomed

i got the salmon tartare and my friend the gu√©dille with lobster and nordic shrimps we were both really satisfied 

best aspect of this place is the service is attentive everyone is kind and laid back the kind of restaurant you can feel the staff is well treated and they work as a team fully recommend

Address: 6653 Rue St-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2M5 Canada
Review: friendly attentive staff and tasty food nice location right on plaza sthubert we were a group of three and all shared the plates so we got to taste several this everything was good but the octopus stole the show

Address: 6653 Rue St-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2M5 Canada
Review: very varied menu open kitchen the chef came to the kitchen counter and described some of the food and its preparation

Address: 1794 Boulevard le Corbusier Laval, QC H7S 2K1 Canada
Review:
i planned an event with about 40 people in the restaurants private room it was perfect

we had all the space we needed the private room even has its own bathroom there are no stairs so accessibility was great for elderly guests

if you want a hall but dont want hall prices look no further

the staff was excellent very accomodating and helpful

i highly recommend this restaurant for events but also for dinner on the restaurant side

Address: 1794 Boulevard le Corbusier Laval, QC H7S 2K1 Canada
Review: food was excellent service was good all in all i am very pleased with this restaurant

Address: 1794 Boulevard le Corbusier Laval, QC H7S 2K1 Canada
Review: great foodhomemade traditional italian fare  best calamari in town  warm and friendly service by all  would highly recommend

Address: 1794 Boulevard le Corbusier Laval, QC H7S 2K1 Canada
Review: food was phenomenal waiters were great very accommodating ambien was nice service was slow though i would definitely come back if i had time

Address: 1794 Boulevard le Corbusier Laval, QC H7S 2K1 Canada
Review: excellent restaurant with a good menu and varied wine list  the staff has been there forever the food is tasty and flavorful well seasoned but not salty like some other places

Address: 169A Boulevard Sainte-Rose Laval, QC H7L 1L2 Canada
Review: the chicken is delicious the specify one in particular the staff are very friendly get the combo you get great value and amazing taste

Address: 169A Boulevard Sainte-Rose Laval, QC H7L 1L2 Canada
Review:
very small restaurant they give complimentary bread and olives which is nice
we were 3 ordered one plate of chicken and a platter to share the chicken was good but very salty didnt care for the rest of the meat the pork seemed a bit over cooked and the sausage was chewy so we really only ate the chicken salad and fries were good portuguese beer was also pleasent but a bit pricey waitress was nice but the guy who served our drinks kept poring a 7up while looking at it and didnt stop until it overflowed on to the floor and served the glass sticky with no apology or offer to bring a new drink since the glass wasnt full very bizarre

Address: 169A Boulevard Sainte-Rose Laval, QC H7L 1L2 Canada
Review:
what a terrific find in laval we had spicy grilled chicken and assorted meat plate with a very nice red house wine the roasted meat with paprika was so delicious mum said she hadnt enjoyed a roasted chicken this much in decades and for dessert a homemade portuguese tartlet which wasperfect
service was fab simple setting which was just fine thank you to all the staff

Address: 169A Boulevard Sainte-Rose Laval, QC H7L 1L2 Canada
Review:
the service was not impressive because it took a while which we did not mind thinking we will get the great food and fresh we ordered a lot but the chicken was very dry and half of the plate was rather burned my family went there before and said the chicken was not bad when an older gentleman cooked it next time we would rather go to romados in montreal
pricey for the burned dry chicken if you ask me

Address: 169A Boulevard Sainte-Rose Laval, QC H7L 1L2 Canada
Review: some of the best chicken youll have in this areas chargrilled with a mild or spicy sauce topping it almost tastes south american and super delicious lunch special choices were chicken light or dark chorizo sausage or grilled sardines paired with pomme frites and a tasty salad had the breast and wing and the chicken literally falls off the bone parking is a little spotty but a public parking lot is about 200m away with a few more potential spots

Address: 993 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1M5 Canada
Review: food is delicious loved the calamari perfectly fried so far the best in laval

Address: 993 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1M5 Canada
Review:
favourite restaurant easy in laval

this restaurant is one of my all time favourites in laval ive come here over 30 times in my lifetime and it has never disappointed me its my familys goto spot

my favourite dish is the scaloppine alla grigio veal with a side of vegetables and pasta i usually ask for regattoni conspec as my pasta side absolutely delicious the mushrooms and the veal in the porto sauce are really good the picture was taken after i had already dug into it i couldnt resist my sister gets the regattoni con spec as a dish and she loves it every time

the appetizers here are also very good and popular with us we have the calamari every time we come here an easy 1010 crispy and delicious the newest one we had was the sausage which was just pure bliss sublime

the desserts here too are great i had the cr√®me caramel and my sister had the cr√®me br√ªl√©e both super sweet and tasty

thank you so much for the impeccable service and food

Address: 993 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1M5 Canada
Review: extremely good  food arrived hot  our server believe her name was eli was just fantastic  we give her a 10 for professionalism  congrats to the whole team  will definitely be back  we are about 40 minutes away from there but well worth the trip  thanks again de

Address: 993 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1M5 Canada
Review:
baby friendly restaurant

pretty nice decor a bring your own wine restaurant you cant miss food is good and well priced  will definitely come back again

the service was very good too

the only problem were the fruit flies  fix that problem and it will be a definitely 5 stars

Address: 993 Boulevard Saint-Martin Ouest Laval, QC H7S 1M5 Canada
Review:
food was excellent but service was awful  it was a saturday night granted but ive been to many other restaurants where it wasnt as slow we were 10 people   we were not all served our meal at the same time our waitress was more attentive to the men especially mine  she totally ignored me until she saw it was me who paid the bill sweetheart  your boss should remind you to treat all your customers the same  i gave her a generous tip in spite of her embarrassing and inappropriate behaviour

my friend said the same thing  her husband was served his meal before any of us  he did not want to start eating while the rest of us waited for our entr√©esmeals  but we all insisted he do so

Address: 5024, ch de la C√¥te-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3V 1G6 Canada
Review:
short review 
decor layout and music was great food was delicious service was impeccable

more elaborate review
firstly when we walked in we were so happy with the ambienceatmosphere of this restaurant the decor music and layout were lovely

second this was our first time trying russian cuisine and i personally wasnt sure about what i was reading about on the menu after ordering i realized they have pictures of all their meals on their website in the gallery section i highly recommend to go take a look if you also are unfamiliar with russian cuisine

furthermore i am so pleased to say that the food was delicious generous portions flavourful and truly satisfying plus the bread butter and sour cream were all homemade im sure more was homemade but this is what we specifically found out was homemade ill post photos of what my husband and i got for reference

third the lady who served us i wish i had asked her her name was so warm kind generous helpful and pleasant she is a gem and 100 added to the amazing experience we had such attention to detail and care

all in all please go check this restaurant out it is worth it

ps most photos are from the website i forgot to take pictures of the food myself website photos are true to what we were served

Address: 5024, ch de la C√¥te-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3V 1G6 Canada
Review: was a complete 10 out of 10 experience the food was delicious and the service impeccable would definitely recommend the icecream at the end was a real treat homemade and decadent will be coming back for sure

Address: 5024, ch de la C√¥te-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3V 1G6 Canada
Review:
enter into a quaint ten table eastern european restaurant with an amazing staff and chef the setting  ambiance is amazing

the appetizers are fantastic main course kiev and stroganoff of many options  fantastic

finished our evening experience with a mouth melting honey cake with a dripping of strawberry glaze and a coffee

my word selection may not identify the specific menu listed entrees we enjoyed though im sure you have a quality understanding of our experience

amazing

Address: 5024, ch de la C√¥te-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3V 1G6 Canada
Review: the waitress did a phenomenal job with our family of 7 including 5 children 10 and under  the food was delicious and tasted like the cuisine i had eaten in russia  this restaurant  is obviously popular and has a number of regulars who frequent  make sure to call ahead since they regularly have parties that block out the whole place

Address: 5024, ch de la C√¥te-des-Neiges Montreal, QC H3V 1G6 Canada
Review:
every meal is fresh and delicious made with love and beautifully presented the waiters are courteous and friendly the owner will ensure everything is to your liking and more and will go out of her way to please you
we recently had an over 20 people celebration there everything was seamless from the delicious food on the table amazing and thoughtful service attention to detail and personal touches they have surpassed our expectations all guests were complementing how good the food was
the experience was just as positive when i went there for supper with a friend
this restaurant has been in business for many years and they value their reputation and maintain their standards of quality you will not be disappointed
will be back soon for sure

Address: 5690 Avenue Victoria Montreal, QC H3W 2P8 Canada
Review: we travelled to montreal and visited this restaurant three times within a week we really like the bun bo hue there the soup is so tasty

Address: 5690 Avenue Victoria Montreal, QC H3W 2P8 Canada
Review: its a small restaurant but offers an authentic vietnamese delicious food i love b√∫n b√≤ hue spicy noodles soup that has a very good taste of lemongrass bbq pork is delicious too service is quick and professional its a musttry restaurant in busy montreal

Address: 5690 Avenue Victoria Montreal, QC H3W 2P8 Canada
Review:
sen vang is one of the best pho in montreal  in these times of pandemic its hard to transport soup  the menu is reduced but the best spicy soup is still there  i love their pho and i am a regular sony owner is one who can pack the take away really well the spring rolls are fantastic  its a perfect lunch on a cold afternoon hop off and pick up the soup and you can heat up the broth at home in case its not as hot as you would like it

update by this time the ownership has changed and the pho is still very good  now there are a more items on the menu and we hand a wonderful time  the place accepts credit and debit cards now  i would recommend this place

Address: 5690 Avenue Victoria Montreal, QC H3W 2P8 Canada
Review: yummy my special beef noodle soup is great the ingredients are fresh the beef is thick and plentiful the environment is very clean the boss is very kindwhen the boss knew i was pregnant he took out the spices that i couldnt eat how nice

Address: 5690 Avenue Victoria Montreal, QC H3W 2P8 Canada
Review: the bun bo hue flavour is loaded with lemongrass flavour small size was reasonable service was nice and homey

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: went for my birthday the host heard that it was my birthday and came with a desert and made sure that our glass was always filled  super good wine im a bit disappointed about the portion size of the ribs it is a good portion however if youve been in the past it changed you have fewer sides than before overall its a super good place for chicken and beef amazing host

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: its a hit or miss place depending on your waiterwaitress the food is good 90 of the time if its not after your first few bites they are happy to take it back in the kitchen to cook it again i wouldnt mind coming here if i needed an idea on what to eat for dinner obviously you come here for the ribs

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review:
so happy to sit down on a nice comfy seat and have a delicious lunch on our shopping day
i shared a delicious grilled chicken caesar and it was plenty for 2 our waitress was lovely and so chipper and made it all a very pleasant experience for us

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: i had a dinner with my friends here the food was good but i think the prices are too high but the service and atmosphere were good

Address: 3035 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review:
for fine dining this place is da bomb
service is top shelf
portions are very generous
baton rouge has a rather unique system whereby the wait staff are constantly attempting to be aware of each others tables  what this means for the customer is fast efficient service  if your meal is up in the kitchen and your server is not there but another is  that server will bring it out to you  simple things like water refills and clearing dishes is rarely missed
for starters we had the calamari  it was cooked to perfection tender and crispy on the outside served with smoke show aioli the seared ahi tuna salad the tuna was meltinyourmouth delectable
the new york strip loin ordered rare was incredible
we also went overboard by adding a side of sizzling shrimp and scallops
the waitress maria was quick to ask if i wanted the steak off the regular menu  or the special upgrade that came with starter salad and the steak was topped with a generous slice of brie and pan seared mushrooms and accompanied with green beans and choice of second side
our meal was capped off with the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake to share
the prices are quite fair considering the exceptional service and generous portions  it seems rare that you can find a restaurant where the entire waitstaff seem happy to serve are very friendly and efficient in their work

Address: 908 Rue Sherbrooke O Montreal, QC H3A 1G3 Canada
Review:
i came here for lunch on a thursday with my friend i ordered the vegetable noodle combo and my friend ordered the small special lanzhou beef noodle combo both with spicy cucumber everything was very delicious my vegetable noodle was a nice generous portion both the the noodles and the vegetables were cooked perfectly and the broth was very tasty the spicy cucumber was crunchy and sweet which i really really liked

its a small restaurant with maybe 20 seats id say its more of a place where people just come eat and then leave less of a place where people sit and chat especially during weekday lunch rush because it gets really busy

service was very efficient even though we were sitting tightly in a corner the waitress checked in on us and filled our glass of water

Address: 908 Rue Sherbrooke O Montreal, QC H3A 1G3 Canada
Review:
as a fan of authentic chinese noodle dishes i absolutely loved this place i had the large beef noodle soup with the ‰∏âÁ¥∞ san xi noodles with the shredded tofu skin as an appetizer the texture of the tofu was perfect almost exactly like a firm curd cheese the broth of the soup is extremely fragrant and tasty but beware of the large portion its massive

only downsides to this place are that the interior is very cramped and there isnt a lot of seating also keep in mind that they only take cash and debit no credit

very highly recommended

Address: 908 Rue Sherbrooke O Montreal, QC H3A 1G3 Canada
Review: the broth is very flavourful and the toppings are decent the beef can be chewy at times the noodles however are far too chewy for me and i wish they were softer still a decent experience place is very small and packed and i visited in summer so cant really recommend the place for its ambiance

Address: 908 Rue Sherbrooke O Montreal, QC H3A 1G3 Canada
Review: western chinese noodle soup classic with all the fragrance and flavors its all well balanced the noodle are freshly made in store and you can watch it from the front window on the street really cool professional and efficient staff quick service you have to pay before you eat the prices are fairly good with 15 for the large bowl the cucumber side is very good a must try plan to go back to try their other soups and noodles size i recommend this place

Address: 908 Rue Sherbrooke O Montreal, QC H3A 1G3 Canada
Review: i thing this place is one of the best chinese noodles in montreal the service is nice and server was easygoing with us the noodles were delicious highly recommend

Address: 885 Boulevard D√©carie Montreal, QC H4L 3M2 Canada
Review:
to put it simple not the best but not the worst korean restaurant out there food was okay but nothing too special about it

only one waiter doing everything from cash to serving food so keep that in mind if you gohe was very nice though

Address: 885 Boulevard D√©carie Montreal, QC H4L 3M2 Canada
Review:
the kimbap was great it was freshly made soft rice perfect vegetable crunch and just very delicious

the seafood noodles was amazing lots of seafood and noodles and the taste was great not too spicy love this

Address: 885 Boulevard D√©carie Montreal, QC H4L 3M2 Canada
Review: ribs were cold and tough when served they waited until the wings were ready to bring out the ribs seafood pancake was best part and the salad on the side was actually spicy unlike the wings service was good

Address: 885 Boulevard D√©carie Montreal, QC H4L 3M2 Canada
Review:
although the restaurant could use a fresh coat of paint you will be impressed by the huge variety of korean dishes present on the menu
they offer excellent service during lunch and the bulgogi porc and rice cakes are just as good

Address: 885 Boulevard D√©carie Montreal, QC H4L 3M2 Canada
Review: despite ordering from them after they had come back from break the food ordered gimbap was slightly dry however what was more displeasing was the tteobeokki that was in a large container and barely filled 14 of the container barely had any spicy sauce inside the container along with the rice cake to top it off there was a piece of paper inside the container stuck on the food wasted quite a large amount for the total amount for such little quantity which was also disappointing based on its quality wouldnt recommend ordering gimbap and tteobeokki however i dont know how their other dishes taste like so i will not comment on them

Address: 6704 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2S 3G2 Canada
Review: okay this place is amazing the staff are so kind and the food is incredibly delicious the gravy mac and cheese and biscuits were really really good and the desserts as well i got the key lime pie and also tried a bit of the blueberry cheesecake i seriously cant wait to go back and try their chicken and waffles and other rotational desserts

Address: 6704 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2S 3G2 Canada
Review: i liked the setup of the restaurant a lot and the key lime pie is very good  not too sweet or too creamy given the balance of the white chocolate mousse and the sour lime cream however though i find the mac and cheese a little too salty so i had to keep on drinking water but still its the best mac and cheese ive had so far

Address: 6704 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2S 3G2 Canada
Review:
the fried chicken was decent it was freshly fried so that made it taste good enough but the batter felt a little off maybe seasoning maybe oil too hot and the breast was a little dry but overall the biscuit was amazing mashed potatoes and gravy were good and the waffles were tasty

we also got a derby pie if i remember the name correctly and it tasted very sweet but not in a bad way but the crust was very hard dry and felt old

i will give this place another chance at a later time hoping for a better experience

Address: 6704 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2S 3G2 Canada
Review: ordered sweet tea waffles and fried chicken total is about 30 waffles and tea were good but the fried chicken was old dry and under seasoned you could get better chicken at your local grocery store where they let the pieces sit under a lamp for 16 hours at a time and it would only cost you 8 when chicken is the only protein you have better make it good if you dare to charge that much

Address: 6704 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2S 3G2 Canada
Review: i usually get the fried chicken and had tried some of the sides such as the coleslaw mashed potatoes hush puppies pinto beans and buttermilk biscuit today i decided to try the big nasty it was so good and it did not disappoint the service staff are friendly as usual and it was a pleasant dinning experience

Address: 1510 Chomedey Boulevard Laval, QC H7V 3N8 Canada
Review: was enjoyable  i like when they play with fire  the chef was somewhat animated and made some nice jokes

Address: 1510 Chomedey Boulevard Laval, QC H7V 3N8 Canada
Review: we were very pleased fun atmosphere good food and a very entertaining show it took us some time to do it all but thats what the experience is about

Address: 1510 Chomedey Boulevard Laval, QC H7V 3N8 Canada
Review: wowwww i went to toyo for the first time last night omg the food is delicious our waitress was very nice great customer service but the cherry on top was ron our cook he was hilarious it was like i was in a comedy show an awesome first experience looking forward to go again 5

Address: 1510 Chomedey Boulevard Laval, QC H7V 3N8 Canada
Review: overall we are very pleased with our experience at this restaurant the food was great the service was fast and efficient and more particularly the chef named ron was amazing he was humorous engaged well with the table was very entertaining and excellent at preparing the food we have no complaints and will definitely recommend it and go back again

Address: 1510 Chomedey Boulevard Laval, QC H7V 3N8 Canada
Review: the food was good the experience was fun and our cook was quite the comedian  the food portions were very large at least mine was i chose the vegetarian meal

Address: 232 Rue Jean-Talon E Montreal, QC H2R 1S7 Canada
Review:
the moment i stepped into this restaurant i was welcome with a big smile and friendly attitude by the staff they have tables inside and on the terrace too the vibe of the place is a relaxed one almost teleporting you to beautiful mexico
i found it a great place to savor the traditional mexican dishes food was fresh well seasoned and brought to the table pretty fast

Address: 232 Rue Jean-Talon E Montreal, QC H2R 1S7 Canada
Review:
if youre in the mood for some delicious mexican food el rey del taco next to the farmers market is a mustvisit spot we tried their pork tacos and enchiladas de mole and they were equally as delicious the pork was juicy and flavorful and the mole sauce on the enchiladas was rich and delicious

one thing to keep in mind is that el rey del taco doesnt serve alcoholat least they are not on menu

overall i highly recommend el rey del taco

Address: 232 Rue Jean-Talon E Montreal, QC H2R 1S7 Canada
Review: good service and beautiful interiors my tacos were good except they were a little salty its easy for carnitas to be salty tho the churro was to die for will definitely come back

Address: 232 Rue Jean-Talon E Montreal, QC H2R 1S7 Canada
Review: el rey del taco is the place in montreal for authentic tacos make sure you order by weight their al pastor is incredible id recommend about 250g of meat per person

Address: 232 Rue Jean-Talon E Montreal, QC H2R 1S7 Canada
Review: sooo good i just wish they put mushrooms on the burrito and the hibiscus water is super good just a bit less sugar please your food is always perfect muchas gracias tudo sempre est√° muy saboroso

Address: 1541 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1L4 Canada
Review:
i tried roch le coq on a friday night with a friend the place was packed and they had about 15 door dash orders waiting on top of the customers who ordered as takeout i heard good things about the place and really wanted to try it

i ordered the rochy sandwich which was very small but inexpensive 550 which could explain the price the presentation was good the pickles as well it had kimchi mayo inside which was really good the fries dont come with the burger you have to order them on the side they were good as well the sauce that came with them had a weird taste i didnt really like it they also dont have ketchup which i found weird my friend ordered the 2 piece combo which was 1475 for the chicken fries and a coleslaw salad a bit expensive for what it was

overall the chicken was great but nothing out of the ordinary it was tasty and juicy we waited around 20 minutes for our orders which seems reasonable considering that it was a friday night and there were a lot of people

Address: 1541 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1L4 Canada
Review:
philo poutine popcorn fried chicken wild flower honey hot sauce green onions

i really really really loved this spot over the weekend we got a couple of things but this poutine from rochlecoq doesnt have a single flaw tbh its perfecty fried and crispy chicken heavenly gravy and unique hot sauce all blend together in this harmonious poutine

ive been wanting to go here and try them out for months and months and finally i was in the area happened to pass buy it and had to get it amazing food go and check them out

Address: 1541 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1L4 Canada
Review: the dining experience  was 5 star really amazing everything was on point  but sadly two days after i had delivry and we didnt really like it and i dont know why but 4 star overall loved the employee the day i was there and the fried chicken is one of the best i had in mtl

Address: 1541 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1L4 Canada
Review: all around great place old school music great friendly service and the chicken is on point great single combos and family friendly combos nice selection of sauces to dip your chicken into as well will definitely be coming back for some more of it all a must try in my books

Address: 1541 Avenue Van Horne Montreal, QC H2V 1L4 Canada
Review: loved this place one of the best chicken sandwiches ive eaten in montr√©al great fries too also the guy the guys were so nice

Address: 4007 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2W 2M4 Canada
Review:
a small group of four we shared the shrimp cocktail had lobster risotto and the sea bass for two dinner  the shrimp was tasty sweet and completed by fresh horseradish and cocktail sauce  the sea bass was wonderful perfectly crisp light and flaky in a tray bean gravy with thin roasted fennel bulb and crispy shoe string potatoes we were a hungry group so everyone enjoyed their dishes that night yet all felt the same the next day  

in addition our server was wonderful and had great stories to share on the history of montreal and the changes happening in the latin quarter today

Address: 4007 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2W 2M4 Canada
Review: enjoyed the food but wish we would have tried some different dishes we had the catch of the day and the mussels which were both tasty but nothing to rave about when it came to the flavour the service was great and the restaurant has a fun vibe would definitely come back to try something else

Address: 4007 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2W 2M4 Canada
Review:
restaurant we booked shut down due to an electricity issues so we stumble upon josephine impromptu i have to say our experience was not the best despite the high pricetag of the restaurant to start off as i was tasting the wine i had to select from a mini wine list i mentioned that the temperature of the wine¬†was not adequate and the waiter proceeded to convince me that my mouth was probably detecting the wrong temperature cos he touched the bottle and it was ok
the service was very slow slow to take orders slow for food to come slow to check back slow to get the check and slow to pay

had the oysters and mignonette as a starter and they were good¬† the main was the octopus and really the dish was problematic the octopus itself was chewy tasteless if not for a strong artificial smoke taste¬† it came with a caponata that had never heard of sicily and a tasteless artichaud puree

other guests had

 the cesar salad that was good and the salmon tartar that was¬†average

 the mussels were  hard as stone not sure how that is possible may be they were recooked and not enjoyable to eat

Address: 4007 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2W 2M4 Canada
Review:
highly recommend this restaurant the food is wonderful and the space is bright and decorated beautifully

we loved the grilled oyster mushroomsso good both the lobster risotto and the moules frites were amazing nothing but praises for this menu

Address: 4007 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2W 2M4 Canada
Review: was really looking forward to a fine dining seafood restaurant experience instead was extremely disappointed in the food  service and atmosphere the server did not explain the dishes as they were served on your plate the arctic char was a very small thin piece of dried out fish served with eggplant she told us it was a large portion served with bok choy and potatoes the wine by the glass was only 3 choices of very cheap quality white wine that did not go with the food at all the music in the background was annoying and the entire atmosphere of the restaurant is unattractive and loud it was also very pricey for that quality of food i dont usually give reviews but this one was necessary so as to let people know what to expect for their time and money

Address: 4367 Rue Notre Dame Laval, QC H7W 1T3 Canada
Review:
quite frankly possibly the most underrated greek restaurant in laval

we got some takeout  it was ready very quick for a saturday night the pork gyro pita are fantastic well balanced and stuffed to the brim pork is not too fatty the moussaka was very good  probably the best weve had very fair prices

im very interested in coming back and trying some of their other daily or weekly specials the greek meatballs roasted pork or the lamb look amazing

glad we discovered this little gem dont think well need to go anywhere else in laval to satisfy our greek cravings i think it deserves more recognition

Address: 4367 Rue Notre Dame Laval, QC H7W 1T3 Canada
Review:
welcome home the food served here is a delightful showcase of traditional greek cuisine prepared with utmost care and attention to detail what impressed me the most was the affordability of the dishes without compromising on taste or quality its truly a haven for those seeking authentic flavors at reasonable prices i was in awe when i first glanced at the skepasti platter that i ordered and later i was in absolute bliss after tasting it the horiataki salad was also fantastic  the tomatoes were just perfect as was the dill salad psilokomeni  the greek potatoes will make you question every other potato youve eaten before what was also a huge highlight was how tasty their olive oil was they serve bread with your meal and the olive oil tasted unlike any olive oil ive ever had i could have drank an entire cup of it it was so good the portions also are very generous you are getting your moneys worth

the wines offered here are all imported from greece featuring a selection of highquality wines we were a party of 6 and we all thoroughly enjoyed each bottle we shared

the ambiance of the restaurant is cozy and welcoming creating a warm and inviting atmosphere to enjoy your meal the friendly and attentive staff further enhanced the overall dining experience dom our waiter took good care of us the entire evening he helped us decide what to start with and made us feel confident in our selections based on what we liked and the portions 

if youre in laval and craving traditional greek cuisine at an affordable price this restaurant in the chomedey area is an absolute mustvisit

Address: 4367 Rue Notre Dame Laval, QC H7W 1T3 Canada
Review: great food vibe and service the food is so good and yummy the greek vibes are amazing we were ported to greece in this short period of time highly recommended

Address: 4367 Rue Notre Dame Laval, QC H7W 1T3 Canada
Review:
i really like this place if you are craving some good greek food made by nonna this is the place to go

the staff is always so nice and the food is so good the portions are big also if you get a plate it already comes with tsatiki so you dont have to buy extra which i love because alot of places you need to buy extra

they have a small little dinning area which is nice

definitely a must to try honestly

Address: 4367 Rue Notre Dame Laval, QC H7W 1T3 Canada
Review: we received an incredibly warm welcome and were presented with the daily specials the cuisine was both fresh and outstanding and the service was flawless i couldnt help but observe the restaurants remarkable cleanliness and the evident dedication and affection put into maintaining it

Address: 11655 Boulevard Gouin Ouest Montreal, QC H8Y 1Y4 Canada
Review:
what a gem  stumbled upon this restaurant searching for a place to eat on google maps
the staff is so friendly the restaurant is really clean and the food is outstanding  the portions are extremely generous soup salad shrimp rice veggies and whatever protein you chose   the products used are great    my 2 kids loved it and we cannot wait to go back

Address: 11655 Boulevard Gouin Ouest Montreal, QC H8Y 1Y4 Canada
Review: we went as a group and ordered separate food but then the chef divided the meals and only gave us small servings each food is also a bit bitter i think its too expensive for such small servings soup tastes good though and the chef entertained us well with the fiery stuff

Address: 11655 Boulevard Gouin Ouest Montreal, QC H8Y 1Y4 Canada
Review: i only took one picture of the food because everything was so delicious i forgot about documenting my meal the chef was great the food came fast the service was on point i went with my wife for date night and we were really happy its good value wed definitely go back  i would recommend going in a group to avoid sitting with random people

Address: 11655 Boulevard Gouin Ouest Montreal, QC H8Y 1Y4 Canada
Review: this would be my first time at a teppanyaki grill restaurant and i wasnt disappointed they chef was super nice and personable i love the whole act food was cooked perfectly i went with the steak cuts and chicken it was very delicious also the onion soup was great i was with a big party and everyone agreed they had a good time fyi you get what you pay for

Address: 11655 Boulevard Gouin Ouest Montreal, QC H8Y 1Y4 Canada
Review: my first time at this style of restaurant and i loved it food was great i never thought onion broth could taste so good the staff are all attentive and very pleasant and the chef was friendly entertaining and funny overall a great host

Address: 1575 Rue Fleury Est Montreal, QC H2C 1S7 Canada
Review:
everything was perfect
the most friendly helpful service we shared a fun shot with our waitress
the calamari was good tuna tataki salad excellent very good poutine the burger so surprisingly amazing the thai pasta was also perfectly done we had the lava cake for dessert and it was so warm and good
will be coming back

Address: 1575 Rue Fleury Est Montreal, QC H2C 1S7 Canada
Review:
brought my mom here for supper and had the plance with various meats was more than we could finish and was delicious

the waitress was wonderful and really kind my mom doesnt speak much french and i truly appreciated her efforts to ask my mom questions i cannot share enough how nice the folks at this restaurant are

as a local who lives in the area im glad to have found this place and plan to return

Address: 1575 Rue Fleury Est Montreal, QC H2C 1S7 Canada
Review: very nice find we were looking for a rsvp last minute in the area and found this gem of a place food was very good my safe had the bavette which were grilled to perfection and i had the st louis rib which was falling form the bone ambiance was nice and they have a well stock bardesert menu was unique ask for it and you will seetried one of their drinks gin with basil which was phenomenal will recommend and be back

Address: 1575 Rue Fleury Est Montreal, QC H2C 1S7 Canada
Review: great service from samuel our waiter funnyfriendly and knowledgeable of the menuwe had many laughs  food was amazing nice portionsso happy i went on recommendation of a friend  will definitely go back so nice to know we have a few good restaurant on fleury ahunstic

Address: 1575 Rue Fleury Est Montreal, QC H2C 1S7 Canada
Review:
well hidden restaurant below the street fleury
place is know for its bib of beef 

nice atmosphere insidecosy decor and nice wine selectionfriendly service and prices are decent my favorite restaurant on fleury street for these reasons

merci

Address: 5312 Patricia Avenue Montreal, QC H4V 1Z2 Canada
Review: it serves mostly take out there is a sitting area with two tables best for sitting while waiting for your order the temperature in the restaurant is warm inside so if you dont mind the heat then dine in the service was very good and professional

Address: 5312 Patricia Avenue Montreal, QC H4V 1Z2 Canada
Review: 1st time and i found the patty to be very big in size and value  i found the secret is to heat the patty either in oven air fryer or toaster oven  the pastry will be nice and crispy  fluffy  if you microwave the pastry will come out tuff and a bit hard to chew  i found the to patty pastry was very thick and heavy overtaking the filling which seemed mildly spicy maybe it was the batch but i wished there was more beef filling  anyhow these are big patties  please more filling it would make them so much more enjoyable  thanks

Address: 5312 Patricia Avenue Montreal, QC H4V 1Z2 Canada
Review:
best home made jamaican pattys in westmountteal authentic
make sure u order in advance

Address: 5312 Patricia Avenue Montreal, QC H4V 1Z2 Canada
Review: quality has gone down over the years one a great local business now need work on customer service and business they just got a few changes and take the business seriously good luck

Address: 5312 Patricia Avenue Montreal, QC H4V 1Z2 Canada
Review: am honestly disappointed in the past their beef patties actually tasted like beef patties bought a patty and i felt like i was eating a bread crumb patty with little pieces of meat here and there i dont know if they are attempting to save money by cutting down on the beef and increasing the portion of bread crumb but it shows in taste texture and appearance it looks very pale compared to how was before hope they go back to their old recipe

Address: 4567 Rue Wellington Montreal, QC H4G 1W8 Canada
Review:
loved the buzz and vibe of the place

we ordered a bottle of wine but it took quite a while to get it  another couple arrived after us and they got drinks well before us so maybe we just didnt get the right person

the enchiladas were great although i would have loved to have a little hot sauce

my wife had the picante grilled shrimp and calamari  they were not picantebecause we didnt get the accompanying sauce  asked oncenothing  asked a second time and finally got it  this would have been solved had our wait person return a few minutes after serving to see if all was good

we did give an extra tip to one guy that was running around giving 100  although he didnt serve us we noticed his hard work  wow

maybe we will get him next time

i will return and hope we have a better experience

Address: 4567 Rue Wellington Montreal, QC H4G 1W8 Canada
Review: passing by and seeing this peruvian restaurant my friend is peruvian and was happy to see that this is my second peruvian meal compared to the first peruvian restaurant i have been this one was not very professional there were two dishes with missing ingredients my friend reminded the waitress to make up for it later other than that the ambience service and dishes were great and i loved the decoration of this restaurant

Address: 4567 Rue Wellington Montreal, QC H4G 1W8 Canada
Review: delicious  peruvian food very tasty  and freshthe portions are abundant and satisfyingthe service is great  so is is the atmosphere with irs peruvian musicthe patella dish was amazing  especially the riceamazing texture and seasoningloads of delicious dishes

Address: 4567 Rue Wellington Montreal, QC H4G 1W8 Canada
Review: i highly recommend this cozy peruvian restaurant the quality of the food is consistent and the staffs are very welcoming once you try their tasty food you will crave for it later thats how it makes you go back to the resto again and again overall an superb restaurant for a foodie

Address: 4567 Rue Wellington Montreal, QC H4G 1W8 Canada
Review: best peruvian food ive had in canada by far the food tasted as it should  with authentic peruvian seasoning  and it was delicious and the service was excellent even though it was a busy friday night we were a group of 8  and had reservations so we were seated right away my family and i will definitely be back  cant wait to try their other dishes on the menu

Address: 597 Boulevard C√¥te Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L Canada
Review:
very delicious food the staff is super hospitable and welcoming
the taste of the kaak itself is amazing as if i am taking a bite from home very close taste to kaak abu arab in lebanon

by far the farfelu kaakeh 3 cheese  mozzarella akawi halloumi is their signature kaakeh it is a must try

i also ordered the basterma  cheese as well as the turkey and cheese very good taste and the portions are big enough if you are not a heavy kaakeh eater 1 kaakeh is more than enough

prices are crazy good compared to the size of the portion and ingredients the price is very acceptable

chez wafi chapeau bas my expectations have been exceeded will i visit again you bet i will

1010 service
1010 food
1010 pricing

Address: 597 Boulevard C√¥te Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L Canada
Review:
i would share my own experience which might be different from others
food taste is average not impressed
they were not honest as they overcharged me way more than the published price
unfortunately i figured out after i left the place first and last visit
my advice is to be careful when you pay if you want to go

Address: 597 Boulevard C√¥te Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L Canada
Review: such delicious food always have to stop by when im montreal they are always so friendly and the food is incredibly fresh highly recommend

Address: 597 Boulevard C√¥te Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L Canada
Review: very good and delicious food very kind people

Address: 597 Boulevard C√¥te Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L Canada
Review: an amazing kind lady and food was better than great and fresh

Address: 7112 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2S 3E2 Canada
Review: we unexpected had free soup and salad after weve ordered food cozy restaurant great amount of pork katsu it was really crispy and tasted really good karaage was average for me

Address: 7112 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2S 3E2 Canada
Review: food is really just average ive had better korean food is montreal i ordered their pork sauteed and although presentation and color is really nice taste was lacking the chicken katsu is actually better food is served is a long wooden platter but portion is actually small

Address: 7112 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2S 3E2 Canada
Review: very tasty japanesekorean food fairly affordable they bring you a free miso soup and little salad to start really loved the vegetable tempura and the chicken katsu especially we also ordered the bibimbap which was quite good as well and edamame which are always nice to have

Address: 7112 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2S 3E2 Canada
Review: absolutely delicious food cooked with care and so much skill i had the tofu teriyaki and my girlfriend had the beef we were both blown away the agedashi tofu was delicious as well and the tteokkochi was perfection crispy outside chewy inside perfectly spicy miso soup and a fresh and delicious salad come with every meal this place is such a find super yummy affordable food and caring service we cant wait to go back

Address: 7112 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2S 3E2 Canada
Review: delicious food they have the best chicken katsu or okonomiyaki i definitely recommend this place the staff is very friendly however i wish they offer delivery whenever i open uber eats or skipthedishes app it is always close for delivery

Address: 5136 Avenue du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4G5 Canada
Review:
i really loved the soup soooooooo much
my sister also loved her dish so much
i really really want to say a huge thank you to the owners i have left my instax camera at the restaurant but the owner even ran out to find me and to give it to me backÍ∞êÏÇ¨Ìï©ÎãàÎã§
great food good service nice and kind hearted owners
its a restaurant you cant miss

Address: 5136 Avenue du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4G5 Canada
Review:
one of the best korean restaurants ive tried it just tastes like korea the soup base is amazing good spicy level it was huge but i couldnt help finishing it even the banchan was excellent  especially kimchi
the owner is very kind def must visit krestau
if iived in montreal id come everyday

Address: 5136 Avenue du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4G5 Canada
Review:
the freshly baked cowboy bones sizzled on the hot iron plate and the aroma hit my face the big plate full of cowboy bones made my mouth water the marinated cowboy bones are very tasty and the meat is very tender and easy to bite it may be a little salty when eaten alone but it is just right when paired with the black rice served by the store seasonal vegetables are also grilled which is very appetizing and relieves greasy when paired with cowboy bones we ordered the vegetarian tofu bibimbap the bibimbap with sun eggs is very tempting bibimbap itself has only the aroma of rice and seasonal vegetables the store will serve it with a korean spicy sauce which can be adjusted according to personal taste
the hot sauce is also tempered fragrant and not too spicy

Address: 5136 Avenue du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4G5 Canada
Review: beautiful warm restaurantperfect for a family dinner or date night  fast and friendly service the seafood pancake was so light and crispyevery bite had delicious veggies and seafood bimbimbap was on point but the star of the show was definitely the pork bone soup gamja tang the meat was the most tender thing ever and the soup was just out of this world if you go here you must try it enjoy

Address: 5136 Avenue du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4G5 Canada
Review: this restaurant is a mustvisit for anyone looking for delicious authentic korean food in a cozy welcoming atmosphere the family who runs it are incredibly hospitable and make you feel like youre dining in their home i highly recommend this spot to anyone looking for a delicious authentic korean meal

Address: 6015 Saint-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2L8 Canada
Review:
i would try this place again

ive only tried this location so i will comment this location alone they have 2 other locations
very nice staff
the drinks were good
they have a big selection of wines and a pretty big menu for cocktails aswell

this is a tapas restaurant so for those that like sharing its perfect because the portions are not huge its perfect to get a few different things and share in between

we got the oysters the tuna tatakithe crab bites and also the salmon tartare all of those were good the only disappointment that i had was more of the tartare i feel like the amount of salmon in the tartare was not enough and there were more of the other ingredients then the salmon in the tartarelike tomato that looks like tartare but its actually tomato

prices are not that expensive compared to other tapas restaurant in mtl

i definitely recommend this place its nice for a date night or to catch up with a friend this location wasnt big

Address: 6015 Saint-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2L8 Canada
Review: the oysters and the sangria are delicious one of the best sangrias ive ever had but theres no air conditioner and it gets very hot  the fried calamari

Address: 6015 Saint-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2L8 Canada
Review: great place to go eat and drink the asian fusion food is excellent i was surprised that the poutine bibimbap tasted that good the flavours blended well the tuna tataki was amazing and calamari was good the service is great as well but my only thing that i would neatpick would be the decor that needs a bit more love but besides that very good place to come and eat with some friends

Address: 6015 Saint-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2L8 Canada
Review:
nice restaurant with a budget friendly menu
music and ambiance was nice and welcoming
the oysters were really good
my friend ordered crab bites those were very good as well
there was a dish i chose that wasnt really to my liking and the waitress immediately spoke with management and offered to replace it with something else from the menu she suggested two that were her faves and i ended up with the tuna tataki it did not disappoint excellent dish right down to the details on the plate
we also ordered a mocktail of one of their drinks and it was so refreshing
would definetly recommend this spot

Address: 6015 Saint-Hubert Montreal, QC H2S 2L8 Canada
Review:
been wanting to go to la b√™tise for a long time and finallyhad the occasion to try
they offered a special menu since it was their anniversary and we got to try their shrimp pasta with lobster bisque sauce if only it was on their menu all year long because it was excellent
the truffle oil fries are a must lightly salted with a not too overpowering taste of truffle oil served with some kind of spicy mayo sauce addicting
dont forget their 2 oysters had to order 2 platters one as an appetizer and another for dessert

Address: 575 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7M 1Y9 Canada
Review:
exactly as it was when it first opened on cote des neiges 40 years ago  food staff ownerall the same and all is as good and cheap as it ever was back in the day iconic

its not high end fancy sexy presentation its just tasty great cheap american chinese food that comes to your table fast fresh and hot  service as always very rapid and courteous

Address: 575 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7M 1Y9 Canada
