new comment the place techniquelly should close at 1000 pm we come 932pm to order the lady she said we are close and we are waiting for the cleaners to clean the fan 
and it was ppl there with their orders  honestly its not nice at all i hope the owner sees this comment

Address: 2125 Boulevard le Carrefour Boul Laval, QC H7S 2J7 Canada
Review: we went there without  reservation and they accepted 4 people they told us we had 15 hours to eat and then leave which i find was strange we accepted as we were sure they would not kick us out if we stayed 12 hour more dont want to choke on steak we waited 20 minutes for our meal my friend ordered the new york steak and it was fatty and rubbery i wanted a rib steak but they did not have they provide you with little fries and then they come back to see if you want more they charge 50cents for tiny bread which is ridiculous service was poor as waiter hardly came by to verify if all was ok ambiance was not great we would not return back

Address: 2125 Boulevard le Carrefour Boul Laval, QC H7S 2J7 Canada
Review: my 8 months pregnant wife and two of our friend with two kids total guest of 8 however the server was very pushy the lamb was dry and when my wife asked her why is it so dry she said thats how its supposed to be at the same time my friend lamb was juicy our bill was 400 i would not go back due to service they 05 per bread i would not go back

Address: 2125 Boulevard le Carrefour Boul Laval, QC H7S 2J7 Canada
Review: good service but food is not that good compare with another steak house

Address: 2125 Boulevard le Carrefour Boul Laval, QC H7S 2J7 Canada
Review: we had a reservation for 13 people we had an amazing service the atmosphere was nice i ordered la table dh√¥te in which i had snails with garlic and cheese new york steak with a lobster tail and cupcake trio the snails and the lobster tail were delicious the steak was good too but i ordered it medium and it came mediumwell the fries lacked seasoning and were bland the trio cupcake was good overall the food is delicious and i had a great experience

Address: 2125 Boulevard le Carrefour Boul Laval, QC H7S 2J7 Canada
Review:
french fries are all you can eat here with mayo and ketchup always freshly made the lamb sharnk is tender but served without a sauce the st paul steak is tender but the chef failed to produce the medium rare as ordered the terre et mer is very good both the lobster tail and well done filet mignon all vegetables came with the main are excellent roasted the calamari is good but the size of squid is too small for making the dish
it was an enjoyable evening will come back next time and bring a bottle of wine

Address: 2940 Ave Pierre-P√©ladeau Laval, QC H7T 3B3 Canada
Review:
this place is okay but its not authentic

the octopus was really good but very small portion
the calamari was okay nothing special there was no tentacles

the truffle pasta was okay also and the risotto dish came with a big piece of osso bucco was not expecting to have a big piece of osso bucco i thought it would be bone off

but i can say that the creme brulee was really good

the service was actually amazing the waiter was really friendly

i had ordered an espresso martini with my dessert but they had forgotten to put khalua in it and it taste horrible when i told the waiter about it he was doubting me on why i wanted to return the drink back but then he realized that it was the khalua that was missing in the drink he brought me khalua in a glass so i can mix it in my drink

this place seemed to be more of a place for groups they had private rooms if you are celebrating a birthday party or a big get together in laval with italian type of food i think its a good choice

Address: 2940 Ave Pierre-P√©ladeau Laval, QC H7T 3B3 Canada
Review: went on a weekday evening hardly anyone there but yet the service was lacking   caesar salad was made with green lettuce instead of romaine  became very soggy plates did not look nice   steak was very hard to chew  where was the veggies in the shrimp and veggies dish cold and tough shrimp  and the ravioli was just ok    i expected so much more from this restaurant i was not impressed at all did not finish plates  sprinkling tomatoes does not make a plate look nice

Address: 2940 Ave Pierre-P√©ladeau Laval, QC H7T 3B3 Canada
Review: the service was pretty bad we found a bug in one of our glasses and after removing the insect our server tried to give us the same glass of wine since the wine was still drinkable the food was good but the service was very off putting

Address: 2940 Ave Pierre-P√©ladeau Laval, QC H7T 3B3 Canada
Review: great service  but the food and ambiance here are absolutely nothing to write home about the food was mediocre and as such acceptable but the overall experience feels tired and dated i understand that not every place wants to be trendy but calvi lacks a sense of pride

Address: 2940 Ave Pierre-P√©ladeau Laval, QC H7T 3B3 Canada
Review: just avoid this place the restaurant was empty the manager name adil welcomed us however he didnt seems to happy since we were with 2 kids therefore he gave us a table in an isolated room where it was very hot as soon as we wanted to sit he even closed the door  it was 42 degrees celsius outside i asked him is the air conditioning working in that room he told me yes which was not true therefore we decided to leave and we came to sterling steakhouse right next door they were very nice and accommodating and helpful with the kids mr adil i hope you have kids and if you do i hope no ones treats you like how you treated us

Address: 1145 Rue Fleury E Montreal, QC H2C 1P9 Canada
Review: our first time at this  great local bistro restaurant very nice

Address: 1145 Rue Fleury E Montreal, QC H2C 1P9 Canada
Review: lovely cafe with a french menu the cafe is cute the service is friendly and inviting this was my first and only experience eating out since the start of the coronavirus and they were so professional there arent a lot of options for those who dont eat meat  but its french cuisine so thats on me the quartier of the cafe is also lovely i would highly recommend this beautiful spot

Address: 1145 Rue Fleury E Montreal, QC H2C 1P9 Canada
Review: went there a couple days ago food was ok coffee and desert were nice good service

Address: 1145 Rue Fleury E Montreal, QC H2C 1P9 Canada
Review: salad was very good but chicken was dry great presentation nice atmosphere with outdoor space

Address: 1145 Rue Fleury E Montreal, QC H2C 1P9 Canada
Review: very nice place cozy  friendly staff  the food is average going next time for a coffee

Address: 3591 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2X 2R9 Canada
Review:
juicy packedfull dumplings that are flavourful and comforting good prices too 
the egg and tofu dumplings were among my favourite even compared to meat ones the beef and coriander were also very good
pork and cabbage were my least favourite
cute atmosphere  its literally in a house
great for vegetarians

Address: 3591 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2X 2R9 Canada
Review: dumpling hut is the barbie dream house of dumpling places in the milton parc area my friends and i wanted to make sure we were emotionally and spiritually ready for our movie adventure so we fuelled our bodies with dumplings as is tradition we all split our different types of dumplings so we got to sample the lambcoriander chickenmushroom and beefcoriander varieties wow is this place good the sweetness of the ginger ale was made sweater when the waiter complimented our barbie outfits i am a barbie girl sampler of dumpling worlds great place highly recommend

Address: 3591 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2X 2R9 Canada
Review:
really good dumplings all made from scratch
we had the cabbage and mushroom and pork and cabbage both were delicious
hopefully will get to try the fried version next time it was too hot and no ventilation the day we went so they werent offering fried

Address: 3591 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2X 2R9 Canada
Review: super spicy chilli oil reasonably priced hand made infront of you dumplings would return for another 16 pork and cabbage

Address: 3591 Rue Clark Montreal, QC H2X 2R9 Canada
Review: wonderful restaurant the food is 1010 i went three times and will definitely go back whenever in montreal again the servers are all so nice and cute and service never takes long it is a clean and chill space perfect for people of all ages i also loved the little candy bowl by the register and the little space with the notes in the entrance so cute

Address: 7032 Rue Waverly Montreal, QC H2S 3J2 Canada
Review:
great little corner in montreal must try if you are in the area food is slightly overpriced but you should also consider the experience and the vibe
i got the pulled pork sandwish and it was a solid sandwish i would like to try their burgers next time as it was highly recommended to me as well

Address: 7032 Rue Waverly Montreal, QC H2S 3J2 Canada
Review: this is our kind of place straight forward food focused decorated like a cozy basement with a vintage look adorned with silly props like a giant comb quirky signs and jars in the shape of shorts this is a great place for to have a satisfying sandwich or burger for lunch huge juicy fresh exquisitely seasoned and topped served with a refreshing smile theres nothing about deplepickup that we dont love

Address: 7032 Rue Waverly Montreal, QC H2S 3J2 Canada
Review: its a great little place to have an amazing sandwich the pull pork sandwich is the one you want to get although the rest is good too simple place simple people i wish there was parking spots its a residential area and you need a sticker i got a parking ticket so be careful

Address: 7032 Rue Waverly Montreal, QC H2S 3J2 Canada
Review:
i went to this place many years ago and ive visited it again last week and i was not disappointed still the same great homy easy simple vibe wish this place was in my neighborhood

tried the vegetarian options with the fake pulled pork amazing even better than the real stuff no cap made from tofu skin with a rich cozy delicious barbecue sauce and halloumi both were successes they also have a great selection of local beer and wine

Address: 7032 Rue Waverly Montreal, QC H2S 3J2 Canada
Review:
diamond in the ruff
unassuming small and convivial depanneur that serves the best sandwiches in town grilled halloumi cubano pulled pork and trout gravlax are all amazing
super friendly and casual atmosphere they also sell microbrewery beers hot sauces try their home brand mango pick up hot sauce amazing and other specialty items

Address: 1626 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O Montreal, QC H3H 2N4 Canada
Review: blown away by the ground beef and lamb wrap it was phenomenal the bread was made fresh on site and was so delicious highly recommend we also tried the chicken wrap which is also good chicken was tender we liked the ground beef and lamb more the owner is so nice it started pouring outside so he lent us his umbrella so we can get to the car safely thank you

Address: 1626 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O Montreal, QC H3H 2N4 Canada
Review: excellent kebab and more i had the chicken kebab sandwich for about 12 and it was pretty filling with a bottle of ayran  about the size of my hand you gotta have cash they have an atm in there but its one of the sketchy grey ones you find at clubs

Address: 1626 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O Montreal, QC H3H 2N4 Canada
Review:
nestled in the heart of the city antep kebab is a true gem for lovers of turkish cuisine from the moment you step through the door youre greeted with warm hospitality and the enticing aromas of perfectly seasoned meats grilling on open flames however what sets antep kebab apart from other turkish restaurants is its exceptional homemade bread and mouthwatering dressings that elevate the dining experience to new heights

the star of the show at antep kebab is undoubtedly their freshly baked bread with each bite you can taste the care and craftsmanship that goes into its preparation the bread is soft yet slightly crispy on the outside creating the perfect vessel for savoring the tantalizing flavors of their kebabs the bread is served warm allowing it to melt in your mouth and complement the grilled meats impeccably its evident that antep kebab takes great pride in their breadmaking tradition and it shines through in every delightful bite

the assortment of dressings at antep kebab is a true delight for the taste buds each dressing is thoughtfully crafted and perfectly balanced enhancing the flavors of the kebabs without overpowering them whether you prefer the tanginess of the yogurtbased tzatziki or the rich smokiness of the roasted red pepper sauce there is a dressing to suit every palate the attention to detail and quality of the dressings truly add depth and complexity to the entire dining experience

beyond the bread and dressings antep kebab offers a wide selection of kebabs each prepared with the utmost care and using authentic turkish spices the meats are tender and succulent showcasing the expertise of the chefs and their commitment to serving topquality dishes the menu also includes an array of vegetarian options ensuring that everyone can find something to savor and enjoy

Address: 1626 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O Montreal, QC H3H 2N4 Canada
Review: so delicious this place is a must try the antep kabab sandwich is my goto which is a blend of ground beef and lamb the pita bread is made fresh inhouse and is soooo goood just bring cash with you as it is cash only

Address: 1626 Boulevard de Maisonneuve O Montreal, QC H3H 2N4 Canada
Review: this place was on my radar for awhile now and i had the opportunity to check it out today i ordered the lamb sandwich with spicy sauce and my oh my was i blown away from the soft warm bread to the ever so juicy lamb i will most definitely be back here to try the chicken and filet sandwiches my mouth is already watering thinking of them 1010

Address: 2379 Boulevard Rosemont Montreal, QC H2G 1T9 Canada
Review:
this restaurant is amazing never had one meal that i did not enjoy 

friendly staff along with the owners food is so tasty and prices are reasonable for the quality of food

Address: 2379 Boulevard Rosemont Montreal, QC H2G 1T9 Canada
Review: d√©licieuse food in a very cozy and friendly environment staff is amazing i definitely recommend

Address: 2379 Boulevard Rosemont Montreal, QC H2G 1T9 Canada
Review: this place is just amazing the food was fresh and really delicious service was very welcoming the atmosphere was nice and actually you are able to have a good chat with your friendfamily when enjoying your meals

Address: 2379 Boulevard Rosemont Montreal, QC H2G 1T9 Canada
Review: my partner and i had a wonderful time at la menthe poivree the servers were friendly and seated us quickly the menu had a ton of options that made it easy to satisfy more than one of our cravingscuriosities a hidden gem in rosemont

Address: 2379 Boulevard Rosemont Montreal, QC H2G 1T9 Canada
Review: a quiet place with very well priced food the scallops were amazing dont let the pictures on the online menu fool you the flavours are very good in their dishes i went for the terrace but it is not open yet

Address: 3669 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9G 1X2 Canada
Review:
this restaurant produced some of the best southern food ive ever had the drinks were amazing appetizers esp the fried chicken were immaculate entrees were tasty with large portions

the customer service was amazing the waiters were extremely knowledgable and answered every question we had the head chef interacted with customers and was extremely welcoming

ambiance cozy

wow wow wow i will definitely be back soon

Address: 3669 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9G 1X2 Canada
Review:
finally tried this west island establishment after passing by it for over a year booking a table was easy via the open table app service was friendly and attentive the food of course was the shining star we had the jambalaya which was super tasty the pork bao was delicious and so were the fish cakes for the mains the brisket and blackened catfish potions were very generous and also very tasty
will be back to try the tasting menu

Address: 3669 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9G 1X2 Canada
Review: what an incredible place my friends had raved about it for so long and i finally got a chance to join them  already cant wait to go back the food was incredible every bite of every item was memorable the drinks were on point and so was the service major compliments to the chef cant wait to go back soon and try the tasting menu

Address: 3669 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9G 1X2 Canada
Review: my favourite restaurant in montreal my boyfriend and i go every time we visit and we are never disappointed the menu is small but top quality with a wide selection from comforting mac and cheese to the complex flavor palate of scallop ceviche a focus on sea food with new orleans spices small quaint atmosphere caring servers

Address: 3669 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9G 1X2 Canada
Review:
decmber 17th 2022

where do i even begin first off we were here thanks to a giveaway that i had initial won through a certain platform entr√©e main meal and dessert was on the house for two

from the moment we entered the restaurant we were greated right away they already knew why we were there which was great i didnt have to explain myself and show proof and have to go through a long series of waiting for an authorisation from the owner the staffs were all well informed about everything

we were seated right away they took the time to explain the menu and informed us about the specials of the evening our waitresshostess was a little cold by mid meal meaning she did not took a moment to ask if everything was to our liking while on the other hand a table next to us were regular costumers and i will say they were treated firstclass mind you we ordered extra items two cocktails and tip was given according to our entire meal including the extra items

despite that little hiccup our dinner experince at bistro nolah was by far the best we have ever had in a very long time

i have always wanted to try southern dishes without having to travel too far and let me tell you the food was mouthwatering it was an explosion of flavors the details on each plating was immaculate

the whole experince was so memorable that we came back a second time not long after

mr chef taitt you have an amazing team with such talent and your restaurant reflects that thank you for 2 unforgetable dinners

Address: 3035 Boulevard Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: i celebrated my birthday there 20 ppl it was an amazing time and food was very good portions are amazing and the staff where above and beyond great

Address: 3035 Boulevard Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: my first time ever to this restaurant i heard that it was good so i wanted to try it i had a great experience here clara was my waitress and she was very nice thank you clara for the service next time i come i will ask to be seated at your table

Address: 3035 Boulevard Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review:
loved the ambiance and enjoyed the tuna which was cooked perfectly despite the kale salad which is last place in my salad choices

wine by the glass had a generous pour and tasted good

Address: 3035 Boulevard Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: nice atmosphere super friendly staff delicious food we will definitely come back

Address: 3035 Boulevard Le Carrefour Laval, QC H7T 1C8 Canada
Review: great experience food was properly prepared and well worth the price overall experience was amazing ive been left disappointed at other restaurants but i can gladly say i will be returning to table 51

Address: 5163 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2T 1R9 Canada
Review: feels like authentic mexican food tapas are great a few to choose from some tastier than others overall a good and tasty experience service is on point charming waiter and waitresses add to the experience i will come back again to try out more of the menu

Address: 5163 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2T 1R9 Canada
Review: great mexican place to eat gringas al pastor plate was a good size served with a plate of chips had a chat with the owner and it was a nice moment

Address: 5163 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2T 1R9 Canada
Review: i came across this lovely authentic mexican restaurant in montreal while on a stop over before heading to quebec city with my husband and daughter the food was great and taste really good cozy ambiance and great service  definitely a must try

Address: 5163 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2T 1R9 Canada
Review: this was our second visit to this colorfully decorated mexican restaurant it was a warm evening so we took advantage of the warm weather to eat on their curb side terrace the service was prompt  the waiter explained the concept of the tapas style menu with cazuelitas you make your own tacos the margaritas were good  accompanied with tasty nachos  guacamole our appetizer of cheese quesadilla however lacked a little flavor the tacos came in a pretty little bowl with towel that kept them warm you order your own fillings for the cazuelitas there are 2 extra sauces that you can add a mild one  an extremely hot one that my wife who  likes spicey foods even found too hot we ordered 3 cazuelitas which i found underwhelming i would have liked the opportunity to order some rice or refried beans as a side but they are not on the menu the presentation  service were very good however overall the food lacked the wow factor for us

Address: 5163 Boulevard Saint-Laurent Montreal, QC H2T 1R9 Canada
Review: could not be more impressed honestly the service was amazing the food  drink was perfect wasnt even troubled by the delay on the food but they still went above and beyond with extra chips and churros on the house id give this place 6 stars if i could just for that

Address: 4418 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2J 2L1 Canada
Review:
pros
nice place to play board games with friends they have a good variety of games even though not as much as other board games places in montreal
for 5 you have access to all of the games available and ask questions to one of the employees that will help you pick a game depending on your mood
the tempeh salad tasted great i loved it and wasnt expensive
the mocktails are original and delicious

Address: 4418 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2J 2L1 Canada
Review:
always a great place to have fun with friends while playing boardgames great ambiance the food and service are both great
personally i like it better than randolph
the only thing is you cannot reserve a table but it does give a fair chance for everyone to get a table

Address: 4418 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2J 2L1 Canada
Review:
very nice and happening place  everyone was so fun and the food was good too they had a trivia night but we were late for it they do have plenty of board games this is the right place to chill out with your friends

the waitress speak english and being non french speaking we didnt have problem communicating

they did have vegetarian pizza option  which was good

Address: 4418 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2J 2L1 Canada
Review:
cocktails are delicious me and my 2 other friends ordered three to four of them each cant say anything about the food as we had already eaten before coming

we came on a friday around 9pm and had to wait in line for about 15 minutes we were seated at the bar at first and then moved to a table when one freed up

we had a great time and would totally come back again also their bathrooms are very clean

Address: 4418 Rue Saint-Denis Montreal, QC H2J 2L1 Canada
Review:
excellent concept  great way to spend an evening and satisfy your inner gamer
huge selection of games for all  from quick two player party games to the longer drawn out strategy games
the game concierge are extremely knowledgeable approachable and friendly  the food and drink selection was surprisingly good  the staff was warm and often checked in
highly recommended for a evening with friends or even just a 2 person outing

Address: 7093 Jarry E Montreal, QC H1J 1G3 Canada
Review:
the salad was so fresh and tasty the burger tasted wonderful and the sauce was incredible

order suisse pleurote burger with extra fresh onions  a normal burger with cheddar bacon and onion coleslaw a small salad and a stewarts orangen cream

Address: 7093 Jarry E Montreal, QC H1J 1G3 Canada
Review: one of the best burger i have tested and the spicy fries is a must taste

Address: 7093 Jarry E Montreal, QC H1J 1G3 Canada
Review:
update  its still a 5 star almost 2 years later and several times of dining in taking out or delivered

amazing food amazing service  absolutely unbelievably kind and generous owner  this is the place to go for a burger worth driving here

yes it could be a little slow to get order but its only because the patty is thick and they make it all fresh  well worth the wait  if youre in a rush then call ahead of time   ive done that before

Address: 7093 Jarry E Montreal, QC H1J 1G3 Canada
Review: amazing burgers and steak honestly is there a better burger joint in the city than this place inexpensive especially for the quality you are getting most burgers will top out around 78 and the portions are big for most common burgers theyre cheaper than the fast food restaurant chains but much better quality quality is also way above some of the trendy hamburger restaurants that have opened recently they are substantially cheaper than them had a 12oz steak new york strip with a side for 1895 pic below  very inexpensive for the quality of the steak they make and its fresh due to this the price is variable

Address: 7093 Jarry E Montreal, QC H1J 1G3 Canada
Review: great burger and good service recommended

Address: 5007, Avenue Du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4E9 Canada
Review: the best lasagna restaurant in montreal it was really tasty when we tried the meat one the pasta was delicious the texture was great there is a vegetarian option as well the restaurant offers takeout lasagna as well as a few tables for eating in the staff owner were friendly and helpful this is a place i highly recommend

Address: 5007, Avenue Du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4E9 Canada
Review: this is the best place in montreal to have lasagna you can certainly dine in but i think most of the business is a takeout business i stop in once or twice a week to get my lasagna fix id go more often but this restaurant is only open wednesday saturday the owner has his own recipes and handles everything himself im wildly pleased with each type of lasagna he makes definitely recommend him to anyone who loves lasagna the way that i do

Address: 5007, Avenue Du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4E9 Canada
Review: really good lasagna the pasta was especially nice great consistency feels very homemade only organic ingredients no added industrial sauces to top it all off the owner is really great and kept up a great chat

Address: 5007, Avenue Du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4E9 Canada
Review:
ldp lasagna is on point if you like good marinara sauce and homemade pasta ldp never disappoints excellent for parties chalet events or when you are hosting an event and you do not want to do hours and hours of work but want your guests to be satisfied and impressed with the food vegetarian options available our favourite is the vegetarian lasagna and eggplant parm seasonal whether you order a tray or a single portion you can expect the same quality ldp does not skip out we have ordered from ldp for lunches of 20 people for work precovid chalet outings 10 guests or just grabbed lunch every time ldp has delivered and have our friends going back on their own for more a great plus the owner is a great human and cares about his customers
pro tip  call them order ahead because they sell out often

Address: 5007, Avenue Du Parc Montreal, QC H2V 4E9 Canada
Review:
let break it down for everybody
straight up super cool place super cool guy  bruno reminds me as if we were in a bronx tale  he made us 2 lasagnasbeef sauce and one ravioli
it was amazing texture of lasagna was immaculate tomato sauce wasnt acidic but perfect like what you make at home cheese enough to melt in your mouth and finally temperature to perfection enough for you to enjoy your meal we were 3 people and every bite we were giving each other eye contact and agreeing to ultimate satisfaction if you dont like your meal message me and ill pay it thats how much i trust this place
so ladys and gentlemen enjoy
soho carpets

Address: 138 Avenue Atwater Montreal, QC H4C 2H6 Canada
Review:
first time trying singaporean restaurant and was definitely impressed by its unique flavours the ambiance and service were fantastic and the staff were all dudes dressed in shorts and tshirts giving a relaxed and welcoming vibe

the chicken satay was absolutely amazing the other dishes and cocktails were good as well i highly recommend this place

Address: 138 Avenue Atwater Montreal, QC H4C 2H6 Canada
Review:
amazing place great staff and ambiance music is a bit too loud but very good everything was delicious papaya salad and pork buns are a must

highly recommend to share the plates we shared 5 plates and the desert plate for 3 people and it cost us under 40 before tax and tip

place gets packed everyday reco to get there before 7308pm

Address: 138 Avenue Atwater Montreal, QC H4C 2H6 Canada
Review:
the music was extremely loud when we visited impossible to make any conversation even with the person sitting next to you food was alright would have enjoyed it better if we couldve talked to each other
we made a reservation for 11 people and one person didnt show up they split the 11th persons charge evenly over our bills even though they only brought food for the 10 of us

unfortunately i would not go again

Address: 138 Avenue Atwater Montreal, QC H4C 2H6 Canada
Review: a must for those who love asian food but crave something different from the traditional flavors found in chinatown i suggest coming as a group and ordering many dishes to share the umami is through the roof and can feel heavy if not paired with white rice my personal favorites are the pork belly steamed buns and the laksa

Address: 138 Avenue Atwater Montreal, QC H4C 2H6 Canada
Review:
no resos for groups under 6 and i recommend getting there early we arrived at 630pm on a thursday and it was packed we waited roughly 1520 minutes for a spot for 2 they let you order drinks while waiting though which is a great start

must trys on the menu are the satay skewers with peanut sauce the fried pork and shrimp rice rolls not pictured but we both agreed it was the best thing we tasted papaya salad and the regular pork steam buns

the shrimp buns were part of their specials but its not as balanced and tasty as the pork buns if youre stuck between the two go pork

for the noodles i would go for the mussel and chorizo noodles instead of the shrimp and cuttlefish

but really everything on the menu is excellent we also have our amazing experience to thank to our server carl who went above and beyond in the service

100 recommend

Address: 46 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7N 2H4 Canada
Review: i get it that its a fast food place but dont offer a salad if youre not going to wash it first i paid over 11 for a caesar salad no extras the lettuce was dirty and to top it off a blue collar worker with very dirty hands helped himself to the croutons behind the counter  i guess hes a regular customer so they dont bother him he reached into the jar of croutons took out a handful  put his grubby hands to his mouth and then reached in a couple more times  these are the very same croutons that were on my salad  ewwwww

Address: 46 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7N 2H4 Canada
Review:
this chez gerard is phenomenal the customer service is excellent and the food is really good the prices are somewhat better than the one on concorde
picked up food many times and it has always been good

Address: 46 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7N 2H4 Canada
Review: my brother and i went to this place we did not regret it best poutine in town tall man served us with the best service he is the owner or manager will be back soon for sure

Address: 46 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7N 2H4 Canada
Review: been going there since i was 6 years old spot never changed same owner same awesome fast food they dont mess around with the quebec classics wont regret

Address: 46 Boulevard Cartier O Laval, QC H7N 2H4 Canada
Review: great fries and poutine customer service is friendly and kind

Address: 733 Boulevard de La Cote-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 1Y3 Canada
Review:
hello

im traveller and this is first time i tried meat and chicken cooked one day before
not healthy atmosphereuse to be good before

the owner very rude and he treated customers base on their background

wont recommend it

Address: 733 Boulevard de La Cote-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 1Y3 Canada
Review:
so disappointed by abu elias clear sign that anthony cant be trusted anymore as a reliable source got the marinated chicken legs raw meat and ribs

the bad chicken thighs sadly had to be thrown out the next day it was old and smelly for the price tbh i was expecting fresh chicken for it to spoil within a day isnt a sign of fresh chicken it was stored along with the ribs which were amazing so definitely not a fridge issue on my end
the raw meat was not handled according to canadian guidance for handling raw meat which was a major disappointment given that they make kebbe nayeh
the ribs were delicious so no issue there
prices are really inflated and doesnt justify the quality

Address: 733 Boulevard de La Cote-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 1Y3 Canada
Review:
review of abou elias restaurant

i recently had the opportunity to visit abou elias restaurant and unfortunately i left with a rather disappointing experience while i had heard positive things about their sandwiches and service my personal encounter was far from satisfying

one of the first things i noticed was the size of the sandwiches they were incredibly tiny which left me feeling a bit shortchanged it seemed like there was barely any filling making the overall taste and satisfaction quite underwhelming

to make matters worse the meat in the sandwiches was extremely chewy it felt like it had been overcooked or lacked tenderness this greatly affected the overall enjoyment of the meal as i had expected a better quality of meat

moreover the service i received when requesting a bit of garlic sauce on the side was quite disappointing the employee seemed irritated by the request and proceeded to lecture us about their policy of not providing additional condiments their attitude was unprofessional and left a negative impression it is disheartening when a customers reasonable request is met with such hostility

the most disappointing aspect was the stark contrast between the restaurants online presence and the actual experience while they may portray themselves as generous and offering amazing service on various youtube channels the reality was far from it it felt as if they were merely pretending to provide exceptional service for the sake of online appearances

overall my visit to abou elias restaurant was far from satisfactory the sandwiches were tiny the meat was chewy and the service was below par i would advise potential customers to approach this establishment with caution as the actual experience may not align with the advertised image

Address: 733 Boulevard de La Cote-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 1Y3 Canada
Review:
delicious food tastes just like in lebanon i cant believe ive waited all this time to discover this place

treat yourself and go the mixed meat platter i see some comments here saying its overpriced its just not this is much better than what you can get from the big lebanese food chains its incomparable the meat is flavorful fresh juicy it comes with all the right fixings their potatoes are d delicious too

also please give a try to their hummus this is what real hummus should taste like this is the only place ive tried  that serve a proper hummus in montreal and trust me ive tried many lebanese restaurants on the island and in laval for the past 10 years this would be considered a good hummus even in lebanon it is creamy and you can really taste the tahini

ordered through doordash and it arrived quickly and well packaged

Address: 733 Boulevard de La Cote-Vertu Saint-Laurent, QC H4L 1Y3 Canada
Review: the food was excellent we ordered the mixed tray to dine in however there were no forks or knives just if you ask they will give you they also dont accept credit cards

Address: 1459 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7S 1N1 Canada
Review: i really enjoyed their large variety of options in their menu which caters to a lot of people with different types of food restrictions it allowed a large group like ours to all find something that we like easily the food here was decent the prices are a bit higher than a lot of other italian restaurants but the quality is a bit better i would say the portions are also reasonable for the prices the service was split in two one waitress was nice and friendly being very careful about allergies and food restrictions while another waitress was a bit more less friendly in my opinion everything was decent and a bit above average overall a decent place to enjoy a meal with a larger group

Address: 1459 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7S 1N1 Canada
Review: i remember going there 15 yrs ago with my best friend and after all this time i would still recommend it if you are looking for a nice restaurant the staff was friendly we had good service

Address: 1459 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7S 1N1 Canada
Review: great variety of pizzas and pastas that caters to everyone also nice that you can bring your own alcoholic beverages the atmosphere can get pretty loud and busy at times especially on the weekends so best to make a reservation

Address: 1459 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7S 1N1 Canada
Review: good place to hang out with friends the food was good and the service lets say a bit too fast one of the good things is that u can bring your own wine

Address: 1459 Boulevard Saint-Martin O Laval, QC H7S 1N1 Canada
Review: food was tasty too salty we ordered 3 different plates and we all had the same comment service too slow if u are in hurry better  go elsewhere for quicker lunch

Address: 4337 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9H 2A4 Canada
Review:
for allyoucaneat the food was great service was nice and friendly small space needs better ventilation there was a lot of smoke and it was very hot

ice cream is also allyoucaneat

Address: 4337 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9H 2A4 Canada
Review:
the restaurant is small and has no ventilation so it was very smokey  the staff was very friendly and helpful  they changed the grills often to reduce the amount of smoke but it didnt make much difference

the food was decent but nothing special  some of the meat was tender and some was chewy  the shrimp were tasty but not very big  the best thing that we ate was the spicy fried chicken  it was crisp flavourful and juicy  it would have been nice to have more dipping sauces for the largely unflavoured meats  the kimchi was also very nice and not overly spicy

the restaurant is fun since you grill your own food to the doneness that you prefer but once the novelty wears off you realize that you are paying to cook your own meal in a restaurant

my main concerns was more of a food safety issue  you are given tongs to grill the raw meat but you use the same tongs to serve the cooked meat and the side dishes thereby contaminating everything  im not usually a stickler about these things but in this case you are cooking many different pieces of meat at many different stages of doneness and everything is contaminated

Address: 4337 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9H 2A4 Canada
Review:
its sad for me to say but this was the worst dining experience i had in years food was okay but nothing special

i recommand the marinated chicken and the spicy chicken legs also their seafood on the grill was decent

unfortunately this place is understaffedno ventilation and they give you 2h max even though the place was slow me and my colleagues were inhaling gas and charred meat smoke the entire time i felt sick to my stomach and had a headache until the next morning sorry guys but am not coming back
3499person for a terrible supper experience

on the brighter side of things decorum was very pleasant

Address: 4337 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9H 2A4 Canada
Review: maria may and bob are the nicest the more kind and genuine staffs ive had in a bbq resto changed our grills often passes to check up the clients a lot very present on the floor not once we had to chase down our server she was always present although the ventilation could be better i enjoyed very much my time here eith my friends and theyll most definitely see us coming back more often as a group

Address: 4337 Boulevard Saint-Jean Dollard-des-Ormeaux, QC H9H 2A4 Canada
Review:
absolutely loved the food here
lots of choices for meat and other korean foods

amazing staff as well and our ice cream came with a cute deco

Address: 431 Jean-Talon Rue O Montreal, QC H3N 1P9 Canada
Review:
i got the xl rare well done and beef brisket pho it was very good i really enjoy that they have multiple sizes to choose from the atmosphere was really lovely quiet im surprised that they dont have more people just hanging out and enjoying a bowl of soup
the service was marvelous too very fast

Address: 431 Jean-Talon Rue O Montreal, QC H3N 1P9 Canada
Review: the best vietnamese restaurant in montreal the b√∫n b√≤ hu·∫ø is delicious

Address: 431 Jean-Talon Rue O Montreal, QC H3N 1P9 Canada
Review: not only do they have a great menu filled with delicious choices the staff are so friendly and helpful that its a delight to eat here we always go for the soups which are always served with fresh thai basil sprouts and if you want to live dangerously or love spice fresh chillis we never leave disappointed we also have tried a few sides and desserts which are delicious place is always kept clean even when it is super busy prices are reasonable

Address: 431 Jean-Talon Rue O Montreal, QC H3N 1P9 Canada
Review: big plates delicious food reasonable prices super attentive and friendly staff clean and utilitarian inside looks mediocre from the street but its really a hidden gem

Address: 431 Jean-Talon Rue O Montreal, QC H3N 1P9 Canada
Review: we ordered the extra large spicy beef and pork pho it was delicious flavoursome and huge i mean huge i was starving before ordering xl but turns out that still was too much definitely coming back recommended

Address: 8084 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2R 2J6 Canada
Review: had the beef bahn mi and the chefs special banh mi they were really good and good price also had the bloody beef soup and since i ordered take out they gave it in 3 separate containers 1 with broth 1 with meat and 1 with sproutssauce and limes made it good so when i got home it tasted fresh

Address: 8084 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2R 2J6 Canada
Review: woow this place is a gem the food is sooo good  i had the bbq pork banh mi and its stellar the best one ive had in montr√©al cant wait to try the pho soup

Address: 8084 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2R 2J6 Canada
Review: its a cozy place from vietnam the owner and the cook are really friendly youll discover that theyre not working for profit today i took a delicious chicken soup for just 10 dollars i liked it because is beside jarry station ill be back soon

Address: 8084 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2R 2J6 Canada
Review: very good food at low cost the owners treat you great

Address: 8084 Rue Lajeunesse Montreal, QC H2R 2J6 Canada
Review: always a pleasure to get a banh mi from this place  so friendly too

Address: 2119 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7S 1Z4 Canada
Review: great menu awesome service very cordial servers and all were helping each other out the food was fantastic especially the beef tacos and the guacamole dip

Address: 2119 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7S 1Z4 Canada
Review:
ask your waiter about lexp√©rience escondite and you wont be disappointed you get to taste a few items on the menu for 40person

we got the nacho dumplings highly recommend it  mango salad as an entree then they served us the ribs which were to die for then we had the tacos  my favorite was the fish baja 20 and finally churros for dessert overall the meals were very well balanced and we were super full by the end

Address: 2119 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7S 1Z4 Canada
Review: second time here  small very cute and trendy place atmosphere is fun cute signs hanging on the walls  see pictures albeit a little loud for conversation the food was excellent meltinyourmonth good and very flavourful i had the mango salad wow and my husband had the chips n guac and we had 2 tacos each  it was plenty the tacos are quite small but with an appetizer sufficient i would definitely recommend for a fun night with friends

Address: 2119 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7S 1Z4 Canada
Review: friendly staff fast service a bit pricey but dont expect to be full its mini size snack we enjoy our night but was still hungry after this mexicain restaurant is more of a chill and hang out for drink kinda place beautiful decorations and the male  female bathroom are kool

Address: 2119 Boulevard le Carrefour Laval, QC H7S 1Z4 Canada
Review: when i took my first bite of their nachos i saw the holy light i was surrounded by angels i could hear the trumpets my life flashed before my eyes i witnessed every moment that led me up to that very moment when i snapped back to reality those nachos had already made sweet sweet love to me twice and that was just the beginning their tacos i did not think these flavors were even possible i was killed beautifully and reborn and baptized gracefully by their tacos it was a moment like never before this is what love feels like and that love was found here at escondite behind a bar being served by an angel of a bartender i wanted to spend the rest of my life and grow old with this meal i wanted to be buried beside this meal the only thing i could ever complain about this place is that i cannot stay there all day

Address: 2010 12th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review:
we had a wonderful evening here tonight we reserved on the penthouse patio gorgeous view of the city and a nice al fresco dining area seated initially in one of the banquette style seating tables  pro tip if you have people in your party who are shorter request at time of reservation to be seated at the traditional table and chairs seating we asked if we could be moved and our server checked with the hostess to make sure that there was a table available that hadnt been reserved in advance to seat us at there was but the restaurant was not as busy as one would expect on a beautiful saturday summer evening so we lucked out
we ordered drinks aperol spritz was well made cold and refreshing the cucumber basil gimlet was stellar cucumberbasil were a perfect match for the gin and citrus ingredients gave lively sweetsour notes served on rocks it was a welcome aperitif for a warm humid evening
appetizers were shared the korean kimchee dumplings were delicious beautifully thin wrappers with pork and kimchee filling steamed and served with a soysesame dipping sauce the giant calamari crown was a whole calamari tube sliced into rings delicately breaded and fried  tender tasty served with one of the best aiolis ive ever had  smoky savoury slightly spicy with an herbaceous note i couldnt identify but really enjoyed crab cakes were homemade with a nice crust pan fried and served with chipotle remoulade good texture and taste bruschetta was good the tomato topping was fresh and tangy my only issue is that i prefer the baguette slices toasted or grilled and these were served au naturel not my personal taste
mains were the double cut pork chop stuffed with brie pecans and dried cranberries big appetite at the table the chicken supreme with maple mustard glaze for the smallest appetite the pork chop was nicely seared tender juicy served with a port reduction the chicken was cooked perfectly on the bone the glaze skewed more to being a sauce but it was quite delicious more savoury than sweet well balanced both were served with roasted baby potatoes that were creamy inside and seasonal fresh vegetables cooked tender crisp also tasty myself and the other member of our party ordered the fish special pan fried salmon filet with pineapple and apple salsa seved with pecan fried rice and the fresh summer veg the salmon filet was cooked perfectly seared outside moist and tender inside the salsa was a fresh tangy note that complimented the rich salmon pecan fried rice was astounding a seemingly odd combination that was extremely yummy we ate every bit of it
for dessert the large appetite had a creme brulee the rest of us ordered one each of the three available desserts to share creme brulee was nice the custard was smooth silky with perfect texture the sugar crust torched to a golden brown that cracked satisfyingly when struck with the spoon it was a hit with the creme brulee lovers at the table the lemon tart had a light fresh filling topped with 3 individual meringues lending a nice textural element the crust was on the thick side and very difficult to cut into with the spoon but the flavours were there the absolute stand out was the chocolate torte dark rich decadent sweet and bitter notes of the chocolate perfectly balancedso good
our server tegan was excellent friendly and personable
we had 2 cocktails a beer 9 glasses of wine couldnt agree on bottles 4 appies 4 mains and 4 desserts the bill after tax and before tip was 434 we left stuffed and extremely happy 5 stars highly recommendwill eat here again next time im in town
20ten you need to relocate to vancouver where you would be truly valued and packed out every nightrecent reviewers seem to lack a true appreciation for andor familiarity with this style of food and dining

Address: 2010 12th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review:
special rooftop birthday surprise with fianc√© it was super expensive  we really liked the dessert the food apps didnt have much flavour  the meats were pretty dry disappointing food especially for how expensive dessert was delicious

also the view was amazing at sunset

Address: 2010 12th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review: absolutely top marks for 20ten city eatery  the ambience and atmosphere was outstanding the service was fantastic and the food was first class  the quality presentation creativity and flavour of each of the dishes were exceptional  there was a lot of thoughts put into each of the plates  20ten city offers second to none the finest dining experience  highly recommended

Address: 2010 12th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review: ive never eaten at 20 ten city eatery until tonight oh my god the food is so good i kept meaning to take pics before i dove in like a pig but i failed horribly trevor is the chefs name and his food is amazing

Address: 2010 12th Avenue Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review:
im surprised with all the good ratings of this place visited from toronto and decided to try the restaurant on a friday evening yet our experience at the 2010 restaurant was a great disappointment  we tried to make a reservation by chat email and phone and no one got back to us either way so we decided to walkin when i told the manager this he simply laughed it off and said that if we didnt get a response we didnt get a reservation this caught me off guard and reflected on his unprofessional and rude demeanor
they placed us at a wiggly table and we felt completely ignored the evening wasnt that busy and there were a couple of empty tables when we asked if we could change our table after a couple finished to get a better view the waitress came back and told us that the manager said it was booked yet we stayed past 9pm and no one came to claim the table however  one couple did come and surprisingly they changed their table three times so basically from what i gather is if you are a regular and an important personal youll get the highend golden treatment if not you are treated with rudeness
as for the food  it is overpriced and nothing to crave about any good food critic would give them nothing higher than one star if you are looking for something with flavor id recommend an ordinary pub such as taverna or the pizza restaurant famoso
i do not recommend this restaurant   simply visit the restaurant for the view and order nothing more but one drink but getting a helicopter ride to see the veiw of regina would be a better experience bad service  rude management  overpriced food highly not recommended

Address: 1625 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X3 Canada
Review: on our first time in regina we found this nice indian restaurant with fantastic food and friendly staff the mix veg pakora glutenfree as a free start which mesmerized me was so yummy and tangy  samosa not glutenfree chana masala and fish curry were also delicious as well as the saffron rice as a glutenfree person i immensely enjoyed my dinner if you did not try this place yet add it to your mustgo list  bon appetite

Address: 1625 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X3 Canada
Review: i loved this restaurant i ordered the chicken korma with saffron rice and garlic naan the best chicken korma ive ever had next time i go i will request extra chicken its that good

Address: 1625 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X3 Canada
Review:
great food and incredible service 
absolutely recommended
tried the chicken samosa and lamb beryani
the portions are not much but they meet the price you pay 5 out 5 experience

Address: 1625 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X3 Canada
Review: we have been coming here since it first opened i have tried almost every dish on the menu too  their lunch specials are very delicious and filling  their service is so welcoming and humbling  with myself being east indian and completely approving the variety of flavours and taste to be on par says a lot on how authentic it really is

Address: 1625 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1X3 Canada
Review: this place blew me away  hands down some of the best se asian food ive ever had  the chef knows how to balance spice and flavour to let the ingredients shine through this is my goto place in regina now

Address: 1852 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G3 Canada
Review: got served by brady tonight very friendly  guy and created such a good environment thanks man best bartender around give this man a raise

Address: 1852 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G3 Canada
Review: this used to be one of my favourite spot when i was working downtown with great service but have gone back three times in the last 6 months and the service has been terrible it was between 23 pm when there hardly any customers there and the staff does not seem to care you literally have to keep watching around for some to serve you a drink while everyone is chatting even when you are sitting at the bar i literally wanted to get up and leave all three times but it was cold so just stayed

Address: 1852 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G3 Canada
Review: this bar was subpar i dont recommend it and would not return they have a simple selection of drinks and food i tried their wings which may have been the worst wings ive ever had also tried the shrimp poboy which was very salty they had a chicken pot pie soup it was odd tasting their fires were also very salty my friend said the blt was good and would order it again server was kind but didnt know much about drinks but she was diligent on getting the answers to our questions

Address: 1852 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G3 Canada
Review: cold food terrible service sat at our table for over two hours and saw the waitress maybe 3 times it was not busy enough to justify this waitress seemed more concerned with hanging out with her friends than serving customers wouldve liked to have more than two drinks over the 2 hours at a bar definitely was not wanting to stay as long as we did but it took 45 minutes just to get a bill will not be returning

Address: 1852 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G3 Canada
Review: homemade burgers healthy salads all at a reasonable price reginas best known and most loved restaurant is popular with locals and tourists alike ive always enjoyed lunch at the badger healthy hearty meals served with a smile

Address: 2032 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y3 Canada
Review:
best steakhouse ever i was randomly walking around and i happened to walk by this building and i was wondering what it looked like in the inside turns out it was open so i walked in and it turns out to be a fancy place which is awesome
so someone escorted me to a seat and when they asked me what i wanted to drink ive asked for a double cherry vodka which is awesome because usually cherry vodka is not available at bars and stuff so that was nice
i normally dont order seafood but ive asked to get a fresh grilled salmon and the waitress recommended the better version which was something i wasnt expecting so i got it and wow did it ever tastes great in fact i wanted more lol so ill make sure to get that again if i have the luxury to go there again 
as for the staff all of them were really nice to me especially alyssa so keep up the good work guys

Address: 2032 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y3 Canada
Review:
best fine dining experience in the city of regina hand down

for staff service id give an easy 5 stars the waiter was courteous and checked in to ensure our meal was going great and we had all we needed throughout our stay

for the food it was tasty well seasoned satisfying and there was so much variety to choose from it took a reasonable amount of time to prepare compared to some other fine dining outfits in the city that take more time

the plating technique here is very impressive too

only downside is parking the parking lot for this restaurant is quite small and not easily accessible

Address: 2032 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y3 Canada
Review: although our last two experiences at the diplomat had not been positive we decided to give them another chance when friends from out of town arrived  the waitress was wonderful unfortunately i didnt get her name and the drinks were made to perfection  our friends had the chateaubriand for two and said it was delicious  i enjoyed the diplomat chicken although the stuffed potato was burnt  we were extremely disappointed in the 10 ounce steak my husband ordered  it was cooked to his preference but the steak had so much gristle in it he found it was inedible  our waitress offered to take it back but this would delay his meal and we would be done by the time he got his meal back  for this reason he declined a replacement  i suggested there should be a reduction on the bill as the steak was priced at 4695 i was vastly disappointed to see the restaurant took a mere 10 off  ultimately we paid 3695 for a piece of inedible meat  this is the third strike  we will not be back

Address: 2032 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y3 Canada
Review:
this place is is what the keg wants to be when it grows up literally has changed my perspective on what steak should taste like and every time i go i leave in awe staff is old school cool and classy but with modern and accepting of everyone wine collection and bar is best i have seen in canada and will always tell people to go for the experience

its a spectacular spectacle that is worth it

Address: 2032 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y3 Canada
Review:
lovely restaurant and the staff are extremely friendly you just always want to go back to a place like that
the ambience is perfect as well i brought my friend here to celebrate her birthday although they dont offer a birthday special or chefs special treat for birthdays they were kind enough to let us bring our cake and they helped cut it and serve it to everyone at the table
the food tastes so good i ordered the new york streak strip and some potatoes
for a special night out you want to visit this place

Address: 2903 Powerhouse Drive Regina, SK S4N 0A1 Canada
Review: was djing for a wedding on the patio beautiful weather staff were attentive and friendly food was delicious and presentation amazing some very creative flavor pairings made for a wonderful experience could use more plug ins but that doesnt concern me as a consumer just as a vendorlol

Address: 2903 Powerhouse Drive Regina, SK S4N 0A1 Canada
Review: super cute from the inside it has a completely different interior in comparison to other restaurants in regina the food was exceptionally well and the chef also had halal chicken available upon request

Address: 2903 Powerhouse Drive Regina, SK S4N 0A1 Canada
Review: when you enjoy the best thanksgiving meal youve had in a long time and make a special request almost an year later to fullfil your craving of some good chocolate cake and you fulfilled cant thank you guys enough 2 amazing cakes delivered over 1500kms all the way to minnesota delivered by family members cant wait to stop here the next time we travel to regina

Address: 2903 Powerhouse Drive Regina, SK S4N 0A1 Canada
Review: waffle and chicken the chicken doesnt really jump out in flavor however it is balanced out with the waffle the saucegravy has a flavour that i was not able to distinguish it did however bring the waffle and chicken together

Address: 2903 Powerhouse Drive Regina, SK S4N 0A1 Canada
Review: 1010 must try if youre in the mood for something comforting and next level brunch was simply amazing and the atmosphere is beautiful from the food presentation to the flowersdecor right down to the hand crafted cups

Address: 4626 Albert Street Regina, SK S4S 6B4 Canada
Review:
my husband and mother in law went here after we walked out of another chinese food place it was a buffet and it was disappointing nothing but scraps in the buffet this place was nice and many great options everything from canadian chinese to vietnamese fresh noodle bowls the ginger beef was a nice crispy with the right amount of spice the pork noodle bowl was tender with the right amount of fat on the pork
the serving of chilli oils on the table could have been fuller i was digging out the last bit
the service could have been a bit better the servers kept forgetting to fill our drinks
other wise the atmosphere was clean and a nice touch of colour

Address: 4626 Albert Street Regina, SK S4S 6B4 Canada
Review:
good food fast service we ordered a mix of sweet pork in peking sauce then a spicy dish chicken xo sauce and they both work so well
together enjoyed it overall with some
taro boba and some soup and fried rice

Address: 4626 Albert Street Regina, SK S4S 6B4 Canada
Review: the food is very good but most of the service staff here have a very bad attitude and the way they serve they do not smile do not welcome guests everytime i come its always like this and to be honest i think the management staff should review and replace all employees if they continue like this

Address: 4626 Albert Street Regina, SK S4S 6B4 Canada
Review: great food and good service the wait was a bit  long but it worth it definitely try it with a group of people so you can order multiple dishes and share

Address: 4626 Albert Street Regina, SK S4S 6B4 Canada
Review: this is good asian food close to home generally the food comes fairly quickly and the service is good this time we were told after we were sat that the kitchen was backed up and our food would take at least 30 minutes we were given the choice to stay or not i didnt like the wait but i liked i was given the truth and the option  the only downside thing i can say is that the prices are a couple of bucks a plate more expensive that other similar restaurants

Address: 4908 Dewdney Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1B8 Canada
Review:
ill be honest i dont even really like poutines i wasnt overly looking forward to coming here but i had to give it a shot because of all the hype i loved it so many choices almost too many makes it very hard to pick and such a great value there is so much food no one at our table could even finish their meals seriously mmm leftovers everything was delicious even the burgers i cant wait to go back

ps coney island rekindled my love for milkshakes

Address: 4908 Dewdney Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1B8 Canada
Review: fun little dinner great selection of milkshakes im addicted to the german chocolate cake milkshake and im not a chocolate person i love their pickadilly poutine and have ordered it more than id like to admit if youre a pickle lover this is your poutine dont be fooled by their smaller size option their poutines are very filling and a small always fills me up for hours

Address: 4908 Dewdney Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1B8 Canada
Review: delicious food and a crazy good selection of poutines this place wont disappoint to fill you up and keep you eating even though you dont want to gravy is very tasty and good consistency fries cooked well and taste good too chilli was delicious and didnt taste bland would recommend this to anyone looking for a nice greasy snack

Address: 4908 Dewdney Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1B8 Canada
Review: friendly staff with fast service and tasty food i recommend the pulled pork poutine and chocolate milkshake

Address: 4908 Dewdney Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1B8 Canada
Review: the service burger and poutine were so good  the staff very friendly and offered excellent suggestions and lots of options to choose from a wonderful place  for something different i didnt have a milkshake but those who did said milkshakes were very good

Address: 227 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0P4 Canada
Review: we love this place we always order lemongrass pork vermicelli bowls so good tonight they threw in two things of fresh rolls on the house wow they are incredible

Address: 227 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0P4 Canada
Review: amazing  price for the amount of food you get such a cute little restaurant and the service is great will come again new favourite vietnamese restaurant in regina by far

Address: 227 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0P4 Canada
Review: first time there ordered fried rice and wings she asked me wut level spice i wanted ended up getting the regular level if u dont like spicy not a place for ui cant imagine wut the higher level spicy isbut the meal was so goodi would go backfriendly people too just one thing little pricey for how much food u get could get abit more its fried rice

Address: 227 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0P4 Canada
Review:
we were passing through regina
i read some reviews on this place and it did not disappoint we had bun bue hue with rice noodle my usual go todeluxe noodle bowl and bahn mi sandwiches the food was delicious the staff was very friendly  and the atmosphere was busy
great job definitely recommend

Address: 227 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0P4 Canada
Review: recently i went to dine in for supper with my family they didnt have any air conditioning which made it super hot inside they also had a bunch of flys flying around which made us not able to enjoy our food at all

Address: 1881 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 4K9 Canada
Review: we made a reservation for 15 the day of which they happily accommodated however the service was painfully slow even though we were the only ones in the restaurant 2 hour wait for food made our guests wondering what was going on only got offered one round of drinks and no refills after that the pizza was pretty good but salad and pasta was only okay gelato was a treat overall not the best experience but would likely be better with a smaller group of people

Address: 1881 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 4K9 Canada
Review: food is always great service was okay but not the servers fault as she was the only one serving inside outside and the bar because of the large homeless population in downtown core right now i would suggest sitting inside for a better experience

Address: 1881 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 4K9 Canada
Review: decent hang out place in the downtown with delicious food

Address: 1881 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 4K9 Canada
Review:
very disappointing we have enjoyed our experience at famoso in the past this time the carbonara sauce was bland curdled and separated and they also forgot the pancetta the lettuce was rusty the worst parts were in the garbage by the time the picture was taken the wings themselves were good but you can see a lack of care even in simply tossing them so the sauce would be evenly coated the lasagna was fine though not very warm which i will give a bit of a pass on since it was takeout the pizza was good

edit this review was intended for the east location but i understand the ownership is the same regardless

Address: 1881 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 4K9 Canada
Review: the food was really good the waitress never checked in with us and it took well over 20mins to flag her down after our table was cleaned just to get the bill the restaurant wasnt even busy

Address: 1953 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2H1 Canada
Review: cute little venue with tasteful decorations the service was very kind we overstayed an hour and a half without knowing and they were serving us drinks even after closing the food was good and the smoked whiskey was one of our favourite drinks

Address: 1953 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2H1 Canada
Review: heard about the dolmades and had to try them they were delicious i would recommend had the chicken souvlaki again it was delicious the service was great and friendly loved the original menu blow up on the wall whish i could still get pumpkin pie for ten cents

Address: 1953 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2H1 Canada
Review: came in right at closing and wait staff was extremely kind and fast with our food seafood saganaki was flavorful and the soup was one of the best ive had highly recommend

Address: 1953 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2H1 Canada
Review: ive gone here twice and both times it was a 1010 experience the food is just amazing and the service is really good too i would definitely go here a third time

Address: 1953 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2H1 Canada
Review: historical restaurant in the heart of downtown regina top tier food highly recommend anything greek or the pizza

Address: 1851 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G9 Canada
Review: reasonable prices sauce was great  unfortunately the pasta seemed store bought and was undercooked  will try again

Address: 1851 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G9 Canada
Review: i had the limoncello on ice and fettucine alla boscaiola with chicken and mushroom the bread was perfect soft and straight out of the heaven la signora was so nice and helpful will visit again

Address: 1851 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G9 Canada
Review: restaurant was clean service was good food was okay had the spaghetti aglio e olio taste was good but the pasta was quite watery

Address: 1851 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G9 Canada
Review: i went to this restaurant many times  to eat i had pizza and ravioli special  everything was really delicious and staff  is friendly and kind  everything is homemade

Address: 1851 Scarth Street Regina, SK S4P 2G9 Canada
Review: hands down best food in regina

Address: 1800 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 7K3 Canada
Review: food was quite delicious and the service was also great the music they play is also great to vibe to and it was altogether a good experience having my dinner there i dont remember the names of the dishes as it has been a while since i went there

Address: 1800 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 7K3 Canada
Review:
moxies is one of reginas finest restaurants it has a clean sofisticated design which i enjoyed a lot the staff are friendly and professional the lighting for evening dining is perfect

the appetizers main course and desert were all very good i was satisfied with the prices as well i recommend you try out this fine dining restaurant the booth area has a an intimate feel to it especially when it is dark with that low light

Address: 1800 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 7K3 Canada
Review: they have some of the best shrimp tacos staff was super friendly and they have a good menu would definitely come again

Address: 1800 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 7K3 Canada
Review: great service  great food  we shared the pot stickers and nachos and couldnt finish lol

Address: 1800 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 7K3 Canada
Review: wow the cashew chicken lettuce wraps were amazing great service food and atmosphere for our little date night

Address: 1975 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y1 Canada
Review: while staying at doubletree by hilton decided to try the happy hour at wild sage kitchen and bar  had the classic canadian pizza which was very good and a couple of drinks  allison our bartender was great  friendly and efficient   happy we chose this happy hour

Address: 1975 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y1 Canada
Review: very disappointed as we waited 12 hour for a server no beverage provided and then didnt take our order we booked for a 4 night stay and if this is how the restaurant is run we will not return a skeleton staff is no way to run a business patrons next to us waited for their bill for over 40 minutes and contemplated on just walking out servers have to acknowledge and inform customers ahead of time if there is a wait hotel staff is great but the restaurant needs better management

Address: 1975 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y1 Canada
Review: great restaurant located in the double tree hotel 15 dollar pizza and pint special is more than enough food and terrific value

Address: 1975 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y1 Canada
Review: food was nicely prepared nothing breathtaking but they got all the fundamentals down quality food good service friendly staff and reasonable prices portions were a little small but in line with what youd expect at similar place would eat there again

Address: 1975 Broad Street Regina, SK S4P 1Y1 Canada
Review: wonderful experience friendly and knowledgeable staff amazing food we had the beet hummus and rock shrimp fritters to start  both things i wouldnt normally choose but i was practically licking my plate after i had the avocado club and parmesan fries for my entree and it was delicious  a bit of spice but not too much awesome dip for the fries and of course dessert the ice cream purple yam and salted egg ice creams  cant even describe but definitely worth checking this place out

Address: 1946 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2C4 Canada
Review:
delicious food never been to thailand but just feels very authentic

generous portions will not leave hungry if even can finish the portion

very fast service didnt wait more than 10 minutes to get it

Address: 1946 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2C4 Canada
Review: the shrimp cakes are a must try the curry and tom yum are awesome it actually suits the name very well authentic thai highly recommend the service and atmosphere is also great the decoration reminds me of asia a gem in regina

Address: 1946 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2C4 Canada
Review: great service and great tasting food this is authentic in the way the food comes spicy i dont think there is an ability to make anything mild trust me ive asked on a variety of food items and always end up getting medium spiced food i dont think they do true thai spice levels but for those who can handle the heat the hot is hot

Address: 1946 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2C4 Canada
Review: went for dinner and loved the food shrimp cakes were delicious ambience is okay and service wasnt very prompt but the authentic taste makes up for it pad thai portion was decent but there wasnt much on the plate of shrimp with cashew h04 would come again and try other items on the menu

Address: 1946 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2C4 Canada
Review: world class in regina of all places the most amazing match of flavours every piece of the meal was cooked to absolute perfection  the red curry pork was outstanding  the drunken noodle was equally amazing cant say enough about this place  if youre into thai you have to try this place

Address: 1845 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0R2 Canada
Review:
definitely top 3 of my favourite restaurants in regina

 the staff here are super helpful and courteous

 the restaurant environment is really neat offers great lighting and is great for picture taking as well

 the food was very tasty well seasoned and cooked to my preference

 their food prices are moderate and theres a wide variety of food options to choose from

 having a dedicated bar tender would be nice tho as there wasnt one when we visited and the drinks had to be remade a few times

if youre also looking for a private dinning or small event room up to 16 people you can check out there lucky 12 private room

Address: 1845 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0R2 Canada
Review: great for gathering with family or friends has a pretty good selection of menu items and good service from the staff

Address: 1845 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0R2 Canada
Review: we were very eager to visit as my husband  has had the prime rib multiple times and raved about it  we wanted a table on the actual rooftop as it was a beautiful evening chairs are extremely uncomfortable and not met for someone with any extra body weight it was a saturday evening 6pm one of the tables was enjoying their alcoholic beverages rather loudly and very colorful with their language  i understand its a bar and grill but it was a bit excessive  appys were delicious deep fried chicken dumplings and calamari cesar salad lacked dressing and croutons chicken souvlaki was dry fries had no crisp and raved about prime rib was far over done overall not impressed  might go back for drinks but not for a meal

Address: 1845 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0R2 Canada
Review: the night started out fine server was friendly courteous took a long time for our drinks though we felt they might be understaffed or we got forgotten about i got a lime margarita flavour was good though it didnt come in a proper margarita glass nor was the rim salted i ordered the steak and shrimp with pepper sauce and sweet fries steak was cooked well though it could have been trimmed better the fries were good the pepper sauce was disappointing it tasted like mushroom soup which i detest there were no peppercorns that i could discover despite repeated searching my partner had the baked penne with broccoli she enjoyed her dinner not sure we would return

Address: 1845 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0R2 Canada
Review: late supper date food was below subpar calamari was rubbery and inconsistent caesar salad was flavorless and the lettuce was old mushy and wilted lobster pasta was made with a can sauce and dried noodles burger was frozen had a very odd flavor like it was old fries were hot but floppy and soft no crisp to them overall really bad experience over priced for the kind of food youd expect from a lunchroom cafeteria

Address: 1717 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0P9 Canada
Review: absolutely excellent dining experience for our first time at this restaurant we had the spanakopitas as an appetizer and the entrees were moussaka and greek pork chop the food was delicious and large portions and the service was outstanding we will certainly be back

Address: 1717 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0P9 Canada
Review: we had a lovely night with friends for dinner food was excellent and service was attentive and fun thanks for the great night

Address: 1717 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4P 0P9 Canada
