Review: so stinking delicious not even kidding their savory breakfast crepes were tasty their coffee was good the quiche was exceptional but those pastries the croissants the creme puffs the fruit tarts it was paradise we got a sampler box and ate on it over time but if we lived here we would have to come and try everything on their menu so good the atmosphere was wonderful as well and they make cakes to order

Address: 2705 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review:
a must stop if youre coming to or passing through regina the deserts and crepes are fantastic the portions are large for the price i saved half my crepe for later so id have room for desert

if youre from winnipeg and remember s squared patisserie this place is just as good for petite gateux and tarts i also found the macarons were better

Address: 2705 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review:
good location in a shopping plaza nice simple building from outside magical experience with decor and design when inside good smells good music and nice staff
my favorite food here is the cr√™pes plate sweet and decadent
they really focus on quality and customer experience and it shows
went there with family member when she was visiting from germany

Address: 2705 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review:
delicious decadent and divine  a delightful experience everything tastes superb

the macaroons croissants and pastries are all great everything we tried was devoured  enjoy

Address: 2705 Quance Street E Regina, SK S4V 3B7 Canada
Review:
this is the first french bakery i visited in general the space was not outstanding but because the bakery appears to be cozy and the bakery has both a cafe and sells breakfast many people prefer to visit because of the convenience shop type concerning the staff i dislike the staff here because they are impatient in waiting for their customers for example last week when i went to buy a cake they were impatient and had a bad attitude toward me instead of waiting for me to ask anything else i believe they should guide and recommend delicious and unique cakes to new customers
the second is about the cake i purchased which consists of a dozen macarons a pitasschio and a fruit tart as shown below they all have the same flaw in my opinion and taste the cream in the cake is too sweet and very sweet it was too sweet for me to eat any longer by definition macarons are sweet but in terms of taste the flavours i purchased are nothing special except for chocolate because chocolate flavour is the flavour that shows its taste most clearly and accurately
if i have the opportunity again i will try other bakery dishes but i will not recommend them to those who are not as fond of sweets as i am however if you enjoy french cakes you can try them and make suggestions

Address: 305 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N6 Canada
Review:
we have few options because we are vegetarians one of the best ways to go on a date and spend time with someone you love is to do this

additionally they provide combos so you can have tasty cuisine at the lowest possible cost

also they have best buttermilk

Address: 305 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N6 Canada
Review: i recently had the pleasure of dining at flavour of india a restaurant that specializes in punjabi cuisine i was blown away by the quality and authenticity of the food and i would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a delicious and authentic indian dining experience we ordered manchow soup and veggie pakora at first and then for the main dish we ordered paneer jalfrezi butter naan rosted papad rice daalmakhni and sweet lassi

Address: 305 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N6 Canada
Review: we recently dined at flavours of india and it was blown away by their exceptional customer service the host went above and beyond being incredibly helpful and kind throughout our visit what really impressed me was their new indochinese feature its a fantastic addition that brings together the best of indian and chinese flavors creating a unique and exciting dining experiencethe chicken 65 dish left me in awe the flavors were sensational with the perfect balance of spices flavours of india is a must visit

Address: 305 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N6 Canada
Review: we tried first time here  the taste is really good  quality and quantity is excellent this is real taste of india  really appreciate for service

Address: 305 Victoria Avenue E Regina, SK S4N 0N6 Canada
Review: flavours of india is a relatively small restaurawe had had take out which piqued our interest in visiting the restaurant itself we were warmly greeted and seated the server was very attentive to our dietary needs and noticed we had ordered a dish we thought was purely vegan but was not and suggested an alternative after checking with the kitchen we had onion baji for an appetizer which was wonderfully fine light and crisp our two shared main dishes were fresh rich and complex in flavours one cannot recommend this restaurant either in person or take out highly enoughand weve eaten indian food in far flung locales including amsterdam and heidelberg flavours of india vies with any indian food we have had

Address: 3422 Hill Avenue Regina, SK S4S 0W9 Canada
Review:
love this location and their food chefscooks are top notch and the waitresseses are outstanding with their service  kharen specifically brings such a joyful positive and genuine vibe

will definitely be back

Address: 3422 Hill Avenue Regina, SK S4S 0W9 Canada
Review:
amazing pizza very generous on toppings crust is perfect and a little chewy which is great the sauce is tangy and delicious pizza is cooked perfectly
just a bit pricey

Address: 3422 Hill Avenue Regina, SK S4S 0W9 Canada
Review:
heard from coworkers that houston pizza was some of the best pizza regina has to offer going into it i was super excited although a little hesitant since the prices of pizza arent listed on the website the pizza is quite expensive
at first i was very disappointed with my first pizza as it was undercooked but i was offered a redo which was very nice of them the redo was much better and i understand now why people recommend houston pizza
at first i thought the ingredients were low quality but that was because it was undercooked on the second time i can confirm the toppings are toptier and would recommend

Address: 3422 Hill Avenue Regina, SK S4S 0W9 Canada
Review: ordered a xl pizza from this place and it was awful the pizza is about half of what it normally is and the quality wasnt there i ordered from this place before and it was good but this time it was very lackluster i left a complaint with the employee for the manager and didnt hear back but i expected something better then this for what ive ordered i atleast wouldve liked to hear from the manager of why there wasnt much meat and fewer toppings all of a sudden but i guess they dont care for loyal customers

Address: 3422 Hill Avenue Regina, SK S4S 0W9 Canada
Review: we ordered the combo for 4 fries and gravy were ice cold and the souvlaki smelled very offwe didnt eat it because it smelled so bad the pizza was okay but also cold and not as good as usual we have ordered from here for yearsthis is very disappointing

Address: 919 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P6 Canada
Review: ordered from here through ubereats  spent over 10000 and food was awful  wings dumped all over pizza box  the garlic bread was rock hard  ribs were good and wings lasagna was ok  the driver took forever  sat on my street and then took off and  came back again  i had to stand outside for driver to see me  not impressed

Address: 919 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P6 Canada
Review: love the greek salad  veggies are always cold and fresh lots of feta superb dressing and pick up is a breeze they have kind knowledgeable well trained staff who really make the transaction effortless oh and the garlic toastfresh homemade bread amazing

Address: 919 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P6 Canada
Review: ordered pizza for the office and while this location isnt my normal go to i was redirected to this location since its near my place of work ordered large pizza combo with salad and drink when asked what 3 toppings we wanted we said triple pepperoni my usual location usually loads up on the pepperoni since it would be considered 3 separate toppings however when the pizza came it had one layer of pepperoni i was hyping it up how good houstons is dont get me wrong the flavor was there just very disappointed we were allowed 3 toppings and got 1 layer ill be driving to the houston pizza in my area  next time

Address: 919 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P6 Canada
Review: ordered lasagna from your albert location wasnt very impressed with it seems the meat sauce was forgotten or your amount you put on is extremely very little very disappointing made phone call was told they do put sauce on i showed two people what it looked like and they said what the hell is that 1600 for just a tad of sauce noodles and cheese  i have had far better  first time ordering from your place and the last

Address: 919 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2P6 Canada
Review: they were short staffed but very kind and the food was delicious i got the all dressed pizza and was very happy with it the crust was nice and crispy despite having a lot of toppings

Address: 2102 - 11th Avenue Unit  TT10B Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: good food to stop caving for middle eastern food customer service is amazing

Address: 2102 - 11th Avenue Unit  TT10B Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: never been and when i came there the person working was very nice gave me a sample and then when i ordered added a salad to my order on the house tried the food and it was awesome 1010 recommend

Address: 2102 - 11th Avenue Unit  TT10B Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: the best baklava i ever had here in regina friendly staff gave us a lot of free samples

Address: 2102 - 11th Avenue Unit  TT10B Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: very good doner wraps must try if you get a chance

Address: 2102 - 11th Avenue Unit  TT10B Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: ive eaten here many times i am never disappointed the food is great there is a location in the east end that is equally as good you gotta eat here give it a try

Address: 1247 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2R4 Canada
Review:
my mom and i were looking for breakfast on sunday and we noticed this place on skip never heard of it so we thought wed give it a go

we both ordered the usual you get a choice of egg meat and toast and a side of hashbrowns for only about 10 it came hot fresh and soooo delicious it was probably one of the best breakfasts weve had in a while great value for your money

id eat here again

Address: 1247 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2R4 Canada
Review: never herd of this place  so i order breakfast  very delicious and good portions will definitely order again or drop in to eat a meal recommend this place

Address: 1247 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2R4 Canada
Review: very good food just wondering about allergy info

Address: 1247 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2R4 Canada
Review: food was good this is a breakfast brand related to western pizza but everyone liked it would order again

Address: 1247 Albert Street Regina, SK S4R 2R4 Canada
Review: was unable to find this physical store skip suggests it is available for delivery no pickup option makes me very skeptical went out of my way to come to a new local restaurant perhaps they should be clear about status on google google maps

Address: 1883 Victoria Ave E Regina, SK S4N 6E6 Canada
Review:
clean restaurant with professional staff i like the available seating options they are very comfortable
i have had breakfast and supper at cravings and at this time i am not opposed to coming back for more of the menu items so far everything has been good
the food has flavor i was impressed when i ordered my food with rice being a side to my surprise the rice was actually flavorful unlike some places where they give you only white rice as a side

Address: 1883 Victoria Ave E Regina, SK S4N 6E6 Canada
Review: overall i was very happy with my meal here had the calamari as an appetizer this came with homemade tatziki which was very good i had the fettuccine alfredo for an entree i did go with the added chicken the chicken wasnt bad but just didnt have much flavour the alfredo sauce on the other hand was quite good i would recommend skipping the chicken on this dish my friend had the steak sandwich he enjoyed that as well only odd part about that dish was the side it came with soup came out with the appetizers leaving just the steak sandwich by itself on a much too large plate i think adding something to that dish would make the plating much nicer even if it was just a small portion of vegetables

Address: 1883 Victoria Ave E Regina, SK S4N 6E6 Canada
Review: i was at cravings to meet an old friend for lunch the food was tasty however not very warm the food came in a reasonable amount of time was priced competitively  the waitress was very friendly  funny the experience was good  i would go back again next time i may try the wing night i had the beef dip  my guest had soup  salad

Address: 1883 Victoria Ave E Regina, SK S4N 6E6 Canada
Review: i rarely leave reviews unless it should be a warning for others i ordered a greek skillet for i believe is 1849 anyway this might as well be a dive diner based on the food shredded hash browns  basically uncooked i mean they were white its not what the delicious description is it 23 potatoes shredded that fills almost the entire bowl then 23 eggs thats just scrambled and then folded to fit in said bowl maybe 610 leaves of spinach  1 whole olive sliced and then 2 tsps maybe of crumbled feta cheese  on top and baked to make it look great but its just layer of hash folded eggs then sprinkled said ingredients on top for 3 worth of food and 20 price tag its in my opinion definitely not worth it marbled toast was fantastic but that was it oh i missed the chopped onion which couldnt have been more than 12 slice if that will not return

Address: 1883 Victoria Ave E Regina, SK S4N 6E6 Canada
Review: ordered the beef dip with a garden salad and really enjoyed both  i would have preferred a whole wheat sub bun instead of white bun but forgot to ask if they have before ordering  later at the till i did ask and learned they dont have whole wheat buns but they do have flax buns which would probably have less carbs and higher fibre than the white buns  because i have type 1 diabetes i need to know how many carbs i am getting so that i can calculate how much insulin i need to take

Address: 3622 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: the buffet was cold food looked like its been a while since it was refilled kinda disappointed the sushi was very good tempura shrimp was very good salmon  was tasty the restaurant needs to clean up the doors and windows were very dirty if u go make sure u order sushi that filled me up service was not the best ran out of water and ginger and wasabi not once but twice

Address: 3622 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: very good place to find chinese food sushi was great takes a while for you to get the food but other than that it was a very nice place

Address: 3622 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: i havent been to i love sushi since 2014 and decided to go out with my wife on a saturday all i really like is sashimi since i dont eat rice and stick with a very low carb diet i put in one order at 558 for 12 pieces of sashimi and it didnt arrive until 640 i had to go ask the front of staff where the order was twice the lady didnt seem to really care too much and talked to the kitchen staff she came back and told me later later i did put in two more orders since i thought they mightve missed the original order i had to speak to her a second time  and she grabbed the ipad from us and seemed annoyed that we kept bothering her after speaking with the waitress directly who was serving our table our orders finally came i was so disappointed with the quality of the food here the sashimi was mush and not high quality very small bite sized pieces and i completely lost my appetite after reading some people got food poisoning here im not really sure what happened to this place because back in 2014 i was a satisfied customer the washrooms were very dirty as well definitely not coming back to this place ever again makes me really sad to write this review  feels like i wasted 66 on poor service and poor food

Address: 3622 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review:
i love sushi really gives meaning to their name
i visited them again during a very busy time and while service was slow due to so many people ordering with limited staff working the 3045 minute wait time between sushi orders is very worthwhile to me because it is so good and fresh  but there is also a chinese buffet that you can have between ordering or as an appetizer
on a regular day with a few other customers  the wait time after ordering is amazingly fast  we ordered several different dishes and had them all served within 10 minutes
the staff also deserve high praise doing their best to multitask as servers taking care of customers needs clearing tables and setting up for the next customer and running the till  all with a smile and a friendly attitude
the quality of the food is where they really shine fresh ingredients time and care in preparation and presentation are very important and it all shows with their sushi  i cant wait until my next visit to this restaurant

Address: 3622 Eastgate Drive Regina, SK S4Z 1A5 Canada
Review: as many have already commented i will pass the comments and make a recommendation to the business owner you can limit the total pieces of sashimi one adult can order like what miso ya is doing you dont have to use a longwaiting 45min waiting plus thincut lowing number of pieces  customer ordered strategy to lower the service and food quality theres always a better way to cut the cost for your business

Address: 545 Albert Street N Regina, SK S4R 8E2 Canada
Review: every boston pizza in the city of regina has a unique self representation at this location the seats give off an oldschool vibe the artwork displayed on the walls gives it a relaxed look with a hint or artistic sofisticationcaughs while holding on to mustache the staff members are friendly professional and knowledgeable about their products the food was good i was going for something light and i sure was not disappointed

Address: 545 Albert Street N Regina, SK S4R 8E2 Canada
Review: food was great as always friendly staff fast delivery of food to tables i believe our servers name was dexter he was great very professional friendly polite and was great with my baby youre doing awesome

Address: 545 Albert Street N Regina, SK S4R 8E2 Canada
Review:
ordered a ham and pineapple it appears they made a cheese pizza and then put ham and pineapple on top after coming out of oven then a quick reheat the toppings fell off while eating it
should have got a frozen pizza instead
boston pizza food quality over the years has become a joke only senior citizens with a couple taste buds remaining like this factory food

Address: 545 Albert Street N Regina, SK S4R 8E2 Canada
Review: rude customer service and not great food upon entry the lady managerhost was condescending and trying to be funny when i couldnt find my guest the burger on special tasted premade and old bun was stale and ive never had so many onions in my life atleast the kettle chips were good

Address: 545 Albert Street N Regina, SK S4R 8E2 Canada
Review: it was a very peaceful and relaxing  stop for dinner service and food was exceptional as expected will be back again

Address: 2926 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review:
delicious authentic filipino cuisine
i visited today and had the chicken adobo it was rich and so tender and delicious my friend had the pork menudo and it was unreal the spices were perfect

Address: 2926 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review: the food was fantastic  deliciousthe pancit was to die forthe pork menudo was masarapwe really enjoyed our dining experiencedstevejoi

Address: 2926 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review: love the food here great staff as well worth every single pennies you spent

Address: 2926 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review:
super great place to sit in silence while not eating anything

popped in for what we hoped would be pancit and other nice treats sat at one of the three tables woman behind counter did not acknowledge us at all we sat there for 6 or 7 minutes while she did something at the counter then we just packed up and left lame

Address: 2926 13th Avenue Regina, SK S4T 1N7 Canada
Review: took an employee and his son here  we loved the food and had fantastic friendly service  i highly recommend this place  we will be back

Address: 1779 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 1Z4 Canada
Review: the dishes could have been more flavourful its not as good as dim sum in bigger cities but for our city id say its the best dim sum place weve got the service was great

Address: 1779 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 1Z4 Canada
Review: i went for lunch here and had a good meal with reasonable prices we did the dim sum option and had nothing but good food the service was also very good and prompt would be interesting to see their dinner menu

Address: 1779 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 1Z4 Canada
Review: excellent dim sum i took my friend from edmonton and we both agreed much better than edmonton fresh tasty and good portions i enjoyed all the dishes  7 between the 2 of us

Address: 1779 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 1Z4 Canada
Review: if youre looking for authentic and really good tasting dim sum this resto is for you the dim sum especially on the weekend specials are very fresh tasty and well made the exterior facade and og part of the resto can be considered old and intimidating by new patrons as its a bit dated and has the hole in a wall vibe but for anyone who grew up in asia this is the look of a mompop store where you will be served food cooked for family and not commercialized food like so many restos in regina do nowadays the service is topnotch and the food comes out real quick will definitely recommend

Address: 1779 Rose Street Regina, SK S4P 1Z4 Canada
Review: food is delicious so many dishes that you dont see anywhere else not your standard americanized chinese food if your go to is chicken balls and fried rice this may not be the place for you they do it differently and it is awesome

Address: 1812 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review:
i adore this cafe great atmosphere and the cheesecakes are delicious though i personally didnt like the cinnamon buns they tasted more like donuts
highly recommended to meet up with friends and enjoy a lovely treat

Address: 1812 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review: the coffee is good and it has a great view i was able to find a place to sit on a weekday so it might not get as crowded as expected

Address: 1812 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review: stopped for a coffee it was a great environment and the service was perfect i sometimes do not like the upsell but the addition of cinnamon buns put the coffee date over the top

Address: 1812 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review: their cinnamon bun is well known the morning seems much busier than lunch time i also tried their cheese cakes good with black coffee

Address: 1812 Hamilton Street Regina, SK S4P 2B8 Canada
Review: this was a welcoming and sociable environment to have my morning coffee along with a delicious warm cinnamon bun the employees are friendly and helpful and put care into their food would definitely recommend this place on saturday morning for the buns

Address: 806 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R6 Canada
Review: my husband brought me here as its his favourite place in regina nice atmosphere great service  incredible food cannot get over the beautiful flavours definitely worth visiting

Address: 806 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R6 Canada
Review:
it is our third time here and we loved it every time manmeet served us here in the last two times and we really enjoyed the service as well
the food is plenty delicious and served beautifully

Address: 806 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R6 Canada
Review: a good indian restaurant with authentic indian taste great service with a smile kapil and the team is doing a good job

Address: 806 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R6 Canada
Review: we had the butter chicken combo and lamb dhaba curry with garlic naan i was looking for a curry that was very spicy to fulfill my needs and the dhaba curry absolutely met my spice level  butter chicken was bomb they were both a little salty but perfect with rice and naan the prices were very reasonable convenient parking space right behind the building 100 recommended

Address: 806 Victoria Avenue Regina, SK S4N 0R6 Canada
Review: you will not regret if you came here because everything is delicious and it is best restaurant in regina city

Address: 2102 11th Ave Unit 11a Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: avoid this location theres many others in the area that you can go to its ghetto dirty and dangerous ordered a bagel today and it tasted like cigarettes the person who made it mustve not been wearing gloves and just came back from a smoke disgusting

Address: 2102 11th Ave Unit 11a Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: always very nice and sweet peoples there to treat you very well and coffee my favourite one is 1milk  1sugar small one

Address: 2102 11th Ave Unit 11a Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: the pizza at this place was amazing the crust was crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside and the toppings were plentiful and flavorful i highly recommend trying the margherita pizza

Address: 2102 11th Ave Unit 11a Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review:
the guy who is supposed to clean the placewas cleaning the floor with a broomthan he used the same broom to clean the tables
staff didnt want to open the bathroom for customers when they asked very weird attitude to their visitors

Address: 2102 11th Ave Unit 11a Regina, SK S4P 3Y6 Canada
Review: every time i go there i get great serviceslove their coffee  good parking

Address: 8 Barrows Road St. John's, NL A1A 1G8 Canada
Review:
the food was excellent taste was great and everything was cooked perfectly we particularly enjoyed the cod thongues the scallops crudo and the pork belly
we where in a little and quiet side room which we really loved it felt cosy
however the service staff didnt come very often in our room so we sometimes had to wait a few minutes for service they sometimes forgot to take our plates away when we finished eating we were also advised that the portions were very small and that we needed to order more but ended up with too much food that we couldnt finish we both took 1 appetizer 1 side and 1 main dish and shared 1 extra appetizer staff was kind but overall service could be improved

we recommend booking a few days in advance

definitely recommend this place if you want to eat a great meal and are prepared to pay a good amount

Address: 8 Barrows Road St. John's, NL A1A 1G8 Canada
Review:
class act all the way here doesnt hurt that its a stones throw away from quidi vidi brewery for some predinner drinks either

seriously though the service here was kind and thoughtful and the food matched the rustic decor the reputation for which precedes this place

suppose the only thing the people to watch out for is youre gonna have a hard time coming in here if youre over 6 12 feet tall but then again you can squeeze your way through the hallways and into the main dining room where everything opens up and you get a nice view onto an open kitchen

Address: 8 Barrows Road St. John's, NL A1A 1G8 Canada
Review:
cute historic restaurant 2 locals i met suggested i come here for some of the best food in st johns

while i really enjoyed the good service and atmosphere the food wasnt as impressive as i expected the lobster thermidor was difficult to eat without the right cutlery and because it was just a half portion i was left wanting the scallop crudo was great but ive also had better elsewhere

overall great experience but just lacking a little something extraordinary

Address: 8 Barrows Road St. John's, NL A1A 1G8 Canada
Review: i have visited mallard cottage a number of times and i have yet to be disappointed we visited a couple weeks ago on my fathers birthday and the brunch was exceptional we had the french toast fish cakes  taters steak  eggs  eggs benedict they were cooked excellent and all delicious you can definitely tell they use good quality products at mallard cottage

Address: 8 Barrows Road St. John's, NL A1A 1G8 Canada
Review: food here was delicious and the setting and building in quidi vidi are gorgeous cocktails and wine were excellent and we shared scallops crudo beets hanger steak and some particularly delicious potatoes roasted in honey a delectable lemon meringue pie with raspberry rounded off our meal service was slow with gaps between courses and we struggled to get a table quickly  despite calling on the day and being told their online platform isnt very good but assured that if we called 15 minutes ahead of arrival wed be served in reality this was not true and we ended up waiting a long time almost missing the opportunity to eat food was spectacular service was lacking

Address: 223 Duckwoth Street Saint John's, NL A1C 6N1 Canada
Review: excellent food quality flavor and portion sizes we were so impressed  everything was incredibly fresh and delicious the service was also excellent from hailey we got 2 burgers and they accommodated my lettuce bun for no charge the cod bites and the unreal chowder

Address: 223 Duckwoth Street Saint John's, NL A1C 6N1 Canada
Review:
the reservation we made wasnt recorded but they got us a table table was by a beam so we moved to another one which was much better

we ordered 3 appetizers and a main each the apps were wonton nachos bacon wrapped buffalo chicken stuffed jalape√±o poppers and spicy shrimp the food looked amazing and tasted amazing but the portions were a little underwhelming especially the shrimp 6 shrimp with sauce for 18 seems a little steep but as i said the flavor was fantastic the apps took long to come out as the had originally burned our nachos and the ones we received seem to be overcooked still it also had a lot of pulled pork and toppings under the wontons so it was basically half and half toppings to wontons

we both ordered burgers i got the pierogi burger and she got the geraldine hot honey southern fried chicken burger they both cane with fries and spicy ketchup which was awesome really enjoyed the spicy ketchup my pierogi burger was pretty good burger patty was a little overcooked but still juicy and well seasoned her burger was a little less impressive it came with coleslaw which was large chunks of cabbage which had a bitter taste the batter on the chicken wasnt that good either but the sauce was the best part she didnt even finish half of it due to the coleslaw tasting so bad hers meal was 24 and mine was 23

overall the food was fairly good but the apps pricing was a turn off dont think well be returning but it is worth a try

Address: 223 Duckwoth Street Saint John's, NL A1C 6N1 Canada
Review: the server was super nice but we wished the fries were better fried and bigger we loved the curry sandwich though

Address: 223 Duckwoth Street Saint John's, NL A1C 6N1 Canada
Review: absolutely great entr√©es were delicious chowder was killer the dessert was meh kinda dry will be back for sure

Address: 223 Duckwoth Street Saint John's, NL A1C 6N1 Canada
Review: huge portions incredible food if you are dining with two people split a burger  they are too much for a single meal

Address: 5 Bates Hill St. John's, NL A1C 4B5 Canada
Review: i love this place amazing music and atmosphere i started with the strawberry fields cocktail special created by danny best bartender ever i had pig ears with buffalo sauce sooo crispy  good i tried the duck delicious had the punch cocktail so yum overall just so so impressed by the taste and presentation of everything the cocktails had dried flowers so cute and the people such lovely staff and the owner michelle is such a down to earth sweetheart you must come here

Address: 5 Bates Hill St. John's, NL A1C 4B5 Canada
Review: food has always been good and i gave it a 5star rating 4 years ago however i am back to change it to a 4star rating now because i feel really hurt i have celebrated my birthday three times here in the past but this year i am extremely disappointed we made a reservation a week before my birthday but when we arrived on time the waitress informed us that they were busy and seated me at a table facing the washroom i politely requested a different seat for my birthday but she refused to accommodate my request not even pretending to do so throughout the meal the washroom door remained open which was highly unpleasant furthermore the waitress used an uncomfortable tone while reiterating how busy they were and insisted that we finish the meal within 15 hours even though we had just sat down after placing our food order she did not bother to check on us or inquire about the quality of the food when she changed the water bottle it was done hastily and with a hint of rudeness her fingers even touched the inside of the bottle yet she said nothing and left it on our table when we finished our main dishes only one dessert arrived instead of the two we had ordered not wanting my partner to witness me eating the cake alone we had to wait for someone else to check the table and inform them of our missing order despite the disappointing experience we still tipped 18 for the meal however this birthday experience has left me deeply hurt in numerous ways i used to love chinched which is why i celebrated my own and my parents birthdays here in the past unfortunately i will never go to chinched again

Address: 5 Bates Hill St. John's, NL A1C 4B5 Canada
Review:
our experience at chinched was absolutely delicious we shared a small charcuterie and cheese board had a pancetta summer sausage aged cheddar and brie  the meats were so flavourful the apricot compote was a great addition and the spiced nuts were good on their own or with the meat and cheese

we also had the cod dish and the roasted cabbage caesar based on the recommendation from our server ivan not a crumb left

highly recommend  great service and great food

Address: 5 Bates Hill St. John's, NL A1C 4B5 Canada
Review: absolutely an amazing restaurant that we stumbled upon during our trip to st johns the food was the best we had during our trip  the bao and potato wrapped cod earned them 5 stars in its self our server was one of the best ive ever had he was so personable and attentive  he even provided us with a list of other restaurants to checkout while we were in the area we will be returning to stjohns specifically to enjoy another meal at chinched

Address: 5 Bates Hill St. John's, NL A1C 4B5 Canada
Review: the dill pork ears are seriously good also i cannot attest others experience but the waiter is super super nice one of my friends forget the stuff and one of the waiter chased us to ask if we lost our staff going well and beyond the service and didnt accept any appreciation tip at the end will come back if i had the chance

Address: 334 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: excellent experience all the staff was super friendly and the food was incredible excellent oysters tuna sashimi was to die for brussel sprouts were so flavourful tuna taco was delicious the fish meal ive been craving

Address: 334 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review:
recently had the pleasure of dining at adelaide in st johns and i must say the experience was nothing short of amazing from the moment i stepped in the warm and inviting atmosphere set the perfect tone for a memorable evening

what truly stood out was the impeccable service provided by our server sarah her attentiveness knowledge and genuine passion for ensuring our dining experience was exceptional truly shone through she went above and beyond to make us feel welcome offering insightful recommendations and accommodating our dietary preferences with a smile

the menu at adelaide is a true culinary delight the dishes we ordered were prepared with precision and skill showcasing the chefs creativity and attention to detail each bite was a tantalizing explosion of flavors leaving us wanting more

whether youre a local or a visitor to st johns i highly recommend adelaide for an unforgettable dining experience the exceptional service from sarah and the rest of the staff combined with the fantastic culinary offerings make it a standout destination in the city

thank you adelaide for a truly memorable evening i cant wait to visit again and explore more

Address: 334 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: great cocktails and great food a small menu and i think a couple more options would help round it out the crispy fish tacos were a favourite amongst our group cauliflower share plate was also very good if you have oysters there was a spicy pear pur√©e offered that was delicious if you like some heat the only dessert option was a sticky toffee pudding which was a bit on the dry side the atmosphere is very cool and old comes out as its ready not all at once which adds to the relaxed shared meal feel of this place

Address: 334 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: amazing spot and nice menu with a variety if options brussels sprouts were dementedly good really fun vibe and staff in here sit at the bar if you can its a great experience thank you

Address: 334 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: fantastic the food is delicious and fresh you have to try their poke and the oystersthe ambiance is very romantic cant wait to be back

Address: 291 Water Street St. John's, NL A1B 4B8 Canada
Review: solid restaurant with a good tasting menu could improve with some slightly more experienced staff but they were able to maintain the atmosphere the sommelier made some good pairings and the food was generally well prepared and tasty would have liked some nonmenu surprises the carrot cake was great

Address: 291 Water Street St. John's, NL A1B 4B8 Canada
Review: the food was amazing and there was such a wide variety from steak to pasta to crab the overall restaurant had a lovely ambience i ordered the spaghetti carbonara and it was extremely delicious with lots of cheese creaminess and flavor the artic char was incredibly delicious and tasted almost like salmon overall a great option for a night out

Address: 291 Water Street St. John's, NL A1B 4B8 Canada
Review: overall not bad but disappointing especially given the price i dont mind paying for good food but this was simply mediocre at best most of the restaurants ive tried downtown have been great but unfortunately not this one in my opinion this tarnishes the raymonds name service was speedy but i felt rushed to order  drinks were also heavily pushed which was unnecessary in my opinion atmosphere was nice but restaurant was quite loud appetizer was amazing which was the only good part of the evening we had calamari the mains lacked flavor and felt small the chicken was kinda dry and the  lemon beurre blanc didnt really help thought that desert might have been able to make up for the mains but they were even more disappointing pastry of the lemon tart tasted stale i have my doubts that any of it was made in house because the meringue was no better then store bought package the worst part i paid 12 dollars for the tiny tart which is shown in the photos definitely will not be back to the restaurant was hoping for so much better

Address: 291 Water Street St. John's, NL A1B 4B8 Canada
Review: this was our first time visiting merchant tavern but it definitely wont be our last the service was great and i loved the atmosphere we especially enjoyed the open kitchen the food was amazing 1010 we had the mussels as an appetizer and had scallop risotto and steak frites as our mains they were all delicious

Address: 291 Water Street St. John's, NL A1B 4B8 Canada
Review: mediocre food for the price 125pp not good but not bad first course of local scallops fermented gooseberries and chive oil was unbelievably sour it was a hard time attempting to finish the dish the rest of the courses were okay but not worth the price tag as well being sat at a bar was also quite uncomfortable as the bar table was much higher than the seats making it hard to eat i had reserved  1 week prior to the visit in order to have good seating but still got sat at the bar nonetheless wish it was a better experience but the first course was such a disaster it ruined the rest of the evening

Address: 318 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: busy friday night got a table easily service was good but they didnt clear our empty dishes from the table for quite a while they brought food the food out within a decent time food was good we had a delicious juicy moose burger with pickled beets it was delicious the jiggs muscles were good we got an order of 2 lbs our black forest cheesecake was scrumptious

Address: 318 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review:
moose burger is available here although it doesnt taste different from a regular beef burger
the mussel is pretty tasty
salad is overpriced for the portion

Address: 318 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: this was the final night of our stai in newfoundland our group enjoyed this restaurant i had mussels done in a german style sauce  it was good

Address: 318 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: luckily got a table on a busy friday night with no wait  service was friendly quick and competent  food was good

Address: 318 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: the nachos and stein was a good deal at 26 and the yellowbelly red was smooth nachos with pulled pork sauerkraut and dill pickles  who knew it would be a winning combination the red curry mussels were ok quite a wait considering the restaurant wasnt super busy but we enjoyed ourselves

Address: 377 Duckworth Street St John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review:
came here for the first time the other night we were seated quickly our server was friendly it was clean inside

i wasnt a huge fan of the orange creamsicle drink the tomato sauce on the pacchi di proscuitto was really tart the stephanie pizza was good and my smash burger was decent i dont think it was worth 80 though

Address: 377 Duckworth Street St John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: the pizza was delicious the staff is kind and the atmosphere is very nice with the open kitchen area and the dim lighting  candles would recommend booking though as it can get very busy especially on the weekends the bathroom is very clean too

Address: 377 Duckworth Street St John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review:
their pizzas are truly delicious
the best one ive ever had
weve had the one with honeyprosciutto and one with blue cheese  mushrooms both were very tasty
you can really feel the authenticity from italia the pizzas are cooked in a wood oven which is great the incredients on the pizzas are sparse which makes every bite taste different the cooks seemed to be having fun and if youre seating at the bar you can watch the preparation
we didnt try their pasta but they looked freshly made
you should definitely go

edit i went again to try their pastas and wow it was delicious i had the rigatoni with the lemon ricotta chefs kiss love this place

Address: 377 Duckworth Street St John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review:
i absolutely loved the pizza it is my favourite that ive ever had highly recommended for sure my boyfriend had pasta there and he loved it as well i got the margarita with added pepperoni and i absolutely fell in love with it its so delicious juicy and full of flavour

the best pizza ive ever had in my life and nice atmosphere too

highly recommended

Address: 377 Duckworth Street St John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: best pizza ever waiter was very efficient we ate outside and traffic was busy so the exhaust from cars was not great but the food made up for it

Address: 320 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: ordinary food at extraordinary price the post disappointing if all is the lobster which is small and meatless for a high price while the cod fish was good i do not know what the hype of this restaurant is about noted this is the most disappointment meal of our 5 day trip in nl the biggest factor that drove this mediocre rating is that they cannot even do the fries right it is greasy and soggy soaked in oil very disappointing

Address: 320 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: i was hesitant after reading some of the reviews but went for it and i cannot be more thrilled that i did our server russell was the absolute best fun and attentive and just top notch all around we had the chowder and burger and oysters and lobster roll after living in boston and florida for fifteen years i can say that this was hands down the best lobster roll i have ever had and i am what some would call a food snob i would recommend to anyone

Address: 320 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: okayyyy this restaurant is  great atmosphere our server recommended the bruschetta and it was absolutely to die for ive never had such delicious bruschetta before i had the seafood chowder and while it was quite tasty my only criticism is that it didnt have a variety of seafood in it no mussels or shrimp just white fish which im assuming was cod so it should be called cod chowder instead the food is on the more expensive end but i would definitely recommend

Address: 320 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review: we had a great experience food was great and we thought very reasonably priced atmosphere and service also top notch will def be back nice cocktail menu too  original and well priced

Address: 320 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C1 Canada
Review:
i have to say i think saltwater needs to be rebranded if you are a local in stjohns youll remember the saltwater on duckworth after the move to water street im sure the chef and owners have changed and if not that the brand or audience they are attracting is not the same as when they were on duckworth

my family and i were celebrating a birthday  early mothers day we ordered a fair amount of food or server was very sweet and helpful when we ran in to food issues so 4 stars for that only issue it was not 5 is because service includes the kitchen in my eyes

drinks
elderflower fields martini  sweet elderflower does come through 55
cesar  classic cesar its good 45
i forget the name but its the spicy margarita on the menu  really nice refreshing wish there was more of a salt rim 45

apps
mussles  plump but over cooked not much broth and underseasoned
wings  i actually really liked the breaded wings i thought they were 55
pork belly  kinda funny but maybe a bit too honest our server apologized for the wait on this dish due to the fact that the chef slipped and dropped our original pork belly on the floor she quickly offered a discount on our meal and it came out maybe 7 mins later

mains
seafood risotto 
came with mussles scallops and shrimp i believe my dad had it and the read was average not over done but nothing to make you want to order it again

cod with beet salad 
my mom raved about this dish she was it was excellent

steak
unfortunately my brothers steak was over cooked again our server noticed without us having to say anything this was due to her own experience cooking at home she visually saw the cook was over following this she offered to have another one made or give us a discount my brother opted to keep the one made already due to food waste and time the garnish and flavours on this dish were very delicious

salmon with beet salad
when i got the plate i realized i am particular about salmon and probably should of asked more questions the salmon was over cooked and the skin was kinda soft which i personally really like salmon skin crispy or with a hard sear maybe it was just personal preferance but i really didnt like the cook on it the fish was just not handled well again simular to the steak the cook not on par but the flavours of the sauce and seasoning were greatthe beet salad on the side was a vanilla dressing with goat cheese

dessert
baklava 55 so good made with walnuts and you can tell its a home recipe

overall

i think the place can do really well as a relaxed seafood restaurant i think the pub food options are awesome for students to get some food before going out theres a wonderful atmosphere with the arches and long tables thay give a cozy casual feel i also would tell anyone that the wings are good the only downfall is the price for what you get i wouldnt want to pay for food overcooked or not paid attention too i think sorting out a clear focus on what kind of restaurant this is now will help an updated about us online will bring in more people in the upcoming summer season for tourists now a days online presence is so important im excited to go back with a few friends and try more of the pub food when i get around to it

Address: 298-300 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B6 Canada
Review:
ive given the celtic hearth many chances but unfortunately it just hasnt gotten better so ive gone for the last time i went recently with my girlfriend it wasnt very busy at all the food took about 3040 minutes to come out our server was very friendly kind and attentive so i didnt really mind that wait

i got fish and chips and my girlfriend got the steak and cheese sandwich her sandwich was tasty just very oily which is a little off putting my fish and chips were below average as well with only getting a few fries that were luke warm and the fish just tasted bad the batter wasnt crunchy and  just came right off the fish shame

the prices here have gotten ridiculous as well youre better off going to yellowbelly or somewhere else nearby youll get more food thats much better and fresher and cheaper

i hope this restaurant can turn things around but in my opinion its just not worth going especially at the inflated prices

Address: 298-300 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B6 Canada
Review:
we stopped here for dinner as recommended by our waitress in brigus service was quick and friendly

i had the cod au gratin flaky cod baked in a creamy sauce topped with cheddar i had a side salad with mine and it was all very tasty  i would definitely go back again

Address: 298-300 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B6 Canada
Review: quaint spot and read it had good breakfast options it had the irish pub vibe friendly service they had gf toast options but dont order the ham with the breakfast  there was more fat and grizzle than ham  bacon or sausage options looked better when we asked if the hash browns were gf we were told no problem but got our celtic breakfast and the home made hash browns which were good came 20 minutes later  it wasnt busy and our server was very nice good coffee here as well pricey for a breakfast at 1795 pp plus lovey 15 tax and tip makes for an expensive but typical breakfast

Address: 298-300 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B6 Canada
Review: the celtic hearth once held the title of the best burger ive had but things have gotten a bit rocky since the service and atmosphere here are always great but my main issue is the massive increase in pricing prices in the past two years have gone up nearly half and its honestly ridiculous  not to mention portion sizes i went here today and the food was decent ive only had one bad experience here with taste but it was almost insulting how little you get for the price they used to give you a full basket of fries that would fill you up by themself but now it pretty much amounts to what would be in a small mcdonalds fries

Address: 298-300 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B6 Canada
Review: always awesome and count on able i was looking for a place to eat last wednesday night around 9pm and they were the only place i could find still serving today i came straight here

Address: 319 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B9 Canada
Review:
we just finished a lovely stay at this hotel and highly recommend it  the staff is amazing  i havent experienced this level of attentiveness in many years  thank you victoria and others for making us feel so special  the bathroom in our room was to die for  we loved the heated floor and the beds were so comfortable
if there is any room for improvement it is the coffee supplied in the room   all three of us joked and called it coffee water  even though it was a specialty company who supplied it   i would not hesitate to recommend this hotel   if only to remind people of what true customer service is all about

Address: 319 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B9 Canada
Review: a local friend recommended blue and it was a pricey but wonderful location for exploring st johns we were in room 201 so facing the street the room was large comfortable and had a fridge tv  although odd channels coffee station and an amazing bathroom despite many ceiling lights the lighting in the bathroom is terrible i found opening the drapes and standing in front of the long mirror was the only place i could see to put on makeup the sounds from george street do find their way to you until 200am parking was on a roof a block away and cost an additional 20 a night  there are many restaurants pubs coffee and various shops within walking distance we had one evening meal in blues restaurant chicken tacos scallops and a chowder it was fine but we didnt go back for more they were very good to accommodate a gluten free request and every server was friendly helpful and pleasant whether helping with luggage serving a meal or checking us out of the hotel

Address: 319 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B9 Canada
Review:
i have absolutely nothing negative to say the experience was stupendous from beginning to end i loved my room i dont remember the name but it was 301 and the staff everyone was so kind and generous in spirit and help

i also recommend the goddess salad in the restaurant

the accompanying photos are from my stay in stjohns and not from the hotel

Address: 319 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B9 Canada
Review: we had grilled lobster with risotto very good and this lobster arancini that werent on the menu other ones in the pictures are seafood clam chowder and seafood linguine and scallops  best food we had by far in st johns would recommend servers were very nice too

Address: 319 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B9 Canada
Review:
great food  probably one of the best restaurants in stjohns  access to the hotel during the summer is tricky but not impossible  take a smaller suitcase
the rooms are all beautiful one is very dark

Address: 1 Dunns Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 3L1 Canada
Review:
nice local diner with fast  friendly service and considerable variety of tasty lunch and dinner items on the menu

very popular local restaurant  if the dining space were larger i am sure they would continue to fill the place

Address: 1 Dunns Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 3L1 Canada
Review: this really is a hidden gem  always friendly service and great meals im partial to their chinese food but the fish and chips or the hot turkey sandwich are great as well drop by and give it a try you wont be disappointed

Address: 1 Dunns Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 3L1 Canada
Review: by far the best chinese food decent oricesgreat service this restaurant doesnt get enough recognition uts always fresh and hot if you want a delicious feed of chinese food i highly recommend this gem

Address: 1 Dunns Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 3L1 Canada
Review: great service very well cared for  thank you

Address: 1 Dunns Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 3L1 Canada
Review: had my husbands birthday supper there last night have not been there in years it was so good definitely be going back again

Address: 178 Water St St. John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review: nice chill atmosphere tasty drinks and i enjoyed the veggie tempura and egg addon i want to like it but the ramen broth is just okay for the price on the cold day i visited the room was wearyourcoatindoors chilly

Address: 178 Water St St. John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review: exceeded my expectations we ordered the pork tantanmen and pork belly shoyu both had plenty of pork and a good amount of noodles and vegetables also added the homemade hot sauce which was sweet and spicy its not quite traditional but was quite good service was good and efficient for having only one person on staff for the whole restaurant decor was familiar for a ramen restaurant with the menu on a wall chalkboard and benches along the wall and chairs on the other side would definitely recommend

Address: 178 Water St St. John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review: this was my first time at bad bones ramen located in downtown st johns and it did not disappoint we had the chicken gyoza dumplings as an appetizer and the pork belly ramen and miso chicken ramen both so flavourful and delicious i cant wait to visit again i only managed to take one picture after i had already taken a few bites it was too good to wait lol

Address: 178 Water St St. John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review: awesome food looked delicious and tasted amazing too i had the fried chicken curry and the flavours were sooo good and the ramen eggs were awesome aswell as the chicken super crunchy we also had the chicken dumplings for a side and even they were really good deffinitely reccomend and doesnt even compare to instant ramen lol

Address: 178 Water St St. John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review: every time i go to bad bones its a pleasant experience the service is quick and kind the atmosphere is very welcoming and the unique and absolutely delicious menu is one everyone should try would highly recommend

Address: 1304 Topsail Road Paradise, NL A1L 1N9 Canada
Review:
had a great experience at ocean sushi so far this is our favorite sushi spot since arriving to newfoundland

very pleased with the various options on the menu for different kinds of seafood we went with the salmon 5 ways platter crispy spicy crab rolls calamari appetizer octopus sashimi and butterfish sashimi

all of the cuts of fish were extremely generous the rolls had the perfect ratio of rice to meat the batter on the calamari was light and crispy and the calamari werent rubbery on the inside

we were also happy that there was a low sodium soya sauce option for dipping the flavors and spices used throughout were delicious

our server was very attentive and checked back often we didnt finish a glass of water or a drink before he came over to ask if we needed more

will definitely be regulars here thank you

Address: 1304 Topsail Road Paradise, NL A1L 1N9 Canada
Review:
we stopped here for one last taste of fresh fish before flying out of newfoundland and it did not disappoint the servers were exceptionally pleasant and attentive every piece of sushi was delicious  some were just more delicious than others ive never encountered asparagus sushi before trying ocean and it was a really fun and tasty new one for me

great location too great bathrooms and great atmosphere whenever i am back in newfoundland i will be stopping back in here

Address: 1304 Topsail Road Paradise, NL A1L 1N9 Canada
Review:
their lunch menu is fantastic with some great deals food is fresh and with some newer combinations of flavours it is delicious im from west coast where there are loads of sushi snobs this place is better than a majority of any other places ive ever been to
pictured is dynamite roll salmon avacado roll salmon tempura roll salmon mango roll spicy scallop roll tuna avacado

Address: 1304 Topsail Road Paradise, NL A1L 1N9 Canada
Review: ive been to every province in canada and this is hands down the best sushi ive had it is insanely good very nice quantities for an insane price the lunch special is also crazy with 3 standard rolls costing less than 20 that includes miso soup too great location and on skip as well ample parking and never had a problem getting a table if youre in st johns and want sushi this is hands down the best spot of them all the dynamite roll is sublime

Address: 1304 Topsail Road Paradise, NL A1L 1N9 Canada
Review:
there is something special about the sushi here  not only is the sushi and sashimi fresh and made to order but they also offer a torched aburi variety that sears the fish and adds a bit of charred smokiness giving it an extra boost of complexity  there is an addon cost to this technique but if youre looking for something different give it a try

the first time i was there we had the sushi and sashimi combo for 2 and a fried calamari appetizer  although the fried calamari was good it was similar to what you can get at any steakhouse restaurant  2nd time i was there i had the grilled calamari and it is 100x better  cooked tender not chewy very umami

it is my new favorite casual sushi spot in the st johns area

Address: 294 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: cute little shop with old architecture tables available inside only locally owned food is fresh and delicious 12 for a small wrap small town feel and decor right on the water street strip was busy with customers ordering for takeout inside seating less busy could be a bit cleaner insidefloors windows and tea ceremony table otherwise a nice place to get freshly made good food

Address: 294 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: we had their breakfast sandwich on a croissant and a cheesegreen onion biscuit they nailed it on flavour and amount of food very filling without being stuffed coffee and london fog were great good community vibes too

Address: 294 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: popped in to grab a coffee and sweet with my partner today the coffee was amazing and so was the brownie that i got i was extremely impressed with the price point of everything offered by rocket bakery my partner got a london fog and almond croissant which were both fantastic the store front was clean and the staff were friendly definitely recommend

Address: 294 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: so if youre in newfoundland and happen to be anywhere near water st st johns and would love a cappuccino that will rock your world then the rocket is a must the young lady behind the counter makes the best cup ive had so far  i spend a lot of time in latin america so im a little picky the atmospheres amazing food is incredible ten stars

Address: 294 Water Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: the rocket sandwich was very tasty and the quinoa salad fresh great spot if you dont want to visit the many taverns on the street you can see signal hill from here and its tiny

Address: 210 Water Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review:
my husband and i did the all you can eat at sushi island and it was decent overall the all you can eat menu is great if you want to try different dishes they do charge for sushi and dishes not finished 2roll 7plate for a dish but will let you take it home

the fried wontons were a little overcooked and lacking filling the sushi rolls were not cut evenly but the food was fresh and rice was sticky

we wanted to order sashimi but didnt see it on the menu during lunch 1200pm it did appear to be sold later in the day

service was good they do have server robots that bring your food to you the server we had did some around to check on us a few times as well

Address: 210 Water Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review:
the food is absolutely delicious and in all seriousness i have to say that its the best service ive ever received at any restaurant the staff members are so nice and they all seem very genuine my mother and i go fairly frequently admittedly to the point that we get recognized by most the quality of the food is consistant and the prices are amazing we always get the 40 combo thing they offer and honestly its such a steal that it feels criminal you get two drinks pop two extra sauces four appetizerlike things soup and salad four rolls of sushi and three side dishes they offer complimentary ice cream at the end of your meal if its available and ginger and wasabi are both free as well the combo feeds 23 people also they have robotic cats that bring you food and i promise seeing them and getting to pet the robocat is enough to make grown adults squeal like children its seriously so fun the atmosphere is wonderful and the walls are covered in beautiful murals i know this review sounds like im being paid to write this but im genuinely not i just love it that much i have literally nothing to say about the place except for glowing praise if youre in the st johns area and you like sushi or would like to try it id highly recommend you go

food recommendations
 seaweed salad
 black dragon roll
 spicy tuna roll
 salmon avocado cream cheese roll
 golden crab roll
 pork cutlet
 sweet and sour chicken
 fried scallops

Address: 210 Water Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review: the sushi  is pretty bland  the fried rice is very good the price is affordable

Address: 210 Water Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review:
i go here everytime im in st johns

food and service are awesome very friendly staff and they have the cool robot

Address: 210 Water Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1A9 Canada
Review:
we had a great experience at sushi island the staff were amazing to the point they ran after us because we forgot our leftovers

the food as always was super tasty and the little robo kitties make it such a fun experience

Address: 123 Quidi Vidi Road St. John's, NL A1A 1C3 Canada
Review: a tucked away gem of downtown st johns if youre looking for pasta based dishes or you are hungry then you should come here

Address: 123 Quidi Vidi Road St. John's, NL A1A 1C3 Canada
Review: delicious food cozy atmosphere and excellent service we ordered the deluxe bruschetta as an appetizer  the carbonara pasta and chicken parmesan sandwich as mains took a lovely tiramisu latte to go as well will definitely be back on our next trip to town

Address: 123 Quidi Vidi Road St. John's, NL A1A 1C3 Canada
Review: the experience i had at bellissimo tonight was top notch i had the seafood linguine and it was simply a delightful explosion of flavours the music and atmosphere was pleasant and the server was very professional after a long and stressful day at work bellissimo truly made my day will definitely go back

Address: 123 Quidi Vidi Road St. John's, NL A1A 1C3 Canada
Review: we liked the food but felt portions needed more a sandwich with a salad or fries instead of alone pasta with a salad instead of alone unfortunately it didnt quite fill us up the service was friendly decor has potential but it is cold and missing a cozy feeling we thought the exterior was nice

Address: 123 Quidi Vidi Road St. John's, NL A1A 1C3 Canada
Review: best to call ahead to make sure they are open we drove an hour to eat here arrived at 750 and was told the kitchen closed early the food is great however  worth the hour drive

Address: 375 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: tried this place for the first time today and really enjoyed we got two of the daily specials vegetarian and non every bite was packed full of flavour and so delicious the naan bread was a treat and the samosas were good as well an added bonus was that our order wasnt ready when we came for it so the owner brought it out to our car so we wouldnt get a ticket will definitely be back

Address: 375 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: ate here a couple of times while visiting st johns and had their lamb kebab and non vegetarian mixed platter both times the food was ready soon affordably priced tasty and had generous serving sizes would definitely eat here again

Address: 375 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: quaint spot small menu but you certainly get your moneys worth i imagine their takeout is most popular

Address: 375 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: cozy cute welcoming and very tasty the lovely couple who i believe own this place serving me were polite and prompt they welcomed me in and served such delicious authentic afghan food i absolutely love how much the way they have set this small space up their veggie samosas were so crisp came with a delicious dip sauce and hit the spot the veggie dish i ordered was packed with flavour and spices ive had afghan food before but this place is legit what a lovely tucked away gem for st johns if you have never had afghan food make this the first place you go thank you for your kind hospitality and amazing food

Address: 375 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H7 Canada
Review: one of the best meals ive had in st johns with great service at a great price

Address: Glenhill Plaza 74 Old Placentia Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 5H6 Canada
Review: best pizza place in town these guys are serving the perfection

Address: Glenhill Plaza 74 Old Placentia Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 5H6 Canada
Review: almost everything i and my girlfriend have had from here is amazing the pizza donairs gyros all great the only things ive had that i didnt like were the fries and wings those were mediocre at best

Address: Glenhill Plaza 74 Old Placentia Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 5H6 Canada
Review: mistake made on our nacho grande order  much less cheese than it used to be much less toppings price much higher they asked for a tip at the pay terminal to pick up take out which is rude and inappropriate for no service pay your employees and dont beg to top up their salary used to be the best nachos on the avalon but now just another ripoff

Address: Glenhill Plaza 74 Old Placentia Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 5H6 Canada
Review: i ordered a while ago on door dash the dasher must have dropped my order off at another house the dasher said it was delivered but it wasnt and i never got a refund

Address: Glenhill Plaza 74 Old Placentia Road Mt Pearl, NL A1N 5H6 Canada
Review: this place is great the staff are friendly and the food is delicious they also give you a cookie with pizza slices nice touch

Address: 283 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G9 Canada
Review:
i have heard of basho quite a few times and always wanted to try it i got the chance today and i was not disappointed at all loved the sushi and the tempura i had it was nothing less than authentic and was absolutely delicious although it was a bit pricy but i think its well within reasonsthe servers were very professional and friendly too they provided pretty good service
i would like one thing changed though i would like a bit more lighting in the dining area as it was a bit too dark

Address: 283 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G9 Canada
Review: salmon tartar amazing but eel and avocado roll there were bones a lot mojito was really fresh and tasty

Address: 283 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G9 Canada
Review: great meal that didnt disappoint the nobu new style sashimi was exceptional and worth a try the goats cheese cheesecake was also an unexpected treat if youre looking for something different well done

Address: 283 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G9 Canada
Review:
had seafood  vegetable tempura seasonal nigiri  sushi assortment spanish wine and blueberry mojito at basho everything was quite nice particularly nigiri and the blueberry mojito their sushi rolls were good but i have had better at another restaurant in the avalon area a friend who had surf n turf  pan seared seasonal white fish confirmed that they were both great they looked great too
a good thing about basho is that you can get gluten free appetisers mains and desserts
ambiance of the restaurant is amiable and the staff is not bad either

Address: 283 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G9 Canada
Review:
1010 service  atmosphere

if you want the best meal  service in the city i couldnt recommend this place more from the service the atmosphere the staff it truly is a one of a kind dining experience in the heart of st johns

we love basho

Address: 36 George Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1M3 Canada
Review:
pretry good place for some well done japanese food the atmosphere is pretty fancy and the staff are quite hospitable

we had their yuja cha and that was delightful their ramen was divine and their sushi was fresh and smooth would definitely come here again

Address: 36 George Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1M3 Canada
Review: i had the teriyaki chicken meal with an honey avocado salad the salad was not wring properly so the mixing it the bowl made the honey avocado taste watered down the chicken was white meat and overcooked it was just warm so i got a feeling its not freshly made and was just kept warm the teriyaki sauce was good though the place was pretty empty but it was a monday night i was seated close to the sushi bar and heard all the staffs conversations as they were speaking pretty loudly my soup and salad came first and 3 minutes later my entr√©e came i didnt have time to finish my appetizers plus my table had traces of dried sauce nobody ever came back to ask how was my food nor did they come back to fill my water or tea i had to raise my hand to get someone to come over and i had get up afterwards to pay at the cash since i dont want to have to raise my hand again to get the check very disappointed on everything not going back until they train their staff better this is the worst restaurant ive been to in a long time

Address: 36 George Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1M3 Canada
Review: ill give a 4 stars for service but the food is about 3 stars as i loved their fusion of japanese to sit western tastes but the really should arrive for keeping it japanese as so many people i included have been there and people who has had real japanese food live it more than the stuff you find at home so if youve never been to japan this place is the best but if youre like me i think the best options are the basic  and their ramen alcohol is a bit expensive so keep that in mind too

Address: 36 George Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1M3 Canada
Review: great and fast service mind me it was a monday night and there was less than 10 people when i came in i had the pork belly ramen and it was delicious sweet and salty with chilli on the side as requested the server surprised me with a free appetizer fried sushi it was good but a bit on the cold side did i say free  also the washroom was the best i have seen in a sushi restaurant  i might come back and try the fish

Address: 36 George Street Saint John's, NL A1C 1M3 Canada
Review: decent prices and good service well made rolls ordered octopus salad and im sure it was good for those who like it but it wasnt for me made a good long island ice tea too good for groups dates or solo dining on george street

Address: 142 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2E7 Canada
Review:
we came here for lunch after landing in st johns after sitting on a plane this simple to the point meal was perfect i didnt leave feeling heavy or hungry i loved it even more after finding out that they do this as a social enterprise to help vulnerable adults and help get them into the food service industry

the service was really good and the food and atmosphere is perfect there is a small outside area to eat but we just sat inside by the window its a lovely cafe to have lunch we didnt need reservations or have to wait in line and came in 30 minutes before they were expected to close we never felt rushed or like we were being waited for i would say the cost is acceptable and for the cause i would say that it is well worth paying for

would definitely return to have lunch

Address: 142 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2E7 Canada
Review:
im gonna give an objective review since im not from nl and because ive only been there once

the cafe in itself is cute with a warm ambiance

first i was disappointed because i expected them to offer a variety of coffee like espresso but they only have regular filter coffee which isnt bad

then the service wasnt bad but it was kinda strange from what i could grasp i think employees there are being rehabilitated to society by being offered a job at this cafe by the church please tell me if im wrong
i think its great more places should do this but like i said it was kinda strange i think one of the server didnt like my boyfriend and he was giving him weird intense looks i had to point it out

then the food was good i had the applebutter grilled cheese but the portion is too small for the price

i cant give a better rating because of these reasons im still glad i tried it

Address: 142 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2E7 Canada
Review:
this teeny caf√© is delightful its not cramped there is no uncomfortable banquette seating thank the gods and its open and sunny in the morning
the server was extremely friendly and attentive the food was delicious we both had the hearty breakfast with sausage and we were tempted by dessert afterwards but couldnt have fit it in we will definitely return though

Address: 142 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2E7 Canada
Review: the ambiance of the place is good with giant windows its very bright and clean the fresh little flower vase was a nice touch the food is alright although its unique its a little bit pricey i liked the mimosas here tried the soft shell moose tacos and breakfast on the bun with potatoes and salad the dessert was delicious the covid protocols are being practiced and the tables spread apart

Address: 142 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2E7 Canada
Review: i was pretty disappointed with our experience especially when the place had so many good reviews the food tasted old felt like rubber and was in very small portion for the price paid a breakfast with one egg so cooked it was like rubber some veggies boiled tomatoes and spinach  and old potatoes cost 16 plus tax and tips the waiter made us feel very uncomfortable and reached at us a couple of times i am unsure what that was about but i will give them the benefit of the doubt all in all a bad experience do not recommend

Address: 302 Kenmount Rd St. John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: not only did we have a missing entre our whole order was a disaster and this is not the first time out salad had rotten lettuce throughout it chicken was burnt and soggy and our order of brushetta was coated in seasoning salt it was not edible the inconsistencies at this restaurant are unreal  120 dollars wasted

Address: 302 Kenmount Rd St. John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: karle was an awesome server she helped make our order more enjoyable  always came back to our table to make sure things were going smooth and if we needed anything else

Address: 302 Kenmount Rd St. John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review:
just had the best experience at kelseys on kenmount rd we were seated by a lovely hostess our server miranda came straight away to offer drinks and advise us of the specials she gave the appropriate amount of attention genuine and not pushy she told me it was her first time making my sangria it was perfect my husband and i had the steak my dad had the ribs and wings my compliments to the back of house team my steak was perfect a beautiful rare steak isnt easy but mine was melt in your mouth delicious the chili sauce over the shrimp was so tasty  for the desert they indulged in the cheesecake and i enjoyed the churro fries they were good but would be better with the chocolate
all in all the food was great but everything was enhanced by mirandas five star service she was fantastic and i hope she sees this

Address: 302 Kenmount Rd St. John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
