Review: was at kelseys and ordered a full rack of ribs i did the rib and wing combo the ribs were succulent and the wings cooked to perfection we had the best service we could ask for the waitress was kind and very accommodating the service at kelseys is definitely worth the stop ask for erin o and the service will be unmatched

Address: 302 Kenmount Rd St. John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: we had a wonderful experience our server brittany was amazing we were a large group of 14 and she didnt miss a beat  she was warm friendly and efficient she kept track of all our orders and i was very impressed with how fast we were all able to pay  separately if you go ask for brittany

Address: 364 Duckworth St St. John's, NL A1C 1H5 Canada
Review: i am glad that i went there as the food is exceptionally delicious i was happy to see that there are places which offer pure vegetarian   egan food order teriyaki bowl and it was portioned well with brown rice i wish that dining area was bit more option but not at big issue

Address: 364 Duckworth St St. John's, NL A1C 1H5 Canada
Review: great food especially the enchiladas would highly recommend for someone looking for a great vegetarianvegan option

Address: 364 Duckworth St St. John's, NL A1C 1H5 Canada
Review:
delicious vegetarian and vegan sandwich soups and dishes everything was fresh and the tastes were well balanced
didnt have any of their mains but if the their soups and sandwiches are any indication then theyll be top knot too

Address: 364 Duckworth St St. John's, NL A1C 1H5 Canada
Review: we were visiting from out of town and really enjoyed our dinner here we dined in the restaurant which has several cozy tables indoors as well as outdoor seating we had the burrito and chicken tacos both made vegan they are not kidding about the spice on the habanero sauce but that is to be expected and it was great the burrito was delicious and filling we often struggle to find vegan options when we travel but this place was great we were stuffed so we didnt have dessert but they had several vegan and gluten free sweets on offer as well

Address: 364 Duckworth St St. John's, NL A1C 1H5 Canada
Review:
we had the bravacado sandwich and the chickpea curry everything was delicious service was pleasant and accommodating

highly recommend this place for well made food at a good price

Address: 355 Main Road St. John's, NL A1S 1J9 Canada
Review: nice place to meet people and have a chat friendly helpful wait staff music left a bit to be desired

Address: 355 Main Road St. John's, NL A1S 1J9 Canada
Review: so want to say thanks to the server at jungle jims on topsail road for suggesting we try here when they were really busy  had a great meal with the kids and hubby  our server was friendly and efficient  the food was hot and tasty

Address: 355 Main Road St. John's, NL A1S 1J9 Canada
Review:
in fact my friend and i did not visit the shamrock city pub in the goulds
we went to the sister business aka jungle jims for wednesday wings
theres a lot more on offer than just wings great value and selection there was no crowd when we visited service was first rate very enjoyable visit thanks

Address: 355 Main Road St. John's, NL A1S 1J9 Canada
Review: so happy we found shamrock city in goulds closer than mt pearl and absolutely much a much more preferred spot distance aside menu is comprehensive but not overwhelming steak night is by far the best value anywhere and the quality does not suffer excellent fast and friendly servers each visit is a treat

Address: 355 Main Road St. John's, NL A1S 1J9 Canada
Review:
great food and service
nice atmosphereand really good music

Address: 246 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G6 Canada
Review: theres a reason this place is voted best breakfast in st johns because it is the menu selection is massive and everything ive tried so far was delicious on our last visit the lineup wasnt bad but began to lineup after wed been seated you definitely want to get there early on weekends this is one of the most popular places downtown for breakfast and the wait times can reflect that

Address: 246 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G6 Canada
Review: visit  from toronto for work on the same street as bagel cafe walked pass by it a few time then decide to make a plan to go with friends and it was the best decision  everything we ordered was on point service was awesome our water and coffee mugs were always full  atmosphere inside is extremely clam everything is friendly  i order me a simple bagel egg sandwich it was delicious fresh it comes with a side of home fries   hash brown  bagel was fresh nicely toasted it was tasty my friends order omelette fruit bowl and other items everyone was funny satisfied with the amount of food that comes with each order so is i like to eat big meals u got urself a lot of food u can eat  they dont cheap away from the portions  if u visiting make sure to visit this for breakfast and hope u have the same experience as me  thank you

Address: 246 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G6 Canada
Review: ordered the mushroom spinach cheese open omelette and it was huge no paper thin omelette here more like an inch thick for just the egg there had to be like half a dozen eggs in it very tasty also ordered the touton breakfast sandwich with bacon egg and cheese with a side of molasses and hash browns another large meal and also very good a lot of dough though only issue is that there are no drinks on the menu ordered a coffee which came in a large cup but was also 485 i would also go directly to the website to look at the menu for pricing google maps menu link deep links to an old version of the menu and older prices service was quick and efficient by both the host and wait staff the atmosphere is definitely cozy and quaint small pathways and low ceilings and some unique small booths for two we got a small booth right beside the front window which was nice overall good food good service and good value for money

Address: 246 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G6 Canada
Review: we had breakfast and dinner here for breakfast we ordered harborside big hardy breakfast the dish is huge its too much for one person so we shared it and added two bowls of yogurt with fruit its the best breakfast we had in st johns for dinner we had two lobsters the lobsters were steamed cooked at right level very fresh and taste delicious

Address: 246 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1G6 Canada
Review: great deal for 2 for 1 dine lobster dinner for 7999 with a bottle of wine hubby added a steak for additional 1299 wine was actually decent not sweet

Address: 315 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B4 Canada
Review:
the food was very good the brie was exquisite the duck special was outstanding gypsy salad delicious and refreshing not to forget the calamari just yum the cocktails were also good

the service stuttered when the crowd appeared but it caught back up

Address: 315 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B4 Canada
Review: i recently made reservations here for my parents to try they had a very pleasant experience here the staff were friendly the food was on time fresh and flavourful ordered the calamari and curry chowder for appetizers and for the main they both had cajun chicken linguini overall great spot for a date night or special occasion

Address: 315 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B4 Canada
Review:
my cousin   i came in for lunch the staff was very attentive  went out of their way to make us feel special my cousin ordered the turkey brie something with pepper soup which she loved i ordered the blackened salmon which i didnt care for much but i would still come here again

ps do not miss their addictive chocolate mints which they so generously plied me with

Address: 315 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B4 Canada
Review:
the food was unbelievably delicious
basically anything that we ordered was great
staff were super friendly and professional
loved it

Address: 315 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1B4 Canada
Review: it was a bit busy at around 2pm their outdoor eating area wad blocked and busy during the pedestrian mall i went inside and sat at the bar it was about 10 minutes to be served and 20 minutes to receive food i ordered the  loaded street fries and a corona they could have been great except the fries were cut very small something in the dish was extremely salty and the jalape√±os were candied not hot and very sweet i didnt eat it all as  the meal was too salty the corona on tapwas enjoyable and the bartender was nice though

Address: 329 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review:
we were blown away food was perfectly done dasha was our server and she was excellent giving just the right amount of attention but friendly and welcoming i fear we closed the restaurant after two bottles of wine and she never made us feel rushed

but the food everything we had was perfect from the calamari to the cr√®me br√ªl√©e we had a delicious lobster and even the julienned vegetables were perfect imagine taking the care to make veggies delicious under a lobster

im kind of glad we found this place at the end of our trip because any other restaurant would have paled in comparison

Address: 329 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: well we have been dining at magnum  steins off and on for 20 or more years experiences have always been super but tonights was a bit of a downer we went for the advertised happy hour and from the outset it was more hijack hour  maybe i dont get out enough but happy hours to me imply 2 for 1 specials or similar the red wine special tonight was tripache malbec 5 oz glass regular price of 950 for the low low price 875 and there was no pan fried cod option to boot i understand that the restaurant business is tough but in my opinion you need to build in a little more joy into the pricing of your advertised happy hour specials

Address: 329 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: my partner and i enjoyed dinner at magnum and steins last night and it was fantastic we had the duck nachos to start which were highly recommended by friends and they did not disappoint definitely the highlight of the night for mains i had the fish of the night which was a cod dish the dish was prepared very well my partner had the pasta of the night which was a chicken based pasta dish which was quite good for desert we had the chocolate flourless torte which was superb our server laura was friendly helpful but a bit slow at points however she had many tables she gave us great recommendations and even surprised us with our mains and wine pairings the restaurant was clean and the atmosphere was intimate would recommend

Address: 329 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review:
not fussy

we had reservations at 7 but were able to get in at 645 and take advantage of the happy hour specials she ordered a starburst martini while i sipped on a long island ice tea

we ordered appetizers duck confit nachos and the potato skins they tasted great but the nachos were quite small and the potato skins are literally 3 halves of potatoes

pretty sure we were the youngest people there besides the servers the next youngest person after myself looked to be 15 years older we felt very out of place the menu was also minimal but didnt have so many options different outside of most restaurants locally

the meal of two drinks and two appetizers came out to about 50 the drinks were as expensive as the aps their wine menu was quite extensive except we arent wine drinkers so this probably isnt the place for us

i dont think well be returning any time soon there is literally nothing else on their menu i would like to try that i cant have anywhere else

Address: 329 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: food was amazing  oven baked halibut  fish and chips and duck confit nachos were phenomenal   highly recommend

Address: 10 King's Road St John's, NL A1C 3P1 Canada
Review: please visit we loved our pizzas visiting from our of town and went more than once gluten free  vegan options too were amazing sooo delish dont skip eating here lovely staff amazing food great location you wont be disappointed

Address: 10 King's Road St John's, NL A1C 3P1 Canada
Review:
we ordered the fibonacci and sir isaac salmon pizzas it was our first time having fibonacci and we really liked it however the sir isaac salmon pizza wasnt as good as the previous time we had it the crust was delicious but the fish was salty and not smoky enough

we got take out because the inside of the restaurant had a bit of cigarette smell and the atmosphere is not that cozy

Address: 10 King's Road St John's, NL A1C 3P1 Canada
Review:
pi pizza until tonight was my favourite always order prime colours not sure what has happened the crust has changed its very doughy now and lets face it the crust makes it breaks your pizza while the toppings were mostly liberal i had to hunt for the bacon overall it was rather tasteless i asked for their hot oil sauce and got some kind of hot tomato base sauce the pizza was also not hot or even warm despite the fact that we picked it up on time their online menu said the cost was 30 plus 2 extra for the sauce yet we got charged 42

anyway perhaps their recipe has changed or their pizza maker whatever the reason sadly i wont be going back

Address: 10 King's Road St John's, NL A1C 3P1 Canada
Review:
wouldve left 6 if i could
best pizza pie in st johns

Address: 10 King's Road St John's, NL A1C 3P1 Canada
Review: editing review chocolate fudge is disgusting i wish i can go back and prove myself its a mistake cuz their food overall is amazing good pizza alot of varieties amazing and very lovely staff and customer service ill definitely come back but mainly for the friendly quick easy service

Address: 127 Harbour Drive Bishops Cove Landing St. John's, NL A1C 6N6 Canada
Review:
best patio in st johns  we stopped in here after a long walk to have an afternoon drink  the outdoor patio on the 2nd floor over looks the harbour
it is very picturesque  and relaxing  the service was great

Address: 127 Harbour Drive Bishops Cove Landing St. John's, NL A1C 6N6 Canada
Review:
the warm hospitality and inviting atmosphere set the stage for an unforgettable meal

lets start with the star of the show  the steaks kegs steakhouse truly lives up to its reputation as a steak lovers paradise the menu boasted an impressive selection of prime cuts each cooked perfectly i opted for a juicy steak cooked mediumrare and it arrived at my table with a mouthwatering sear and a tender meltinyourmouth texture the quality of the steak was evident in every bite and the expert seasoning beautifully enhanced the flavours this was one of the best steaks i have ever had the pleasure of eating

the service at kegs steakhouse was topnotch the staff was knowledgeable attentive and genuinely passionate about ensuring a memorable dining experience from offering recommendations to promptly refilling glasses they were always one step ahead ensuring i wanted nothing throughout the meal in addition the waitstaffs friendly demeanour added a personal touch to the evening making me feel like a valued guest rather than just another customer

the restaurants ambiance was elegant and sophisticated with dim lighting cozy booths and tasteful decor it was the perfect setting for an intimate dinner or a celebratory gathering the noise level was wellcontrolled allowing for comfortable conversation without feeling overwhelmed by the surrounding buzz

Address: 127 Harbour Drive Bishops Cove Landing St. John's, NL A1C 6N6 Canada
Review: you can feel the difference here everything tastes fantastic we were a group of 7 and we ordered different types of food but all were delicious great staff harbor view

Address: 127 Harbour Drive Bishops Cove Landing St. John's, NL A1C 6N6 Canada
Review:
my family and i had a wonderful meal from start to finish this evening  being quite warm inside we asked if we could be accommodated outside which was done quickly and seamlessly

the food was hot delicious generous in portion size and our server was very attentive  we will definitely be returning

Address: 127 Harbour Drive Bishops Cove Landing St. John's, NL A1C 6N6 Canada
Review:
not as good as we expected we arrived at 445 pm for an early dinner and we were told there was no server before 530 pm so we ended up having a drink at the bar they have a good selection of beers and wine the bloody ceasar is filled with ice in a small glass so not a big drink you got a couple of sip

i dont recommend the burger there it was very dry fries were good friends with steak said they were very good but one of them was overcooked

long story short i think you can get a better taste somewhere else for the same amount

Address: 402 - 408 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C9 Canada
Review: we used to eat at this restaurant all the time and get excellent service since covid the service kept going downhill every time we placed an order today we placed an order and when we showed up my husband was given one order instead of two the staff argued with him and myself saying that we only placed one order and their staff was right not me i asked him what would i gain by showing up to pick up two orders when there was only one ready we ordered there that much they would have known our orders previously and known that we have never placed one order we always place the exact same order all the time so instead of saying that the person on the phone was mistaken they just argued with me and said no it was me that was wrong then she wondered why i wouldnt take that food that was ready and wait for more to be made so i could have one order of food half cold i asked to have two orders made and they refused needless to say it will be my last order placed ever there the staff is rude not friendly at all even the food itself has gone downhill since covid started there was absolutely no one in the store picking up an order or eating in at this time so i think this should tell them to treat people better its not worth my time ordering from a place that calls me a liar about my own order i think i remember what i ordered

Address: 402 - 408 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C9 Canada
Review: very clean and well taken care of very welcoming non judgemental atmosphere the waiter was very kind and the food is always amazing the food is so delicious and flavourful

Address: 402 - 408 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C9 Canada
Review:
the staff was friendly and helpful the food was tasty

the deep fried bbq pork bun had a lot of flavour but i thought it would be bigger

the sweet  sour pork was spot on but it was strange that it tomatoes instead of red pepper in it but it was still tasty overall

the egg roll was flavoursome i liked it

the crispy wonton was wonton sheets deep fried it wasnt deep fried wonton balls with shrimp  pork in it but it was still good with the sauce

the coconut pudding was a coconut filling in batter deep fried and dusted with icing sugar it was sweet to end the meal

the restaurant had a great atmosphere and the service was good too i would come back here and try other dishes on the menu

Address: 402 - 408 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C9 Canada
Review: it was a nice place the food and environment was good i especially like the cocktail i ordered

Address: 402 - 408 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C9 Canada
Review: very good chinese restaurant the authentic dishes are very authentic the chef knows how to work the wok the service is very attentive and friendly this is one of the cleanest restaurants ive been to and its very well maintained ive been there multiple times and i havent been disappointed

Address: 367 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: great spot with a great atmosphere a little away from the hustle and bustle of water street but close enough that youre still in it love the staff something to eat for everyone definitely recommend giving it a try

Address: 367 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: holy cow their drinks on point food incredibly delicious servers the very best they treated us so amazingly love this place

Address: 367 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: ordered delivery last night price was outrageous 2 pizzas garlic bread and 6 pops for over 100 plus they forgot to send our drinks said they could do anything about it when we called about it i asked to talk to the manager who apparently wasnt there that day and was told they would call me back the next day to refund the drinks never did hear back extremely disappointed  i get people make mistakes but then they should do what they can to fix it

Address: 367 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: absolutely terrible experience  i ordered the chicken parmesan the picture from the menu looked delicious with the pasta and all my order took one and a half hours to get here my food was freezing cold half of what i ordered wasnt even in my plate and i couldnt use my gift card because the delivery guys machine was messed up all this for 30 and not to mention my chicken was hard as rock i wish i could get a refund for this but i dont know how to

Address: 367 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review:
tables were sticky and dirty dishes were left on the tables around even tho servers were not busy and were passing by dirty tables several times
we ordered pizza which it was ok
i am not going to come back here for sure

Address: 286 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: food delicious background music soothing service comes with a warm towel at the end of the meal excellent

Address: 286 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review:
i dont know what to say when you will open the menu for dine in this is the first thing you will be looking at
thats really awkward you are forced to give 15 tip along with the minimum 25 order for per person order while all the meal are overpriced compare to any other locations who served indian food in the city

Address: 286 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: weve visted this location twice and loved it will  be repeat customers delicious food

Address: 286 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: this has been always one of my favorite places to go in st johns  but not anymore service was good but the food wasnt much chop they have lost their flavors the lamb i ordered was cooked separately from the sauce it should have been stewed in the soup was the same thing  chicken added after the soup was poured honestly in my opinion it was not much better then something from a food court the restaurant is very nice but i wanted a better meal when we got our bill they informed us the tip of 15 was included in our total i discovered later that we tipped the hst amount as well not happy and wont be going back

Address: 286 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: food was nice service was good the food was overpriced and then at the end to find out there was a mandatory tip was very disappointing if we were 2 tables of 2 we wouldnt have had an extra 60 dollars added to the bill if they cant handle serving 4 people at once maybe a new career is needed wont be going back

Address: 102 Kenmount Rd St John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: i loved this restaurant but its been closed since the covid outbreak hopefully it will open soon the food was awesome and it had a very nice atmosphere you can relax and feel like your in your own private space the staff were always very friendly if or when it opens again i would greatly recommend trying it out

Address: 102 Kenmount Rd St John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: went on a date here and i did not have too high of expectations and yet they were abundantly exceeded the decor of the restaurant looks quite beautiful and relaxing although very old fashioned which may not be everyones taste our server was very sweet to us and the food was honestly delicious i had a chickpea tomota curry kind of dish forget the actual name and my date enjoyed a stir fry both were large in portion sizing and were very good i would highly recommend to give this spot a try great for a family dinner less so on the romantic side

Address: 102 Kenmount Rd St John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: i have given this place multiple tries and unfortunately i nor my company have ever had warm meals they always come out coolcold  is there not a warming area if so it is broken also seems they are always understaffed giving one person all responsibilities host bar server cashier  who is not to blame the staff member has always been patient and friendly the serving sizes are ok  prices high being in a hotel i suspect ordering the prime rib medium rare gets you well done salmon is always well over cooked too i can say the seafood chowder is awesome  however  again a bit overpriced done giving them chances

Address: 102 Kenmount Rd St John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: if i could give half stars i would have rated pj billingtons 35 we were seated promptly and our server was very attentive drinks came quickly food arrived promptly the mussels were delicious and the wings were tasty our entrees lacked flavor were pretty bland and forgettable overall service was great and the food was ok

Address: 102 Kenmount Rd St John's, NL A1B 3R2 Canada
Review: great spot for supper havent gone here for lunch or breakfast they have a new menu that as far as i am aware of is fantastic everyone in my party of 4 enjoyed their meal the only complaint was an overly greasy onion ring out of 2 apps 4 entr√©s and 1 dessert which brings me to the apple pie and ice cream which was amazing hot pie and cold ice cream after photo attached

Address: 12-14 George Street St. John's, NL A1C 1L9 Canada
Review: i only had one night in stjohns and i wandered my way into this pub drawn in by the live music i was treated with nothing but kindness glad i walked in happily stayed for 3 hours and delighted went back to my hotel

Address: 12-14 George Street St. John's, NL A1C 1L9 Canada
Review: great atmosphere with great live band that get the crowd out of their seats

Address: 12-14 George Street St. John's, NL A1C 1L9 Canada
Review: lobster roll made especially for us  can you get any better  it was delicious  service excellence  our server kenzie was excellent  thanks for the experience

Address: 12-14 George Street St. John's, NL A1C 1L9 Canada
Review: little pubbar on george street 5 for 25 beer or seltzer are great deal only problem is when sitting on the patio is you are getting the music from green sleeves as well as martini bar across the street and the  street stage just down the street it was very annoying hearing 3 competing different songs at once we had to leave cause it was too hard on the head probably be fine if you are sitting inside

Address: 12-14 George Street St. John's, NL A1C 1L9 Canada
Review: great live music they actually play music that isnt celtic which is rare here dont get me wrong i dont mind celtic music but every bar except this one and jungle jims plays it

Address: 250 Duckworth Street Saint John's, NL A1C Canada
Review: we had a great experience stopping by this family owned vegan restaurant during our visit in st johns we are not vegans we found this place from online reviews about local favourites in town and this place did not disappoint  the owner loi is so kind and generous and immediately served us with tea and soup upon sitting we ordered the squash roll and shanghai noodles and a rice dish each dish was full of flavour and complimentary home made sauce was provided to add to your liking i would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone vegan or not local or traveller hope you enjoy it as much as we did

Address: 250 Duckworth Street Saint John's, NL A1C Canada
Review: this was such a wonderful experience in hospitality and delicious food i brought three nonvegans and everyone enjoyed their food im also allergic to gluten and the owner took excellent care and made sure i didnt taste any of my friends dishes which contained gluten  i cant wait to eat there again

Address: 250 Duckworth Street Saint John's, NL A1C Canada
Review: coming from toronto i didnt expect good chinese food in newfoundland however i have to give this place 5 the owner of this restaurant is super friendly i can tell he loves what he does he greeted us with a big smile served us like we are his family and omgthe food was super delicious no msg high quality ingredientswhat can i ask for more

Address: 250 Duckworth Street Saint John's, NL A1C Canada
Review: this place was amazing my husband and i went here for our anniversary the service was exceptional the food was equally amazing im so grateful to have this fully vegan restaurant in st johns will be coming back

Address: 250 Duckworth Street Saint John's, NL A1C Canada
Review: this may be the best chinese food you will find in atlantic canada let alone in st johns they make traditional chinese dishes while substituting meat with their own housemade meat substitutes made with soy gluten etc the flavours are detailed and so beautifully rich staying true to the flavours of the original dish  eg soy fish made with seaweed to give it an ocean flavour or gluten marinated and grilled like char siu bbq pork youll also get free housemade sauces which vary by the day free soup and free green tea the portions are great and the prices are great  less than 20 for nearly all dishes all of this comes from the pure passion the old couple from macau have for their art the man server is a retired engineer in his 70s who opened the restaurant just to express his craft and not for any profit motives the space is decorated with beautiful art and wise calligraphy showing all that the couple has learned through their life i have nothing but the utmost respect for them and i highly recommend that everyone finding themselves in st johns tries this food whether they are vegan or not

Address: 70 Clinch Crescent Saint John's, NL A1B 4G8 Canada
Review: friendly service and amazing food got the grilled cheese and roasted red pepper soup and it was so delicious

Address: 70 Clinch Crescent Saint John's, NL A1B 4G8 Canada
Review: soo good visiting from ontario and tried out this cafe i loved my brown sugar latte and i liked the veggie breakfast sandwich i got it on a croissant the prices are were great it was a smaller caf√© nice and clean and our server was so kind hope to come back one day

Address: 70 Clinch Crescent Saint John's, NL A1B 4G8 Canada
Review: our meal was excellent and for a great price highly recommend the vegan chili especially you may want to make reservations as it seemed really busy with only a few tables we got takeout and it travels well

Address: 70 Clinch Crescent Saint John's, NL A1B 4G8 Canada
Review: friendly server excellent service delicious foods everything is good in here

Address: 70 Clinch Crescent Saint John's, NL A1B 4G8 Canada
Review: waited 30 mins to get an overpriced falafel wrap the size of a taco zero care to service

Address: 55 A-1 Kelsey Dr St John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: my family and i love the dan dan and the firecracker stir fry dishes both very spicy filled with flavour and a go to choice definitely recommend both of these if you enjoy spice fireballs and spring rolls are also an amazing side to add to your order would like to add staff were also very knowledgeable and went above and beyond to ensure a great quality meal definitely a go to spot in our books now we will be back

Address: 55 A-1 Kelsey Dr St John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: the food is amazing the sweet mongolian and spring rolls are my favorite menu items the service was professional and we were served very quick as well friendly environment and will definitely be back again

Address: 55 A-1 Kelsey Dr St John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: super delicious  i will 10000000 go back again super affordable and cooked right on front of you

Address: 55 A-1 Kelsey Dr St John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: the smell coming from this place was phenomenal i ordered chicken pad thai with chow mein mongolian beef and broccoli on rice and butter chicken on rice the mongolian beef was our favorite by far despite the broccoli being almost raw the beef is tender and i really like the sweet sauce the pad thai tastes too strongly of tamarind for us unfortunately the butter chicken was ok but i wouldnt get again we were not fans of the texture of the chicken in either dish the service was great and i really like watching the food being prepared i will order from here again probably a beef dish

Address: 55 A-1 Kelsey Dr St John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: my son loves the butter chicken here hes always asking me to take him to wok box every weekend staff are always friendly and helpful would definitely recommend this place to anyone oh and the kimchi fireballs are to die for

Address: 460 Topsail Rd St John's, NL A1E 2C2 Canada
Review:
food was hit or miss some items like the noodles werent great and the baked potato was not good either other things like the wings rice broccoli and general tso chicken was pretty good nothing extraordinary ice cream was good central dairies stuff

staff was tentative but it was completely dead so that was kind of expected

now the price pretty ridiculous if you ask me 30 per person is a bit out there for what it is but i guess thats what covid done to this place

if you want to try it go for it i was stoned so i was loving it some of the food was not up to par but what do you expect this place is dead

Address: 460 Topsail Rd St John's, NL A1E 2C2 Canada
Review:
ideal for having your dinner with friends family members or as a small group its a buffet with many choices worthy for the price usually around 2030 pp beverage extra
staff is very friendly fast and caring nothing to complain about

Address: 460 Topsail Rd St John's, NL A1E 2C2 Canada
Review: the food tastes quite good and the staff were very friendly the highlights for me were the wonton soup and hot and sour soup allowing me to have hot and sour wonton soup  so good the second bonus was the delicious pork dumplings with small bowls nearby so you can bring some of the sauce goyaish back to your table for dipping other unique fare included sticky buns dim sum and white rice the chicken and broccoli was a nice variation recommended

Address: 460 Topsail Rd St John's, NL A1E 2C2 Canada
Review:
so disappointed
first time going to buffett since the pandemic 
i use to love their foodbut after last weeki wont be going back
and it has doubled in pricebut the quality of the food has gone down drastically
the chinese food was like it was all cooked in the same sauceand the canadian food was too hard and dry to eat

Address: 460 Topsail Rd St John's, NL A1E 2C2 Canada
Review: food was pretty good but 30person is insane they have a sign on each table warning that any scraps you leave on your plate will be weighed and you will be charged 999 per pound for any food you cant eat  not a pleasant dining experience

Address: 25 George Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: we used to eat at this restaurant all the time and get excellent service since covid the service kept going downhill every time we placed an order today we placed an order and when we showed up my husband was given one order instead of two the staff argued with him and myself saying that we only placed one order and their staff was right not me i asked him what would i gain by showing up to pick up two orders when there was only one ready we ordered there that much they would have known our orders previously and known that we have never placed one order we always place the exact same order all the time so instead of saying that the person on the phone was mistaken they just argued with me and said no it was me that was wrong then she wondered why i wouldnt take that food that was ready and wait for more to be made so i could have one order of food half cold i asked to have two orders made and they refused needless to say it will be my last order placed ever there the staff is rude not friendly at all even the food itself has gone downhill since covid started there was absolutely no one in the store picking up an order or eating in at this time so i think this should tell them to treat people better its not worth my time ordering from a place that calls me a liar about my own order i think i remember what i ordered

Address: 25 George Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: very clean and well taken care of very welcoming non judgemental atmosphere the waiter was very kind and the food is always amazing the food is so delicious and flavourful

Address: 25 George Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review:
the staff was friendly and helpful the food was tasty

the deep fried bbq pork bun had a lot of flavour but i thought it would be bigger

the sweet  sour pork was spot on but it was strange that it tomatoes instead of red pepper in it but it was still tasty overall

the egg roll was flavoursome i liked it

the crispy wonton was wonton sheets deep fried it wasnt deep fried wonton balls with shrimp  pork in it but it was still good with the sauce

the coconut pudding was a coconut filling in batter deep fried and dusted with icing sugar it was sweet to end the meal

the restaurant had a great atmosphere and the service was good too i would come back here and try other dishes on the menu

Address: 25 George Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: it was a nice place the food and environment was good i especially like the cocktail i ordered

Address: 25 George Street St John's, NL A1C 1B8 Canada
Review: very good chinese restaurant the authentic dishes are very authentic the chef knows how to work the wok the service is very attentive and friendly this is one of the cleanest restaurants ive been to and its very well maintained ive been there multiple times and i havent been disappointed

Address: 57 Rowan Street St. John's, NL A1B 2X2 Canada
Review:
im changing my review because the next time we went with my friend the food and drinks were much better i order tacos and we had a pitcher of margaritas so yummy
past review 3 stars id recommend the margaritas and sangria but not the food in general the burritos did not have any greens and the salsa was not fresh the taco was ok

Address: 57 Rowan Street St. John's, NL A1B 2X2 Canada
Review: my partner and i have been coming here since i moved to st johns twenty years ago we are going again tonight i expect it to be thoroughly delicious clean friendly staff and terrific food i dont drink but my missus always has at least one margarita

Address: 57 Rowan Street St. John's, NL A1B 2X2 Canada
Review: 2nd time being here and amazing again best nachos in st johns  thomas served us today and the last time very friendly knowledgeable hope to have him serve us again ive worked in restaurants for over 20yrs and if i had my own place i would try to steal thomas to work for me

Address: 57 Rowan Street St. John's, NL A1B 2X2 Canada
Review: excellent service  among the best i ever had  the food was very very tasty gotta love the complimentary nachos and salsa that they make in house  the food was hot the dessert was very tasty  you couldnt ask for a nicer experience we will be back and i recommend the speciality coffees

Address: 57 Rowan Street St. John's, NL A1B 2X2 Canada
Review: my partner and i always have an amazing experience when we go here the food is so good and our service is always amazing weve had jess the past few times and after not being there for a few months she remembered us and asked how weve been she is so lovely and i hope she is appreciated for how awesome she is at her job nowhere compares to her level of customer service or just the quality of the experience we have there

Address: 662 Topsail Road St. John's, NL A1E 2E2 Canada
Review: lads couldnt cook a pizza truly repulsive grease caked in the middle of the pizza puddled the toppings would fall off every time you took a slice i think i could cook a better pizza using mud as dough in the sun health inspection report confirms this read that before ordering

Address: 662 Topsail Road St. John's, NL A1E 2E2 Canada
Review: seriously delicious pizza delivered fast gluten free options are cheap and worth it their gf garlic fingers are the best in the city

Address: 662 Topsail Road St. John's, NL A1E 2E2 Canada
Review: never again will me or my peers eat this pizza very distasteful normally i only leave positive reviews unfortunately this place doesnt get one awful service and the pizza had so much grease it was pooled in the middle like someone poured water on it go somewhere else this place is disappointing

Address: 662 Topsail Road St. John's, NL A1E 2E2 Canada
Review: pizza is good tho garlic fingers are there better item price is fair and staff are really nice

Address: 662 Topsail Road St. John's, NL A1E 2E2 Canada
Review: we were overcharged and i dont feel like the gluten free pizza was really gluten free

Address: 29 Commonwealth Avenue Mt Pearl, NL A1N 1W7 Canada
Review: great food atmosphere was a little all over the place 2 tvs playing different shows with both volumes on and music playing the server was nice enough to put both tvs on mute so we could enjoy our experience better but i had to ask

Address: 29 Commonwealth Avenue Mt Pearl, NL A1N 1W7 Canada
Review: had this for supper today and the family all agreed it was great talked about doing a little job with the owners but they didnt need it after all so there was no payment needed but they gave me a free comp jumbo pizza for my time great people thanks guys for anyone saying theirs may have been undercooked i always ask for well done anyways to always avoid that problem as pizza shops will always go with 10 mins recommended times anyways

Address: 29 Commonwealth Avenue Mt Pearl, NL A1N 1W7 Canada
Review: came here recently with my aunt because this is one of her favourite places for pizza and donairs the owner came and chatted with us and he was so sweet and kind made sure everything was good and it shows he does care what he does staffing was an issue and hopefully they find the people they need if im ever in the area again ill definitely stop by

Address: 29 Commonwealth Avenue Mt Pearl, NL A1N 1W7 Canada
Review: amazing service right before closing cody was very accommodating professional and friendly even though it was closing time he still made sure we didnt feel rushed and provided amazing service

Address: 29 Commonwealth Avenue Mt Pearl, NL A1N 1W7 Canada
Review: this pizza place has a surprisingly good sports bar section for sit down and dinein eating the walk in service is good but cursory as they are quite busy with take out pizza which is their main feature the pizza is a classic pizza joint pizza that will satisfy the need for a cheesy bite available for delivery on skip the dishes and door dash

Address: F3-35 Kelsey Dr St. John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: my sister and i ate here for dinner this evening i was surprised that there werent any specials especially on a monday most restaurants have daily specials we both ordered the chicken club and shared a small garlic fingers both were very good soft drinks are 4 so a little overpriced in my opinion restaurant was very busy server was polite and efficient food came fairly quickly

Address: F3-35 Kelsey Dr St. John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: ordered delivery through skip the dishes their app says the accuracy of the order is on the restaurant this location put the blame on skip the dishes for items missing an hour and a half wait with overpriced food to not even get it right and then throw around the blame  unreal at least skip the dishes helped

Address: F3-35 Kelsey Dr St. John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: one of the few restaurants that would take reservations for our rather large family group the service was excellent the young man who was our server never missed a single item on our ordersa daunting task no doubt the food arrived hot and within a reasonable time frame the one issue we had was with the dill chicken sandwichthe texture was rubbery though the taste was good definitely worth another visit

Address: F3-35 Kelsey Dr St. John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: cant share details about my experience because i didnt get to made reservations 2 days in advance for a large party of 10 everything was ok even called to increase it to 15 and they said no problem on the day of the reservation  they call and say theyre closed for renovations poor customer service there making renovations requires planning so they had to know they were closing not satisfied at all

Address: F3-35 Kelsey Dr St. John's, NL A1B 5C8 Canada
Review: the food was good and the atmosphere is definitely up to brand standard the only downside is that we didnt get any top ups on our drinks which we received prior to receiving our main dishes so got a little parched our sever angela was very nice

Address: 75 Kenmount Road St. John's, NL A1B 3P8 Canada
Review: complete disappoint we ordered for pick up a 90 dollar order and honestly i have never felt so ripped off 2 thumbs down took a hour to bring out to us not a soul in the park lot the dinner for 4 was honestly enough fir 1 very poor quality we definitely will not be back i thought as a business owner myself how can you feel good about sending this out to a family brutal  save your money

Address: 75 Kenmount Road St. John's, NL A1B 3P8 Canada
Review:
i love the old layout and the building has a cool design
i dont know why people are complaining so much why would you go to a restaurant just for the wallpaper
you should go there for the food

i had the yang chow fried rice and i enjoyed it
its just too bad im broke because theres so many other dishes there that sound yummy and i dont have the money to afford to go there often but the food is well worth the price

we dont see a lot of fancy old school chinese restaurants like this anymore
i think its cool

if its not busy there like how it used to be then thats because theres a buffet across the street duhhh
so its not because the restaurant is bad  its a very good restaurant but people who are cheapskates rather pay 20 at a buffet to eat cheap quality buffet food with very little taste in the meats that isnt always fresh instead of spending a little extra money to go to a traditional chinese diner and order freshly yummy well cooked served chinese dishes made with better quality

Address: 75 Kenmount Road St. John's, NL A1B 3P8 Canada
Review: the decor is dated and there are never many customers there when i visit but the food is the best chinese food available anywhere  and i mean anywhere in north america im referring to americanized chinese food that we are accustomed to try the chicken balls yang chow fried rice chicken chow meinwings of heaven and egg rolls and enjoy better hurry though because i suspect the owner will be retired  soon and the restaurant will be closed

Address: 75 Kenmount Road St. John's, NL A1B 3P8 Canada
Review:
i have read the comments yes its older but beautifully maintained very clean will lit in a romanticsubdued way very friendly staff
i would recommend for a family dinner party or just by your self
food was good

Address: 75 Kenmount Road St. John's, NL A1B 3P8 Canada
Review: the worst chinese food ever the price is a total rip offcanned mushrooms2 slices of beef in the brocoli and beef plate for 4 persons3 tiny chicken pieces in the 4 serving padthaifrozen wong tongdry and tasteless eggrolls4 servings take out cost about 100 could have get better food at the dollar storedont waste your money in this scam restaurant

Address: 107 Long's Hill St John's, NL A1C 1V4 Canada
Review:
absolutely love this place the folks who run it are friendly and knowledgeable and bottom line they make awesome food the store side of the business has a lot of difficult to find african cooking ingredients and treats from all over the prices are very reasonable and there are some absolute killer deals on things like olives
my favourite place for takeout in st johns by far

Address: 107 Long's Hill St John's, NL A1C 1V4 Canada
Review:
new takeout restaurant and grocery store

they have a variety of interesting and healthy ingredients from africa and they also have juices togo the juices are healthy delicious and good value the staff are helpful and friendly and will show you some ingredients to try
also a good place for glutenfree flour

give this place a visit and support a new local business

Address: 107 Long's Hill St John's, NL A1C 1V4 Canada
Review: we ordered the patties one beef dish and chicken that we shared with our two year old it was all exactly what we needed just a satisfying mix of flavours  our two year old ate all of her portion with many yums being uttered mama africa has been added to one of our favorite take outs

Address: 107 Long's Hill St John's, NL A1C 1V4 Canada
Review:
love the food here and its so underpriced the beef mafe is world class nothing like it in st johns the marinated chicken in their dishes is crazy they serve fresh baobab juice and im telling you for a hangover nothing beats it its a miracle cure they also have the best price in town for jarritos soda the owner is very excited to explain any questions you have about his products theyve got a huge selection of spices skin and haircare cold drinks and grocery items on top of their amazing food i bought a pack of orange blossom soap and now i smell like a king

also the food they serve is halal when you go you have to try the hot pepper sauce that the owner prepares himself its almost like a salsa and you will be addicted right away

Address: 107 Long's Hill St John's, NL A1C 1V4 Canada
Review: i had the maf√© and it was very filling and delicious i would have liked a bit more beef in the portion but it was still very good i also got the pineappleginger juice which was amazing it had a strong ginger flavour which i loved i had the bissap as well which was phenomenal

Address: 364 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C1H5 Canada
Review: i am glad that i went there as the food is exceptionally delicious i was happy to see that there are places which offer pure vegetarian   egan food order teriyaki bowl and it was portioned well with brown rice i wish that dining area was bit more option but not at big issue

Address: 364 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C1H5 Canada
Review: great food especially the enchiladas would highly recommend for someone looking for a great vegetarianvegan option

Address: 364 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C1H5 Canada
Review:
delicious vegetarian and vegan sandwich soups and dishes everything was fresh and the tastes were well balanced
didnt have any of their mains but if the their soups and sandwiches are any indication then theyll be top knot too

Address: 364 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C1H5 Canada
Review: we were visiting from out of town and really enjoyed our dinner here we dined in the restaurant which has several cozy tables indoors as well as outdoor seating we had the burrito and chicken tacos both made vegan they are not kidding about the spice on the habanero sauce but that is to be expected and it was great the burrito was delicious and filling we often struggle to find vegan options when we travel but this place was great we were stuffed so we didnt have dessert but they had several vegan and gluten free sweets on offer as well

Address: 364 Duckworth Street St. John's, NL A1C1H5 Canada
Review:
we had the bravacado sandwich and the chickpea curry everything was delicious service was pleasant and accommodating

highly recommend this place for well made food at a good price

Address: 201 Blackmarsh Rd. St John's, NL A1E Canada
Review:
absolutely horrible jiggs dinner  salt meat was like brine  turnip was strong and sinewy  gravy was like water  i have been sick all night due to the level of salt in the beef   worst ever

i was all hyped up for this my friend told me it was the best in town  i think not

Address: 201 Blackmarsh Rd. St John's, NL A1E Canada
Review: had breakfast this time the omelet was pretty good service was great waitress was new and attentive

Address: 201 Blackmarsh Rd. St John's, NL A1E Canada
Review: ordered 2 piece fish and chips with dressing and gravy for pickup fish was not fresh and was mushy from being soaked in gravy the fish needs to be kept separate from the gravy folks every thing was all packed tight in a square container  the price almost knocked me off my feet too last time i go there

Address: 201 Blackmarsh Rd. St John's, NL A1E Canada
Review: been there for pickup asked the lady infront how much time will it take and she said mayb its 10 min or 20 min then i was asking a guy and she interrupted us by saying she already talked to me after i said this is rude she start passing racist comments i really prefer not to go here if you are not canadian facing this kind of behavior first time in canada racist

Address: 201 Blackmarsh Rd. St John's, NL A1E Canada
Review: terrible place if you knew what happens in that kitchen youd never eat there again worked as delivery driver at blackmarsh rd location for 4 years i have seen first hand the nepotism and lack of respect they have for their workers after i had been there for 3 years the other driver quit so the owner hired his friend to do deliveries well suddenly i started getting scheduled for less days and rescheduled from the busy days like friday and saturday the owner was pushing me out to favor his friend even though i had been there for years at this point when good friday came around the best day for the year to be doing deliveries for the big r i wasnt even scheduled despite being the driver that was there the longest so in summation terrible food terrible owner stjohns would be better off without the big r

Address: 81 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2C8 Canada
Review: awesome pizza spot they even catered to our specific request that wasnt on the menu not saying theyll do it all the time for anyone but the fact that they catered to a specific allergy request was amazing thank you they have all types of pizza and even some fried food options too i havent tried everything there yet just the pizza but i wouldnt be surprised if i go for the mozza sticks sometime would definitely recommend giving this place a try

Address: 81 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2C8 Canada
Review: venice is not necessarily a place to dine in but their takeout pizza is consistently good the sauce is fantastic

Address: 81 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2C8 Canada
Review: good pizza ordering over the phone can be frustrating i find the employees could work on their manners other then that no complaints a little expensive

Address: 81 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2C8 Canada
Review:
pizza 85
good price 650 for one slice which is actually 2 very filling served warm good variety of toppings definitely a step up from any fast food pizza you can get in st johns

other menu items was surprised to find out that their fries are actually amazing did not expect that from a pizza place putine is also good overall you can expect everything on their menu to be served warm and in large portions

overall experience as someone who goes there a lot i have never had a bad experience with customer service food is served quickly and the people working there are pretty chill
only con is that the store is not very big so there is not always places to sit thats really only a problem in winter though since it is right next to bannerman park

Address: 81 Military Road St John's, NL A1C 2C8 Canada
Review: a staple in st johns its my wifes favorite spot for garlic fingers they have really good slices too when theyre fresh

Address: 166 Merrymeeting Road St. John's, NL A1C 2W4 Canada
Review: found a red pushpin that was baked into a turkey roll never ever had an issue with fabulous foods before now will be more cautious in the future

Address: 166 Merrymeeting Road St. John's, NL A1C 2W4 Canada
Review: amazingly tasty turkey and dressing flips and gravy flakies are really good stay away if you are concerned about your weight

Address: 166 Merrymeeting Road St. John's, NL A1C 2W4 Canada
Review:
simply the best turkey around theyve got turkey lot pies hot turkey sandwiches that come with a pile of fries dressing gravy and peas

super reasonably priced about 10 a for the plate pictured  and their homemade flakies are a musthave

Address: 166 Merrymeeting Road St. John's, NL A1C 2W4 Canada
Review: a st johns classic for old school take out grub those turkey flips with a side of gravy for dipping are the bomb and the cream puffs are a tower of deliciousness  you wont go hungry here buddy

Address: 166 Merrymeeting Road St. John's, NL A1C 2W4 Canada
Review: the name says it all fabulous foods not posh just perfect homestyle meals served with warm newfoundland hospitality fish  chips turkey pot pies turkey roll flip turnover and ovenfresh baked goods daily its all simply fabulous

Address: 9 Kiwanis Street Unit 1C St. John's, NL A1B 0A2 Canada
Review: this location is nice i miss the steak option and they ran out of rhe spicy chicken on the night i attended but was able to find an alternative the price remains decent for the city the atmosphere in this location is lacking front door is broken and the general feeling of the eat in area feels run down and out of date its right on rhe edge of that to creepy to order food state more so if youve never been to this location

Address: 9 Kiwanis Street Unit 1C St. John's, NL A1B 0A2 Canada
Review: most disappointing burrito i have had since i started visiting this place for the past 5 years server didnt seem like he had any skill wrapping up a burrito had to use a fork knife and spoon to eat a burrito  should have just gotten a bowl if i need a  cutlery had one staff working out front while the rest of the staff were lost inside

Address: 9 Kiwanis Street Unit 1C St. John's, NL A1B 0A2 Canada
Review:
tasty food with fresh ingredients
menu is appealing
service is usually fantastic
restaurant appears clean and organized
packaging is durable
slightly vegan and vegetarian friendly
not wheelchair accessible
rewards program available

Address: 9 Kiwanis Street Unit 1C St. John's, NL A1B 0A2 Canada
Review: not worth the money paid 32 for 2 small burritos that were garbage  if you want a decent good burrito go to burritos mexican out on topsail road

Address: 9 Kiwanis Street Unit 1C St. John's, NL A1B 0A2 Canada
Review: i like getting quesada when really hungry it is very filling and i love how you have lots of toppings to choose from

Address: 272 duckworth street St. John's,, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: one thing you need to keep in mind that they are not well known for their interior or anything its a very simple place the interior is not impressive at all but if we are talking about their food thats first class starting from the appetizers to deserts almost everything will satisfy your craving for deshi food

Address: 272 duckworth street St. John's,, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: the best in st johns to have chicken biryani i have visited over 10 times to have chicken biryani at this place keep up the taste

Address: 272 duckworth street St. John's,, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: mom and pop but really really good authentic indian food great price

Address: 272 duckworth street St. John's,, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: simple tasty and definitely aromaticthe atmosphere is filled with peace and serenity something that many restaurants lack by poisoning their places with loud music that has zero resonance with the bodys need for piece during a meal homestyle east indian cooking and the lady running the place gives you the impression of enjoy your meal and make sure you empty your plates no masks no makeup or false smiles almost like home i have to come back

Address: 272 duckworth street St. John's,, NL A1C 1H3 Canada
Review: poor service to say the least had to wait a long while to see no one in the store we had to leave when we understood that there wasnt anything coming our way any time soon we had to have our lunch from somewhere

Address: 210 Pennywell Rd St. John's, NL A1C 2L6 Canada
Review: hot and fresh  very generous portions  ordered the singapore noodles and combo wonton soup egg roll rice sweet  sour chicken balls and veggies  owners were polite and accommodating

Address: 210 Pennywell Rd St. John's, NL A1C 2L6 Canada
Review:
a little bit too cool 
the food made up for it all i could not describe how delicious it wasand the portions were monumental we had take out for the next day very nice lady who cooked and served

Address: 210 Pennywell Rd St. John's, NL A1C 2L6 Canada
Review: great food huge portions and friendly staff

Address: 210 Pennywell Rd St. John's, NL A1C 2L6 Canada
Review: good food  friendly service  small prices big portions amazing taste

Address: 210 Pennywell Rd St. John's, NL A1C 2L6 Canada
Review:
visiting from toronto and good lord is it ever awful
the food tastes like dirty tap water and is bland overcooked and blasted in a microwave
not sure if its because we ordered later in the day but please do not eat from here
we ate three bites and threw it out as we are flying back out tomorrow and are scared of having food poisoning
please do not order here

Address: 18 Commonwealth Avenue Mount Pearl, NL A1N 1W5 Canada
Review:
i ordered a sub with double cheddar online so 8 pieces of cheese i think either way there wasnt any cheese on my sub at all  i was already home it was late by the time i noticed so i wrote the manager
the manager offered me extra cheese for free the next time i buy a sub after sending him proof of course
so the math is they rip you off for 8 pieces of cheese and correct that by giving you 4 pieces of cheese if you buy another sub
there are subway stores in either direction i wont be returning to this one

Address: 18 Commonwealth Avenue Mount Pearl, NL A1N 1W5 Canada
Review: worst subway sandwich i ever ate was at this location terrible shop terrible operator avoid

Address: 18 Commonwealth Avenue Mount Pearl, NL A1N 1W5 Canada
Review: staff is really nice but would recommend ordering for pickup by app or website as its like unreasonably slow with just a couple customers

Address: 18 Commonwealth Avenue Mount Pearl, NL A1N 1W5 Canada
Review: excellent customer service and well prepared sub   my son and i really enjoyed our experience there

Address: 18 Commonwealth Avenue Mount Pearl, NL A1N 1W5 Canada
Review: the subway at the crossroads on kenmount road has a drive through which has been great during this last lock down we were there twice this week however our second trip was much better the first time the bread was not fresh and over done plus they did not put everything we wanted on our subs

Address: 179 Elizabeth Ave St. John's, NL A1B 1S8 Canada
Review: worker literally yelled at me for calling rotisserie chicken shredded chicken and then got really mad because i asked for avocado last and told me that i should have known better sorry i dont work at subway lol

Address: 179 Elizabeth Ave St. John's, NL A1B 1S8 Canada
Review: food is fine service is awful the people working theremost of them do not care at all and do the bare minimum no smiles no hellos just what do you want very rude often have to stand at the cash for minutes at a time waiting for someone to check me out while my sub is sitting there getting cold everyone there seems to hate their life but dont take it out on customers

Address: 179 Elizabeth Ave St. John's, NL A1B 1S8 Canada
Review:
by far the slowest subway ive been too even when the line is short its incredibly slow the amount of cheese they use doesnt cover the entirety of the sub
they also do not take subway points or gift cards and they leave you waiting at the cash while they serve the people before you

Address: 179 Elizabeth Ave St. John's, NL A1B 1S8 Canada
Review:
whoever is in charged of this station stop exploiting your workers workers are doing much more than they are supposed to do
hire more people plz

Address: 179 Elizabeth Ave St. John's, NL A1B 1S8 Canada
Review:
worst service ever the ladies working there are high on attitude and pretend as theyre paying for my sandwich
awful service
ask them for a more than 3 veggies on your sub and u will see them getting irritated

Address: 361 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: got a noodle dish with bbq pork and shrimp  wheres the pork or shrimp very shy on ingredients other than noodles and everything was finely diced so even when you got meat you couldnt taste it

Address: 361 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: one of the best places in town to get authentic cantonese chinese food

Address: 361 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: i ordered take out the food looks ok but unfortunately the taste just wasnt there for example the chop suey tasted like it was stir fried in water instead of the usual sauce that i am accustomed too the egg rolls were puffy full of air with very little filling inside the egg roll cover was good and crispy and the filling was ok just very little of it the food overall wasnt badjust wasnt up to my overall standard

Address: 361 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: fresh ingredients vegan options i love the broth of their won ton soup and usually get the rice noodle dishes if you like heat they have a great chili sauce to add to anything just ask if you are calling for take out try a second time if no answer during business hours

Address: 361 Water Street St. John's, NL A1C 1C2 Canada
Review: if i could give zero stars i would i dont think ive had food so bland restaurants cant be getting away with charging money for food that tastes like nothing worst chinese ive had in town

Address: 1 Richmond Street W Toronto, ON M5H 3W4 Canada
Review: so glad we tried the tasting menu tonight fresh and quality ingredients we love the duck liver pate with strawberry puree seared yellowfin tuna braised chicken terrine dry aged rib eye with oyster mushroom and the black forest cake the most friendly service and non pretentious highly recommend this restaurant in the heart of downtown toronto

Address: 1 Richmond Street W Toronto, ON M5H 3W4 Canada
Review:
yo richmond station had a good time eating here and felt appreciated by your staff

drinks
ordered the black walnut old fashioned i always gravitate towards old fashioned whenever i see it not the absolutely best but it does the job

food
we started with the duck liver pate we just simply love pate richmond station provided a new experience for us we havent had it with strawberry jam but it went well over the brioche toast we ordered the stn burger and this weekly special item that has bacon wrapped rabbit we asked for plain but to keep the rest on the side hard to review this as my girlfriend prefers plain burgers she did enjoy it though dessert was interesting i recommend the rhubarb sundae the earl grey whip cream was simply amazing it had this rhubarb syrup and sorbet and stacked with these waffle crunch what the heck is a waffle crunch anyway oh well lets not think too much and just enjoy good food

definitely can recommend this place the pricing isnt on the cheap side but gratuities are not expected theyre able to pay their employees well foster a good environment for everyone and more i like this so 55

Address: 1 Richmond Street W Toronto, ON M5H 3W4 Canada
Review: this place is absolutely amazing  the food is first class the service is great the atmosphere is soulful the duck liver pate  is mind blowing  the combination with dried strawberry and strawberry sauce is something you must try the brioche that accompany the  pate is delicious itself  the menu changes every 34 weeks so dont hurry up with the burger  its been in the menu for 10 years and will not disappear

Address: 1 Richmond Street W Toronto, ON M5H 3W4 Canada
Review: the service was amazing the lady was so patient with our large group robyn some of the food items were delicious and i wish there were more cocktail options the station burger was a great choice as well as the chickpea panisse what was most refreshing was at the end they didnt expect a tip because it was included in the bill i really appreciated this

Address: 1 Richmond Street W Toronto, ON M5H 3W4 Canada
Review: the overall service was great and it was a nice setting for our tasting  the food itself was just average compared to our palette underwhelming flavors on most of the course the empanada on the first amuse was dry the watercress soup was a mid level dish with 2 out our 4 diners still containing shrimp shells definitely not what we expected from a top chef winner but it could have been an off night for the team

Address: 3265 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2L5 Canada
Review: food was great  loved the brisket the parmesan truffle fries are a must try as is the mac and cheese i will say i was a little disappointed with the ribs and with them being nearly 50 for a rack i expected more they werent horrible but a little over cooked pulled pork was okay as well service was great

Address: 3265 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2L5 Canada
Review:
we went in this place to celebrate a farewell party with friends saturday night 8 people it was not busy beyond our table just two more i counted on total 4 waitress so we were expecting good service but they are so busy talking with each other that forget about the costumer  service

despite this the food was really good

Address: 3265 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2L5 Canada
Review: one of my favourite restaurants in the city the food is too good my boyfriend and i always get the mac  cheese as an app the brisket burger as a main and truffle parm fries as a side  the combo dreams were made of highly recommend

Address: 3265 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2L5 Canada
Review: we dined in the restaurant and were very unpleasantly surprised you can clearly tell that the brisket and ribs were boiled not smoked the ribs are tough and dont fall off the bone the pulled pork burger consists of an extremely dry and tasteless patty and about a teaspoon of pulled pork which was barely pulled the chicken is raw and also tasteless its great to come here after having a bad day and being cheered up by the amazing waitresses as long as you dont eat anything

Address: 3265 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2L5 Canada
Review:
service was great we enjoyed the platter for two everything was great the brisket was the clear winner of the meats the sides were tasty too beans slaw  cornbread had to be taken home and were fantastic for breakfast the next day
good cocktails as well will definitely go again

Address: 254 Queen Street  W Toronto, ON M5V 1Z8 Canada
Review:
395

their lunch special is good value for money we sat down for a quick lunch on a weekend the space is clean and well kept

we started with the takoyaki which was mostly batter and one small piece of octopus in each ball i wouldnt order these again

their lunch specials range from 1620 and come with a main rice miso soup and side dishes we chose the steak lunch which was a nice variety of flavours the steak could have been better as it was a bit chewy but for the price not a bad deal if we visit again id like to try one of the cuts from their regular menu

the slight disappointment here was the service the host and server were pleasant but the service was quite slow and no one checked on us i had to get up once to go ask for chopsticks and again to ask for the bill

overall its fairly good value if youre hungry

Address: 254 Queen Street  W Toronto, ON M5V 1Z8 Canada
Review: this was a wellbalanced delicious meal started with scrumptious gyoza for an app the steak was cooked just as ordered and the sides were a great compliment for the meat this was a filling meal but didnt leave me feeling stuffed or uncomfortable which is exactly what i wanted the sapporo went surprisingly well with the dish the online ordering was easy to use but the servers were still attentive and helpful it was busy on a weekend night so i recommend making a reservation

Address: 254 Queen Street  W Toronto, ON M5V 1Z8 Canada
Review: excellent steak i had the wagyu beef sure it is the american version but it was still great cooked just right and very reasonably priced 82 cad for 10oz the sides were very good too highly recommended

Address: 254 Queen Street  W Toronto, ON M5V 1Z8 Canada
Review:
first  foremost service was excellent the food was delicious hot and fresh the sizzling plates are a perfect touch to the experience casual vibe good music and overall very welcoming

if youre downtown looking for a casual spot for a great steak dinner  do your taste buds a favour and stop in

Address: 254 Queen Street  W Toronto, ON M5V 1Z8 Canada
Review:
with the atmosphere like any good established steakhouse expectations were reasonably high although the results seemed to be pretty average and rather disappointing across the table

the wagyu don i had asked for was good without being great with the cook being just about there and a dish that couldve always done with a little more meat sadly across the table the sirloin was tough and barely rare and needed 2 hotplates to get it to a consistent rare to consume comfortably

supposing this is a oneoff i would be willing to give them another try down the line with the recommendation to introduce thicker hot plates that would allow the dish to remain warm for longer and even cover for any cooking inconsistencies

Address: 196 Robert Street Toronto, ON M5S 2K8 Canada
Review: we keep coming back to this place the food is always consistently incredible with excellent flavours portion sizes are decent the menu is shareable and is split into vegetables sea and land so there are options for everyone menu favourites are the chopped salad ceviche and sticky bun for dessert you can get the bacon on the side the new addition of chickpea fritters to the menu was a great choice too hopefully it stays honourable mention to the burger not pictured though it used to come with fries and now it doesnt

Address: 196 Robert Street Toronto, ON M5S 2K8 Canada
Review: an amazingly creative playful and delicious restaurant in the heart of the annex the classic tasting menu offered a diverse selection of their menu items and we were allowed to swap out the burger for tacos the tasting menu was also a bargain at just 60 a person and server alex was very knowledgeable and provided excellent service as well just be warned that the food is a bit on the heavy side so do come extra hungry we will definitely be returning to try all the other items on the menu

Address: 196 Robert Street Toronto, ON M5S 2K8 Canada
Review:
i loved every bite and every sip we had the chickpea fritters chopped salad beef short ribs and lemon cake for dessert my husbands favorites were the chopped salad and the fritters and he really enjoyed the negroni as well as the where theres smoke that he was recommended to try its hard to do the dishes justice without trying them for yourself but i highly recommend this place for friendly attentive and fast service as well as a delicious night out the food is sharing plates and we ordered three which was almost too much for just the two of us dessert wasnt necessary but then it always is
also we got lost trying to find the restaurant not sure if this was because our uber dropped us off down the street but the address didnt seem to match the physical location in case this happens to anyone else it is there on the main road just keep looking  its worth looking for

Address: 196 Robert Street Toronto, ON M5S 2K8 Canada
Review:
we were 2 couples and we started off with their refreshing peach drink and a spicy concoction they were both amazing and went with every dish

for vegetarian options we had the chickpea fritters salad and squash ravioli nonveg dishes our friends had were the octopus and crab dishes service was amazing and the food was really tasty

the only issue was the portion size they say it is tapas style but for 25 of squash ravioli there could definitely be more on the plate or like have more than 1 tentacle for 42 of octopus

we finished our meal with their sweet dish it was really tasty but quite heavy on the sugar

Address: 196 Robert Street Toronto, ON M5S 2K8 Canada
Review: we really loved the family style dining and had 4 dishes between 2 people the service was really friendly the server recommended the chop salad burger and tuna tartare which were all great we also really loved the pea pappardelle which was super lemony and light the cocktails were really yummy as well the mangorita was our favourite patio was very cute

Address: 46 Saint Clair Avenue E Toronto, ON M4T 1M9 Canada
Review:
addicted to mazesoba but theyre hard to find outside of japan in vancouver theres one and even in big megapolitan like la theres only one nyc only one  you get the picture toronto dubbed as the most diverse city in the world didnt have one  until megumi

food was tasty and delicious service was great make it a point to be a regular here and tell all your friends of this amazing food

Address: 46 Saint Clair Avenue E Toronto, ON M4T 1M9 Canada
Review: great food with a relaxed atmosphere and great service the noodles are very tasty and they do not cheap out on the toppings on each dish the chili oil and kombu vinegar pack a lot of flavors that add to the dishes

Address: 46 Saint Clair Avenue E Toronto, ON M4T 1M9 Canada
Review: i have lots of experience eating japanese cuisine especially ramen though this isnt technically ramen the style is similar in the sense that it is a bowl of noodles with various sauces and toppings the flavours of the dishes are very balanced one spice does not overpower the other they allow the dish to speak for itself appearance wise its very neat not too complex but not too simple its indicative of a chef that is confident in their food and it really shows when you eat it atmosphere wise it is very relaxing you do not feel too rushed to finish your meal and the layout of the building coupled with the relaxing music really compliments the taste of the food quite well the owner is also quite friendly and is happy to help anyone who may be confused in regards to how to eat mazesoba being how it is such a new dish for most in canada overall great experience and i highly recommend it to anyone who wants to try something new or step outside their comfort zone

Address: 46 Saint Clair Avenue E Toronto, ON M4T 1M9 Canada
Review:
megumi mazesoba opened up in my neighbourhood two months ago and i had been meaning to check it out soonerboy i wish i did

i went with a friend of mine who had been raving about it and the owner paula  and the moment we walked in i could understand why the warmth and familiarity with which we were greeted instantly made us feel at home

it was lunchtime on a friday and i would say it was more than 50 occupied we picked a table perpendicular from the long row of tables along the far wall i would say that while we were there it only got busier  both with dinein patrons and people coming in to pick their takeaway orders up all the more impressive that there were only two visible employees working  paula who worked the floor with her hospitality and also somehow managed to assist with the dish preparations and another gentleman

my friend and i both ordered the megumi mazesoba  hers with no spice while i got the signature spicy which is a midtier spice level man  i can handle my spices and this was definitely a fragrant pungent sharp and delicious spiciness they dont mess around
