we both got our bowls with udon noodles they were perfectly cooked  warm supple bouncy and mixed together with the pork lard ajitama egg and all the other ingredients it was a flavour bomb in my mouth soooooo good

do not finish all the sauce at the bottom of the bowl  i made this mistake because it was just too yummy to resist but you are supposed to save a bit of it to eat with rice at the end thankfully my friend hadnt hoovered her food down like i did so she spared some of her sauce for me and i got to enjoy those last few bites that are meant to be mixed with the rice

i am still dreaming about this mazesoba

for dessert paula brought out little sample portions of the banana cigar dish served with ice cream it is like a banana spring roll very simple and delightful and a nice sweet finish to a meal filled with so much savouriness

it is so great to finally have a good asian noodle restaurant option in this neighbourhood

Address: 46 Saint Clair Avenue E Toronto, ON M4T 1M9 Canada
Review:
today was my first time coming to megumi mazesoba and make no mistake it wont be my last from the moment i walked in i was amazed by the ambiance of the establishment and how it was designed then i was greeted humbly by paula as i entered and steven from the kitchen then after i ordered the house special and between the thin noodles with meat and egg and other ingredients along with the white rice that came with it after to scoop up the rest of the sauce i have to say that i was incredibly satisfied with my meal brothless ramen in my modest opinion is really underrated and this ramen establishment along st clair east is one i would recommend hold heartedly thank you for the wonderful experience it was worth every dollar
update
megumi mazesoba was so good the last time i was there the day before that i had to come back again to order the same signature dish only this time with udon noodles this style of noodle reminds me of the homemade style of pasta my paternal grandmother used to make which made the experience all the more worthwhile thanks again paula and audrey from the kitchen for great food great service and for once again welcoming me back into the humbling and modest ambiance of your establishment

Address: 21B St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review: big place with lots of tables inside and some outside it works as a self serve basis you place your order at the counter take an order number and they bring you what they prepare they have a variety of healthy types of food smoothies and cookies me and my friend had smoothies that we enjoyed a lot as well as a chocolate sesame cookie which was delicious will definitely come back

Address: 21B St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review: i love this place yummy meals and baked goods consistently excellent service tons of room nice ambiance the whole package i moved away from toronto but make a point to visit here whenever i am in town

Address: 21B St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review: this was my first time getting food here as i usually only stop in for a drink i loved the variety they had my friend got 1 protein  2 sides and i just got 2 sides we both got the mac and cheese which was so delicious my friend got their mocha smoothie which ill definitely be getting next time as it was so tasty i got the ginger maple lemonade which was very refreshing too ill definitely will be coming back here

Address: 21B St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review: really adorable spot with delicious healthy food cant wait to come back and try all of the other things on the menu i had the chicken breast with salsa verde the mediterranean chopped salad and the roasted cauliflower

Address: 21B St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review:
5 had a wonderful first experience at mary be kitchen went with a group for lunch so had the opportunity to try many things the sides are flavorful and delicious very much enjoyed the brussel sprouts and found all the sides quite flavorful the smoothies are a great consistency and the desserts sweet potato brownie and vegan cookie were both so good need to return to try the lentil dal and the curry

returned for the lentil dahl and its amazing comes on long grain rice with currents

the regular salted chocolate chip cookie is really amazing too

Address: 633 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review:
the menu offered a wide variety of authentic italian dishes each one made with the freshest ingredients and expertly prepared  we started off with mussels and clams in a white wine sauce and grilled calamari both cooked perfectly and bursting with flavor
main courses included pizza pasta alla gricia lemon bisque shrimp spaghetti and branzino id love to say something negative here but its impossible these dishes were just outstanding the branzino on another level of freshness and perfect preparation
to finish off the meal we had the tiramisu it was light and fluffy with just the right amount of sweetness and a hint of coffee
i would highly recommend positano restaurant to anyone looking for a delicious and authentic italian dining experience in toronto the food atmosphere and service were all exceptional and i cant wait to go back

Address: 633 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review: came here for the first time for my birthday location atmosphere service  the food all so excellent the gnocchi was delicious tasted like when i was in italy 1010 for me

Address: 633 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review: great restaurant very friendly with a great vibe  the food is delicious and diverse i bet it was the best pizza ive had in toronto the tiramisu was pure italian the staff is super friendly and professional i will definitely come back and recommend

Address: 633 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review: we had brunch at the positano restaurant last weekend the atmosphere was very inviting the service was excellent and the food was delicious my favorite was the granola yogurt parfait housemade granola and mixed berry compote with balkan yogurt and fresh fruits yummy make sure to try

Address: 633 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review:
amazing food and atmosphere with excellent staff  branzino pizza and short ribs are my favourites cheesecake and tiramisu are wonderful
they started serving breakfast  brunch on weekends with a wide selection we had the best menemen and pide best quality definetely will be a regular for weekends  highly reccomend

Address: 398 Church Street Toronto, ON M5B 2A2 Canada
Review: it was my first time at this restaurant it has an amazing welcoming atmosphere and presence the staff are great at recommending food items on the menu the service is also great theres indoor and outdoor dining all dishes were delicious its recommended to try multiple dishes to get a full experience on the various items on the menu i highly recommend the mushroom cheese and rice dish

Address: 398 Church Street Toronto, ON M5B 2A2 Canada
Review: this spot is a must try the service is on point the ambiance is great and theyre not going to disappoint in terms of food you need to try their salmonshrimp ozusushi the chicken karaage and the rice bowls highly recommend trying a sake bomb if youre with a group of people too overall this is great spot and i was really happy with my experience

Address: 398 Church Street Toronto, ON M5B 2A2 Canada
Review:
great for light dinnerwe couldve easily eaten more if we were hungrier but we were perfectly served

loved the imported sashimi and the lobster sashimi too chicken namban hit the spot fun atmosphere with a young attentive staff 3 soju shots theres a catch  gotta cheer with the staff and the rest of the crowd but hey why noti wont forget eating there now

Address: 398 Church Street Toronto, ON M5B 2A2 Canada
Review: came before the dinner rush  but service was a little slow to begin with i ordered the grilled mackerel bento the mackerel was good however the fish cake tempura was not the crispy tempura i was expecting was kind of soggy and cold dining outside was a cool experience but the food wasnt what i expected and service overall couldve been better

Address: 398 Church Street Toronto, ON M5B 2A2 Canada
Review: super fun high energy atmosphere the heated patio is much quieter if you want a chiller vibe everything from our drinks neko punch and the gin fizz to our shared plates was amazing and our server nick was so friendly and attentive even though it was a busy night the miso cod special was one of the best plates of fish ive ever had the tapas are pretty small so you may also want to get a main if youre hungry but everything is very reasonably priced for how beautiful and delicious it is oh and the hojicha brulee was to die for

Address: 18 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5H 3G8 Canada
Review:
came back after a while and food was still very nice we came as a group of 6 and all of the food we order were great i love tom yum so much green curry and chefs choice are the musttry dishes
it was a little bit packed when we arrived there were enough room for us to sit comfortable
drinks were not really nice

Address: 18 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5H 3G8 Canada
Review:
one of the top spots in toronto for thai dishes very long lines even during weekdays
the best dish was hands downt the pad thai it was everything i expected it to be the green curry was not exceptional but everything we tried was delicious portion sizes are average and service was a little bit slow overall great with enjoyable food

Address: 18 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5H 3G8 Canada
Review:
the food and service here were overall really great they have an entire separate section for vegan and vegetarian so its definitely diet restriction friendly

the khao soi curry noodles with the crunchy noodles and egg noodles had a nice texture contrast as well as strong curry flavor beef was a tad tough so id go with the chicken next time as for appetizers the grabong squash fritter was amazing the dip that comes with it was so flavorful and not too sweet while the fritter itself wasnt too oily

i recommend either coming 1015 mins early before opening to grab a table for 1st seating or getting a reservation outright the lines start to get long before it even opens even on weekdays

Address: 18 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5H 3G8 Canada
Review: amazing spot for authentic thai food the tom yum soup was spicy and tangy and packs a punch the main course was so delicious i forgot to take pictures cant wait to go again and try new items

Address: 18 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5H 3G8 Canada
Review: loved this place the food tastes so homemade and authentic we went at 2pm and had to wait for 30 min at 3 it dies down a bit i had the pad thai and it was amazing but the see ew was the star of the evening so tasty and flavorful definitely recommend coming here

Address: 2335 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E6 Canada
Review: been to their downtown location before but love love love the vibe of this location a little hard to spot from the street but the interior is beautiful the food came fairly quickly and definitely reminded me of thailand fair portions and lots of options on the menu its a little pricey but understandable with how popular this place is the dishes were well executed and had a lot of flavour would definitely return again

Address: 2335 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E6 Canada
Review:
loved this northern thai restaurant foods are very authentic and tasty service is good and fast i liked this location because it is less busy than the downtown location
interior decoration are modern with a high ceiling it is a nice place to hangout with friends
will definitely come back try more dishes

Address: 2335 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E6 Canada
Review: its a lot more spacious and open than downtown branch it was busy but it was not overly packed recommended to make a reservation however we loved everything we ordered and we would definitely go back again we had chicken wings green curry pad thai and their coconut sorbet for dessert  all of them were unique in terms of flavor and texture

Address: 2335 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E6 Canada
Review: first time visiting and will def be back service was great and attentive food was amazing and overall a great experience my only complaint is that it took a while for our server to take our order however food came out quick and hot i liked how they served our meals at the same time you have to try the coconut sorbet served in a coconut shell  best sorbet ive ever had the restaurant closed at 10pm but they let us finished our meal left around 1030pm would def recommend

Address: 2335 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E6 Canada
Review: first time at pai uptown and it wont be my last from the moment i got there i loved the atmosphere we had some time before our table so we enjoyed some cocktails at the bar the bartenders were so helpful and friendly from helping us decide what drinks we might like to try to what dishes off main courses might be a good choice we all loved our meals and drinks and to finish on a high notedo get the coconut sorbet best shared though as its a big portion  but just scrumptious although i wish there was more mango  thumbs up for great friendly staff all around great music too might be a little loud for intimate conversations but we managed a must try if you havent been here yet vegan options bonus busy area so plan ahead for parking on the street or find a green p  subway right near by too

Address: 1580 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: delicious armenian food they mix traditional cuisine with a modern twist friendly staff atmosphere is elegant and great for dates or just a casual dinner with friends very clean restrooms were neatly kept would recommend would go back

Address: 1580 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: we came here to try the summerlicious menu but so many things on their regular menu looked good too so we decided to pick our own dishes the service was really good and super attentive we got their dips tabule manti dumplings akawi cheese batata harra adana kabab and lamb chops and kunafa for dessert the manti dumplings and akawi were a stand out the only thing we didnt enjoy is the kunafa only because we make the best at home their patio and vibe is really nice and wed def come again

Address: 1580 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: this restaurant is amazing had a late lunch there we first called in mirage restaurant on the same street and were treated rather strangely the food at the mayrik is top shelf the service out of 10 is at 11 we had such a lovely lunch and will visit them again wish i could give them 10 stars

Address: 1580 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: the fatoush and the falafel were very flavourful very satisfying just on the brink of too much seasoning which is really unnecessary also i was really looking to get radish and pomegranate seeds as became customary in fatoush at other restaurants  or else the dish feels simplistic and overpriced the armenian beer is very good malty  would drink another if not costing 10

Address: 1580 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: definitely a must try spot in toronto the service was great the concept of being an armenian fusion was on point while the food did not blow my mind away the experience and taste was for sure above par you wont regret trying this place out  ambience service food everything is of high quality

Address: 2373 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2C8 Canada
Review: excellent food came here on a busy weekend with couple of my friends and was able to get a table within 5 minutes the food didnt take much time to arrive on our table scrumptious fine food with good quantity the hospitality was also exceptional will be my regular dinein places from now on

Address: 2373 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2C8 Canada
Review: love the baked goat cheese salad the servers were nice i and my friend asked to recommend dish because it was first time to visit for us we ordered what he recommended and these dishes were perfect  the interior design was cool as well

Address: 2373 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2C8 Canada
Review:
this place is a gem
though the waiter forgot to give us olive oil for the bread at first he later prepared and introduced us the hidden special spicy oil for it which we loved it
ordered the most popular pasta and the pizza giovanni food is awesome service is excellent as he knew we are sharing our food pasta came in two separate plates one for each of us
the recommended creme brule cheesecake is very good and so natural that the combination seems meant to be together
i will definitely go again and again

Address: 2373 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2C8 Canada
Review: we visited here for lunch and it was a nice experience the server was lovely and extremely nice the interior is very friendly and cozy their wine selection is great as well and they have a beer and cocktail menu as well they will bring a bread basket for you as well the pastas were really creamy and tasty everything tasted amazing it was a nice experience overall definitely will come back to taste the rest of the menu

Address: 2373 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2C8 Canada
Review: everything about this place was great impeccable and fast service truth be told i was a bit disappointed when i first saw the size of the shrimp in my meal but dont be fooled by that the main ingredient in my spinach fettuccine was the creamy sauce never tested anything so divine savour it slowly and you will know what i mean

Address: 214 Laird Drive Suite 101 Toronto, ON M4G 3W4 Canada
Review:
came here on a saturday evening after attending an event at the japanese canadian  cultural center its like 10 min drive

easy street side parking just in front of the restaurant

upon arrival we find the restaurant quite spacious and the staff was friendly

they seem to be quite kidfriendly as well
 there are high chairs
 paper and crayons for coloring
 unicorn chopsticks that our girl love
 kid friendly utensils as well

we ordered a bowl of udon the spicy trio sushi and an appetizer

prior to the food we ordered we gave us the appetizer small portion of delicious noodles in broth with some crunchy tempura bits our sushi combo also came with salads

overall it was a nice experience

Address: 214 Laird Drive Suite 101 Toronto, ON M4G 3W4 Canada
Review: a hidden gem that any sushi lover should experience the waitress is very kind and attentive the food is delicious ive had numerous types of sushi and maki from here and its always fresh the bulgogi was very tasty too got a pineapple vodka drink to top it off extremely satisfying meal i will be back

Address: 214 Laird Drive Suite 101 Toronto, ON M4G 3W4 Canada
Review: pretty good quality fish here especially considering the price definitely a step up from a lot of other sushi places in the neighbourhood the service is great too

Address: 214 Laird Drive Suite 101 Toronto, ON M4G 3W4 Canada
Review:
wish i had found this place sooner quality is on the higher end of nonizakaya places and the value for the lunch combo is unbeatable not to mention the presentation too did not expect the lunch combo to be served on a wooden platter

their menu has a variety of appetizers and sushi including dishes that not many places know about as well as some of their unique traditional rolls
will come back for more

Address: 214 Laird Drive Suite 101 Toronto, ON M4G 3W4 Canada
Review:
we ordered sake  he gave us a free cup each right off the bat such a welcoming  atmosphere then we each ordered dragon rolls so delicious and we are sushi snobs we have tested sushi from toronto to thunder bay this was the best in toronto and on par with the thunder bay we had  we would definitely make the 2 hour drive into toronto again just to have sushi here
highly recommend it

Address: 420A Wellington Street W Toronto, ON M5V 1E3 Canada
Review:
they had a total change

i came here when they first opened and a couple times after that its been a few years since i visited last time but wow they changed their entire menu

honestly i think the previous chef was better trio ceviche was disappointing not sure why they had to add a vegetarian version

happy hour was cute but the quality of food wasnt there maybe because its happy hour food

the beef tongue and short ribs were nice beef tongue was the best dish their fried rice was also interesting but great id recommend the beef tongue short rib and the rice the rest were mediocre

Address: 420A Wellington Street W Toronto, ON M5V 1E3 Canada
Review:
perfecto food service and atmospheres are perfect theres nothing to complain about

i was always in the pain when the restaurant asked a bunch of tips and actually did nothing

but waitresses here is next level

they catch your needs right away especially the waitress who served us today braided hair has a beautiful attitude the owner of the restaurant  please compensate her i was extremely surprised that i didnt have to call them for help

amigos please go to this place and enjoy your dinner

Address: 420A Wellington Street W Toronto, ON M5V 1E3 Canada
Review: mira was a surprising discovery we were craving some peruvian food and google suggested mira tucked away in a quaint little street on wellington street mira has a beautiful ambience and really good food the waiter was super nice and courteous as well the portions look small but trust me theyre super filling the chicken empanadas stole the show totally so flavourful and filling definitely going back

Address: 420A Wellington Street W Toronto, ON M5V 1E3 Canada
Review: really cute place service and food was a little slow but the food was really good  we ordered the ceviche trio and it all tasted different in a good way  not the typical lemony ceviche that you get  the wagyu carpaccio was ok the beef was cut too thin so didnt capture a lot of flavors the short rib was pretty tasty  the meat was tender and sauce was good  id go back to try the other dishes  oh if you like your cocktails stiff this is the place  dang was hard to down it but 1 drink got us buzz

Address: 420A Wellington Street W Toronto, ON M5V 1E3 Canada
Review: we went there for my birthday and i really enjoyed it the only thing is that service is really slow the ribeye is a must a bit pricey but worth it the grilled chicken was also amazing the 3 leches was just superbe highly recommend

Address: 1084 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L4 Canada
Review: the first time i experienced grandma loves you was back on december 19 2020 i was having this weird obsession with hot dogs and i saw that grandma love you made a variety of them the swedish dog was definitely my favourite it was pretty cold that day and i remember just eating it in my truck and it was fabulous the spicy ham is my favourite sandwich for sure the chefs choice was also very good i know my brother loves the german rye sandwiches since he always asks me to pick him up one if im in the area really nice to see them expanding i just hope the quality doesnt get compromised due to that

Address: 1084 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L4 Canada
Review: was recommended the spicy ham and cheese sandwich and it was phenomenal sandwich was juicy and fresh truly felt nutritious would say it wouldve gone perfectly with chips and a drink which they have ate half of the 12 and feel full but not heavy no bloating would recommend to try out

Address: 1084 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L4 Canada
Review: i love deli sandwiches and someone told me that this place offers the best sandwiches in toronto a bold statement but i would rank it  near the top for sure the amount of people coming in and out of this place tells you its a sandwich place worth trying got the mixed cold cut and honestly was full after eating only 6 inches of my 12 inc sub sandwich good typical cold cut ingredients i was able to add green pepper and olives if i would go back i would probably ask for banana hot peppers the grandma sauce they use is good if youre into deli sandwiches you should definitely check this place out

Address: 1084 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L4 Canada
Review: been wanting to try this place for a long time oh boy it didnt disappoint got 3 different 12 inch subs and each one was so good  i cant wait to go back and try another set of 3  the staff were super friendly and helped me choose as it was our first time its a small place but with a little corner window seat prefect for a quick bite with leftovers to spare unless you are like me and devoured the entire thing people who knew what they were ordering were in and out quickly this place takes sandwiches to a whole other level def worth trying

Address: 1084 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L4 Canada
Review: very friendly adn quick service prices are on the higher end for a sandwich but still within reasonable range everything tasted fresh and quality the spicy ham could have been a little more exciting but no complaints i would try this place again when im in the area

Address: 163 Spadina Avenue 1st Floor Toronto, ON M5V 2L6 Canada
Review:
attentive and easy to talk to staff weve been here twice now and love it every time its a must when we visit toronto eve fry thing in the menu is great weve tried new things every time but the wedge salad is to die for it has such a refreshing touch

desert was great the lemon pie was too tart for me so i prefer the strawberry parfait

overall this place is great just make sure you set up a reso before coming

Address: 163 Spadina Avenue 1st Floor Toronto, ON M5V 2L6 Canada
Review:
an amazing experience from beginning to end ive never been to a restaurant with such diligent front of house its like magic when you turn around and realize your glass has been refilled or that your napkin has been folded neatly for you given their reputation its still a surprise

the food is also really good and a good balance of comfort and original the pigeon was essentially korean fried chicken and the lemon meringue pie is classic speaking of which the food here is a bit acidic but i prefer that the torched scallops were platted like ceviche and was a great start the complimentary cheese bread with smoked butter and the wedge salad were highlights the wild rice with the wedge salad made it the standout dish by far followed closely by the ravioli 46 dishes should do it for 2 people

excited to try the other menu items

Address: 163 Spadina Avenue 1st Floor Toronto, ON M5V 2L6 Canada
Review:
this was a great experience overall the food selection was great for a smaller menu

each dish we tried had levels of flavour and most importantly you definitively taste all flavours out into the dish nothing got lost

the presentation of each dish was photo worthy as you can see the care of how each dish is created

the service was prompt and gave great recommendations for our group

no complaints here

Address: 163 Spadina Avenue 1st Floor Toronto, ON M5V 2L6 Canada
Review:
great service and experience if you are going during peak lunch hours it is better to reserve ahead of time via phone

great lunch menu prices were a bit expensive relative to the portion size but the flavours were great oysters seemed a bit small but were still flavourful the prawn ceviche and the aloette burger are definitely a must have when visiting

the crispy squash was surprisingly sweet and served as a great end part to the meal even though it was not dessert specific dish

Address: 163 Spadina Avenue 1st Floor Toronto, ON M5V 2L6 Canada
Review:
one of the best spots i have tried in toronto their burger was super flavorful the complimentary toast was delicious the stuff wings were very delicious but i wish it was a little more crispy their fries were also amazing but the chocolate tart was the winner tonight definitely one of the best desserts ever super decadent and melt in your mouth rich
service was great fastest water refill ever not once my glass went more than half empty definitely recommend this place very nice atmosphere and amazing creative dishes its a little on the pricey side but worth the quality and creativity in my opinion

Address: 1618 Bayview Ave Toronto, ON M4S 1T3 Canada
Review:
been coming here for a few years always start with their lime margarita 1010 for flavor and portion get the pitcher size trust me    we also started with their nachos and later had the chorinacho for dinner  yes we love nachos lol but they make their fresh nachos here and was super good  always a favorite place to
visit

Address: 1618 Bayview Ave Toronto, ON M4S 1T3 Canada
Review: this is the first time we visit  it is a family style mexico restaurant with only three people operating  the dishes are like family cooking  lime margarita is a good choice pairing with nice and tasty enchilada chimichanga quesadilla and tacos  the price is reasonable  next time we will try burritos and fajitas  we also order dessert churros with peanut and caramel mixed paste

Address: 1618 Bayview Ave Toronto, ON M4S 1T3 Canada
Review: one of the best mexican restaurants in town from the beautifully decorated interior to the cute patio right on bayview theres a lot to love about mexico lindo i highly recommend the enchiladas

Address: 1618 Bayview Ave Toronto, ON M4S 1T3 Canada
Review:
i lovee this location

i ordered this time through ubereat food was still hot and tasty as usual

steak and shrimp were perfect delicous flavours good quality

tacos were filled with lots of toppings lots of meat i wish they gave extra hot sauce next time forgot to ask for it

anyway 1010 for ubereat food

Address: 1618 Bayview Ave Toronto, ON M4S 1T3 Canada
Review: i absolutely love this restaurant the food was delicious and the environment was so festive

Address: 96 Laird Drive East York, ON M4G 3V3 Canada
Review:
we accidentally found the olde yorke fish and chips in an old neighborhood setting the pub reminds me of the uk pubs very authentic the place feels oldfashioned cozy setting with an old fashioned bar in the centre there is an open patio the fish is thick the batter is thin and crunchy the chips are thick cut just like in the uk as we left we saw a truck deliver fresh fish inside not frozen very good

waitresses are very friendly and helpful to us in choosing the many types of fish on the menu

Address: 96 Laird Drive East York, ON M4G 3V3 Canada
Review: this is is the best fish and chips ive ever had in toronto now i havent eaten at every place but this is definitely now my favourite the chips were so crispy and fresh the fish was  nicely battered not overly done and it was incredibly tasty i had the cod with fries and coleslaw and everything was really well done i end up spending 26 for my meal plus tea tip included and i think for what i ate and how good it was it was a pretty good deal the staff was nice and my waiter was so beautiful and friendly i will be coming back here its a small place and gets very busy so perhaps book ahead of you have a larger group

Address: 96 Laird Drive East York, ON M4G 3V3 Canada
Review: i got the haddock and chips the piece of fish is quite large everything tastes great and it wasnt greasy they dont include tarter sauce in the package so when they ask you if you want any condiments please ensure you ask for it oh their gravy is also really good i will definitely go back they have a nice space to eat outdoors too

Address: 96 Laird Drive East York, ON M4G 3V3 Canada
Review: upon walking in you have to bypass a huge curtain i guess to keep the cold out this place also has a distinctly strong malt vinegar smell the food was pretty good with their crispy fish and good fries their cod is delicious portions were not overtly large my husband and i dined there server did not make eye contact with me once  and yes they were busy but did not ask if we wanted another drink and their glasses are smaller than average i was thirsty the two things annoyed me friendliest person in the joint was the friendly guy who greeted us and showed us to our table

Address: 96 Laird Drive East York, ON M4G 3V3 Canada
Review:
the fish and chips were good the mushy peas were watery and had a slight flavor  the vinegar was weak the service was good

avoid the solarium it has an external door which was opened multiple times on a very cold day without any extra door did not mind the cold but it did make my food colder faster

Address: 612B-3401 Dufferin Street Upper Level Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review:
truly enjoyed this restaurant they offer a variety of japanese inspired dishes the ingredients used are fresh and the menu is well thought of

the overall ambience is pretty and the conveyor belt system surely entertains our little ones its family friendly and very clean we came in on a weekday as soon as they opened so we had the place to ourselves a few minutes later we noticed that the place is full so be sure to plan ahead especially on peak hours

their aburi sushi selections are the best their red tuna just melts in your mouth they have a few food options for non sushi lovers that are quite sumptuous

will definitely go back and will definitely recommend

Address: 612B-3401 Dufferin Street Upper Level Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review:
we had a great delicious meal here the sushi was very freshthe server was so kind and enthusiastic
loved every dishes that we ordered 
happy soul for this foodie definitely going back for more

Address: 612B-3401 Dufferin Street Upper Level Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review: we visited during lunch time and it a great experience note they dont take reservations so groups of 4 may have to wait the menu was vast and we got to try a variety of different types the service was speedy and the staff were friendly the conveyer belt was a nice touch that brought your food out very quickly although pricier everything was of a high quality and standard some dishes i have never seen but would love to try i cant wait to go back and try their dinner menu overall it was a very unique sushi experience that everyone should try

Address: 612B-3401 Dufferin Street Upper Level Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review: i have been here three times and every time the service and food is excellent the sushi is always fresh and good quality the servers are friendly and makes the experience better for the good quality sushi the prices are reasonable i always recommend this place if people are looking for a cool dining experience with excellent food

Address: 612B-3401 Dufferin Street Upper Level Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review:
tora for all the sushi aficionados lovers of great quality fish and delightful artistry look no further tora has done a great job with their aburitorched and i do especially enjoy the sauce for their shrimp

the tuna was fatty and buttery with every bite

only negative the karaage was minuscule the small tiny quantity was disappointing especially paying premium prices

otherwise always a great dine

Address: 121 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1C4 Canada
Review:
we found this place while wandering around the streets of yorkville
next time we will be looking for it
we both had the winterlicious menu offerings everything was delicious the food was perfectly seasoned
they had a wonderful scotch whisky selection worth going just for that
this place brought us right back to our vacation in scotland and ireland
our server was wonderful but clearly the team there works together very well we felt well looked after
this was an amazing place and we will be back

Address: 121 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1C4 Canada
Review: we stopped in for a drink while walking around yorkville enjoying a winters evening a warm and inviting space that just looked like the perfect choice when walking by and we werent disappointed we chose the upstairs bar and dining room and got great seats the bar tender was extremely friendly and discussed our drink preferences as he educated us on spirits we had not tried yet after a lengthy discussion about gin he pointed out the two he felt i would enjoy the most and i ended really enjoying his first pick my spouse enjoyed a hard cider we werent hungry enough to eat but all of the food coming out for the tables looked very appetizing we will make sure to save room for our next visit and stop back

Address: 121 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1C4 Canada
Review: great cocktail its like provence summer in a glass thanks to the suggestion from our wonderful waitress

Address: 121 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1C4 Canada
Review:
food and ambience was great love the old london pub look really brings the uk vibe

food for the most part was delicious lots of traditional english dishes the oxtail was perfectly cooked and the pudding soft and flavourful my partner ordered the tenderloin medium rare and it came out raw we sent it back to the kitchen and it returned a minute later looking exactly the same see pic below we sent it back again with the manager this time to have it cooked properly

the main reason this restaurant receives a 15 is because of poor customer service our server was quite rude to our party of 8 when we asked about specials he curtly replied that he would prefer to wait to go over specials until the remaining two people show up so he doesnt have to repeat the specials twice sure makes sense but also is it that difficult to present the specials twice one person in our party asked for some salt and he replied that he was still going around with the pepper and would get to it after he could just say sure no problem it was just the tone and choice of words there was always some explanation that we found extremely patronizing not to mention he lectured my partner about how an old fashion drink is actually made when we just asked for a large ice cube and not small crushed ones im not sure if our server was just in a grumpy mood but it sure did rub off on our table and frankly that kind of patronizing attitude is just not acceptable at a restaurant in yorkville charging 100 a head

slightly disappointed because i was excited about trying this london style restaurant

Address: 121 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1C4 Canada
Review:
we came here for brunch and got the english breakfast and eggs benedict the food was okay and a bit pricey considering the eggs benny didnt come with any sides

the atmosphere and service were great though we were seated outside in the back which had a nice cozy feel and the service was excellent

Address: 4 Manor Road E Toronto, ON M4S 1P8 Canada
Review: we had such an incredible meal here delicious syrian food this is a must visit the ownersstaff were also super nice and welcoming and can make some suggestions for you from the menu pro tip get the knafeh volcano for dessert blew our minds best dessert ive had in a long long time

Address: 4 Manor Road E Toronto, ON M4S 1P8 Canada
Review:
i saw the ratings on google and decided to visit zezafoun it didnt disappoint at all from the moment we sat till we left we enjoyed every minute
the hosts are so kind and polite the food will leave you craving for more they have authentic and tasty dishes there was good music playing inside
they even good us a dessert as we were celebrating a birthday
thank you everyone at zezafoun we would visit again soon

Address: 4 Manor Road E Toronto, ON M4S 1P8 Canada
Review: one of my favourite restaurants in the area with lots of vegetarian options the waitstaff is very friendly and accommodating i havent had a chance to make a second visit but i hope to do that soon

Address: 4 Manor Road E Toronto, ON M4S 1P8 Canada
Review:
this famiily owned eatery that has positive vibes  friendly service and courteous hosts middle eastern cuisine that has a syrian touch food is fresh and flavors are unique albeit the taste is little bland as compared to other reataurants that offer similar food

tamarind based cocktails are unique mezze platter was fresh and tasty althoug a little expensive muhammara is a super hit molokia
tasted different but too sour the leafs speciality for our liking musaka
was average and so was the shawarma platter we liked the hariseh better than the hyped  volcano kunafeh

overall a good  casual  family dining option around the midtown to which may pinch your pocket a bit

Address: 4 Manor Road E Toronto, ON M4S 1P8 Canada
Review:
we tried kebbeh labanyeh beef kibbeh in a cooked garlic yogurt sauce served with side rice  kabab karaz beef kabab marinated in black cherries sauce topped with almonds and parsley served with bread side salad
the taste for both dishes was phenomenon  very different and flavorful portion of kebbeh labanyeh was small in my opinion with 4 pcs of meat balls
we also tried kunafeh volcano and its a must try its a kunafeh tart stuffed with homemade cream cheese qashta topped with ice cream and covered with ghazli syrian cotton candy and pistachio turkish coffee was also great
meal cold drink desert and warm drink would come down to nearly 4050per person
i recommend this restaurant for unique taste of meal and ambiance

Address: 647 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1L1 Canada
Review: waited for almost an hour worth the wait food is really yummy even the side dishes love the hot plate and cold noodles rice cake is just average will come back again to try more dishes

Address: 647 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1L1 Canada
Review:
recommendation
kimchi fried rice
Î∂ÄÎåÄÏ∞åÍ∞ú
seafood pancake
pork belly bossamsmelled so good and tasted not oily
stir fried spicy squidremember you can order the portion for one person if youd like
stir fried sweet potato noodles smelled       great like sesame oil in it
soft tofu stew with seafood rich and tasty the most delicious one ive ever had in toronto

everything was delicious and the price was also reasonable

Address: 647 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1L1 Canada
Review: good food ordered the cold noodles and the noodles were chewy and the soup was flavourful refreshing for a hot summer day side dishes were refilled by request seafood pancake was dense and crispy highly recommend the seollatang was also soothing and warm service was ok took a while and 34 of us to get their attention the majority of the time we came around 530 and there was no wait but by 6 a line started to form so come early

Address: 647 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1L1 Canada
Review: had dinner with some friends here and the food was amazing the seolleongtang was especially good and the seafood pancake was nice and crispy it gets pretty busy around dinnertime so try to come a bit before highly recommend if youre in the area

Address: 647 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1L1 Canada
Review: easily the best korean spot in the area smaller menu than others but all heavy hitters their cold noodles are amazing their bossam is amazing their fried chicken is amazing their black bean noodles is amazing the service is amazing they definitely get busy in the afternoon and evenings on the weekends usually there is no wait if you come between 2pm4pm their lone waitress is always super sweet and patient

Address: 66 Gerrard Street E Unit 100 Toronto, ON M5B 2M2 Canada
Review:
delicious food would go back i think the price is very good for what you get great meal

the server in my experience have a harder time describing the meal to me for example explaining between cheese katsu and potato cheese katsu but overall the other server or food runner was super nice and super hospitable

Address: 66 Gerrard Street E Unit 100 Toronto, ON M5B 2M2 Canada
Review: i really love this location the food is incredible for the price and its an awesome date spot if youre craving japanese food the crab croquettes are slept on they were so delicious and honestly the best i havent found many places that serve it the way katsuya does the karage chicken was great as well i really enjoy the light batter they use and the side sauces that come with it are all super unique and innovative

Address: 66 Gerrard Street E Unit 100 Toronto, ON M5B 2M2 Canada
Review: its been a while since ive went to katsuya it was delicious crisp light sauce was on point we were the first ones there for lunch everything was awesome def need to come back and have the other ones 100 better than other places the chicken was super light and tender and wooow juicy

Address: 66 Gerrard Street E Unit 100 Toronto, ON M5B 2M2 Canada
Review: delicious and filling got some appetizers cheese crabmeat croquette and the karaage chicken thighs good for sharing main dishes were the honeycomb katsu curry katsu and the japanese katsu for the choice of meat i chose the sweet potato cheese katsu which had pork loin with mozzarella and mashed sweet potato it was really good and very filling the katsu was very crispy i really enjoyed my meal here

Address: 66 Gerrard Street E Unit 100 Toronto, ON M5B 2M2 Canada
Review: a cozy place to enjoy warm food sounds perfectly ideal despite the weather outside we tried garlic chilli chicken katsu which was finger licking good and dont get me started on miso soup it was one of the best that i have ever had definitely a must visit if you are looking for exquisite japanese food and hospitality

Address: 2009 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review: we had a really good experience here  the food was amazing and everyone working there were attentive  we really enjoyed the baba ganoush and found ourselves coming back to it between bites of the other things we ordered  the grilled entrees had that smokey flavor for the grill that added to the flavors perfectly  theres a lot of shareable plates so if you have a group of friends that want to try out many different things consider coming to tabule

Address: 2009 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review:
we have dined  here many times and nice to see the same quality and service maintained over the years restaurant has even better vibes post the renovation few years ago

authentic middle eastern food and taste and quality have been same fo years warak enab arnabeets sample platter and the tabule salad all taste good although the pita  and arnabeets have changed a bit

simplistic menu and reasonable prices  a couple items are slightly overpriced   staff is courteous and attentive  good dining option in mid town to wherabouts

Address: 2009 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review:
went here for lunch with a friend because we were in the mood to try a new cuisine they are a lebanese based restaurant so we were pretty excited when you walk in the interior is very clean modern and bright
to our surprise they were offering winterlicious although their restaurant wasnt on the winterlicious list of restaurants regardless this nice surprise elevated our experience i ordered lebanese coffee as the server explained it is very similar to turkish coffee which im a fan of its definitely lighter than turkish coffee with strong cardamom hints
we ordered the mezza sampler hummus baba ghanouj tabul√© and falafel and halloumi salad for starters the portions were generous i mean we were full from just the appetizers
for mains we ordered a kefta burger and salmon kebab the kefta burger was bursting with flavour and the grilled salmon wasnt over cooked yay lastly for dessert we ordered rice pudding and knaffa ashta i personally loved the knaffa ashta the custard was so creamy and flavourful but not too heavy
all in all we had a great experience and would love to return

Address: 2009 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review:
amazing place to be in for middle eastern cuisine babaganoush is a must have here
food is well cooked falafel was not dry and had a unique taste to it

Address: 2009 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review: been to tabule numerous times and as usual enjoyed my visit had their hummus with meat chicken liver and kefta bandura which are my fav goto dishes i must say the hummus and chicken liver were on the drier side compared to before but i still love their food the interiors are really gorgeous now with decent amount of seating great service as per usual with good priced portionsdishes i also love their mint limeade thanks

Address: 72 Kensington Avenue Toronto, ON M5T 2K1 Canada
Review:
the tacos  were mouthwateringly delicious  however beware of the hot salsa it is burning spicy

the staff were friendly and helpful as well

definitely would like to recommend

Address: 72 Kensington Avenue Toronto, ON M5T 2K1 Canada
Review:
possibly the best taco ive ever had

i ordered only one blackened cod taco because i was not that hungry it was pretty big i would only need two for a meal the corn tortilla tasted very strongly of corn and each of the toppings added freshness to the fish the fish itself was freshly fried to perfection

there are a few standing tables for guests to dine at and a self serve salsa station

highly recommend this spot it definitely lives up to the hype

Address: 72 Kensington Avenue Toronto, ON M5T 2K1 Canada
Review:
you want a good taco come here  they dont have chairs but you dont need one since the food is so good that by the time you set youve already devoured it 
the fish taco is my favourite but they also offer amazing ceviche and smoked meats and i loved their cactus juice  from crispy shrimp to swordfish or blackened fish you wont be disappointed at seven lives

Address: 72 Kensington Avenue Toronto, ON M5T 2K1 Canada
Review:
great tacos we tried the carnitas baja fish and the shrimp and queso it was all delicious but i wish the shrimp was grilled or fried for some crunch

side note not sure why their salsa is placed right above their garbage can

Address: 72 Kensington Avenue Toronto, ON M5T 2K1 Canada
Review:
always revisiting this tacos joint its a must visit for me whenever i come back to toronto freshly made  absolutely delicious each bite sends exciting bursts of flavors in your mouth

wish there were seatings so i can eat more comfortably while ordering more try to come before the lunch crowd surges

Address: 794 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B6 Canada
Review:
the food and service at nodo is always top notch every time i visit we are always treated so well by the staff the hostess as well as the managers that come by to check on us
the food is always tasty and the menu has so much variety to choose from we usually get a bunch of plates to share which allows us to taste a  bit of everything my favorite dish is the old school gnocchi which ive had at least 15 times and it always tastes like the first time i discovered it chefs kiss

Address: 794 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B6 Canada
Review: i live in this neighbourhood for about 4 years and finally got the chance to try nodo which was on my list for a quite while i found antipasto options so satisfying especially enjoyed octopus dish which was accompanied by baby potatoes kalamata olives and capers the crispy texture of the potato skins was a highlight the dressing of oyster mushroom  arugula salad was so delicious i ordered the classic spaghetti with meatballs while i prefer my pasta al dente i felt that it could have used an additional 30 seconds of cooking time i liked the gnocci more despite creamy sauces typically being a tad heavy for my taste the stuff was friendly the interior had interesting details like the plates the mirrored wall and the ceiling light  and our night was pleasant

Address: 794 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B6 Canada
Review: honestly was pretty disappointed service was mediocre and the food was not amazing i got the gnocchi as it was a recommendation from our server this dish was way too salty and lacked any good flavour we also ordered a pizza  the oltraggioso it lacked overall taste

Address: 794 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B6 Canada
Review:
excellent restaurant nestled in the heart of the community their food is incredibly deliciouswe ordered the pulpetti the sausage and rapini pasta and the ossobucco  each plate was well made bringing that old country italian flavour to the heart of stclair west portions are well sized

the location would also be great for small parties and events

only reco for this place they need more beer options on their menu however i appreciated that each beer glass was chilled

Address: 794 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B6 Canada
Review: love this place honestly  we went here for a private party and the food was amazing  service was wonderful and the atmosphere is very nice i highly recommend to check this restaurant for a delicious meal

Address: 101 Portland Street Toronto, ON M5V 2N3 Canada
Review:
always been a fan of their mushroom pasta but havent been here in awhile the portion definitely got smaller and the sauce is not as rich as its used to our pasta came a bit cold so it was not as enjoyable also barely any cheese

tried their calamari for the first time it was good but nothing special all in all a bit disappointed with this visit hopefully they can be more consistent next time

Address: 101 Portland Street Toronto, ON M5V 2N3 Canada
Review: an airy industrial space that offers quality italian dishes for all types of pallets the service is very professional and upbeat we went for brunch and had two dishes and drinks both were large portions and fresh the eggs were freerange and you can taste the richness of it the pizza dough was not chewy but had a nice texture  the seats at the smaller tables were not comfortable though the bench on the side looked more comfy the kitchen is open it is noisy but you can see which dishes you want to order and it was tough they all look good

Address: 101 Portland Street Toronto, ON M5V 2N3 Canada
Review: got the recommended mushroom pasta and it was as good as everyone said it was pasta was cooked perfectly and the mushroom flavour was tasty and not too overpowering would come here again

Address: 101 Portland Street Toronto, ON M5V 2N3 Canada
Review:
the high ratings are well deserved we ordered the popular items mushroom truffle pasta mushroom pizza and tiramisu pasta was creamy delicious n best of the bunch

nice italian joint with cool decor and lively vibe highly recommend

Address: 101 Portland Street Toronto, ON M5V 2N3 Canada
Review:
sydney made the whole experience and birthday celebrations feel our of this world

she gave the best reviews of food insider tips and tricks

everyone here enjoyed our meal and we will be back tomorrow thank you sydney

Address: 11 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5V 3M2 Canada
Review:
thank you for making my birthday celebration such a memorable experience 
it was such an amazing birthday celebration at byblos downtown
i can rate this restaurant as one of the top 5 restaurants in toronto and gta
everything they have was simply amazing the staff the food and the overall atmosphere
the staff are very welcoming and so nice we almost felt we have our own waiter as she taking good care of us 
for the food we truly enjoyed every bite of all the dishes we had both starters and mains i can confidently say that their lamb shoulder dish is one of the best and delicious dishes i had in my life
we loved the atmosphere of the place with the details of the interior design and furniture

Address: 11 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5V 3M2 Canada
Review: the food was fantastic we tried many dishes to share and especially enjoyed the turkish manti dumplings lentil pide labneh and sweet jeweled rice all so carefully prepared with sophisticated flavor combinations and sauces nice decor upstairs although the booth seating is getting quite worn in spots definitely a treat for the pallet

Address: 11 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5V 3M2 Canada
Review: excellent service delicious food and great vibes special shoutout to alexandra  she was fantastic and detail oriented when it comes to explaining the dishes they also have amazing handcrafted cocktails and a decent wine collection i highly recommend this place no walkins we were so full that we didnt have apetitie for desserts but i was told their baklavas are really good

Address: 11 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5V 3M2 Canada
Review: we had such an amazing experience we were lucky to be served and helped by tyler the bar managerour server he was so helpful and kind and attentive it really impressed us we thoroughly enjoyed the experience not only because the food lookedtasted great but tyler also contributed to a majority of our experience he managed the bar our table as well as 2 other tables and he managed to remember our order dietary restrictions and was even considerate enough to tell us that the short rib was cooked in red wine but hell make sure ours isnt due to us having dietary restrictions alcohol free halal meat overall great experience cant wait to come back here to celebrate more occasions

Address: 11 Duncan Street Toronto, ON M5V 3M2 Canada
Review: such a lovely evening we sat at the bar and got to meet tyler the bar manager and our server he was so kind and just amazing we loved the food the lamb shoulder was succulent and just fell apart the baklava was definitely shareable and as delicious as it was beautiful it was on the pricey side but well worth it as a special evening out

Address: 2183 Danforth Ave Toronto, ON M4C 1K4 Canada
Review:
we went there for lunch the food was delicious we got a huge portion for two with a bit of everything we like it the service is not bad they really worry if you are enjoying
we arrived a bit early so left we could see that they were preparing for a live music just the atmosphere that need a bit effort to be more inviting

Address: 2183 Danforth Ave Toronto, ON M4C 1K4 Canada
Review:
we came to danforth to run some errands and came across this budapest restaurant with great google reviews so we decided to give it a try

its tuesday lunch time around noon the place was filled with 45 tables of customers

we grabbed a seat at one of the tables and ordered 2 schnitzels and a beer

the schnitzels were really good fried just right  crisp and tasty not dry at all it tasted so authentic according to my friend from europe

i think thats what makes toronto amazing  the fact that we can always find good authentic food in different parts of toronto

gave it 4stars due to the rather cold service we felt that the servers didnt bother to make us feel welcomed it was very transactional without much engagement  sit down order taken heres your food pay or maybe i shouldnt expect too much

Address: 2183 Danforth Ave Toronto, ON M4C 1K4 Canada
Review: as an hungarianamerican who now lives in toronto i can honestly say its a blessing that if im craving hungarian foods i can actually go somewhere to get it rather than cook it myself sometimes you know we just dont want to cook after a long day  the food here is authentic delicious and comes in huge portions if thats your thing  the service is always friendly and im assuming that if one goes and doesnt really know hungarian food theyd be knowledgeable as well to walk you through the menu  go there and make sure to get the langos

Address: 2183 Danforth Ave Toronto, ON M4C 1K4 Canada
Review:
there are many things to like about the place the food the theming and the service

we wanted to sample many dishes that are close to authentic as possible so we ended up ordering the budapestplatter 4495 for two in the platter you get 2 sides a porkchop 2 slices of debreceni sausages 2 types of schnitzel and a cabbage roll there was a good variety of food present in the platter as well as very generous portions it was listed as good for 2 people but i believe it can be spread out to even accommodate 3 people

there was a good amount of thought put into the interiors theming laminated pictures of sights and attractions of budapest hungary were present at the table to give a good perspective and insight into hungarian culture

lastly i have no complaints and have only praises to the service we received while dining here we were attended to dutifully and we had the best of time dining

Address: 2183 Danforth Ave Toronto, ON M4C 1K4 Canada
Review: me and my wife dine in here last month and all we can say is excellent service and delicious european food my wife is polish and its not easy to get a real eastern european food there are many food chain in toronto but not everyone is so good we will definitely visit this place again

Address: 337 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1N7 Canada
Review: came here for summerlicious with my family young kids its quaint quiet and cozy the staff there are super friendly and the food is delicious theres some outdoor seating and its kid friendly

Address: 337 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1N7 Canada
Review: i have often passed by papyrus and made a note to try it the idea of egyptian food on the danforth was so intriguing i didnt know what to expect with a mostly vegan and vegetarian menu i had to really coax my partner to give it a go of course we had to order the two meat dishes on the menu namely the beef hawawshi and the chicken hawawshi both were very good and nicely spiced wanting to try more we alo ordered the full and tameya platter that came with lentil hummus and salads baladi and bread the tameya were so good we ended up ordering a side dish of 3 more and the owner who helped to serve us and who was so kind and took time to explain everything and reccomend what order to try things etc also brought us a small bowl of koshari to try egypts national dish wow what amazing flavour the layers of rice lentils pasta tomato sauce with chickpeas and caramelized onions spiced to perfection made this a stand out dish for certain we already agreed at the outset to try dessert so we needed to pace ourselves and brought some of the hawawshi home so we split a bird nest konafa and it was simply remarkable light vermicelli pastry filled with pistachios  and exceptionally good quality ones at that with a hint of coconut we had to admit next time we are each getting our own it was that good not too sweet just ever so flavorful like everything we had the textures and layers of flavour made this a truly wonderful meal experience and my carnivore companion had to admit how much he loved the vegan and vegetarian cuisine we also had 3 glasses of wine there is no doubt at all that we will be back and if you are vegan or vegetarian this is a must try restaurant in toronto for you be warned however that it is small seats about 20 or so so make a reservation

Address: 337 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1N7 Canada
Review:
wow  papyrus is such a hidden gem the service was phenomenal  he kindly explained the different menu options to us and recommended the perfect options for us to try the most while also being the right amount of food

the food was absolutely delicious and we devoured it all i personally havent had egyptian before but will be back here in a heartbeat for a lunch for 4 of us it was only about 60 such great value

Address: 337 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1N7 Canada
Review: everything tastes delicious the owner is amazing friendly yet professional koshari tastes better than back home i   papyrus

Address: 337 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1N7 Canada
Review: small place with a nice ambiance the koshari poutine and ful platter were both really good drinks were okay and service was a little slow but still a good experience

Address: 267 Scarlett Road Toronto, ON M6N 4L1 Canada
Review: first time here as we were looking for a good seafood place we called to make a reservation  good we did as seating is limited and it was very busy immediately the service was friendly and welcoming the server did an amazing job explaining the specials of the day for appetizers we got the cajun muscles and lobstershrimp bisque  both were absolutely delicious and savoury for mains we got the fresh fish of the day and the shrimp creole the sea bass was so well made and honestly the best tasting fish we ever tried the portions arent huge but with an appetizer youre very likely to get full the owner or manager was present and he was so kind and attentive we would definitely come back for some amazing seafood and ill be recommending this to my friends and family

Address: 267 Scarlett Road Toronto, ON M6N 4L1 Canada
Review: exceptionally good food and amazing service the food tastes so awesome that you can overlook the small size of the place the superb service that is managed by mike is by far the best you can get anywhere in toronto and he does it in a really phenomenal manner that you feel at ease and enjoy the experience of authenticity of the flavours that this nice restaurant has to offer would strongly recommend for a fine dining experience and great place to explore seafood at its best

Address: 267 Scarlett Road Toronto, ON M6N 4L1 Canada
Review: i chose this restaurant to celebrate my birthday and i cant wait to go back there i love the old charm decor of the restaurant its very warm and inviting i love the smell that fills the restaurant its a smell of delicious high quality seafood that just makes my mouth water the food is delicious the service is impeccable everyone was so friendly and personable and they took very good care of me i received a special treat for my birthday from them and i felt so special perfect medium rare steak lots of interesting spices used the roasted asparagus were a favourite of mine cajun shrimp was juicy and full of flavour i cant wait to go back here im getting hungry just writing this

Address: 267 Scarlett Road Toronto, ON M6N 4L1 Canada
Review: you will absolutely love this place theres a reason why theyre so busy food is delicious and service is top notch the owner comes around the tables often ensuring that youre happy with everything so attentive did i mention how fabulous the food is highly recommend this great restaurant

Address: 267 Scarlett Road Toronto, ON M6N 4L1 Canada
Review:
a fine dining experience that delivers amazing cajun flavours in an unexpected location

ive lived in the area most of my life and have always felt the area was lacking when it came to restaurant options even in regards to take out i probably have driven past new orleans seafood  steakhouse hundreds of times coming home and never noticed it until i saw it pop up on google maps when looking for cajun restaurants in toronto boy am i happy it did because this has become easily the best restaurant in the area when factoring everything

first the location and service the location is a lacking point as the restaurant itself is very small and probably fits less than 30 people max although its size it doesnt get too loud in the restaurant and the interior design is very formal and  has a hint of new orleans culture as for service the family running this restaurant are incredibly kind and welcoming the person i presume to be the owner was around making jokes with patrons and checking in on all of us ensuring our glasses are full and all requests are answered

now onto the food man does this place hit the spot ive wanted to try cajun food for years but never thought a place like this would be so close to home we started our meal with the crab cakes that do come in a serving of two

without asking we were presented our crab cakes on separate plates perfectly plated for myself and my date fried to perfection tender inside but not mushy accompanied by a bouquet of fresh veggies this was a great start to the meal alongside the complimentary bread

onto our main dish there were a couple options on the menu i wanted to try but i felt jambalaya had to be my first deep dive into cajun food this dish although being priced highly is a hefty portion and easily feeds 23 people the rice the sausages the various seafood all of it was just amazing and fulfilled all my expectations and maybe even exceeded them

this restaurant has become the best fine dining restaurant in the area to me and will now become my go to spot for going out to celebrate special occasions

Address: 563 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6 Canada
Review:
ive tried this location for dinner and for brunch both experiences were very good their cocktails are also nice the burgers were very good the brunch is priced higher than t
average but the portions are gigantic the steak and eggs is a fantastic deal and the steak is delicious i wasnt a huge fan of their sweet options but overall everyone was happy with their order

Address: 563 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6 Canada
Review:
we went here for sunday breakfast and it was a pleasure food was really good my eggs benedict were perfectly cooked soft inside

the lemon french toast i think was a bit too lemony would love for the chef to try an orange french toast

the chocolate cake was too for for it was very rich and just melted in the mouth

Address: 563 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6 Canada
Review: heaven on the earth has been my absolutely favorite french toast tasted so flavorful with cream cheese and berries steak and eggs was also amazing since the steak was juicy and fatty fantastic option for meat lovers great portion of brunch as always however it would have been better if there are some seasonal specials for brunch as well looking forward to seeing new dishes on the menu

Address: 563 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6 Canada
Review:
i recently visited the insomnia lounge in toronto and had a mixed experience while the staff was generally friendly and attentive i did have an unpleasant interaction with a server who assumed we would prefer a cheaper vodka option however they were quick to correct their mistake and provided us with the premium vodka we desired

the food at insomnia lounge was enjoyable but the wait time for our dishes left something to be desired it would have been nice to see the kitchen keep up with the bustling atmosphere of the lounge

one of the standout features of the establishment was the lighting which was truly exceptional and added a unique touch to the ambiance however the decor in the back of the restaurant could use some updating particularly the odd red sofa chairs that seemed out of place with the overall aesthetic

despite some positives the negatives of my experience at insomnia lounge have led me to the decision not to return while the staff was mostly pleasant and the lighting was a highlight the presumptuous server and lengthy wait times for food detracted from the overall experience additionally the decor in certain areas could benefit from an upgrade to better align with the vibe of the rest of the lounge

in conclusion insomnia lounge in toronto has potential but fell short in some key areas during my visit if youre considering a night out at this establishment be prepared for both hits and misses

Address: 563 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6 Canada
Review:
1010 in every aspect

beautiful decor
great food
great service
everyone at the table loved their food lots of vegan and kosher options as well fun and creative drinks as well
highly recommend for a work brunch taking your parents out for breakfast or a cute date
best waffle i have had in my entire life
slightly pricey

Address: 535 Mt. Pleasant Road. Toronto, ON M4S 2M5 Canada
Review:
great food options and they have their specials i got the burger but my friends got the pasta which they all found amazing

we also ordered the sweet potato fries as an appetizer and it was perfect great cuts and sauce

Address: 535 Mt. Pleasant Road. Toronto, ON M4S 2M5 Canada
Review:
it was our first time dining here and we all liked this cozy place so much  their decoration in the restaurant was cute especially since they light up a lot of small bulbs which makes the whole space look cozy

we ordered a chicken and coleslaw sandwich and a steak salad i enjoyed the steak salad very much and it was very delicious and unique  my partner also really liked his sandwich and the fries were delicious too

our server was also excellent she answered our questions about the meal and was very knowledgeable about everything  they served fast and were super friendly i appreciated them
we will be back very soon for sure

Address: 535 Mt. Pleasant Road. Toronto, ON M4S 2M5 Canada
Review:
cozy comfort restaurant fun with family and friends

veggie curry was good had a nice kick in spice and packed with a wide mix of veggies

Address: 535 Mt. Pleasant Road. Toronto, ON M4S 2M5 Canada
Review: this is my favourite neighborhood restaurant i often go there for breakfast lunch and dinner not all in same day  love the cobb salad steak salad fries eggs benedict and fish n chips the fish specials on the chalk board are often very good as well

Address: 535 Mt. Pleasant Road. Toronto, ON M4S 2M5 Canada
Review:
nice ambience friendly service the food was good too

i ordered the chicken pot pie which was yummy though a little small it comes either with the garden or caesar salad and i had the latter which was good my hubby had the burger also kinda small but it was tasty as well the portion of fries was quite large the sticky toffee pudding was amazing

Address: 858 Eglinton Avenue E Toronto, ON M4G 2B6 Canada
Review: these guys are good not cheap on pepperoni either when you order on uber they deliver with their own inhouse professionals that keep the pie nice and hot unlike uber drivers that dgaf and dont have big enough sacks for pizza anyhow

Address: 858 Eglinton Avenue E Toronto, ON M4G 2B6 Canada
Review: ive ordered and picked up pizza from here picking it up is a better option because it somehow tastes better they make a great pizza the crust towards the edges is perfectly crispy its a thin crust which is what i prefer and i didnt need to ask for it to be well done they load the toppings on you never feel like you didnt get enough you can taste the quality in the meats and the freshness in the veggies its decently a place you need to try keep in mind that if you go to pick it up its inside a unit with 3 other businesses

Address: 858 Eglinton Avenue E Toronto, ON M4G 2B6 Canada
Review: really enjoyed this pizza we had two different ones the white sauce cowspiracy pizza was our favourite of the two but the canadian was also very good  having the different sauces and cheeses from a typical pizza really added something to the flavours  we split the two 10 pizzas between us with some left over the toppings are so hearty they are very filling

Address: 858 Eglinton Avenue E Toronto, ON M4G 2B6 Canada
Review:
while waiting for our ice cream in the same location we couldnt help but order a pizza to go everything smelled amazing and it seemed rather busy always a good sign

menu is fun as far as names go and i appreciate a brand who puts some creative twists into things

we were not disappointed 2 small pizzas to go one was gluten free and im told was amazing crust was fresh fluffy ingredients taste fresh  pricing is great for made to order different types of pizzas

definitely worth going to try it out

Address: 858 Eglinton Avenue E Toronto, ON M4G 2B6 Canada
Review: i love their new menu because they added more nonpork options the personal size is exactly what we needed and pizza was delicious

Address: 2388 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J5 Canada
Review: from start to finish our visit was topnotch our table wasnt ready in time but the hosts were appreciative of our patience and we were fine to wait the culinary experience was delightful to the taste buds as well as appealing to our eyes what really made the night exceptional was our awesome server melina who was genuine outgoing and made several great recommendations geared to our preferences  she rocks will definitely return and bring friends

Address: 2388 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J5 Canada
Review:
we were at stock bar this past sunday and truly we have nothing but good things to say we arrived at our reservation time and were seated immediately no waiting around  which is nice as sometimes even when you have a reservation you still have to wait for your table so we had very little interaction with the hostess but she was pleasant enough we were a bit nervous as we had read some of the reviews that the service was lacking so we had braced ourselves for a subpar experience and we were just hoping the food would outshine any negative experiences however this was not our experience at all we had exceptional service from our server jessica if the management team at stock read these reviews jessica was amazing she was attentive quick and very friendly it was just my husband and i and we were seated between 2 parties of 6 people that she was also waiting on and she was extremely on the ball reviews and ratings are obviously subjective to your own experiences and i think restaurants should aim to have some level of consistency amongst their staff so i do hope there are more servers like jessica at stock because she really did make the experience enjoyable

as for the food we order the
 shrimp and lobster roll 45 the bread was perfectly soft and toasted the lobster tasted fresh
 pancakes 55 the pancakes were the highlight for me they were so soft and fluffy and served warmed  they were great
 stock burger 455 the meat was unreal  one of the best burgers at a restaurant we ever had knock 5 because it doesnt come with a side
 truffle fries 45 they were standard fries really tasty with the truffle and parmesan on top and the highlight was the truffle mayo i did find them a bit expense at 22
 brownie 55 soft and warm inside not to sweet which was perfect with the sweet ice cream

Address: 2388 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J5 Canada
Review:
i heard good things about this place online and we decided to try it out we ordered the albacore tuna tartare romaine salad cavatelli pasta truffle fries and ribeye to share amongst the three of us

nothing to be impressed by all the dishes were fine but definitely did not justify their prices

Address: 2388 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J5 Canada
Review:
our friends invited us here for a brunch and after checking the reviews i was skeptical about this place but honestly i dont know why people wrote such bad comments

we booked a table on a rooftop patio but unfortunately it was raining so they relocated us inside which wasnt as cute but its okay

the food was good  everyone was satisfied with their choice thanks to your server who helped us to decide what we wanted as well

we had 5 dishes  2 beers and 2 cocktails which costed us around 200 plus tips which is not bad  yes it isnt cheap but we knew what to expect

Address: 2388 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J5 Canada
Review:
restaurant and atmosphere is beautiful but the dishes are nothing spectacular

the pizza was very underwhelming the cheese was not melted and very rubbery almost like cheese curds although  it was thin and had no structure i couldnt cut through with knife due to dryness

the seared steak tartare was decent but the bread was very hard

the seafood pasta taste was good a tad on the salty side and some of the pasta was dried the amount of seafood was too little for the price

cocktail was quite strong but taste was not to our liking also it is very expensive for a cocktail at 18

we waited a very long time for order to be taken as well as getting bill the food also took very long to arrive the mains arrived almost an hour after we sat down the service was very basic and not too friendly overall

Address: 709 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2N4 Canada
Review:
dont come if youre looking to take your time eating they seemed in a rush to get us out we were just coming in for quick bite my first time here great food younger lady was super sweet and very attentive older lady was also nice but typical asian mom attitude eat enjoy get out 

overall excellent food

cutely decorated space
the food was delicious

Address: 709 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2N4 Canada
