Review: i was looking for something different and i never really had thai food before except for some fast food place and this was exactly what i was looking for small quaint little place where the staff are friendly and personable the combination of curry and if i remember correctly coconut milk was a great sensation for the taste buds it was so good that i had to go back and it was just as good the second time i am going to keep going back until ive tried everything on the menu at least once

Address: 709 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2N4 Canada
Review: their food is so good also the presentation makes it look more fancy nice portion with acceptable price friendly service

Address: 709 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2N4 Canada
Review: the best thai in toronto weve been going there for years and its consistently amazing the ambiance and decor are nice and cozy the service is super friendly and prompt and the food is so good fresh ingredients super flavourful we had the spring rolls the pad thai and the pad sew ew all of which were so good we also order takeout and the portions are generous

Address: 709 Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2N4 Canada
Review:
tasted very authentic the flavours may be too strong for some but thats what nonwatered down thai food is

service was good and price was reasonable id go back

Address: 21 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review:
my partner and i had the pleasure of dining at this restaurant for the first time and overall it was a pleasant experience with a few highlights and some room for improvement the restaurant boasted a delightful atmosphere creating a cozy and inviting ambiance for a relaxed evening

the service was commendable  the servers were exceptionally friendly and attentive throughout our meal adding a positive touch to the overall dining experience

we decided to try their popular chicken tenders and fish and chips while the chicken tenders seemed to be a crowdfavorite we were slightly disappointed by the dryness of the chicken though they provided some sauce on the side the tenders inherent dryness made it a bit difficult to enjoy fully however on the flip side the fish and chips truly stood out the portion size was more than generous offering two servings of deliciously crispy fried fish the fish itself was cooked to perfection  crunchy on the outside while the flesh remained tender and flavorful on the inside the accompanying portion of chips was excellent adding a delightful touch to the overall dish

one noteworthy aspect of this restaurant is their enticing happy hour deal available from 3 pm to 5 pm and 8 pm until closing time regrettably we visited during dinner hours and consequently we missed out on these attractive deals nevertheless the ample portion sizes of the meals made up for it leaving us feeling satisfied and content with the value we received

all in all the dining experience was positive with the standout being the delectable fish and chips although the chicken tenders were a bit disappointing the restaurants overall performance and inviting ambiance left a good impression

Address: 21 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review:
my boyfriend and i went for the summerlicious menu and overall it was pretty yummy we made a lunch reservation for 12 pm on the dot we both started with the parmesan truffle fries which were very good and a decently big portion the only complaint is that they didnt use real parmesan

for our mains i got the ace high club and he got the tofu tacos with salad the sandwich comes with a side of fries but i chose to do a caesar salad instead the sandwich and salad were pretty good the market salad that came with the tacos was a little too sweet and the tacos werent as flavourful as he wouldve liked he is a sauce monster

we chose the seasonal creme brulee which we were told was just vanilla flavoured and not really seasonal unless vanilla is a summer seasonal flavour which he really enjoyed and the apple pie jar pretty standard desserts not gonna lie i was kinda full at this point and didnt eat much of it

our waiter was a very nice and chill dude who provided great service and we got to choose our own seats as it wasnt really busy at the time paid around 6070 all together after tax and tip so around 3040 per person

Address: 21 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review: we went for the summerlicous menu and very much disappointed i ordered the house braised sirloin firecrackers to die for  tofu taco with salad my girlfriend ordered the parmesan truffle fries and chicken taco with salad we ordered our dessert ahead of time and there seemed to be no problem once we were ready for our dessert we were told they ran out and they only had 2 left for the day the gm came and she was very defensive as we addressed our concern she promised a discount but when we got our bill no discount was given we even asked the waitress to pack our left overs but she forgot to bring us doggy bags we paid our bill with bad taste in our mouth this location is definitely thumbs down

Address: 21 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review:
union social eatery is a great spot for a work lunch with its nice location and laidback atmosphere however if youre planning on dining here its best to arrive at noon or before as it can get quite busy quickly despite the crowds the service at union social eatery is great and you dont need a reservation to be seated promptly

during my visit my server got my wing order wrong and unfortunately i didnt have enough time to return or cancel before lunch ended this was disappointing but it didnt ruin the overall experience

if youre looking for a spot to catch up with colleagues or friends over drinks union social eatery is definitely worth considering while the food didnt exceed expectations the drinks are wellcrafted and the overall atmosphere is quite inviting

in summary union social eatery is a decent option for a work lunch or drinks with friends while the service is great its important to arrive early to avoid the crowds and while the food may not be the main draw the drinks are worth checking out i would consider returning but perhaps for a more casual and relaxed outing

Address: 21 Saint Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M4V 1K6 Canada
Review:
tried out with a friend for summerlicious the app was delicious crispy brussel sprouts with bacon and a generous serving it almost filled me and ok to share for main we tried was butternut squash ravioli which was cheesy but a bit on the oily side they were out of creme br√ªl√©e so we had key lime which was fine standard stuff not too much coconut
service was hospitable
i did not care for the atmosphere since it was incredibly loudechoing and the table was wide so we felt far from each other giant tv with sports over big bar its a kinda industrial feel and there is a garage door which was open to the sidewalk patio very humid when we were there so that didnt help youre beside parked cars there
you go through 2 doors to enter and accessible but bathrooms downstairs
lots if regular pub type stuff and gluten free offerings and vegetarian friendly

Address: 2365 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J6 Canada
Review: i love this place the food is always delicious and the service is good it is not always very fast when they are busy so be prepared to wait a bit 10 mins this place is affordable i got 4 baos for only 2200 this is incredibly cheap the bao is big enough and one can fill me up for a meal

Address: 2365 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J6 Canada
Review: their food is amazing the squid taco is perfect its just 5 per one and its so worth it the staff is always friendly and welcoming

Address: 2365 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J6 Canada
Review: we tried the five spice pork banh mi and fried chicken braised beef five spice pork belly baos we love the banh mi and the fried chicken bao and the pork belly bao was really good too

Address: 2365 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J6 Canada
Review: chicken sandwich in this locations was very tasty i also loved sweet potato fries order didnt take too long to be ready and the staff was nice

Address: 2365 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 3J6 Canada
Review: went for a quick lunch with a friend ordered the chicken taco pork belly banh mi and sweet potato fries delicious best to eat in store to avoid eating soggy tacosbanh mi very good value for money service was fast and friendly

Address: 55 Bloor Street W Manulife Centre Toronto, ON M4W 1A6 Canada
Review: nice place amazing atmosphere exquisite delectable food if youre planning on going here make sure you bring a lot of money with you the only drawback is everything is really expensive aside from that this place is certainly an experience with numerous markets and restaurants if there is a special occasion i would definitely consider coming here although i would avoid busy hours because this place gets crowded at times

Address: 55 Bloor Street W Manulife Centre Toronto, ON M4W 1A6 Canada
Review: bustling place for anything italian from breads to pastries to gelato to pizzas pasta and restaurants overpriced grocery items but surprisingly the hand or machine made pastas are worth it since they are made right there and then so cant go wrong amazing atmosphere if you want to go with a much smaller group as there is so much to discover and explore

Address: 55 Bloor Street W Manulife Centre Toronto, ON M4W 1A6 Canada
Review:
this tiramisus is amazing  creamy and there isnt too much sugar added tasted like a mixture of cheese and egg white
dont by that small lasagna the noodle is a bit dry and hard to chew but the meat sauce is tasty

Address: 55 Bloor Street W Manulife Centre Toronto, ON M4W 1A6 Canada
Review:
we had a great time over the weekend strolling through the mall this is a fun filled day where everything is fresh and great tasting for all there are so many different areas as you walk though and experience unique foods like you were in italy vibe great customer service and everyone seemed happy to be there

we seated ourselves for a bite to eat and ordered some delicious italian cuisine the service was on point and we enjoyed the experience overall cant wait to check it out again

Address: 55 Bloor Street W Manulife Centre Toronto, ON M4W 1A6 Canada
Review: the marketplace and specialty store are very cool you can find a great variety of special italian food items the restaurant was average and a little underwhelming for the price the lasagna was good the burrata pizza sauce was a little water and soggy but tasted good the best part was the rossa foccacia  its a good spot for small bites and getting some specialty groceries but probably not worth the price for the restaurant

Address: 2031 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z9 Canada
Review:
fun creative dishes designed to be shared with friends over drinks between the 2 of us we ordered 5 dishes and it was the perfect amount i enjoyed everything but didnt have any standout favourites

service was excellent  our server recommended cocktails and the food came out staggered at a comfortable pace we actually stayed there chatting well after our meal was finished and nobody made us feel rushed it was a quiet night but still appreciated

i would definitely come back to try more from their menu

Address: 2031 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z9 Canada
Review: phenomenal tasting food and service other reviews say portions are a bit small for the price but we split the shrimp curry nasi goreng and 6 skewers between two people and it was the perfect amount of food for 35 each the seasoning and spices in the dishes are very well done and make the food taste amazing its well worth the price

Address: 2031 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z9 Canada
Review: ive been wanting to try little sister and finally got the opportunity to go with my sister great atmosphere with exceptional service bartender was constantly crafting amazing drinks and the main server was delivering terrific service and super friendly the food is a bit on the pricier side but definitely worth it lots of great sharing plates and options i personally had the sangria and little brother cocktail both 1010 i cant wait to return to try some more

Address: 2031 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z9 Canada
Review: food is very plain everything tasted like it was very minimally seasoned nothing was outright bad but lacked flavour the lamb satay was probably the least flavoured dish we ordered portions are also extremely tiny all the skewers we got were 1 bite maybe 2 max and id say thatd be smaller bites the drinks were 1719 for like a vodka martini which is insanely priced service was decent its a pretty small place and kind of cramped very dark inside so hard to see overall it was a very ok experience but not somewhere id ever go back to

Address: 2031 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z9 Canada
Review: the entire experience was excellent  the service food and ambience the war fries were crispy and flavourful the chicken satay with peanut sauce was perfect and the shrimp curry was rich and tasty would definitely go there again

Address: 643A Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review: best japanese food ive ever hard all 9 dishes were out of this world it was such an amazing experience watching the chef make all the dishes and his attention to detail the service was 1010 i cant wait to come back

Address: 643A Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review: i wholly enjoyed the experience  every dish and every flavour you gotta appreciate the ingredients and skill that the chef and his team put into a service its not everyday that you get to taste the sea on a plate everything was so fresh beautiful and well blended together would totally recommend if you want to experience and taste something different

Address: 643A Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review:
my wife and i had an amazing time at yukashi which recently hit my food radar after getting its michelin star last year weve been to a bunch of top restaurants in toronto and yukashi really stands out each dish in the tasting menu was beautiful creative fresh and most importantly delicious the pictures really dont do the food justice my wife is pescatarian was they were able to accommodate by creating a great substitute for the wagyu and a couple other meat items

we didnt have much experience with sake and decided to add the sake pairing for the full experience it was a great addition and we loved how each sake complimented the paired food watching each dish prepared in front of us was an amazing experience with great attention to detail from chef izutsu and his team i really cant say enough about our memorable experience and the delicious food at yukashi

Address: 643A Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review:
hello from san francisco we had a pleasant experience with chef daisuke on july 5th congrats on the michelin star by the way daisuke has his process down to a tee everyone worked well together and are involved in the whole dining process there wasnt much waste if any the price tag was a little higher than expected but it seems to be a result of rising cost of living and importing ingredients straight from his hometown in japan you do get to enjoy wagyu uni and foie gras as part of your 9 courses the wasabi are grind fresh by daisuke  you usually dont see real fresh wasabi other items worth highlighting are their toro and smoked hamachi the toro was just so fatty and delicious i feel like all hamachi should be smoked after trying it here cant forget the dessert at the end its really expensive to buy it on your own he used this large knife to cut it definitely got everybodys attention the melon was juicy and literally melted in my mouth before i even start chewing amazing experience

keep in mind the head chef is busy in the beginning dont think and just enjoy your food he will have time to converse with everyone later its not just your experience but everyone elses its easy for other guests to ruin the overall experience but we made it through ours thanks again daisuke and for taking a pic with us

Address: 643A Mount Pleasant Road Toronto, ON M4S 2M9 Canada
Review: hands down best sushi place i have ever been to to date i dont have anything negative to say about yukashi everything was perfect presentation is incredible ambiance is warm and inviting and the food itself is top top quality this is a genuinely artistic omakase experience the chef was a true pleasure to watch and speak to sake pairings were unbelievable i could have paid much much more without it feeling overpriced

Address: 1568 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: my sisters and i received excellent service here first half of the items on their menu wasnt available today but they were apologetic and let us know what wasnt available second they accidentally gave us the kids classic breakfast with sausage and was apologetic and immediately made us new ones which showed us that they understood different diets like vegetarianism aside from those two hiccups the food was amazing and the service rocked

Address: 1568 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: great restaurant for halal brunch i absolutely loved the nashville eggs benedict we also got the scotch egg and i wasnt particularly a fan i had a latte with oat milk and i enjoyed it a lot the restaurant itself was pretty busy even on a weekday but we were seated immediately our server was super friendly and helpful

Address: 1568 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review: one of the best brunches so far its halal  we got lucky the lotus pancakes was on the house  excellent service kobs helped us out super nice person also the soundtrack was nice  a true 1d fan playing all the new niall and harrys song

Address: 1568 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review:
i went to eggstatic for the third time with my family this place is very lively and busy on a sunday as a result parking can be a little hard to come by but every once in a while a spot out front opens up and there is a green p lot about a block away

the owner faris and his partner are extremely friendly and kind they went out of their way to ensure my family and i had a great dining experience i would highly recommend trying this spot if you are looking for a halal brunch spot with a variety of options also the mangostrawberry lemonade is really delicious and not too sweet

Address: 1568 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3B7 Canada
Review:
this place is so cute the food was really really good i had a chicken sandwich my coworkers had the nashville chicken eggs benedict and it looked phenomenal the portion was huge in comparison to other breakfast spots

kiara was our server she was so friendly and accommodating she recommended a drink and i ended up trying  loving it would definitely recommend her choice of the mango strawberry lemonade she was great

really enjoyed our meal  will definitely be back

Address: 2405A Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E7 Canada
Review:
cozy ambience they havent changed anything in the past 67 years except for the flooring friendly staff

we mostly had seafood they were good but a little overcooked my seafood saffron risottos scallops were very over cooked but the shrimps were perfect the seafood salads seafood was also overcooked but they were refreshing mussels were perfect veal with lemon sauce was good but maybe the piece was too thin overall pleasant experience

Address: 2405A Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E7 Canada
Review:
i randomly found this place i went there just for brunch but turns out its an authentic italian place with all sorts of class and beauty i ordered a brunch course followed by fruits and cheese and paired it with a glass of rose absolutely loved the bar tender  server jawahar and his service
it was only me and i must say they treated me the best i am going back with my entire crew loved every bit of it toronto is showing its good old kind canadian face again

Address: 2405A Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E7 Canada
Review:
we were a table of seven at la vecchia and we all left very pleased

the food was really good and the portions were satisfying

the staff was very friendly and attentive taking good care of us

Address: 2405A Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E7 Canada
Review: i came to the yonge and eglinton location for my birthday and had the most incredible experience the brunch menu had tasty options and the service was very impeccable alex greeted me and checked on our table very frequently we had the best seat in the restaurant and our waiter manny was very attentive i will be back for all my special occasions

Address: 2405A Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4P 2E7 Canada
Review:
what can i say one of the best italian restaurants ive ever been to
i have a different food pallet so generally im not that big of a fan of italian food  but manwhat a great place the place is packed and it looks like everyone who works there actually loves their job
the owner is amazing super welcoming and cool the server was amazing fantastic stuff
only 2 issues  pasta portions are small and i wish they served free bread with the olive oil

Address: 6 Garamond Court Toronto, ON M3C 1Z5 Canada
Review: what do you get a guy who has everything  an elite birthday dinner at kaiseki yuzen  the experience was exquisite from start to finish the entire restaurant holds just three tables  each table is set in a separate and cozy room emulating the traditional tatami feel with western seating  our server was impeccably professional friendly thorough and knowledgeable with every detail of our meal  each dish was immaculately plated  id tell you to avoid a spoiler alert by skipping the photos but your visual and taste experience will change with the meat seafood and vegetables in season at the time if you want a fine dining experience like no other this is the place

Address: 6 Garamond Court Toronto, ON M3C 1Z5 Canada
Review: truly an experience where youre transported outside of toronto and into a traditional kaiseki in japan from the moment you walk to the front of the restaurant the cherry blossoms outside the building bloom as i went in late april just as they were blooming theres a magnificent entrance and walk to your dining room as for the meal the flavors slowly build up as the night goes on each dish adding a bit more complexity than the last from the food to the impeccable service its an experience you will never forget amazing memories

Address: 6 Garamond Court Toronto, ON M3C 1Z5 Canada
Review:
an absolutely perfect kaiseki experience im confident to say this was the best ive had outside of japan from the very beginning the attention to detail is present the staff immediately greet you and walk you to your seating area as you make your way into the restaurant the decor and ambiance of really pops out each decorative piece works as a whole to make you feel like youve been transported to kyoto and prepares you for the work of art that is their kaiseki tasting menu even the movement of the servers showcased careful poise with no wasted movement as each dish was placed with such care and love and a respectful bow as they enter and leave the room

they really have mastered the art quite well as each dish stimulates all five of your senses individually each course itself is a work of art in its own right the textures of each dish work well individually and together feel like a harmonious symphony that doesnt overpower you i must give kudos to their house made sesame tofu the texture of that dish was a personal favourite of mine their steamed dish also whetted your appetite as when you uncover it the balance of the vegetables and red snapper emit a delicate scent that is is a stark contrast with the umami of the mingled broth formed at the bottom needless to say each dish was absolutely delicious and inventive the chef has not only mastered his art but showcases how well thought out his combinations of seasonal ingredients are the pairings of each dish and how they prepare them prove its michelin status

the only possible way they could have made the experience even more perfect would be to offer a seizastyle seating room with traditional tatami mats i truly feel like that would make diners feel like they really have been transported to japan this has been my absolute favourite michelin experience in canada thus far kudos to all the staff

Address: 6 Garamond Court Toronto, ON M3C 1Z5 Canada
Review:
went for my boyfriends 20th and it was phenomenal the service and pace of the meal couldnt have been better and you leave feeling  full but not uncomfortable

food was delicious and a completely new sensory experience each one was plated exquisitely truly a feast for all your senses its hard to pick a highlight out of all the course as each and every one had its unique quirks i look forward to experiencing this in japan when i get the chance

thank you to our gracious host haruna she was kind patient and extremely informative and of course thank you to chef k who went out of his way to greet us at the end of the meal and talk us through the kaiseki experience

i look forward to coming back and trying their ever changing menu again gochisousama deshita

Address: 6 Garamond Court Toronto, ON M3C 1Z5 Canada
Review: lovely private setting with amazing dishes the service is perfect and the hostess tended to our requests i wouldnt recommend bringing young children as it might ruin the atmosphere of other guests there

Address: 21 Davisville Avenue Toronto, ON M4S 1G3 Canada
Review: what a hidden gem located in the back of this hasty market lies a wonderful shawarma shop they make their own flatbread and its so unique and delicious not your standard pita i really enjoyed the different texture i ordered the chicken shawarma wrap all dressed and they loaded it up its a hefty wrap i got a couple of falafels broken up and added to the wrap and they soaked up some of the sauce to add a really nice flavour and consistency to the filling highly recommend

Address: 21 Davisville Avenue Toronto, ON M4S 1G3 Canada
Review: hasty market  flaming stove is √† truly hidden gem in davisville that definitely worth try at the back of the store with lots of findings you can see the flaming stove the best local halal dish theres dine in only in summer they are mostly take out i totally suggest the baba ghanoush and the wraps

Address: 21 Davisville Avenue Toronto, ON M4S 1G3 Canada
Review: the quality of the chicken is great however portions were rather small the quality of the rice could also be better but overall a decent shawarma plate i like mine without veggies we also tried the falafel which was not bad if youre in the area you should check it out

Address: 21 Davisville Avenue Toronto, ON M4S 1G3 Canada
Review: its a fine spot for takeout wraps the food tasted good but i feel like its missing a bit of seasoning great portion size though

Address: 21 Davisville Avenue Toronto, ON M4S 1G3 Canada
Review: a place hidden in a convenient store the entire place is quite clean comparing to most of the corner stores the food is decent but not overwhelming the shawarma chicken is good the salad is mediocre this box is 20 i also bought hummus and baba ghanoush liked the hummus but dont recommend the ghanoush too much salt

Restaurant_name: El Saz√≥n de la Tia Flor
Address: 1549 O'Connor Drive Toronto, ON M4B 2V7 Canada
Review: cant go wrong for 1 taco tuesday it was our first time there so we had to navigate all the amazing taco choices needless to say it was busy in there that day but staff were friendly and helpful with all our taco questions and the tacos did not disappoint will definitely be back

Restaurant_name: El Saz√≥n de la Tia Flor
Address: 1549 O'Connor Drive Toronto, ON M4B 2V7 Canada
Review:
we happened to catch ordering some quick take out right before they were closing at 7pm the lady was kind enough to take our orders around 10 minutes before the end of the day

there were not a lot of menu options available to get at this time and we were limited to ordering the pastor taco  i think the chicken taco both orders were good and looked good the tacos came with 2 sauces

probably the only minor thing i can comment on that did not go right was that the lady did not include any napkinstissues in the take out bag we would have appreciated having some included for our takeout because we had the tacos to go and ate it at a park somewhere else

i will surely try to experience dining in some time in the future the interiors were themed right and the place was very homey i also can only expect some good and personable service received from the restaurant

Restaurant_name: El Saz√≥n de la Tia Flor
Address: 1549 O'Connor Drive Toronto, ON M4B 2V7 Canada
Review:
finally found a place with proper sized tacos im tired of all these open faced burritos with massive tortillas masquerading as tacos only thing they are missing is a double tortilla the flavor is amazing

edit came for for the 1 tacos stayed for the the amazing food tried a few other items on the menu since the first visit so far everything is incredable chilaquiles are super good

Restaurant_name: El Saz√≥n de la Tia Flor
Address: 1549 O'Connor Drive Toronto, ON M4B 2V7 Canada
Review: we found this place 2 years ago they have the 1 tacos every tuesday  wednesday weve tried the pastor chorizo carnitas and carne ranchera they used to give lime with the order but now you have to buy it we also tried the birria soup it was 2 for a mini portion of it but my sister think its delicious i remember they used to have delicious desserts too but they didnt have anything last time we came to visit i used to get the hot salsa too and it used to burn my mouth but i guess they watered it down now overall it is 1 taco every tuesday  wednesday so what else can you ask for

Restaurant_name: El Saz√≥n de la Tia Flor
Address: 1549 O'Connor Drive Toronto, ON M4B 2V7 Canada
Review: went there for the first time to try out the 1 taco tuesday and wednesday the tacos were delicious  theres a good variety to choose from will definitely go back to try their other dishes 4 stars only because i only tried the tacos

Address: 2057 Yonge St Toronto, ON M4S 2A2 Canada
Review:
ive walked by this place many many times and have always wanted to try it i finally gave in and made my take out order i ordered the spicy veggie ramen 1905 around 2 more than a meat option  2120 with tofu compared to a 1695 for meat and asked for tofu to be added since there wasnt any protein in there extra 215 since i ordered it to go i was charged a 1 to go fee what honestly after spending 25 totally not worth it for a veggie bowl im not sure id go back again the noodles were really nice but honestly i thought the rest of the bowl was just okay in comparison to some other restaurants where ive tried ramen before there was hardly any soup and the description on the menu lists that theres broccoli included but i received none
the service was also very slow maybe they were short staffed but i swear when i put my order through the gentleman said it would take minutes which turned into about 20  there was even a lady sat in there with her family that was complaining because their order was taking so long to come out also a little shocked to find out its a chain restaurant

Address: 2057 Yonge St Toronto, ON M4S 2A2 Canada
Review: i went to this ramen shop with my wife and two daughters  the ramen was excellent  the wait staff are also nice and friendly  you can order different sizes of ramen bowls depending on how hungry you are which is great because my daughters weigh less than a 100lbs so they cant eat a large bowl of ramen  the small bowl was plenty for them  we will be back again the next time we are visiting toronto

Address: 2057 Yonge St Toronto, ON M4S 2A2 Canada
Review:
its a nice little ramen spot with a good atmosphere and pleasant service

i thought the ramen flavours were good but not excellent it seems to be a bit on the tame side of flavor a bit on the pricer side for what you get overall not a bad place

Address: 2057 Yonge St Toronto, ON M4S 2A2 Canada
Review: great place for ramen the food is great but might want to book before arriving the fried chicken was the most tender chicken i have ever had do try the chicken and pork ramen

Address: 2057 Yonge St Toronto, ON M4S 2A2 Canada
Review: great service you can order regular or large size ramen the option to get a smaller size is great i got spicy veggie ramen with kale noodles and tofu on the side would definitely recommend it was delicious

Address: 4 Crescent Road Toronto, ON M4W 1S9 Canada
Review:
i absolutely love their sandwiches and my absolute favorite has to be their mouthwatering roast beef sandwich with its delectable bbq sauce the combination of tender succulent roast beef layered with the perfect balance of tangy and savory bbq sauce creates a taste sensation that is simply irresistible each bite is a symphony of flavors that leaves me craving more

not only are their sandwiches incredibly tasty but the quality of ingredients and attention to detail truly sets them apart the roast beef is expertly cooked to perfection tender and juicy with a hint of smoky flavor that pairs perfectly with the bold rich bbq sauce the bread they use is always fresh and just the right amount of softness providing the perfect vessel to hold all the delicious ingredients together

if youre looking for something special and unique to tantalize your taste buds i highly recommend trying their sandwiches

Address: 4 Crescent Road Toronto, ON M4W 1S9 Canada
Review:
awesome food they do no advertising and its all word of mouth  there is a tiny patio for eating outside this place has been around for at least 10 years it is constantly busy but the wait wasnt bad and the staff is friendly
inside its a utilitarian vibe now back to the food i think any foodies would love the sandwiches in all my reviews this is a top spot

Address: 4 Crescent Road Toronto, ON M4W 1S9 Canada
Review: great sandwich its was extremely delicious and lives up to the hype the bread was great decent portions savoury meat definitely recommend to visit its got some nice patio area outside now that the weather is great very close to the subway station

Address: 4 Crescent Road Toronto, ON M4W 1S9 Canada
Review:
a cute little place by rosedale station it has 4 seats and 2 tables so be prepared to get a takeout no washroom in sight a good menue that is accommodating to almost everyone i got decent service when i visited but since i only went once i cant exactly vouch for the service i took their recommendation and got veggie roasted sandwich with pesto mayo and it was about 11 a little over priced but thats midtowndowntown for you

the veggies tasted fresh and the bun was nice and chewy although not toasted they could have added a little more sauce to it

overall a good place to grab a filling on the go lunch

Address: 4 Crescent Road Toronto, ON M4W 1S9 Canada
Review:
really excellent sandwiches cannot wait to try the beef brisket sandwich again but with toppings next time the meat is tender and moist and bun soaks up the delicious barbecue sauce the camel blt is a wonderful combination of classic flavours its loaded with toppings but at its core its still a great pesto chicken sandwich the shop is tiny only two 2seater tables and a standing room counter but the diners seem to eat as quickly as the sandwiches are prepared

update 2nd visit was just as good pulled pork with caramelized onions and roast sweet peppers was delicious

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review: absolutely amazing experience from the service vibe and especially the food we were a party of 3 got sat right away on the roof top it was a monday so not too too busy ordered quit a few different items off the menu and we shared everything our server was very attentive and gave us lots of great recommendations the grilled octopus was honestly one of my favourite things ive gotten at a restaurant to date we had pasta fish and pizza as well as some apps and desserts nothing disappointed

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review:
the truffle pasta is a must try i come here every few months just for the truffle pasta the other pastas are good too but if you like mushroom just get the truffle one the pizza bread and bruschetta are also delicious

the atmosphere and service is great i highly recommend coming before 6pm to avoid waiting if you do have to wait youre usually seated in 1530 minutes

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review: went with my family 4 people for lunch hostess was very friendly and opened the door for us and promptly sat us it was pretty busy our server was quick very friendly the octopus as an appetizer was absolutely delicious and the plating was beautiful happy with our experience lots to choose from on the menu  will be back again

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review: it was a nice restaurant with nice atmosphere not a big place but i like the interior settings inside my friend love their risotto and the nduja pizza is also very tasty with sweet and sour taste also marc is very nice  ive been told the service is usually just so so but he is friendly and been nice all the time

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review:
delicious delicious delicious
must try their truffle pasta
the female server was very kind and sweet

one thing to note is that the tables are stacked pretty close to one another and it could get very lively and loud

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review: absolutely amazing experience from the service vibe and especially the food we were a party of 3 got sat right away on the roof top it was a monday so not too too busy ordered quit a few different items off the menu and we shared everything our server was very attentive and gave us lots of great recommendations the grilled octopus was honestly one of my favourite things ive gotten at a restaurant to date we had pasta fish and pizza as well as some apps and desserts nothing disappointed

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review:
the truffle pasta is a must try i come here every few months just for the truffle pasta the other pastas are good too but if you like mushroom just get the truffle one the pizza bread and bruschetta are also delicious

the atmosphere and service is great i highly recommend coming before 6pm to avoid waiting if you do have to wait youre usually seated in 1530 minutes

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review: went with my family 4 people for lunch hostess was very friendly and opened the door for us and promptly sat us it was pretty busy our server was quick very friendly the octopus as an appetizer was absolutely delicious and the plating was beautiful happy with our experience lots to choose from on the menu  will be back again

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review: it was a nice restaurant with nice atmosphere not a big place but i like the interior settings inside my friend love their risotto and the nduja pizza is also very tasty with sweet and sour taste also marc is very nice  ive been told the service is usually just so so but he is friendly and been nice all the time

Address: 75 Yorkville Avenue Toronto, ON M5R 1B8 Canada
Review:
delicious delicious delicious
must try their truffle pasta
the female server was very kind and sweet

one thing to note is that the tables are stacked pretty close to one another and it could get very lively and loud

Address: 1677 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3C1 Canada
Review:
was craving thai and my friend recommended me pii nong im so glad she did because everything was delicious and lots of fresh flavours im a sweets gal so the teddy bear iced tea was absolutely adorable and refreshing the mango sticky rice and the durian pancake were so good i wouldve smashed them if i wasnt too full off all the delicious entrees i could go on forever about how tasty everything is the service was also top notch as well

highly recommend

Address: 1677 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3C1 Canada
Review:
lovely dinner at pii nong thai we loved every dish and highly recommend the pandan chicken soft shell crab and the shrimp platter every saucecurry dipping sauce is amazing

dont skip the sweets and grab the thai milk tea bear and the coconut soup dessert to finish amazing service will return

Address: 1677 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3C1 Canada
Review:
the thai tea bears are adorable

this is a decent thai spot in the area the presentation of the food and drinks were great and the restaurant has a nice atmosphere as well

i thoroughly enjoyed the soft shell crab curry and highly recommend getting this item the curry was delicious and i really liked how it paired with the crab

the other dishes were okay i felt like some could use a bit more flavour and some was a little too umami and salty for me but thats just my personal preference

i did have a good time and enjoyed my dinner overall

Address: 1677 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3C1 Canada
Review: my favorite thai restaurant in toronto so far this restaurant is quite so spacious and has nice intimate vibes where lots of foodies like me would love to visit often unique and creative menu with fantastic flavor 3 of us went there on thursday noon and we were so easy to find parking spot even though i was bit concern about its location at the beginning we ordered many dishes and our server was so friendly to offer signature dishes based on our preference food came out so quick and services were excellent firstly we were so surprised by the way how they make the thai mike tea with the shape of cute bearsuch a genius idea best beverage to start a meal here so refreshing and  not too sweet at alland i love the seasonal specialty durian roti so much which came with great portion of durian and they taste so creamy which perfect for people who are big fans of durian aand you couldnt find this any thai restaurant soft crab curry also tasted surprisingly good and i fell in love with soft crabs since then pandan leaf chicken is also a dish which you couldnt easily find anywhere and i was so impressed with the idea how they marianate and grill the chicken while they were wrap with leaf they are so juicy and tender with light scents of leaf the owner is also talkative and passionate about different ideas for the food his restaurant offers i believe thats why this thai restaurant is so outstanding and should deserve a michelin star one day will definitely come back again

Address: 1677 Bayview Avenue Toronto, ON M4G 3C1 Canada
Review:
i had a very pleasant dinner at pii nong the servers really managed to find a table for us even if the restaurant was very busy and we didnt have a reservation so thank you very much for that

i am usually not a big meat lover but probably the ribs were the best dish of our meal so tender and juicy
overall also the other items were very good we had nana garden salad chicken khao soi pad thai and soft shell crab  the last one was a bit pricy and portion small but def good taste
we finished our meal with thr durian roti that was excellent durian flavoured desserts are often very artificial flavoured but this one tasted very fresh

overall very recommended

Address: 111 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V4 Canada
Review: my favourite spot in ontario for tacos best fish and beef tacos its a tiny spot so id recommend coming early or making reservations

Address: 111 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V4 Canada
Review:
this place by far has one of the top 3 fish taco i have ever tried
 fish taco i ordered ubereats but when it arrives the fish was still crispy i really like how they season it and love the sauce the portion is pretty good with great amount of veggies i was quite full with only 3 pieces of tacos and didnt have to eat or drink anything else
i saw the lobster taco on the menu and definitely will come back to try

Address: 111 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V4 Canada
Review:
455

wow these tacos were an explosion of mouthwatering flavours and textures hands down the best ive had in town thus far

we tried the ceviche del dia which was okay nothing particularly special about this dish but the chips were fresh and very good

for tacos we tried the carnitas on soft tortillas and the pollo tinga on hard shells  both were great with a wonderful combination of garnishes and sauces my personal favourite was the pollo tinga as it had a good bite to it and the guacamole on the side was nice

its a small and very busy restaurant with dimmed lighting and a cozy feel the older gentleman bartender who served us was attentive and friendly id definitely return

Address: 111 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V4 Canada
Review:
the food here is incredible i was so impressed and will definitely be back

their house hot sauces are so good i put the milder one on everything theyre deliciously spicy

we ordered the grilled corn and salsa and chips to start the grilled corn was tasty but missing the char i expected from grilled corn the salsa was fresh and delicious with a generous portion size of tortilla chips

tacos come as a set of 34 so we ordered a set of the shrimp and al pastor both were so good the al pastor tacos pack a punch of flavour  the seasoning of the pork is spot on plus the juicy sweetness of the grilled pineapple and slice of orange on top mmmthe shrimp tacos were milder in flavour but so juicy and so tasty the fried taco shell was a nice touch

we also tried the tres leches cake which was massive shared between two people and not too sweet

incredible experience overall and definitely coming back to try the other tacos

Address: 111 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V4 Canada
Review: delicious a must try taco joint in the city the guacamole and corn was absolutely delicious very fresh the fried fish tacos were so big which you think would be a good thing it was honestly difficult to eat and wish we ordered the grilled option instead

Address: 950 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 2C2 Canada
Review:
overall had a good experience
the bi bin bap was good but i had the tofu version which was very different
this tofu was lighter and softer the dish also seemed low in salt
they had mexican coke which was yummy
the beef not pork tacos were delicious as were the dumplings

the space is small but owner is accommodating to groups service is friendly and helpful

great price havent paid under 25 for my own dish for a while

washrooms available downstairs

wouldnt recommend for wheelchair accessible unless its on the patio

Address: 950 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 2C2 Canada
Review:
been bummed out recently that most korean restaurants i visit have not met my expectations however this place helped me be proud of my culture and regained excitement for eating my food

we ordered the beef bibimbap and the beef itself was so tender and soft the apps were simple but yet delicious and affordable

definitely will be coming back

Address: 950 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 2C2 Canada
Review: delicious love the food from here good portions and good prices must try

Address: 950 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 2C2 Canada
Review: my first time to dine in here the  food are amazing and delicious the presentation of the food is beautiful the service of the food was efficient we dont have to wait longer the staff was friendly definitely coming back in here

Address: 950 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 2C2 Canada
Review: this place is awesome never misses just tried the water dumplings today and they are outstanding we always get the kimchi fries and love the chicken or beef bi bim bap

Address: 872 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1M5 Canada
Review: decent tasting food fairly priced and excellent service i order the fish of the day which was sea bass with white rice avocado salad and green plantains sea bass was cooked perfectly crispy on the outside moist in the inside but it lacked in seasoning i wasnt too fond of the green plantain however the soup of the day sea food soup was amazing it was the best dish overall lots of different kinds of sea food and bursting with flavour lastly the mojinica tasted like lemonade no rum

Address: 872 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1M5 Canada
Review: friendly service huge portions i left so stuffed the daily special seafood soup was good the yuccanadas tasted just like nachos with cheese and salsa my favourite meal was the pez dorado grilled mahimahi very flavourful the fish of the day sea bass was cooked beautifully crispy on the outside moist inside however it lacked seasoning i found the mojinica drink to be very tart and strong in mint but light in rum there are other dishes that i would love to try so i will be back

Address: 872 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1M5 Canada
Review: i love this place a local brought me here 3 years ago when i moved to toronto its a small cozy restaurant with lots of great food options and amazing cocktails i eat here once in a while and enjoy the experience everytime

Address: 872 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1M5 Canada
Review: made a reservation and was glad i did since the place was packed on a friday night i got the carne asada as my main and added the fried cheese for the appetizer we got the fish ceviche and mussels ive never had such tender mussels it was cooked so deliciously we didnt waste a drop of the sauce and soaked it up with bread the carne asada was not tough and had a good chew but couldve used more flavour the ceviche was too sour for my liking everything was fresh and came piping hot only thing i wished was for a little more considerate service after we paid we stayed a little longer to chat but they stopped serving us water although the staff are very friendly and didnt rush us to leave i still had a great time

Address: 872 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1M5 Canada
Review: this was our first time trying nicaraguan food and we were impressed the service was friendly and the servers greet you in spanish we enjoyed our food here and we couldnt finish everything as the main dishes were fairly big next time we will do different appetizers so we can try more items on the menu the polo jalape√±o plate is cooked with coconut milk which was delicious but we expected it to be a bit more spicy this dish wasnt spicy at all considering that its supposed to come with jalape√±os we loved the mixed seafood ceviches beef churrasco could have been a bit better as ive tried this type of dish before also vegetables on this plate were very plain overall a great experience thank you

Address: 180 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V7 Canada
Review: first time here giving this a definite 5 across the board i am amazed how many people work here besides that the food was really good the waitress awsome hair by the way working there new the menu and was knowledgeable with the products i highly recommend having a few drinks and a bit to eat here thanks again

Address: 180 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V7 Canada
Review: had an amazing experience at this place patio was lovely many thanks to our server we asked if they use vegetable oil as i couldnt eat that due to my allergies and unfortunately they do use it but really loved the fact that she didnt give up and suggested all the items that i could safely have  from the menu and suggested they can cook it in butter instead we ordered roti with curry and enchiladas  both of it was delicious

Address: 180 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V7 Canada
Review: great place always has good food nice drink selection i recommend trying the house lager diligent about checking vaccinations no complaints

Address: 180 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V7 Canada
Review:
reviewing latest visit may 2023 
vibrant eatery hidden in the interiors of midtown they have huge place no shortage of seating but we always fancy the patio  rooftop getting to the washroom is a bit of inconvinience as its located deep down in the basement cheerful atmosphere and the place is always packed

cocktails are one of the best and they also have a good collection of beers and serve seasonal local brews too food is average and can get better rotating menu and
also more veganvegetarian options
service has been up and down but just about there in general

parking is very limited and is challenge finding every visit

we visited the local at vancouver location recently but prefer home base better

Address: 180 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V7 Canada
Review: 1st patio is pet friendly they brought a water bowl for my dog all staff was really friendly i order the breakfast sandwich amazing it has everything you need to start your day with the right foot i paired with a beermosa with grapefruit juice

Address: 407 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review: ordered via uber eats and we couldnt have been happier with all the dishes so fresh and delicious hugely appreciated their care to accommodate allergies cant wait to go experience it in person now we will be regulars

Address: 407 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review:
greek craving satisfied what a homey authentic and delicious experience we went on a friday at around 8pm and had a feast the grilled and fried calamari were to die for best calamari in the city dont waste your time anywhere else the dips were amazing too the menu was so pleasantly overwhelming we wanted to order everything
some people on the table had the lamb rack and really enjoyed it too
be mindful that the portions are huge and youll want to order everything
super fresh super delicious and i cannot wait to go back

Address: 407 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review:
without doubt this has been one of the most amazing experiences i have had in a toronto restaurant in my 4 years here
food made with passion and care served hot or cold as the dish needs and tasted delicious and this is when we are vegetarians
service  felt treated like a guest as cared for in small ways like hot water sugar
when i mentioned that i was at the restaurant with my family visiting as a tourist they made the dinner special with honey cake on the house
had a very pleasant and memorable time and my family is going to remember this as one of the most special times they had while in canada
thank you everyone at pantheon for having such a high bar for customer service i will definitely visit again and tell others to not miss this incredible experience
this is the reason dining out is not just about food but an extraordinary experience

Address: 407 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review: my family and i have been going to pantheon for years as our choice to dine on the danforth there are many quality greek restaurants in the area and i would encourage everyone to try as many as possible to support local businesses however pantheon goes a step above and they serve a high quality menu especially the beautiful seafood my favourite is of course the grilled calamari but also very good lamb chopsleg their service is prompt and efficient they make sure you are taken care of and always give you a complimentary greek cake for the table on the house  have some coffees after your meal and unwind make a reservation as it might get busy especially in summertime if you want a seat inside for a larger party

Address: 407 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review: i went for dinner around 630pm and it wasnt immediately busy but it didnt take long to become a full restaurant we ordered the grilled calamari dinner a large skewer and saganaki all of which was great the portions were generous and we were pleasantly surprised they gave us honey cake on the house as well which was a nice end to the meal the sweetness level was exactly as you would hope it to be

Address: 100 Front Street W Fairmont Royal York Toronto, ON M5J 1E3 Canada
Review: such a classy place beautiful ambience amazing service have tried number of cocktails and there is always more to these cocktails you cant judge it with one sip a place to bring your date if you want to impress her its inside fairmont hotel we always have desserts here and the best is bourbon creme brulle its huge and can be shared by 2

Address: 100 Front Street W Fairmont Royal York Toronto, ON M5J 1E3 Canada
Review:
went for drinks the bar is really nice with a great ambience our server joe was very nice and suggested great options
we didnt have any food
the drinks were well made delicious and creative

Address: 100 Front Street W Fairmont Royal York Toronto, ON M5J 1E3 Canada
Review: i had the amore cocktail with tequila and that was the best drink i tried from what we ordered the espresso martini was okay ive tried a better one from voodoo cocktail bar our server brie was excellent she was attentive and made our stay worthwhile this is a nice bar to catchup with friends or with your date

Address: 100 Front Street W Fairmont Royal York Toronto, ON M5J 1E3 Canada
Review: this is a very classy place i visited this place along with some of my colleagues the person attending our table was really nice and attentive he made several recommendations and suggestions which turned out to be great

Address: 100 Front Street W Fairmont Royal York Toronto, ON M5J 1E3 Canada
Review: i loved this bar the bartenders especially aoife are skilled and really nice and fun great vibes and good cocktails i also ate dinner here three times and enjoyed all three meals very much  the caesar with shrimp the burger and the pasta were all really good pricey but worth it no complaints from me ill be back

Address: 2867 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Y9 Canada
Review: we had a really great experience there no reservations for small parties and walk ins only we didnt wait too long before seated at the bar overall we were happy with meal drinks and ambiance but they were far from 5 star rating here is my break down on the food we tried calamari was a bit saggy but flavorful toad in the hole was probably the best fresh sausage and pudding batter sheppards pie was soso if you like strong lamb flavor youd probably like the pie to me it lacked proper seasoning and spices panna cotta was standard negroni was very aromatic with complex profile loved it the menus were awful degraded and mostly torn pieces  i get the hip vibe but still menus should be reprinted  serve staff were not auper friendly rushed  and a bit aggressive in taking orders some diversity training for them would be beneficial

Address: 2867 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Y9 Canada
Review:
absolutely gorgeous and fantastic vibes in this place

i didnt know what to expect but it still trumped my expectations

highly recommended for anyone looking for arguably the best pub atmosphere food and drinks

below you can see two cocktails and their regular pepperoni pizza

long island wasnt technically on the list but they served it

Address: 2867 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Y9 Canada
Review:
this was my second time visiting this location after having just a few cocktails the first time my boyfriend and i went back a second time for dinner and more drinks im very happy we did

here are the five ss for anyone wanting to visit this excellent restaurant in future for dinner or just for drinks

space a very unique space with a seat yourself policy meaning you can find the perfect little snug hideaway at the back or choose to sit at the bar or the hightop tables with a great view of the unique and appealing interior a very eclectic mix of random memorabilia antiques whisky bottles and a very charming bar with an excellent selection of spirits

seasoningspice we started with two martinis which were very well made then went on to have the chinatown calamari which was delicious and wellseasoned the main courses were a toad in the hole which consisted of a huge homemade yorkshire pudding a delicious cumberland sausage which was actually a traditionally made british sausage which was surprising and delicious i had a lamb shepherds pie which was delicious with a light and fluffy mashed potato seasoned well with a very tasty meat filled lamb part fantastic we finished with more cocktails and aged whisky they have an amazing selection of whisky

size delicious food and the right size not too big and not too small

spend the prices are worth it for the quality of the food you wont be disappointed typically main courses are around 2025 but again the quality of ingredients means its totally worth it

service very good service attentive staff who are knowledgeable about the drinks and the dishes

Address: 2867 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Y9 Canada
Review:
this is my favourite bar in the junction area  the place is small and seemingly crowded but very cosy and lively i feel that sitting so close with other people adds to the intimate atmosphere
the food is fantastic the craft beer selection is great and the dollarish oyster tuesdays are a hit as always

Address: 2867 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Y9 Canada
Review:
this is such a new discovery for me in the junction dundas area the place is easy to be missed but you have to check them out and try their amazing pizzas their fish  chips plus their beers and cider the grape open is amazing on tap
nice environment and beautiful people behind this business

Address: 3353 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2M6 Canada
Review: 445  delicious food awesome service nice atmosphere all the dishes we had were very good including even the bread wait staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating of any needs also great singers for happy birthday definitely recommend stopping here

Address: 3353 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2M6 Canada
Review:
my entire dinner experience was top notch

food very tasty and made with care i loved the cozy vibe most of all the waiter went above and beyond he is what customer service should be approachable helpful hilarious and so much more i felt like i knew him for years

this is also a family owned restaurant which makes it even more special i will be back

Address: 3353 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2M6 Canada
Review:
recently we had the pleasure of summerlicious dining every dish we ordered was prepared with utmost care and precision bursting with flavor and beautifully presented from the appetizers to the main course and dessert each bite was a delightful journey for the taste buds it was a true culinary masterpiece

equally impressive was the exceptional service we received from the staff from the moment we stepped through the door we were greeted with warm smiles and genuine hospitality we were feeling like valued guests throughout our visit

thank you the monkey bar

Address: 3353 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2M6 Canada
Review: we were excited to try this place when we browsed their menu and they came through the braised lamb shank and grilled atlantic char were succulent and cooked to perfection the wait staff were friendly and very attentive

Address: 3353 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4N 2M6 Canada
Review: the food is so good went for my birthday and they were amazing the host chefs son is lovely and made our experience so fun personalized drinks bday song and card the food took about 30min to come out but honestly it was worth the wait everyone at the table raved about their dish even the vegan meal they were able to host two large groups and both servers were attentive we wish the ac was a bit better but truly there is little to fault about this place we would definitely go back

Address: 1794 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 1H8 Canada
Review: delicious local pub serving above average food if you come here just for the brussels sprouts you wont regret it pizza and salad was delicious our friend ordered the smoked chicken and loved it will come back again

Address: 1794 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 1H8 Canada
Review: great east end restaurant with a spacish bar and welcoming interior with a diverse menu sourcing many ingredients locally the mussels were particularly impressive with a very flavourful sauce and fresh bread overall everything was great and the menu is certain to offer something for all palates and diets

Address: 1794 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 1H8 Canada
Review: just had dinner here everything was great aside from the service whic was slow cold drinks great atmosphere and food

Address: 1794 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 1H8 Canada
Review: went there for dinner for my friends bday we did order the burger it was very good the waitress and the waiter were very friendly they have a nice collection of beers the feel of the place is very nice  cozy and warm it has a long bar nice wooden feel i have moved to the neighbourhood about a year ago and it was the first time i go there definitely will return soon

Address: 1794 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 1H8 Canada
Review: nice decor craft beer bar and excellent food well done

Address: 2140 Yonge Street North York, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: had a wonderful brunch here the back patio has a great vibe their espresso martinis is 1010 got the fried chicken and waffles and loved the gravy they have drizzled 1010

Address: 2140 Yonge Street North York, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review:
ordered french toasts they looked great on the pictures but i would not order them again
system of booking is weird while most of the places use opentable  they ask you to message in instagram what about the people who does not have it  you also can call but no one pick up the phone you cannot make a reservation the same day so if you woke up on sunday and decided to book a table do not even try you should know in advance that you want to have a branch at this place we have been waiting 20 min while 3 tables were hold and no one eat there

Address: 2140 Yonge Street North York, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: we got there around 10am  there was a few groups waiting for the tables but we opted to sit at the bar which didnt require any wait  the service was average for what you would expect  one thing to note is that it gets a little noisy at the bar due to the staff crushing ice  if you care to talk to your friends you may want to avoid the bar  as for the food everything came out as expected  we really enjoyed the smoked salmon benedict and the brunch poutine was pretty tasty  it was a good experience and we were already talking about going back to try other things on the menu

Address: 2140 Yonge Street North York, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review:
the food is overpriced i would say but we liked its freshness and taste the portion can be much larger than this at least it was not sufficient for me i suggest reservations as it may become super crowded
i would recommend the place if you are not that hungry or they balance the portionprice for instance for two sunnyside up eggs a few fried potatoes a slice of toast bread and a few selected fruits and a few bacon strips good morning plate was 18 it had a good variety of freshly made stuff but just a sample of each

Address: 2140 Yonge Street North York, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: recommend their pancakes eggbenedict was good as well but not extraordinary servers are very friendly and cozy atmosphere to have a relaxing brunch under sunshine must seat their patio

Address: 5 Coady Avenue Toronto, ON M4M 2Y9 Canada
Review: a sweet spot for good price food we got the tacos  and the pulled pork box and a pop it was like 30 dollars also the outside seating is excellent the service was dope and they played some amazing tracks in there

Address: 5 Coady Avenue Toronto, ON M4M 2Y9 Canada
Review:
really great food experience the flavour is outstanding and exciting i tried the steak box and it is beyond amazing the eggs the steak the fries everything tasted wonderful together

definitely a must try put it on your list

Address: 5 Coady Avenue Toronto, ON M4M 2Y9 Canada
Review:
2023 june 4
tacos 1150
3 housemade hardshell tacos with your choice of steak pork chorizo veg or vegan finished with their house hot sauce jalapenolime crema mashed avocado refried beans fresh salsa
and shredded cheddar the tacos are great the hard shell is crunchy and flavorful
a definite recommend

corn chips with cheese 795  200
house made tortilla chips served with mashed avocado tomatocilantro salsa house hot sauce and crema
the corn chips were amazing in the tacos that i had to get them separately though the shredded cheese was a tad expensive given the amount that was on it the avocado was ok the salsa was ok the hot sauce was good
would recommend but skip the cheese

completo poutine 1095  4 for the chorizo
hand cut fries refried beans and aged cheddar topped with house made salsa served with mashed avocado and their hot sauce and crema
this was ok their chorizo was more like a meat patty  not that it wasnt good but the overall was so so
would pass next time

very limited indoor seating about 3 outdoor seating for about 14

Address: 5 Coady Avenue Toronto, ON M4M 2Y9 Canada
Review: my coworker recommended this place especially tacos so we went there its a small take away place we ordered steak and pork tacos portion sizes were pretty good for the price the fries were also so really really good now its one of our fav places to get food  we will definitely go back

Address: 5 Coady Avenue Toronto, ON M4M 2Y9 Canada
Review:
if you have the choice pick their broadview location over this one unless you just want takeout this is a little hole in the wall takeaway spot not an actual restaurant as we learned i really thought it would be as amazing as their other location

the food was just as good although the menu is much smaller but it loses a lot of points for ambience and seating you dont really have a choice but to sit outside on their tiny little patio sets there is technically minimal indoor seating but the music is so loud and the cooking too that i cant imagine it would be great if youre looking to eat and chat with a friend eating outside on the sidewalk in chilly fall weather really killed the vibe for us so just be aware youll have to bundle up now its either wasps or cold

they have almost no selection of drinks and no hot drinks not awesome when youre eating outside and its autumn

the staff was super friendly and helpful however

as a takeout spot 45 stars as a dinein outside its only 3 as its just okay nothing bad but also not great still delicious food

also if youre a woman or man looking for a husband hang out here for a while  in the whole time we sat here it was all men coming in only one other woman with her boyfriend good luck single ladies

Address: 337 Broadview Ave Toronto, ON M4M 2H1 Canada
Review:
if you want the besttasting sandwich in toronto come to completo the beer on tap is barely cold and does not taste good but let me tell you their sandwiches are the best the classic churrasco sandwich will blow your socks off add a friend egg over easy and enjoy seriously no other sandwich place in toronto beats their classic churrasco sandwich imho

the service was great the brazilian lady working there is friendly and courteous

the outdoor patio furniture is very basic though they should invest in nicer outdoor patio furniture and please get bettertasting beer on tap oh yeah and make it colder you serve barely cold beer on a hot summer day i want to enjoy a pint of ice cold beer not barely cold beer ask the brazilian lady working there how cold the beer they serve in brazil is its ice cold the way it should be not barely cold like most places in toronto serve it anyway my rant is over go to completo and enjoy the best sandwich ever

Address: 337 Broadview Ave Toronto, ON M4M 2H1 Canada
Review:
trying this location for the first time on a tuesday evening at around 845pm ive been to the other location in leslieville and this place also did not disappoint i ordered the box and the tacos which came to be about 30 tax included food was made fresh to order and came in good portions although its quite greasy in general its still bomb

would recommend and come back

Address: 337 Broadview Ave Toronto, ON M4M 2H1 Canada
Review: the food here tastes great their steak classic churrasco tasted amazing and the fries were well seasoned their oak latte was also just sweet enough but not too sweet to actually drown out the drink i had already made up my mind on what i was planning to order because i looked up the menu online but there are also some daily specials that i might try and grab another time

Address: 337 Broadview Ave Toronto, ON M4M 2H1 Canada
Review: one of the best latin restaurants in the city usually not a big fan of hard shell tacos but they just do it right stuffed with huge chunks of meat other fillings and hot sauce good selection of desserts  bolas were so fluffy and sweet my friends also swore by their flan and sandwiches it is located only minutes away from riverdale by foot so it makes a great picnic food too

Address: 337 Broadview Ave Toronto, ON M4M 2H1 Canada
Review:
these are
 the classic churrasco sandwich looks messy from the inside but its filled to the brim
  goat fries

tip for spice  level
 there are 2 spice levels to choose from for the sandwich medium  spicy i chose the latter if you think you can tolerate the heat go for it it complements everything

Address: 672A St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B1 Canada
Review: the food here might be up to taste my bf loved his lamb dish i can only finish half of my zucchini but this place no doubt has one of the best atmosphere among restaurants ive been too the furniture decoration art pieces utensils and music all came together so nicely for not just a delightful meal but a delightful experience

Address: 672A St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B1 Canada
Review:
been to this place many times for various occasions

the food is great  whether its for dinner lunch or as of recently brunch great presentation very similar to more high end iranian restaurants in iran variety of options on the menu from kebabs to stews to small platters for share

very happy with their recent brunch addition to the menu delicious and reasonably price checkout the videos and photos from last year and this year

Address: 672A St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B1 Canada
Review:
initially we were seated quite close to another table however one of them offered to rearrange some furniture and move our table further apart from the table next to us which i really appreciated the service was quite relaxed or because they were busy we had to flag someone down a couple of times and so we didnt feel rushed until they had another reservation a couple hours later

generous portion sizes for the price and great balance of flavours  i could easily share or have enough left over for another meal the lamb skewer was tender and moist while the lamb stew had a good amount of bitesized lamb and aromatic and flavourful rice while i would order a skewer or stew dish again the dessert pastry roll seemed smaller than expected compared to the mains and couldve had more pistachio taste

Address: 672A St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B1 Canada
Review: what a gem i went late on a rainy sunday night and it was full and vibrant the waitress was very kind and helpful with the menu i had a delicious dish of stewed chicken with rice and a bright salad of greens pomegranate ground walnuts and white cheese the flavours were tangy and complex and really dont need as much salt as chef is using definitely will return with friends to sample more items a welcoming oasis on an otherwise dull stretch of st clair

Address: 672A St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6C 1B1 Canada
Review: went there for summerlicious food was very good especially liked mirza ghasemi ghormeh sabzi and ice in paradis for 44 i found the quantity in each dish to be very generous service was perfectfriendly  had better baklava but all the rest was spot on

Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review: ive been coming to jerusalem for as long as i remember whether it was to celebrate birthdays celebrate easter or just to have a dinner with the family the food has always been delicious sometimes the tabouli is missing some lemon but overall its good the falafel here is probably my favourite and the fried eggplant the dinner for two is such a good deal and theres a lot of food you definitely get your moneys worth sometimes service is a bit a slow but overall the servers are very nice

Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review:
food was good  we tried the taste of jerusalem dinner for two   had yummy eggplant  hummus baba ganoush  the chicken and lamb skewers were good as well  the dinner for two could really be a dinner for 2 and a child
good service  good atmosphere

the menu you see now has actually increased in price   the dinner for two was 50 now its 54  a glass of wine was 14
total all in with tax and 15 tips was about 80   a bit pricey   but gotta try it at least once

Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review:
this restaurant is now on my list of favorites in toronto
clean and calm with classical music in the background  the decor is pretty and simple which is a charm as
we ordered the plate for two and we had enough the plates were big and everything was delicious  we also tried a different beer i recommend it
my experience was 100 positive  i will definitely come back and for sure very hungry

Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review:
i ordered the kafta plate with an extra skewer the meat was very good although underseasoned i believe the intention was that the diner is supposed to add salt and pepper to their taste so i dont really mind it the fries and rice were not bad the tahini was very good the bread was also very good
the service was good enough i wasnt pampered i also wasnt ignored
the decor is pretty nice floors were clean table wasnt sticky and oddly enough the dining area had no smell at all which for the most part is a good thing although i wondered why the restaurant didnt even smell of the food they make
i would come back again to try the other dishes

Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review: love their food great shish tawoo and lamb kebabs

Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review: ive been coming to jerusalem for as long as i remember whether it was to celebrate birthdays celebrate easter or just to have a dinner with the family the food has always been delicious sometimes the tabouli is missing some lemon but overall its good the falafel here is probably my favourite and the fried eggplant the dinner for two is such a good deal and theres a lot of food you definitely get your moneys worth sometimes service is a bit a slow but overall the servers are very nice
