Address: 955 Eglinton Avenue W York, ON M6C 2C4 Canada
Review: love their food great shish tawoo and lamb kebabs

Address: 1991 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review:
this is my favourite indian restaurant in toronto the staff are friendly food is delicious and the menu is robust so youll never be bored as there are always news things to try

ive done both dine in and take out both are great

what ive tried that ive loved
 bhindi rajsthani  deep fried okra side dish ive never had anything like it this dish was recommended by the owner and was so crispy and delicious

 stuffed spinach paneer  so unique and flavourful

 briyani  very unique in its presentation with a piece of pita on top of it

 lasooni dhaniya

Address: 1991 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review: great indian restaurant food is quite good and can be adjusted to your spice tolerance the servers are very nice and informative walked us through the entire menu and had good recommendations we ordered the stuffed mushrooms lamb chops burra lamb rogan josh dal makhni chicken dum biryani and pudina paranthas lamb chops burra dal makhni and chicken biryani were really good lamb rogan josh was their own version and was decent worth a visit if you like indian food

Address: 1991 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review:
the vibes are so cool therethe music slogans paintings and ofcourse food everything is just great
bhindi rajasthani deserves a special shoutout

Address: 1991 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review: the food here is mindblowingly good the lamb was succulent and mouthwatering the butter chicken outshines all other indian restaurants in toronto 10010 if you havent tried this spot you are missing out and that needs to change

Address: 1991 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4S 1Z8 Canada
Review:
khau gully is one of the finest restaurants with indian cuisine loved the food and tase is really very mesmerizing it reminded me of the food taste from back homeloved the food and the servers were also very nice we tried the vegetarian appetizer platter  fried okras which were really tasty

we also loved the kofta sham savere and lasuni dhaniya paneer in the main course both of these sabjis were up to the marka gem of a eatery hidden in eglinton and yonge food is delicious just perfect they accommodate customers wish as per their choice we went for our friends birthday and they gave us the best service as well as served awesome food thank you khau gully as we had a memorable and tasty experience

highly recommended

Address: 288 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M4R 1B2 Canada
Review: the restaurant was able to place a reservation for a group of friends and family a week earlier the staff was very accommodating and always checked in to see if we needed anything else their food was very generous in portions and it was incredibly tasty overall great service and good one of the best thai spots in toronto

Address: 288 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M4R 1B2 Canada
Review:
we love thairoomgrand we actually come here many times and they are always giving us best service best food and reasonable prices

the staffs are super friendly they are checking how we are doing the food is delicious good portions and the prices is really reasonable too considering the portion that is so big

two of us came and we spent around 60 for 2 main courses and 1 appetizer and even that we never finish our food so we can take out and eat that for tomorrow lunch thats how big the portion is

Address: 288 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M4R 1B2 Canada
Review: came here in july and it was the best thai restaurant ive been to in toronto the menu has a great selection more options than many other restaurants and the dishes are thoughtfully presented despite the affordable prices the food had generous portions and was very flavourful  especially the tom yum soup also would highly recommend the mango dessert  so beautiful and delicious not to mention a tastefully decorated ambiance and friendly service would love to come back

Address: 288 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M4R 1B2 Canada
Review: this cozy place on eglinton has a decent not too spicy kao soi with a different presentation than ive had before and included a hardboiled egg which was tasty albeit odd we also had the equally yummy malay curry the flavors of the two dishes were so similar that after a while we couldnt tell them apart the holy basil beef was nice only absent a distinct a basil scent or flavor would not recommend the amount of rice with that dish was shocking although beautifully presented the place was empty except for some takeaway pickups it was midweek so not too surprising our server was delightful and even recommended another thai restaurant in the area we should try

Address: 288 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M4R 1B2 Canada
Review:
we had a great time dining here we ordered 2 main dishes and an appetizer food portioning was generous even for its price thats leaning towards expensive

we ordered cashew nut chicken and beef massaman curry for the main dish and both were great the chicken and beef were not chewy at all

for the appetizer we had cripsy fried tofu portion was huge its firm tofu nice and crispy but flavour wise quite bland the peanut sauce is bland and too chunky but still a good shareable

we also had coconut rice for the sides my girlfriend was shook lol when she first saw the coconut rice were served with rainbow sprinkles on top the texture was rice pudding like too mushy and tasted a little too sweet not umami

overall with a great service provided and for the price we paid it was a pleasant evening spent

Address: 288 Eglinton Avenue W Toronto, ON M4R 1B2 Canada
Review: the restaurant was able to place a reservation for a group of friends and family a week earlier the staff was very accommodating and always checked in to see if we needed anything else their food was very generous in portions and it was incredibly tasty overall great service and good one of the best thai spots in toronto

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: service was quick and staff are friendly we ordered chicken and lamb skewers braised beef noodle soup and chicken cutletor filet noodle soup id say that the lamb skewers were my favourite it was so tender and flavourful perfectly seasoned i knocked off a star because the soupbroth had no flavour to it i ordered extra spicy because i love spicy foods and although it looks spicy it wasnt at all didnt even get a little kick of spiciness which was a bit disappointing because i expected it to be spicy other than that it was very filling and we really enjoyed our time dining here

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: very tasty food and cozy environment  read the reviews and decided to go and try the food  the portion is not small enough to fill up  thanks to the staff who served us  they are very kind and welcoming  the guy gave us a fork so that we would not suffer with chopsticks

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
the portion is ridiculous great for sharing for sure the lame on a stick is delicious the best thing there i might go back for something else and try their other noodles the non caffeinated drinks are also yummy great service

their noodle though is good but flavour wise is not very flavourful but maybe i should have ask them for something else on the side

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: i came here because of a tiktok the food was really good the taste of the dan dan noodles were really good not as spicy as i thought they would be the beef noodle soup tasted like home the beef was so tender however i got the flat noodles which were too thick for my liking but that was my fault overall great service and the food was really nice

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
delicious food had the stir fried noodles with chicken thick round noodle size and it was delicious nice large portion and the service was quick  i got take out and had the food within 10 mins
will definitely visit again

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: service was quick and staff are friendly we ordered chicken and lamb skewers braised beef noodle soup and chicken cutletor filet noodle soup id say that the lamb skewers were my favourite it was so tender and flavourful perfectly seasoned i knocked off a star because the soupbroth had no flavour to it i ordered extra spicy because i love spicy foods and although it looks spicy it wasnt at all didnt even get a little kick of spiciness which was a bit disappointing because i expected it to be spicy other than that it was very filling and we really enjoyed our time dining here

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
delicious food had the stir fried noodles with chicken thick round noodle size and it was delicious nice large portion and the service was quick  i got take out and had the food within 10 mins
will definitely visit again

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
i really wanted to like this place maybe i ordered the wrong thing it was average there were a few things i did not enjoy but first the restaurant itself was clean and bright the tables small and enough for 2 people and two bowls of noodles the service was good and i liked their bubble tea
i ordered the pickled vegetable beef noodle soup the beef was so overcooked it was all crumbling in my soup and there wasnt a lot the noodle portion sizes were crazy big crazy big there were so many noodles in there it felt like the more i ate the more noodles there were the flavour was alright
it was definitely something that can be shared among two people or they could even have a size small

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
9610
one of the best noodle dishes in the city for sure please visit the restaurant as well as it will enhance your experience

ordered through doordash before once and enjoyed the beef noodles this time tried the braised beef noodles and it was delicious reheated the broth but that was due to my dasher not putting in a heating bag 9210

reply to owner hello i just visited the restaurant and the noodles were absolutely delectable its a different experience eating them fresh the waitress with glasses was very polite and accommodating my impression has become even better now 9610
theirs no such thing as a perfect dish but this is close

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
this place is beyond amazing i cant put into words the noodles i had i know it seems very menial however these noodles are some of the best noodles ive ever had the combination of the love put into the hand pulling done by the chef and the seemingly handful yet carefully chosen spices blend perfectly into a medley of amazing taste

i cant wait to go back and try more of their food

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review: i have been here twice so far and have thoroughly enjoyed the food both the times i would 100 recommend their braised beef noodle stir fried chicken noodle and lamb skewers the server jay was so helpful and patient with our questions overall i highly recommend this restaurant

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
for the price you are paying you get a huge quantity i ordered the braised beef noodle soup and you can choose your spice level the beef was very tender and the broth very flavorful

i also ordered the bean noodle which i thought was jellyfish at first really delicious appetizer i think it was topped with chili oil

restaurant is relatively small but humble and i really enjoyed my meal fair price point for flavor and quantity definitely appreciated that

Address: 1755 Lake Shore Boulevard W Toronto, ON M6S 5A3 Canada
Review:
the service was not good the attendant didnt offer or explained anything about the order they cleaned out table with a smelly piece of cloth splashing us in the meantime they didnt dry the table properly we have to ask for tea cup to be changed twice as it was dirty with pink lipstick the pottery was old it wasnt worth the money spent
the place has a very nice view

Address: 1755 Lake Shore Boulevard W Toronto, ON M6S 5A3 Canada
Review: i love the atmosphere perfect location however our food was burnt it didnt taste bad and they dont do pitchers  but the service was good

Address: 1755 Lake Shore Boulevard W Toronto, ON M6S 5A3 Canada
Review:
sunnyside cafe a summer must visit good service and view the best  try the mexican bulldog drink
yummy

Address: 1755 Lake Shore Boulevard W Toronto, ON M6S 5A3 Canada
Review: nice outdoor place to eat near the humber bay park interesting drinks and very tasty pizza i suggest to try the upside down beer drink in the photo

Address: 1755 Lake Shore Boulevard W Toronto, ON M6S 5A3 Canada
Review:
i recently had the pleasure of visiting sunnyside pavilion a charming spot for frozen drinks by the lake and i must say that my experience was absolutely delightful thanks to the exceptional service provided by maddy our server from the moment we arrived maddys warm smile and friendly demeanor set the tone for a memorable outing

maddys attentiveness and professionalism were truly remarkable she went above and beyond to ensure that our visit was enjoyable and that we had everything we needed her knowledge of the menu and drink offerings was extensive and she took the time to explain each option in detail making thoughtful recommendations based on our preferences her genuine passion for her work was evident and it added an extra layer of enjoyment to our time at sunnyside pavilion

not only was maddy prompt in taking our orders but she also ensured that our drinks and food were delivered promptly and in perfect condition despite the bustling atmosphere she managed to handle multiple tables with ease always making sure to check in on us to ensure we were satisfied with our experience

sunnyside pavilions location by the lake is simply enchanting the serene view coupled with the delightful summer vibes creates a picturesque backdrop for enjoying frozen drinks maddys cheerful presence added to the overall ambiance making us feel even more immersed in the carefree atmosphere

now lets talk about the drinks sunnyside pavilions frozen drink selection is nothing short of fantastic from fruity blends to refreshing classics there was something to satisfy every palate thanks to maddys expertise we were able to sample a variety of frozen concoctions each one more delicious than the last the presentation was impeccable and the flavors were perfectly balanced it was truly a treat for the taste buds

in addition to the exceptional service and delectable drinks sunnyside pavilion offers a delightful space to relax and unwind the outdoor seating area is comfortable and offers a great view of the lake allowing guests to soak up the sunshine while enjoying their drinks the overall atmosphere is inviting making it an ideal spot to gather with friends or spend a leisurely afternoon by the water

in conclusion my experience at sunnyside pavilion thanks to the attentive service provided by maddy was absolutely outstanding her genuine hospitality knowledge and professionalism truly elevated our visit and made it an unforgettable one i highly recommend visiting sunnyside pavilion and having the pleasure of maddys excellent service youre in for a delightful experience by the lake

the place has a very nice view

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review:
we had a fantastic meal here the standouts were the scallops the deer cavatelli and the boar chop the boar chop was actually one of my favourite dishes ive had at any restaurant in the city so juicy and flavourful
the service from jade was awesome as well she was so sweet and attentive we will be back

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review: really great dining experience here drink selection was eclectic and great the servers were very friendly and helpful my friend ordered the venison while i had the duck the plating was beautifully presented i will say my duck was a bit overcooked to my liking but overall the experience was great would definitely come back

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review:
antler is the restaurant that i owe my entire culinary journey to i first came here during the tail end of my university days i lived off free campus food cheap pizza and late night shawarmas up until this point antler was the very first high end restaurant that i visited a lot of memories were made here my first date my first time having game meat an amazon based collaboration dinner with dom ive been making visits ever since

you really cant go wrong with any of chef hunters dishes they are all phenomenal and in my humble opinion are well deserving of a michelin star antler has the identity the culinary inventiveness the atmosphere and the service that is expected of a michelin restaurant this restaurant will be a forever staple in toronto and i highly recommend that you dine here when the chance arrives

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review:
we sat at the kitchen table for those who like cooking its a perfect spot to see everything that the chef is doing
the food was good yes but we had higher expectations the food was missing a little bit of peps we did not got any dessert as we were slightly disappointed
it is still a nice place a fancy stakehouse

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review: staff were very polite and friendlythe owners and staff care about your experience and it shows i didnt drive 5 hrs to toronto just to east here but if i had i would not have been disappointed the pan seared duck was phenomenal to say the least if you dont try this place you are missing out big time

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review:
we had a fantastic meal here the standouts were the scallops the deer cavatelli and the boar chop the boar chop was actually one of my favourite dishes ive had at any restaurant in the city so juicy and flavourful
the service from jade was awesome as well she was so sweet and attentive we will be back

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review: really great dining experience here drink selection was eclectic and great the servers were very friendly and helpful my friend ordered the venison while i had the duck the plating was beautifully presented i will say my duck was a bit overcooked to my liking but overall the experience was great would definitely come back

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review:
antler is the restaurant that i owe my entire culinary journey to i first came here during the tail end of my university days i lived off free campus food cheap pizza and late night shawarmas up until this point antler was the very first high end restaurant that i visited a lot of memories were made here my first date my first time having game meat an amazon based collaboration dinner with dom ive been making visits ever since

you really cant go wrong with any of chef hunters dishes they are all phenomenal and in my humble opinion are well deserving of a michelin star antler has the identity the culinary inventiveness the atmosphere and the service that is expected of a michelin restaurant this restaurant will be a forever staple in toronto and i highly recommend that you dine here when the chance arrives

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review:
we sat at the kitchen table for those who like cooking its a perfect spot to see everything that the chef is doing
the food was good yes but we had higher expectations the food was missing a little bit of peps we did not got any dessert as we were slightly disappointed
it is still a nice place a fancy stakehouse

Address: 1454 Dundas Street West Toronto, ON M6J 1Y6 Canada
Review: staff were very polite and friendlythe owners and staff care about your experience and it shows i didnt drive 5 hrs to toronto just to east here but if i had i would not have been disappointed the pan seared duck was phenomenal to say the least if you dont try this place you are missing out big time

Address: 1545 Eglinton Avenue  W Toronto, ON M6E 2G8 Canada
Review:
doesnt get better than this for jamaican food stopped by for a midnight snack and got a small jerk chicken and a small jerk pork to share with oxtail gravy of course and goes without saying rice and peas also got a salt fish fritter everything was just so amazingly good you just have to walk by the place and smell the smoke coming off the grill to know what the food tastes like
ate in the car cause we couldnt wait inhaled it then i started getting mad thinking about the times i wasted money getting jamaican food from places that are subpar
im already thinking about when we can go back

Address: 1545 Eglinton Avenue  W Toronto, ON M6E 2G8 Canada
Review: best jamaican bbq that you can get they have jerk chicken jerk pork rice and peas coleslaw fried fish snapper or saltfish topped with onions and carrots soup dumplings festivals and more but most importantly they have sauce and not afraid to give it overall the food is very flavorful their customer service is great and thats what you want from a business so you can keep coming backthe line was long before opening but after that it was moving hope this small business will always stay despite all the construction

Address: 1545 Eglinton Avenue  W Toronto, ON M6E 2G8 Canada
Review:
the smoke from the bbq and the line up could be seen from a distance one table was there to cut up the meat and the grill with pork was on the other side cash only at this restaurant  if you dont have theres an atm inside the fee is 250
they have a variety of items on the menu theres no menu by the way just askthere was fried chicken on the left and dumplings festival fried plantain  escovitch fish on the other side  they have oxtail the night we visited  you can order the small for 9 with or without rice 2 meat only or 3 large meat and rice and peas  ask for gravy on the rice and get bbq sauce on your meat  you got to go outside once you ordered for the bbq items  it is worth the drive to oakwood and eglinton and worth the wait

Address: 1545 Eglinton Avenue  W Toronto, ON M6E 2G8 Canada
Review: they are providing best quality food instant really appreciate to their hard work

Address: 1545 Eglinton Avenue  W Toronto, ON M6E 2G8 Canada
Review: jerk chicken was juicy smokey full of flavour finger licking good jerk pork also juicy and delicious rice and peas and festivals were on point too  will be ordering regularly

Address: 3070 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Z7 Canada
Review: i have been here a few times and the quality of food and service is consistent everything on the menu is really good and wont disappoint their chicken  waffle sandwich is a must try and dont miss out on their home fries i also enjoy their eggs benedict only downside is that they can get pretty long line ups but it is worth the wait

Address: 3070 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Z7 Canada
Review:
very popular for brunch so if you havent reserved be prepared for as much as an hour long wait but usually youll be able to be seated in less than 30 minutes

i had the strawberry johnny pancakes very good very filling but got a look at their benny and it looked hearty as well

our server was very pleasant  attentive without being overbearing  and all the clientele seemed to be families or dating couples so if youre looking for a good brunch date place consider this one meat and vegetarian options available

Address: 3070 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Z7 Canada
Review:
delish ive been wanting to come here for a while now so some of my girls and i finally came in for brunch the other day and wow the explosion of flavour was so savoury and so unexpected i will definitely be back again
i highly recommend their chicken and waffles the candies jalape√±os were such a nice touch as well as the jalape√±o infused syrup my mouth is watering as i write this review right now  1010

Address: 3070 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Z7 Canada
Review: very popular and tiny place makes for a loud and chaotic environment servers vibe was overwhelmed at times having said that the food service was quick and the food itself was really really good we had the chicken and waffles and the special which was a pork belly benny

Address: 3070 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M6P 1Z7 Canada
Review: had a bit of a wait here but its worth i love the southern brunch flare and the food was honestly too good so flavourful and decadent i had the brisket benny which was perfectly cooked the brisket was fatty and tender and the home fries were so buttery crisp and so indulgent the staff was also very nice and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there

Address: 280 Spadina Ave Unit M-N Toronto, ON M5T 0A1 Canada
Review: 5 stars for this restaurant  delicious dumplings and an unbelievable cost  they were nice and juicy  be ready for long line ups due to how good they taste and the low price  the wait isnt too long just have some patience as its worth it

Address: 280 Spadina Ave Unit M-N Toronto, ON M5T 0A1 Canada
Review: looking for a reasonablypriced dumpling spot in torontos chinatown juicy dumplings your place ive heard that this place does get super busy but we were lucky enough to find seats we ordered the panfried mini soup dumpling with crab and pork panfried chicken dumpling and beef balls and everything was delicious the crab and pork dumplings were a hit and definitely something well try to replicate at home they should get better microphone and speakers though because i found the cashier hard to understand its a shame that their customerfacing staff seemed cold and distant at the time of our visit having said that overall we enjoyed our time here the food here at juicy dumpling is excellent and i would definitely recommend them

Address: 280 Spadina Ave Unit M-N Toronto, ON M5T 0A1 Canada
Review:
juicy dumplings review

i recently visited juicy dumpling and had a good experience the vegetable buns including the one with chinese spinach and the mushroom bun that turned out to be filled with green veggies were delicious despite being busy the service was friendly highly recommended for dumplings lovers

Address: 280 Spadina Ave Unit M-N Toronto, ON M5T 0A1 Canada
Review: we were visiting toronto and just had to stop by here for lunch this place has the best soup dumplings once you bite into them they burst with flavors and the hot sauce they give just adds that extra kick of flavor super inexpensive for what you get they have a sit down area as well definitely recommend to give this place a try if you are on the fence about it when i visit again i will be back

Address: 280 Spadina Ave Unit M-N Toronto, ON M5T 0A1 Canada
Review: while the service was average due to the selfserve setup the dumplings at this dumpling joint were simply amazing they were juicy delicious and exceeded all of my expectations overall i highly recommend giving this place a try for their exceptional dumplings

Address: 2150 Yonge street Toronto, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: when expecting better you are served with best that really happened at juicy dumplings a very small shop a very simple atmosphere and a short menu but worth trying all the menu items ordered crispy chicken veg dumplings chicken pan fried dumplings mushroom bun all were so good cant control our taste bud so got another chicken dumplings and crispy chicken will definitely go there again

Address: 2150 Yonge street Toronto, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: a great place to get a quick little snack my favourite is the panfried soup dumplings theyre definitely best fresh so i would recommend eating them as soon as you get them the restaurant has an eating area inside kind of like a cafeteria theres some street parking out front as well as some side streets to the right of the restaurant

Address: 2150 Yonge street Toronto, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review:
super quick easy to order very reasonable prices and deliciousmy 3rd time here this week

soup dumpling pork amd tried the pan fried crab and pork

more soup in the steamed  onesyummmmm

becoming my regular meant to order the steamed pork as wellnext time

Address: 2150 Yonge street Toronto, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: insane value everything we ordered tasted very good and was extremely reasonably priced i believe we ordered 5 items today and paid just shy of 25 food came quickly and was fresh no complaints whatsoever

Address: 2150 Yonge street Toronto, ON M4S 2A8 Canada
Review: these are some of the most amazing dumplings the value of the s1 is mindblowing would totally recommend

Address: 128 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
this is the third location of hana don and the first location downtown it specializes more on premium seafood donburi so expect more on the menu if sashimi is more what you like

it also has donburis that are found at the other locations though like chicken katsu or sous vide beef

all the donburis are very colorful and plated nicely a donburi can definitely fill you up but if you can eat a lot might be better to order an appetizer too the price ranges from 19 to 30 for a donburi depending on what you order the most expensive one is the lobster donburi which can be upwards to 70 a donburi

food comes out relatively quickly but always check their instagram for any specials that might be going on

Address: 128 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: first time in toronto chose this japanese restaurant and the food is great we chose 8pc sushi set beef don and nagoya don at the end we also ordered the mucha cheesecake and all dishes taste absolutely great highly recommended and will definitely come back

Address: 128 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
went to try hana don and we ordered
 salmon carpaccii
yuzu ankimo  monkfish liver with ponzu sauce
 toyoso don  sweet shrimps salmon white fish scallop  ikura on premium sushi rice
large premium hana don  hanas top selection of seasonal seafood which whole abalone on premium sushi rice

the fish is very fresh and delicious and there is so many options definitely coming back again

Address: 128 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: very fresh and delicious and the price is affordable  the best highquality seafood rice bowl in toronto more importantly the service was absolutely brilliant and friendly a casual atmosphere and great value for what youre getting even got a 10 off coupon after will visit again

Address: 128 Dundas Street W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: the sushi rice was superb all the seafood was cold and fresh i love their chefs choice of sushi we enjoyed eating here highly recommended

Address: 1800 Sheppard Ave E Unit 2020 Toronto, ON M2J 5A7 Canada
Review: this place is actually pretty good portion and price about right selection is a bit crowded they have dons and fried items and sushi rolls should focus on doing couple of things well but no real complain about quality servers are polite and courteous

Address: 1800 Sheppard Ave E Unit 2020 Toronto, ON M2J 5A7 Canada
Review:
definitely a treat as their bowls werent cheap but solid i ordered the aburi don to go and it was delicious fair portions and well seasoned rice came for 7pm on a friday and there was seating available

would recommend and comeback

Address: 1800 Sheppard Ave E Unit 2020 Toronto, ON M2J 5A7 Canada
Review:
it was just an amazing experience having dinner at hana don
although it wasnt planned but i am happy i decided to go to this place for dinner
i enjoyed all the dishes i ordered soup appetizers and the sushi was really amazing
i will definitely be coming back again whenever i will be around in the area and will also bring my family and friends over
the staff were really amazing very welcoming and highly friendly

Address: 1800 Sheppard Ave E Unit 2020 Toronto, ON M2J 5A7 Canada
Review:
great and cozy atmosphere delicious food friendly customer service

the menu has good selection of food and i have been working on trying each one

i have been  to this place several times never disappointed

Address: 1800 Sheppard Ave E Unit 2020 Toronto, ON M2J 5A7 Canada
Review: pretty nice restaurant at farewell mall good choice for a quick meal while shopping flavor is decent but nothing special seafood is not the best uni is not fresh enough

Address: 337 Oakwood Avenue Toronto, ON M6E 2V8 Canada
Review: the chuck burger was pretty great loved the flavors of brisket and other cuts of meat being tossed into a burger patty

Address: 337 Oakwood Avenue Toronto, ON M6E 2V8 Canada
Review: this is such a hidden gem the oakwood hardware is easily one of the best restaurants in all of toronto and i would even say in all of canada the ambiance service food and total experience are simply amazing

Address: 337 Oakwood Avenue Toronto, ON M6E 2V8 Canada
Review: i organized to host a baby shower at the oakwood hardware and anne and her staff were all very accommodating helpful and so kind the food even went with our theme and she was so flexible with our budget the staff and manager were so great on the day and all our guests had an amazing time

Address: 337 Oakwood Avenue Toronto, ON M6E 2V8 Canada
Review: we came here for brunch with a couple of friends our reservation was at 10 am and were the very first customer of the day we ordered the omelette special of the day and the sausage biscuit the former was delicious while the latter was decent the frites were well done we were a tad disappointed with the coffee refills we were not informed that the refills were an additionalcharge

Address: 337 Oakwood Avenue Toronto, ON M6E 2V8 Canada
Review:
just had one of the best burgers ive ever had in this city grab that oh burger and soak up this cozy incredible place seriously its the highlight of the whole neighbourhood for me

friendly staff great burger absolutely coming back

Restaurant_name: The Queen And Beaver Public House
Address: 35 Elm Street Toronto, ON M5G 1H1 Canada
Review: nice spot close to the eaton centre to grab a drink or two cozy interior that reminds me of european pubs and they pour a lovely pint of guinness here too didnt try the food but the menu looks interesting there are 2 floors as well as an upper patio friendly service by the bartender and front of house staff would recommend

Restaurant_name: The Queen And Beaver Public House
Address: 35 Elm Street Toronto, ON M5G 1H1 Canada
Review:
i came here for the first time as a friend who had a good experience

the bars atmosphere was great the decoration was also very english and the overall style was wellestablished but it is a pity that their food taste was relatively average the portion was small and the price was a bit too high

there were six people in our group and we ordered fish and chips seafood pie and curry rice
for the fish and chips friends like it and some dont because their fish is crispy on the top but soggy on the bottom if you like crispy skin their fish and chips might be for someone else
i ordered the seafood pie but it didnt surprise me that pie was almost all mashed potatoes and little seafood in it and it was about 30 so i didnt feel delighted

the service was okay because it was jampacked on weekends and the server rarely checked on us he talked fast and felt rushed all the time

overall the food could have been more satisfying the price was too high and the service was average

Restaurant_name: The Queen And Beaver Public House
Address: 35 Elm Street Toronto, ON M5G 1H1 Canada
Review:
cute british pub with hearty delicious food we sat on the 2nd floor which has a more casual vibe with couches tvs and bar service was excellent drink selection had some classic uk pints food was british pub style with great flavours we had the squashchickpeacurry  pie which had a lot of great spices and flavours with a nice tangy garnish my friend had the cod fish and chips which were perfectly cooked inside and out

update  came back in spring and its still excellent try the pies not too heavy and just right

Restaurant_name: The Queen And Beaver Public House
Address: 35 Elm Street Toronto, ON M5G 1H1 Canada
Review: great pub love the atmosphere wonderful space  i had the steak and onion pie and my wife had the rib eye steak   both dishes were extraordinary   love the staff very friendly   thanks

Restaurant_name: The Queen And Beaver Public House
Address: 35 Elm Street Toronto, ON M5G 1H1 Canada
Review: incredible burger ive never tasted anything like that holy f hand chopped meat cooked medium rare topped with aged cheddar bacon horseradish curry mustard and a side of fries with malt vinegar mayo made for some very unique and delicious flavours also the place itself is cozy and the staff was super friendly will definitely be back

Address: 100 Adelaide Street E Toronto, ON M5C 1K9 Canada
Review:
amazing seafood restaurant with great daily deals my friends and i came for the 100 for 100 oysters deal which is definitely a deal nowadays in toronto a lot of buck a shuck places have become 2 a shuck places so its rare to find such a high quality oyster deal the oysters are fresh a good size and beautifully plated the 100 came out staggered in 3 plates which were delivered over the span of an hour or so it did seem like they could bring them out at the pace that you requested we asked for a staggered delivery because one of our friends was running late we had three people sharing the oysters and it was a bit much  four people would have been ideal

we also tried the pd fries and icelandic cod both of which were good next time well probably bring more people to split the 100 oysters and try a few more of the apps definitely make a reservation if youre coming on a thursday since thats the day of the deal

Address: 100 Adelaide Street E Toronto, ON M5C 1K9 Canada
Review: if youre a lover of seafood pearl diver is absolute must im glad i made reservations for this place because even early on a weekday night it was completely packed   and for good reason great atmosphere cheerful service and above all else some really incredible dishes we ordered the sesame fried calamari pd fish  chips and the atlantic lobster the calamari might be my new favourite out of anywhere else ive tried the fish and chips were perfectly fried with a delicious flaky texture on the haddock the lobster was also quite large packed with meat and very flavourful so glad we tried this place on recommendation of a local friend i know well definitely be back again on our next visit to toronto

Address: 100 Adelaide Street E Toronto, ON M5C 1K9 Canada
Review: such a great local eatery the oysters are always great here the burger is one of the best in the city we went with other options this time and its all very delicious can get busy even during the week so make a reservation ahead of time

Address: 100 Adelaide Street E Toronto, ON M5C 1K9 Canada
Review: another delicious and classic seafood meal we went for dinner on a saturday evening and it really hits the spot the chowder was hearty and thick the lobster sliders are made with chunky lobster chunks and flavourful the fish and chips were crispy and better than your average pub type the oysters were a hit a great place for a casual seafood dinner

Address: 100 Adelaide Street E Toronto, ON M5C 1K9 Canada
Review:
cozy  that is how i would describe this quaint and an charming nook right off the busy streets of adelaide  a quirky bar celebrating all that is seafood  the decor and the ambience of this venue is memorablefeaturing anchors ropes iridescent shells and fishnets and with the walls and posts coated with blackboard paint features of the daily specials and the pace is allows you take a pause and breathe but that does not the service gets shortchanged all of the servers are prompt and with adequate knowledge of the menu and faster on their feet in bringing the food over

for seafood lovers look no further as pearl diver features a wide array of freshly shucked oysters all across the nation and a wider array of malted beverages to wash them down i had the oysters from pei with the mignoette sauces alongside hot mustard and they were divine i had a thre grilled sea bream and my friend dined on the  fish and chipsi wasnt particularly attached to my sea bream but that is no bearing on the chef sea bream is encased with bones but which fish isnt my friends entree had me salivating for more

overall would definitely make another trip

Address: 969 Coxwell Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 3G4 Canada
Review: wow wow wow hidden gem in the city the menu alone brought us there the photos on instagram looked great we get there and the smell drew is right in we got the classic chicken and flank steak sandwiches and the tater tots supreme generous portions and taste extraordinaire beautifully crafted flavour overload in a great way nothing overpowered anything else it was so well balanced and just taste with every bite rustic ideas but modern spins on it and it really brought out the right impacts messy goodness and you love every bite of it definitely going back

Address: 969 Coxwell Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 3G4 Canada
Review: for someone that isnt muslim this is a good non halal option i ordered the classic chicken sandwich and i didnt pay much attention to the actual description which i should have when i think classic chicken sandwich i think fried chicken with mayonnaise the chicken was cooked well however it was way too sweet for my liking and had no mayonnaise on the sandwich whatsoever personally i dont see the connection between classic chicken sandwich and this sandwich id like to know what other people think i wouldnt recommend this sandwich as a classic sandwich i could only eat half way to sweet for me also the bun was supper soggy and i only live five min away as a suggestion id recommend putting a traditional chicken sandwich on the menu that is savory and not sweet for 1689 i also think the product doesnt reflect the price definitely over priced as well i tried eating the other half but had to throw it out its like eating a spoon of honey what a shame id be interested to know if anyone else has other recommendations on where i can get some good fried chicken non halal thanks

Address: 969 Coxwell Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 3G4 Canada
Review: its ok heard alot of buzz about this place and their big sandwiches went in for a takeway snadwich and ordered the fried chicken sandwich it took alot of time to make which i was fine when i went to pay and tip it came to about 20 bucks which when i opened the food doesnt seem worth it the sandwich was ok but i wouldnt be going back anytime soon

Address: 969 Coxwell Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 3G4 Canada
Review:
im what you would call serious about my eating choices and i love the food there it is wholesome if you want to get something thats notsogreat you can choose that option
if you want to have something that is clean theres that option too
you wont get the ugh why did i eat that feel its worth the money and its fresh my first time there was great and i would definitely go again

if youre in the area give them a try its worth it

Address: 969 Coxwell Avenue Toronto, ON M4C 3G4 Canada
Review:
way too expensive for what you get 30 with tax for a chicken sandwich and brussel sprout salad no drink included

the food is alright honestly as far as fried chicken sandwiches go there is a lot of competition in this area putting out a better product for less the cuban was good but again why is it 15tax for just a sandwich i will echo another review here and say this is beyond inflation i went during peak times and the place was empty it has potential i want to like this place

i went here twice really wanted to find a reliable sandwich shop in the village the atmosphere is actually nice beers in the fridge could be way more popular if prices were lower

sadly i wont be returning a third time too expensive for a quick lunch not as substantial as a dinner elsewhere at the same price

to the owners if you read this i suggest either increasing the quality of your chicken including a soft drink if youre going to charge 11 for a side or overall just lowering your prices even a dollar or two i would go once a week if i could get a cuban sandwich small fry and can of coke for 18 or 25 with a beer

Address: 401 Danforth Avenue Danforth Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review:
we had such an amazing meal and experience here the servers were super nice and attentive we had the assorted meat platter momos which were delicious with the sauces they teach you to mix the chili chicken was also super flavourful and the meal came with soup and a ginger cardamom tea

prices were very good and they had lots of seating inside and out we enjoyed a nice sunny evening on the patio highly recommend

Address: 401 Danforth Avenue Danforth Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review: my girlfriend and i found this spot accidentally while visiting toronto from buffalo years ago since coming here the first time this place has become a destination for us and we try to make a point of getting here at least once a year because of the pandemic and resulting border closure we hadnt been in over two years we were finally able to make it up yesterday and its still as good as ever food service vibe all on point coming here absolutely made our day in toronto a 1010 thank you guys btw i recommend the tingma buns dipped in the momo sauces they give with a bit of soy sauce

Address: 401 Danforth Avenue Danforth Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review: must go place for momo dont miss out on their amazing mixed platter which allows you to experience all the fantastic flavors they offer the staff were incredibly helpful and made our  dining experience even better the overall atmosphere is pleasant making it a great spot to visit with family

Address: 401 Danforth Avenue Danforth Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review:
came by for a quick bite and definitely glad we did inside there are colourful flags with writing the establishment itself is large there is a small patio outside

the service was great very attentive also they serve water with chilled glasses

tried several different momo from shrimp vegetarian and chicken butter chicken

the sauces they provide definitely added to the flavour of momos the butter chicken momo was our favourite our least favourite was probably the shrimp

they provide complimentary tea and that was delicious

Address: 401 Danforth Avenue Danforth Toronto, ON M4K 1P1 Canada
Review: first time trying tibetan food and the server was so patient when explaining the menu it was a relaxing dining experience i had 10 pieces of dumplings a salad and a bowl of soup for around 20 however if you were hungry you might need a bit more food

Address: 788 Broadview ave Toronto, ON M4K 2P7 Canada
Review:
i tried a chicken steak and pork taco they were tasty id say the pineapple in the pork taco really made that one stand out as extra delicious you get a generous amount of protein in each taco

the service was efficient there is a qr code for the menu which is not my favourite but cost effective  this can help keep the food prices reasonable

the atmosphere was fun and casual

Address: 788 Broadview ave Toronto, ON M4K 2P7 Canada
Review:
a gem discovery and will definitely be back to try other bites

here we ordered the tacos de birria con queso comes with four tacos grilled together with cheese topped with slow cooked beef marinated in mexican chiles salsa with a side of birria consomm√© cilantro onions limes and salsa super delicious

we also got some tacos baja style specifically the pescado deep fried battered fish served in a blue corn tortilla this was definitely good but maybe not what i would try again here i would opt for the birria or new dishes

Address: 788 Broadview ave Toronto, ON M4K 2P7 Canada
Review:
the birria here is excellent  i didnt have a single complaint about textures or flavors or anything else to do with this place

there is a reason the rating is still so high even with the 1 star reviews  100 go try it yourself

Address: 788 Broadview ave Toronto, ON M4K 2P7 Canada
Review: the cuisine was incredibly delicious and brought a sense of comfort the staff who attended to our orders was both fast and amiable

Address: 788 Broadview ave Toronto, ON M4K 2P7 Canada
Review:
the food was amazing  super flavourful not salty at all just packed with flavour the presentation was great and authentic the place is cute and quaint and feels comfortable with delicious food the server was super kind and charismatic the food came out quick
i had the tacos of nopal and hongos saut√©ed cactus and mushroom and they was the best the torta de chorizo  queso sausagecheese sandwich was delicious the tres leche and churros were amazing and the birria tacos were the best ive had so far in the city they have horchata too

Address: 1333 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1N1 Canada
Review:
cozy space with great vibes finally came to try the food after being curious about the space for awhile we had a great time the tables are close together but we got to have a nice chat with our table neighbour and share recommendations on the menu

we ended up ordering 2 appetisers and 3 mains  the indonesian fried rice dish was our favourite super fragrant and was the perfect combo of salty sweet and spicy definitely get this with the satay chicken skewers that house made satay sauce  yum we cant wait to come again to try the rest of the menu service was great and food came promptly we spent less than 100 on the food for 2 and were stuffed

highly recommend this local gem thank you to the team that served us and fed us

Address: 1333 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1N1 Canada
Review:
cozy warm atmosphere friendly staff and good service it was my first time trying dutch cuisine and i liked it we had bitterballen snert frikandellen boerenenkool and poffertjes the food was tasty full of flavor and wellpresented

four stars due to reasonable criticism first portions are tiny and i didnt feel satisfied with the dish and second the problem is that the menu is limited there should be a broader spectrum of dutch dishes for example notorious pannenkoek was not on the menu for desserts there is only one option

overall it was a great experience and i would come back again and recommend it as an introduction to dutch cuisine

Address: 1333 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1N1 Canada
Review:
i came here once for genever once for rijsttafel and finally here just for dinner

i really wish it was better the flavours just dont cut it for indonesian food we had a lot of indo food in amsterdam including rijsttafel a bunch of times at various places this was as good as the worst place we tried there i do recall precovid the rijsttafel here being disappointing but this city is incredibly limited for this food so i was just grateful to have it at all

this time as nice as the staff are they cant make up for the poorly flavoured food the satays were edible but not good tasteless just some overcooked chicken skewers the nasi goreng was bitter and bland and the plate was just ugly and brown not even a cucumber for colour and where was the egg

the bitterballen were actually perfect i dont know why i ordered them though because i didnt really get the hype about them in netherlands so i dont know why i thought that would change ill say borrels are almost identical to the ones we had in the hague so they do succeed there very authentic

the fries were just terrible they tasted and felt like they had been fried cooled and refried about 10 times and then sat out all night under the headlamp rock hard and full of grease and didnt even taste good we had loads of dutch fries in our visits and to say these are anything like the ones there is not even reasonable i dont really know what to make of it if they cant make good fries

its hard to find good indomalay food in toronto so i appreciate borrel trying by doing not only the white dutch food but also the netherlands great indonesian cuisine culture i just think there are other restaurants in toronto that do indo flavours so much better

also if you havent had genever do it when youre here it is almost impossible to find in ontario and its not available in any lcbo or any other toronto bar as far as i know i have to give kudos to borrel for going through all the trouble of bringing this spirit to us

i think it seems like the dutch food is generally welldone so if i ever do return ill just stick to that and genever and go elsewhere for indonesian food

Address: 1333 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1N1 Canada
Review: this was my first time trying dutch food and it was quite good came here on a saturday morning for brunch with a friend menu is simple and not too much items it was good that we were also able to order from their snack menu too bitterballen was a surprise for me and it was delicious frittata was good and even better with the sausage my friend also enjoyed her frikmuffin but was surprised with how tiny her portion sandwich was service was great and staff was attentive overall its a great place to introduce yourself to dutch food delicious and my friend says is authentic i just wished they opened for lunch during weekdays too

Address: 1333 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1N1 Canada
Review: what a great place dutch food at first i thought itd be bread and meat and bland i was so wrong the menu is a fun easy introduction to many dishes ive never heard of before we tried the genever  traditional dutch spirit similar to gin we ordered two dishes from the indonesian part of the menu as well mmmmmmmm peanut sauce

Address: 1 Benvenuto Place Toronto, ON M4V 2L1 Canada
Review: we chose this restaurant to celebrate our anniversary and it was a great experience so much attention from our waiter he was professional and knowledgeable the food exceeded our expectations and let me tell you the filet mignon is one of the best in toronto only don alfonso can compete the cut was extremely tender cooked to perfection as ordered rare chicken was very tender too the coconut cream pie is delicious and the chocolate cake was so good as well had many textures and elements in it the atmosphere is so cozy and high end it felt like a restaurant in paris they have a wonderful view from the balcony if you are lucky enough they let you go and enjoy it for some time the only downside was that it was our anniversary and  my partner mentioned it in the reservation notes but no one acknowledged it a simple happy anniversary would do  but thats my only complain beautiful wonderful dining experience definitely recommend

Address: 1 Benvenuto Place Toronto, ON M4V 2L1 Canada
Review:
being trying to have everything go right on my anniversary for more than three years now and im so glad it finally did thanks to scaramouche

i do the reservations for my husband and i read tons of reviews on the place and it was an absolute dream come true my husband is an arvid stake eater and if he likes a stake its definitely good in his own words hed never had stake quite as good as this before

with scaramouche its not just the food thats great the ambience too is absolutely wonderful the waiters are kind we get our corner to ourselves and we enjoyed our meal in peace

i love love love this place and id be back in a few months again 100

Address: 1 Benvenuto Place Toronto, ON M4V 2L1 Canada
Review:
absolutely one of my favourite restaurants in the city its been around for so long for a reason

wonderful city views incredible service and in my opinion worth every penny for the experience

please never take the peppercorn fettuccine off the menu i have a tree nut allergy and they are able to accommodate this famous dish for me by not adding the pine nut crust it is one of my favourite things ive ever eaten here and a must try if you come

Address: 1 Benvenuto Place Toronto, ON M4V 2L1 Canada
Review: one of the best restaurant experiences ever thanks not only to the fantastic food but the wonderful service from start to finish by all the staff no wonder they have been around for decades perfect place for those special

Address: 1 Benvenuto Place Toronto, ON M4V 2L1 Canada
Review:
pro tip valet parking is included and the entrance is unmarked when you arrive at the condominium enter the roundabout and lookwait for the valet at the condo roundabout

must try if youre in town this place is a michelin gourmand bib but on its way to a star for sure every little bite was perfect and kudos to the pastry sous chef shienita for her amazing talents and she even came out to take a picture with me

Address: 414 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V9 Canada
Review: never a bad meal here  feeling so lucky we could slip in without a reservation so yeah reservations are a good idea here very good food our biggest dilemma was decided whether to go hard on the dips or save room for the entrees the cauliflower called our name highly recommend this spot and bring your friends

Address: 414 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V9 Canada
Review: it was my first time at fat pasha and it exceeded all expectations we got the fat salatim platter and everything was delicious the cocktails were great too i was most impressed with the service here the host and servers were amazing and super helpful we also loved the vibe of the outdoor patio 55 great place

Address: 414 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V9 Canada
Review: amazing food you will not be disappointed there is a wide variety of flavors that are all executed excellently be aware they do accept reservations so may fill up fast i would not skip on fat pasha if you are in toronto

Address: 414 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V9 Canada
Review: came to try the famous cauliflower was not disappointed i dont know how they did it but it is the best cauliflower ive ever had the back heated patio was also really lovely shared the cauliflower and small dips tray between 2 people and was more than enough food

Address: 414 Dupont Street Toronto, ON M5R 1V9 Canada
Review: stopped here for lunch food was amazing and very high quality we got one of the platters that was recommended by our waitress the hummuses were all very good and the falafels were perfect it was definitely big enough for 2 people there are so many other things that looksound great on the menu so we may need to try it again staff was also very friendly

Address: 81 Harbord Street Toronto, ON M5S 1G4 Canada
Review: i had an expectation and they met it  we reserved counter seats and the experience was great  our chef was making for us and a dining table which meant we basically had a private chef  the sushi were great there were some fish ive never had as sushi so it was surprising  overall excellent experience but definitely on the expensive side

Address: 81 Harbord Street Toronto, ON M5S 1G4 Canada
Review:
amazing omakaze spot the quality of sushi is outstanding and the variety of fish is very unique compared to other omakaze locations the restaurant has maybe 1520 seats so its very intimate great for anniversary or special occasions only due to the high price point

staff was extremely friendly and accommodating due to a few allergies i had

great experience overall definitely recommend

Address: 81 Harbord Street Toronto, ON M5S 1G4 Canada
Review: absolutely stunning omakase was able to secure a reservation port last minute their ingredients are fresh and expertly prepared if youre looking to treat your palette to a delicious adventure i highly recommend

Address: 81 Harbord Street Toronto, ON M5S 1G4 Canada
Review: this place is all about the food service was prompt the chefs are very talented and they ask you how the rice portion is and if you would like to up the wasabi level was well worth it a very memorable dining experience

Address: 81 Harbord Street Toronto, ON M5S 1G4 Canada
Review:
best dining experience in toronto everything is so beautifully and meticulously prepared its the perfect amount of food to not make you too full
the overall experience and food we enjoyed more than alo
only wish they had some cocktails on the menu

Address: 333 Lonsdale Rd Toronto, ON M5P 1R3 Canada
Review: first time to try pizza banfi last night with a party of 7 people it was highly recommended by friends who have been visited there for over a decade the inside was not so big but definitely a great ambience and cozy atmosphere high quality dishes  each of them was carefully crafted lovely presentation and they all tasted delicious we loved the pizza prosciutto e funghi and their thin crust was fantastic we also ordered the fish of the day  red snapper and mussels their seafood were fresh and seasoned well their ravioli and spaghetti were a must try on menu they did show warm hospitality the owner was super friendly staff were all polite and attentive they came several times to check on us to make sure everything was good that made it an authentic italian restaurant we enjoyed our meals and what a wonderful dining experience at pizza banfi please make a reservation in advance to avoid missing the opportunity having good decent italian food will definitely recommend to friends and family who love italian cuisine

Address: 333 Lonsdale Rd Toronto, ON M5P 1R3 Canada
Review: visited pizza banfi recently atmosphere was very cozy and warm staff was really friendly and knowledgeable had the vegetarian pizza  honestly probably one of the best pizzas ive had in toronto absolutely delicious the dessert was also really good price is reasonable

Address: 333 Lonsdale Rd Toronto, ON M5P 1R3 Canada
Review:
my wife and i have been going to the place since 1998 and we have never been disappointed

nestled in forest hill village banfi is one of my favorite pizza and pasta places its a small cozy place you almost feel like youre walking into someones living room

each and every visit  the owner has greeted us with a great and welcoming smile they consistently serve great pasta and pizza and the specials vary

best compliment i can pay to this place in over 20 years of dining at this place service quality of food and overall experience has never disappointed

and in my humble opinion they serve the best tiramisu in the city next two terroni and stock tc

Address: 333 Lonsdale Rd Toronto, ON M5P 1R3 Canada
Review:
my daughter and her husband booked their wedding reception here for 35 people  while the restaurant is small we all fit beautifully  and in very comfortable chairs i might add

the food was traditionally italian and of a super high quality and beautifully laid out  plates of bruschetta for starters and then several platters of seafood and antipasti were brought to each of the 7 group tables

for the pasta course cannelloni which my brother said was among the best he had ever eaten  i am severely gluten intolerant so they customized a penne plate for me with lots of veggies  delicious

then came a choice of osso bucco or salmon or a vegetarian plate  i chose the salmon which was a huge and perfect portion with lovely mango and baby tomato bits as a sauce  it was perfectly seared served alongside baby carrots and grilled asparagus  bottled flat and sparkling water was served alongside choices of wine

for dessert we had a customized gluten free wedding cake delivered and they placed it on a dedicated table in the corner of the room near the light  beautiful  servers sliced and plated it at no extra charge  guests also ordered digestifs our table had amaretto with large orange slices  wow

everything was brilliant and service was impeccable  wine and water glasses were refilled and plates were cleared at a comfortable pace  staff was super professional and chatted with us in a friendly manner

few receptions are planned in small neighbourhood restaurants as people often turn to banquet halls or weddingspecific venues  several guests said this is what they would choose for their future weddings

thanks banfi backandfrontofhouse staff  and owner  my daughter was elated as everything went so well and the restaurant was beautifully set up with traditional thick crisp white linen tablecloths and huge linen napkins  so classy

on each table was a glass with a large sprig of freesia in it  banfi didnt know this but that was the memorial flower of the day  and in my daughters bridal bouquet as well

Address: 333 Lonsdale Rd Toronto, ON M5P 1R3 Canada
Review: absolutely stellar service and amazing food will definitely be returning best dinner ive had out in a very very long time

Address: 658 Bloor Street Toronto, ON M6G 1K9 Canada
Review: pretty standard korean fare the quality of the meat was good prepared food was tasty cozy interior with friendly service amazing that they are open late every night great place to cap off an evening out with friends or if you just want to grab a tasty meal minimum 2 orders of meat or vegan set per table

Address: 658 Bloor Street Toronto, ON M6G 1K9 Canada
Review: the place was packed when we arrived but wait times were quick and we were seated within 10min   quick and attentive service by staff high quality meats and vegetables paired with wonderful sides   atmosphere was clean and lively  i would definitely recommend dining here again

Address: 658 Bloor Street Toronto, ON M6G 1K9 Canada
Review:
took a friend who has never had korean food before this place was very convinient  clean to introduce korean table top cooking all the side dishes kimchi  korean soybean stew all at once
they loved everything especially the quality of meats soybean stew  kimchi my korean food introduction dinner was such a success

although it was hard to get attention from the server because they were way too busy and i heard if we go during the weekend it could be even worse

they also have 15 hours limited seating time due to the restaurant being so popular for me i need minimum 2 hours to sit down and have a few drinks chat order more meats

if you have any friends who would like to experience korean food for the first time this place might be it

Address: 658 Bloor Street Toronto, ON M6G 1K9 Canada
Review: if you are looking for the best korean barbecue in town this is the place to be it is not a very big place but it is one of the best pork and beef barbecue are delicious all the complimentary sauces and side dishes are delicious of course order a pancake it is a bit spicy but not really the kimchi soup is moderate spicy as well and so so good comparing to the one i had in south korea i didnt feel the difference the staff is so friendly and helpful there is a paid parking lot right behind the restaurent place is so busy all the time evening time

Address: 658 Bloor Street Toronto, ON M6G 1K9 Canada
Review:
went there to have a soju and eat some good meat with my friends

we got there right before the rush at 6pm so id recommend to go around that time or you might have to wait

each meat comes in 200g worth and id say thats about one portion but i also shared some seafood pancake and ate rice with it so id say a minimum of 30 of food per person to get full

this plays is famous for their infinite corn cheese so take good advantage of that you can always ask for more side dishes and if youre someone like me who likes kimchi at kbbq you can ask for extra 

i feel like i shouldve drank another bottle of soju ill do that next time lol

Address: 606 Sherbourne Street Ground Level Toronto, ON M4X Canada
Review: a longtime favourite of mine for weekday lunches prices are extremely reasonable especially considering the quality and quantity you get their daily specials are all excellent  the spicy pork and bulgogi are my favourites the fish katsu only available on thursdays is also delicious and freshly fried to order all hot foods come with side dishes japchae fried dumpling spring roll vegetables which really round out the meal portions are big and ive never been able to finish it in one sitting the owner is really nice as well and provides very quick service so dont be intimidated by the lunch queue cash only

Address: 606 Sherbourne Street Ground Level Toronto, ON M4X Canada
Review: wow ive always wanted to try this place and finally was able to today i went with the veggie bibimbap as it was the daily special and added beef bulgogi the flavour is out of this world rice veggies beef japchae a spring roll a dumpling a fried egg all came in my order serious bang for your buck and the lady who served me was so kind and quick 100 will return

Address: 606 Sherbourne Street Ground Level Toronto, ON M4X Canada
Review: food is so flavourful fresh and delicious woman that runs it always greets you with a big smile my favourite is the chicken curry special

Address: 606 Sherbourne Street Ground Level Toronto, ON M4X Canada
Review: i got the chicken curry and spicy pork i like the spicy pork very much korean flavor

Address: 606 Sherbourne Street Ground Level Toronto, ON M4X Canada
Review: my first time here getting take out and to be quite honest this place is probably one of the tastiest korean places ive tried i got the bulgogi meal that was packed with tons of food the shop is ran by a kind and sweet lady that clearly puts all her love in her cooking will definitely come down here to have this place again

Address: 335 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1W7 Canada
Review:
dinner menu during lunch time tried almost everything all of them are tasty while all the beef and pork are good other memorable ones are salmon ajilo bibimbap pineapple

menu is not extensive but straightforward and covers all the things you might and might not expect and none of them disappoints it seems the current selection comes from years of experience they left only mostdemanded and truly popular delicious item very satisfying
comfy seating quick attentive service

Address: 335 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1W7 Canada
Review: the bloor location is my favourite in the toronto area the wait list isnt usually too long and the dining area is spacious and clean the service is great as there are a good number number of servers and they change your grill for you at a good frequency without you having to ask the food here is always tasty as well the meats are fresh and well seasoned and i havent had any complaints with the desserts or appetizers to date

Address: 335 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1W7 Canada
Review: my cousins and i had a dinner last night the restaurant and restroom are both clean the staff is courteous and efficient for a twohour seating period this is an allyoucaneat restaurant fresh meat is provided dessert is also offered the price is high but the food is great they also offer discount if youre paying in cash i highly recommended this restaurant

Address: 335 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1W7 Canada
Review: my family had lunch today the food is provided very quick after order you just tell the server what you want and the server will give to you soon they deliver very excellent service high efficient and friendly i like the environment here clean and neat

Address: 335 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M5S 1W7 Canada
Review:
very good deal for an all you can eat the staff were all very nice and helpful the service is quick too

i really recommend the pork belly and beef brisket their soda drinks are very good as well the best we had are ume yuzu and peach soda its also nice they give you a melons by the end of the meal
