Address: 1158 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L9 Canada
Review: we initially had a reservation at another restaurant but decided to change it up last minute and we chose sorrel it did not disappoint at all the atmosphere the food and our server tj were nothing short of amazing highly recommend

Address: 1158 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L9 Canada
Review: my friend and i came here for her birthday and we had a great experience our server was incredibly nice and informative of their special menu i had the hanger steak and my friend had the duck confit and both meats were fresh and delicious definitely a spot to check out for a special occasion

Address: 1158 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L9 Canada
Review: my husband and i dined here in february it was a great romantic atmosphere with an amazing menu of delicious items and drinks we sat at the bar and the staff were so accommodating and friendly the food reasonable portions and flavourful cant get enough would definitely recommend and will visit again

Address: 1158 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L9 Canada
Review: came here to celebrate our anniversary the ambience was really nice and i also like the bright and welllit restaurant for a wednesday night in the middle of a storm it was quite packed our host was alright not very warmhelpful with suggestions but did his job well and was also kind to take photos for us the food was quite good the grilled octopus linguine and duck confit stood out we had a flourless chocolate cake and ice cream for dessert which was also nice i had mentioned it was our anniversary dinner ahead and when we arrived but i still had to ask for a candle for the dessert there was pretty much no acknowledgement of the celebration which is unlike other restaurants ive visited otherwise it was a nice experience but i doubt ill be back

Address: 1158 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4W 2L9 Canada
Review: sorrel with their french mediterranean inspired menu its a perfect spot to chill all the dishes we tried were great amazing value for the 2 oyster if that is your kinda thing reservation is highly recommended as they have a full house every time we went great atmosphere lunch from monfri dinner only for sat and closed on sunday

Address: 3415 Bathurst Street Toronto, ON M6A 2C1 Canada
Review:
got the chicken sandwich and it was delicious very juicy with a nice crunch to it perfect amount of sauce and the owner was awesome to talk to as well it doesnt feel oily or greasy and the spicy mayo gives it a nice kick to it everything was packaged neatly and organized

we were the first customer of the day and even got some free cookies the chocolate chip cookie was so fresh and soft i can eat a box of them

definitely would be back if im in the area again

Address: 3415 Bathurst Street Toronto, ON M6A 2C1 Canada
Review:
just had their food and its amazing all made inhouse familyowned business

know of the place because of the folks at dope cannabis located across the street ordered online and picked it up ordered the honey hot chicken sandwich added on the rancheros fries also got the kalbi burger

the hot honey chicken sandwich was the perfect combination of crispy juicy and flavorful expect a spicy kick with the sauce and jalape√±os and the bun is just the right amount of softness this sandwich will not disappoint actually the best chicken sandwich ive had in a long time

the rancheros fries was a nice side choice meat with the fries was yummy and the addition of sauce jalape√±os onions etc was a great combination

the kalbi beef burger was juicy and flavorful packed between two pillow soft buns

since i picked it up i visited the store small cozy spot for pickup no seating instore other than a twoseater bench delightfully decorated inside also love the yellow believe ted lasso reference above their kitchen doorway

excited to try their poke bowl and other items on the menu next time

Address: 3415 Bathurst Street Toronto, ON M6A 2C1 Canada
Review: love this place everything is amazing burgers are california style smash and oh so good and decadent the poke bowls are fantastic it all comes down to the best quality ingredients dont leave without trying a homemade cookie

Address: 3415 Bathurst Street Toronto, ON M6A 2C1 Canada
Review:
absolutely amazing value for money the food here is really tasty good portion size and wont make a dent on your wallet

ive tried their chicken sandwhich and loved it crispy skin super tender meat l nice springy bun tangy secret sauce also tried the bulgogi bowl which i also enjoyed sweet beef good amount of side veggies

nozomi is a takeout spot so youll been to grab and go despite that the owners make it as welcoming and friendly an environment as any dinein place male sure to stop by if you want a really tasty and affordable bite

Address: 3415 Bathurst Street Toronto, ON M6A 2C1 Canada
Review: the food was pretty good  they were kind enough to let me switch my order after the fact when i called them thankfully got the poke bowl because we like the tofu poke bowl better than the burger the burger got too soggy by the time i got home shouldve asked to put the sauce on the side both are on the sweeter side the cookie was ok because it was way too sweet the owner was too busy to make a conversation with us but her husband was very sweet and even helped me put the food in my bag the ambiance is very clean and they have a funny sign with a weighing scale

Address: 456 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P4 Canada
Review: always great food fresh vibrant tasty the staff is always very friendly and accommodating even at their most busiest time highly recommended

Address: 456 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P4 Canada
Review: one of my favourite greek restaurants on the danforth weve been back multiple times and loved it every time we typically get some skewers dips their pita bread with the dips are the best  a salad this time we opted out for the seafood platter which was delicious full of shrimp calamari and grilled octopus it was good but definitely a lot for 2 people

Address: 456 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P4 Canada
Review:
the service here is top notch the food arrives fast and hot dishes are replaced instantly once finished and the water does not stop flowing the restaurant is lively and the prices are better than some of the competitors down the street

the fried calamari was truly excellent the squid was abundant juicy and seasoned and fried perfectly

the aegean fare special was loaded with savoury meats and veggies unfortunately the moussaka was dryer than id prefer

overall it was a 45 for me

Address: 456 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P4 Canada
Review:
been here one time before and the food is amazing saganaki and the chicken breast plate were so damn good
other items ordered lamb chop by piece dolmades grilled octopus
our waiter did not smile once though and the service was so blah  not engagement or enthusiasm at all

Address: 456 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4K 1P4 Canada
Review: its a pretty busy greek restaurant we tried their lentil soup grilled vegetables grilled octopus and lamb chop the food was good the octopus had too much vinegar and it became sour it was cooked properly though and not overbooked we wanted the lamb chop to be medium rare but it came out medium it still tasted good the staff was friendly the place was clean and vibrant overall probably would go again

Address: 1008 Queen Street E Toronto, ON M4M 1K1 Canada
Review:
great place to watch the game and eat delicious food  loved that you could also see into the kitchen

tempura duck confit was tasty and crispy
dessert would have me returning  it is big enough for 2 but i crushed it on my own no complaints

Address: 1008 Queen Street E Toronto, ON M4M 1K1 Canada
Review:
the vibe here was very good and i was overall a fan of the food the kung pao broccoli was my favourite dish i wasnt expecting much from it but it was so tasty and the sauce was amazing the tuna was also good although a small serving all the appetizers were good to share
my main was the fish and chips and that is the reason we are at 4 stars it was genuinely nothing special but i had some of my wifes  poke bowl and that was tasty i would come back to try again and try something else next time

Address: 1008 Queen Street E Toronto, ON M4M 1K1 Canada
Review:
we had a fantastic experience at the eastside social our party of 4 didnt have a reservation on a friday night and the busy eastside social was so accommodating and lovely

we had drinks by the bar while we waited for a table to become available and boy let me tell you they were so good

dinner was fantastic definitely order the eggplant crisps the olives were nostalgic tasted just like my uncles olives from italy our mains pictured were very satisfying big portions and had so much flavour

service was exceptional and so friendly  going above and beyond not to mention when we left they still remembered our name

we would definitely recommend the eastside social and cant wait to come back

thanks for having us

Address: 1008 Queen Street E Toronto, ON M4M 1K1 Canada
Review:
we would probably need to come back and try dinner menu
brunch was ok burger buns were cold
the kiddo didnt like the kids menu at all
we didnt like that it was super noisy all tables were occupied cant hear each other

Address: 1008 Queen Street E Toronto, ON M4M 1K1 Canada
Review: we ordered a smash burger and doner from their brunch menu housemade aioli was amazing the doner was definitely not your regular shawarma it had a beef patty and and overwhelming sweet sauce i still think the place is great but i should have ordered something else

Address: 3 Baldwin Street Toronto, ON M5T 1L1 Canada
Review: fresh quality food and enjoyed every dish not the place if you want to be stomach full as it is on the pricey side definitely will consider coming back and trying the tasting menu the place is quite tight my elbows were already on each end of the table

Address: 3 Baldwin Street Toronto, ON M5T 1L1 Canada
Review: good food on the pricey side as portion is small bring lots of people so you can try more items uni is recommended tuna roll is bang for your buck

Address: 3 Baldwin Street Toronto, ON M5T 1L1 Canada
Review:
good food slightly on the pricier side everything tasted nicely cooked and fresh service is great attentive and friendly we sat on the patio out front

croquettes nice and cheesy crisp on the outside
tomago temaki the truffle overpowered the egg
scallop temaki our favorite bite
bluefin futomaki big pieces of tuna with freshly grated wasabi really good
omai futomaki deluxe roll which are quite big

couldve done without the truffle flavor as it was quite strong that masked all the natural sense

inside had a bar seating but felt very dark inside
they also have a tasting menu for 85pp

Address: 3 Baldwin Street Toronto, ON M5T 1L1 Canada
Review: bad quality fish overpriced worst uni ever had especially considering the price other sashimi is very average but when you look at the price it really is worse service is good atmosphere is great

Address: 3 Baldwin Street Toronto, ON M5T 1L1 Canada
Review: excellent combination of atmosphere food and knowledgeable service went here for dinner with my girlfriend and we ended spending about 140 but everything was worth it all we will return to try the tasting menu for sure highly recommend for enthusiasts for japanese cuisine

Address: 87 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3T7 Canada
Review: first time here and i have nothing bad to say the location is perfect for anyone who lives in the midtowneast end area the service was quick and the waitress was friendly price was reasonable for 3 brisket tacos fries and 1 single order of wings was around 50 plus tip

Address: 87 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3T7 Canada
Review: food was amazing so was service the only one area that could have given this location a fifth star was the side plates were not clean the server changed the platesgood food and excellent service

Address: 87 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3T7 Canada
Review:
we arrived late and was informed that our dessert may be packed up everything came out very fast im not a big fan of cauliflower but fell in love with the buffalo cauliflower
we split a tofu pad thai from the summerlicious menu and the mushroom sandwich the amount of food was a lot and it all tasted great
the service was very kind

Address: 87 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3T7 Canada
Review:
nice service and ambiance we ordered the chicken wings with apple butter sauce brisket burger and the pasta special spicy sausage with penne overall the food tasted good

the chicken wings werent worth it for its price its 17 for only 7 wings they gave a lot of brisket for the burger which was great the brisket can use a bit more sauce since it was a bit dry the pasta was unremarkable

Address: 87 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3T7 Canada
Review:
an amazing experience

when you are planning a milestone event like a retirement partyyou want a lovely setting with great food and wonderful stafftrisha events manager and the team at the amsterdam barrelhouse delivered on all counts

i was so thankful for trishas kindness and supportthere was not one request that was met with a willingness to make it happen  trisha and the restaurant managers helped make every detail including the showing of photos a special film and our music a reality

all of the guests loved the beautiful upstairs patio setting great food and atmosphere createdi loved the magical evening

many thanks to the amsterdam barrelhouse for helping to make my celebration so wonderful  i highly recommend having your next special event there

sincerely
lisa r

Address: 93 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V1 Canada
Review: good food at reasonable prices my only criticism is you have to completely exit the store again to get a cart if you want to do any grocery shopping at longos but its a minor inconvenience theres no easy solution for

Address: 93 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V1 Canada
Review: sadly it is closed due to covid but when open it is a hidden gem of a restaurant good burger salad and steak sandwich the pizza is also great situated in longos renovated historic building it is a unique experience

Address: 93 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V1 Canada
Review:
a great place to get a meal off the menu or from the prepared food section of longos compliment the meal with drinks from the bar all served by friendly and attentive staff portions are sized for sharing or if youre hungry they will fill the void
free wifi

Address: 93 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V1 Canada
Review: i eat there once or twice a week with my team  we love the food drinks and staff

Address: 93 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3V1 Canada
Review: incredible value but servers are overworked and the atmosphere is to be desired more staff dinner lighting and some background music would help a lot

Address: 90 Bloor Street E 9th Floor Toronto, ON M4W 1A7 Canada
Review:
i love visiting this new hotel in downtown toronto as they have a number of great venues including the skylight rooftop bar
i recently brought a colleague for summerlicious and we had a great experience
the portions and offerings for this menu are a bit different than the regular menu but the quality and service are maintained we werent able to enjoy the lovely patio given the weather but its great if you have a chance
you wouldnt think that a typical hotel restaurant like this would be known for middle eastern fare but its authentic  and delicious we had the hummus with chicken the baba ghanouj as well as the wagyu beef kebabs and they were all very well presented flavorful and very filling
they also make a mean paloma which is my favourite beverage
while youre visiting be sure to check out the beautiful library bar with a large open fireplace not to mention a mo√´t and chandon vending machine
thank you kindly and ill be back soon

Address: 90 Bloor Street E 9th Floor Toronto, ON M4W 1A7 Canada
Review:
great ambience and great service by our host we went for the taste of mexico menu picture attached

however the food was below our expectations and even below average compared any mexican restaurant in toronto the presentations were perfect yet they fail to make up for the taste

i would recommend going only for drinks

Address: 90 Bloor Street E 9th Floor Toronto, ON M4W 1A7 Canada
Review:
w torontos rooftop restaurant is a mustvisit for all food and drink lovers located on the top floor of the hotel the restaurant offers a breathtaking view of the city making it the perfect place to enjoy a meal or drinks with friends

the menu features a variety of contemporary dishes with a focus on locallysourced ingredients the menu is constantly evolving so there is always something new to try the chefs take pride in their dishes and it shows in the quality of the food

the drinks menu is equally impressive with a wide range of cocktails beers and wines to choose from the bartenders are knowledgeable and can recommend the perfect drink to pair with your meal

the atmosphere at the rooftop restaurant is lively and sophisticated the design is modern and stylish with plenty of seating options including indoor and outdoor seating whether you are looking for a romantic dinner or a night out with friends this rooftop restaurant is the perfect place to go

overall w torontos rooftop restaurant is a fantastic experience from the food and drinks to the atmosphere and view everything is topnotch i highly recommend visiting this restaurant for a memorable dining experience

Address: 90 Bloor Street E 9th Floor Toronto, ON M4W 1A7 Canada
Review: came here for drinks for my birthday on a saturday with 2 girlfriends and it has a great atmosphere  theres a dj spinning mostly what seems like latininspired music and the venue is just beautiful  cant wait for the summertime when the patio opens up  i cant really speak to the food as just one person ordered the octopus but she said she enjoyed it  i ordered the chocolate dessert and it was amazing  our waitress was so amazing and attentive to our needs and she was so sweet and put sparklers on my dessert and took it off the bill  it was really nice  cocktails were great  would definitely come back for drinks again

Address: 90 Bloor Street E 9th Floor Toronto, ON M4W 1A7 Canada
Review:
the atmosphere here is great its beautiful inside there selection of wine is interesting with some local choices from ontario excellent customer service cocktails are beautiful 
the price was also reasonable
would go here again 10 out of 10

Address: 157 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5B 1E4 Canada
Review: service was super quick and very kind and helpful everyone there working was awesome and nice the food was delicious my only comment is that there wasnt that many options for chicken and meat not many cuts of protein for the lunch menu also not many sides or appetizers for the all you can eat lunch as well but for the cuts and options there were they were super good

Address: 157 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5B 1E4 Canada
Review:
both take out and dine in are incredibly amazing the quality of the food and the portions are both impressive pre and post covid and i cant seem to get enough

this spot is great for gathering sharing and meat lovers if you have dietary restrictions i recommend you stay away from this place given everything is shared and it gets quite hard to keep everything tidy

i hope they keep it up and i will keep coming backkeep ordering delivery

Address: 157 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5B 1E4 Canada
Review: amazing service food and atmosphere as always meat tastes very high quality and the servers are always on top of everything and very attentive brining you things immediately we were a bit worried the lunch menu wouldnt satisfy us as there are less options but it was still more than enough and you can still choose the dinner menu during lunch time if you really want beef is definitely our favourite as its a bit more marinated and wed honestly be happy just getting it and skipping the pork hope to be back soon

Address: 157 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5B 1E4 Canada
Review:
very clean restaurant it was nice to be able to eat unlimited refills at a reasonable price the quality of the meat was good and the side menu grilled salmon seaweed soup and bibimbap was also very tasty as a restaurant where korean and japanese cuisines are well harmonized i want to visit again next time thank you

ps i was very satisfied with the way each individual was provided with convenient tongs to grill the meat

Address: 157 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5B 1E4 Canada
Review:
each table has rolled screen which makes private place for own group red meat we ordered is only beef which is very tasty cold noodle and bibim rice are strongly recommended every portion is small so we can try one each after trying we ordered literally unlimited times service is do good they often came over our table and ask what we need for dessert cream brulee is must eat item
i will visit again

Address: 20 Charles Street E Toronto, ON M4Y 1T1 Canada
Review: came in here after a friend suggested to try shrimp cream croquette  could have known the taste better if it had not been burning hot ps have patience before taking your first bite patient and ever smiling servers quite ambience good place for a restart if you are feeling low

Address: 20 Charles Street E Toronto, ON M4Y 1T1 Canada
Review: this mom and pop japanese restaurant is to die for  very good curry and bento boxes at a reasonable price  i loved everything in the bento and im not usually a sashimi person

Address: 20 Charles Street E Toronto, ON M4Y 1T1 Canada
Review:
came for a weeknight dinner with a friend just before 6pm the restaurant is quite small although they do have patio seating once the weather warms up enough and filled up quickly so id recommend making a reservation if you can

i ordered the pork katsu curry pork katsu was cooked well very fresh and not dry at all the curry was rich and came with chunks of beef rice was on the sticky side though but overall tasty and very good qualityquantity for the price

service is friendly although it was a bit difficult to get their attention at times would be helpful if they updated the menu on their website as some items are no longer available

Address: 20 Charles Street E Toronto, ON M4Y 1T1 Canada
Review: you need to make a reservation before coming we did not know this and came to tokyo kitchen on a friday night as a party of 3 we made a reservation on the spot but it took them about 20 minutes to seat us once we sat down it felt like everything went really fast we were served our meals and the side we ordered in a matter of minutes we got a side of tempura one sashimi don one chicken katsu and one beef sukiyako udon the food was delicious and even the atmosphere was really nice the only thing is this place is really busy so make a reservation

Address: 20 Charles Street E Toronto, ON M4Y 1T1 Canada
Review: the food tasted great and the portions are filling we got the chicken katsudon curry chicken california roll and korokke i wasnt a big fan of the korokke but the curry was great the staff were also very nice and the atmosphere was great it was very homey and i enjoyed my time there

Address: 620 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1K7 Canada
Review:
yummy is a pleasant surprise with good quality big portions and low pricing the bulgogi on rice 12 had a nice hint of smoke flavor but was dry the noodle with red sauce and fish cake 12 was a generous serving seafood pancake was my favorite  extra crispy and crunchy although took time to come out

every table here is a large booth with high back rest gives you lots of privacy

very low price point and 10 discount when paying cash

this has become my new go to for kfood

highly recommend

Address: 620 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1K7 Canada
Review: this place is great the restaurant name is great because its true yummy and cheap its a nice comfy place for 2 4 ppl the tables are nice even if its only 1 or 2 if you come when it is busy you have to wait at the front but the service is pretty fast and the one girl with the glasses is always very polite with me i appreciate it very much food is delicious cheaper than majority of korean restaurants ive been to great value for your dollar

Address: 620 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1K7 Canada
Review:
i have been coming to this place since the days at their old location for more than 8 years

this is the best korean restaurant based on portion sizes valueformoney and flavors and service is as good as humanly possible given how busy this place is it is always busy for a good reason

the quality of the food has been very consistent over the years great job and i must say i love all the banchan  the kimchi and the potatoes always hit the spot

yummy korean restaurant is an institution of toronto like swatow and manpuku 

one thing i would suggest is to update a small portion of the tables to be 2tops so the flow of customers especially solo diners and couples can be managed more effectively

another thing is that i will recommend servers to ask about drinks orders or at least mention both alcoholic and nonalcoholic options this should help boost drink sales

last but not least i recommend creating an instagram page to connect with your fans yes many torontorians are your fans

Address: 620 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1K7 Canada
Review:
ive heard of this popular korean spot for a while as theyre known to be a good bang for your buck spot

my friend took me here on a thursday night for dinner and it was really good we ordered 3 dishes and had leftovers for tomorrow

highly recommend and i cant wait to come back we arrived for 630pm on a thursday and didnt have to wait but prepared to wait as this place got really busy after we were seated

Address: 620 Bloor Street W Toronto, ON M6G 1K7 Canada
Review: great place to have a korean meal portions are large and prices are reasonable we enjoyed bulgogi beef bibimbap in a bowl and shrimp fried rice side dishes are really good as well amazing japchae and you can request refills

Address: 23 Charles Street W Toronto, ON M4Y 2R4 Canada
Review: i went here with a friend and we ordered a shrimp japanese pancake and a chicken teriyaki the shrimp japanese pancake was delicious it came with the right amount of fluffiness sauce and fillings definitely get the fish flakes as an addition otherwise i feel like the pancake would be lacking such a vital component the chicken teriyaki was pretty standard that you could find anywhere however their pancakes are certainly worth it  i find japanese pancakes are also not always super common to find the prices were also super reasonable this place is definitely worth a try

Address: 23 Charles Street W Toronto, ON M4Y 2R4 Canada
Review:
small inconspicuous storefront thats very very cozy and welcoming friendly and helpful staff overall great dinner ambiance

osaka style okonomiyaki thats fairly priced and portioned flavours were great and savoury we tried the beef squid both great options yakisoba was also memorable definitely recommend to visit just a heads up there can be a bit of wait during the evening also i recommend the plum wine its delicious

Address: 23 Charles Street W Toronto, ON M4Y 2R4 Canada
Review:
its been ages since my last visit as this used to be a frequent affordable goto place for dinner since my student days the food is still delicious with fast service while also being super busy i ordered the scallop okonomiyaki with seaweed and fish flakes yum

cant wait to come back again

Address: 23 Charles Street W Toronto, ON M4Y 2R4 Canada
Review: the squid okonomiyaki is decent highly recommend adding katsuobushi flakes and seaweed for 50 cents the yakisoba was too salty for my liking the interior of the restaurant is a bit dated but service was great and the staff were responsive and friendly decent food for a decent price

Address: 23 Charles Street W Toronto, ON M4Y 2R4 Canada
Review: came here for dinner and had a wonderful time i loved the decor and the service was excellent the real highlight is the food  super tasty and really wellpriced each item was 10 and the portions were pretty big this is one of the few restaurants left in toronto where you can still get a filling meal for under 15 this is def worth the visit

Address: 556 parliament st Toronto, ON M5S 1X2 Canada
Review:
from the moment you walk in the door the atmosphere of this taco joint is welcoming and warm the decor is fun and lively with bright colors and unique artwork that make you feel like youve stumbled upon a hidden gem

but lets talk about the real reason youre here  the tacos the menu is full of delicious options that cater to all tastes and dietary needs from traditional beef and chicken to fish every taco is bursting with flavor and fresh ingredients

what really sets this taco joint apart is the attention to detail each taco is made to order with care and precision and the flavors and textures are perfectly balanced whether youre looking for something spicy and bold or mild and comforting theres a taco here for you

and lets not forget about the sides  the chips and guacamole are the perfect accompaniment to your meal and if youre feeling thirsty theres a great selection of drinks to choose from including delicious margaritas and refreshing beers

overall i highly recommend this taco joint to anyone looking for an unforgettable dining experience the staff is friendly and attentive the food is exceptional and the atmosphere is unbeatable dont miss out on the best tacos in the city  head to this place today

Address: 556 parliament st Toronto, ON M5S 1X2 Canada
Review:
edit parliament locationmost toco joints are line quick and dirty no frills this place is a nice restaurant but of an elevated atmosphere i could take a date here for a nice dinner kinda vibe intimate staff are friendly and helpful
classic margarita on point
guacamole  tastier than most smooth not so chunky and youll want to order 0ne for each individual
pastor barbacoa fish and steak arrachera i think all super flavorful
house sauce is very flavorful heat forward but not there to punish you white people may find it too much but the heat does not linger long i will 100 be back

Address: 556 parliament st Toronto, ON M5S 1X2 Canada
Review:
we were pretty excited to try a new taco spot in cabbagetown

we ordered 3 tacos to go the al pastor black tiger shrimp and fried fish

the tacos come with one tortilla and the size is just fine not too big not too small more filling than pastor taco on gerard st for comparison

the al pastor  really dry i was worried about this as other reviews state dry meat i indeed also received dry meat theres potential with the flavours here but the meat was dry and hard to enjoy

black tiger shrimp and fish tacos were fine but nothing memorable

considering this places other location has great reviews and they are still working on opening their dinein space i plan to return in a couple months to give them another chance because this area needs more taco spots

Address: 556 parliament st Toronto, ON M5S 1X2 Canada
Review: we ordered online for pick up pick up was fast the tacos were tasty with a good amount of filling the cheese quesadilla combo which comes with tortilla chips was disappointing as the portions were very small and barely any chips it was not filling expected them to be more generous from a so highly rated restaurant

Address: 556 parliament st Toronto, ON M5S 1X2 Canada
Review: the food is good for dine in it looks they take care of the ingredients and taste as a mexican i like it but the service needs to be improve we wait like an hour to complete the whole service and we didnt ordered too much the girl couldnt explain what is the dish about but probably she was not her fault she was rushing it was only one waitress for paying attention to the tables take out pick up and everything maybe they need more staff to fill from my point of view the price is so high 1 taco for 750 tax but i guess they wanted to give mexican gourmet food experience but as expensive gourmet food the customer service should be at the same level or above

Address: 218 Geary Avenue Toronto, ON M6H 2C3 Canada
Review:
this gem has amazing portuguese food with amazing prices
good quality food
warm  friendly staff
awesome food portion
easy parking

photo salmon with garden salad  steak wegg fries and salad

Address: 218 Geary Avenue Toronto, ON M6H 2C3 Canada
Review: going to really miss this please its the best portuguese chicken in town handsdown  i think the next time ill eat portuguese chicken is in portugal lol thats how good it is cant  forget the leit√£o either

Address: 218 Geary Avenue Toronto, ON M6H 2C3 Canada
Review: amazing food every time worth coming here if u love bbq

Address: 218 Geary Avenue Toronto, ON M6H 2C3 Canada
Review: the fries are probably the best we have ever had portions are huge for the prices they charge really juicy portuguese bbq chicken and inexpensive great lakes brewery craft brew on tap i was in heaven good espresso too dont pay attention to the decor go for the food and drink

Address: 218 Geary Avenue Toronto, ON M6H 2C3 Canada
Review: really good portugese good at affordable prices the sandwiches are a real bang for your buck the leitao is fantastic super juicy and flavourful will continue to go here often staff are also very friendly

Address: 3200 Dufferin Street Toronto, ON M6A 3B2 Canada
Review: very popular restaurant with lots people waiting in line but waiting time is short lots of food variety and they are all delicious great portions as well bring couple friends if you wanna try multiple dishes

Address: 3200 Dufferin Street Toronto, ON M6A 3B2 Canada
Review:
if you want to try a special pho i highly recommend this place its certainly different from other pho restaurants as their soup was unique imo if you prefer non greasy clean taste this is not the place for you but if you love rich meaty flavour you should definitely give this place a try
price was cheap for the amt of food they serve i felt like i shouldve brought 4 people to finish two bowls  of noodle
i really liked hue special which they only sell on fri sat and sunday never had any bowl like this elsewhere broth was so rich w flavour and it had interesting toppings like crab cake meat ball which looked lik a spam and variety of tendon beef  more
regular pho comes with huge chunks of beef with a bone broth was quite greasy with sooo much meat but because of that its so rich w meaty flavour

be warned of the xxl portion for ladies i recommend sharing one bowl i eat alot but i was defeated after eating 13 of the bowl
there will be a line but wait time is short about 10mins or so
this place would be perfect esp during wintertime

Address: 3200 Dufferin Street Toronto, ON M6A 3B2 Canada
Review:
a very busy and amazingly good pho in north york 
pho anh vu opened in 2019 and it in my opinion is one of the  best vietnamese restaurants in north york
if you have big parties or want to dine with your family pho anh vu offers the best vietnamese is the right place
the ingredients are fresh and good quality and the service is fast

Address: 3200 Dufferin Street Toronto, ON M6A 3B2 Canada
Review:
really big portion with sensible price

i ordered their recommended vermicelli it has grilled pork sugar caned shrimp peanuts and spring roll

their chilli sauces are top notch

Address: 3200 Dufferin Street Toronto, ON M6A 3B2 Canada
Review: was pricy a bowl of pho for twenty dollars the food was good last time i went here  but this time was a bit disappointing they only take debit or cash and not credit there were many servers but they are not attentive i order one coffee with condensed milk they brought out two and i had to remind them that the meal is done and the coffee was not even served yet

Address: 220 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3X2 Canada
Review: the food was really good we were four people and shared like 5 dishes plus some starters was delicious and also very cheap and they were so nice i would definitely recommend

Address: 220 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3X2 Canada
Review:
5 star  service excellence

title a culinary journey to the far east tao northern chinese cuisine

when seeking a dining experience that waltzes across the tightrope of exotic flavors lavish presentation and warm hospitality one need look no further than tao northern chinese cuisine tucked away at 220 laird drive this hidden gem is a veritable treasure trove of dishes that transport your taste buds to the mystical far east

our culinary odyssey commenced with the chicken won ton noodle soup a soothing symphony of delicate flavors that nourished our souls the chicken spring rolls were next to grace our table their golden crispy exteriors revealing a delectable filling that married the playful textures of perfectly seasoned chicken with the earthy crunch of fresh vegetables

taos chicken fried rice danced on our palates a whirlwind of flavors that united smoky caramelized notes with the tangy sweetness of pineapple the lemon chicken was a true masterpiece as if da vinci himself had crafted the dish tender succulent pieces of chicken were lightly battered then bathed in a vibrant lemon sauce that dazzled the senses with its perfect balance of sweetness and acidity

the pepper beef left us utterly speechless with its tender morsels of beef that melted in our mouths juxtaposed against the fiery heat of black pepper and the delicate sweetness of caramelized onions the assorted seafood  vegetables was a delightful marine medley harmoniously combining the briny freshness of the ocean with the natural sweetness of colorful crisp veggies

as for the chicken singapore vermicelli it was a tantalizing fusion of textures and flavors each strand of vermicelli expertly coated in a fragrant curry sauce that bewitched the senses

our adventure culminated in the sinfully delicious deep fried bananas with vanilla ice cream and strawberries the bananas enrobed in a featherlight batter and fried to crispy perfection were the perfect accompaniment to the creamy velvety ice cream while the vibrant strawberries added a dash of color and tang to the exquisite dessert

throughout our epicurean escapade we were guided by the evercharming lambert whose genuine warmth and attentiveness elevated our dining experience to celestial heights the evervigilant manager jackie ensured that every detail of our evening unfolded seamlessly allowing us to fully immerse ourselves in the culinary wonderland that is tao northern chinese cuisine

in a world of commonplace dining experiences tao northern chinese cuisine is a beacon of culinary creativity and hospitality its not just a meal its an enchanting voyage to a land where flavors reign supreme and gastronomic dreams come true

Address: 220 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3X2 Canada
Review:
tried this spot as its close by and we were hoping to satisfy our dumpling craving we tried the xiao long bao pork soup dumplings steamed chicken dumplings steamed pork  chive dumplings and pan fried pork buns

we felt satisfied with the amount we ordered due to the small sizes of the dumplings and we found the flavours to be quite fresh

our favourite dish was the pork bun it was so warm the filling was delicious flavourful and fresh

the dumplings we found to be just okay all in all we spent 40 which i think is definitely a little pricier than other dumpling options relative to quality the soup dumplings were not comparable to others ive had  they were mediocre and just didnt get the job done in my opinion as well we found the wrapping of the dumplings to be quite thick i dont think that we would order dumplings from this spot again however seeing the reviews others have left im definitely open to trying other dishes here

the staff were very pleasant and friendly and our order was ready in 15 minutes quick and prompt

Address: 220 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3X2 Canada
Review:
usually order takeout from here which is consistently delicious
this time we dined at the restaurant
everything was super tasty and the server was very attentive
we ordered general tao chicken sweet and sour shrimp shanghai noodles rice chilli cashew eggplant

Address: 220 Laird Drive Toronto, ON M4G 3X2 Canada
Review: we tried the lunch menu and the food was a bit underwhelming think a fast food place on the food court quality the prices are reasonable though and the lunch combos include a choice of meat soup spring roll and rice the service was good so it is ok for what it is if you are in the area and you want a quick chinese meal it is not too bad

Address: 4704 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5M4 Canada
Review:
1st time trying this place during lunch had late lunch n restaurant still full was greeted by two amazing and smiling wait staff added nicely to the restaurant coziness

yellow curry was amazing n had right balance of thai herbs which is hard to find in toronto each lunch special also came with thai spring rollwhich came hot n freshly fried luv hot food slightly surprised with crispy pork as it was cooked in heavy sauce so the pork wasnt crispy but since sauce was good dish was ok at the end what was unexpected was the hot  sour soup which had enormous amount of black pepper was hoping thai soup so surprised with chinese just a note that theres limited parking space only 1 spot in front and 3 paid street parking on the south street beside hero burger so easier to take public transitwalk

Address: 4704 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5M4 Canada
Review:
excellent service the waitress was super nice she gave us plates for sharing and chopsticks before we asked
ordered pad thai and chicken satay tasty and portion was decent  definitely will come back

Address: 4704 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5M4 Canada
Review: did take out from eat bkk for a few times so had to go in and gran the crispy pork pad thai special which is one of my go to dishes they could turn up the spice levels a lot more on the pad see ew we ordered that was the only miss chicken wings zaab was a decent appetitizer for flavor

Address: 4704 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5M4 Canada
Review: it is a very cozy nice restaurant if you like thai you should try them i got khao soi which is fried noodle and chicken within a coconut milk soup with vegetables as garnish it was perfect it would be better if the owner renovate the place everything looked dull

Address: 4704 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5M4 Canada
Review:
oct 2022 editaddition theyve changed their khao soi ingredients or presentation tastes just as good and also added the laab grilled chicken a must try i always order the laab wings and had asked if they had it in chicken form they do they have a cash discount available

i ordered the braised beef with rice my friend ordered the veg pad see ew and we got wings

my order had something wrong with it had to send it back and they corrected it i hope they sent us complimentary spring rolls for the experience i cant dock them mistakes and accidents happen they did well to make up for it

helpful staff though they were slammed with many customers and pick ups

these wings are on my top 5 list of best wings a must try

Restaurant_name: RH Courtyard Restaurant at RH Toronto
Address: 3401 Dufferin Street RH Toronto Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review: yesterday we celebrated our first year wedding anniversary the server was so sweet and she did everything for us to enjoy our dining experience excellent service the food was just perfect the ambiance of the restaurant was like wow we felt like we were in europe the tour of the gallery was impeccable

Restaurant_name: RH Courtyard Restaurant at RH Toronto
Address: 3401 Dufferin Street RH Toronto Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review:
during our recent visit to the restaurant my wife and i had a satisfying dining experience i opted for the shaved prime rib sandwich and found it to be quite delicious the flavors were wellbalanced and the meat was tender and flavorful my wife on the other hand chose the quarter chicken which was cooked to perfection the chicken was juicy tender and had a delightful crispiness to the skin

the restaurant itself had a charming and elegant ambiance however one minor downside was that the tables were positioned a bit too close together which made it feel a bit cramped at times on our way to the bathroom we had the opportunity to browse the furniture they sell which was a unique and interesting touch

while the overall experience was enjoyable we did find the service to be a little slow it would have been great if the staff were more attentive and prompt in attending to our needs nevertheless the friendly and accommodating nature of the staff made up for the slight delay in service

in conclusion the restaurant provided us with tasty food a pleasant atmosphere and a glimpse into their unique furniture offerings although the tables were a bit close together and the service was a touch slow these minor drawbacks did not significantly impact our overall positive dining experience

Restaurant_name: RH Courtyard Restaurant at RH Toronto
Address: 3401 Dufferin Street RH Toronto Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review: it is my first time to be there the environment is really nice it has a very tall and delicate ceiling and there also have a lot of green plants around you the food presentation and portion is terrible all of our main courses only have one piece of parsley as garnish and for salmon and lobster roll just have additional piece of lemon there is no side dish with any of those main courses i feel really disappointed about that because the price does not match with food quality the only thing make me feel happy is their service our waiter is super nice she pay attention to any details that we asked also she replaced our steak after we told her that was over cooked she said sorry to us because the steak was bad i really appreciate for her service

Restaurant_name: RH Courtyard Restaurant at RH Toronto
Address: 3401 Dufferin Street RH Toronto Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review:
if there is one place that you can take pictures worth posting to social media it is going to be at the rh courtyard the interior is decked out in the most beautiful and luxurious couches and chandeliers the entirety of the main floor is just brightly lit with the warmth from the chandeliers and it makes the whole atmosphere so warm and inviting

the food was also quite good too we got the lobster roll the half roasted chicken and the gem lettuce salad and all of them were superior the price is a bit in the higher side but they really do give you an amazing experience so i would say that its reasonable

the waitstaff was also super nice and since we were celebrating a birthday they even came out towards the end to give us a celebration dessert a chocolate chip cookie it was so cute and unexpected and overall really made our day

in short if you get the chance to please give this place a visit the food is good and the atmosphere is even better but just note that the price is on the higher side

Restaurant_name: RH Courtyard Restaurant at RH Toronto
Address: 3401 Dufferin Street RH Toronto Toronto, ON M6A 2T9 Canada
Review:
a beautiful restaurant with excellent service the staff is very professional and pretty prompt for the most part great place to go for brunch with friends

the chicken was a bit dry in the caesar salad but the rest of the salad was fresh the truffle fries are great to share

overall the food tasted very good with the pricing and atmosphere theyve set you do expect things to be high quality and to not miss a beat it is expensive for brunch but makes for a solid outing once in a while 4 stars

Address: 1108 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A7 Canada
Review: cano is always a vibe if youre looking for some great italian food this is the spot the service is top notch and the staff is extremely friendly ive been here quite a few times so if youre planning a trip here make sure to order the gnudi and if you like fish sharing the grilled seafood board is a must the only downside this visit was the pizza was undercooked couldve got a better char on it also portion sizes are very generous so you are able to share everything with your table if you like to eat family style

Address: 1108 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A7 Canada
Review:
came for the first time back in april this year and cant believe it took me so long to come here easily one of my fav restaurants after one visit 

carpaccio di manzo 
grande fritti di mare 
gnudi ai funghi 
pizza nduja 
tiramisu 

i order calamari at most places i see it on the menu but ive got to say this is probably the best calamari ive ever had  it was so fresh and soft with a light crisp batter exterior carpaccio was very light and seasoned very well topped with alot of parm  arugula and a soft and cheewy homemade bread the gnudi gnoochi was melt in your mouth soft ive never had it at such a soft texture before very different but also so good with the mushroom truffle sauce im very spicy sensitive and this was the first time i had a nduja pizza i could handle thanks to the great recommendation of our bar server spreading the burrata over the top of the pizza likely helped a lot the tiramsu was rich and creamy a bit thicker texture than others im used to and loved it

we sat at the bar and our bar server was great he provided the best recommendations and everything we had was amazing

cant wait to come back and try other dinner items and the brunch menu

Address: 1108 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A7 Canada
Review: ambiance was cute and great service food was finger licking good and we would go back to this place it was a bit pricey but everything tasted delicious from the nduja pizza burrata cheese kale salad gnudi pasta we definitely enjoyed the food even though it was super loud we could barely hear each other im not sure if the restaurant was too small with too many people but it was loud and crowded

Address: 1108 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A7 Canada
Review:
my friend and i grabbed drinks on the patio  sunday may 14th mothers day around 2pm we didnt catch our servers name but he was awesome super friendly honesty no fuss when we said we were just in for drinks at first gave a great recommendation for food honestly he was a big part of us enjoying our experience it was refreshing to have such a memorable and pleasant server

we enjoyed 2 rounds of the espresso martinis we cant wait to come back on another weekend and enjoy the cocktail hour specials i believe between 35pm

Address: 1108 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A7 Canada
Review: amazing food service was good and atmosphere is nice a bit loud inside and cramped but overall amazing experience

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: service was quick and staff are friendly we ordered chicken and lamb skewers braised beef noodle soup and chicken cutletor filet noodle soup id say that the lamb skewers were my favourite it was so tender and flavourful perfectly seasoned i knocked off a star because the soupbroth had no flavour to it i ordered extra spicy because i love spicy foods and although it looks spicy it wasnt at all didnt even get a little kick of spiciness which was a bit disappointing because i expected it to be spicy other than that it was very filling and we really enjoyed our time dining here

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: very tasty food and cozy environment  read the reviews and decided to go and try the food  the portion is not small enough to fill up  thanks to the staff who served us  they are very kind and welcoming  the guy gave us a fork so that we would not suffer with chopsticks

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
the portion is ridiculous great for sharing for sure the lame on a stick is delicious the best thing there i might go back for something else and try their other noodles the non caffeinated drinks are also yummy great service

their noodle though is good but flavour wise is not very flavourful but maybe i should have ask them for something else on the side

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: i came here because of a tiktok the food was really good the taste of the dan dan noodles were really good not as spicy as i thought they would be the beef noodle soup tasted like home the beef was so tender however i got the flat noodles which were too thick for my liking but that was my fault overall great service and the food was really nice

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
delicious food had the stir fried noodles with chicken thick round noodle size and it was delicious nice large portion and the service was quick  i got take out and had the food within 10 mins
will definitely visit again

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: service was quick and staff are friendly we ordered chicken and lamb skewers braised beef noodle soup and chicken cutletor filet noodle soup id say that the lamb skewers were my favourite it was so tender and flavourful perfectly seasoned i knocked off a star because the soupbroth had no flavour to it i ordered extra spicy because i love spicy foods and although it looks spicy it wasnt at all didnt even get a little kick of spiciness which was a bit disappointing because i expected it to be spicy other than that it was very filling and we really enjoyed our time dining here

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: very tasty food and cozy environment  read the reviews and decided to go and try the food  the portion is not small enough to fill up  thanks to the staff who served us  they are very kind and welcoming  the guy gave us a fork so that we would not suffer with chopsticks

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
the portion is ridiculous great for sharing for sure the lame on a stick is delicious the best thing there i might go back for something else and try their other noodles the non caffeinated drinks are also yummy great service

their noodle though is good but flavour wise is not very flavourful but maybe i should have ask them for something else on the side

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review: i came here because of a tiktok the food was really good the taste of the dan dan noodles were really good not as spicy as i thought they would be the beef noodle soup tasted like home the beef was so tender however i got the flat noodles which were too thick for my liking but that was my fault overall great service and the food was really nice

Address: 124 Dundas St W Toronto, ON M5G 1C3 Canada
Review:
delicious food had the stir fried noodles with chicken thick round noodle size and it was delicious nice large portion and the service was quick  i got take out and had the food within 10 mins
will definitely visit again

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
i really wanted to like this place maybe i ordered the wrong thing it was average there were a few things i did not enjoy but first the restaurant itself was clean and bright the tables small and enough for 2 people and two bowls of noodles the service was good and i liked their bubble tea
i ordered the pickled vegetable beef noodle soup the beef was so overcooked it was all crumbling in my soup and there wasnt a lot the noodle portion sizes were crazy big crazy big there were so many noodles in there it felt like the more i ate the more noodles there were the flavour was alright
it was definitely something that can be shared among two people or they could even have a size small

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
9610
one of the best noodle dishes in the city for sure please visit the restaurant as well as it will enhance your experience

ordered through doordash before once and enjoyed the beef noodles this time tried the braised beef noodles and it was delicious reheated the broth but that was due to my dasher not putting in a heating bag 9210

reply to owner hello i just visited the restaurant and the noodles were absolutely delectable its a different experience eating them fresh the waitress with glasses was very polite and accommodating my impression has become even better now 9610
theirs no such thing as a perfect dish but this is close

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
this place is beyond amazing i cant put into words the noodles i had i know it seems very menial however these noodles are some of the best noodles ive ever had the combination of the love put into the hand pulling done by the chef and the seemingly handful yet carefully chosen spices blend perfectly into a medley of amazing taste

i cant wait to go back and try more of their food

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review: i have been here twice so far and have thoroughly enjoyed the food both the times i would 100 recommend their braised beef noodle stir fried chicken noodle and lamb skewers the server jay was so helpful and patient with our questions overall i highly recommend this restaurant

Address: 760 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 2B6 Canada
Review:
for the price you are paying you get a huge quantity i ordered the braised beef noodle soup and you can choose your spice level the beef was very tender and the broth very flavorful

i also ordered the bean noodle which i thought was jellyfish at first really delicious appetizer i think it was topped with chili oil

restaurant is relatively small but humble and i really enjoyed my meal fair price point for flavor and quantity definitely appreciated that

Address: 1382 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1M9 Canada
Review: great brunch place we easily got a table and the service was so quick not to mention the staff was patient and friendly we ordered their mimosas and they were so good reasonably priced as well their corn hummus is definitely a must try goes so well with the drinks we tried their beef and chicken burgers which were delicious i usually dont like fries as sides but their fries are so well seasoned definitely a must try great food options with their special menu available as well do give this place a try

Address: 1382 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1M9 Canada
Review:
we have been wanting to try the wren for several months now but it has always been so crowded and the wait too long even in a wednesday night we had a 20 minute wait
the service was excellent and the food super yummy everything was reasonably priced their beer list is extensive with a lot of yummy options on tap where they are lacking is their cocktail menu they were unable to make several simple bar staples  but i suppose thats just not their jam
i had their special chicken big mac burger which was amazing their fries were excellent  although my dh found them too greasy
if youre a cocktail drinker id say this is not your place but if youre a beer drinker and yummy food eater absolutely go here

Address: 1382 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1M9 Canada
Review:
this was our second time my husband i really loved the food we had this special skirt steak weve had the mozzarella sticks and the burguer last time everything was absolutely delicious cant believe this is a pub we sat at the bar both times the service was very good and friendly we are definitely becoming regulars 
we also enjoyed the ambient we are definitely coming back with some friends music is not loud great for enjoying a conversation

Address: 1382 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1M9 Canada
Review: they were so welcoming and friendly the beer was great the food was great the wine was great they forgot to charge us for a glass of wine when we mentioned it they didnt charge us we paid for it in the tip  i had the big ol dippa and my partner had the chorizo burger both excellent

Address: 1382 Danforth Avenue Toronto, ON M4J 1M9 Canada
Review:
phenomenal menu this place clearly has a very talented chef they have a curated menu with probably 1015 or so options yet somehow all of them sounded insanely delicious in addition to that if you check out their instagram youll see they have a daily special to come up with something of that caliber everyday is extremely impressive the prices are very reasonable for the quality of the food and service

the fish tacos are some of the best ive ever had great fusion flavours that being said im confident that anything off this menu would be amazing everyone at our table was very happy with their meals and they have a great drink menu to go with it definitely stop here for a meal if youre in the area but its also worth going out of your way to get there

Address: 954 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A1 Canada
Review: this place is the bomb dot com i walked by many times but have never gone inside my friend finally invited me to go there and ill be going back all the time food is sooooo good and so affordable the people owners are so nice so sweet   also the fruit they gave with my meal is my favourite watermelon and pineapple thanks so much ill be coming back many times

Address: 954 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A1 Canada
Review: really wonderful spot owners are so sweet and the food was delicious so excited to come back again

Address: 954 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A1 Canada
Review: i wish i knew about this place 5 years ago the owners are so sweet and their food is simple and delicious the way foods are supposed to be ill be there every saturday morning for my breakfast from now on my breakfast place used to be boom bon voyage

Address: 954 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A1 Canada
Review: the people that run this place are very lovely and so sweet the prices are awesome the food is delicious i hope they continue to prosper and do well in their business

Address: 954 St Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A1 Canada
Review: the best juiciest most flavourful chicken shawarma in town comes with their homemade sauces and a hot sauce thatll blow your socks off if you are a spice fan 1010 definitely try it if you havent

Address: 4916 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N5 Canada
Review: this place is a new favourite spot for korean noodles the service is great and the food hits the spot on a cool evening the soup noodles were spicy brothy and perfectly cooked we got two kinds of noodles with pork pork bone and potatoes the beef dumplings were crispy and a perfect side a great place to grab a bite the shares hot bowls great for sharing if you are hungry

Address: 4916 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N5 Canada
Review: recommended by a korean friend that this is the go to place for gamjatang we ordered the large pot and is enough to feed 45 people we also ordered korean fried chicken with sweet glazed sauce and tonkatsu would highly recommend

Address: 4916 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N5 Canada
Review: had my very first spicy pork bone soup in life and it was delicious there were 4 pieces of meat in the bowl with soft potato and glass noodles they also served unlimited side dishes if you need to devour a lot per your appetite i got full just with my soup and rice id love to come back again another time the lady servers were very prompt and helpful thank you for the lovely experience

Address: 4916 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N5 Canada
Review: very tasty pork bone soup it was served on butane gas stove to keep it hot korean side dishes were also amazing definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves korean food

Address: 4916 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N5 Canada
Review: havent had gamjatang for a while out so we decided to try it here i had an order that was less spicy but will try the regular spiced one next time the flavours were on point the pork neck bone was not boiledsimmered enough the flavours of the broth was not infused enough into the bones as the pork bones didnt break apart easily overall the flavour profile was there but just required a bit more time in the pot the kimchi that came with the side dishes were delicious service was fine since we went in the late afternoon they are between a 3  4 star i will make adjustments base upon my next visit

Address: 575 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 1Z3 Canada
Review:
overall mabu generation is rather mediocre all things considered although some menu items here do stand out the majority are exceptionally overpriced on busy nights you can expect to join a virtual queue and will have to go elsewhere and wait for a table to open meanwhile which detracts from the experience

the atmosphere is rather flashy and aesthetic though not necessary comfortable it feels more so like a trendy pub at times as it can get quite crowded and loud

of the food notable appetizers include the okonomiyaki fries and the deep fried tofu with garlic sauce both being exceptionally flavourful for the price i dont recommend the bbq crab sticks as they tasted as if they were overseasoned with pepper entreewise i highly recommend sharing the mabu egged sukiyaki with rice although pricey it is exceptionally filling and is definitely a meal fit for more than one person id advise against getting the house special deep fried pork chop with mapo tofu sauce on rice for the price it isnt really noteworthy nor does it taste as spicy as one would expect of mapo tofu and is overall a letdown

i will note however that the rice bowls are decently filling and probably one of the few decent recommendations at mabu likewise the only other solid options at mabu are the desserts but they are exceptionally overpriced if youre fine with burning a bit of cash sharing either the mango or matcha honey cube toast ice cream tower with friends is a solid choice same applies to the mabu house special grass jelly with brown sugar milk tea

to conclude mabu generation is overpriced underwhelming and overrated

Address: 575 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 1Z3 Canada
Review:
i dined at mabu generation È∫ªÂ∏É at the yonge  wellesley location as its website sums it up its a trendy taiwanese fusion cuisine i found the staff provided excellent service and by default check on me to see if everything is ok and refilled my ice water by default interesting and unique decor with all the nostalgic artwork that reminds us back home and the memories

i ordered the tawianese spicy beef soup noodles its spicy just the way it should be spicy broth 1699  tax isnt cheap per say but at downtown location and inflation its the norm nowadays

overall i enjoyed my visit

Address: 575 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 1Z3 Canada
Review: pretty good taiwanese spot i loved the decor and vibe there were retro movie posters and a large cute mural on the opposite wall everything appeared to be made of wood the food was fairly good i really liked the hot plate i found the hot pot to be just okay the portion was good for 2 people tastewise it was okay not amazing the desserts looked pretty ridiculous and very sweet the service was very good and attentive i would probably come for the other sizzling plates and maybe the dessert with a group

Address: 575 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 1Z3 Canada
Review:
i got many recommendations for this restaurant the food was great crispy chicken soft and juicy pork feet the cocktail was pretty and not strong
but the customer service experience was not good
1 the menu needed to scan qr code while the network was super bad in the restaurant i struggled for a while until i was told there was wifi available by waiters
2 the crispy chicken rice actually included egg but not mentioned on the menu then i added extra egg while ordering at the end i got 2 eggs and no one reminded me of it

overall its great and some customer service experience can be improved

Address: 575 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M4Y 1Z3 Canada
Review: went in to grab a small bite late at night now i think i found my new favourite their food is so delicious and so well seasoned when i came in the restaurant was packed we sat after 1015 mins and the wait was worth it the manager even gave us free dessert as an apology for waiting their restaurant was closed when we ordered but they even waited for us until we finished so happy about the service and the food its rare but definitely  a gem

Address: 4848 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N2 Canada
Review:
so happy to be so close to one of my favourite spots for oysters sushi rolls and other japanese fares love the yuzu cocktails and unique take on dishes absolutely love the salmon roll with asparagus and apple such an interesting flavour pairing and it was so filling

definitely love bringing folks here for the vibe and its so conveniently located right off yonge and sheppard near the highway and transit parking is tricky if its full but other than that its a great location

make sure to try it out at least once and head over tuesday and wednesday for specials

Address: 4848 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N2 Canada
Review: had dinner with a group of 6 on their spacious patio pretty nice vibes but they had a mandatory 18 gratuity for a group our size we tried various items their sushi rolls were not conventional but not my favourite i liked the octo wasabi appetizer and it was pretty good with the oyster too

Address: 4848 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N2 Canada
Review: food tasted pretty good we enjoyed the seared salmon roll the most however menu prices are on the higher end service was good and ambience was also nice they have 1 oysters on tuesdays and wednesdays

Address: 4848 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N2 Canada
Review: what a susprised for this little izakaya  we couple frds gather for drinks and food  they have 1 per oyster which is good for what we came  we ordered 5 dozen with other food  food is acceptional good service is fast for the 1st round  abit slow for next round as the restaurant got busy at late night  it is a good place for some drinkz nd food chill and relax  highly recommeded

Address: 4848 Yonge Street Toronto, ON M2N 5N2 Canada
Review:
definitely on the pricey side but loved the creative touches they added to the items on the menu and the quality of the food restaurant ambience was lovely  and felt classy

we had the seared salmon roll cali donburi east and west coast oysters crispy pork belly and their specialty sakes food took a bit to arrive but it was absolutely worth the wait

servers were also very friendly sometimes took a little to get their attention as it was busy  but generally very attentive

consider coming with a group of friends as they have many shareable options

overall a great experience will be coming again in the future

Address: 998 St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A2 Canada
Review: probably the best tacos in toronto im not the biggest taco connoisseur but i think anyone that likes tacos and has a half decent palette would appreciate this place this is a very small restaurant that is out of the way but its worth travelling to dont expect a lot from the decor its a food served on paper plates type of place incredibly nice staff everything i had was great

Address: 998 St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A2 Canada
Review:
chorilocos nachos were fantastic  just the right amount of heat loads of flavour and lots of crunch beware youre likely to fill up on these sausagetopped nachos before your tacos even arrive

i really enjoyed the shrimp taco but the volcan steak pastor marinated pork choriqueso cheese and sausage and pescado fish tacos tasted just alright

very limited indoor and outdoor seating no frills cash only authentic and local

Address: 998 St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A2 Canada
Review: an authentic small and family run place i loved their taco very fresh and felt like a homemade one its cash only by the way but they take etransfer too

Address: 998 St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A2 Canada
Review: thought this place was a bit pricey for what you get we ordered the torta sandwich with pork and it was very large and can be split between 2 people  very tasty opted out of the tacos since fancier dining establishments charge the same amount per taco if not less and this place is more of a take out or quick bites place also got the beef quesadilla and it was ok wasnt wowed by it

Address: 998 St. Clair Avenue W Toronto, ON M6E 1A2 Canada
Review:
itacate is a small familyrun taqueria on st clair west we usually come to st clair for sushi but shunoko is gone now  and always walked by itacate on the way to get dessert at futura

there isnt a lot of seating and a lot of people get their food togo however we were able to grab a table near the door where there was additional window seating expect longer wait times during peak hours

the place has a bunch of different luchador masks adorning the walls which were super cool the kitchen is open and you can see them preparing the food right in front of you

we got 7 tacos for 8 each served with 2 hot sauces it is on the pricier side compared to other toronto taco places weve been to but the food was delicious nonetheless

cash and etransfer available for taxfree payment debit is also available tax

3x pastor marinated pork pineapple
volcan steak onions cheese
suadero beef
2x camarones a la mexicana shrimp

Address: 454 Parliament Street Toronto, ON M5A 3A2 Canada
Review:
tried this pub for the first time and we quite loved it the staff were super friendly and the food was great as well
we tried the steak and wild mushroom pie scotch egg the parliament burger and steak sandwich the steak sandwich was particularly good

Address: 454 Parliament Street Toronto, ON M5A 3A2 Canada
Review:
a great experience as a whole
big portion plates with super amazing taste
very friendly and attentive staff
loved all the details of design and space this place is more than a pub restaurant its a community space for the cool people of the block

Address: 454 Parliament Street Toronto, ON M5A 3A2 Canada
Review: love the location customer service was top notch food was hot tasty and excellent great beers highly recommended

Address: 454 Parliament Street Toronto, ON M5A 3A2 Canada
Review: i think its the vibe and the friendly staff that always makes it a memorable visit good eclectic menu that tries to cater to different palates and needs my friends loved the food i felt it could have been a bit better in terms of the flavor i got the coconut shrimp chowder and the caramelcake dessert nevertheless it was minor compared to the whole experience the string of people that keep coming and the fact that its always packed is a testament to them being one of the best places to be in this area

Address: 454 Parliament Street Toronto, ON M5A 3A2 Canada
Review: the decoration is amazing perfect place to go if you are looking for esthetic place we ordered chicken wings with french fries it tasted so good  highly recommended for you are looking for a nice place with good food staffs are exceptionally good 1010

Address: 1744 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M1R 1R4 Canada
Review:
we pre booked a table for a group of six and got seats instantly the inner decor looks great and the service was really nice

now coming to the food it was refreshing and mouth watering we tried multiple dishes like mango salad chicken satay beef salad one shrimp dish one crab dish stir fried beef stir fried chicken green curry iced tea and no complaints and a special thanks to the chef for the mango and beef salad i would highly recommend this place and would love to be back again

Address: 1744 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M1R 1R4 Canada
Review:
love their thai iced tea chicken pad thai and fish red curry werent spicy or maybe i should have asked but it was still great and mango sticky rice was great too
the staff and service were good too

Address: 1744 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M1R 1R4 Canada
Review:
great food but a bit too westernized but take note that i just came back from thailand few months ago so my tastebuds are tamed to real thai authentic cuisines pad thai and tom yum was good khao soi is very different from what i used to get in northern thailand tasted a bit too artificial
service is superb nice smiley thai staffs

Address: 1744 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M1R 1R4 Canada
Review: located in a strip mall you wouldnt have guessed that they have a hidden beautifully renovated sitting area  we ordered an array of different food and everything was delicious  service was friendly and prompt

Address: 1744 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M1R 1R4 Canada
Review: halal thai restaurant in toronto their food is terrific when it served spicy the mild option is pretty blunt if you order mild make sure you ask them to give you extra chilli paste on side if you add their thai chilli in soup it will make the soup 10 times better you will get the kick i loved their mango salad tom kha pad thai penang curry the most

Address: 1109 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M4B 2K2 Canada
Review: this place is a favourite for sure the foods great the vibe is great and the waiters are very kind its a tad bit disorganized if im being honest but i dont mind cause its made up for overall with everything else if youre an impatient person or just very critical of the places you eat this might not be the place for you if youre looking for a casual place to eat some good food then its pretty great

Address: 1109 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M4B 2K2 Canada
Review:
so so went here after a bad long day
heard their fish tacos was great however i will review on what i had fries with guac veggie tacos and veggie tostado so so not the best beer was good

Address: 1109 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M4B 2K2 Canada
Review:
incredible experience tonight at mexitaco it was mine and my wifes first time and the food and drinks were great i had the mexitaco beer which was a light tasting lager and my wife a strawberry margarita both drinks were brought instantly as well as the food i cannot say how quick it was because we ordered it and less than 10 minutes later we had the food we ordered

we ordered the nachos and tacos de birra the chips were fresh tasting and crispy and delicious and i would definitely recommend them  the tacos de birra were phenomenal and i cannot say enough good about them i loved the flavourful beef the complimentary sauces and the beef au jus wasnt necessary but a nice touch

the food was so good we also tried the baja fish tacos and then shared the churros

overall the experience was great and all of the staff was so very friendly and helpful

i will definitely return probably next weekend for the live music and more of their delicious food

Address: 1109 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M4B 2K2 Canada
Review: surprisingly very good fries and wings at this joint plantains left a lot to be desired

Address: 1109 Victoria Park Avenue Toronto, ON M4B 2K2 Canada
Review: fantastic service and the birria tacos were amaaazing great guacamole and sangria too and the family i went with loved the fish tacos

Address: 172 Main Street S Toronto, ON M4E 2W1 Canada
Review:
i have been working in the area for a month and i kept passing this place its quite small and unassuming as a veteran home smoker im often critical of smokehouses as you cant beat my own cooking beach house smokehouse does not disappoint as soon as you walk in the sweet aroma of authentic bbq fills the air
im greeted by people that are proud of they are serving i ordered the ribs with the intention of bringing some home they offered bbq sauce i took it just in case my ribs would be dry that sauce remained untouched as the ribs were juicy and perfectly cooked they let me try a piece of brisket and i have no words melt in your mouth
i would highly recommend to any smoke enthusiasts and i will definitely be back
