Review: omg the best soup weve ever had you must try beef sate noodle soup the other two dishes pho and lemongrass chicken we had were good but the beef sate noodle soup was very memorable

Address: 1425 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C2 Canada
Review:
food is actually very good and filling i had the spicy vermicelli soup and spring rolls beef pho is also good
i think what could be better is the cleanliness i could smell the washroom from were i was eating

Address: 1425 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C2 Canada
Review: it was a nice small restaurant my friend brought me there we ordered fried chicken wings salad spring rolls and some noodle soup everything was good didnt feel very thirsty after all we came one hour before close but the waiter was still nice and patiently taking our orders

Address: 1425 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C2 Canada
Review: excellent meal it was my first time trying vietnamese cuisine its totally worth it

Address: 1425 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2C2 Canada
Review: tried the crispy spicy pork deep fried spring rolls vietnamese style coffee and our regular deluxe beef pho best pho in winnipeg with a great broth great flavor in the pork and spring rolls the pork is pretty spicy so this dish is not for you if you cant handle high spice levels first time trying vietnamese style coffee and it was really good

Address: 75 Forks Market Road Winnipeg, MB R3C 4Y3 Canada
Review: my family likes that the food on the menu tasted different it was unique and gave an experience congruent to the vibe the forks offers we also likenthe dinner ware we ordered mushroom toast with beets lamb pickerel meat balls

Address: 75 Forks Market Road Winnipeg, MB R3C 4Y3 Canada
Review: had a great dinner full of laughs and delicious food our server was excellent and gave us some tips on new drinks to check out and was very informative about the food really enjoyed all of the dishes i personally recommend the rack of lamb nice place for a date or just to go have some fancy cocktails

Address: 75 Forks Market Road Winnipeg, MB R3C 4Y3 Canada
Review:
visited just before the dinner rush

service was pretty good we made a reservation for a certain number of people and they gave us enough seats but for some reason we were missing two sets of flatware and napkins it was corrected but it felt like the server didnt believe us at first

aside from that our server was really polite and accommodating the whole time i appreciated her patience since we were a pretty big group there is an 18 gratuity included for bigger groups

i ordered the pan fried bearcat pickerel the taste was very mild and overall it was just okay there is nothing to write home about i wouldnt really recommend it my partner ordered the special which was a modern surf and turf with pork belly and octopus that was much more flavourful i say to definitely try asking what the special is before ordering food is very pricey but you can see that in their menu online

overall it was a good experience but i wont go out of my way to come back

Address: 75 Forks Market Road Winnipeg, MB R3C 4Y3 Canada
Review: excellent food and service yesterday definitely will come again i recommend the buttermilk fried chicken with the brussel sprouts as a side

Address: 75 Forks Market Road Winnipeg, MB R3C 4Y3 Canada
Review:
i had a few hours to kill while i waited for people and wanted to try someplace new and this place had eggs bennie ill just say that the only reason it got 4 stars instead of 5 was it was a really cold day and the tea for my earl grey came tepid i really wanted hot tea and it doesnt take that long to preheat a cup the eggs benedict were good not eggsellent but good i loved the crunchy potatoes
all in all it was a good place for breakfast and to wait out a few hours watching people

Address: 1084 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 1Z9 Canada
Review: amazing restaurant food is always tasty and healthy owners are really nice great price and delivery option large menu selection thank you

Address: 1084 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 1Z9 Canada
Review:
i have been going here for years  i can tell that the owners of old must have sold the restaurant to someone who hates their customers
to start the rice was days old they served us old rice they didnt want to throw out  then we try to ordered chow mein  the server asked if we meant bean sprouts with dry noodles
i told her no even argued that we wanted fried noodles
whoever took the order insisted we have bean sprout chop suey  i told them i wanted chow mien noodles   they sent me the bean sprout chop suey anyhow with dry noodles in a bag
the beaf stew with bean cake had no meat in it it was all cheap vegetables and tofu   the real insult was the fact they used rotten bok choy that had black mold on it in the dish   something tasted off immediately   by the time we noticed they had closed  and we even tipped them for the abuse  not only would i not recommend anyone going here ever i will be reporting this establishment for their gross misconduct

Address: 1084 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 1Z9 Canada
Review:
we ordered pic up some beef chow fun singapore noodles and cantonese sweet and sour pork
the food was tasty and plentiful i cant believe how many times i have driven past it and never ordered from it i see there were some negative comments on delivery times i ordered in person and waited the food was ready in less than 15 min
give it a try

Address: 1084 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 1Z9 Canada
Review:
ordered the cantonese chow mein for pick up havent ordered since christmas
used to be excellent
wondered why it was so heavy
must be a ton of noodles i thought
yummy
they filled it with gravy juice wth
no taste very little noodles minimal veggies
drained out the juice container was less than 12 full 
get your old chef back

Address: 1084 Pembina Hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T 1Z9 Canada
Review: my husband loves chinese food with a passion im not quite at his level of devotion but this place is really good the golden inn beef is my favorite and any of their hot plate choice are delicious word of warning dont get the fried rice theres absolutely nothing special about it very bland and dry other than that this is a great place

Address: 670 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X7 Canada
Review:
the setting of places excellent one can imagine that one is in italy
the seasoning of the food is very nice the quality of the ingredients is good
unfortunately the service is terribly bad the assignment of the table did not take long but it took almost half an hour to take our order and almost an hour to serve us then to ask for the bill was a similar story it wasnt that there were many people the service staff wasted a lot of time joking with each other

its not a bad place when you have a lot of time to waste

Address: 670 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X7 Canada
Review: this restaurant has the most cozy atmosphere and delicious food it is filled with italian and roman decorations which adds to the charm of dinning there the menu has so many options but for us the standout dishes were the onion and seafood soups which were delicious also the pastas were fantastic especially the linguini alla pescatora and linguini al vongole both had amazing sauces and were rich in flavour the service was excellent with attentive and really nice staff i highly recommend this place to anyone looking for delicious italian food in a super cozy atmosphere

Address: 670 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X7 Canada
Review:
where do i start

the first thing i thought when i was here with my partner was ive always wanted to try this place out the second one was i think ive seen this episode of gordon ramsays kitchen nightmares before some first impressions are the most important but in this case it was the second

my partner got the pesto linguine which as you can see from the attached photo was drenched in oil immediately upon receiving the plate pushing down gently on the noodles revealed a layer of oil underneath halfway through as shown the situation hadnt improved i could picture gordon ramsay commenting about the quantity of oil probably using language more colourful than the basil

i had looked at the menu and saw homemade pasta with an entry for cannelloni i make fresh pasta semiregularly so i was excited to try this entree what i got was _not_ what i was anticipating as before images of gordon ramsay shouting its not fresh its frozen popped into my mind the meat mixture alone was off the taste was acceptable but no more but the texture was pasty at best and the pasta the pasta was well and truly bad fresh homemade pasta is not a hard thing to make even just semolina and water can give excellent results this however was not that it had clearly been frozen at some point in its lifecycle perhaps long ago it cracked a little from the dry interior as i cut through it with the knife the flavor was off as well in a way that i cannot explain ive had better noodles from a grocery store box by an order of magnitude ive also had better frozen meat filled pasta dishes from a grocery store box as well

and thats nothing to say of the overall experience the staff cut my partner off twice when asking a question put their hands on our shoulders without asking and were the loudest fixture of the establishment the guests were far quieter and the only ambience was the staff joking with each other while sharing things on their phones

overall this trip was characterized by regret my stomach not 30 minutes from my experience there is gurgling and uncomfortable my partners is as well for 30 a plate you would expect quality or at least quantity but we received neither i regret choosing to not waste the food i regret making the choice to give it a try and i regret mostly not having a personal tip line to gordon ramsay

edited to add 2 hours after our seating my partner is now throwing up 0 stars

Address: 670 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X7 Canada
Review:
honestly i cant find better pasta  pizza than colosseo in winnipeg if i want some pizza or pasta i literally only visit this restaurant

a bit loud inside so 3 stars for atmosphere however except for that everything is perfect

recommended

Address: 670 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X7 Canada
Review: great food loved the pasta and pizza our server was energetic and enthusiastic while explaining the menu and serving the only thing that didnt work for me was the atmospherealmost dungeonlike interiors lighted with only artificial lighting patio seating may be better a little on the pricey side but still worth it

Address: 1406 Ellice Ave Winnipeg, MB R3G 0G4 Canada
Review:
when my wife asked for jollibee for her birthday i knew there was no denying that request i mean who am i to stand in the way of a jollibee celebration back in the philippines jollibee was a staple for all our special occasions  birthdays graduations even just getting a good grade on a test and let me tell you every time i sink my teeth into their food its like a trip down memory lane to my childhood

my goto favorites are the filipinostyle spaghetti  sweet meaty and just like how i remember it the palabok fiesta which is a fiesta in my mouth with all its amazing flavors and of course the spicy chicken joy  crispy juicy and oh so satisfying honestly i could eat this every single day and never get tired of it

so if you havent tried jollibee yet consider this your official sign to go and check it out you wont regret it  trust me its a whole experience in itself

Address: 1406 Ellice Ave Winnipeg, MB R3G 0G4 Canada
Review:
so this was my first time dining at jollibee ive always seen the very distinct signage and was curious about the place my perspective of the place was that it was inviting when i first entered the establishment i quickly came to the realization that this place was very popular for many people i like the relaxed feeling in the atmosphere it wasnt congested the staff were really relaxed and continually on the spot with their roles this made it feel even more welcoming

the seating was comfortable and not cramped

the speed of the service was excellent when i asked for extra napkins a staff member stopped what she was doing and kindly obliged

i liked the chicken it was something new to me the way the chicken was really crispy

i gave this rating a five in atmosphere and service and only a four for food because i just selected exactly what my friend was having im sure if i picked what i would have really wanted i would have given it four stars

im giving this a 5 star overall because i was so relieved that it wasnt one of those nightmare food runs

overall no complaints

Address: 1406 Ellice Ave Winnipeg, MB R3G 0G4 Canada
Review:
had the regular and spicy chicken mashed potatoes and fries

really like the chicken  enjoyed it much better than kfc and popeyes

kids really liked the pineapple quencher reminds me of drinking the pineapple juice of a can of dole pineapple

overall very good for a fast food chain

Address: 1406 Ellice Ave Winnipeg, MB R3G 0G4 Canada
Review:
place is good pleasant people food is good but sometimes their chicken is  undercooked

parking is a challenge  which also means that the place is popular especially to filipinos

Address: 1406 Ellice Ave Winnipeg, MB R3G 0G4 Canada
Review: doesnt even taste and look like jollibee anymore the chicken was old and the batter was too hard on the outside and undercooked on the inside hope it was a one time thing

Address: 730 St Anne's Rd Unit M Winnipeg, MB R2N 0A2 Canada
Review:
delicious pupusas just like youd get back home

only downside is that theyre often very busy and it may take some time to get your order as everything is being made in the back from scratch

id recommend getting a reservation and ordering appetizers so youre not dissapointed

Address: 730 St Anne's Rd Unit M Winnipeg, MB R2N 0A2 Canada
Review: insanely good just at the restaurant with a full tummy but want to eat more because it is just simply too good ordered combination and a cerveza now i want to try all of their menu even in weekdays it seems quite busy wouldnt hurt to make a reservation

Address: 730 St Anne's Rd Unit M Winnipeg, MB R2N 0A2 Canada
Review: authentic salvadorian cuisine with many vegan and vegetarian options different days of the week have different specials the owners are quite friendly my favorite are the black bean pupusas with salsa and curtido this place used to supply mondragon with corn tamales and bean pupusas back when it existed

Address: 730 St Anne's Rd Unit M Winnipeg, MB R2N 0A2 Canada
Review: these are the best pupusas in the city without a doubt my wife and i make it a thing to come frequently you will not be disappointed

Address: 730 St Anne's Rd Unit M Winnipeg, MB R2N 0A2 Canada
Review: so much fun delicious pupusas and tomales be sure to try the horchata drink very friendly staff wednesdays and saturdays have live mariachi music cant wait to come back

Address: 219 Saint Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J2 Canada
Review: wow amazing staff and food is so good highly recommend the chicken cesar sandwich

Address: 219 Saint Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J2 Canada
Review:
an old time classic and iconic diner an amazing find in the peg after a long road trip which ended here fortunately i have a lifelong friend who resides here and knew i would luuuuvvv this place
our gregarious server vickie was a joy and when i found out they served coke floats i was blown away i have not had one in decades the chocolate milkshake was a bit of a watery disappointment which did not taste like it was made with actual ice cream
the greek chicken burger was a lovely grilled breast but a bit smothered in too much tzatziki sauce which overpowered its flavourthe cheezburger was a delicious hand made pattie of flavourful juicy  meat but again was a bit disappointing with the addition of a very smoky chili sauce which overpowered the burger apparently this is the house specialty which i did not know about and will know better the next visit
a pleasure to see places like this still exist and a great end to a sadly short visit

Address: 219 Saint Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J2 Canada
Review:
its a very busy and highly popular restaurant i mean not by the internet influence but loved by local people
you could be waiting for a while to get your meal but definitely worth to wait
i like the fried chicken and bolognese pasta i guess many people be here for the burger burgers are also good and you could be very comfortable to have a meal with your family or closest friends
i saw theres a christmas card send from a customer to the staff you can see neighbors loves it and many people come to eat as a naturally choice

Address: 219 Saint Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J2 Canada
Review: the food was absolutely incredible big huge portions i will definitely be coming again and you spend half the money you would if you went to a fancy restaurant and you actually leave full

Address: 219 Saint Mary's Road Winnipeg, MB R2H 1J2 Canada
Review: this place has been around for over 50 years and you cant beat that foods excellent atmosphere was good well worth the stop by

Address: 99 Osborne Street Suite 102 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2R4 Canada
Review:
the food arrived hot and tasted absolutely delicious

i would highly recommend the sweet and sour chicken as basic as that sounds it was probably the best sweet and sour chicken i have ever had

the noodles were nice as well veggies tasted fresh even the rice was soft and fresh which you dont see to often anymore the satay sauce is also very tasty

will be ordering here again really impressed with the quality and price

Address: 99 Osborne Street Suite 102 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2R4 Canada
Review: weve been ordering from spicy noodle house for over 20 years staff and service are the best my favourites are soup a18 with 1 broth deep fried shrimp and honey garlic chicken our favourite chinese food restaurant in winnipeg

Address: 99 Osborne Street Suite 102 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2R4 Canada
Review:
large menu all sorts of choices soups noodle soups other dishes which would be best to order a variety and share
friendly service was very quick with the food

Address: 99 Osborne Street Suite 102 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2R4 Canada
Review:
ordered on skip got the peanut soup the broth was thin and there was a bad almost vinigar taste to it if i had not paid money i would not have eaten it
the spicy beef was okay
we also got the curry chicken it wasnt really a curry the chicken was kind slimy we did not eat it
we wanted to try something new we will never order from here again very expensive and we couldnt eat one dish didnt really like but ate the soup only the beef was okay but not that good

Address: 99 Osborne Street Suite 102 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2R4 Canada
Review:
whenever im sick i get soup here the broth is full of flavour unfortunately i usually cant taste much else as when im sick my sinuses are blocked reasonably priced for osborne village
also even though i havent actually eaten here when im not sick for the last 10 years its the village every restaurant here is good most have some creative aspect to them because its the village but its chinese food the broth for soup is flavourful you know that the food is good

Address: 598 Ebby Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M Canada
Review:
dont come to this place for buffet just dont  we went there today for buffet and found out there was nothing  only 5 chicken pieces and 2 pieces of beef on the meat part we paid 1699 dollars and had nothing to eat only veggies we asked them more than 3 times to refill but they did not and all of them were inside the kitchen i dont know what went wrong today it was a dinner buffet one of my friends didnt even get to eat a single chicken piece there was no tandoori chicken available the samosas were stale from the day before so we threw it away we called the waiter n told her that samosas were stale but she kept on denying worst place
im sooo mad paid 1699 dollars plus tax n got out starving i hate myself for even coming here dont go there are many other indian places just go there if it comes for buffet

Address: 598 Ebby Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M Canada
Review: came here for their lunch buffet on a sunday  the food was good the naan that comes with the bread was hot and crispy when it came  decent variety of meat and veggies dishes

Address: 598 Ebby Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M Canada
Review:
had the buffett meh
the butter chicken isnt even decent
the nann bread is doughy
the pea corn slime was acctualy food
service is weak slow impersonal but also its kind of nice to be left alone
the fruit plate you get for free is pretty ok
the indian pasta was edible
the rice was good
the buffett price is was to high 1399 for what you get
i wouldnt go back
i didnt even want to pay for the food
my total for 2 was 3164 the guy stood there staring at the money and eventually came to the conclusion the out of 40 my change would be 6

Address: 598 Ebby Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M Canada
Review: it was a whole empty area it was dead i understand the point cause may be it was not the peak time but it was dead in a sense that someone wouldnt wanna go and sit there to feel more lonely apart from that the food wasnt good enough to substitute with loneliness we ordered 2 things from the menu one of them was naan with shahi paneer they served in a to go tray like the subway stores have for dinning inside pretty bad experience it wasnt worth it if you can see in the picture thats how they served the food

Address: 598 Ebby Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3M Canada
Review: been waiting over 20 for a pickup yet the dining room had only 2 table very slow

Address: 43 Sherbrook Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B1 Canada
Review:
the nook diner does not pretend to be anything fancy its an old school family restaurant where portion sizes are generous and the menu is straightforward breakfast all day a few salads burgers and sandwiches
we were a large group on fathers day and food arrived at the same time and at the correct temperature we had blueberry pancakes grilled cheese sandwich eggs benedict a cheese dog the chili cheeseburger and two eggs breakfast food was good coffee was okay service was excellent
if you want a no fuzz diner the nook is a place you can consider

Address: 43 Sherbrook Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B1 Canada
Review:
ive been going to the nook for over 15 years and its always been 55 local diner quality sadly it has gone waaay down hill the last few years
last few visits were so disappointing that i dont think ill go again the prices have more than doubled i can understand some increased pricing due to inflation but the quality has also gone way down  and 2000 for a benedict felt excessive for a locally owned diner more expensive than stellas or clementine for a humble diner portion sizes are smaller and there were what seemed to be eyelashes or small hairs on my plate and my partners plate  careless presentation very sad im so sorry to leave this review but im just so disappointed

Address: 43 Sherbrook Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B1 Canada
Review: was my favourite and most reliable breakfast spot in wpg great staff im all for price adjustments but my goto omelette went up by 550 last time i stopped in hard to justify an omelette for 1750 will miss this spot thanks for years of good food at reasonable prices

Address: 43 Sherbrook Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B1 Canada
Review: food is fine no frills good portion but after tax and tip an omelette and coffee came to over 25 which is more than a breakfast at frenchway cafe stellas or miss browns

Address: 43 Sherbrook Street Winnipeg, MB R3C 2B1 Canada
Review: food and service was excellent our server jaiden was particularly friendly and super helpful four stars due to the rude manager with the black hair that sat in the corner and berated her staff super unprofessional of her to be openly mean to her staff who are working hard and doing well

Address: 1038 St James Street Suite C1 Winnipeg, MB R3H 0K5 Canada
Review: good amount of seating for dine in experience however i got take out this time and food was amazing for a second visit

Address: 1038 St James Street Suite C1 Winnipeg, MB R3H 0K5 Canada
Review: one of the best shawarmas in north america their saj is always fresh and tasty and the meat is perfect i always enjoy their shawarma when i am in town i highly recommend

Address: 1038 St James Street Suite C1 Winnipeg, MB R3H 0K5 Canada
Review: delicious food and the kindest staff you can tell they love their food and value their customers ive been eating here for years and have never been disappointed highly recommend

Address: 1038 St James Street Suite C1 Winnipeg, MB R3H 0K5 Canada
Review: found this hidden gem on st james st while visiting winnipeg wonderful healthy tasty food really enjoyed the falafel wrap my first visit 2nd visit i ordered the chicken platter which was excellent

Address: 1038 St James Street Suite C1 Winnipeg, MB R3H 0K5 Canada
Review: great beef rice bowl and friendly staff but the mango drink was not best recommend basil seed drink

Address: 1697 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J9 Canada
Review: im happy to have dined at an italian restaurant which has certificate of authenticity by government of italy  i ordered gnocchi al tartufo but gnocchi ran out so i got it substituted with capellini then had a tiramisu finally tried a cappuccino with amaretto and topped it all off with a pistachio gelato cappuccino gelato wines were awesome service was wonderful ambience was spectacular i sat outside alfresco however the pasta dish and tiramisu were just okay because the taste was bland they mention the use of truffle oil but i could not smell it or taste it in the dishmoreover the tiramisu was dry and had a very subtle hint of espresso so these dishes should have been flavourful for the appreciation

Address: 1697 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J9 Canada
Review: was here for a staff gathering during their regularly closed hours we were able to eat and then play bocci ball on their courts which was super fun  service was perfect and the wine selection was great  very very helpful staff  ive been her before and this just solidified my reasons for liking it we had a buffet style meal which was really good and they looked after all the special diets in our group very nicely i think this is a guaranteed great place to go if you want a nice evening out

Address: 1697 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J9 Canada
Review:
the front of the house was totally disorganized our server was doing the best he could with his workload being half the restaurant the owner was walking around oblivious to the patrons trying to catch her eye for help when i finally stopped another woman working there asking questions about dessert she had no clue would i go back never was the food good absolutely i think the young family who took the restaurant over from their retired parents need to keep their eye on their customers and stop walking around like we should be grateful we are allowed into their restaurant and the gelato was so cold the flavour could not be determined my partners gelato was filled with ice crystals
our bill for 2 was just under 20000
my opinion

update i was not complaining about our server he was doing his best  i was pointing out the owner never took the time to actually see what was happening in her restaurant the two ladies at the table behind us who had different server were having the same issues

Address: 1697 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J9 Canada
Review: simply the best i bought their pizza kit it comes as you see on pictures in a box every ingredients separately about the quality impressive all fresh it is kit for you to open the dough the flavour of it is absolutely fantastic you feel you are in italy price super fair worth every cent

Address: 1697 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3N 0J9 Canada
Review:
i havent been here in years
the pizza was exceptional
sat on the patioit was a perfect evening
mona lisa is on my list to visit more often
well worth the trip

Address: 2169 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3J 0L7 Canada
Review: great food excellent service good vibes both french onion soup and clam chowder are exceptional beef ribs is a bit spicy but tastes great kid menu offers lots of choices and we particularly like the pasta  a bit underseasoned for adults but just right for kids or toddlers the creamy crab dip with crostini forgot the official name on menu was a bit salty but is still fine overall a great dining experience will definitely go again

Address: 2169 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3J 0L7 Canada
Review: lovely dinner on a saturday night at this restaurant  the special included a half rack of ribs chicken breast and prawns your choice of carbohydrate  mashed potato baked potato fries or rice plus vegetables and a salad or soup to start  we had the mashed potatoes with gravy  was very creamy  started with a tossed salad lots of salad dressings to choose from  fantastic flavours with this meal  the breading on the large prawns was crunchy and well seasoned  really enjoyed it  bbq sauce on the chicken and ribs was perfect  rib meat feel off the bone  the chicken was fantastic  green beans were seasoned with a herb vinaigrette was very nice  the restaurant was very busy that night but our server was attentive friendly and helpful  great experience at this local restaurant   would definitely go there again

Address: 2169 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3J 0L7 Canada
Review:
an oldschool beef meat place  if youre old enough to remember when steak houses were a thing youll feel right at home  if youre not this place will make you wish you were sixty so you could have the memory of simple generouslyproportioned food served by smiling staff

we had the ribs  bravely advertised as the best ribs in town  and were not disappointed  our small sample size precludes confirming theyre the best ribs in winnipeg but brothers and sisters they were excellent ribs  tangy fall off the bone masterpiece work  lots of flavour lots of volume  ribs are very rich  lots of tasty fat  a few ribs are a lot of ribs  show up hungry dont fill up on the buns and when the ribs show up tuck in like fred flintstone and go hard  well worth the money

vegetarian options are ha ha ha ha ha ha ha limited  if you came to a rib place for the salads you done messed up

Address: 2169 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3J 0L7 Canada
Review: i joined my friends for an evening at the lounge where we were greeted by an exceptional waitress the ambiance transported me to a charming european bar enhancing the overall experience while the menu boasted an extensive selection i found the prices to be slightly higher than my personal preference opting for the prime rib i discovered that it fell short of the high standards i typically associate with renowned establishments like the keg this aspect was somewhat disappointing particularly considering the comparable prices however i must emphasize that a lower price point would have greatly contributed to my overall satisfaction

Address: 2169 Portage Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3J 0L7 Canada
Review:
our party was 13 of us paid 40 for a 10 oz steak maybe 7 ounces potato was baked but had to wait way to long to get sour cream and butter potato was warm when i finally did get it the cesar salad was so small i first thought it was a joke im not even five bytes of salad and croutons were rockhard i saw no value in this meal there is no way there was maybe 8 dollars of food cost but the charge 40 dollars for it
not going back and yes other meals were not good also so its just not me
its to bad because i thought it was going to be a great night out with all of my family

Address: 277 Rupert Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 0N5 Canada
Review: met up with friends over lunch here and had great food with the great company when we visited this place it was operating in a more a la carte style than the cart style dim sum places i am more familiar with but that didnt deter from how good and reasonably priced the food was this visit was over a month ago

Address: 277 Rupert Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 0N5 Canada
Review:
went to sampo dim sum this morning and it was not really good the shrimp rolls were very bad the fried calamari were just a lot of fried batterthe only thing that was good was the beef balls and the pea tips in garlic turnip cake was mushy and the eggplant was also not so good i wouldnt go again i prefer by far kumkoon
it was also so silent with zero ambiance and the service was also bad and you have to order with a menu for dim sum

Address: 277 Rupert Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 0N5 Canada
Review: we got to this place when it just opened at 11am and it got busy real quick on a tuesday too parking was free right next to building so that was good service was quick and good dim sum was good but only thing they didnt have was the chili sauce we get in us

Address: 277 Rupert Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 0N5 Canada
Review: very tasty dimsums and service was also good it was a bit dirty on the table and on the floor but food is delicious

Address: 277 Rupert Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3B 0N5 Canada
Review:
my family and i frequent here often and it is often a good experience there were four of us and we asked if we could sit at a table that seats 6 as we order lots there was a family of 3 sitting at a 10 person table
the employee told us that with a rude expression on her face that it was reserved
she then returned to give us our plates utensils etc and we  showed our order we asked again if we could move because we were sitting in a tight corner table and we ordered a lot of food she rolled her eyes and walked away

we sat at the new table our ordersheet was full and the two employees looked at us and mumbled something and walked away they passed by us a few times and have not asked for our order sheet it was the first that i can recall experiencing a negative experience here as we have been regulars since the 90s we walked out and went to dim sum garden across the street way better service and and treatment from the get go

Address: 155 Scurfield Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1L6 Canada
Review: first breakfast experience in canada and it was great we went mid week so it wasnt busy the service was friendly and helpful it was hard to choose what to have but i landed on the banana  chocolate crepe which was like a 3 course meal in one crispy bacon with added maple syrup eggs sausage and potato then the highlight of the dish being the banana and chocolate filled crepe this made my stomach very happy lol just a note i ordered a coffee i am used to ordering a large in australia so went for the bowl which was the larger of the 2 sizes they arent wrong it is a bowl of coffee just be thirsty thanks for a great experience will be back next time im back in winnipeg

Address: 155 Scurfield Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1L6 Canada
Review:
this was our first time here and it was easily the best breakfast place weve tried in winnipeg and maybe anywhere weve traveled around the world we enjoyed this more than the original pancake house and ihop in winnipeg also better than dennys and smittys we havent tried other breakfast places in winnipeg toph and ihop have this beat hugely in terms of atmosphere and decor but not in food imho

our server was very busy as someone had called in sick but she was lovely and attentive we were there during the saturday breakfast rush 9am but easily found seating for 4 and our food came out incredibly quick

my meal the first picture was sooooo delicious and unique the oldfashioned ham  cheese curds skillet it was described as shredded oldfashioned ham mixed peppers red onions and cheese curds covered with a mix of hollandaise sauce and pure maple syrup

ohhh it was good not remotely healthy but fun for every now and then our entire party thoroughly enjoyed their meals and we will return

Address: 155 Scurfield Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1L6 Canada
Review: my first time visiting ben  florentine on kenaston  the service was awesome the breakfast options varied and delicious spacious and clean environment and very good covid measures in place  the only thing i would have liked was if my coffee was served in a tea mug that was warm because hot coffee in a cold mug makes your coffee cold before two sips  prices for breakfast items range between 1295 to 1795 approximately

Address: 155 Scurfield Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1L6 Canada
Review:
my sister and i were not impressed by the cleanliness of the food we were serviced both were on our cantaloupes and eggs

this has not happened to me before and i have been coming to this location often not entirely sure if it is someones dog hair or  improper wear of hair nets

i dont recommended to go to this location

Address: 155 Scurfield Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R3Y 1L6 Canada
Review: incredible eggs benedict they have many different options to choose from their hollandaise sauce is spot on their bbq version is slightly spicy with with meaty toppings i wasnt a huge fan of the goat cheese but it went well with the rest of the flavours their eggs benedict also comes with a good portion of hash browns and fruit i ordered a side of crispy french toast  caramelized apples which was very large the topping was like apple pie filling with almonds very tasty their service great as well server was very attentive and polite we also preferred a booth and appreciate how they made that happen will definitely be going back

Address: 500 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0P1 Canada
Review:
the food was the highlight of the experience whereas some of the servers seemed to be new to the serving world but were kind all the same  one can simply tell when there is an experienced server vs when theyre new we found ourselves waiting for things like water refills and more drinks
they also didnt have garlic bread available which i found almost shocking    its like a restaurant staple how do you not serve garlic bread
in any case the food wait was to be expected and well worth it  my partner and i absolutely loved the bruschetta i had a cup of french onion soup the steak sandwich and he had one of their burgers all of which was absolutely fantastic

during another visit i tried their chicken tenders which are easily the best i have ever had  and their parmesan fries are delectable

Address: 500 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0P1 Canada
Review: we had abby as our server a wonderful young lady was a pleasure for my wife and i to spend some time with her the fish and chips and sangria were wonderful will be back again great atmosphere as also

Address: 500 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0P1 Canada
Review: food was great i had tacos and my friend chicken finger portion was a good size service was fine fairly quick as well i think i like interior better before the renovation unfortunately it lost the vibe and looks more like a bistro now i think the wall behind the bar was making the space look bigger anyhow good location enough parking and good food so what else one needs

Address: 500 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0P1 Canada
Review: chicken parm sandwich  delicious  great suggestion by my server   i came in about 730 and the bar staff spent more time talking to coworkers who were getting off shift than checking back with me my meal and drink  all good though overall very good meal chill vibe  id come back  im sure service is usually good

Address: 500 Corydon Avenue Winnipeg, MB R3L 0P1 Canada
Review: most of the time we go places not just for foods but also because of people good service all servers are all friendly smiling and asking if there is anything they can offer  i came there to decorate but since im with the kids needed to order some foods

Address: 1101 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X3 Canada
Review: i havent been here in probably close to 20 years will not be waiting that long to go again its fantastic the food is delicious prices are very reasonable with large portions our food came out very fast and it was hot and fresh upon arrival friendly staff and busy right up to closing go early they close at 2 pm i cant wait to go back again the yam hash mix with the vegan heaven breakfast is to die for

Address: 1101 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X3 Canada
Review: i didnt enjoy the food some were greasy and salty some were too dried but they did give really good portions for the price staffs are nice and fast this is a small familyowned restaurant so i might give them another chance to support their business and if you never try you should come and give them a chance i didnt like their food but you might still like it

Address: 1101 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X3 Canada
Review: i have visited falafel place on two occasions and thoroughly enjoyed my breakfast for a lighter fare i suggest trying the cheese blintzes on my second visit i was a little more hungry and tackled the salami mix oh the salami was delicious attentive service on both occasions with pretty quick service even when busy busy place so you may have to wait well worth it definitely recommend

Address: 1101 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X3 Canada
Review:
food was fantastic  glasses were dirty and the clean replacements didnt smell that great 5 for food 1 for cleanliness

update went again after a long hiatus it was much cleaner this time the food was still amazing but the wait time to get the food was really pronounced id say the 3 rating holds food is still a 5 tho if youve got the time the breakfast brisket is divine

Address: 1101 Corydon Ave Winnipeg, MB R3M 0X3 Canada
Review:
it was okay was the consensus for each of our party for breakfast i like that its local potato pancakes are great as is the house hot sauce
welcome service is good but turned mediocre after food arrived coffee cups are very small only got a halfcup refill and they never came back or checked in after food arrived
eggs and bacon were blackened presumably from a dirty grill with burned grease bacon was very dried out almost as if it were precooked and put back on the grill falafel balls were good but are much smaller than their early days
water tastes oddlike well water no ice
they dont give you an itemized receiptonly the total owed at the til

Address: 30-2583 Pembina hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T Canada
Review:
second time here and came based off a recommendation the ramen itself spicy fried chicken ramen 455 was good and spicy the fried chicken was good but obviously gets soggy really quickly and 55 for the black garlic tonkatsu we got seated very quickly and service was good but we never did get our waters refilled it was fairly busy but we ended up calling them over several times near the end nothing horrible but i think filling of water should be expected takoyaki was very good and served quickly

sushi is pretty pricey but looked well made

however we would probably come back on a tuesday because they have specials where ramen is 1295

Address: 30-2583 Pembina hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T Canada
Review: fabulous hangover cure as you can see i completely devoured my bowl of raman broth was great  the pork was was ok but im not complaining the chicken was tender and juicy the egg was not the right color but still tasted great

Address: 30-2583 Pembina hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T Canada
Review: i got the tonkatsu ramen and spicy salmon roll i loved the pork slices but the rest wasnt anything to write home about loved the service and overall atmosphere though

Address: 30-2583 Pembina hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T Canada
Review: june 28th 2023 ordered black gatlic tonkostu ramen salmon sashimi white dragon roll the food was fresh and very tasty would recommend this place priced a bit high but worth it

Address: 30-2583 Pembina hwy Winnipeg, MB R3T Canada
Review:
ordered the tiger roll and smoked salmon roll

it was a fairly slow day service was very quick and i had my food within 5 minutes of ordering it

the tiger roll was amazing a must have if you order

Address: 238 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2T3 Canada
Review:
everything i had was so good with good price i had pharaohs vacation and opera cake the plate is so filling and filled with loads of veggies  hummus was little bit salty but it perfectly matched with eggs and garlic bread

opera cake was beyond my expectations i thought it would be too sweet  to me but it had perfect balance of sweetness and bitterness and it was so creamy

i got raspberry cheese brownie for my kids they loved it too
i would definitely go back again as i would love to try out crepes croissant and more

staff are so friendly and approachable

Address: 238 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2T3 Canada
Review:
i went for the first time in november then went back three days later to order the exact same meal because i could not stop thinking about how delicious it was everything ive tried since has been incredible

the staff ive engaged with have all been so lovely and friendly even when theyre incredibly busy the sweets and pastries are fantastic and its so fun to look at them all in the display at the counter

i love the variety of art thats on display and for sale its very fun to look at the pieces while enjoying your meal it all felt creative and interesting lots of good conversation pieces i really loved that aspect of the physical space itself

they also collect donations for local womens centres or possibly womens shelters specifically i cant remember i asked someone behind the counter about where the donations go since they didnt have a specific location listed and they explained that they distribute donations to several resources in the area its great to see a local business taking that initiative and very cool that staff are engaged with it enough that they can answer questions and have a conversation about it i really appreciated that

cant wait to go back again soon

Address: 238 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2T3 Canada
Review: cute little cafe just off corydon there was lots of seating and parking right beside the building i tried the spectacolar burger bean burger which was really good the combination of flavors worked well i also tried the fruit tart which was okay but the tart shell was overcooked and hard definitely would come back here to grab a bite and coffee with a friend

Address: 238 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2T3 Canada
Review: we come here regularly and the food is consistently delicious i think they also have the best croissants in town the staff is wonderful there is something special about this place if you havent been youre missing out

Address: 238 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2T3 Canada
Review:
i love the food here but i wouldnt describe the dinein experience as welcoming or friendly

for example when i walked in with a friend today there were at least three people working the front with no customers in line and they didnt even glance at us unsure what to do we decided to wait by the entrance to check out the hot menu the only signage posted by the entrance when my friend i were finally acknowledged it was to tersely inform us that the kitchen was closed we chose to eat elsewhere

Address: 1270 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B1 Canada
Review: we went there to see some good photos and reviews to try their kimchi fried rice and udon but we were very disappointed with the taste quantity and the price but the atmosphere and the staff was very good and polite wasnt happy with their food taste and quantity at all we also ordered sushi which was so good but spent 50 with tips on those foods wasnt a great choice for us to do as we were very hungry after the day of hiking

Address: 1270 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B1 Canada
Review: always enjoy coming to eat here at kimichi foor is good and service is great no complaints from me we ordered sushi and boku boku it was delicious

Address: 1270 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B1 Canada
Review: visited on a whim as i was walking back to my hotel i was alone and got seated in a totally separate room from all of the other diners and in the corner it was fine but i just thought it was a bit strange my 19oz draft pint as stated on the menu was more like a sad 12oz i ordered the sashimi salad and some steamed rice assorted sashimi is a stretch when you only include 2 kinds of fish the amount of fish was disappointing it looked like they took 2 pieces of sashimi max and cut them into tiny cubes and spread them out all over the salad flavour was good but the salad was merely empty nothing but spring mix dressing the sad portion of fish and a few pieces of cubed mango that was starting to go bad dumping my entire bowl of rice on the salad honestly saved it however the server was excellent and he was very polite he did ask if i enjoyed the food and everything was ok which again the flavour was good and honestly i hadnt eaten all day so i wasnt going to complain about something i finished but i do think the portion of fish was sad

Address: 1270 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B1 Canada
Review: located on pembina near jubilee this sushi place has quite an easy excess with tons of parking spots the interior is beautiful and has dividers between tables to give you more private dining experience the menu is really big and has quite a lot of selections for fish and rolls also has specialty section and korean food we didnt get to try to korean food but the sushi we ordered was very fresh and delicious they serve fresh oysters here as well which were amazing definitely order a house hot sake

Address: 1270 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2B1 Canada
Review: great place to mellow down and have some good soul food had some noodles with korean fried chicken will definitely knock you out when you get home just overall great dishes

Address: 350 St Mary Ave Winnipeg, MB R3C 3J2 Canada
Review: went here for dinner once while i was staying at the delta and it was not bad i feel like my expectations for the food was higher based on the pictures the pie flight i ordered was good but not really spectacular we also ordered a side of the meatballs wrapped in puff pastry and they were a bit on the bland side for my taste it looked like it was missing parsley or some sort of garnish based on one other picture i saw i do like the underground british decor and the service was pretty average convenient place to get food if youre staying at the hotel though

Address: 350 St Mary Ave Winnipeg, MB R3C 3J2 Canada
Review: oh my gosh this place is so awesome the food was out of this world truly a slice of england landed in manitoba the most delicious meal ever the service was brilliant

Address: 350 St Mary Ave Winnipeg, MB R3C 3J2 Canada
Review:
this was the first restaurant i ate at when i visited winnipeg i stayed at the delta hotel marriott and i liked the convenience that it was right next door to the hotel

vibe
the vibe of the pub was a british underground space and pretty spacious at the time i went which was late dinner
service
a little slow and not busy at all i went late evening so there werent many servers around that time
food
the sunday roast  turned out to be a huge meal for one it came with a puff pastry on top mash long beans and cooked carrots and some thin slices of roast beef it wasnt bad for the price point

minisausage rolls  this one was probably my favorite it seemed to have missed its garnish in another review i saw but other than that it was the sauce which made it tasty it came with a chutney like sweet sauce to dip the rolls in it had a decent portion to share between 23 people

the wee pie flight  this was small enough to taste test each of the savory pies but i didnt find anything too special with them

overall food was not bad for a late night snack or meal i would go again just for the sausage rolls i found them addicting

ig missasiapattyc

Address: 350 St Mary Ave Winnipeg, MB R3C 3J2 Canada
Review:
i heard that honey dill sauce is unique to manitoba so i had to try it out
i just came in for an after work conference glass of wine just made it in time to order a happy hour glass of wine happy hour is until 600 pm unlike bcthank you braydon for the quick pleasant service back to the honey dill sauce it was sweet tasty with just the right creaminess definitely a great pairing with salty fries peal on or chicken strips thank you braydon for providing me with a unique manitoba experience

Address: 350 St Mary Ave Winnipeg, MB R3C 3J2 Canada
Review: lovely laid back atmosphere grate music and with excellent friendly staff definitely a place to try and will be going back soon

Address: 100 King Street Unit A Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review: love this place love sushi burritos delicious every time i wish they didnt close at 7 its a big early but thats okay

Address: 100 King Street Unit A Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review:
ive eaten by delivery a handful of times this is some of the best quick food ive had in winnipeg tastes fresh and the service is very good i always get a sushi burrito i will note that sometimes it can taste a bit bland they recently called me on my last order in regards to the gluten allergy i noted makes me feel safe to eat the food they make
thank you chosabi

Address: 100 King Street Unit A Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review: i used to eat here all the time i loved the family that worked here not very happy how things were handled and they flat out lied to me on the phone saying they washed their vegetables but feel free to look at the picture below there is still the sticker on the red pepper which has just been cut into slices and served into my bowl not only does that mean they didnt take the plastic sticker off but they probably didnt wash their vegetables sadly i cant find the remainder of the sticker which means i probably ate it

Address: 100 King Street Unit A Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review: similar to other chosabis with limited menu but you can build you own bowl great service

Address: 100 King Street Unit A Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review:
best date night takeout on your way to the movies
grab a sushi burrito on your way to the theater youre full all evening

i always get the happy buddha my partner loves the california sumo on brown rice

Address: 1045 St James Street Unit - K Winnipeg, MB R3H Canada
Review:
took my family of 5 plus 3 others here for a dinner and oh boy was it ever delicious they have lots of rolls to choose from as well as non sushi options if thats your thing everything was fairly priced and super fresh
they have something for everyone highly recommend checking them out you wont regret it

Address: 1045 St James Street Unit - K Winnipeg, MB R3H Canada
Review:
delicious flavors at a reasonable price the service time is acceptable and the attention is very good

definitely goes on my favorites list and we will be back soon

Address: 1045 St James Street Unit - K Winnipeg, MB R3H Canada
Review: ordered after reading the good reviews and unfortunately it was the worst sushi ive ever had in my lifethe rice was crispy either not well cooked or old one of the two the rolls were not properly rolled and would break every time we tried to eat the shrimp had shell residues in the roll the soya came in small bag packs and was so salty non edible the ginger tasted like plastic not exaggerating i do not recommend for takeout

Address: 1045 St James Street Unit - K Winnipeg, MB R3H Canada
Review: sushi is fairly priced tastes delicious it has always been busy when we came to visit but service is prompt

Address: 1045 St James Street Unit - K Winnipeg, MB R3H Canada
Review: got in early so it wasnt very busy by the time we left there was a lineup great service food was very well prepared and presented the veggie caterpillar was extremely cute

Address: 100 King Street Unit D Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review:
on road trips i try to sample local sandwich shops

this one came highly recommended per reviews originally wanted to try hoagie boyz but they were closed on monday im glad they were because i wouldve missed out on one of the best places ive been to i couldnt decide which sandwich to get and i saw them putting the cheese sauce on a sandwich they were making for someone else cant say no to cheese sauce that turned out to be the philly sandwich i was intrigued by the smoked buffalo chicken so i got both one for lunch one for later

exceptional flavour the bread was so soft and fresh unbelievable a little pricy but you get what you pay for i opted for their jalape√±o mac n cheese it was alright their coleslaw was outta world hella fresh and packed with flavour when im in winnipeg again im definitely stopping by again

Address: 100 King Street Unit D Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review:
15 for a small sandwich ok better be the best sandwich ever sadly it was not
king  bannatyne has limited menu options and its overpriced i got the roast sweet potato  hummus disappointing they didnt make it properly
really good customer service though

Address: 100 King Street Unit D Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review: brisket sammich was weak on meat but tasty tomato soup was good you can use all that extra bread for dunking staff courteous but not overly helpful pricey

Address: 100 King Street Unit D Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review:
the atmosphere is great the bread to filling ratio of the sandwich is not too much bread not enough meatveggies especially considering the price side potato salad was good

they dont serve their sandwiches on plates this leads to quite a mess as you eat since the fixings fallroll right off the boards not ideal when you need to look professional after lunch

Address: 100 King Street Unit D Winnipeg, MB R3B 0P6 Canada
Review:
great staff and great sandwich
didnt have their regular sandwich bread avail so they made mine on a kaiser bun and it was still so so good
highly recommend the carolina bbq sandwich each sando approx 16 all sides extra

september 2022

Address: 248 Avenue de la Cathedrale Winnipeg, MB R2H 2V9 Canada
Review: very cute little place tried a corned beef sandwich and a tart with earl grey tea i dont remember the name of that dessert but it was so yummy

Address: 248 Avenue de la Cathedrale Winnipeg, MB R2H 2V9 Canada
Review: i happened upon this bakery by accident as i was walking my dog as i passed i saw the place was full of people the next morning on my walk i stopped by to see what the hype was about and now i know exceptional service beautiful looking and tasting pastries next time i am visiting winnipeg this place will be one that i stop by again

Address: 248 Avenue de la Cathedrale Winnipeg, MB R2H 2V9 Canada
Review:
service was great but the amount of chocolate in the chocolate croissant is unreal
why was the chocolate croissant so low on chocolate
i will make sure to drive to √† l√©pic de bl√© next time to get my chocolate croissante at least there i know i will get what i paid for
very disappointed

Address: 248 Avenue de la Cathedrale Winnipeg, MB R2H 2V9 Canada
Review: great little french bakery in the heart of st boniface great selection of tasty treats and make sure to try the bread pudding and strawberry croissant

Address: 248 Avenue de la Cathedrale Winnipeg, MB R2H 2V9 Canada
Review: great desserts as always was there at a busy time but the line moved quickly and the staff were friendly

Address: 230 Dalhousie Drive Winnipeg, MB R3T 2Z1 Canada
Review: wow this place is insane 14 for a dish you should know the quantity of food you pay for  what a scam i wont be going back and i strongly do not recommended anyone to support this place  i phoned in and spoke with the owner regarding to the food portion we paid for wow the owner admit their portion is small and this is how it is she said zero star for this place scam

Address: 230 Dalhousie Drive Winnipeg, MB R3T 2Z1 Canada
Review:
very good taiwanese food
my families favorites are the sour cabbage and pork noodle soup and the shrimp pancake
i dont know if thats its name because they just order it when we go i didnt look at the menu

they also have bubble tea in the past they did not use a powder and used real whipping cream which made it stand out for me

Address: 230 Dalhousie Drive Winnipeg, MB R3T 2Z1 Canada
Review: the food was so tasteless and soupy we ordered a stir vegetables and stir fried lamb with cuminonions looks like the vegetables was boiled and put in some stock and the lamb was boiled and saut√©ed with onions in a stock food portion is very small as well we called to let them know and the owner just said they are sorry really bad experience overall

Address: 230 Dalhousie Drive Winnipeg, MB R3T 2Z1 Canada
Review: if its available i will choose 0 they made the worst chinese food which i experienced before

Address: 230 Dalhousie Drive Winnipeg, MB R3T 2Z1 Canada
Review: food are good but service could be better

Address: 660 Osborne Street Unit 4 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B6 Canada
Review: love this place dont know why we havent gone more often i had the cauliflower pakora burger with fries and it was delicious smashing it before eating is a must its huge and messy but worth it we all loved our meals and we cant wait to go back and try more menu items oh and the cake homemade that day and yum highly recommend getting dessert

Address: 660 Osborne Street Unit 4 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B6 Canada
Review: the oakwood has a breakfastbrunchdinner dish for an array of tastes family easter brunch for eight was easily accommodated no one wanted to cook  we had our stretchy pants on and were looking forward to the eats from others who highly recommended oakwood our table had the crown burger with fries feta tomato and avo eggs benny chicken chorizo waffles french toast patty melt and bacon and eggs breakfast all plates demolished delicious and large portions coffee was really good i think it is bob marley blue mountain not sure why it took me forever to eat here must add to your casual diner eats list most definitely will be back licensed with mimosas or breakfast beers if that tickles your fancy they also sell premade meals to go

Address: 660 Osborne Street Unit 4 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B6 Canada
Review:
really great place the servers are great and the menu has lots to choose from my boyfriend and i got the salmon dill benny and johans club i was expecting to taste a bit more of the dill in the dill hollandaise but other than that its a solid benny my boyfriend said the club was solid too

will be back to try other stuff in the future

Address: 660 Osborne Street Unit 4 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B6 Canada
Review: the food here was excellent i was very happy with the portion size as well the servers were friendly and fast the inside was clean and felt spacious considering its size i felt it was moderately priced especially considering the quality and quantity of food i received i would most definitely go here again and recommend it to friends i look forward to trying more of the menu

Address: 660 Osborne Street Unit 4 Winnipeg, MB R3L 2B6 Canada
Review: friendly and quick service decent selection of items to order reasonably priced

Address: 404 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0B8 Canada
Review:
great neapolitan style pizza bright and modernly designed dinning room seating at the bar pizza bar window and patio we had the don which was all meat no veg husband staple and the rustica no meat all veg they have about 4 vegetarian pizza options but you can always omit the meat on any pizza beer menu is small sorry beer lovers cocktail menu had about 8 options with a focus an a larger wine menu
if you have a love for the za and want an upscale pizza dinning experience this would be your jam highly recommend making a rezo during prime time

Address: 404 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0B8 Canada
Review: amazing spot for lunch great menu great staff in a professional and modern setting we were seated as a large group in the private room and it was perfect  downstairs quiet and with a great feel and style  the menu had the usual goodies like meatballs caprese salad and the incredible mushroom risotto

Address: 404 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0B8 Canada
Review: had our team holiday dinner here and super glad we picked this spot to try out we got a few items to share starting with the caesar salad and following with 3 pizzas the don margherita and pollo dolce all delicious and fresh we were very pleased at how quick and friendly the service was looking forward to coming back and trying out the rest of the menu

Address: 404 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0B8 Canada
Review: oh my the pizza here is to die for we had the lucia and the combination of flavors is incredible kudos to whoever thought that one up

Address: 404 Academy Road Winnipeg, MB R3N 0B8 Canada
Review:
this is an awesome destination restaurant  my siblings and i from across canada met here for a reunion meal and loved it  great food and wine and dessert  and great and friendly service

i had one of my bestever caesar salads  and the margherita pizza was very tasty  and straight from the woodburning pizza ovens

and of course we had a few bottles of red wine from their terrific wine list

although the prices are a smidge higher the delicious meal and ambience are well worth the cost

this restaurant is wheelchair accessible and has a great outdoor patio  it is also lgbtq friendly

try it  you will like it

Address: 1235 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2A9 Canada
Review: wonderful little sushi shop super kind staff wonderfully decorated interior and incredible service was faster than any fast food place ive been too and much healthier i would absolutely recommend them if you need some quick tasty sushi or a place to sit down and hang out for a minute with some great ambiance

Address: 1235 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2A9 Canada
Review: i have been ordering from here for years its always so fresh and so delicious service is great definitely recommend

Address: 1235 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2A9 Canada
Review: i ordered medium sushi party tray first time processing time was fast the sushi was delicious combination of sushi mix is just right for familywith child i am so happy to find out this nice sushi take out place in winnipeg staffs are also very friendly if you want to taste decent quality of sushi with good price in winnipeg this is the right place additionally fried spring rolls were exceptionally crisp and warm

Address: 1235 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2A9 Canada
Review: kind of average sushi flavor  its what you get everywhere the rice was flavorless and the fish was not great  i am not in love very average and cant eat inside not worth it

Address: 1235 Pembina Highway Winnipeg, MB R3T 2A9 Canada
Review: i came here for dinner and ordered alaska roll shrimp tempura roll and salmon sashimi i opened the box and had them immediately when i return to my car as a sushi chef who had 2 years experience i would say the experience is goodcompare to the price i feel everything i ordered worth the money i paidexcept the miso soup if you are looking for a sushi place where you spent little but can get a good portion of sushithe quality is above the average maybe give it try suggestion removing the tail crust of shrimp when you guys make the shrimp tempura roll i know it looks good but uneatable

Address: 159 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y7 Canada
Review:
the goto place in winnipeg for sushi the naru roll is the best sushi roll ive ever eaten creamy house sauce fish eggs crispy pawn yum
the sushi boats are highly recommended for shareables the nigiri is fresh and tasty cheap drinks are the cherry on top service is fast highly recommend

Address: 159 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y7 Canada
Review: top 3 in winnipeg atmosphere is great and the sushi is very high quality fresh and fairly priced their service is also excellent my friend and i cant eat mirin and they made a batch of rice for us without it so we can eat as well

Address: 159 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y7 Canada
Review: dinner for two platter was amazing it comes with a fantastic variety of rolls the rolls are have lots of filling compared to the amount of rice which is very enjoyable

Address: 159 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y7 Canada
Review: this used to one of my favorite sushi places in osborne village in the last 5 years it has gone downhill and tonight was my final visit do not waste your time eating their less than fresh fish and dealing with the alarmingly rude staff walk 5 minutes away to akindo sushi bistro where you will have the most delicious food and kind servers zero stars

Address: 159 Osborne Street Winnipeg, MB R3L 1Y7 Canada
Review: naru sushi had very fresh sashimi and great rolls that were big in size without too much rice in the rolls we ordered the medium sushi boat which ended up being too much food for three people

Address: 270 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0L4 Canada
Review:
what a cool experience
we did the upstairs dining area where its all you can eat  basically you order sides i loved the cheese balls and then someone comes around with a giant skewer of meat and offers it to you as long as your card is green theyll keep coming with various cuts on repeat turn your card to red when you need a break or are done flip as desired
the meat was cooked to perfection and i honestly enjoyed it so much
you get some pretty tasty dipping sauces to try as well
for dessert i tried the cheesecake and i did not like that it tasted like coconut but was supposed to be berry

expensive but for the unique experience and food quality it was fun and worth it

Address: 270 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0L4 Canada
Review:
the food was so good i even got to try lamb for the first time and it was really good only draw back is because of the open ceiling concept it makes voices travel a lot  it was hard at times to carry a conversation because of the echoing of the dining area and the restaurant wasnt that busy
prices are a tad high 1400 for drink the meal ranges from 4900  7000 per person did give a senior discount which was nice
its an experience for some special fine dining
once again awesome service and staff

Address: 270 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0L4 Canada
Review: if youre a hungry carnivore then this is the dinner place for you tons of meat selections that are brought and carved at your table lots of sides to choose from did find the food quite salty but the accompanying drinks were delightful you need to try the one in the pineapple the price for the dinner all you can eat is a little steep but definitely an experience you should have if youre going anyway there is a separate menu for downstairs that includes individual items

Address: 270 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0L4 Canada
Review:
all i can say is wow come hungry wear a loose pair of pants and be ready for a taste of heaven
the food is excellent the staff are friendly

let me add gordon ramsey would be seriously proud with this place they wiped down every nook and cranny including the ventilation

a

Address: 270 Waterfront Drive Winnipeg, MB R3B 0L4 Canada
Review: wow epic food and even more epic service great ambience the lounge is the perfect place to watch the game enjoy great eats and a solid selection of local ipas highly recommended supportlocalwinnipeg localgood2go greateats

Address: 386 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2J2 Canada
Review: date night with the hubby and stopped at yellow dog tavern as we were driving around delicious food super nice staff great night

Address: 386 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2J2 Canada
Review: a classic downtown pub food was all homemade and delicious server was fun and efficient she even looked up ingredients in their home cookbook for us service speed was moderate but we felt very welcome in our large group i will definitely be going back

Address: 386 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2J2 Canada
Review: love this spot ordered an ok cesar and a messy nacho plater with out spoons or forks but the staff were awesome and upbeat it was hopping

Address: 386 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2J2 Canada
Review: this bison burger has ruined all other burgers for me i will be thinking about it for the rest of my life absolutely amazing this was my second visit and both times the food and drinks have been amazing

Address: 386 Donald Street Winnipeg, MB R3B 2J2 Canada
Review: great customer service the food is awesome the perogies and garlic sausage are the best good prices and great selection on tap

Address: 157 Provencher Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2H 0G2 Canada
Review: would love to give this place 5 stars because its so cute inside but the karaage don was good not amazing i would still go here again though to try other stuff on the menu they have really cool ideas for drinks i love the zelda themed drinks they were adorable but there was a mix up when i tried to order the apricot zelda drink on the online menu it was red but when i received it the drink was blue which caused some confusion hopefully that gets fixed in their menu overall i enjoyed my visit here

Address: 157 Provencher Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2H 0G2 Canada
Review:
great japanese food in st boniface with a cute gift shop above

the menu is extensive with many different japanese plates to choose from we had the green onion  sesame sauce takoyaki spicy chicken katsu yakisoba and teriyaki mayo karaage don the highlight was the spicy chicken katsu the sauce was excellent and the breading was just the right amount of crispy

the portion sizes were large and ended up taking enough home another full meal the prices were affordable especially given the amount of food for two people it would be reasonable to share one appetizer and one main dish

the staff were very friendly and the food was served impressively fast the decor is an eclectic mix and the furniture was a bit uncomfortable however this was not an issue we enjoyed taking a walk through the gift shop upstairs after our dinner

we look forward to returning to dwarf no cachette to try more of their menu including their ramen and okinomoyaki based on our first experience we recommend it

Address: 157 Provencher Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2H 0G2 Canada
Review:
i visited this restaurant by a recommendation for japanese izakaya food there were about 10 of us and was pleasantly surprised that they had room when we showed up at around 67pm i made sure to call beforehand though just in case

vibe
its a cute and quirky little restaurant featuring gnomes and dwarf decor arrangements it was cozy inside and on the top floor there was a local gift shop the shop sold cute little knickknacks from handmade jewelry pins to anime buttons and stickers

service
the service was pretty good for having to deal with all 10 of us and we didnt have to wait too long to get seated the only downfall was that one of the drinks we ordered didnt quite match up to the description of the menu on their website we ordered from some of the food items or specials on the website were not on the menu either but were still available to order

food
what we were intentionally drawn with by choosing to eat at this restaurant were the playful drinks the zelda themed drinks were fun and we would have no idea about these drinks if not for checking the website

onigiri combo takoyaki  3 choices of onigiri which i chose 1tuna mayo 2 karage 3 shrimp tempura and it came with a miso soup and 6 pieces of regular takoyaki the onigiris were huge and i ended up only being able to finish one and taking the rest home to go the takoyaki came out with floating pieces of the bonito flakes waving in the air as expected the miso soup was very rich in flavor and i dont think i ever had sesame in miso soup before

drinks
milkshake shingenmochi with black sugar syrup  this drink is very delicious and sweet with the black sugar syrup and chewy mochis

master sword  cold sake calpico and club soda mix with a master sword iced jelly the master sword jelly gets floppy pretty quickly when left out too long so its best to take the pics quick and then stir the drink with the master sword

hearty elixir  peach redbull and red coloring its a tangy and pretty refreshing drink for the summer

blue jelly sake soda  i found the blue jelly was fun to stir around in my drink but the blue jelly itself tasted pretty bland and not that great with the sake its nice for photos only

apple popping boba sake  this was an alright tasting drink and it only made it better with the popping bobas the light hitting the bobas made the drink look radioactive and was fun to take pics of

i would go here again just to try their other dishes everything looked and sounded so good we all had trouble choosing what to get

igmissasiapattyc

Address: 157 Provencher Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2H 0G2 Canada
Review: absolute gem of winnipeg quite a varied menu of japanese dishes anywhere from ramen don buri curry rice yakisoba and the gamut of appetizers the food portions were on the more plentiful side the service was so pleasant and the cute decor really enhanced the experience

Address: 157 Provencher Boulevard Winnipeg, MB R2H 0G2 Canada
Review:
went here for the first time the service was good and we really liked the tempura but on our second visit the shrimp tempura had too much flour

on a side note they had big portions of their ramen the broth was good but it wasnt the best in my opinion

Address: 243 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2S2 Canada
Review: service was excellent personable and efficient we had calamari and salad but it looked so good we ate it before taking a picture fantastic presentation and taste was incredible for everything ordered fett chile and pappardelle if the picture looks good its because it is had cr√®me br√ªl√©e and espresso for dessert and it could not have been better

Address: 243 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2S2 Canada
Review: a good place to enjoy your food we went as a family of 6 made reservations ahead of time no hassle at all we went right as it opened and got busy very quick with that being said food came out slow but there it was a full house food was good nothing overly memorable for me but i definitely enjoyed it

Address: 243 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2S2 Canada
Review:
we really enjoyed the ambience and the hospitality from the staff but we are a little picky when it comes to restaurant food because i have an amazing chef at home still a great place for a romantic date

atmosphere 5
food 3
overall 4

Address: 243 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2S2 Canada
Review:
our server apologies for the forgotten name was absolutely fantastic attentive accommodating and impressively knowledgeable about the menu and pairings

the bruschetta appetizer was a delightful 1010 bursting with flavor we couldnt resist trying the famous fett chile a unique creation of cafe carlo along with the meaty penne despite the warning of spiciness these dishes didnt set our tongues on fire

while the meaty penne was a bit saucy and lacked some flavor to my personal preference the sausages in both pasta dishes were slightly firm regrettably the main dishes didnt quite live up to expectations considering the price

the atmosphere was elegant with dim lighting and each table was beautifully set with forks knives and glassware

kudos to our server for sharing info about the cool artwork for sale and the talented artist behind them by the way that alicia keys piece mindblowing

recommendations try the bruschetta and fett chile

Address: 243 Lilac Street Winnipeg, MB R3M 2S2 Canada
Review: great place lovely ambiance friendly and professional staff would recommend the fett chile without sausages as the sausage taste could dominate and ruin the dish and the pappardelle is just heavenly

Address: 120 Donald Street Suite 2 Winnipeg, MB R3C 4G2 Canada
Review:
